Reviews.Title: “Clean but a little creepy....”
Reviews.Author: TSMDaisy_Maryland
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice enough, but the hotel is cavernous and lacks a soul, if you know what I mean. And the place is just a little creepy. The elevators are set up so that when you press a button requesting one, you're told which number elevator to enter. If you enter a different elevator--even if it arrives before "yours"--you can't get to where you're going unless you go to the top floor and then take it back down to the floor you want. If you do get into "your" elevator, your floor button is already pushed. I don't know, the place just didn't do it for me, but the price is right, particularly if you book through TripAdvisor since they have a special rate in that case.

Reviews.Title: “amazing trip!”
Reviews.Author: natbel80
Reviews.Content: Staying in the Park Central Hotel while my short trip to NYC was a great expierence. Its location and convinient transportation made my stay an amazing one! The hotel is clean the room was great staff was very helpful and efficient I had the opportunity to encounter Ricky on the lobby. He was a stunning and very pleasant to speak to helped me with no hesitation. it was a real pleassure staying here I will definitely come back and hopefuly for longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & good value for New York”
Reviews.Author: Claire927
Reviews.Content: Although this is an older hotel it was in reasonable condition & was good value both in cost & proximity to most of the "must dos" in NY. We found it to be very quiet even tho it is in Midtown Manhattan. There is a choice of restaurants nearby in addition to the hotels own. The staff didnt really look like they were enjoying their role even tho they "did their job" - a smile & some warm greetings would help!

Reviews.Title: “Understanding customer service...”
Reviews.Author: Grant G
Reviews.Content: The hotel's front office director, Fady Awad, is very impressive and the sole reason why I opted to arrange for my friends (newly weds) to stay here, as I was incredibly frustated by the concierge and others on staff who I tried to make some special arrangements through. They were either unfriendly, less than accomodating or short on customer service. I can't speak for my friends' stay (I assume it went well), but if the GM were smart, he'd have those who interact with guests over the phone to model their style and behavior after Mr. Awad because if other prospective guests are only a fraction as underwhelmed and frustrated as I was, there will be no stay. --Grant G

Reviews.Title: “A Two Star dump in any other town.”
Reviews.Author: RoccoNC
Reviews.Content: I don't want to waste energy thinking about this place any longer, but did want to warn future guests. The rooms were stale smelling and the AC did not work. Rust/mold in the bathroom. If you pay more than $100/night your are being robbed. Unfortunately, I paid way more than that, so live and learn.

Reviews.Title: “Visited again: it's like watching a place die ...”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadtoomuch
Reviews.Content: Wow, how things can change in the hotel business! The hotel staff who used to be friendly, warm and welcoming have become distant, cold and arrogant. I'm talking about the front desk staff. Not at all helpful. Not at all concerned about the quality of interaction or serving the customer. The room was not at all acceptable: slow drains in the both the sink and the tub. Uncomfortable bed. HVAC system not yet set to air-conditioning so even the "coolest" setting pumped out heat. We had the windows open 24/7 during our visit but the room was STILL like a sauna. I stopped by the front desk the morning after checking in and asked if the drains could be snaked. I was assured this would be taken care of, but it was not. That evening, I asked if we could be moved to another room because of the standing water in the tub and the sink AND the sauna-like conditions of the room. "We'll get back to you" was the reply. Never heard back. I avoided the restaurant completely as I remembered the $35 breakfast buffet from my last visit. Too many good breakfast options within two blocks to pay that kind of money. Noise. I realize that NYC hotels must cater to groups in order to fill rooms, but the noise in the lobbies from the hundreds of kids swarming the place was just wrong. There was never an attempt to control this hysteria. On the way out this morning, one of the concierge staff members followed me across the lobby trying to get me to accept the "offer" of a car service to the airport. He kept insisting that $50 was the same price as a cab. Ha! I'm not some first-time tourist to NYC. Finally I said, "Does that include tip and tolls, and will the driver accept a credit card?" "No, no and no" was the reply. Yea, right. I ended up at LaGuardia with a $30 trip charge and $5 toll charge. With tip: $42. I know that extra money is a great motivator, but having the concierge staff pimp for the car service drivers is an annoyance, not a service. On the good side, the housekeepers are wonderful. I need to find a new Times Square hotel. As I say in the title, I felt like I had revisited an old friend/relative who had suddenly stepped over that line into a death spiral. I can't help but wonder if the Park Central is spiraling down. It had been such a reasonably priced hotel option with decent service and a good atmosphere. It's very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but the staff makes the hotel great”
Reviews.Author: Toni S
Reviews.Content: The beginning was not good, we had to wait for three hours until we could get checked in. But then the wonderful and very obliging Drita from the Front Desk took care of us...so everything before was forgotten. The room was good, some renovations would be nice...but all in all it was good. The first days we had some troubles with the room service. For example they forgot to do our room at all. But if you call the front desk and tell them your situation, they will take care of everything...thank you Drita :-) From that day on, the chambermaid Angela Garcia took great care of us and we could enjoy the rest of our stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Julie C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel twice and both experiences were great. The rooms are clean, quiet, and have a good deal of space. The service at the hotel is also excellent. On our most recent stay, we arrived early and Elizabeth at the front desk was extremely helpful. She allowed us to check in early and our room was very nice with a great view of Times Square. I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody who is looking for a centrally located, service-oriented hotel with great amenities and modern rooms.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: johnw58
Reviews.Content: hotel staff were very friendly and helpful be sure to ask for Jessica not only is she beautiful but very caring to customers and friendly to. also there is a Jamaican lady on the front desk that is also very friendly and also asks all the right questions and is very respectful to the hotel guest i could not wish for a more nicer atmosphere and very clean hotel i would definitely go back again i stayed in room 1110 for 7 day i travelled with a friend from the uk and the hotel is smack bang in the middle of nyc 2 minute walk down to times square and 2 minute walk to central park couldnt wish for a better position i RECOMMEND

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Park Central Hotel:-)”
Reviews.Author: Danijela Z
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, the room was big ang clean, the breakfast a perfect start on the day! But Elisabeth was the main reason for our perfect stay. She is lovely and really friendly! Smiles everytime time, and is really helpful! So we will be back at Park Central Hotel again, just because of here:-)

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: James S
Reviews.Content: The average prison cell is 8' X 12'. The room at park central is less than 12' X 18'. Fully furnished there was only room for one person between the bed and dresser. The bathroom was so small that the door cleared the comode by only 1". The walls could be touched by raising both arms with one arm reaching over the comode. There was approximately 3' X 3' of usable floor space. The room did not contain a refridgerator, microwave, TV guide, or coffee maker. We had to request shower caps, ice bucket liners, a refuse can, and phone book. A tooth pick that was on the bathroom floor was still there when we left three days after check-in, and a 1" X 1" piece of white paper I placed in the middle of the small floor space available in the living area was there for two days when we left. You do not have the choicee of air conditioning or heat. On our last night our room was at 77 degrees. The operator said that the air conditioning was turned off and we should open our window (on the 15th floor). We spent a sleepless night listening the traffic noise. However, TV did work.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: 6mars2012
Reviews.Content: I spent very good time in this hotel!... Rooms are very good, location near time square, and the most important is staff, helpful, and great. Especially Elisabeth how was so lovely and pleasant!! Ask her whartever you want, she's so professional that if one day I ll be back in new york I would stay at this hotel! Wonderful stay! Thank you so much Elisabeth!!! You re the best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lynn F
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Central for the second time in the a month. What a find. The rooms are spacious, the employees are friendly and it is conveniently located. Great place for business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: SteveN999_12
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and, yes, the rooms are generously sized. But the hotel could be so much better by paying attention to details - clean furniture upholstery, position furniture properly, better lighting in the bathroom. Our room was missing its room number. Attention to detail could make this hotel so much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Lauravoice
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from new york, and this hotel was great i would stay there again. The hotel lobby is really nice and the staff where really polite, the rooms are a little shabby round the edges but the bed and bathroom where really clean, the house keeping staff where great!! The food prices in the hotel are a bit OTT.. and the food is ok. But for me the location was fab right by central park and with a subway just next to the main door, a 5min walk from broadway and times square. i would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Less than mediocre and grossly overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Warren H
Reviews.Content: The Park Central is a million miles from the glossy pictures and self description that you may have read about and which tempts you to stop there. Our room was tiny and had absolutely no worthwhile facilities unless you were prepared to pay extra for them, like wi-fi, which the world and his wife provides either as a component of a package, or completely free as most other places in New York do. Park Central want an additional $14:10 per day for this, but it is completely free at Starbucks next door but one, free at the Flatiron, (on the street) free at the apple stores on either 5th Avenue or at Grand Central station and many other locations throughout the city. The room itself was tiny, had a strong smell when you walked in (like cat pee) and had torn/frayed carpets and blistering paintwork. It was also dark as the only window was obscured by another part of the building which jutted out, the bath was tiny, only allowing for sitting in, it was incredibly shallow and the pipe-work for the taps which were on the wall were loose and ill fitting. On our first night there was a fire in the hotel at around 3AM, albeit a very, very minor one which was of such low significance and was already under control by the fire department, but nonetheless the tannoy in our room woke us up as some muppet (the concierge) in charge at reception, chose to alert everyone in the hotel that there was a fire, but asked that everyone remained in their rooms and did not panic, as the fire was very minor and was under control. As you would imagine, panic followed as everyone tried to leave the hotel, but the lifts had been suspended, so everyone was attempting to use the stairwell which had an acrid smell of smoke, which furthered the panic. The concierge was still using the tannoy to tell everyone to go back to their room and not to panic as the fire was minor and was under control, but as it was also said that the Titanic couldn’t sink, this had little effect at subduing the panicking masses. In the event, the fire was so minor it was hardly worth mentioning and the resulting panic was as a direct result of the announcement that there was a fire and as the initial announcement (at 3AM) was to let the residents know that the fire was minor and that everyone should stay in their rooms. After a very broken night’s sleep, which followed a day of travelling which lasted 11 hours and the 5 hour time difference, we were awoken at 8AM by the fire alarm, which after frantic dressing was followed by an announcement from the concierge that the alarms were being tested. This continued for around 45 minutes, with the concierge constantly ‘counting’ through the tannoy, the alarm sounding again and the concierge announcing that the alarm was fine and if it sounded again, it was because there was a real fire! Of note, the alarm never sounded at all at 3AM, just the announcement that there was a fire, but that everyone should stay in their rooms and not panic. There was no need for panic, which was only caused by the concierge announcing that there was a fire but no-one should panic, so if the announcement hadn’t happened at all as most people were asleep in their beds, there wouldn’t have been any panic, or even any knowledge that there had been a fire at all, which raises the question of whether the initial announcement was even necessary? On the day of checkout, our flight wasn’t until 8PM, so we asked if we could leave our luggage at the hotel as we would be coming back for our transport to the airport, which was possible, but at a cost of $7.50. We stopped at Trump towers in Chicago last year and at the Roosevelt New York at two separate occasions before and have never been charged for holding our luggage, so this was yet another arm to the contemptuous profiteering that is evident at this dreadful hotel, where it is more than apparent that the residents are treated as cash-cows rather than valued customers. Of note is that wi-fi access was also free at Trump and the Roosevelt and Trump also provided coffee and tea making facilities in the room. If repeat business is the key to success, then this hotel will never realise its full potential as I am certain there are many more like me, who would never put another cent of the money I work hard for their way. Yes it is a very busy hotel and I am certain that they make lots of money, but if they treated their customers better and concentrated on short term investment to improve the rooms, they would make even more money and earn a better reputation. It is true that a negative reputation will work so much harder for you than a positive one and I for one would suggest that people should walk a country mile and spend their money elsewhere before stopping at the Park Central.

Reviews.Title: “The Way It Is Supposed To Be!”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: I've gotten to the point where when traveling, I really don't expect much. Prices are too high, accommodations are too low and there is always a problem at check it. But wait....that didn't happen at my stay at the Park Central 3/28-3/31. It all started with Drita Oroshi at reception. Charming, very pretty and efficient. She retrieved my reservation, greeted me warmly and after pointing out features of the hotel sent me on my way with her wonderful smile. My room was great, the food at the hotel restaurant was very good and my trip was off to a wonderful start. Throughout my stay, hotel staff was courteous, helpful and well informed. Normally I don’t much like travels to New York, but Drita and her colleagues made this one the best yet. I’ll stay at Park Central whenever my travels take me to the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Carolyn was very helpful on room change at Park Central”
Reviews.Author: GoDBacks100
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Park Central Hotel on 7th Avenue regularly, and our experiences are generally very positive . On our March 2012 visit, we had someone smoking in their room and the smoke ended up in our room, which we reported to the front desk. Carolyn was extremely helpful and went over and above regular service while ensuring that we were comfortable in making a room change. We appreciate her consideration and wonderful response to our requests. Thank you, Carolyn!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location but Mediocre Service”
Reviews.Author: etphonehm
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three nights, 3/27-3/29. I guess I was not fortunate enough to be greeted by Elizabeth, the person whom all these people are giving praises. Checked in by a smile-less female with a robotic voice that sounded as if I were bothering her. There is absolute no amenities in the hotel, not even a coffee maker. The room was not well lit and I heard the trash truck from the street every morning promptly at 7 am. There was not even a hang by the door sign which you could use to let the housekeeping know that you wanted to sleep in. I guess I was in the City that never sleeps so they figure there is no need for the door sign. I could also hear clearly the conversation that was going on in the other room from other guests as there was an adjoining door between the two rooms. The only positive thing is the location but there is another hotel across the street, Wellington, so maybe I'll try that next time.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Kwaith
Reviews.Content: I visited new York city a few months back with my family and was very pleased with the level of service we received from your staff. Especially one individual I believe his name was Bill Persaud. He's a very patient and polite individual. In closing we had a great trip and would recommend your company to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Environment... Home in NY. Want to say Thanks so Much :)”
Reviews.Author: giomar m
Reviews.Content: Great LOCATION, very good customer service, clean yet simple rooms with excellent value. My partner and improvised and decided to go to NY, we heard that this was a good hotel. With no doubt it was! We went in with no reservations and the crew was very welcoming, specially Elizabeth. In general it was a good hotel and again the location it's the best! In between Times Square and

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service...Want to say "Thank you!"”
Reviews.Author: S S
Reviews.Content: If you want really great customer service in the heart of NYC, then you need to stay at Park Central. This is my second time staying here and both times the staff were so wonderful and accommodating to my needs. For example, extending our check-out time to accommodate our later departure from the city and helping us plan our events for the day. I especially wish to thank Elizabeth in Management who went out of her way today to make sure that we had a wonderful stay. *Hotel is clean, staff are amazing and location is so perfect!* Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Happy Canadian Visitor.

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent Place To Stay!"”
Reviews.Author: DreDiddy
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy my stay at the Park Central. The Staff is always friendly, Ellen greeted me wit a smile and was able to check me in with ease. The location is perfect, walking distance from Central Park, Subways, Shopping and Restaurants. Every time I come to NY I Always try and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Jay E
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Park Central on numerous occasions over the past several years while in the City on business and it has become my home away from home in New York. The location is terrific, the rooms are clean, the prices are very reasonable for New York and the hotel staff is generally very friendly and helpful. Carolyn at the front dest is especially courteous, friendly and is also extremely efficient. The Park Central bar is friendly place to unwind at the end of a long day. Melvin, and John are always interested in to talking with their customers and conversation with them is intelligent and informative. The restaurant associated with the hotel serves a European style breakfast buffet and as well as items from a conventional U.S. breakfast menu. The food is well prepared and reasonably priced. Lunches are of similar quality and also reasonably priced. I highly recommend the Park Central to anyone staying in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Location fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Lou B
Reviews.Content: Great location and great price. Rooms a bit outdated but service was great. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My NYC trip”
Reviews.Author: elise356
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded all of my experctations. It was so sheek, and right in the middle of NYC, fast paced and fun. The staff was amazing, not true what they say about New Yorkers. Ricky, in the lobby was so helpful and pleasant, he even gave me tips on shopping an getting around. Thank you Park Central!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a trip to New York”
Reviews.Author: Waterfordshome
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at this hotel, first time was 4 years ago. My sister also stayed here in January with her boyfriend while on a shopping trip & they were delighted with the hotel. Perfectly located midway between Times square & Central Park (Only 5mins walk each side) with the subway stop on the corner. Stayed in room 1406 which is a corner room giving a nice view of Times square & Carnigie Hall. The corner room felt a bit smaller than the room we stayed in 4 years earlier but it was nice seeing Times square. The rooms were cleaned every day & fresh towels etc, It was all very clean. The concierge was very helpfull with directions to different places we wanted to go to. Wifi in the hotel costs $14 a day, however there is a Starbucks beside the hotel which offers free wifi-ideal if you only want to log on for 5mins during the day! We stayed for 6 nights and got a discount of 40%, roughly working out at €110 per night for the 2 of us. Really good value for somewhere so nice, clean, friendly & central. A restaurant we loved while there is 'Chocolate by the Bald Man', a Max Brenner restaurant. Its just off Union square. It had really delicious food. I'd highly recommend looking it up also. We're already planning another shopping trip for early 2013 & will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations Exceeded”
Reviews.Author: Don E
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at the Park Central and my expectations were exceeded. The location, is outstanding. The hotel amenities, to include workout facility were very nice and the hotel staff was very accomodating. Ellen was professional and courteous, in short a joy to work with.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: familyfun_ola_2010
Reviews.Content: Rooms were ok. Good size but a bit outdated. Staff great..especially Ellen at front desk. Best part of hotel is the location. Step outside, look to the left and see Central Park 2 blocks away...look to the right and see Times Square about 8 blocks away! Loads of cabs waiting outside to take you around the city. Good selection of restaurants. Excellent value for price of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience all around”
Reviews.Author: MB H
Reviews.Content: When I travel to New York for business I like to stay in an area, that will be in the "heart of it all." Park Central is conveniently located near Times Square, great restaurants, and Central Park. The rooms are much bigger than other hotels with comparable rates yet the quality and service I received was just the same, if not better. The beds are so comfortable and the views are amazing. I am so grateful that I was able to meet reservation agent Shanies H. Shanies has extensive knowledge of New York, she was kind, accommodating, and offered great customer service which made my stay very pleasant and my check in as well as check out process seamless. The friendly room service staff were excellent as well. My room was clean upon check in and through out the week. Most hotels say they offer certain services or amenities, but when you get there you see they don't offer everything they mention. Park Central exceeded my expectations and my only regret is that I didn't visit the hotel sooner. I would definitely stay here again and will recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money”
Reviews.Author: Tino187849
Reviews.Content: After a long flight to New York from Europe I arrived two hours before hotel check-in time. Normally in this situation you have to wait but Elizabeth, at Reception desk, made me so comfortable and she found a beautiful room for me. In addition the hotel is located in a strategic position near Times Square, Carnegie hall, 5th Ave: in summary the best you are supposed to expect in town. The room price is below other famous hotel network but Park Central offers more. I am a Executive frequent flyer and I can say, with no doubt, that this hotel is definitely the best for what you spend in NYC. I would certainly recommend this hotel. Tino

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Carlos C
Reviews.Content: Excelente experience, everyone very nice, very good location

Reviews.Title: “Park Central Perfection”
Reviews.Author: LisaJere
Reviews.Content: I travel to NY for business and pleasure 2-3 times per year. I ALWAYS stay at the Park Central. I consider it my 'home away from home'. Located between Times Sq and Central Park, it is the perfect location for shopping, theater or a stroll thru Central Park. It is on the NQR subway line that can take you almost anywhere. The staff is amazing. Be sure to ask for David Cleary at the front desk. He will treat you with the kind of professionalism that is hard to top. I always feel safe and comfortable at the Park Central.

Reviews.Title: “When the fire alarm got me”
Reviews.Author: Alex M
Reviews.Content: That was my forth time at Park Central NY. This time, there was a surprise: the fire alarm went on at 01:30 am and the NYFD came in with at least 6 vehicles and ambulances. Apparently a transformator got fried outside the building and some smell of smoke came into the hotel hallways. after about two and a half hours, with many people coming down to the lobby because of the alarms and the address system inside the rooms. anyway, in the morning I checked out and asked for a compensation for the lost hours. The clerk sent me to the Elizabeth, the guest relations manager who happily offered me the next night half price and paid for my luggage storage. That's a good deal, considiring the fact that there was no fire at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “front desk service”
Reviews.Author: joseph b
Reviews.Content: I had traveled all day on business. I arrived to learn that my room was not ready. The front desk manager, Ellen, and Nilsa, spent 15 minutes getting me a great room. The team is always going out their way to provide great service

Reviews.Title: “Ugh”
Reviews.Author: alfiemellow
Reviews.Content: Booked a king, they stuck me in a room with two double beds (I'm 6'3... that's not a comfortable night's sleep). Some reviews said free Internet/breakfast, which is absolutely not the case. They have these stupid elevators where you can't just hit the button andhave it take you to your floor, but instead you have to punch in your floor on some screen and have it assign you to a specific elevator... apparently the veneer of high tech trumps traditional conveniences. I forgot my toothbrush at my last hotel and called the front desk to ask if they could send one up. The phone rang for at least 5 minutes before anyone even picked up. Now 30 minutes later I'm still waiting for a toothbrush. The rooms are big enough, especially for New York, but all in this is a pretty crappy experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed -Okay experience”
Reviews.Author: Kathy1480
Reviews.Content: I have been at this Hotel in the past and never had any bad experiences with the Hotel or with the Room. My niece and I were there for a Bridal shower in March. The room was okay. Inside room. Shower handle was broken, we were missing the toilet paper holder, but they did bring that up. The cleaning person must have called that one in. We set the air conditioner on HIGH but it only cooled the room a little. The Front Desk Hotel Clerk -Ellen- was exceptional. She is an assett to this Hotel. It was a pleasure having her as a person to speak too. Kathy

Reviews.Title: “Excelent!”
Reviews.Author: Estevaop
Reviews.Content: Cynthia and Ellen S., members of the staff, are so kind and are allways willing to help. The hotel is very good and sure i will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Marlene M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Park Central. We found the location to be excellent for walking to sights or taking the crosstown bus to see the museums on Fifth Ave. The entire staff from the manager to the engineering staff and maid service were courteous, helpful and sincerely interested in making our stay a pleasant one. Our room was comfortable. We also discovered that the management is in the process of planning to update the hotel. I can highly recommend Park Central Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great staff”
Reviews.Author: great_golf_weather
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this hotel, I will stay here on my next visit. I Stayed for 4 nights. Only 1 block from Central Park, a short walk to Broadway and Times Sq. Access to subway is 20 feet from the door of the hotel. Room rate was competitive compared to other hotels I checked out nearby, and they do special offers on their website. All the staff were welcoming and friendly, I was checked in by Elizabeth. The front desk sorted out a room key which wouldn't work on my last day by sending up security to open the door which only took less than 5 minutes. All the bar staff in the hotel bar were very friendly and look after the guests well, John in particular. A pleasure staying there each day.

Reviews.Title: “Be sure to print your reservation info!”
Reviews.Author: RoxAnne B
Reviews.Content: I had selected a Midweek special package from Park Centrals website, which included the following: Just minutes from the Javits Convention Center, the financial district, and prestigious Manhattan businesses, the Park Central New York is the perfect business hotel. Enjoy complimentary high speed internet, breakfast and a $50 Amex Gift Card with this package. When we checked in reception was not at all friendly, barely spoke and pointed to the elevators, without explaining the way they worked, which is actually quite odd. You go down a hallway and turn left and the 3 elevators are there, but to use them you first go back in the hallway to a console and press your floor number and THEN go to the elevator. A little help from the front desk would have been nice. After our third day there, a console was put in front of the elevators which of course was a good thing, except all the elevators were shut down {without warning ) and my husband and I got to walk down 23 floors. Later found out this is not uncommon and when I asked at the desk when they would be fixed and that we had walked down 23 floors the gentleman merely shrugged his shoulders. Back to the special. I was not given any of those items at check in and so after dropping of the luggage we return to the front desk and were told "we do not offer the breakfast anymore-haven't done that since February" but after some while was given the 50$ gift card and they acknowledged the free internet. Since I had my reservation info printed but not with me, we later brought that to the front desk and were given 4 breakfast coupons. Again not any of these people were at all pleasant. The free breakfast is very nice and all the employees in the restaurant were excellent but you know what? Every single new customer that came in to breakfast was asked "do you have a coupon?" And most did. Hey I thought they didn't do that anymore! It is still on their website. On checkout day our bill was put under the door and everything was AOK so we checked out. The printed bill however was not what they charged my credit card...they added almost 90.00 dollars. I called and they said that was for BREAKFAST and then said it was a glitch and I could call Juan on Monday as this was Friday and so nothing could be done. Of course Monday I could not get any further and was then told to email them. Honest that is what they said they were told to do in this type of situation. So anyways I emailed them and called my credit card company and disputed the "glitch" and have yet to hear from Park Central. I really don't understand why they did not want to honor a special they are clearly still offering and why the front desk staff are so unhappy. The reason for our trip to NYC was our 25th wedding anniversary and my sister had called Park Central to have a bottle of Champagne put in our room. After talking to 4 people they said it could not be done unless she faxed her card and id to them. My sister was not near a fax machine so too bad! In some of these reviews I read about their friendly service and I guess they must of all been on vacation or different shifts. The maids were friendly as was all the bar and restaurant personnel. Our room was clean, they were plenty of towels and I noticed some reviews said there was no refrigerator but the king concierge room does include one as well a a coffee maker. The bed was very comfortable, the walls a little thin but even though I am a light sleeper I slept great. Park Central has an excellent location with questionable elevators (I really do think they are trying to update them, but be prepared) so as long as you pay attention to your credit card you could consider this 4 stars. For people that don't like the hassle 2 stars

Reviews.Title: “Carolyn, Saleem and Ellen - if I owned a hotel, I'd have them working for me...”
Reviews.Author: Udi K
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Park Central Hotel for several years, several times a year. The property's OK, but the service is usually outstanding. Carolyn, Saleem and Ellen, who work at the Front Desk, are always incredibely friendly and helpful, always leaving me with a feeling that they actually care.

Reviews.Title: “location”
Reviews.Author: 691lal
Reviews.Content: great location in NYC .. I was hosted by Ellen, who is a good example of efficiency and kindness .. workout room well equipped; this is a major factor for me to choose a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ellen's exceptional service at the front desk transforms the Park Central into a favorite boutique hotel. I stay at the Park Cen”
Reviews.Author: Thomasda22
Reviews.Content: Ellen's exceptional service at the front desk somehow transforms the Park Central into a very classic and charming boutique hotel. She is a natural people- person and a consummate professional. I first came to the Park Central years ago because of its location. I return every time I am in NYC because of the excellent, warmhearted,service.

Reviews.Title: “Sabena G.”
Reviews.Author: Sabena G
Reviews.Content: I would like to take the time to congratulate the Park Central New York for hiring Elizabeth as a Customer Service Agent. She truly exemplifies excellent customer service skills and more agents should learn from her. Elizabeth's attention to detail and concern during my stay made me feel right at home, something that is rare, since I travel on business extensively. My perception of the Park Central New York has positively changed and that is due to Elizabeth. For the Hotel: Location is perfect, views of Times Square are great, and the suites are spacious. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poorly maintained & run, nickle & dime you”
Reviews.Author: amy_joseph
Reviews.Content: Pros: Convenient to Times Square, Central Park, Rockafeller Center, other mid-town attractions. Relatively large room with two doubles - enought floor space to put down an inflatable twin matress we brought with us for one of the kids to sleep on Cons: Nickle & dime you - $50 "valet" parking with no in and out; $3.75 a bag to store your luggage after checkout while your tour the city the day of departure (my wife and I travel a lot, and we have never seen this at a hotel). Even though the room is a "quad", there was an extra chage for the third and fourth guests. Maintenence and cleanliness issues: Room safe broken. Prior guest's dirty underware on the shelf in the closet. No ventilation in the bathroom. Water pressure in sink faucet so high you got splattered every time you turned on the water. Staff issues: Had to go inside and find a bellman to valet park my car. Carried our own luggage to the front desk to check in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and a very efficient service. We were hosted by Elisabeth, a gentle person at the front desk, who gave us great”
Reviews.Author: Pauloalc
Reviews.Content: Based in NY HOTELS, park central is a worth it choice since the greatest location near central park as well as clean rooms. I really recommend this hotel and will be back sooner.

Reviews.Title: “Great service !”
Reviews.Author: YihsuanFu
Reviews.Content: The location is great! Price is reasonable as well. Front desk staff is friendly, especially Elizabeth! Shes patient, professional, and very approachable. Strongly recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Amber S
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights this month (March 2012) and had a really wonderful time - cannot fault it in any way - brilliant location and lovely hotel. All the staff were extremely helpful, friendly and efficient - we felt well-looked after here. Our room was very good too. The rooms are going to be refurbished soon I think - but ours was fine as is - spacious, tidy and clean with everything we needed and a really comfy big bed. Although it seemed fairly busy in the hotel generally generally the corridors to our room were very quiet and we couldn't hear much from outside either - so slept very well. I would definitely recommend Park Central to anyone as a great place to stay. Next time I am visiting New York I will use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Odd elevators, but nice sized rooms for NYC”
Reviews.Author: MaryEliseM
Reviews.Content: There is no great way you can do a weekend in New York City on the cheap, but we did find a very reasonable rate at the Park Central. Our room was quite spacious and very clean. Our bed was comfortable and the TV was a good size. We ate breakfast in the little restaurant in the hotel's lobby - $70 for two adults - but the food was decent. The location is also terrific. We went to see a Broadway show and were able to easily walk there. One note - our room had a great view but was loud, whereas my mother-in-law's room had no view but was super quiet. Oh and the comment on the elevators...I'm not sure if it is a security measure or not, but the Park Central's elevator system was confusing and a little annoying. You use computer screens around the corner to select your room and then it gives you a bay number to go to. but we were staying on different floors, so we had to take different elevators several times - not to mention that it took us awhile to figure out how to get to our room on the first night!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Escape”
Reviews.Author: Jim53951
Reviews.Content: The Park Central is the perfect hotel for a quick escape to Manhattan. We like staying in midtown for proximity to Broadway and museums and the Park Central worked great for us. This was the first time we stayed at the Park Central and we will be going back. The hotel is perfectly situated and has the amenities that you expect. The highlight of the hotel however is the staff. Each encounter with staff was pleasant and helpful. Ellen at the front desk was pleasant and helpful at checkin and even remembered us at checkout. Visit New York and stay at the Park Central.

Reviews.Title: “OLDER /updated with ALL amenities & Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SCHATZIGreenValleyAZ
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Crowne Plaza and just discovered the Park Central 870 7th Ave. MUCH better location. The rooms are large with their own "entry corridor". Closets good size with a solid door, not flimsy sliders. Wooden hangers slip off the rod. Bathroom was large and had very convenient amenities, including new shower heads and HIGH soap dishes in shower. Perfect & quiet climate control. The service at front desk is impeccable, very courteous. Ms. Butz & Ms. Rodriguez were VERY helpful. Maid service excellent .. . . room not only clean ,but smelled nice. Easy walk to theater district AND Central Park & Lincoln Center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rate compared to others”
Reviews.Author: Martha Y
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night at a rate of $210 the night. Great location with in walking distance of all central park, Times square, Fith Ave etc. One king size bed that allowed room to walk around in a average size room. The bathroom a little small for two people. I did not have time to ck all the amenities. It was clean and I safe

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Thomas507
Reviews.Content: Over the years, I have stayed in any number of five star hotels around the world. The Park Central, though, is easily one of this business guy's favorites, and the value for the money is tremendous. I've stayed here over a dozen times and always been very satisfied, particularly when I am not on expenses and paying from my own pocket. The location is great, the rooms reeaonably spacious, and are always clean. The elevator system can be a little confusing, but you quickly figure it out. And the desk staff is friendly and very helpful. On several occasions, Elizabeth has been particularly helpful. So I rate this place very highly. And it can't be beat for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Jessica Brito - Six star service”
Reviews.Author: Saimay R
Reviews.Content: A six star service in a four star hotel! I have traveled all over the world and stayed in variety of hotels including 5 and 4 star hotels. The quality of hotel does reside in its history, architect, and the location but the ultimate longevity and sustainability of hotel's profitability lies in the people who work there. Jessica Brito is one of those rare service professionals that any organization would love to have because of her positive, pleasant, and personalized attitude towards tired customers and ever demanding customers. Jessica was thoroughly professional, accommodating, and very empathetic. Emotional intelligence is a rare quality that can not be taught easily and she has abundance of it. She should be promoted as mentor and a manager for training all new employees in teaching soft skills of grace, understanding, listening, and accommodating. For her service only, I highly recommend this hotel. The bottom line is that organizations' profit lies in its people. Happy workers lead to happy happy customers and happy customers means happy revenues and profits for decades to come.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Arina Daiana P
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice stay at the Park Central, I am getting ready to check out right now :). The staff was very helpful and polite, especially Elizabeth at the Front Desk. The hotel is located in a very accessible area of the town for tourists visiting the Big Apple...walking distance from Time Square and Central Park. The ratio price /quality is good, check the restaurant downstairs the Tomato soup is delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, But...”
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel is a good hotel and they are consistently one of the least expensive to stay in for the area by $50 a night or more. The hotel is situated around 57th and 7th which is a 5-10 minute walk to Central Park and 10-15 minute walk to the heart of Times Square (where the NYE ball drops) and 30 Rock. Check in is pretty sternly between 2-4. We flew in the morning and arrived at about 10:30 at the hotel and our rooms weren't ready. They have a service at the hotel that will hold your bags for $3.50 per bag, But that's not too bad and safer than a bellman's closet that you get at most hotels. The elevator system is really efficient since you choose the floor before you get on and it keeps things running smoothly. The rooms are nice with very comfortable beds and lighting. The towels aren't rough and coarse like most hotels, but the water pressure leaves a lot to be desired. The beds have one size of pillow and that's large and thick like a down pillow. If you like thin or fluffy pillows, bring your own. They also add a 3 foot small body pillow which is a nice touch. Housekeeping does NOT knock. We experienced this every morning. they simply use their card and come in. 3 mornings in a row there was no knock. We bolted the door after the first occurrence. But they are efficient and passed the "loose change" test. We weren't setting them up, but everything was accounted for after they were finished. The hotel is very quiet, but it is off of 7th which is the main street that goes down to Times Square, so there may be occasional fire trucks, ambulances and such that you'll hear. The curtains are very thick to block out light and we slept soundly every night. Nice places to around the hotel also including Fluffy's across the street which is a good place for breakfast as is Cafe Metro (both under $6 for a decent meal). There is a good spa a lock away for manicures and pedicures as well. Lindy's is a good dessert place which is across the street and 1 block away is the famous Canegie's deli which is an absolute rip-off. Sandwiches are $20 and they charge for everything from lettuce to condiments and drink refills. Order only one sandwich and share. They are that large and I'm a big guy. All in all a good hotel. If you want the hotel to be a major consideration for your stay, I give it a 3 out of 5, but if you just want a nice place to sleep and keep your stuff while you enjoy NYC, it gets a 4 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience with a plus”
Reviews.Author: frapan65
Reviews.Content: I have been for three days at the Park Hotel and the localtion is wonderful, rooms are very nice and large. I have forgotten my Ipad in the room at check-out and a nicest chamber made brought it immediately to me while I was still at the lagguage store. Thanks Billie Billini, you have been wonderful! Franco

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: James P
Reviews.Content: Park Central hotel was perfect for a quick trip to NYC and a show at Carnegie Hall (it's one block away from the hotel). Park Central is in a great mid-town location and we didn't find it be too noisy. Our stay was made better by Ellen Douglas at the front desk who treated us well and allowed us a late check-out to match our travel schedule. The hotel has decent "pay now" rates on their website if you can pay up front and not at the end of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and amazing service...”
Reviews.Author: C J
Reviews.Content: I have to say for my first stay here it was an unbelievable suprise. great service great lobby bar and most important a fantastic front desk host in Elizabeth. Not only courteous and professional but gorgeous as well. Thanks Liz for making this a great stay and great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, friendly guest services”
Reviews.Author: felixkristl
Reviews.Content: Our two-day stay the the Park Central in New York did not disappoint. The only point of complain would be that the room was missing a mini bar or fridge generally and that WiFi is 14$ a day, but the latter is to be expected from larger hotels so no big deal. The location is great right at central park in walking distance of times square and many other sights. Walking to southern manhattan (WTC, Skyline) is a bit far, but the metro stop is right next to the hotel. Outstanding was the service received from all employees, especially guest relations manager Elizabeth. Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Shiva G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for the NYC Half Marathon, running for team LIVESTRONG. All the staff that I met were very friendly, helpfull and supportive. Special thanks to Zaheda Williams, Tony and everyone else for going the extra mile during my stay. The Hotel is located close to the park and walking distance to 42nd Street. A perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “pippo & pedro”
Reviews.Author: pedrito1005
Reviews.Content: great hotel, very reasonable prices, great service, very well located, and the staff very helpfull, special thanks to Jessica Brik

Reviews.Title: “Let down by a few little niggles”
Reviews.Author: crazyrain
Reviews.Content: I went to New York for a week on business and chose the Park Central Hotel for one reason above all others - location location location! I wanted somewhere reasonably central, but not so busy as Times Square and its immediate vicinity, whilst also being in close proximity to Central Park. In this respect it ticks all the boxes - you can walk to Times Square and Cental Park easily, whilst there are subway stops nearby and reasonable quality diners for those nights you don't fancy venturing out! The staff were also good - check in and check out were quick and requests for ironing boards etc were dealt with efficiently. The rooms are also above average size for NY and I didn't feel claustrophobic living in one for a week (although obviously I didn't spend a lot of time there!). Unfortunately though, that is where the praise ends... My first complaint is minor and forgivable given that it is such a large hotel and therefore hard to maintain - wallpaper peeling off the walls in the bathroom, slightly ripped curtain, other minor aesthetic things. The room was clean though so I don't hold this against them too much. The lack of free wifi was disappointing. I know other hotels in a similar price range do provide this. $14 per day to access the internet is ridiculous - you are better off buying a coffee in the starbucks next door and logging on for free! Next, my room safe wasn't working. Admittedly I didn't mention this to the front desk, and if I had, maybe they would have given me a new room, but I was already unpacked by then. Finally, and most annoyingly, my room (and the whole building for that matter) was SO hot! It was early March, I had both windows open as much as possible and the temeperature at the lowest setting possible and I was practically melting! I tried turning the air con off altogether and it made no difference. All in all, nothing dreadful, but if little details really matter to you, maybe you are better off looking for an alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Saved my sanity!”
Reviews.Author: Gayla G
Reviews.Content: I was in NYC overnight on a business trip to attend a fund-raising event. I had been working 20 hour days for the previous week to prepare for the event. I made a reservation for a budget hotel downtown. When I arrived at the budget hotel, I discovered that it was a substandard establishment (dirty, smelly, loud-jack hammer, screaming people). I looked online for another hotel to book at the last minute and found PCNY. I headed up town and arrived in a harried state (I had worked all night, taken a train, checked into a horrible hotel and then took a cab uptown to PCNY). I needed to be at the event refreshed by 6pm that evening. I spoke with Elizabeth Cacovic about my reservation. She put me at ease and assured me that I'd have a beautiful room and be able to rest before my event. She also upgraded me to a suite which made ALL the different in my state of mind. After returning from a busy evening, I was able to relax comfortably in my room and get a great night sleep - the room was PERFECT. Elizabeth followed up with me to see if I was comfortable and ask if there was anything else that I needed. I cannot say enough about this hotel. They (and Elizabeth) really did save my sanity that day after a series of mishaps enabling me to get to my event refreshed. I will ALWAYS look to stay at this hotel when traveling to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Wow”
Reviews.Author: Simsim64
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 6 nights. Prices are ok weekdays increase around weekend. Resturant have great food. Concerge are very helpfull with great info. Reception guys not very helpfull. Rooms are ok but not great. Bit the location is the best. Two blocks from central park, about 5 blocks from time square, madison park and park Ave.

Reviews.Title: “The hottest room ever”
Reviews.Author: Squeakyboo
Reviews.Content: When we checked in at the hotel we were greeted by Ellen who was super accomidating. We had our 11 month old baby with us and Ellen made sure that we could have a room right away even though check in was not until 4 pm and we got to the hotel around 1 pm. I was so appreciative because my baby was tired and I would have given all 5s for this favor but once in the room everything went downhill. The rooms have no temperature control and it was probably 90 degrees in our room. My baby slept in his diaper which was a first. The window could be opened a little bit but would not stay up. We had to prop the window open with a coffee cup. Every moment in the room we were sweating. It took 3 hours to get our crib. I had to ask three times for it. On a Monday morning around 9 am we waited 10 minutes for an elevator. My dad got stuck in an elevator for 15 minutes and the Fire Dept. had to come to get him and a bunch of people out. The hotel accomidates large groups so be prepared to walk through a lobby at all times extremely crowded with people. Location of hotel is great. Ellen at the front desk is amazing. Everything else with the hotel was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Marc T
Reviews.Content: Yep, I just called this my favorite hotel. This is my "go-to" hotel in NY. Location is perfect - close to Times Square, blocks from Central Park, on Carnegie's doorstep. Staff is always fantastic and rooms are just OK enough for this historic property. Restaurants are good and bar is great for pre-show cocktails. Without a doubt, no hesitation ever in booking a room here.

Reviews.Title: “3rd visit to The Park Central”
Reviews.Author: janealibee
Reviews.Content: Another wonderful stay at the Park Central - superb room as requested to the social media team there who made it happen and the use of the hotel limo to take us to the airport. We'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Just great!”
Reviews.Author: maglezdoval
Reviews.Content: We spent a very good days!! All was perfect! The hotel people was great, specially Elisabeth that helped us allways. Thanks!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Reviews.Title: “Elizabeth - the best attendant of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bruno M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent, I am very satisfied and I am sure that when I come back to NYC I will stay in Park Central. Elizabeth was very polite and and helped as more as she could, because I told her I would run the half marathon. The room is very comfortable, safe, and the hotel is very well located. Nothing to complain. Just to thank to all the employees and specially to Elizabeth that was excellent to me and to my family.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Park Central Hotel everytime”
Reviews.Author: tarini c
Reviews.Content: I always stay at Park Central hotel and have a great experience everytime. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, especially Elizabeth, who checked me in this time. Elizabeth made sure that she could do everything to make me have a comfortable stay. The hotel is also in a great location. Would highly recommend the hotel to anyone visiting New York City!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Stassia21
Reviews.Content: Locations is fine , it was a wonderful and close to everything room excellent . Always stay here . Especially love the front desk assistants by Elizabeth she was great

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way”
Reviews.Author: bennygiac
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one week this March, our second visit to the Park Central since 2009 and in spite of some of the reviews I have read on Trip Advisor I am happy to say that once again my visit exceeded any of my expectations. Arriving from JFK in the late afternoon, I can truly say that the check in process was very streamlined and it wasn't long before we were in our room on the 19th floor with a great view of 7 Avenue below. As for the room itself, we were greeted by a freshly cleaned floors, surfaces and bathroom and beautifully made bed (important after nearly 24 hours plus of travelling from Australia). During our week, the room was always well maintained by the housekeeping staff, who would always greet us with a friendly service and a good morning every day. The hotel is in perfect location for Midtown - within walking distance to what many travellers come here to see (Times Square/Central Park/Broadway/5th Ave etc.) and should your visit to NYC include trips further afield then what more could you ask for than the 57 st subway with entrance literally beside the hotel (handy for Downtown/Brooklyn & Queens) and several other stations servicing other nearby locations in the area. When we first chose the Park Central for our first visit to NY on 2009, I have to admit that the price was a deciding factor, however in both of our visits we have found that it is the excellent service from staff (from housekeeping, room service and not to forget reception (ask for Ellen) that truly make this hotel stand out from the crowd. I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody who is looking for great value for money, coupled with quality accommodations and excellence in service from all staff. My only regret was having to check out and return home, when after a week at the Park Central it truly felt like home but I know that it won't be too long until my partner and I come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but definitely NOT a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: liveeatdrinktravel
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms for our most recent three night NYC trip during March break based on the location, price and star rating. Location was great, price and service was good, but this is a three star hotel, not anywhere close to a four. The rooms were very dated, the bathrooms were dingy and dimly lit, and there were room service carts in the hallway all day long. The elevators were oddly set up and very far from the rooms. If you're looking for a true four star hotel like a W or an Intercontinental, I would not recommend the Park Central.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Key Location”
Reviews.Author: DutchMuseChicago
Reviews.Content: I am a regular to both Manhattan and, lately, to the Park Central. Although I live in Chicago, I travel virtually weekly to New York as my office there is a block from the hotel. For a long time, I stayed in my old neighborhood, Chelsea, but decided to give the Park Central Hotel a try as it was so close to my office. Bravo! This hotel is a charm, and I have become so fond of it, I have now become a regular. This is because I have found the staff very customer service oriented--especially the front desk and the reservations staff. The rooms are nice and a bargain given the location (across from Carnegie Hall) and size. As a frequent traveler, I am picky about hotels, but it makes a statement that the Park Central has now become my go-to hotel for NYC. For sight seers, this is a great location because the tour busses stop almost in front of the hotel, the subway is right there, Columbus Circle is an avenue away, and Carnegie Hall is about 30 steps away. I have come to love the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and front desk service”
Reviews.Author: cblank3
Reviews.Content: Arrived early and Ellen at the front desk found us a room immediately and was very friendly! I was very happy with the cleanliness of the room. The location of the hotel is amazing. . .anywhere you want to go in NYC and you're just a short walk away. We had a great time and we're already planning our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great base”
Reviews.Author: Kellykbhv
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend and it was a great base for exploring the city. Very close to the subway and within walking distance of everything. The hotel was clean, comfortable and well priced. Would recommend, great base for all there is to see in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: allisland
Reviews.Content: I stayed last week at the Park Central Hotel in New York City.The hotel is very well located. It is near all the theaters,Lincoln Center and great restaurants. My first impression was the friendly reception by the hotel staff. The room was spacious, the bed very comfortable and the bed linens were immaculate.Elizabeth,the manager, is very attentive to the needs of the guests.I am returning yet again in April, May and June.The hotel is a second home for me in the City.I have recommended it to my friends.However,the decor could use updating.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Morgen_15
Reviews.Content: Had a fabulous time and our room was very clean and tidy, thank you to Rosana Ventil on floor 23, she made us feel very welcome and at home, as did the hotel staff. :) - Susan and Morgen McNab Will recommend and return again to Park Central

Reviews.Title: “Very Close to Central Park, City Walk to Times Square & Broadway”
Reviews.Author: Searcher55
Reviews.Content: With all of the hotel choices that NYC has to offer, Park Central is an excellent choice. I was leaning to one of the popular chain hotels, but was pleasantly surprise at Park Central. My wife and I were celebrating our anniversary and mentioned that at check-in. We were both surprised to receive a knock on our door and room service brought us chocolate covered strawberries and bottle water complementary. Nice touch! The restaurant was good for one evening. We had their special three course meal. Room was clean and excellent views of Times Square. My wife and I really had a wonderful experience at the hotel and the staff was quite polite and accommodating. Yes, I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Location. From Houston, TX”
Reviews.Author: Hvargas215
Reviews.Content: Elizabeth, What can I say your staff is outstanding and awesome customer service. We stayed from 3/8/12 thru 3/16/12. Every day of the our stay was the extroranary experience. Beautiful rooms excellent view of the town. Vargas family from Houston, TX

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in NYC & Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: alex c
Reviews.Content: All thumbs up for what is truly the best price/value in NYC. Arriving late in the evening after a nine hour flight and then being welcomed by Ellen, the most competent, charming, friendly and efficient Front Desk Manager I have so far met, is a great way to start your stay !! For the last 15 years I have traveled to NYC about five to ten times a year on business and have stayed in probably 15-20 different hotels in the 4-5 Star category. No question whatsoever, the Park Central is the best price/value in this category. The location is great (for business and leisure); the rooms are comfortable and rather spacious for NYC standards (king bed had a great mattress for my chronic back pain) ; bath rooms are functional; and everything very clean. WiFi very fast, breakfast buffet with all you really need and great location of the restaurant. All of the staff is courteous and competent, of course lead by Ellen probably being the nominee for the "employee of the year" - If you look for a quiet and romantic hide away with evenings spend in the bar with just you and the piano player, this might perhaps not be for you, but otherwise I can not see what someone could be missing or dislike - even more so if you consider the very competitive price.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for our 1st ever trip to New York”
Reviews.Author: DavidTro
Reviews.Content: Just home from our stay at Park Central between 10/3 and 14/3 and our first ever trip to New York. Check-in was smooth with a nice welcome. First impression of the room was that it was rather dark even at midday so we had to put all the lights on. Room was clean,large king bed,bathroom was also clean,other amenities in the room were also fine. View from the window was of a brick wall (but who goes to New York to look out the window) We were on the 12th floor. Elevator system took a little working out when calling from the lobby,you push the room floor on a panel to the side of elevators and wait until it shows what one to use,you cant just use any elevator to get to your room.Talking of elevators our room was right next to them and it was rather noisy at night with being able to hear the workings of the elevator so try to get a room away from them. Only had to use the front desk/conceirge twice and on both times the staff were really helpful and friendly. Great location,really close to Central Park and a short walk to Times Square. Only used the hotel to sleep and shower in so can't comment on food quality or bar service etc but if its like the service provided by the front desk then you won't go wrong I think. For our first visit to New York then I think we made a great choice in Park Central and won't hesitate to recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “All in all, a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: RBarnhart
Reviews.Content: I will start with the positive. Our stay kicked off to a great start when we came to the hotel 5 hours before check-in time in the hopes of storing our baggage until we could check-in. The front desk agent (Ellen) surprised us when she told us there was a room ready. By 11:30 a.m. we were in our room, looking out onto 7th Avenue. By 11:45, we were out the door, ready to take in the city. Our room was large for a Manhattan hotel and very clean. The location could not have been better, near Central Park, MOMA, Carnegie Hall, and probably most important, the 59th street subway. Our experiences with the bar and restaurant were not as wonderful. The hours were erratic. Bar did not open at time it was listed as opening. Only one bartender made us feel welcome at the hotel. Everyone else ranged from apathy to open hostility. I'm used to inflated food and beverage prices at hotels, but the prices on wine seemed off the charts. ($14 for a glass of Beringer sauvignon blanc?) I thought of reviewing the hotel and bar/restaurant separately, because if I had, I would have given the hotel a 5 star, easily. It was a wonderful experience. The bar/restaurant, 2 stars. In the future, if I were to return, I would avoid the bar and restaurant completely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant service”
Reviews.Author: nour c
Reviews.Content: Thank you Elizabeth , Drita and most of all Marie Pual for excellent service. Marie Paul who works overnight is the sweetest person Ive met. Took good care of me.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location!”
Reviews.Author: janeWaterlooOntario
Reviews.Content: We recently enjoyed 4 four days in NYC with our teenage/ young adult children. The location of the Park Central was perfect for us. One day we had a wonderful walk north through Central Park to the Museum of Natural History, and the next day walked south through Times Square, did a 30 Rockerfeller Center tour and enjoyed a wonderful exhibition at MOMA. Being slightly outside Times Square suited us perfectly, we enjoyed the quieter neighbourhood and the great coffee shops and restaurants in the area. The hotel is quite nice for the price. A bonus is the "temporary" coffee shop set up in the morning in the lobby, with muffins, bagels, coffee etc. available. The rooms were just okay, the cleaning staff is amazing and they did the best they could with the slightly tired rooms. Would definitely return to this hotel for the great location and the good sized rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Xiao N
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is located very close to the Times Square and Central Park. And their staff, like the Front Desk Manager Ellen who welcomed us and the cleaners of 7th floor impressed me by making me feel like home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: MarkJen51703
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the park central hotel 3/4/12-3/6/12. The hotel has a great location by times square and central park. Rooms were clean and maintained. I did not like that they left the cleaning carts in the hallway the entire time, but that is the only negative I have. The staff was very polite and helpful. We asked for a couple of suggestions on where to eat and they suggested great places. I would definitely return, you can't beat the price or the location.

Reviews.Title: “For NY, it's fine!”
Reviews.Author: MRUtah
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy about this hotel. There seemed to be a lot of tour groups booked at the hotel. The lobby decor is chic/modern, but it doesn't really work. The interior is a bit worn. But....for affordable midtown Manhattan it was just fine. We stayed for 5 nights at the hotel. Our room was very clean and spotlessly maintained each day. The staff is friendly - especially the housekeeping staff. The bed was incredibly comfortable!! The size was generous for NY - we have paid much more for smaller rooms. The location was great - a few blocks from Times Square and the theatre district; Central Park was just around the corner. I noticed other reviews mentioned the elevators - we thought they were fine, especially for a hotel with over 25 floors. The only thing that bugged me was the $14.10 charge per 24 hours of internet service; most tourists these days rely on the internet for planning and booking. Overall, I can recommend this hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central ... Central to the Big Apple ... Staff with Big Hearts!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeGeorgeCanada
Reviews.Content: This is my 6th stay at this Hotel and I'm a pretty picky traveller who looks for comfort, value, cleaniness and location. The Park Central has it all, along with a very friendly staff that does their utmost to make your stay memorable and without havoc. Right from the onset Sohka, the Front Desk Manager did a wonderful job welcoming us, noting I was a return client and along with me was another couple coming to NYC for thier first time. They are equally impressed and felt at home. Feeling at home when you're thousands of miles away is pretty impressive. We can afford to basically stay anywhere ...however when you have a location like Park Central which is walking distance to Times Square one way and Central Park the other way ... what more do you need. Subways is just below ... Carnegie Deli is next door ... Letterman is around the corner as are all the Broadway shows. Go to the Park Central. You'll be happy and will appreciate the excellent value and awesome attitude and care from the fine staff here. Tell them George George from Canada sent you. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “"Great location...not so great accommodations"”
Reviews.Author: nikkipaylay
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just average. They are renovating it,however, they have quite a ways to go before it will be above average. The rooms are small so when you have the heat on (even on low) it knocks you out of the room. The room had a musty smell when we first went in, however, that went away. The door for the closet hits the wall so you can't open it all the way. The same with the bathroom door it hits the toilet and also the fan didn't work in the bathroom. The telephone in our room didn't work. The entry light blinked off and on when you left it on. We had to pay for wi-fi which didn't work very well at times. We didn't have a "Do Not Disburb" sign for our room. We didn't even know our maid's name. On one of the elevators the button for our floor never lit up however it did stop at our floor. The elevators were very slow. Our room came with the American Breakfast Buffet, we found this to be just ok.The maids carts were left in the hallway every night . The hallway is very small it barely fit two people side by side. However the bed was comfortable and the room was clean. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Our train wasn't leaving until 2:00 p.m. and they let us stay in the room until 1:00 p.m. at no charge. It was okay for our short stay for 2 -3 days, however, if you were planning to stay longer I would not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, but with surprising charges”
Reviews.Author: rtrejo
Reviews.Content: Yes, the location is unrivalled and, yes, it is not a luxury hotel. The place is standard and, for NYC, the price is acceptable. But the attention to customers are frequently impolite. We have been three times in the New York Park Central. Last time was in the New Year Eve's days. The hotel is such near to Times Square that in December 31 the police fencings were upon the Hotel's doors. Anywar, we preferred to dinner in a place in font of Central Park but that was another story. In our recent stay, the reservation that I made was not honoured. I requested for a room with to beds and we needed to wait one day until the appropiated room be available. We had our departure very early in January 3 to take the plane back to my country, so I had to use the voice mail check out system. The bill that I received that morning was charging me about 160 dollars more than the expenses I had. Anyway I decided to pay. But a couple of days later I realized that the hotel was made an adittional charge. In total, my payment was 250 dollars higher. It is not too much in a 3500 dlls bill but, anyway, that is an inappropriate conduct by the Hotel's administration. I asked two times about that charge, by e-mail and in the web page, but the Manager is to busy to answer. We (my wife, my son, myself) travel almost each year to NYC. Undoubtely we need another hotel for our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Bellman, Carmelo!”
Reviews.Author: Ann F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Park Central New York. Our Bellman, Carmelo was outstanding! From luggage care and delivery to arranging transportation for us. If you visit that hotel, make sure you ask for Carmelo! He is one of their BEST employees!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, Great Location, Frequent Customer”
Reviews.Author: Larry L
Reviews.Content: This hotel by far is my favorite place to stay in NYC when on business. This staff has been exceptional over the years and made my stays enjoyable and personable. In particular, Carolyn has greeted me by name and ensures that my stay is comfortable and personable. The rooms are clean, maintained, and spacious. The made staff does an excellent job making up the room and ensuring that it feels fresh when I arrive back to the room. I can't say enough about the staff and responsiveness. Check in is quick and efficient even with long lines. The location is awesome and walking distance to Radio City Music Hall, Carnegie Hall, Times Square, Central Park, Lincoln Center to name a few places. The hotel is large and does tend to have many groups making it congested in the lobby. There have been serveral times during peak times where I've had to wait for elevators or even after selecting the floor missed the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Park Yourself at the Park Central”
Reviews.Author: Steven433
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Central one night on a recent business trip to NYC.The stay was between mediocre and miserable.First the lobby was dark,seedy and the furniture was worn and dirty.The front office staff was courteous as was the bellman.The elevator was dirty and noisy.My room was good sized but only had a desk chair.The lighting the room was poor and the television was an older model.The bright spot was the bathroom which had been recently renovated with new fixtures.The heating unit was extremely loud and old. In summary I would recommend those looking for a more updated hotel look elsewhere.The location is good, staff is friendly but that is where it stops

Reviews.Title: “ny, ny”
Reviews.Author: moogii
Reviews.Content: I was going to give them an average mark because there is no free wi-fi, the elevators are slow & the bathroom was a bit moldy & smelly because of poor ventilation. However, the staff were extremely friendly & helpful. Our hotel maid Chantal Latortue was lovely. She made us feel very welcome. Plus the hotel was in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Staff !!!”
Reviews.Author: Chris Y
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful staff at this hotel. The reception/check-in was very quick, despite a large line when I arrived. I was checked in by a wonderful woman who was helpful and even compassionate. Despite a rough travel day, she made me laugh and look forward to an even in the heart of Midtown Manhatten. This hotel is right in the middle of everything!

Reviews.Title: “Park Central treats you like family”
Reviews.Author: Terry E
Reviews.Content: My frequent stays at Park Central New York always begin with a speedy check-in by friendly staff. It only gets better from there. My room is always clean and spacious, usually with one of the best views in the city of bustling 7th Avenue and the Central Park/Times Square district. The few times I've needed to call for assitance with a cranky heater or more bathroom towels, the response has been quick and efficient. Guest Relations Manager, Drita Oroshi, has been especially helpful and always makes me feel like part of the Park Central family. Finally, I love the location. The hotel is within walking distance to Central Park, Carnegie Hall, Columbus Circle and some of the finest shopping and restaurants in the world. And the cost is definitely reasonble by New York standards. For the money, I am convinced Park Central is the best hotel in New York. Terry Edmonds

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Bruce G
Reviews.Content: Elizabeth, as usual my stay at the hotel was very enjoyable. Thank you very much for the "personal" attention in allowing me early-check in and late check-out. The personal attention I received plus the hotel's location is the main reason I stay at the Park Central, even though I can afford to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “All-in-all a very good stay”
Reviews.Author: Emanuel_NY
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Central for several days. Despite some problems at check-in (very small room) the overall experience was very good. Customers relation (Elizabeth) is excellent, they provided a better room no charge. Elizabeth was professional, kind, helpful, and extremely friendly person - excellance service. Hotel is on a great location, very subway accessible. I had a great time and would stay at the Park Central on my next visit to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a very good stay”
Reviews.Author: Sa12321
