Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Central from the end of February into early March. It was my first trip to NYC along with a friend. The location and exterior of the hotel is amazing, especially for the price! Looks amazing at night. Upon checking in and getting to our room, our special requests had not been implemented, but that was absolutely fine and understandable as we knew they're not guaranteed. We had a decent sized king bed room. Bathroom is quite cramped until you get used to it, then it's not so bad. Clean but not spotless. Lots of different sized towels, all replaced daily. Water pressure in shower could be better. Anyway, from the moment I stepped into bed (I had the window side half of the bed) there was a very strange, unpleasant smell. I couldn't tell where it was coming from, but it was so bad that I had to block my nose to sleep. When I woke up it was the 1st thing I smelt, and I was revolted. I don't like to complain so I ignored it and got ready for a fun day of sightseeing. That evening when I returned, it became apparent that the stench was there to stay, so I informed front desk who sent up several people who just opened the window and sprayed freshener near th bed area. This helped for about 5 minutes. Then the stench returned. It was becoming unbearable. Someone came up to look at the hearing system as they thought it may have been from that, but it wasn't. And now the heating system was blowing out cold air. So we complained again. They sent up an electrician to sort it out but his attitude was quite rude and I don't know what he done but he said hot air will begin circulating within 10 minutes. But it didn't, and we were too tired to complain again. The next morning I woke up to the horrible smell and my friend woke up ill. We were both furious as this made us waste a day of our 7 day holiday. Not acceptable. Phoned front desk demanding to be moved and they said that's fine. Got a key to another room. Got to the door and noticed it was a handicapped room, not great but not a big deal. But once inside we were very angry. It was a very small double bed room. We had paid for a king room, so what made them think we'd happily move to this one? Complained again. My friend was furious so the lady who I believe was a manager gave us a suite with two double beds overlooking Times Square. This room was much more pleasant, although it still had that horrid smell in the living room by the desk. Upon reading reviews it's apparent this is a problem at the Park Central, although the manager denied she'd ever come across this before... Anyway, the last few nights were much better and we appreciated the upgrade. The hotel overall is great. Elevator system is quick and easy, somewhat fun. Cityhouse breakfast was very tasty and the Bengali waiter was very friendly and helpful. It's a shame about the initial problems but I'd still recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Ellen took good care of us”
Reviews.Author: Jack J
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Central for the weekend while attending 2 broadway performances. The overall experience was wonderful and Ellen took excellent care of us while we were there. She was courteous, kind, helpful, and was an extremely friendly person. I had a great time and would stay at the Park Central on my next visit to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Near 5 stars hôtel”
Reviews.Author: funkymaster
Reviews.Content: The park central hôtel is one of the kindest hôtel i've ever do. And the rooms are very clean everything was fine and Elizabeth was very helpfull for us

Reviews.Title: “Great customer relations (Elizabeth was wonderful and Lovely)”
Reviews.Author: mike a
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by Elizabeth at the front desk. Her attitude and manner exceeded the level of excellance. She made us feel at home! We will recommend this hotel to all our family and friends. Thank you Elizabeth!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice value hotel”
Reviews.Author: hokies_k
Reviews.Content: It was my first time staying at this hotel. It is a nice hotel, but the rooms could be a little bit cleaner. The carpets in the hallway looks very aged, as does the elevator doors. The hotel dining at the "City Hall" is quite pricey, but there are other options for dining around the hotel. They have breakfast buffett for $35. The bottom line is, you can't get this kind of value in Manhattan. Everything was in working order. They had a flat screen TV (27"), wifi, and a small gym on the 3rd floor. It is close to a lot of things (Penn Station is about 8 blocks away, Times Square about the same distance, and is very subway accessible). I took a taxi getting around, and came up to less than $10 for each trip, some even under $5. BUT if you are looking for luxury, there is not an ounce here. They will charge you a flat $1.25 if you call a 800-number (phone card for instance). For me, it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel !!! I will be back again!”
Reviews.Author: Agostina44
Reviews.Content: Excellent location! Really nice time sq view! Two blocks away from 5 th av. And its main stores!!! Few blocks away from the central park !! The view is nice!!! Rooms are spacious!! Beds and pillows really confortables!! Breakfast is great!! With lots of different options according to each one of us!!! Elizabeth was really nice and kind to us! Thank you!!! We will be back soon!!! As we gad had an excellent stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Agostin
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect!it is nearby time sq and the gorgeous 5 th av. The rooms are spacious and clean! I ve been staying in the hotel for several times and i will deffinetly be back! Breakfast is really good and you have lots of options according to ypur preferences !!! Elizabeth helped me very kindly in all my concerns!

Reviews.Title: “russians run this place”
Reviews.Author: newtosouthamerica
Reviews.Content: From the time I entered this hotel I encountered people speaking Russian being rude to the desk staff and pushing others' out of the way to be first in line. In my room all I could hear were the same screaming until early in the morning. When I checked out the lady at the desk said she empathized.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at Park Central”
Reviews.Author: Heldo T
Reviews.Content: Cleaning and maintainance of rooms was very good. Employees very polite Excellent ubication to take as base to visit NY, very safe to walk even at night Elizabeth took care of us very good, very polite.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Liverdan
Reviews.Content: Steps from Central Park, Carnegie Hall, City Center, great restaurants, shopping. Right at check in you'll feel welcome by Guest Services managers. Ricky Alvarez helped me getting an early check in and later in the day helped me with a problem with my computer. People like that are definitely a great asset to any hotel, compensating for other things a property migh lack in other areas. There are a few problems with this property like: Lack of pressure on the showers, dated forniture, the elevators are very slow in the morning, loud maids in the morning, old carpeting, funny smell in some of the rooms (I had to go to a nearby Duane Reade to buy air freshener). Overall, it's location and customer service are good enough reasons to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful people”
Reviews.Author: Ted H
Reviews.Content: We haven't stayed at this nicely located hotel since it was part of Omni, but were lured by proximity to Lincoln Center and attractive rates from Quikbook. It has shortcomings, but we got great service from two individuals when we had to change rooms and my wife left our house keys in the safe of the first room. Angela at the front desk and Al Rivera in security were not only sympathetic but greatly helpful. And Angela had already been very helpful in helping us change rooms the day before.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central N.Y.”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey C
Reviews.Content: The Park Central hotel is very well located and an excellent place to stay for the price! The hotel is just a few blocks from Central Park, Time Square, and the Theatre district! The rooms are not the fanciest but they are very clean and have all the amenities needed to make your stay very pleasurable. I have stayed at the Park Central Hotel many times each year and have been returning for over 15 years! Carolyn at the reception is always eager to greet me with a friendly smile and she welcomes me with her always warm greeting!!

Reviews.Title: “That's was a wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: unique011
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my High school group in NY last week. The Park Central hotel is a wonderful place with very pay attention staff. Everyone are great. Rooms are clean and nice. Comfortable location. Would like recommend, if you have some questions, one of their concierge team member, Ms. Osilla Stewart. She is the best. One of the best waitress in the restaurant is Eloy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa K
Reviews.Content: Customer service far exceeded expectations. My young children were extremely comfortable in this hotel. I was impressed by the level of interaction between my children and the front desk staff. Emanuel at the front desk actually encouraged and inspired my children! My daughter is now dreaming about performing at Madison Square Garden someday:) The staff in the lobby helped numerous times with directions and information. The breakfast was delicious and the beds were very comfortable. On our last day at the hotel my two year old said, "few more days!" because he did not want to leave. We are already looking forward to another visit and absolutely staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Services”
Reviews.Author: Stan198031
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great and I love the services, well its not my first time at Park Central Hotel, rooms are great and room services are awesome, Elizabeth Guest Relation Manager was very helpful and nice to talk to and with a good sense of human. Thanks Park Central and keep the wonderful services, I will be back soon

Reviews.Title: “Last stay at Park Central Hotel March 2012”
Reviews.Author: Daniella D
Reviews.Content: Its is a wonderful Hotel at Best Location in Manhattan , Close to Central park and Times Square , Theaters and many good restaurants in the area As specially am grateful for the Representatives at the front desk , always willing to help with my requests , Thank you Ellen so much you made my trips to New York wonderful and enjoyable , looking forward to come back soon Sincerely Daniella

Reviews.Title: “We came back home !”
Reviews.Author: Irmi O
Reviews.Content: That is the only hotel we choose when we come to NY , the location , the rooms , the public facilities , the workers all over the hotel , from the front desk till the concierge......... The hotes is live and we love to stay here . The chance to get the breakfast is very pleasant and comfortable . Lastly , you spend most of the time at the room , this time we want to mention the woman cleaning lady , Mrs. Georgiana , which did her job in a best way !

Reviews.Title: “Nice find near Carnegie Hall”
Reviews.Author: ciaobla
Reviews.Content: The Park Central was a very pleasant surprise. A bit out of all the action (55th & 7th), it was still an easy walk to the hub bub of Times Square. The room was good sized, clean, and the bathroom terrific with lots of fluffy towels and "Pure" bath products. The people from check in to inquiries to check out were really quite nice and helpful. I appreciate hotel associates calling me by my name and the PC folks never failed to use my full name.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but you feel ripped off”
Reviews.Author: LucyW_10
Reviews.Content: I was surprised by the references in other reviews to the great staff at the Park Central. We may have just been unlucky, but having come here straight from another hotel in the same price bracket, we felt the service here was lacking. On arrival I had to wait quite a while to check in, to then find that my room wasn't ready (not a problem), and told that I had to pay $7.50 to leave my two bags at the hotel until the room was ready. I've never come across this before as to my mind this is part of what you pay a hotel for, and to pay a total of $21to leave 4 bags on arrival and again between checking out and going to the airport simply makes you feel ripped off. I also felt this on realising that to use wi-fi at the hotel was $14.50 a day. In this day and age when you can get free wi-fi at most cafes, this seems pretty steep. Having said this, the room was spacious and light, with decent furnishings and amenities (although ours had a somewhat musty smell). If you're happy doing your own thing and want a decent sized room in a good location, then this is fine. But if you'd like some service, or you hate feeling ripped off, I'd avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “4 Nights at Park Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jared S
Reviews.Content: I flew to New York for the first time on Feb 23rd and stayed at the Park Central Hotel, The hotel was very nice and the service was great. When we left to go home the Hotel offered us transportation to the airport, which we thought was gonna be a regular Car but Carmelo the Bellman got us a Limo instead for the same price. Great place to stay in New York and would definetly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great spot with a incredible customer service”
Reviews.Author: Rakel T
Reviews.Content: We were there with several dance troupes and Elizabeth went above and beyond in order to be able to accommodate our many early check-ins for the artists. Her aid made everybody's experience so much better and I dare say she helped maintaining the health of these touring exhausted travelers!

Reviews.Title: “A nice and warm feeling”
Reviews.Author: Lisa O
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice week at this hotell. Good location nice rooms for a good price. And the most important thing, a nice staff. Carolyn and Ellen in the reception were very helpful and charming, they made our days. Thank you Rosanne for keeping our room nice and cleen. We will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Husam034
Reviews.Content: We arrived in New York early on the day and we were so tired after a long flight. The check-in time starts at about 1:00 pm, so we did a pre-registration. I then went to Elizabeth who works as a guest relations agent and she was absolutely helpful. She let us do an early check-in, something which you don't find very often in NYC hotels. We had a little problem with the room and she gladly helped us and changed it right away. She did not let me go down and get the key, but, rather, she sent the bell boy with the key for the other room. The rooms are clean. The bed was made well and we even had an air purifier which we never had in any other hotels. The view is very nice and the hotel location is very good being close to many attractions especially the Central Park. Yeah one more thing, the Internet connection is very fast compared to other hotels. I recommed this hotel strongly and would stay here in my next visits to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “NYC Overnight”
Reviews.Author: john s
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Park Central couldn't have been better for both the service we received and the amenities. The location of the hotel is perfect for acces to both Central Park and the theater distrtict. I would especially like to thank our receptionist, Ellen at the front desk who was most kind and helpful with our needs, Additionally, I would like to give special thanks to our Bellman, Carmelo, who made our stay most enjoyable. We felt part of the "Family!" John Soltis

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Park Central - Elizabeth was fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: Andre P
Reviews.Content: After traveling from out-of-state thinking our reservation was secured at another hotel only to find out later that it was not, Elizabeth was fantastic in helping us find a very nice suite at the Park Central Hotel at a very affordable rate. I've been to NYC several times on business, and somehow missed this hotel. Well my stay at the Park Central was one of my best trips to NYC. In Midtown, it's walking distance to Central Park, the Theatre District, and lots of shopping and dining options. Thanks, again, Elizabeth, for you help.

Reviews.Title: “Great time, Central location”
Reviews.Author: duker52004
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Central recently on a four night, five day quicky trip to NYC. We found the hotel perfectly situated for what we wanted to do: visit Times Square, Canel street, 9/11 Memorial, stores, Empire State Building, etc. We had a King Bed on the 21st floor, and found it better than adequate, but not outstanding. The bed, however, was WONDERFUL! We had very deep and restful sleeps. You could hear some street noise (as others have mentioned) but we slept so deep it was not noticed. There was a internet charge of almost $15 for 24 hrs, which we (and most of the staff, we found!) thought was outrageous! Really?? Come on Park Central, when most hotels, and the Starbucks next door, offer it free, shouldn't it be time to reconsider this policy? When we sometime return to the Big Apple, we will definitely consider the Park Central again.

Reviews.Title: “great View and Checkout”
Reviews.Author: Kerry L
Reviews.Content: had a view of Times Square from a higher floor. Definitely worth getting an upgrade on check-in. The internet connection was a little wonky, and the room was not well cleaned, but the service at the front desk, especially at check out was exceptional. Ellen went out of her way to make sure I knew how to get to the airport, and comped my bags that needed to be checked for a couple hours.

Reviews.Title: “Kindness at the front desk”
Reviews.Author: Pablo Z
Reviews.Content: Tap water pressure is a bit low, so you will need to stay longer at the shower. Besides that, you have Carolyn at the front desk: within just 2 hours, she managed to get a birthday cake, with candle and matches at midnight!

Reviews.Title: “Reservation Department Surpurb”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel with great service. We stay here every time we are in New York. What stands out for me each time I call for reservations is talking to Reservation Specialist Jason Rivera, who assists me for each visit. He is thoughtful, knowledgeable, and so very helpful each time we talk. This fellow deserves a medal !!!!!! He makes staying at the Park Central so pleasant. John F. Coffey Hatfield, Pa.

Reviews.Title: “I'll come back again!r”
Reviews.Author: Juliana S
Reviews.Content: The localization is perfect, the rates are inexpensive. I'll come back! The only thing that is awful is the elevator system. It takes a long time to arrive, along time to close the doors , but it's ok...

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: camilaeclarice
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice! Good location,the attendence Angela was very kind with us. This is my second time in this hotel and I will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara M
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Park Central this week and will definitely go back. The staff was courteous and friendly, especially Ellen at the front desk. The room was large, clean, and comfortable. And the location is great. You can walk to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, and Lincoln Center. It is also close to the subway. I have stayed in a number of NYC hotels for the same price and this one was definitely the best. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: zeepodar
Reviews.Content: We took a red eye flight from LA to NYC. by the time we got to the hotel it was 10 AM and we knew that the check in time was at 4 pm and the likelihood of getting a room at that time was slim. Since it was raining we decided to hang out at the lobbey. The Guest Relations Manager, Elizabeth, really acknowledged that we must have been tired and went out of her way and got us one of the best rooms by 12 O'clock. with this kind of customer service, next time I am visiting NYC, I will be staying at Park Central again.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: calbeth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Central in November last year. It was a great hotel, very central to anything you wanted to do. Staff were very friendly and very helpful when we had a problem with the window in our room. We didnt eat in the hotel as we were out and about so much but the food did look very good that we saw. Only downside was that there is an area that is like timeshare which you were captured in the hotel lobby to see. However that was the only down side.

Reviews.Title: “All Around, A Winner”
Reviews.Author: Geekguy1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Park Central in NYC and were very happy with all aspects of the hotel. The location is great: between Central Park and the Times Square theater district, with nearby dining optiuons ranging from $295 a person (!) to local hot dog vendors and everything in between. The lobby was clean, modern, and functional, but the elevator system -- while it turns out to be excellent -- might take a bit of an explanation from the staff. The best part of they stay was the room, which was clean, large, and had a much appreciated separate sitting area. The bathroom was fine but could have used brighter lighting, a common problem. Checking out took much longer than expected, but only because we enjoyed chatting with Ellen, our checkout person. She was interesting, knowledgable, and helpful. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, excellent location and awesome crew!”
Reviews.Author: RafaelMaia
Reviews.Content: It was an excellent surprise to stay in the PC NY. It has an awesome location, just one block from central park and a few blocks from times square, allowing us to get everywhere around manhattan by foot. It's my first time in NY, and I must say that yes, I'll come back, and no matter what, I'll be staying at the PC!!! Great crew (Elizabeth, the manager, and her team, are amazing!). *** Breakfast package is a must have. Great deal! ***

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous for the Price!!”
Reviews.Author: dylnikole
Reviews.Content: The Park Central Hotel was perfect for our vacation. The location and price are both great. The hotel staff was very accommodating and very polite. They allowed us to check in early and arranged our travel back to the airport. I would reccommend this hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Our New York Trip”
Reviews.Author: Kelly H
Reviews.Content: We took a trip to New York on February 21st and stayed for 3 days we stayed at Park Centlral Hotel, we were on our way to our room when we met a wonderful lady named Bebe; she said she will be the person that was going to take care of our room and if it was anything we needed in the room to just let her know, she also Gave us some ideas where to go for dinner and breakfast. Her supervisor was also in the hall way and he was very nice as well, each day our room was clean and when ever we say her she was very nice, the next time we visit New York and it will be real soon, we will stay at the Park Central Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: AMO31112
Reviews.Content: Coming from an area that always has AC in every hotel, it was a bit of a shock to hear they did not. Opening the windows helped a tad, but with no screens, I was constantly worrying about bugs comign in the room. It was relativity quiet (21st floor), but was aware of neighbors discussions and movements. Tony Cunaj, our reservations manager was incredible and I will stay here again because of him. My only comment is to not have feather pillows, bedspread and mattress cover, as some poeple are allergic!

Reviews.Title: “The service here was excellent, i will defiantly come back.”
Reviews.Author: djamison
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean, great services and has a great location. It is surrounding by great restaurants and it is not to far from tines square.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is pretty beautyful and i will be back again!”
Reviews.Author: Victorhugopinheiro
Reviews.Content: Excellent carefull with persons even from The another country, making To fell in home even travelling with The long way from home

Reviews.Title: “Ready to travel again”
Reviews.Author: alk63
Reviews.Content: Read many reviews here on tripadvisor and was a little uneasy about staying at this hotel. I am glad to report that we had a great experience and yes the hotel needs some updates, but there were no major concerns. Upon checkin, our traveling companion's reservation was mixed up (cancelled for a no show a month prior). Our friends had documentaion of the actual reservation and the staff was very helpful in working it out. His bill was adjusted for the night they had already been charged. As the other reviews stated, pay attention to the floor selection on the elevator and you will not have problems. The room temp was warm but opening the window solved that quickly. Our room was spacious (high ceiling made it feel even larger), clean and no problems from city noise (8th floor). I would stay at this hotel again. The location is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: renata m
Reviews.Content: Choose it! You will not regret! Look for Ellen. She will help you!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: T M
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the hotel. I was upgraded on check in to a suite that was available. Elizabeth was very pleasant, professional and helpful upon check in. I was able to negotiate a late check out time as well. The rooms were clean, bed comfortable, room service was fine. I'd stay there again. GREAT LOCATION.

Reviews.Title: “my home in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Marilisa U
Reviews.Content: Great location, spacious and very clean room, good rates...and a fabulous front desk person. Thanks to Ellen my stay at the Park Central has been great. Helpful, very professional and always smiling. I come to NYC very often and I have been staying in several hotels. Park Central is always the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Pam L
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating a 60th birthday and upon arrival were given a room that we felt was too small. One of the managers allowed us to leave our bags in that room until a different room was ready for us. Drita (another front desk manager) told us to go and do some shopping and return at 4:00 to get keys to the new room. We returned around 4:30 and everything was ready for us. She also gave us vouchers for breakfast which was a very nice surprise!!! Nancy (in the bar) did an excellent job of seeing that our cocktails were served correctly so that we could begin the celebration. Will stay here when in NYC next time for sure. Staff was very accommodating and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very good if you want to be near Carnegie Hall”
Reviews.Author: slsiege
Reviews.Content: I got this room at a steep discount at close to the last minute. The location was ideal for me, since I was meeting people for dinner at the Carnegie Deli and then attending a concert at Carnegie Hall and this hotel is within a half-block of both. The room was on the small side, but still decent for a midtown Manhattan hotel, and it was clean and comfortable, though the mattress was a little soft. There's a decent-looking exercise center on the third floor. A few things you should know: Check-in can be slow, especially at the designated 4PM (!) check-in time; the computers in the business center are $.35/minute ($5 minimum); and you have to turn the shower lever all the way counter-clockwise to get hot water. Another nice touch was the bath soap, which was better than I usually encounter in hotels.

Reviews.Title: “trip to NY”
Reviews.Author: einav u
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a great location easy to get everywhere the subway is outside the door alot of restaurants and coffee places one secound from central park 2 minutes from 5th av the rooms r nice we got very good treatment aspecially Elizabeth from the reception she helped with everthing we needed she treated us realy good she was very polite and called later to see if we r ok she made our trip much better einav udi

Reviews.Title: “Manager”
Reviews.Author: Ricardo S
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel very tired because the trip and Drita was very helpfull to give us a early check in. That was difficult because the hotel was completely booked. She is really good and the hotel is very good located.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Ester Z
Reviews.Content: I was very well received by Elizabeth who helped around the hotel and the city giving me directions and great tips. The hotel is very well localized and have great services to offer to everyone with a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Stay at Park Central Hotel, NYC”
Reviews.Author: ottawa198
Reviews.Content: As soon as we walked into the lobby we knew this place was bordering on being a dive. Long check in line and very mixed bag of people. Front desk looked like it was a 'front' with horrible long black curtains masking something in the background. Upon getting into elevator could not push button for floor. Others in the elevator explained that you have to push the floor button outside of the elevator to access floor. No one at the front desk bothered to tell us that. In addition for such a large hotel it did not have enough elevators for the many people. We had to wait for the two elevatosr to return to the lobby 3 times before we could board it. Room had no radio/clock (which should be a basic feature), no coffee maker (should also be a basic feature), and faced a dark courtyard (so you couldn't really tell what time of day it was). Mattresses were lopsided, pillows were lumpy and sheets were bordering on coarse. On our 2nd day (which was also thank goodness our last day) there was one towel, one hand towel and one washcloth for two people in a room with two beds. Guess housekeeping can't count as it was obvious two people had slept in the two beds. Guess I expect too much common sense. The carpets in the room and hallways were filthy and didn't appear to be vacuumed too often. The walls are paper thin and we could hear every door slamming in the hall way and loud voices projecting through the walls. As well we could hear the tv next door through the walls. The water pressure on the 5th floor was weak. The bathroom is so poorly designed that you can not fully open the door as it hits the toilet! Finally the room was very overheated. We tried regulating the dials inside the radiator turning one to the coolest setting and the other to fan and received hot blowing air. My husband who is usually cool or comfortable turned off the regulating dials as he got nauseated from the uncontrollable heat. We tried opening the 'key locked' window in the room to no avail. We frequent NYC regularly and this was a spur of the moment reservation made because of the location. After all this is NYC how could a hotel offer such low standards and still be in existence? We won't assume anything in the future and let down our guards. Spend the extra money and stay somewhere else that at least offers clean rooms, basics such as a clock radio and coffee maker, and boasts of comfortable beds and pillows. We were never so happy to get out of there on the morning of our departure at 6 am and make ourselves more comfortable at the La Guardia terminal which is not great, but at least it's cleaner than the hotel. Flying home on a small plane I was able to take a nap which provided some decent sleep which I was not able to get in the hotel. It's hard to believe that people posted positive reviews of this hotel received as it does not warrant a rating higher than poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price but nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: fireb0at
Reviews.Content: Plusses: great location, rooms are big enough and clean enough, quiet, plenty of eating establishments of all sorts right near by, felt safe, good water pressure and plenty of hot water, able to regulate room temperature. Minuses: no "extras", room was not cleaned first day so had to ask for towels, very busy lobby always, no coffee pot in the room and only expensive coffee in the lobby ( we walked to the diner down the block to get coffee at half the price), elevator had some issues, some shabbiness to the decor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Christina R
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend away in the city. Quiet rooms, very friendly staff everywhere. Kristen, in the restaurant is a doll! Always smiling and quickly accommodating to our requests. Room was very clean and quiet for facing the street! Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff at Bar!!”
Reviews.Author: Margaret404
Reviews.Content: Jay the bartender and Nancy the waitress were GREAT! Super friendly and entertaining! Thanks Guys!!

Reviews.Title: “Carnegie Hall weekend....”
Reviews.Author: JoanArlington_Texas
Reviews.Content: We were in NYC to see the performance of the Crawley ISD Honor Choir of which my nephew is a member. We chose the Park Central Hotel because of its location to Carnegie Hall and the choir was staying there.... all 110 5th, 6th, and a few 7th grade students along with their chaperones and families. I booked my superior double room. Upon my arrival I was checking in with the Manager, Ricky, who informed us that they did not have a room with two doubles so they would like to upgrade us to a suite. That was very nice. He expedited our check in and offered his services if we needed anything during our stay. The Bellman, Carmelo, was fantastic. Such service I have never had before. Professional, Friendly, and anxious to help with whatever we needed. All Bellmen should be like Carmelo. Which brings me to mention Felix.... on our departure he was the equally as good. He arranged a priviate car to the airport for the same rate as a taxi. Very nice service. The service from the manager and two bellmen was above and beyond any hotel I have ever experienced. We did have a few little hiccups but they were handled with speed and expertise to make our stay at the Park Central Hotel a most pleasant one. I would not hesitate returning here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great New York Location near Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Linda M
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times in the last few years, including one trip with my family of eight. The location is great, the price is great, but most of all the service is great. Only one thing came up with this trip and that was that they did not have a double bed room available when we checked in. They gave us a great room with a rollaway bed and also gave us free breakfast and free wifi. The next day they moved us to a room that was amazing. All in all, a great place to stay and I will definitely stay again - soon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Boxford01921
Reviews.Content: We spent a Thursday and a Friday at the Park Central. The location is fantastic to Central Park, Times Square and the theater. We found the rooms to be large by New York standards and they were very comfortable. We were on the ninth floor and did not hear any street noises. I would highly recommend this hotel based on price and value. We did have breakfast at the Carnegie deli across the street. Excellent food, pricey, and huge servings. Worth the trip but share the meal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AC_from_vancouver
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to New York, I chose Park Central Hotel because of its location, and for its relatively lower price when compared to other options in the area. This is not a luxury hotel, but it turned out great. Just a few blocks South of central park, and a few blocks North of times square, there is a subway stop right outside the hotel entrance. Staff were very helpful, Elizabeth was especially kind: I was very early on the day of my arrival and she kindly arranged for an early check in. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So much wrong with this place yet I keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: David O
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Park Central on each of my last 4 visits to New York and I have had a challenging experience every time yet I just keep coming back. In these room stays I have had a variety of miseries to deal with - a room with no working phone or internet throughout my 4 night stay (I had to continually use a UK mobile to call the operator to complain but the expensive irony fell on deaf ears) - if I have been allocated a room served by the small elevator bank there are only two lifts and they usually have one or both lifts out of action with a jaunty apology like "So Sorry folks we seem to have dropped the ball on this one" or similar. Yet having said this I am returning to Manhattan again in June 2012 and guess what - I have booked the Park Central once again - talk about triumph of hope over bitter experience. On the plus side it is excellently located for my needs with the wonderful Wellington diner directly over the road, PJ Carneys a block or two up 7th avenue and the subway station at 56th and 7th. The hotel itself also has a good lively bar where you can nearly always chat to someone fun and the restaurant (for lunch at least) is excellent. I am just keeping all my fingers crossed for elevators, internet and telephony systems.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Vardibaruch
Reviews.Content: I had a wondefol stay at the park central.it's walking distanec to central park. And ciose to time squer. Rooms were really ciean. Great friendly staff and the manager elizabeth.she was wandefol and more then perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: J T J
Reviews.Content: Over the past year I've been apt. hunting in the city, not an easy task, and I can't recall if this was my third or fourth stay at Park Central. One simply cannot beat the location...you can walk to Lincoln Center or the theatre district with great ease. You are but a few steps away from CPS and just across from Carnegie Hall as well as shopping on 5th Ave.or Madison Ave. By NYC standards the standard king room is a very nice size and is quite clean. Maid service on my last trip was outstanding. Mr. Bill Persalla made sure all the goose down was removed from my room and was exceedingly helpful. The Guest Relations Manager Drita has always been exceptionally gracious and without any doubt one of Park Central most valuable assets.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: praianowedding
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location, less than 10 minutes walk from Times Square in one direction and Central Park in the other. It is also located right by a subway station. There is nothing special about this hotel, it does have a nice lobby which can get very busy. The rooms are standard size and bathrooms OK, although don't bother using the bath as you can only have about 5cm of water in it. You can hear a lot through the rooms, the person's phone in the next room sounded like it was in ours. The bed was quite comfy. We had an inside facing room, which did not have a view but did mean there was no traffic noise which was good It can also take a long time to get a lift, especially in the morning or around dinner time. This hotel was reasonably good, but there is nothing special about it and the decor is starting to get a little shabby around the edges.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ligiacsilva
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at Park Central and we chose it, due to the great localization close to Central Park, Times Square and the Broadway shows. All staff were very attentive and friendly, specially Elizabeth. We will return definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Anna H
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel! One of the women working there - Elizabeth - was by far the best hotel employee I have ever encountered. There was a mix up with our reservation and she was extremely helpful in sorting it out. She even chased us outside when we forgot to take our keys. She really helped to make our experience in NY excellent. Merci!

Reviews.Title: “It is an amazing hotel, location, price, friendly staff esp. Ms. Elizabeth.”
Reviews.Author: Fahad S
Reviews.Content: It is amazing excellent hotel. I loved. exellent location, price,services. I like the Staff. Especially: Mrs. Elizabeth. she is amazing outstanding helpful.

Reviews.Title: “No frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: rinsesd
Reviews.Content: Came to the city for some training and was looking for something central and walking distance to my school which is why I chose this place. I booked through Expedia and was looking for a hotel with a gym and discovered that only 4 or 5 star hotels have fitness rooms. I did one of their bids that don't allow you to see what the name is until after you book it. The hotel itself is dated. Rooms were at least clean though. They don't have much of an atmosphere which is fine cause I wasn't there to hang out in the hotel. It really close to Times Square, which is also my least favorite part of NYC, but it was close enough to walk to midtown and Hells kitchen, which explored quite a bit. Would i stay here again? Probably not. Would I recommend it? Maybe, if your looking for a decent place to sleep. I wish they had more dining options or a later room service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulHarte77
Reviews.Content: Staff so friendly. Great location. Will return. It's just beside everything.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central Hotel -- Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: PhillyTraveler147
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Park Central Hotel. Once in December 2011 and just this past weekend. I am pleased to say that both times the service at the hotel and lobby bar have been stellar. Of special note Nancy at Bar Bella is such an attentive server and made sure that our party had everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Greg C
Reviews.Content: My first time to NYC, and I picked this hotel because of the location and reasonable price. When I checked in, I was given my room key, and proceeded to go to my room. When I arrived at my room, the key did not work, and then another couple showed up and had the same room. So, I went to the front desk, and was greeted by a manager named Drita. She was very sorry, and upgraded my room and gave me a certificate for a free breakfast. She was very kind and helpful. The room was very clean and the bed was more comfortable than my bed at home!! All in all a great trip, and thnaks to Drita who mad a bad situation great!!! I will go back

Reviews.Title: “Maudlyn helped make my stay here exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: Maudlyn went over and above to help me during my stay in rm 1042 last Thursday night. When I saw her in the hallway, she cleaned my room while I had breakfast...then she arranged for an extra 90 minutes stay in the room. What a sweet warm lady. Pleasant surprises and a caring touch make all the difference during a trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a New York Base”
Reviews.Author: joanne r
Reviews.Content: I've recently arrived home from a 4 night stay at the park central New York . Myself & my partner found this hotel to be great for everything you would need . The hotel was clean .... The room could do with updating but your in New York unless you want to sit in your room all day, Which why would you when there is so many great things to be doing it was great the bed was a UK queen size which we loved. Location wise is was perfect come out of the hotel and turn right and your looking at times square turn left and your facing central park , 5th avenue is a few minute walk away . I'd read lots of bad reviews on here before visiting the Park central which had made me really nervous about staying at this hotel , I feel some of these reviews give the wrong impression of the park central, its a fine hotel for all you would need whilst visiting New york with a great location .

Reviews.Title: “CONVENIENT LOCATION, GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: carl d
Reviews.Content: Park Central is conveniently located in the heart of midtown with a very helpful staff. Carolyn at the front desk is always helpful and one step ahead of the game. She even called me back to make sure that i had a resolution to a question that i had. Check in was pleasant and very quick. I especially loved the coffee and pastry service in the lobby every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Service Service Service!”
Reviews.Author: ADuhm53
Reviews.Content: I'm from Pennsylvania and I had a room here in NYC for valentines day for me and my fiancé. First thing I noticed was that my room was a little too small for my liking so I spoke to the front desk about possibly upgrading. I can't say enough about the front desk attendant. Her name was Shpresa I remember. She even helped us find a great italian restaurant in the area that I could wine and dine my fiancé. The food was great and affordable. Oh! And can I just say the view from the room was amazing (overlooking times square) !!! Park Central might just have earned a new regular. Cheers P.S. The bed, super comfy

Reviews.Title: “Arlene Toro " Great Time in NYC "”
Reviews.Author: Arlene G
Reviews.Content: Our first time in a New York City Hotel, I must say our overnight stay was AWESOME!!!!! Very friendly staff( Thank You!!! SOKHA). Great room , the bed was very comfortable. We loved it so much that we are planning a weekend stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: snickerjam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location but its cheap for a reason. The rooms are worn out. Bathroom was clean but needs some fixing up. The carpet shabby not well vacuumed. Lots of dust build up in corners and behind the bed. I was left a big dead bug in the draw by the bed.

Reviews.Title: “my stay at new york”
Reviews.Author: teenaPlummer
Reviews.Content: i visited new york for the first time last week for four nights .Was very excited as it was my daughter thirteenth birthday ..... Hotel is in a great location,central park at one end.And times square at the other. As for the hotel its self would not rate a 4 star plus . Found our room to be very dirty and bathroom not very clean !!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: MEGASKINS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Central Hotel 2/12 where we met Carmelo. Carmelo gave us directions, and called ahead for dinning. We ate at the Sarafina restaurant at his recommandation. Excellent. Camelo made our vacation smooth and easy, even though we were rushed to get here and get there. My hubby and I had a great time and Carmelo made it worry free. Great Staff

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: vickyse16
Reviews.Content: The Park Central good points: 1. good transport links (easy ride on E line from JFK airport) 2. location (just a few blocks from Times Square and Central Park and ridiculously close to MOMA) 3. surrounded by cheap and cheerful eateries (Lindy's, Carnegie deli etc.) 4. reasonably clean and comfortable thing to be aware of: 1. it's a typical conference hotel, slightly shabby and in need of a refurb/refit - particularly noticeable when waiting for the bizarre lifts or on the floors where the actual rooms are. 2. No free WIFI 3. generally a little soulless 4. sheets in beds not tucked in properly which gives a sloppy impression.

Reviews.Title: “Good, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: elirnerak
Reviews.Content: I got a good rate for this hotel for a recent overnight stay. Our prepaid rate was for a single bed (king) room, but my daughter and I would have preferred a room with two beds. At check-in, they graciously switched us to a room with two queen-sized beds for no extra charge. Although we had two computers with us, we were able to log in on both for a single internet charge. The room was small, but clean and comfortable (no fridge) with a clean, updated bathroom. Very few electrical outlets, so bring a power strip. They have an odd elevator system in which you must punch a very 2002-style touch screen on the lobby floor with the number of your destination floor. You enter the elevator and it takes you straight to your destination. This seems to create a backlog of people wanting to go to different floors. Also, the touch screen was apparently broken part of the time, necessitating an over-ride by the elevator-guard. An odd system! We left our car with the parking valet. Upon retrieval I discovered that he had changed every setting for my seat and had also changed the (not electric) headrest in my car. Kind of annoying to drive off, negotiating midtown New York traffic, while trying to restore my seat and headrest to its normal state. I want my tip back. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nikki m
Reviews.Content: Our first time at the Park Central and we were pleasantly surprised.It is clean, fresh, modern and great location.All the staff were very polite and friendly especially Ellen on the checking in desk.The bar prices were a little high.Very good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Christine S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Central for a business trip. The building is older but has been updated over the years. Rooms are small, wi-fi was a bit expensive at $14+ a night - especailly since you can get free wi-fi at a cafe right next door, had a problem with our door key not always unlocking the door, and it was really warm in the room - there was only a heater, no fan or AC to cool it down (luckily we figured out that you could crack a window open at night) but the staff was very helpful, housekeepers were really nice, rooms were clean, and hotel was relatively quiet. Had a hard time figuring out the stairs - we were on the 5th floor and the elevators took forever as they were on a log in system, and when we tried the stairs, it took us to a service area rather than the lobby. Wish they would have been marked better - we were not the only ones who were getting lost on them! Hotel is within walking distance of so many attactions - if you are willing to put on the miles, it you can save alot on taxi $$. Great pizza places, delis, and bakeries next to hotel, very safe part of town. We had an afternoon flight out, and when we talked to Elizabeth at the front desk, she was kind enough to let us stay an extra hour past checkout so we wouldn't have to pay the baggage fee to keep our bags in the lobby while we got breakfast and walked around Central Park. Overall, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Drita, the sweetest one! Best hotel ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Emmaayad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel two years ago, and everything was perfect! But this time, we actually those another hotel, just to try something else! That way a big mistake! We cheeked out the very next day, and came here to park central, praying they would have a room for us, for a price we could afford.! We talked to the Maneger Drita, who cheeked us in, and then she upgraded us to a better room on the 25. floor, also threw in some breakfast, an just had this smile on her face, so helpful and sweet! We did not expect the upgrading, or the breakfast... So thanks for that.! The rooms are lovely, the breakfast is great, and the rest off the coworkers are so sweet to! When we cheeked out, Ellen at the front desk just made our stay so much better, with the smile and the energi she had.!! I will come back here again and again, I've learned that chance can be bad too ;-))

Reviews.Title: “My hotel of choice!”
Reviews.Author: Tony F
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC 3 or 4 times a month and this is always by hotel of choice. Nice rooms. Great location. Good Price. Staff is awesome, Carolyn at the front desk is one of my favorite people in the world!!! Make this your next hotel choice in NYC, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value form money”
Reviews.Author: F J
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Park Central for a week. First timer in nyc ! Because of the low season, the price we payed was quite low (little more than 100 bucks a night) and we were even upgraded to a better room on the concierge floor. This is why it was good value, as the price payed was lower for a better room. The room was/had : a nice view on nyc, quite (cause at the end of the hall, and on 55th), clean but not that young, the bathtub was small but shower worked perfectly. The only bad point came from the A/c first it is automatic and you cannot choose the temperature, second it had some trouble staying at an average temperature and was sometimes too hot or too cold (sweaty one night and cold another). Location is the best ! it is close to everything and at the same time not in the middle of agitation. The metro stop at the entrance of the hotel is a real plus. I have red lots of bad review about the staff, for me, only the concierge wasn't friendly at all, it's a shame because the maids and the people at the front desk where all friendly and helpfull. Finally i would say it is not a great 4 stars hotel but still a good hotel. It has no major bad points (only the a/c) and the location is very good. We had a great stay and for the price we paid i suppose it would be difficult to do better in midtown. I can't say if it would be true without the upgrade. We didn't use the gym neither the hotel bar or restaurant, so can't say anything about that. Just know that you ll have to pay 3.75 dollars/bag if you want to store them after checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Nancy at downstairs bar”
Reviews.Author: Keith H
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most unbelievable experiences I have ever had at a hotel bar. Nancy was attentive and almost read my mind for all the things I needed during my time here. She offered amazing services and had a great sense of humor that made the entire experience enjoyable for me as well as all my friends. In all honesty, Nancy is certainly one of the main reasons why I would return to this hotel. Thanks so much Nancy. I really appreciate all your attention during our stay. Keith

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and service”
Reviews.Author: Asdfgh12345678
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay. We were upgraded to asuite at no cost. Drita, at the front desk, was truly great. Location and price and service cannot be beat. We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jamiek206
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times and they are very accomidating! Great location! They have amazing rates, and if you are looking for a room with a lot of space in NYC then this should def be your pic! just a few blocks from time square and central park! Everytime i come to nyc i stay with them! the rooms are big and renovated! I will definatly stay again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Money!”
Reviews.Author: Ravnene2770
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location,,,,,,,,,, Park Central has a perfect location. Close to 5th Ave-Central Park and Time Squarre! Fantastic Breakfast-Buffet at Cityhouse Restaurant in Park Central,its the perfect way to start the day in wonderfull NYC! One minus is that the Wifi is to expencive---15 $ a day is to much when you can log on Starbucks Wifi around the corner for free. Regards to Ellen in Reception, she`s a doll! We look forward to be back! Kind Regards Ravn from Copenhagen, Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: George I
Reviews.Content: a fantastic hotel, convenient, great staff, particularly Drita! This has fast become the first choise for both business and pleasure in the city. Having stayed here four times in the last two months I will be back and back and back.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok, expected better from rooms”
Reviews.Author: bostonbruinsfan99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our last night in NYC. We got a good deal on expedia for this hotel, 114$ with a continental breakfast included. It's located in a good area, 2 blocks from central park and carnagie hall is almost in front of the hotel. It's about 10 min walk from Times Square, and took us about 12 minutes to come back from the phantom of the opera (Majestic theater) so very convenient. There is also a convenience store (Duane Read) two blocks from there and if you want to take the bus tours, they can drop you near the hotel, you will see people selling tickets for grayline tours and city sights. (They are both the same price, and go to the same places but the people working for grayline are much nicer and explain more what you get, I don't remember the exact price, but it's around 53-54$/per person) The lobby is quite large and very modern, lots of couches to sit, and a small bakery if you need to grab a muffin and coffee, it's a bit pricey but it's expected since it's inside the hotel. No problems to check-in, the man in the front desk was very quick and friendly. When I arrived at our room, I was a bit disappointed, it's ok but we expected a bit better. It's a very basic room, it's clean but it's nothing great, looks a bit old and the hallway really needs renovations. There's a bed, TV, iPod dock, safe & basic amenities in the bathroom (soap & shampoo). Don't expect little extras & frills. I was surprised there was no coffee machine, since I really like to have a coffee before I leave, I found that odd but I guess it's just a detail. What I found sad, is when I checked out, the girl in the front desk told me, there was no complementary breakfast included, we booked this place because we thought it was a good deal with the breakfast. Since we booked with expedia, the girl told me there was nothing she could do. I didn't make a big deal, but I was a bit sad, if I had known breakfast was not included, I would have booked one more night at the hotel we stayed before and at least I would have had a good night sleep before the long drive back home. Also, they charge a 50$ deposit on your c/c for any damages (standard for most hotels in NYC) but it takes about one week to be refunded, longer time period compared to other places. Personally I would not go back, I had better better experiences in other hotels in NYC for almost the same rates. Good: -Nice presentation, large lobby and very quick check-in ( I did not have any problems) -Lots of towels in the bathroom -room is clean Bad: -No continental breakfast included, yet it was suppose to be included. I blame this on expedia for false advertising but also the girl in the front desk, she did nothing about it, did not speak to her manager, at least they could have given us a complementary coffee -the walls are quite thin, I stayed on the 17th floor, and could hear lots of noise from the hallway. Unfortunately, there was a couple fighting on the same floor, yelling almost all night so doesn't help when the walls are thin. -$ to use the internet -expensive to park near, 50$ a night, that's 20$ more than the other parking and not worth it.. (I'm not sure if that's with a discount or not if you stay at the hotel, I called the hotel to ask before we move the car from the previous parking -bed is not very comfortable, a bit hard, although my husband found it ok. I did not get a good night rest, with all the noise, yelling outside and uncomfortable bed, I barely slept. -finally I have to include that there is no coffee maker & coffee..that's bizarre in my opinion, at least offer complementary coffee in the lobby...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: julie l
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to write a note and say how well I was treated my several staff memebers at the Park Central Hotel. Elizabeth Angela and Fred were amazing at the front desk. Fahy was fabulous and helpful and I am trying to think of the name of another great staff member who was at the front of the line. Placido Domingo in house keeping was also great. I extended my stay twice as I was so happy.The location is amazing. The rate was great I will be back in April. The only glitch is the strange operation of the elevator but it was worth it for the other perks:) Thank you! Julie L

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Marco Z
Reviews.Content: This is my first time here and looks pretty good, its being a very pleasent experience. The hotel is very well localized and the rooms are confortable and well equiped. I talked to Elizabeth and she was amazing, giving me very good informations and advices.

Reviews.Title: “Drita Front Desk Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Helen D
Reviews.Content: She was amazing, we have been to Park Central a year prior, she upgraded our room something we did not at all expect.... It was so nice and Drita was to kind , we just wanted to express our thanks and appreciation for her taking an intrest in us as customers, we will definately be back next year...

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: agirges
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth time I have stayed at the Park Central hotel and its always a very pleasant experience for me. The staff was great in helping me and going out of their way to be of assistance to me. The rates were incredible for a five night stay and when I come back to NY, I'll be checking into Park Central!

Reviews.Title: “Really good.”
Reviews.Author: ro_trindade
Reviews.Content: I just loved staying at Park Central Hotel. Just 2 blocks from the Central Park and 8 from Times Square, it's a very good place at a reasonable price. When you get there, talk with Nilsa, she's a very nice women that works at the front desk. The con is that they don't have free internet acces in the Lobby, you have to use Starbucks' wifi for that.

Reviews.Title: “DRITA Front Desk and Customer service”
Reviews.Author: Bill B
Reviews.Content: As a regular gust at the Park Central Hotel in New York I want to say Drita , like many other of her co-workers go out of their way to assist and accomodate you. Drita at both late night and early hour has always been there to assist, offer options that are available to satisfactorily resolve any concerns or issues. The hotel itself has a great location with reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Carmelo "The Bellman"”
Reviews.Author: Daniela M
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience staying at the hotel, but i have to admit that the best part was to find someone who cares a lot about you as a guestt, that was Carmelo "The bellman" Did, i want to congrats him in public, because in big city like New York you'll not find people like him. Thank you very much to did our experience in the hotel best and funn!

Reviews.Title: “Excellency at a more than fair price”
Reviews.Author: ogccunha
Reviews.Content: The hotel acomodations are very good and the personal attentive and responsive. Price was very reasonable for the qualkity. I reccomend without reservations

Reviews.Title: “J.P. Garcia's Park Central NY review from Feb 10th to Feb 16th 2012”
Reviews.Author: JuanPabloGarcia
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Park Central for almost 15 years, it's location is superb. I was treated great at the front desk by Fady and Ellen, whom after checking my record gave a fantastic upgrade to a suite due to my Loyalty without saying a word. The service is phenomenal specially Irma my cleaning lady on floor 22nd. I highly reccomend Park Central in all aspect, a wonderfull hotel at a great price and value.

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Tsulten
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel that is walking distance to many good things to see & do. The restaurant has great customer service. Ask for Winston. He is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Chphair
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Year ago great service then, and when they found out I was staying again they gave me a cool view, and the room is a little bigger. Drita was really nice to me when I checked in. I can't Waite to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Why not try for perfection ?”
Reviews.Author: StevenBBB
Reviews.Content: The Park Central is our home away from home in New York. We come regularly from France to visits NY's rich cultural life, restaurant scene and we're known to do "some" shopping. For us the central location and the price/quality relation of Park Central are deciding factors. True, it's a large place but staff really try and give individual service. On a longer stay (ours was six nights) you can have a room according to your wishes (we always receive a quiet room, at the back). We heard that the hotel is getting completely renovated next year. Let's hope they do not "renovate" the rates. i'm curious to see the result. What can they (definetly) do better? The departure scene is nearly always messy, disorganised, with pushy taximen and the hotel doorman, who should be there to help you but participates in the general mix-up. This is the only hotel in the whole world that i know of where you are charged exorbitantly for holding your luggage. From the morning checkout to our afternoon/evening departure, we paid 30$ plus tips. Yes thirty dollars, for safekeeping of our bags betweem 11am and 3 pm. After having been thus ripped off, we were introduced on the (ice cold) pavement) to a collection of drivers (taxi and hotel limo) all hustling for business plus bellman and doorman joining in this large cacophony. I swore: "never again". How can such a nice hotel where we've been coming for four yeras repeatedely, give you a showoff that is unworthy of it's name and the quality of service it stands for. I gave the hotel management three weeks to answer my email with a request for an explanantion on their departure policy. In the absence of any reaction my adivice is YES stay at Park Central BUT BEWARE and make your own exit arrangements. Need a good ripoff? Give them your bags to hold !!!

Reviews.Title: “great value, great people”
Reviews.Author: Dore P
Reviews.Content: i have stayed at the Park Central for years. the location is perfect and a great value for midtown. today I am writing because of Elizabeth and Drita, their customer service was exceptional and they were both extremely professional and sweet. It is a very busy Hotel and it is a real pleasure to deal with these two managers anytime. I always look forward to staying here. keep up the great work ladies !

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, excellent location and good ammenities”
Reviews.Author: Chichochavez
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel five nights and enjoyed every minute of it. Nancy and Tia from reception were always friendly and willing to accommodate small, yet important requests. I think this hotel is very good value given the price, the quality of the amenities, the location and the excellent service I received. I would stay again there in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Broadway shows”
Reviews.Author: xia
Reviews.Content: This hotel will be our choice for future visits to New York city because of its.location near, but not in the theatre district. The subway stop is steps from the hotel, and It is two stops toTimes Square and the theatres. Carnegie Hall is right across the street, and it is easy walking distance to Lincoln Center, and only two long blocks to MoMA, and Rockefeller Center further down 5th Ave ,.. This is a solidly built hotel in the 30's tradition; rooms are quiet, comfortable, reasonably sized and furnished, and best of all, very reasonably priced. There are many cafes and delis within one block where one can get a good breakfast without paying hotel prices..

Reviews.Title: “Ellen”
Reviews.Author: Glennie W
Reviews.Content: Ellen helped me check in. This hotel is in a great location, very friendly staff and helpful. We needed more towels and the radiator looked at, both requests were satisfied in excellent time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for couples or families”
Reviews.Author: Elyse I
Reviews.Content: As frequent travelers in NYC we've stayed in many hotels.This time we booked on the Park Central website and got a great price! I happen to think this is the best location in the city, whether couples or family. So much to do near by and so many great restaurants! We had stayed here 5 years ago with my kids for my daughters birthday and i dont recall being very impressed. This time, I was very pleasantly surprised. The lobby was renovated with a wonderful art deco appeal. In the morning, there were delicious fresh pastries, fruit and coffee. Considering the many visitors who frequent this location, the elevators were now computerized, quiet, quick and streamlined. The pillows were better than mine at home. We had a large end room with a spectacular view from 3 HUGE, picture windows. Unlike other hotels in NYC, that are double the price and have the feel of a closet. Even the bathroom had two huge (frosted) windows and very luxurious. While my husband was in his business meeting Sunday morning, I went running in central park then went up to the room to shower, relax and read until he was done. After mentioning to the manager, Elizabeth that I had a wonderful stay and "really needed to get away", she gave me a very late check out time so I didn't feel rushed. I was born and raised in New York, and we are very hard to please! I would definitely, without a doubt, highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling from out of town or any suburbians who need a quick rejuvinating get-away.. Only 2 minor complaints: I would have liked free wi-fi and if I was staying longer, or had the family with me, a refridge would be nice.

Reviews.Title: “A great value on a luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: mattsaradan
Reviews.Content: I am a regular commuter from Baltimore to Manhattan. Manager Tony Cunaj and his staff are always warm and welcoming and strive to accomodate every request. The hotel is in a very central location, with reasonably sized rooms and very modern conveniences. Very comfortable at a significant discount from comparable four and five star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte P
Reviews.Content: My first time to new york. Hotel was spot on. Room a good size with very comfy big bed. Fantastic location, only 2 mins from central park, 10 min from time square and 5 mins from 5th avenue! Subway station right next to the hotel too so great for travelling a little further afield. Couldn't have asked for more from a hotel in the middle of new York. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay at the Park Central!”
Reviews.Author: Davey F
Reviews.Content: The Park Central staff made the stay a success! They were so friendly and when my cc was stolen they were able to work with my cc company to ensure that I would not have to pay out of pocket for the stay. Check in was quick and efficient, the bar tender was friendly, the service in cityhouse was fantastic and I had a very clean room with a great housekeeper!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience and hotel in New York City!”
Reviews.Author: shanson123
Reviews.Content: Unhappy with the current hotel I was staying in... I was able to find this diamond through Google. Was looking for a safe, clean hotel in a decent area- and ended up at the Park Central. This is an older hotel which had been refurbished. It has a funky art-decor feel to it. The rooms are clean and safe, AMAZING location (quick walk to Central Park, shows, etc.), and the staff was undoubtedly its best asset. A special thanks to Angela at the front desk for her generous hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Tbe position and price is great for central NY, but it's a bit tired,”
Reviews.Author: Cramers
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 2406 Times square facing room on 24th floor, large room with iron, ironing board and safe but no fridge. Very comfortable bed and pillows, room clean and tidy but just a little tired. No help available for getting around, or info in lobby like you would get in UK. Great position for walking to times square or central park and other attractions. Metro directly across from hotel and tour bus goes from there too. Great omelette can be had for breakfast at park central cafe opposite. But, good tea is going to be hard to find!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: GMandozzi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you're in the city for business or pleasure.Having stayed in a number of hotels in the city, Park Central is now top of the list. It's on the same block as the metro where you can get all over town and a few blocks from the hustle and bustle of Times Square or the tranquility of Central Park. I was here for a whole week and had no problems. The king room i had was spacious, clean and little noise pollution which is hard to come by in NYC! The internet is super fast (and living in hotels, as i mostly do, that is such a bonus!)Staff have been most helpful and courteous. Annette and Tony were brilliant at dealing with my internet needs and Vito on reception was great - he kindly let me check in slightly early as the rooms were ready (if they are not, then there is a storage facility for your luggage) AND pick my favourite from a couple of rooms, no problem! I would definitely stay at this hotel again if the price is right. Do it, i say!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied with stay... great location!”
Reviews.Author: tlhjar
Reviews.Content: Got a free night there because we viewed a time share next door at Manhattan Club. We had to change date at last minute. They were very cooperative. I called bookkeeping when I saw that our deposit for incidentals ($50) had been charged to our account, and they resolved it right away. Great location. Room was fine. When we first entered, the cleaning products smelled rather strong, but this seemed to wear off. Also, we did have to call maintenance about the toilet... didn't shut off, and they fixed this.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: Lewis M
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying here and for what I paid, its worth every penny! I booked a few weeks prior and saved 40%, so i ended up paying a little over $1,000 for 7 nights! I got a king size bed and beautiful view of the cityscape! The woman Nancy at the front desk was very nice and made checking in a breeze!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Phil E
Reviews.Content: There were five of us with two rooms that we booked for the extended weekend. The hotel rooms were nice and clean and roomy for Manhatten. The staff was friendly and everytime I requested an item or had a question they were prompted to act on it. The hotel is situated in a prime location to visit Times Square and Broadway. I will definitly stay at the Park central again. They made our visit very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: Aroundtheworld999
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Central this past weekend for my bachelorette and Tony who worked at the hotel gave me an upgrade to their 1 bedroom suite. The room was very nice and spacious. It came with 2 double beds. i had a great time and would definitely stayed there again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location for carnegie hall concerts”
Reviews.Author: Donna C
Reviews.Content: we needed a venue near carnegie hall as our daughter was music teacher for 8th grade children participating in a professional concert on Super Bowl Sunday. we checked the website and found a perfect package which included parking. a great value for nyc. Super location for us. across the street from the hall. we were even able to get in our room 3 hours early! staff was extremely helpful - from dave upon check-in, to the restaurant staff who directed us to a sports bar to watch the pgh penguins, to andre yao who helped us commandeer an elevator with all our gear upon checkout. would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “It was great!”
Reviews.Author: Jantine83
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great! Clean rooms, in the middle ofmanhattan. You can walk to all the highlights. The people in the hotel are really nice, special thanks to elizabeth Cacovic. She makes our stay completed

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Daantjeblij
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great, large rooms, clean and quick service. Special thanks for the guest manager elizabeth cacovic, who has made our stay wonderfull. The best is the location, in the middle of where it all happens. Perfect stay! And a real reccomandable hotel

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: kmp89
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at the Park Central in New York City. I could not recommend it enough. Each time I have stayed I have not been disappointed. The level of service is wonderful, from reservations, room service, front desk and house keeping. Great room rates and very spacious rooms, unlike most NYC hotel rooms. Perfect location! Throughout my stay Elizabeth Cacovic was a pleasure to deal with. I had a small issue where I could not receive any cell reception in my room and she quickly sorted this problem a moved me to another room with no problem. They don't have a swimming pool but the fitness centre is very high tech! I will be back again Park Central! Keep up the excellent work!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, top notch front desk service”
Reviews.Author: HitTheRoadTooMuch
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel on a number of busines trips to NY. Great location near Central Park and Times Square. Carolyn at the front desk provides excellent customer service, greeting me my name - how often does that happen these days?

Reviews.Title: “More for less!”
Reviews.Author: Kermitkt
Reviews.Content: I have been a guest at Park Central for the past 7 weeks on business. Initially my room was very small, with a beautiful view of a brick wall. That is my only complaint, the front desk attendant agreed quickly due to the length of my stay that room was unsuitable. Yes, there has been a glitch or two, multiple check out-check ins, but Drita the guest services manager ironed them out without a blink of an eye. If every hotel had a Drita, no-one would ever have complaints! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great value, location, and quality of service!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Ellen”
Reviews.Author: Frank E
Reviews.Content: I had a mixup in registration form Priceline.com, Ellen at the front desk went through hoops to correct the problem. If your there and have a problem ask for Ellen, she is the best....

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: summer G
Reviews.Content: It is a good hotel worth to live. You have easy access to Time Square and 5th Avenue. The check in service is amiable and fast. Thanks for Wito's consideration and great service. Guan

Reviews.Title: “EspectacuLar”
Reviews.Author: pabloanton
Reviews.Content: Great location. Good service excellent attention Ask for elizabeth at. The front desk We. Love it

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: whip1976
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel in a great location & for a very reasonable price. You can easily walk to Times Square, Central Park & many other attractions. David on reception kindly let us check in early & noted my request for a room on a high floor with a view. Room is a good size with plenty of room for clothes & bathroom is a good size. The bed was huge, but too soft for me (my only slightly negative comment). Overall a great stay & would recommend for anyone to stay here.
