TIP get a car from the hotel to the airport, cheaper than a taxi & a limo came for us :).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel grate price excellent locatopn”
Reviews.Author: avkapla
Reviews.Content: stay for 5 nights, came early like 8 Am got a good room (if you come afternoon you will get a better room floor 12 and up) so i could get ready for my meetings. got a package with breakfast that was excellent with good selection and excellent service got late checkout, what more can you ask from an hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mariepeacher
Reviews.Content: 30/01/12 - 3/02/12. 4 nts at this GREAT Hotel. Greeted by David at the front desk (5 Stars). Wonderful reception, and So So Helpful. Brilliant View from our Hotel Room of Times Square. Everything you could possibly need from this Magnificent City just waiting to be sampled. Would go back to this Hotel again without hesitation. The sooner the better for us. A very special, memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Shmifyy
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a great location. Customer service is superb, the bag drop very handy. Ellen at the front desk rocks! Well situated for Central Park, Times Square, Broadway, etc. walk through the park, or down to Empire State. 24 hours wasn't enough

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: Samuel S
Reviews.Content: I was very well served by Ellen in the reception and by Winston at the breakfest.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: AlbertoNewYork
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed lots stay at Park Central Hotel. In few minutes we can walking to Central Park, 5a. Av, Time Square Theaters and others nice places. The assistance at front desk was great. Ellen helped us to solve important problem smiling all the time. We´d like to thank you all at Park Central Hotel in New York for this nice trip. Muito Obrigado Sandra and Luiz

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: May60763
Reviews.Content: My stay was excellent, Ellen was very helpful, she gave me good advice. I definitely want to come back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the best city of the world”
Reviews.Author: Luiz Alberto L
Reviews.Content: great location and excellent service. the staff are extremely attentive. jet is the best with his new yorker how to receive visitors. a large hotel in the most beloved city in the world

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience at the Park Central Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: ShimaVazir
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Park Central Hotel in the early hours of the morning on the red eye from Los Angeles. The Park Central Hotel in New York has always been one of our favourite selected few hotels for several reasons - location, room service, cleanliness and most importantly the price. However, this time our experience had a wonderful flavor to it ... Elizabeth Cacovic, the guest relationship manager welcomed us with a beautiful smile and accommodated our request for early check-in & provided us with useful information that made our stay at Park Central delightful. What impressed me the most was her friendly disposition and wonderful demeanor of taking charge of the situation and accommodating us over and beyond her call of duty - now that is service that is very rarely found in Manhattan where people have many demands on their time and just do not have the personal touch to make a difference personally or professionally. I would like to commend Elizabeth Cacovic for a job well done and providing exceptional customer service !! We would highly recommend this hotel to travellers visiting New Your for business or pleasure, and have the opportunity to meet with Ms. Cacovic and enjoy the exceptional service at Park Central Hotel. Best wishes, Ms. Vazir

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: red1962
Reviews.Content: Park Central is working hard to improve on their guest relations. Park Central management should be thanking Ricky for his hard work and dedication to ensuring each and every guest is treated with the kid glove care they deserve. I would also like to recognize Angela who checked us in with great efficiency. We stayed 3 nights in a king suite. The room was spacious, the linens, pillows and bed were exceptionally comfortable and the bathroom was large and spotlessly clean. We really liked the elevators in this hotel. You type in your floor # at the lobby level and the system lets you know which elevator is available for your trip. We found this system to be very efficient. The breakfast was very good with a great variety of hot and cold items and the staff was very accommodating. The hotel is located a short walk to Central Park, a few blocks from Times Square and right next door to the Carnagie Deli. Around the corner is the David Letterman Theatre and just up the street is the best soup in New York City @ The Soup Man as featured on Seinfeld. We had a slight discrepancy with our bill upon check-out and it was resolved immediately. Everyone should always review their bill for accuracy upon check-out so we didn't see this as a negative. Please don't hesitate to book this hotel. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Reviews.Title: “Good assistence”
Reviews.Author: Guta M
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank the wonderful care that has always given us and the hotel. We stayed here for 2 years, 3 times a year, and we are always well attended. Today, Elizabeth, was super helpful, helping us in our check in and solving all our questions. So I can thank this hotel and recommend to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Bret Z
Reviews.Content: I Stay in this Hotel twice a week on average, I have also used there convention center. this hotel and its staff have won myself, coworkers and my company over. Drita and Ellen at the front desk always there to greet and help me with a smile! Matt and Chih up in the convention center have been very accommodating to my company and helpful. Love That!! plus you cant get this quality in a hotel at twice the price in NYC

Reviews.Title: “How wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: AllisonwI
Reviews.Content: A home away from home! The staff was so friendly and considerate. Angela, David, Saleen, and Elizabeth you are so amazing! I've been coming to New York for over 50 years and this has been my go to hotel for over 30! If there was a higher rating to give I would! Perfect location too!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Tom M
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Park Central each january. Prices on line are very good, the hotel is at a great location across from Carnegie hall and a short stroll from Times Square. The subway is right beside the hotel and if travelling from JFK take the E train and with one change you will be at the hotel for €7.50! The rooms are good size for new york with better rooms on the higher floors. Get the all in breakfast deal. It's a great breakfast and make your own waffles! The restaurant has been revamped and we had a great dinner on one of the nights in NY. There are lots of restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable:)”
Reviews.Author: Jessycap
Reviews.Content: I was there for 3 days and i've been well surprised that i finally decided to extend my stay.Everything is great:the location,the food,it's clean and the service is excellent:p all the crew is gentle and helpful.thanks to Ricardo who helped me when i asked him questions.he even gave me advices where to go to have the best and memorable stay!he's just amazing!muchisimas gracias:)

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is awesome!!! The people are even better!!!”
Reviews.Author: soontobejamieg
Reviews.Content: We've been to New York before and this is the best service we've ever had! Ellen was so kind and she thought of anything we might need before we could even ask for it. This hotel is so clean and the staff are so nice and personable. This is also the best location you could ever imagine! We look one way and we see Times Square the other way we see Central Park. GO HERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Drita's Help”
Reviews.Author: Ramona60745
Reviews.Content: After one night of staying at this hotel, we realized that we wanted a room with a view towards the street...and we also wanted to be on the same floor with our friends. We are not the easiest going guests. We went to guest relations and Drita was able to graciously help us. She did not only switched our rooms, but she also made sure that our friends had a room on the same floor with us. Excellent customer service!! Thank you very much, Drita.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, friendly, good winter rates, very central”
Reviews.Author: Thorsten S
Reviews.Content: I had made my hotel decision based on the good recommendations on this site, which turned out to be right. I got a 40 % discount via the tripadvisor website on the hotel's own booking page. That way my average room rate for a superior king room for 8 nights was around 100 Euro (~ $130). If you looked, you might find small spots in the room where it wasn't perfect - small paint patches or so, but it was clean, rather big and all in all nice. It's 10 minutes walk to Times Square, which can be seen directly from the hotel entry; Carnegie Hall is right around the corner. 2 Blocks to Central Park were great! And not far to Lincoln Center (Met Opera...). I would book it again! Just the internet access should be free.

Reviews.Title: “Franklin P "Nice room and courteous staff"”
Reviews.Author: Franklin P
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife so we have a date night. The hotel is located within walking distance to the entire theatre district and most shops. when I checked in it was done efficiently and quickly. One employee Bill Persaud helped out tremendously and went above and beyond his duties and helped me out. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect”
Reviews.Author: Dan A
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at Park central hotel and every thing was perfect. It is much more then the location (so close to central park and to time sq.) my room was large and clean the breakfast was so good. the stuff specially Elizabeth Cacovic were so kind and helpful  in fact it was all perfect. I'll defiantly return to the Park Central hotel

Reviews.Title: “Ricardo-Great Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: L Michele M
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Park Central & I was equally happy with both visits. This time, however, there was an unfortunate incident with the parking garage when it was time to get my car (it took almost an hour for the valet to bring it!). The issue was with the garage itself, not the hotel, yet the hotel staff was fantastic. Ricky in particular was extremely helpful in resolving the situation. He had already greeted me & assisted with checking us out & validating our parking. When I questioned him about my car, he called down to the garage right away. When I further explained how long I had been waiting he actually ran outside to the garage itself to personally straighten things out. He came back, told me what had happened, apologized & made sure my car was then next one out. I found all the staff to be professional, friendly & helpful, but Ricky was particularly so & I really appreciate his excellent service. I still love the Park Central & will definitely be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cooltreats
Reviews.Content: Across the street from Carniege Hall on 7th Avenue. Two blocks from Central Park and 10 blocks from Times Square. Couldn't be more perfect for location for this part of Manhattan. We booked a king and 'upgraded' to two doubles but the room was well used. On further inspection there was mold in the bathroom, burn marks on the dust ruffle, gum stuck in the carpet but we were excited to be in the city and so close to everything. The maids parked their carts (3) right outside our door the entire 3 night stay which I thought was odd. You pay for everything - luggage storage, internet, etc. and even boarding passes - so we waited until we got to the airport. Front desk staff was friendly as was everyone except maybe one who answered the telephone about the business office. Good restaurants all around and the thearters are all right at your doorstep. Yes, would stay here again for location but will be more picky on the interior of room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shabby hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoCityDweller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a recent trip to NYC for business. When I checked in, I was greeted warmly but felt a bit disappointed from that point forward. When I told the front desk clerk that I was hungry and asked if the restaurant was open, he/she said the restaurant was closing within 10 minutes but I could try to order before then. I would have preferred a list of options for delivery in the area as an alternative to a closing restaurant. Instead I had to use the Yelp app on my phone. The room itself was average size and the bathroom was very roomy (a huge plus for a girl!). The counter space by the sink was great for spreading out my make-up, etc.. The water pressure in shower is also great (a big plus!) but I was a little put off that every time I sat on the toilet the whole toilet seemed to detach from the wall. Clearly the room has not been maintained well. Add to that that an outlet cover was missing from the wall in the bathroom and I was getting the impression that my low room rate was due to poor quality, not low season. The thing I hate the most about this hotel was the elevator system. There is a large podium monitor system in front of the elevators. You have to press the floor you're heading to before you get on the elevator or the elevator won't take you to your floor. For instance, if someone presses Floor 4 and you get on the elevator with them hoping to get to your 5th Floor room, you're out of luck. The elevator won't take you any further than the 4th Floor so you'll have to go all the way back down to the lobby level and call an elevator for Floor 5. Once I did make it to my floor, the carpeting near the elevator was stained and shabby looking. It was a bad first impression upon arriving to the hotel. I had dinner in the restaurant one night. In fact, I spent several hours doing work on my laptop while dining. I was so frustrated at how slow the service was considering that I was one of maybe 4 other people in the entire place. I had to flag down a waiter just to get a second glass of wine. Totally unacceptable. As for the food, I had the lobster bisque which was just 'ok' and a warm chocolate cake dessert which was rich and yummy. I used their valet service for a car I rented the last day in town. The front desk made me late for a meeting in Brooklyn by giving me a hard time about my room bill upon check out and therefore delayed me getting my car. I was SO aggravated. The location of the hotel is great; there's no doubt you're in for a treat with all that's within walking distance. But the hotel is shabby and not well maintained. Spend your money at a nicer hotel elsewhere in NYC and enjoy a better experience. Also, it's a little suspicious that 4 recent reviews are by reviewers who have only reviewed one hotel (this one) and have nothing but wonderful things to say about the hotel and mention employees by name. I would be leery about trusting these reviews; they seem fake and planted by people who might be associated with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: dewisun
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Central Hotel for a night of city fun with my girlfriends! We were extremly excited with the comfortable beds, great tv and spacious bathroom (4 girls getting ready). The location was perfect since we were catching two broadway shows and lunch at Tao. The best part of our stay was at check in, Carolyn, went out of her way to make sure we had a great room and even helped us with directions and recommentations for fun things to do while visiting! All in all the hotel is a great find in the city; close to broadway, central park and the subway!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth O
Reviews.Content: My stay at this property is always outstanding and the staff is a 6 star! Angela has been SO helpful and should have a pay increase! Elizabeth O'Malley

Reviews.Title: “E xcellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Lety P
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay and spacios rooms close to everything .. Timesquare is close shopping areas are close. Rooms are nice and clean. And the whole staff is vrey friendly and attentive. Speacially nancy, elizabeth and angie that helped us through our stay. We Will defenitely come back next year for the holidays

Reviews.Title: “Average, really average”
Reviews.Author: Robwg
Reviews.Content: This is a massive hotel without the luxury which is a shame. We booked here over marathon weekend and I would not recommend, hotel, rooms and service were all a bit shabby. Upsides are good location.

Reviews.Title: “VP Marketing”
Reviews.Author: Yaron H
Reviews.Content: Hello every one, I have been several times at the Park Central and it become my second home in my NYC visits. He is very well located and the service is exellent but one of my main reason is Elizabeth Cacovic the Guest Relations Manager that allways smile, remember and helping me fill that I choose the right choise. It would'nt my last time and I'll be back for sure

Reviews.Title: “PARK CENTRAL Broadway's best stay”
Reviews.Author: s i
Reviews.Content: OKay! I rate ths hotel as one of broadway's hippest neat and people places to stay . This hotel is warm friendly comfortable . you feel at home here, you never want to leave. The frot desk is sooo nice . Sooo sweet incredibly accomodating I just love Ricky, His name is Ricardo but his guest will soon find him to be a friend! the front desk assistant manager. He will make sure that you have everything you need. And , Oh the "bellman" Carmelo will put all your things in place nope don't you ever carry a heavy luggage!

Reviews.Title: “Will make an effort to stay here again !”
Reviews.Author: Butchsmith
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The front desk associate, Ellen, was very pleasant and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Broadway Show Adventure”
Reviews.Author: marshall a
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience staying at the Park Central. Had a reservation change to make upon arrival. Elizabeth Cacovic the Guest Relations Manager went out of her way to relsolve our issue. Would not stay anywhere else in New York City. Hotel is clean, centrallly located and convient to shopping and Entertainment

Reviews.Title: “Reliable, comforatable”
Reviews.Author: jonesieinhavana
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel many times. I've always found the rooms to be clean and comfortable. The locations is perfect for restaurants and conducting business. Subway convenient, and quiet. Moderately priced for a Mid-Town hotel. I will continue to stay in this hotel. And would recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marlyse L
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and the service was great, the rooms clean and comfortable. The hotel restaurant and bar are nice and close enough to walk to Central Park and right across from Carnegie Hall. I especially loved the service by my favorite bellman Carmelo, who was not only attentive and helpful, but extremely knowledgeable and personable. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel1956
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on Seventh Avenue between Times Square and Central Park which makes it a great location for staying in NY. It is clean and in great condition. The rooms are a good size and furnishing are good. The staff are friendly and helpful. There is a restaurant and in the morning a really good value snack bar provides really good value coffee and muffins etc. Nearby the is a great range of deli type cafes that provide fantastic food at reasonable prices. Have stayed here before and was not disappointed in recent stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a great price in NYC”
Reviews.Author: mbb1109
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Park Central a few times before and this time it was for a few days over the Thanksgiving holiday. Is it the fanciest place in the world, no. Does it have the best prices and location in NYC, YES. Anyone looking to NOT pay over $300 - $400 per night, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location or the price!”
Reviews.Author: UpstateNYLawchick
Reviews.Content: It had been a long time since I had stayed here, but knowing I had to go to NYC on business, I took them up on an email offer I received last year. I forgot just how convenient this hotel is. First, bonus points for giving me a room when I arrived before 11am. I know this is extremely rare, but made my day nonetheless. The rooms had been rehabbed since the last time I visited, and were nice and clean. Great size for Manhattan. Water pressure was a bit slim for the 11th floor, but I was also competing with a bunch of families in the adjoining rooms. And there was my only one true complaint. Being able to hear young kids whooping it up at midnight when I was trying to get some sleep before my morning meetings was a bit rough. I never complained about it though, which was probably my fault. Still, I'd stay here again in a heartbeat at the rate I got this trip.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Hyde Park, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Good deals for location”
Reviews.Author: Andrea287
Reviews.Content: Every time I go to NYC (which is quite often), either by myself or with friends, I try staying at this hotel mainly because of it's amazing location, rooms are clean and of a good size. Although I've heard some people have trouble when checking in due to amount of people, I've never had any problems...every time I check in it takes less than 5 minutes. I would totally recommend staying at this hotel if you manage to get a good deal at Expedia. Finally, I have to say that Im really pleased with the front the service, specially the night manager and Ricky and Elizabeth, they really know what hospitality is about.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location”
Reviews.Author: Larkins4
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and had a wonderful holiday. We were a little apprehensive having read some of the older reviews - however we found the room very comfortable and apart from a few cosmetic issues in the room it was fab. The breakfast was brilliant and we left the breakfast room feeling more than satisfied with the wonderful food and friendly staff. My kids were always felt welcome - a major plus for parents. As for the location - well what can I say it was ideal. When we return to this wonderful city we would definitely stay at this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Katie B
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner's first time to New York, came for New Years and cannot fault the hotel. Bed was extremely comfortable - good nights sleep every night! Stayed on the 10th floor with a street facing window but despite this were not kept awake by traffic noise at all!! Maid service also good and to high standards every day! Location is also perfect as walking distance to many places and the subway is right outside the doors which has 3 lines that will get you to most tourist locations in the city. Safe to say on our next trip to NYC we will definitely be staying here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our place in New York City”
Reviews.Author: Jon K
Reviews.Content: We love the Park Central. It is unbelievably well located, right near Central Park, Carnegie Hall, Times Square, City Center, 57th St and Fifth Avenue. There is a huge number of Europeans in the hotel and that gives it a wonderfully cosmopolitan feel. On the elevators, we talked to people from India, Ireland, Spain, Italy, Germany and France. And that was two days. The rooms are comfortable, although few have good views. Some face on the inside and you look out at brick walls. Corner rooms have spotty cell service sometimes. The restaurant is okay, but many better places just outside. The bar is expensive. These are nits. The staff is friendly, responsive, and we love the atmosphere and location of the place. It is our spot in NYC. We are very comfortable there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: leeleeManchester
Reviews.Content: Just returned from nyc, we had a fantastic time and stayed at the park central... Hotel was great, perfect location, come out the hotel and turn left central park is at the end of the road or turn right and times square is there, all no more than a 5/10 mins walk away. I would definately stay here again, and would recomend to people. The rooms are nice and spacious, good shower. The only downside i thought was the house keeping could do with being stepped up a bit, one day our room wasnt made or bins empited and on looking closer you could see the carpets in the room needed a proper hoover and the curtains a wash, (few marks on them). That was the only downside to a lovely hotel..

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE NEW YORK”
Reviews.Author: CONNIE2012
Reviews.Content: the park central has that great classic New York Feel. The lobby just invites you in, the bar is aswome if you want some drinks before you head out or just want a place to chill and drink. Elizabeth at the front desk was very friendly and helpful in finding me an excellent room on my 1st stay there . my room on the 20th floor was awsome. the hotel is a great location, if your heading out on the town, or just staying in. the rates that night was too good to pass up so I jumped on the deal.had been wating to stay there for awhile I will deff come back to the park central. thank you Elizabeth and thank you park central. xoxoxoxoxo I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Alfonso C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to NYC for her 30th. She's been before and it was my first time. Staff was efficient and accomodating. Facility was clean. Room was clean. View was nice. Water pressure was great (random but important). Bar staff was friendly (for the quick drink we had). Elevators were pretty cool. System was very efficient. Decor was great, especially since my wife is a huge Judy Garland fan.

Reviews.Title: “The park central is like a second home to me! :)”
Reviews.Author: missmunoz
Reviews.Content: This has been my favorite hotel to stay in when I visit NYC. I've been coming here for the past four years now. The staff are amazing and very helpful as well....one of my favorites is Carol who works at the front desk. ;) I look forward to my upcoming stay here this weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Adam B
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Park Central Hotel and were very happy overall. The location is central and close to everything. Central Park, Times Square, restaurants, entertainment, shopping, grocery store, etc are all within walking distance. The staff are friendly and will go the extra mile to help you as much as they can with whatever questions you have. A big thank you to Ellen at the front desk. She helped us with a special request and went above and beyond with her service. If you stay at this hotel and need any sort of help then go speak with Ellen, she's amazing. The hotel looks very nice inside as do the rooms - they are very comfortable. Note that our room didn't have a coffee maker and mini bar fridge. I'm not sure if other rooms have them. We didn't mind because there's a coffee shop downstairs and Starbucks around the corner, as well as many restaurants. All in all we had a great stay and enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Adella522
Reviews.Content: Pretty decent hotel. The price was right at the time. Needs some TLC and maintenance. The staff at the reception were friendly and professional. Housekeeping staff friendly and did a great job. The ice machine wasn't working on the 15th floor. They said they would send someone. I didn't follow up to see if they did. Elevators were very quick and modern but small. Overall good experience. I asked for a room at the back to be away from street noise, and it was very quiet. No noise from neighbors either. No complaints there. There is a diner across the street that is clean and my favorite is the Brookyn Diner 2 blocks up and around the corner. The strawberry blond cheesecake is to die for. Room was basic and clean, no coffee machine ( would love that). Would go back but may try another place also.The location is perfect. Try to spruce it up a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For The Price”
Reviews.Author: Traveller863
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a bargin with a great location this is the hotel. The hotel is nicely located between central park and times square. The service is only fair at best. When booking I opted for the upgraded view room and had an amazing view of Times Square. I will definately stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in NYC”
Reviews.Author: jeff w
Reviews.Content: The Park Central is my home away from home. While there are better, more expensive, hotels in NYC, the Park Central offers the all-around best value in the city. Location is central and right next to the subway. Rooms are clean and the staff is nice. Special thanks to Carolyn at the front desk - she's the greatest!

Reviews.Title: “Read it ! the most balance review (i think)”
Reviews.Author: mollieitem
Reviews.Content: Business trip to CT via NYC. First time visit of this amazing city. The plan was to use this hotel as a hub as we were traveling between the two states (CT and NY) from Sydney hence the use of JFK in NY. Sydney to NY is a 23-24hr journey, you would feel the full impact on your fatigue as soon you're sit down on your first mattress in a full day. To give a fair and balance feedback I will approach my review using the following simple vectors. 1. Location (Accessibility and convenience) For NYC first timer, budget and reason of travel to explore the city then this hotel's location is PERFECT! located on 7th avenue which 10min radius to the novelty time square, 5th avenue (tiffany and co) and all the goodies (lateshow dave letterman studio etc) plus less than 5min to reach the big apple especially the ice ring. So proximity is a winner with this hotel. Taxis are easy to find as 7th Avenue is a 4 lanes rd and one of the busiest rd. Service Utterly non existence! from check in to check out it almost feels we're bothering the staff. I don't actually have anything good to say about this area.. its that bad! Room (condition, cleanliness and amenities) Room is muggy, dark and old and smells old too. No amenities such as coffee and tea maker let alone minibar. No ventilation in bathroom, dangy, musty and moldy. Shower curtain is almost black. soo big eeew in room. Towels are old and simple amenities such tissue box looked like it came out from a $2 shop~plastic. Houskeeper at least turndown room once a day. Food Once you checked in, experience the room and service we decided to take our business elsewhere. We feel 7th avenue have lots of better option than the restaurant or room service. BTW the cafe right next to the hotel is excellent in my opinion the only american joint that can do proper cappucino and understand the term 'flat white' and I'm not referring to Starbucks-also right next door. Value We paid 130USD/night... now the price speaks for its self. For a 'full service' hotel + location value is their only draw card! it is cheap for any standard even if you compare with YMCA Other tips with this hotel 1. To store you luggage will cost you $4/piece - pathetic 2. The porter/bell man is out there to scam you. with Gimmick like: "Sir i can give complimentary luggage service if you book an airport transfer with us which cost$65 only.." Since I've done my research prior the cost of yellow taxi from anywhere in Manhattan to JFK is a flat $45 it is even plastered all over the taxi panel... so i told him why would i spend an extra $20. Mind you NY Taxis are the best! the pick you up anywhere anytime to whatever from the shortest distance less than $3 trip to $100 or more they are upthere with London's black taxis. Conclusion Stay if you're no fuss kinda traveler and utilize the hotel jst as a hub to sleep and refreshh Big no no if you're looking for a picturesque, good service and ammenities hotel. You will be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: april L
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced rooms and convenient location. We were very pleased with our Park Central experience!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: alessandrocellai
Reviews.Content: I use this hotel all times when I am in NY and is always a very good experience. The rooms Are very good and also the restaurant is good. The location is magic; few blocs from Central Park end few from Time Square. All members of staff Are very kind but the guest relations manager Elizabeth Cacovic is fantastic . She is always available to help the guests

Reviews.Title: “NO REGARD FOR YOUR SECURITY AND WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: chiko85
Reviews.Content: DISGUSTING! great location but appalling service and bad attitude from staff. First of all the room stunk of cigarette smoke and the sheets on one bed had obviously not been washed from a previous guest because they too stunk of smoke and being a non smoker this was a foul way to have to sleep at night. The room was stifling hot with no way of actually turning the heater down so we resorted to opening the windows. The morning after we arrived we went out to explore the city making sure to leave the do not disturb sign on the door as we are always security conscious. When we returned to our room in the afternoon the door was clearly open and therefore had not been locked! The cleaners were no where in sight. I rang downstairs to which the staff tried to blame us, the housekeeping manager came to our room and did exactly the same. She said to me extremely rudely that if the sign was on the door then no one came into our room and that obviously we had not locked it. This really infuriated me as the beds and room had obviously been cleaned and we sure as hell didn't spend our weekend away cleaning a hotel room! When we checked out the "manager" did exactly the same thing as the other staff. Not once was anything offered to make up for their major security breach, they blamed it on us and treated us like we were scum. ABSOLUTELY DO NOT STAY HERE! We were staying in New York City last weekend and we stayed at the Holiday Inn where surprisingly the service was 100000000000x better than that at the park central hotel. Would of received better customer service from the homeless man sleeping under the bridge in Central Park!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Awesome Services & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jaz C
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the PC for the last 8 years. I come here every month for business and stay at this hotel. The service by the Front Desk Manager Elizbeth and her staff is exceptional. Always friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and great location...”
Reviews.Author: Kleewyk
Reviews.Content: Thank you Carolyn for helping and keeping me laughing during a business trip. The hotel is in a very good location and whoever doesn't know what to do with their time while here is beyond help. The rooms are clean and up to standard. Otherwise it is location, location. Great for visiting New York. Shopping an good dining all around. Will stay here again on my next trip to the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “park jcetral hotel”
Reviews.Author: amir c
Reviews.Content: i am staying at this hotel for about 3-4 years. it's not the most fancy one in nyc but it's in great location and have a great stuff. carolyn smith from fron desk does an excellent job, i never had a problem that wasn't solve for my satasfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Was he scalping broadway tickets in the lobby...?lol”
Reviews.Author: Areyoupriceless
Reviews.Content: Recently stay here for a cpl days for my anniversary.I arrived earlier than expected and was hopeful of an early check-in but was unfortunately told no and to return at 3:30 for availability :( I was then told I could leave my bags for a FEE if I decided to leave the hotel grounds.hrs lata after checking-in,a knock on my room door.it was chocolate covered strawberries ,compliments of the hotel due to my anniversary.I was really surprised,but more so was my girlfriend :) lata in the trip i was in the lobby checking my email on my iPad in a corner area where wi-fi is free, when I was constantly watched by a short annoying man who was asking strangers whether or not they attend broadway plays.When i asked about his job title by a near by desk, i was told he was an employee of a company simply working inside of the hotel.If so,i wonder why he didn't ask me about a show?..hmm lol check out was nice.I was helped by a nice lady named Ellen.We very close to Extending my stay because of her.hopefully she's there if we decided to stay there in the future.maybe even free wi-fi.. Im going keep my fingers crossed.lol - R.S

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel in the Center of Everything”
Reviews.Author: Jeri D
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Park Central for the past 10 years. The rooms are reasonably priced and the rooms are clean and comfortable. I always enjoy the wonderful location, which is near Central Park, fine dining, Broadway plays, and great shopping. In a city where everyone walks, a good location is imperative. In addition, the staff is wonderful (especially Drita, who is the Guest Relations Manager). She pays attention to the details so that a good hotel experience becomes a great hotel experience. I will stay at The Park Central for all of my future trips to NYC

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in NYC at the Park Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PJR3570
Reviews.Content: We went to the city to see a show and were thrilled at the service and accomodations of the hotel. We had a view of Time Square that was unbelievable. The hotel is 2 1/2 blocks from Central Park and right in the hub of the whole NY experience. I would highly recommend this hotel. The Staff were great.................PJR

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience (again)!”
Reviews.Author: G A
Reviews.Content: We took a group of students and chaperones (18 total) to New York city and decided to stay at the Park Central for the second straight year. Reservations we easy, hotel was very clean, staff was excellent (especially Ellen at the front desk). The location is perfect - just a few block north of Times Square and just south of Central Park. We will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tom B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 50 plus nights at the Park Central and you cannot beat its Mid Town location. The hotel is clean, rooms are comfortable and the staff is excellent thoughout. Jaimie the Bellman is always smiling and ready to help and John at the bar is the best in the business, especially for weary businesspeople after a long day.

Reviews.Title: “Primo Location for the Price”
Reviews.Author: sharkyteresa
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience for our whirlwind trip to NYC a couple of weekends ago. We stayed in the Park Central over a Sunday into Monday. The room was plenty big with king sized bed. The room could have been a little cleaner just some dust on baseboard when I checked for bed bugs. No bugs. Bed was enclosed in nice clean, white sack with a comforter which looks like its washed for each stay. I like that more than having a fancy comforter which stays on the bed for weeks or months at time. Bathroom floor could have been mopped a little better and there was a little leak in the shower head, but none of this is a major complaint. A pre-check in was available, so all we had to do later was get the key. Check in was late in the afternoon, but for a fee, you could check your bag into storage and go about having a lovely day without worrying about luggage or bags. The location of this hotel was fantastic. We walked everywhere we wanted to go. Didn't even need a cab. Close to theater district and Times Square and plenty of restaurants. Would go there again. Got a great price, I think due to a winter special in January. We're already planning for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “My 2012 Stay At the Park Central”
Reviews.Author: yves D
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with the Park Central had a great rate, room was very good staff was A+ Carolin at the front desk was awsome gave us great things to do around the city, helped me out with my client she was awesome overall great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: ClintLewis
Reviews.Content: The Park Central Hotel went above and beyond the the listed accomadations they tell guest they provide during our stay. Spacious rooms, high speed Internet, excellent rates and service. Elizabeth at the check in desk was amazing amd more than helpful! If you anything ask for her.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Todd G
Reviews.Content: Centrally located - great rooms but most importantly - great staff. Especially Elizabeth at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: bcrunde
Reviews.Content: This hotel has become our favorite in New York. The reason for this is the hotels location. It is close to Central Park, close to 5th Ave, close to Time Square, and the subway station is right at the hotels doorstep. The hotel rooms are good when you compaire the price. But do not pay extra for an upgrade when ordering the room. They never give it to you anyway. The hotel has a spasious lobby, and that it's needed, as the line for check-in can be very long. But if you arrive outside the busy hour, the check-in runs smoothly. The hotel has a restaurant,but we never tried it. The lobbybar is an excellent place to get to know people, and if you meet John. the bartender, you will have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Mmmmmm~”
Reviews.Author: belaireg
Reviews.Content: The location is good for the price... it is a quick walk to time square. Lots of neat deli's to eat at in the same block...and there is a Starbucks right when you walk out the door! BUT.... ours first room smelt HORRIBLE....and the view faced a brick wall. We went back down and they gave us another room, this one smelt better but I never walked barefooted anywhere in the room....and wish I had some shower shoes for the shower. The lobby is beautiful and staff friendly, but the rooms are very out dated and could use some clorox....not pine-o-pine! The bar in the hotel was great....grabed a quick cosmo before we headed out the first night and was the best I had ever had! The David Letterman show is one street behind the hotel and one block down. Keeping in mind we were only in the room to sleep.... I may stay there again. Nahhhh....probably not!

Reviews.Title: “Concerns were unwarranted”
Reviews.Author: WKfam
Reviews.Content: While planning this visit to NYC, I decided to stay near Central Park instead of midtown/lower Midhattan as usual. Some reviews of Park Central Hotel caused me some concern, but others were positive. I made my reservation and hoped for the best. Several days later the room rate was reduced. I called the hotel and the rate was adjusted without any question. Upon arrival I was greeted by the valet, my car parked, my bags handled and I was quickly checked in. The room was larger than expected, clean and quite adequate. I noted to the front desk the window view was to a rooftop. I was told the hotel was full but a large group was expected to check out the next day and they could arrange a room change the next day. I kept so busy with Times Square and Central Park being so close, I decided to keep the room that was quite adequate. The checkout process was very efficient. By the time I checked out, my car was waiting curbside and warming up. The hotel was clean, professionally staffed and a pleasure to visit. When I mentioned my positive experience to "Tia" during my checkout, she was genuinely delighted that my stay was such a positive experience. Can't wait to return and pick up where I left off. Great hotel, great location, great experience. "Tia", I told you I would share my experience with others. :)

Reviews.Title: “convenience and attention”
Reviews.Author: Nicolepb
Reviews.Content: Park Central has become my place to stay when going to the Opera or Carnegie Hall. It is conveniently located, allowing one to easily walk to the Met. This past stay, I appreciated the response from the hotel's staff when we had a problem with the hair dryer. Stanley promptly came to the room and installed a new hair dryer. He was thorough and very polite.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cuborg10
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews placed on here before staying I was absolutely dreading going on holiday!! Even to the point of cancelling and losing our money and trying to find somewhere else, well the worry was wasted!! The hotel and it's staff are amazing, the lobby is spotless with a friendly atmosphere. Hotel staff are eager to help and nothing is too much. Never had to wait for the lift, many other reviews claimed they were useless, well they weren't, they do the job. You press the floor you want on the keypad, it tells you what lift to use and you wait for it, plain and simple!! Room brill, was expecting a little box, but very spacious and clean. Bed and pillows so comfy you don't want to get up and after the busy day running around New York it's something to look forward too! Location again amazing, outside main hotel entrance, turn left and you are less than 5 mins walk from central park and turn right and you are 10 mins away from times square! Cannot fault the hotel at all on anything it's staff, appearance and location are spot on! Would recommend this hotel to all I know, we already planning another visit to New York in the future with friends and am going to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All in the title”
Reviews.Author: leesider
Reviews.Content: The Park Central is near the park, and it's central. A big, busy, bustling hotel with a rather too dimly lit lobby. The first room I checked into was beside an electrical closet that was ticking ... very loudly (you could hear it even when the door was closed). I asked to be moved, and was given a much nicer room. Unlike more modern hotels, where all the rooms are the same, there is considerable variation in the rooms. My room was clean, spacious, with generous drawer and closet space. A good shower, and a very comfortable bed. What more could you want? Free wi-fi, I suppose. One big plus was the fact that the housekeeping staff went about their business very quietly ... in too many hotels, the noise in the corridors is enough to disturb an early morning's sleep. The lift system works very well for the most part, though one morning - at around 9am - I had an 11-minute wait. The location is fantastic - two blocks from Central Park, within walking distance of Times Square and many good restaurants. It's also right beside the E train subway stop, which will whisk you to JFK via the Airtrain in an hour for the princely sum of $7.20. Would I stay there again? Absolutely, if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central NY”
Reviews.Author: Carla N
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at the Park Central NY, staff is friendly and efficient and we felt extremely welcome. The location is perfect, with a subway station right next to it. We are already planning our next stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “would be screwed if there were an emergency!”
Reviews.Author: akjkmn6
Reviews.Content: Stayed second week of December/11 for one night at $400 for two queen beds. Checked in, went to our room and there was one king bed. Tried to call down but the PHONE DIDN'T WORK, so went down, got it changed. Room was not too bad - fairly clean but could have been better. Called to the front desk a couple of times later and even though someone picked up and you could talk to them, there was still ringing in the background. Beds were comfortable. Recieved wake up call and they let us know our cab was there but the ELEVATOR WOULD NOT COME. Tried the PHONE in hallway and it was DEAD. Finally got through to someone on the room phone after trying almost all the options on the phone. They had to send the elevator up for us. If there had been an emergency we would have been screwed with no phone or elevator service! WORKING PHONES AND ELEVATOR ARE A MUST!!!! The few staff we did encounter were helpful. Just not what I expected it to be for the price and the location - the little hotels we have here are much better.

Reviews.Title: “Needs major renovation!”
Reviews.Author: sunshineky69
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Park Central for New Year's Eve 2012, we have stayed there two times before but it has been at least 3 years. Major disapointment! Everything is in need of renovation. the carpets are so worn you can barely see the print/detail in them, the walls have faded wall paper and are dirty, the beds are far from comfy, all the furniture in the room is very old and not well maintained as well as the distressed sofa tables as you exit/enter the floor elevators. I was so shocked when we checked into the room that I actually called for a room change, the staff was very nice and did change our room to a bigger room but still the same problems. In the past we were happy with this hotel, the location is excellent but we do not plan to stay there again until the hotel has a complete makeover. I new the last we stayed it was showing signs of ware and tare and i specifically asked if it had been renovated and was told yes, but NO it is not.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: carol s
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely, lobby very nice, staff very friendly, rooms spacious, LCD tv, clean modern bathroom with bath and shower. Fresh sheets, comfy bed, fab location at the top of 7th Ave you will love this hotel, stayed with my mum at Xmas, starbucks and the tube next door and right next to Central Park- good price also. Enjoy- stayed twice and would def stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Second time around - still very happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: LilifromBrazil
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the morning and our check in was at 4 pm. Although we waited to check in by 4, the front desk associate was extremely kind to us. We were in a party of four and he was able to assign two rooms by each other. You can't beat this location. We walked every night to times square and never had to fight for a cab. The concierge was very helpful. Our overall experience was very positive.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: tolopez
Reviews.Content: We stayed at New York’s Park Central hotel for the weekend. Admittedly we staid at this hotel because of its bargain basement price ($129 a night). It was the weekend after new years when Manhattan is quiet and all the stores are having big sales. Here’s all the positives about this hotel. Location, Location, Location. It’s a stones throw from Central Park, Times Square, and 5th Avenue. There is a subway stop down the street, a Starbucks on the corner of the hotel and the Carnegie Deli across the street. Here’s the rest: the hotel’s lobby is nice, but was always busy. It reminded me of an airport terminal or train station, a lot of people running around speaking several languages. Our room was disappointing. It was 1924, a king size room on the 19th floor facing the interior court yard, meaning there was no view, only of other hotel rooms. The room was clean and small. The room had a flat screen TV, king size bed, chair, closet and desk. It was not luxurious to say the least, but it was livable. The bathroom was tiny. There was barely enough room for two people to be in there at once. In fact the toilet was in the center of the bathroom in front of the door, so if you tried to open the door while someone was sitting on it, you would take off their leg. One of our biggest complaints about the room was it is dark, even with all the lights on it was almost cave like. We had several bad experiences at the Park Central starting with the fire alarm going off the minute after we checked in. It was a false alarm but it kept us in the lobby for sometime because the elevators would not run as a safety precaution. The safe in the room broke, so we had to carry all of our valuables down to the safe deposit boxes. Those boxes are narrow and will not accommodate an iPad, so we had to store them in the managers safe. Then we had some foreign kids prank call our room about a dozen times. It was about 9 in the morning, the phone would start to ring and when we answered a heavily accented voice of a child would say something stupid and hang up. We finally unplugged all the phones and went to complain to the manager. He was very apologetic but expressed that it was out of the hotel’s control. The last thing the hotel could not control is the room temperature. It’s one of those old builds that has a/c in the summer and only heat in the winter. During our stay Manhattan was usually warm, so we decided to turn on the air. When hot air started blowing out we called down to the front desk and asked them to fix it. They told us the building only has heat this time of the year and suggested opening a window. You would think that by opening the window we would be subject to all of New York’s street noise, but since our room faced the interior court yard it was very quiet. We slept the whole not without hearing one siren. Unfortunately we woke up to our room reeking of onions. We think it was from the food carts on the street below. Again I cannot stress that the location is great. The rate was fantastic. But you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: TheAdventurers
Reviews.Content: I kept going back and forth on choosing a hotel in NYC, and was not disappointed with the Park Central. It is clean, roomy for NY, and the rooms are quiet. Location is truly fantastic--two blocks south of Central Park, near all the different subway lines, within walking distance to Times Square and theaters. Personnel were very nice. Hotel is fairly basic, but you can purchase reasonably-priced muffins and such in the a.m. in the lobby and there is a Starbucks and a ton of other such places right there. Only gripe is that WiFi is NOT free--costs a little over $14 a day, which was annoying and felt a little nickel-and-dimey. Otherwise, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “shabby experience”
Reviews.Author: hjlawdoc
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located in a less than attractive spot. outwardly looks ok but the staff is awful. the shower/bath was worn out and i slipped and got hurt pretty badly with blood everywhere. they changed our room to a tattered jr. suite with big holes in the rugs and wallpaper hanging off the walls. while changing our room, they lost or stole thousands of dollars of our clothing which we had to go out an replace in a hurry. they never reimbursed us at all. this is the NY experience that you read about.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: susieOldham
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the Park Central hotel over new year weekend, i have to say i thought it was good. cannot understand the bad reviews. All you need from a hotel in new york is a comfortable bed, so what if the lifts takes a while?? check in was quick and simple, the room was clean and tidy, the only downside was the toilet didnt flush, but so what? just meant the cleaners had to sort it out. check out is at 12.00 wever when we tried to get into the room at 11.45 our key didnt work seems like the cleaners locked our room as they assumed we had finished with it, we explained we had another 15 mins and that we needed to collect our suitcase and the cleaner opened our door, no problem. i have stayed at this hotel twice, and will continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: artymom
Reviews.Content: My friend and I love to come to NYC and stay over one night a month and run and do and see everything we can. The location of the Park Central Hotel is perfect for us. We had an exceptional time this last week. Elizabeth, the guest relations manager was especially helpful and allowed us early check in. We were given a wonderful upgrade of a suite instead of a room with two double beds. It was terrific, with great light, quiet and on a high floor. It was immaculately clean and had a wonderfully comfortable bed. The staff were all helpful and polite. We stayed here about 6 months ago and did not have such a great experience, although problems were rectified. They seem to be trying harder to please. The Park Central could use an updating, but for now it is a great value with a great location. We would happily come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good price, very good location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Vstromer001
Reviews.Content: Busy modern hotel, in excellent location for Times Square, Central Park and well placed for Downtown and Uptown exploring. Fabulous location, very friendly and helpful staff. Price was very good, but compare prices for this hotel on the internet, we booked but then found a better deal on-line for the same hotel making it very well priced. We rang them and they swapped the booking over for us. A very nice room with pleasant touches like a box of tissues, generous toiletries, etc. Elevators take a bit of time to get used to as you have to use a touch screen to pre-book an elevator before you get in or else it won't stop at your foor. Apparently this is what they to in NYC hotels. The elevators get busy at peak times. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: florida2001
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for three nights, beautiful hotel rooms great location very good for all attractions and central park is just around the corner just not keen on new york city itself

Reviews.Title: “First, disinterested, then rude and finally, outright crooks”
Reviews.Author: JA-From-Sydney
Reviews.Content: On 23 Dec I stayed one night at the hotel. In the first few hours after checking in I went out with friends and went shopping. Each time I returned to my room my key did not work. Three times in total. Each time I had to go to the lobby, wait up to 10 mins in line and ask for a new key. The first time I had a problem the woman behind the desk told me that many stores will demagnetise the key when I walk in/out of them given their security system. (Really? No other hotel has such problems with their keys). The second time it happened I was served by the manager on duty, Fransciso who said 'it is due to a computer problem. He barked at me and snarled indicating he really wanted to tell me to 'get ------", but chose his words wisely.He was incredibly rude. The third time it happened a man behind the front desk told me I must have demagnetised the key by keeping it near my credit card. Strange how that can happen as I keep my hotel key always separate to my wallet. The man from the front desk gave me a new key and said to ensure the key works he said will send security to meet me outside my room and they will access the room if my key fails. As expected, my new key failed. While waiting in the corridor outside my room for the security man I saw a mother and 2 kids sitting on the floor at the end of the corridor waiting for the husband/father to return from the lobby complaining of their key not working! The security man, Leon, arrived at my door, played with the lock for a few seconds and finally placed the security tag in the door and yanked the handle UP (not down as is intuitive to most folk). VOILA! It worked! The door magically opened! Leon stated that there are many doors in the hotel that operate trouble free if the handles are yanked UP. I thanked the kind man for his demonstrated competence and fine manners. Without his help I’d have trekked to the front desk a 4th time! Very late that night I was so DISAPPOINTED with my experience I went down to the lobby to complain. I spoke to a guy at the desk whose name I recorded, Emanuel, and told him the story. I mentioned that from the folk at the front desk I was not offered an apology for this fiasco and not offered any compensation. He asked me to wait while he went to the back office to talk to Franscico. I told him just how Fransisco treated me a few hours earlier. Emanuel returned and printed out a complimentary b/fast voucher given the problems I had. I said to him I was so fed up I was going to write up a negative review on www.tripadvisor.com but given the voucher, I will not do so. I thanked him for the comp b/fast voucher. And until now I kept my word in not reporting my awful time at the Park Central on tripadvisor.com. What changed my mind? The fraudulent behaviour of the hotel did. Today on my credit card statement I find a charge for USD 43.36 (AUD 44.07) which is clearly for the breakfast and the tax and the tip, EVEN though I received a complimentary b/fast voucher (which included the USD 35 b/fast and taxes and tips). It said so on the voucher. Being Australian (a nation of people unfamiliar with tipping and added taxes) I confirmed with the front desk that the voucher included these items and was assured it did. I emailed the hotel to credit me the no less than AUD 44.07 (ie USD 43.36) immediately but will not hold my breath.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, soulless shabby hotel”
Reviews.Author: penfold699
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the week before Christmas 2011. It claims to be a 4 1/2 star hotel - no idea how. The beds were comfy, location ideal, but the staff were surly and unhelpful. In fact the concierge tried to rip us off by offering us a private hire car to the airport as he said the yellow cabs don't run a flat rate out of Manhattan - a bare faced lie! Beware, they ask for a hundred dollar deposit the second you check in!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Sallyanne45
Reviews.Content: Position was unbeatable...handy to everything - just 5 mins walk to Times Square and less to the Park... you get the subway or walk to just about everything New York has to offer from here from here... but we found the room interior very shabby given what we were paying and the staff were so rude! We were astounded at their attitude - one even threw our laundry bag against the wall. There are a few rooms with views of Times Square 06 and 07 on every floor I think.. so if you stay mention this as you pay the same for this view as the ordinary view we got! I would not reommend this hotel - the staff are rude and unhelpful. Last straw - we had to pay to store our luggage from 8 to 11 while we went for a last walk - - we thought we were doing them a favour but we had to pay for the kind gesture!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: wor7
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel I would recommend only if you can get a very good deal and do not plan on spending too much time in your room. The location is excellent, walking distance to Central Park, Time Square, the MoMa and many other attractions. Plenty of good restaurants within walking distance too. The rooms are spacious for NYC standards and the king size beds are comfortable. The rooms though need to be updated and detailed. Furniture, carpets, curtains look old and tired, so do the bathrooms. Do not expect much service either. This is a very big hotel, where you can walk in and out without seeing anybody for days as the front desk is pretty much in the back of a very big lobby. Overall I would stay in this hotel again only if I get a good deal and mostly because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: trader4
Reviews.Content: From the moment we drove up in front of the hotel I knew we were in trouble since despite the sign that read "valet", no one actually worked in that capacity.. Asking for help at the front desk was a waste of time- They refused to help me until my husband checked in and of course he was stuck outside for 30 minutes fighting off the police for sitting in the car ourside the hotel- Clearly hotel personnel could have fixed this by appearing. Our room was horrendous: awful, decaying, poorly furnished with peeling wall paper, discolored carpet, water stains, orange and brown crumbling grout in the bathroom . The bedspread was filthy. Totally devoid of any niceties whatsoever. We returned to the front desk and asked for an upgraded room and were advised that they were all in this similar dismal condition but she found one that had a renovated shower. When I turned on the shower, the entire bathroom floor flooded. (The second room was equally bad!) As the last straw, we waited over one full hour to get our car the next day.-

Reviews.Title: “Overall - quite nice”
Reviews.Author: smallberries
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the Concierge Suites on the upper floors with the thinking that our 14 y.o. daughter and friend could sleep on the pull-out bed in one room and my wife and I could have room of our own. The minor drawbacks with this were that the pull-out was rather uncomfortable and the girls had to come through our bedroom to use the bathroom. Everyone we encountered on the staff, from the Concierge to waitstaff to room cleaning was cordial. The location is excellent with many attractions withing walking distance: Central Park and the zoo, many museums, Time Square, Bryant Park, NYPL, Rockefeller Center, Broadway and 5th Ave. Consider attending performances at Carnagie Hall or New York City Center which are both within a block from the hotel. We only had breakfast and apps in the hotel restaurant, and the everything we had was good, priced at New York prices (pretty high). On the negative side, five minutes after we checked into our suite another guest with the bellhop unlocked our door. Somehow we were both given the same room. I should have double-locked the door right away. Imagine if it was just my wife and I and we were getting frisky! Another minor drawback is the elevator system that requires you to enter your floor destination before entering the elevator. It quickly flashes which elevator to use and if you get in the wrong one it won't let you punch your floor. All in all, a good hotel where I would consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “1st Timers to New York”
Reviews.Author: Cmark75
Reviews.Content: Purpose of Trip: Get away from Kids for a Couples Trip in a good location, we stayed from Friday to a Sunday night Getting To/ From Airport: From Laguardia to hotel we took the "airporter" bus service. It was a good choice as it was flat rate (about $25 for both of us) and there was a lot of traffic into Manhattan. It took us to Grand Central Station which was convenient for visiting From there they give us a free shuttle to our hotel. Leaving: we took a Limo taxi service on a flat rate ($65) from the hotel to JFK. This was a wise decision as there was so much traffic and it took over an hour to get to the airport. Leave yourself lots of time. Hotels Rooms: Nothing special, spacious, cleaner than not, we had a King room over looking 7th Ave. and almost a view of Central park which was nice. It was a little cool but I like that. We had a problem with our bed, I mentioned it to the concierge on the first morning, he said it would get fixed, nothing was done. This is your bare minimum nice Hotel, the location is the best feature of this hotel. There is so much to do around the area, all we did was crash in our room from being out all day. Check in/out: One minus – they charged us for luggage storage prior to our room being ready, we arrived at 1:00pm and room still wasn’t ready? Charged us to store luggage on our last day. No express check out. Lobby: spacious and clean – didn’t go to the lobby bar or restaurant Location of Hotel: it was perfect for what we were after; walking distances to attractions: Right at the bottom of the hotel: Subway stop Starbucks with free Wi-Fi Numerous places to eat Approx. 3-5min walk or less: Central park Central Park Horse Carriage Rides Liquor and Wine Store 5th Avenue shopping Times square More shopping than you can believe possible More restaurants than you can believe possible Ed Sullivan Theater Carnegie Hall FAO Schwarz Toy store New York visitor Center with guides, maps and coupons for places Double Decker, Gray Line Bus stop (Stating point for Uptown & downtown loops) Approx. 5-10min. walk or less: Rockerfeller Center (Top of the Rock) Radio City At least another 100 other attractions I’m not listing. Tips/ Trips: We took the Gray line “hop on, hop off” 48hr bus pass. Don’t do your souvenir shopping until you’ve gone to Canal Rd. it’s an experience. The bus trip was a great way to see a lot of places with a lot of stops. We got off at the points of interests we wanted to see, then got back on not waiting more than 10 mins per stop for the next bus. Very affordable and convenient way to see the City. Don’t eat at the restaurant across the road from the hotel with the neon lights, service was brutal, prices were outrageous, food was less than mediocre. With all the places to eat in the immediate vicinity, skip this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: MIKESHIREHORSE
Reviews.Content: A perfectly located hotel for Times Square and all of the New York attractions, room was clean and comfortable, staff efficient and welcoming, all in all a great stay. Only fault is we would have liked to stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “Location-5 hotel-1”
Reviews.Author: BrittL517
Reviews.Content: 110% underwhelmed. What a dissapointing experience. We chose the hotel for Christmas weekend. It was a great location. I wish I could say one other thing was great. The lobby was great! ... okay that's it. The staff could take some lessons from the Sheraton, or the Hilton, or the Motor Inn in Queens. The staff was so blasé. Even with the 'warmth' of the holidays, they were just short of grinch worthy. I've felt more welcome at McDonald's. I expect more from a staff in NYC. My mom requested information about St. Patrick's Cathedral, location, times, etc. and they suggested she walk there and find out. Thanks. The woman at the desk 'upgraded' my senior citizen parents to the 25th floor, without informing us quite how the elevators worked. So we looked like fools, and frustrated with the elevator. Again, thanks. The room was an okay size. No mini fridge, sort of a boring room decor, and overall 'eh' condition. One little trash can. When we got to the 25 floor, the window was WIDE open. No screen, I guess incase the staff drove me to jump, I could. We thought this was weird... BUT then we figured out why. The heat was broken. Our steps: Let's call the front desk, our room is a sauna. Pick up the phone, call down, get hung up on. Call down again, say hello, here hello back, say our heat is broke, here hello again, then get hung up on. Call a third time (my dad sounds crazy now) they say hello back and forth while I wait for him to be hung up on again and I call with my cell phone. The operator asks me if I've called the front desk, if I dialed zero, if I spoke to the operator. I tried VERY hard to keep my patience. I'm not sure what it was about "our phone is broken" that she didn't understand. When the point was made, I said, "I do not care about the phone. Please send someone to fix the heat!" We braced ourselves for the wait. Put the TV on and ate soem peeps. A Christmas miracle- in the form of Stanley, the handy man? He came in about 10 minutes. He also pointed out that we had two phones... WHICH we felt silly about BUT we laughed we probably have 2 because the one doesn't work. Stanley asked if we had turned the heat off... I stared at him and refused to answer his question. My mom laughed. Stanley realized he insulted us and laughed. After observing the heater, He told us that side of the hotel was always hotter because of the water heater... but had nothing to say about the fact that it was still emitting heat. Stanley was nice and found us a fan to put infront of the window- which kind of grossed me out (NY Smog). But thank you Stanley. At least you tried and gave us service with a Smile. Stanley, Thanks. The day we wanted to check out, the maid stopped by our room 3 times. Our check-out was 1pm. The maid did not understand this. The third time she came, thankfully we were packing up and she could come in. We used our 2nd phone to call down to the valet and have our car brought around. They said 15 minutes. We went down to get our car exactly 15 minutes after our phone call and even the Valet had an attitude. He let us know, "I've been waiting a long time." My step dad appologized and he just put his hand out for the ticket (or a tip? for being so kind?) Thanks. Christmas in New York- is beautiful and amazing. Thankfully, I will remember the Rockettes, the Tree, the fabulous dinners, and the time I spent with my family. I hope by next Christmas, I will have forgotten about my 'experience' with the Park Central Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very good value”
Reviews.Author: gmt702
Reviews.Content: I went a couple of year's back (NOV 2007) and paid about £40-£50 pp per night - that was OK for the room. It wasn't the Hilton but then neither was the price we paid. The room was clean and fairly basic but had TV - the bed was rather short through and I'm only 5foot 6.5 (1m68.5) so my feet hung over the edge! My poor friend is even taller! Service was absolutely fine and we ate in the restaurant one evening and the food was good - we didn't do buffet food so breakfast was good too. Lots of info readily available for attractions and the desk staff were helpful. Lots of food places on the doorstep at good value so easy to grab a sandwich or bagel :-) a good 15 min walk to Times Square but it was nice to go away from the hustle and bustle of it too. We were there oct/nov and packed winter clothes and there was a mini heatwave - had to buy shoes rather than boots and some lighter clothing - best to pack a mix at this time of year...layers. Although high up, it was strange to wake up to NYC traffic noise but it didn't bother us so much after all it's NYC! But if a light sleeper bring earplugs ;-) - room was clean - didn't notice how much they did as we were out all the time and just came back to shower and sleep. I'd def recommend looking for deals though and comparing their usual -prices to hotels closer Times Square - it's a good value 3* style hotel - be careful some hotels advertised as 3* are not - especially the one opposite and to think we nearly booked it! Thankfully we didn't as another couple who did, checked out and into Park Central straight away - I'd return to park central no hesitation. Door men friendly but was disappointed not to get a yellow cab to the airport as the doorman was insistent we get into the limo with a bunch of girls and as much as we protested he insisted - so be warned stand your ground and be firm - polite englishness gets you nowhere LOL - plenty of good Irish bars sound too..central park about 10min walk and worth a visit and wander - NYC so vast and we did a lot of walking - metro was fine - we went to ground zero using it - trips - statue of liberty, ellis island, empire state building, bloomingdales, but if you have time take a trip out to one of the big department stores - clothes shopping is cheaper off Manhattan LOL - NYC a girl's dream ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Hot & noisy”
Reviews.Author: Westplan
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable! It's 35 degrees outside and 78 inside and no air circulation on the concierge floor. They gave us a room fan with a taped up, frayed wire. The hotel staff told us many were complaining their room was too hot. For both nights, it sounded like furniture was being moved all night long on the floor above us. Concierge floor means a coffee maker in the room. No joke, that's it! At least the room was clean and the staff friendly. Terrific location for shoppers, but we would never, never, never stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Average NYC Hotel-don't get the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Susie_D_NY
Reviews.Content: I just completed a 6 night stay at the Park Central (12.14.2011-12.20.2011). Overall the hotel is exactly what you need, but nothing more. I swore I read something that denoted the Park Central as a 4-star hotel and that is what i was expecting. This hotel is NOT a 4-star hotel. It's a 3-star. Some people complained of long lines at check-in; however, i did not encounter that. We were quickly greeted and got a free room upgrade to a higher floor (must have been the 'conceirge floor' b/c we had a coffee maker). The front desk agent was awesome and recommended a fabulous local, sit down pizza place (Angelo's-it's next to the Late Show w/David Letterman Theatre-you must go, it's amazing!). NOTE: we purchased the "bed and breakfast" package which included a buffet breakfast. DO NOT DO THIS. the spread included bacon/sausage, eggs (they did not taste like real eggs to me, perhaps they were fake/dehydrated eggs), potatoes, french toast, fruit, meat/cheeses, waffle maker, cereal. sounds lovely, right? The issue we had was not that there wasn't enough food, but the quality and the temperature of the food. we ate there 4 our of our 6 days hoping it would get better-it didn't. the bacon, eggs and potatoes were cold/not hot on all four days. One day my friend tried to eat cereal; however, his milk was spoiled and literally had lumps pouring out of the milk carton. there are a zillion food choices literally right outside the door, i would not recommend eating breakfast at the hotel. The room: it was very spacious for a NYC hotel. the bed was comfortable and the pillows were awesome. It had a nice flat panel TV (which we watched only a few times when coming in from being out all day/night), a desk and a fairly spacious closet. Issue: there did not seem to be any heating or airconditioning. there was what appeared to be a radiator by the window; however, there was no way to turn in on. The window only opened 6 inches and on some night did not provide enough fresh air. Additonally, we were on the 19th floor facing 7th Ave and it was noisy. BRING EAR PLUGS if you plan to get any sleep with the window open. srsly. The bathroom: small and outdated. the shower head needed to be updated and the tile in bathroom/bathtub was somewhat old and could use a good scrub. Some parts of the grout were recently filled, but with a different color. The electrical plugs were mushy and out dated. When all is said and done the bathroom provided the necessities and nothing more. hot water, towels, shampoo and soap. note to women (and men with long hair!): bring your own conditioner as the hotel only provids shampoo. they do supply a decent, small, travel blow dryer. Housekeeping is decent. during our stay they only "tidied" up the room once and did not dump out the remaining coffee from the coffemaker.
