Seems all they did was put new towels out and make the bed. also, i had brought up 3 coffee cups from the cafe from breakfast and left them in the bathroom when i was done and they only rinsed them out. they didn't take them away or sanitize them. that's not sanitary, so i would not drink from any other cups in the room. glasswear must be sanitized not just rinsed out. Overall i was satisfied with the hotel; however, if you require quiet when you sleep do not ask for a room that faces the street(s). i know it's NYC and it's loud by nature, but hearing sirens and honks throughout the night made for rough sleep until i wised up and bought some ear plugs! We had no major issues and were happy with our stay. i would recommend the Park Central Hotel, but just be advised it's a simple hotel in a fabulous location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but not perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Letsgoseetheworld
Reviews.Content: Went to NYC Saturday 12/17 for a one get away to see a concert and the holiday sites. I got my $500 room at a discount on Travel Ticker for $228 + taxes (total $268). The lobby was nicely dressed for the holidays. We got a King Size suite. The bed was very comfortable, the rug was begining to show it's age. The size of the room was bigger than I expected. We stayed on the 24th floor with no view (that costs more). The great thing about our experience was not the $43 to valet our car (hey it's New York), but we asked the reservationist at check in if breakfast was included (knowing it was not), and she kindly printed a voucher for a complimentary breakfast for two! KUDOS to them! The breakfast was a buffet and pretty good. The best thing about this hotel is the location (near Time Square and accross the street from my favorite Carnigie Deli). You can walk to everything. I would stay here again, but not for $500! I know that they are offering a deal now for $99 per night through the holidays. Take advange of this deal. On the downside: The house cleaners did not clean out one of the dresser draws and we found dirty clothes, condoms and other ucky stuff. The other bad thing was waiting 45 minutes for the valet to bring our car around at check out. If you can get a deal on this hotel, go for it. We had fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: B4L
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel well in advance of our trip but became anxious after reading several reports between booking and check in. Have to say there was no need, found the hotel to be exactly what i needed and some of the poor reports seem to be based on minor issues that had no effect on my stay. Check in was fine, quick with nice helpful staff, lifts are fine - only difference is waiting in a nice lobby instead of standing in a cramped overcrowded lift, very efficient. Room was fantastic, clean, spacious and a fantastic view, comfortable bed with adequate ensuite, cleaned daily, corridors are fine. We didnt eat at the hotel, there are many great cafes and diners in the area. We didnt use WiFi therefore did not get charged for it. Every customer is aware of the baggage charge before they arrive at the hotel therefore i cant understand their complaints. Have to say location is great, right on the main subway line, a few blocks from Central Park and Times Square. Dont let the reviews of some other posters affect your decision, make sure to check if what they post is important to your stay. This hotel is cheap for NYC, spacious, great location, clean and a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but expensive in December”
Reviews.Author: westminster1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not actually my choice but we had booked to stay in a new hotel which was due to open early November but was delayed until January so was booked out here. I appreciate that weekends in December are going to be expensive in NY but to pay around 300$ per night for this is pushing it. Location was great but hotel, other than lobby area, is tired and in need of refurbishment. Having read the reviews before I went I was not sure of what we would be going to so e mailed in advance asking for a nice room. May as well have saved my time ! No response and an internal room on 6th floor overlooking airconditioning units and rubbish. However, you don't go to NY to sit in your room so put up with that. Have to say the bed was very comfortable and the room serived adequately each day. The biggest problem we encountered was the total lack of any customer focus. Staff seem completely fed up and almost ignore you - even to the extent of making personal phone calls whilst you are in line waiting to see them . Never enough staff on front desk so always a queue. I guess if you want a tired old bedroom factory then this will do but nect time I'll opt for somehwere that actually seems to care if you want to return.

Reviews.Title: “"Concierge Floor Means A Coffee Maker In Your Room"”
Reviews.Author: gallerygirl09
Reviews.Content: This hotel is trying to be hip on a budget. The lobby looks cool enough with the Pop Art influence of the Judy Garland portraits . The elevator is interesting in that you must press your room number on a touch screen before entering. We went for the most expensive grade room when making our reservation. We say at the manhattan club for 4 days in december but we wanted to get there a day earlier so opted to stay next door t the Park Central Hotel. Concierge floor looked promising and having done concierge floor at the Hyatt and other hotels we felt assured in our minds that it would be a lovely room and some concierge benefits. The room was not that large, the curtains had grease marks on them. The floor of the hotel was a high floor which was great but the floor looked so shabby and there was plastic half way ripped off the threshold of the hotel room across from ours. The breakfast was so so. I would not recommend it except that if you do not care about aesthetics for $190 it is ok. This is a lesson of you get what you pay for. I asked the front desk when checking out what did they mean by concierge floor and he said the coffee maker in the room. Honestly I never even noticed it in the room . There was no mini bar in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Average+”
Reviews.Author: travelllers2
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel mainly becuse of the location. It was close to both- Time Square and Central Park. Hotel was average, nothing too special, but enough for our satisfaction. We stayed for 3-nights. Service was allright, so was the room. We decided to try the breakfast in the hotel lobby one morning and were quite pleased with the fresh and wide choice of the buffet. Too bad it was not included,because we found it a bit too pricy. Overall ok experience, but next time would stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “New York Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Holister57
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to the Big Apple in a year. We stayed this time at Park Central on 7th Avenue. I can say it's not the worst of the three hotels I've stayed at in NYC but it wasn't the best. Everything at this hotel is "Extra"....coffee, internet, checking your bag to hold until your departure....I feel for the price it was too expensive for a two night stay. I will look for a better deal next time at a major hotel chain with inclusives.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the big city!”
Reviews.Author: Robinket
Reviews.Content: The lobby seemed to have been recently remodeled, the elevators and hallways on the floors did not. The rooms where decent, we worried about this hotel it was not that bad seeing as we where out in the city the majority of our time but did kinda wish we would stayed at the Hilton, next time we will try another hotel, when your super satisfied you return to the same place, could of been better I guess....

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: rab77
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst places I've stayed. It's filthy, dated and service is scarce. The reception, lifts etc were so dirty that it felt like there was no cleaning service. The room had wallpaper falling off and was in a poor state. At checkout, we complained and all she offered was a $50 refund. I can't understand how they can get away with charging such a premium. Shall never return!

Reviews.Title: “Think again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hummer022
Reviews.Content: Outdated, phones didn't work elevator couldn't get down when we had to leave. Good location but not as luxurious as the pics. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the service?”
Reviews.Author: nyfriend
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay in city after seeing marvelous play and dining at a great New York restaurant. From there everything went downhill when we checked into the Park Centeral on 7th ave., one of the few remaining afforable (??) hotels left in NYC at $320.00 per nite tax included. Elevator system worked like a big video game, plugging in your floor number and getting assigned the correct elevator - kinda efficent but a hassle. Our bathroom sink was obviously not clean, appeared someone just brushed their teeth (the clorex wiped we brought helped). After 11pm the telephone rang several times and no one answered. Tryed to call downstairs but phone went dead. Oh well, to bed, its late anyway. At 2 am awaked feeling like in a sauna. Get up to adjust the heat, nothing works. Call downstairs - phone doesn't work. Used cell phone to call hotel, get an operator, said she would transfer us. The phone rings 20 times, no answer. Back to bed for restless sleep, sweating. Next morning (feeling awful), find hotel bill under door. We at least know somebody works at this hotel, the person that delivers the bill! It's Manhattan, for $300 bucks I suppose we should be grateful we even found a room. Next time, spring for the $700 - $900 per nite hotel or train back to the burbs.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe location offsets water pressure?”
Reviews.Author: flosser
Reviews.Content: The water pressure on the 8th floor was so bad that we could hardly rinse off razors and wash the sink after brushing, the shower was barely servicable. The toilets did flush and the floors were clean but not the walls...scuff marked and splattered on vinyl wall paper.The sheets were clean and the towels were fluffy but only medium sized. The hair dryer was broken but they did send up a temporary one and although it had a very short cord it was very powerful. The air conditioning might have been turned off for the season? We could not get it to function. (It was an unseasonably warm December) We did appreciate the location as we had functions to attend at Lincoln Center, in Times Square and in Rockerfella Center...all places are walkable from this excellent location. Taxis from here are very easy to hail and plentiful. Subway stops are nearby. Staff outside did try to convince us to take a private car for $50 when the taxi cost was less than $20. I have to say he was honest to tell us the difference, AFTER I asked. He was just offering in case my daughter and I wanted to go in style as there was a limo going that way shortly after a stop at another hotel??? Be leary of this "option" We were nearly charged $1.50 per bag to hold the bags since the room was not ready upon our arrival at 2PM The internet access was $14 per day The only coffee we found in large thermoses, in the lobby was $3 ( Starbucks brand) The elevators functioned with a unique system of "assigning" you an elevator by pressing a panel outside in the hall and everyone was getting caught going up or down in confusion. We had a unique room with two small double beds separated by a closet/wall-on one side there was a TV but not on the other. This could be an advantage if you travel with small children and want alittle separation.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Location”
Reviews.Author: KJBMTB
Reviews.Content: Before we booked this hotel we checked with existing reviews and were left with a slight concern as the comments were mixed - you either hated the hotel or loved it! Maybe because we are Europeans and have different standards but we found the hotel very acceptable. The room was a reasonable size and we were on the corner looking down to Times Square. Several reviewers complained about poor responsiveness over problems and rudeness. Well we had problems with the safe and the plug in the bath and both were fixed promptly with total politeness. The location is fantastic - cross the road and you are at Carnegie Hall; turn left and walk for 200 metres and you are in Central Park; turn right and walk 800 metres and you are in Times Square. We would definitely stay here again. Right opposite is a "traditional" diner with small booths and a counter to sit at which was a source of a good breakfast. I hesitate to say cheap as NOTHING is cheap in New York but this was the best value for money we found. Also right opposite is a very good Greek Restaurant called Molyvos and as regular visitors to Greek Islands (and having been to the real Molyvos in Lesvos) we had to eat here one night. It is good. Final tip is to look into a multi attraction ticket such as the New York City Pass. We bought a 3 day one which provided pre paid access to all the main attractions plus loads more. It did not provide us any quicker access through the security queues but did make it cheparer in the long run compared to paying individually. WARNING: We fully expected New York to be very expensive but it was even more than we expected so make sure you have a lot of money available!

Reviews.Title: “the location, the room and the concierge”
Reviews.Author: ferminablauw
Reviews.Content: Not satisfied with the room? We complained and did get a nice big one with perfect beds. Cleaning okay and fresh bedsheets every day. You can take a New York breakfast in the hall, but better is to go out (try the authentic Carnegie Dinner nearby) and eat in the evening in nice restaurants wherever you want. the Concierge desk is absolutely helpfull. Service is efficient and friendly. Don't expect a boutique or design hotel, but for business or tourism this hotel is all you need. Prices can be different each night if you stay for a longer period. No mini bar, but roomservice for breakfast was good. Easy to get everywhere with the bus. Hotel limo to the airport is same price as cab.

Reviews.Title: “Not really 4*”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: An amazing location and a reasonable place to stay, but: - $14 per day for internet access (I know this is common in hotels but still a bit steep - plus starbucks is next door and gives that free to customers) - $3.75 per bag to store it with them when you check out if you have time between flights and check-out - Very inefficient check-in, with a long queue and only one member of staff - Needs refurb - Nothing extra in the room (no water, tea/coffee etc) I'd stay about 10 - 20 blocks south when I go to NYC again - you'll find it a bit more central to everything you are likely to want to see

Reviews.Title: “Seedy”
Reviews.Author: JerIG G
Reviews.Content: Room curtains were filthy. Bathroom AC vent had cust caked on it. Housekeeper never cleaned countertop. Restaurant rated "Grade Pending" which all our NY friends told us means "Don't eat here; we're dirty but we are appealing our rating." The lobby area is clean and well maintained but the floors above need refurbishing badly. The location is good and the staff of the front dest and of the bar are efficient. The room did not have bedbugs.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever !!!”
Reviews.Author: 001KatW
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this hotel. It doesn't give you value for money!! We didn't get the room category we booked (King size bed) so we had to stay in a room with 2 single beds for 2 nights. The bedsheets were dirty and we had hairs in the bed. There is no service at all and the staff is very unfriendly. 2 weeks after we stayed their they charged our creditcard with 90$ without any reason. Please stay away!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware the added extras.”
Reviews.Author: Tina0710
Reviews.Content: Location great for shopping, central park and broadway shows. The room we had was noisy from air conditioning outside the building. Service ok but not great. Beware hard sell for private cars from concierge to airport. There are always plenty of yellow cabs at set rate of $45 one way plus tolls. A lot cheaper than private cars. Our taxi driver confirmed this. Apparently hotel staff get payment for recommending travellers to private car companies.

Reviews.Title: “Great room for the price”
Reviews.Author: kellyl78
Reviews.Content: In between Central Park and Times Square. Easy walk to either. The room was nice, clean (not perfect), bed was comfortable. No view if you are on one side of the hall, you only see other windows. Plenty of space for my stuff. Bathroom was really small but OK. Room service was really good. No in room coffee which was the only real down side for me. The gym had a good variety of machines, cardio equip and free wieghts (up to 50lbs I think) a couple TVs and filtered water. Over all a good choice especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: bradenob
Reviews.Content: Pros: Amazing location. Good service. Good restaurant. Cons Average room. Costs to check bags. Average concierge service. Stayed Wed - Sun of Thanksgiving weekend. Had to pay $3.75 per bag since we arrived before check in (had to pay AGAIN when we checked out - flight was much later in the day). Great diners all around, including Carnegie Deli. Yellow line for subway right on the corner - VERY easy access. 2 blocks from Central park, 2 blocks from 5th ave, 4 blocks from the Times Square area!! Everyone on staff was friendly. Room was only average, but we were given a partial view room on request, for the parade, which would have normally cost more. The restaurant food was great for a quick dinner before a show one nite. The concierges were friendly, but twice I knew more than they, and they were not impressive with one of the few things I really couldn't know much about - restaurants. Also, before I arrived, the rates dropped, and the reservations manager gave me the lower rate, even after the policy time!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: gezginistanbul2011
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights in this hotel at the end of August 2011. There was Hurricane Irene and the hotel was full. The receptonists and the concierge were always ready to help. We were at the 13th floor with an avarage view of central Manhattan. The room was not large enough but the bed was comfortable. This hotel is just 2 blocks to the Central Park and 7 blocks to Times Square. You can find lots of good restaurants around the hotel. I recommend this hotel for travellers because of its centrally location

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Not 4*”
Reviews.Author: BillyElliot1
Reviews.Content: We arrived late 1030pm after a very long tiring journey. 1st impressions were large impersonal hotel. Typical of a major city. Check in was fairly quick, And we went up to our room to drop bags off and go get a bite to eat.... The room was fairly small and a little disappointing. We kept hearing a swooshing noise every 2 seconds. We then realised we were backing on to the 4 lifts! I decided to phone reception to see if we could change. They said yes but not till morning. We decided to put our personal belongings in the safe. Ie money passports etc. It was broke, so I phoned down again and was told they would send somebody up. When he arrived, he immediately told me that this safe was broke, and to phone down to change rooms. I did as he said and was told that there was no king bed but we could have a double. Fine! We gathered up all our bags and 2 large cases. We were then given the key to another room. Soon as we walked in we were hit with a strong smell of urine. The furnishings were very old and tatty. The lampshades had stains on them. I phoned again and was told to get another key. I was not too happy by this stage. Carting bags up and down long corridors and up and down floors was really annoying! Our next room once again had no working safe. The man came up again and told us that it didnt work in that room!!!! I was furious by now and went down to reception. When we got to the desk the receptionist said shall I get you the manager before I had even opened my mouth. He was a very quiet, unapologetic man. He gave us another key and off we set, bags and all! My husband tried the card in the door, it wouldn't open? After 2 or three attempts a women opened the door to ask us what we were doing? We had disturbed them in bed! As you can imagine I was now ready to blow. When we got there we asked to see him. " is there a problem" he said. We told him somebody was already in the room! All he said was " oh somebody must have forgot to book it out" and proceeded to phone the room up and check all her details, leaving us still with out a room! I told him it was not fair that we had originally booked in 1 and a half hours earlier and were still waiting. He never even apologised. Our last room was ok, nothing special maybe a 3 star at a push. Knobs missing off drawers, not particularly clean and a bit dated, but the safe was new! It was now too late to go out so we decided to have a drink and go to bed. First we had to phone and request tea making facilities, as there wasn't any in there. My husband then went to get ice. Every floor had ice making. He went from the 11th to the 2nd to find a machine that worked! It seems that this hotel is very much lacking in maintanence, and customer service. We have stayed all over the world and never come across such couldn't care less attitude. On a good note, the hotel is very well situated and we did only sleep there. The bed was comfortable and with earplugs we slept ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Goose33
Reviews.Content: I will admit that after reading some of the reviews I was nervous about our stay, but after staying at Park Central I am very pleased. My only real complaints are that the front desk staff and concierge are not as friendly or knowledgeable as I would like. The housekeeping staff was very friendly and accommodating. The location is outstanding, especially for the price. So many things are within walking distance and a subway stop is right at the corner. The room was small, as most rooms in NYC are, but was clean and everything was in working order. The hotel lobby was very modern and clean. I have seen so many complaints about the elevators, but I never waited more than 2-3 minutes for one. I expect when the hotel is busy for events and conventions, or during certain times of the day, the wait is frustrating, but I have experienced that at most hotels. Overall, I think we got a good value for our money. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “i hated this hotel so much”
Reviews.Author: NAR42
Reviews.Content: the rooms were not clean, the toilets had mold the staff were not happy to help at all rooms don't have a mini bar or a safety box the carpets n lamp shades had stains on them

Reviews.Title: “One of the cheaper Time Square Hotels for definately budget seekers but very disappointed overall compared to whats on offer in ”
Reviews.Author: ClarenceofKent
Reviews.Content: I stayed Here for 4 nights last week. Location perfect and right next to subway station. The hotel lobby looks big and lush but as soon as you get towards the reception, the trouble starts. Over 40 mins queue to check in!! Rude, abrupt, awful staff. Arrogant management because we are in New York is simply Not acceptable. The room wad small with 2 double beds. The view was particularly nasty with garbage and a terrible smell creeping through the windows. Beds had a sheet and a duvet but no duvet cover.... Good pillows and big TV but the so called air con system was throwing out warm air and is in desperate need of upgrade. The bathroom was awful, tiny size and cheap toiletries. The bath plug was broken and after asking 3 times for a new one, I gave up.the towels are small and the toilet roll worst than s value brand. The food is not good and highly overpriced, go over the road to eat! The Wellington does a mean chicken noodles soup and great service. Late check out here is $100 ARE YOU JOKING??? THERE ARE FAR BETTER HOTELS LIKE Best Western Time Sq....We moved there when we saw it was half the price and twice the service! When we found the BED BUG SCARE WE LEFT. PLEASE SEE PHOTOS

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: TexasLamont
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to Time Square & Central Park! We found the rooms to clean and the service friendly. We stayed during Thanksgiving week so the hotel was busy but this did not impact the service we received. When we checked in there was no line but we did notice long lines at certain times of the day. There are also some great restaurants nearby that are reasonably priced. Great little breakfast cafe directly across the road called "Fluffy's". We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was a good hotel for the price and experience for the Macys parade.”
Reviews.Author: BBlinda
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good over all for the stay during the week of Thanksgiving. The room was small but I guess it was like all the other NY hotels. It was pretty clean, some staff was very nice and others well I guess ok. The hotel is near shops, restaurants and walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Radio City, etc. It was nice and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: tyramjer
Reviews.Content: Great package price with parkin, walking distance to times square, close to metro. Not very clean, cigarette smoke on floors, elevators slow!

Reviews.Title: “NIGHTMARE”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: I would have had better service at a MOTEL 6. I will never book here again

Reviews.Title: “Where is everybody?”
Reviews.Author: Lisasburg
Reviews.Content: Thought this hotel was in a great location. We stayed in a small suite which was perfect for four, and decently sized for the city. The bar was good, too. My only negative observation? I've never stayed I'm a hotel that seemed to have so few people working...rarely saw a doorman or bellman...never saw more than two people at the front desk...saw one maid...never saw security or any other employees. Odd.

Reviews.Title: “Some flaws but still a good value”
Reviews.Author: lormacmom
Reviews.Content: Yes, there were long lines for check-in. We arrived at 11:30 and the hotel checked us in and allowed us to store our bags until 4:00. We were able to by-pass the long 4pm check in line and just picked up our room keys at a totally different desk. Of course, there was a $1.50 per bag fee for the storage, but this did not bother us (even though the sign said a $1.00 per bag fee). And yes, there are an amazingly small number of elevators for the building which results in a long wait for an elevator. When we left at 6:00 for dinner, we waited nearly 15 minutes on the seventh floor for an elevator to arrive. And probably the most annoying thing was the fact that the room cleaner arrived at 7:55 am on a Sunday morning to clean our room (we were checking out at noon!). But the room was very clean and amazingly spacious. We thought it was pretty quiet and the beds were comfortable. I have never stayed in a NYC hotel that had this much space! The location is great - near the Park and the theater district and on the N/R line. And the staff seemed pretty friendly. Angela at the front desk explained how to avoid the line when we returned at 4 and got us a subway map. The folks at the Concierge desk were also friendly and willing to answer questions. All in all, we thought it was a good value. (But seriously, someone should have a serious conversation with the housekeeping staff - 7:55 am on a Sunday morning!!! Really?!!)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, acceptable but could be better”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelertobe
Reviews.Content: Great location, just south of Central Park and close to subway station. The room is good size for NY city. The room is showing its age and housekeeping can do a better job, but all in all not too bad. The bed is too soft for my liking. The heater didn't work so it's a good thing it wasn't too cold when my husband and I stayed. If you can afford a more expensive hotel, you should. Otherwise this is not a bad place to stay if you're not too picky.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously, don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Jason F
Reviews.Content: 1) After a long journey to NYC including fighting our way walking through 7th Ave Mayhem, we got to Park Central at 3pm, apparently they have a strict policy not to let anyone check in until 4! There were a long line at the counter, 4 people at the desk and 1 other staff to "direct the line", but only 2 staff were helping the customers to "check-in". After the staff looked through my documents and everything at the check-in counter, he told us that we got there too early! We had to wait 'till 4 to check in. He also asked if we wanted to check in our bags, and each bag will be charge for $1.50 for each bag, then told us to get back in line to check in another hour. Once we got to the hotel, it had a very nice view and the room size was decent. I went to check out the bathroom and the toiletries. The shower curtain had boogers with blood stain on it. The toiletries were "formulated in Switzerland" and they were really made in China! There was a hotel magazine and found the cover were covered by numerous human boogers looking objects (not one but a LOT).We were NOT happy, esp. after waiting in line for a long time. We wished that someone (e.g. The person that "direct the line") or a SIGN that could have told us earlier! As mentioned, after a long journey getting to the hotel, we just wanted to relax and be settle! 2) after we paid $300s a night, you want us to keep paying all the little things $1.50 to check in each bag and another $14.10 for internet per night?! Even Motel 6 offers freer wifi! We felt that the hotel constantly tried to rip us off with all those extra fees! 3) the staff at the front desk couldn't offer us a map of area, so we could find the restaurant that we are looking for?! Or was the map another $10??? 4) the cleanliness was unacceptable! Would you also like in the hotel room where things are covered by "questionable" objects? 5) again, after paying $300s hotel and foolishly thinking that the hotel was a 4-star hotel, the hotel is that low that it can only offer "made in china" toiletries? I I mean, "REALLY?!"

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Kris H
Reviews.Content: I would advise against staying at this hotel. Our room was worn out, dirty, and dated. The chair in the room was thread bare, the curtains stained and torn, the rug dirty. The public restroom near the bar had a plugged up toilet and smelled terrible. The lobby couches and rugs and floors all need to be cleaned or replaced. What more can I say. Don't bother with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here unless you want to wake up with bug bites”
Reviews.Author: kate b
Reviews.Content: I am so disappointed in this hotel-- it's 4 star rating is a joke. I walked in the room and opened the bathroom door to be hit with a wall of the most offensive odor-- I guess it was strong mildew but it smelled like a homeless men's locker room. Within 5 minutes I had a terrible migraine from the mold/mildew. Immediately I requested another room; rather than meet me at the room with the keys I was told I'd have to go back to the lobby and wait in another line. I finally made it to the next room, which seemed fine, if not what I expected from a 4-star place. As I started to settle in I realized nothing but the TV was plugged in-- I had to go around plugging in nearly every light and the alarm clock. Not a huge deal, but it should have been done and set correctly. I was pretty grossed out by the immense amount of dust on the lampshades, but not as disgusted with that as I was the reddish-rusty colored stains on the desk lampshade. I had to convince myself it was rust, but I do think it was blood (ew). The only window looked out onto the hotel's generator or heating system, so it constantly sounded like a jet engine was revving up under my window. And what passed as curtains (falling down in both rooms, mind you) were sheer white and did not close all the way so all night I had a massive spotlight from across the street shining directly into my face. Needless to say not the best night sleep. I got ready in the morning and went to check out-- the front desk manager approached me and asked how my stay was. I was very honest and said it was not what it should be, I was disappointed, and thought other than the location the place really needed some work. He assured me he would contact me by email/phone later that day and would try to make things right. By about 11 that morning I started itching all over my legs-- badly. I had at least a half dozen red, welt-y, blotchy bug bites!!!!! Immediately I called the hotel, and the "only" manager on duty was less than helpful or remorseful. Of course they'd say they never had a bed bug or any bug problem, but I did not have these bites until I stayed there. According to the manager, I needed to take this up with security and file a claim. Once on with security I was told I had to fill out some paperwork and there would be an investigation. Once they've determined if there is anything in the room I would be notified. I still have not received a refund, and I am not sure they plan to. This hotel is awful, the staff is awful, and you will wake up itchy... the price and the location is not worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “A mediocre experience”
Reviews.Author: ChildDev
Reviews.Content: I recently visited NYC for a two-day business trip and stayed one night at the Courtyard Marriott at 40th and 5th Ave. and the other night at the Park Central. The contrast was startling. While the room was passable and reasonably clean, it was also dilapidated--hole in the shower curtain, for example, and bare bones, without even an alarm clock. A rather drab environment. Also, this hotel will charge you for anything and everything. In contrast to the Courtyard Marriott, where Internet is free, there's a fee at the Park Central. At the Courtyard Marriott, the staff will store your bags as a courtesy until your city departure time. Not so at the Park Central, where you will need to pay a $3.75 fee for the service. I tried to print out a airline boarding passes in the lobby, where there are two machines for that purpose. Neither worked. The staff at reception said I could go to the business center and pay to print out my boarding passes. This service is also free at the Courtyard Marriott. The Park Central does have a good location, but there are many well located hotels in NYC. Next time, I'll select a different one or just return to the Courtyard Marriott. The Park Central met my needs adequately, but for its cost and the extra fees here, there, and everywhere, I was considerably disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: valitabuenosaires
Reviews.Content: We have been twice with my husband, in this hotel. We choose it because of it' s convenient location. No breakfast included.Rates may vary from high to low season. Prepaid rates are convenient. Most double rooms are double bedded. I would suggest to improve room service. Overall, good equation quality/price.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience with the Park Central Hotel NY”
Reviews.Author: Scolnik
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems to be deteriorating quite rapidly. The safe box was locked, we had to wait hours until somebody came and declared everything was fixed. Luckily I tried it before storing our passports and it was impossible to open it again. Finally they told us it was necessary to replace it by a new one, Also the remote control was out of order. We were expecting some goods to be delivered to the hotel. We saw a woman employee kicking packages with very bad manners and without making any efforts to help us. In general service was awful, This was our second time in this hotel and surely was the last.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sandra F
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from our first visit to New York, and a friend recommended this hotel, I was a little surprised by some of the negative remarks, as she has good taste. We arrived and were promptly seen by check-in, no queues! Our room was larger than we expected and clean, if a little dated. Perfect location for Central Park, Times Square, Broadway etc. We checked out easily and found that all staff that we came into contact with were friendly and helpful. Added Bonus was no BED BUGS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not new”
Reviews.Author: natori
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd stay at this hotel and my experience is very consistant. The hotel location is good - within walking distance of the park, times square, and right above the subway station. Breakfast is very good and there is a Starbucks on the same block. Gym is well equiped and good size. The rooms are relatively old but clean. Overall good value and a default choice for me on business trips to the city.

Reviews.Title: “The best cost benefit”
Reviews.Author: Sandra700
Reviews.Content: We’ve stayed in NYC many times and definitely this hotel has the best cost benefit. Great location, near Central Park and several interesting places. The lobby is nicely decorated. The electronic elevators are very efficient. We didn’t have to wait more than a few seconds for an elevator. The room was comfortable and we were surprised with how big it was, considering that we were in NYC. The hotel is surrounded by useful subway lines. We could easily get to many places. Although some staff members were extremely helpful and polite, we found one or two in a bad mood. The internet was expensive and didn't work. I didn’t like that everything was charged in this hotel, but it happens in all NYC. Unfortunately, we had a little problem with the electricity in our room and we had to exchange our room and we were downgraded. The other room was small and dusty. I’ve have stayed in this hotel twice and never stayed in a room like that, so, next time we have to make sure to stay in a good room. Also, we should complain about things that go wrong in order they could get better.

Reviews.Title: “Mistakes Happen - Repeating Or Ignoring Them Is Something Else”
Reviews.Author: longwayaround
Reviews.Content: First of all, if you are considering a trip to NYC don't let this review discourage you. It is an amazing city with great shows, restaurants, shopping, night life and friendly people. Whenever we opened a map on the street a local would stop and ask where we were trying to go. Can't wait to go back. Unfortunately our stay at the Park Central was very disappointing. When our flights were changed we ended up arriving a day later than expected. I contacted the hotel via email through their website and advised them of our delay. Since the room was prepaid for the entire stay I inquired at check-in if the unused night would be refunded. At minimum I asked if a credit for this amount could be applied to the room during our stay. We were flat out refused any type of assistance by the agent at check-in. Further our check-in was delayed when the agent said they didn't show a reservation for us. Eventually the agent was able to locate our reservation and we proceeded to our room. Before leaving the front desk the agent said the hotel manager would be calling us to discuss our concerns at check-in. For the record, we did not receive a call from any manager or any staff at all during our entire stay. Our disappointment continued upon arriving to our room to find we had a lower floor room, with no view, right at the elevator. From the website it sounds as though this hotel offers beautiful views and quiet rooms. This was not the case for us as we heard street noise, elevator traffic and a view of the building across the street. This hotel advertises refridgerators available for your room. Upon arriving at our room we realized there was no fridge and called the front desk to request one. We were told one would be sent up. After returning to the room a few hours later after purchasing some snacks for the room we realized there was no fridge for the room. I called the front desk, again, and inquired when it might be delivered. I was told there were no fridges and would I like to be on a wait list? I said yes and asked if my previous request hours earlier constituted the same 'wait list' request? For the record, no fridge was delivered during our entire week long stay. I should add that each of these calls to the front desk was an annoyance as none of the buttons on the phone worked. For example, pressing 'front desk', 'concierge' etc or any of the speed dial buttons did nothing. Whenever you wanted to make a call you had to dial the operator and ask to be redirected to the appropriate department. Oh yeah, even better there was a 'lock' on our phone. Even though we had put down a credit card at check-in there was a restriction to placing out going calls from our room. We couldn't even use a calling card. I'd like to say this was the extent of the problems we experienced but it gets worse. The safe in our room was broken. There is no info in the room to tell the guests this. The check-in staff aren't telling the guests this. And why are broken safes left in the room anyways? By broken, I mean that the safe appears to be working. Only after trying to retrieve your valuables from the safe do you realize this can't be done. You need to call the operator, ask to be transferred to hotel security and ask them to come and open the safe for you. Too bad we wasted time like this in our hotel while visiting one of the greatest cities in the world. You should also be aware that there is a time-share style kiosk near the elevators. It is very annoying to be hit up by these staff every time you want to go up to your room. If you tell someone clearly the first time you are not interested in their pitch do not continue to harass the guests every time they go past. The final nail in the coffin was the day before check-out we had to go down to the front desk to have the lock removed from our phone as we needed to place some calls. We were asked by the agent at the front desk how we were enjoying our stay? I said, honestly, that we loved NYC but were disappointed in the hotel and we look elsewhere next time. We were then offered breakfast the next morning and internet in our room for our troubles. Really? All of our troubles, inconveniences and wasted time was worth some bacon and eggs and an internet connection? When you spend over $2300 on your hotel stay I consider this cheap and insulting. For the record, we were still billed for the breakfast and internet at check-out. Although I went up to the front desk to have them remove these charges they still appeared on this month's credit card statement. I sent a letter to the Park Central on October 25, 2011 documenting all of these issues and requesting a refund or renumeration of some type. As of today November 12, 2011 there has been no reply. I will update my review shortly to let others know what the Park Central did to remedy this unfortunate stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not what was offered,worn & old”
Reviews.Author: curlygirlNewYork
Reviews.Content: At the time of booking online, I was offered an upgrade to a king suite if available when checking in. I asked about it when I checked in and the woman at the desk "didn't know anything about it". Since there were 3 adults, I then asked for a room with 2 double beds and a rollaway. She gave us the keys and said the room was ready. When we went upstairs, the room was unmade, dirty towels on the floor, etc. We went back downstairs, waited on line again and was given a new room # and told to "try this one". The room was very small, worn carpet, stains on the wall, hangers for pictures but no pictures. When we came back to the room at 9:00 pm there was no rollaway. We called downstairs and the man who brought up the rollaway said this room was "too small for a rollaway". We had to squeeze it into the hallway and couldn't open the outside door without folding the bed. The room was stuffy, we had to open the window and the smell of the restaurant across the street was with us until midnight. Big disappointment! I've stayed her before and I have to say this hotel needs a complete renovation. Won't stay her again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place!”
Reviews.Author: Davidadamso
Reviews.Content: Just awfull No atmosphere unless you count bus terminals Terrible service super slow check in Super slow check out! No mini bar in room and overpriced room service Bizarre elevators Oh good location

Reviews.Title: “In Need of a Good Cleaning”
Reviews.Author: DC-ite
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Central for 2 nights. Admittedly the price was good for its location, but I'd rather pay more for a cleaner and friendlier hotel. The front desk person who checked us in didn't crack a smile once and--unluckily--I had the same guy on the checkout. The room (which I thought was reasonably large) was a bit depressing and very stuffy. I was able to open the window, however (an unexpected bonus), but in doing so I discovered that the restaurant seemed to vent into the area my room overlooked so the room switched from being stuffy to smelling of frying oil or some such. And, of course, one couldn't sleep with the window open because of the street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, however....”
Reviews.Author: Whirlwind2
Reviews.Content: The Park Central could not have a better location: 7th Ave at 56th, across the street from Carnegie Hall, half a block from Broadway, a short stroll to Times Square, and subway entrance at the back door. However, it is large and our visit coincided with Marathon weekend. The rate for Saturday night was more than doubled. We were constantly barraged by "officials" in the hotel trying to sell the "Manhattan Club" while there were only 2 people at the reception desk; the lines were always long for check in. The rooms are showing some age and use with nicks and scratches; the carpets either need extensive cleaning or replacing, We paid a premium for a "Pure Room," so that we could "breathe easy in our state-of-the-art rooms enhanced with the latest hypoallergenic technology and amenities." Our friends with a regular room had exactly the same fixtures. When I inquired (after again waiting in the long reception line), I was told that we should have an air purifier; what we had was an old rusty radiator. On the third day the air purifier was installed. and the old rusty, dusty radiator remained--Pure room, indeed! Another problem was the HVAC. The heating/cooling unit blew warm air only despite its setting. For November, it was very warm, and the only way we could be comfortable in the evening was to keep the window open--in Midtown Manhattan. Ah, yes, the noise. So while this hotel makes no pretense at being anything above a 3-star, I would have expected at least what was promised and paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central New York 2011”
Reviews.Author: jayned66
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Park Central October 2011 to November 2011 for 6 nights, the hotel is in a great location very near to Central Park, Times Square and next to a Subway to get around Manhattan really easily, you can get the 7 day Metro pass which works out really good value at $29 and can also be used to get right up to the connection for JFK Airport. The rooms are clean and comfortable but the inhouse movies don't have a price by restaurants for breakfast and a starbucks if you want to take a coffee to your room as the room does not have facilities to make your own drink which was the only disappointing thing about the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: GMN
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend & I spent the weekend at Park Central for her birthday. The hotel was busy as it was the marathon weekend. Staff were very good and tried hard to get us a room with a view which they managed to do on our second night. The location is excellent with easy access to all of Manhattan and a constant stream of cab's outside. The only reservations I have about the hotel is that the rooms feel a little tired and are no more special than any standard business hotel I have stayed in in the past which is a shame considering how good the experience could be with just a little more effort on that front. If your looking for something a little bit different for a special occasion you may be better off elsewhere, if you just want a good reliable standard hotel in a good location it's prefect.

Reviews.Title: “Heat and no A/C”
Reviews.Author: jacquelineMNj
Reviews.Content: Overall the room was very small. It was clean enough, but could use an upgrade. The bathroom was tiny, hardly enough room to move, you had to squeeze to close the door to get to the tub and the lighting througout the room was so low that you could not see enough. Forget about getting sunlight, the room faced into a enclosed "well" between buildings. The room was extreamly hot and we called the front desk and was informed that the A/c was turned off for the season, and the room had heat coming out of the vent without it even being on. The front desk said there was nothing they could do about it and to open a window, which by the way only opens 6 inches, into the "well" with no breeze at all. They provided us with a fan, which we managed to put into the widow after pulling it down and out like you would to clean it, there were no screens and all night I was afraid a pidgen would fly in. Overall the worst hotel experience in the city and for the price it should have been nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: Diego1
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in plenty of large hotels and this one is great. Excellent rooms. Perfect location and a rapid, smooth checkin process. I think the front desk agent's name is Jet - very nice and helpful. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: charl0tte1975_
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Park Central on a business trip to New York with my partner and we were treated like second class citizens by the rude and unfriendly staff throughout our stay and were the victim of either pranks or gross mismanagement. The first night they claimed our business had not paid for the room and demanded they hold the cost of the whole stay on our credit card or debit card. In fact, they had all the details of the room as it was paid online. The way they spoke to us about this matter was very unpleasant. The room itself was small, uncosy with a huge ugly empty fridge, small bath and no electronic key system. On our second day after coming back from a day of sight-seeing, we came back to the room to find a pair of someone elses underwear sitting on our TV cabinet. Seriously. We called the staff immediately and NOBODY showed up to remove them! We had to call 3 times for anyone to pay any attention to us and when the duty manager did turn up nearly half an hour later, she had no idea about the cause of the call. I was utterly disgusted. After that debacle it turned out that on the day of leaving, 4 pairs of keys were missing from our luggage. We again registered a complaint with the hotel but they could not care less and have not followed up with us on this since we have left - ignoring phone calls and emails. Take this as a warning shot - if you want a pleasant experience without getting vexed by staff incompetence, do not spend your money on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: rd_hegde
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good one if you are on a business trip (and your work place is in mid town Manhattan) or if you are on a holiday and plan to spend most of the day sightseeing. The rooms are small, but clean. The service is strictly okay-not great. What it has going for it is its great location. If you want to do sightseeing, Rockefeller, Central Park and other mid town attractions are a walk away.

Reviews.Title: “For the cost, a very good option in NYC”
Reviews.Author: DaOrange
Reviews.Content: I travel to NY on business about once a month and mostly always end up at the Park Central. It seems to strike the correct balance between cost and quality. We have to be realistic in that all NY hotels tend to have rooms on the small side, but the rooms are always clean and while you won't think "wow" when you get into your room, you shouldn't be disappointed in any way either. The location of the hotel really couldn't be better - halfway between the park and times square and directly above a yellow subway line station and you can get anywhere in minutes. One lady on the front desk called Ellen was particularly helpful on checkin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with A Better Location”
Reviews.Author: AVogt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here back in 2008. The hotel then was great. We had an awesome location, the rooms was very nice and the bedding was to die for. The hotel gave us a complimentary upgraded room. Next time I got to New York I will definitely stay here again. We booked well in advance and for the location I think we got a great deal. We paid about 900 for the week.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in NYC”
Reviews.Author: mollerCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: This is a large and very busy hotel on 7th AV. The hotel is quite old, but reception area is updated and kind of funky. Front desk very effective when checking inn (and at checkout). Rooms are adequate, a little worn but ok size and standard (no mini-bar though). Beds are actually quite good. They are not very spacious however, but mattresses and pillows are fine. Cleaning wasn’t the most impressive we have seen, ie old price-tags on the floor wasn’t removed the entire stay. Other than that bathroom was perfectly cleaned every day, so really not a big issue, just silly not to remove an obvious visible piece of rubbish. There is a restaurant at the hotel (didn’t try it though so no comments on that) and breakfast to go in the lobby which worked out fine. However there are many restaurants just outside the entrance, so no problem getting breakfast, lunch etc. At first we thought this hotel was rather pricy, but staying in NYC it’s probably very reasonable priced given the location and standard. The location is as mentioned perfect – you can walk to Times Square, Central Park, Moma and 5th AV. Also the subway is just next door. I noticed many have mentioned that handling elevators were very confusing, but you will quickly see through the system. When checking out you will have to pay to have your luggage stored, event if it’s just for a short time – this is not acceptable when you’ve just stayed at the hotel for 10 days and probably the only really letdown we experienced at this hotel. We will definitely like to stay here again if coming back to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFool33330
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location. Across the street from Carnegie Hall and an easy walk to Central Park, multiple museums, shopping on 5th avenue, Rockfeller and the theater district. The hotel is an older hotel in need of a renovation. The room was clean and on the larger size for New York City. Late at night there was hotel staff stationed on the floor which made one feel safe.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious & Spacious”
Reviews.Author: JaylaStarr
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here once before on business. I remember not being too pleased. I had to wait til like 5-6 to check in... then the room was messed up in some way so they ended up upgrading me. This time the room was perfect. I choose the hotel because of the great rates but was a little unsure because of the way the first stay went. My fears were thankfully unwarranted. The room was very spaces. I was in town to hang out with friends so the big double bed room seemed huge given the usual tiny rooms you find in NYC. The location is ideal if you wanna be close to times square but not right in the middle of all the hassle and bustle. Oh I can't forget to mention one thing that bothered me... I know its not the hotels fault... But when I used the shower for like a second or two the water came out some weird rusty color and eww it freaked me out. It happened twice. I wanna assume its because it has old pipes or something I dunno.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and old, hotel needs to be refurbished”
Reviews.Author: Seven64
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Room curtains were ripped and dirty. Cushion bed sheets had stains. Bathroom floor was dirty. The fitness center had outdated equipment. Hotel needs to be shut down and refurbished. The decoration is extremely dark. One positive, location is excellent, close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Staying on a short vacation enroute to Europe”
Reviews.Author: holeinonesummit
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this centrally located hotel very close to central park and carnegie Theatre it was wonderful for walking around Times Square and the Theastre district also taking subway to downtown Manhattan.Many of the airline crew were staying there so that says something of the quality.We were out from very early in the morning to very late at night so we just wanted somewhere safe and clean to park our heads during the night.Staff were very helpful and they had limousine serbvice to JFK and Newark airports.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location; Nice Room; Fantastic Price!”
Reviews.Author: flightgirl78
Reviews.Content: Perfect, central location. The room was really nice - it looked like it was recently remodeled. The price was also very reasonable compared to other hotels that we priced. Only downside was the weird computerized elevators. Something broke on one of the days that we were there and ended up taking the freight elevators with some helpful cleaning staff. The problem appeared to have been corrected within a few hours. Also - it's only a block from Carnegie Deli. The cheesecake!!!!!! Delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Inefficient and unresponsive.”
Reviews.Author: kiltheduck
Reviews.Content: First I'll say that I booked 2 nights through priceline. That might not qualify me as an important guest, but when my wife and I got into NYC late at night we went the the front desk and were told by a friendly person that they didn't have a room that would be available for both nights and, by the way, they didn't have a king bed room, which we had paid for. It's like she was trying to use "the force" on me by saying it so nicely and matter-of-fact-ly. I said "No, I reserved and paid for a king bed and that's what I expect to get." So they magically found us a king room for that night. But the next morning we had to pack our bags back up and take them downstairs and check them into storage. We went out and wandered NYC for the day. When we got back that evening, we were sent to a room for the night. We got our bags and headed to our room only to find that it had not been cleaned since the last occupant. So we headed right back down to the front. They were apologetic and sent us to a different room - this one clean and ready for us. All we were offered was free "wi-fi" for the evening (thanks, but my 3G tower connection works just fine). I think that when I book a room for 2 nights, I reasonably expect that I will have the same room both nights and won't have to repack my bags. I think the most appropriate response would have been an upgrade to a room that was available both nights. Now, having said that, the location is quite good. The staff was nice and friendly, if inefficient. The room (when clean) was fine and the bed was comfortable. The steakhouse in the lobby was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location for NYC activities!!!”
Reviews.Author: janelarry
Reviews.Content: The location of Park Certral is perfect as it is so close to numerous activities and attractions. It is an older hotel, but it was comfortable and we really had no complaints. On our last day there, a guest had reported bed bugs, but I had no personal encounters with this little pest. Because of its central location to NYC attractions, good restaurants within walking distance, and close proximity to the subway, I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Couples! Spend the extra $50 a night for the TS Room”
Reviews.Author: krzastrm
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with our overall stay at this hotel. Although our first impression was poor (the room that we checked into smelled like smoke, although they did check us in 5 hours early), they were quick to rectify our issue by upgrading us to a Time Square View room! Obviously we were pretty psyched about this upgrade, which changed us from a generic/small older room with no view, to a larger newly renovated room with a perfect view of Time Square! Although I normally do not stress about room views as you shouldn't spend enough time in you room for this to make a difference, but there was something special about being able to look out over the sites. I would recommed upgrading your booking to one of these rooms, they are newer, larger, and the veiw really is excellent; even with the $50 a night difference, I would have been disappointed with our original room. Front staff was great, and they held our bags for us when we checked in very early (for free since our first room was smokey), as well as when we left. We will be returning this November for another stay; Times Square view of course!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but awful service and cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: COSYKOZO
Reviews.Content: We stay there because it was very well located, but they charge for everything, and the worst was the day the maid came to our room and left all the garbage from the WC into my shopping bag!!!! I reported that situation to the customer service and they did nothing! Not even an apology.

Reviews.Title: “An old hotel”
Reviews.Author: caposotto
Reviews.Content: Too bad this hotel, which is close to Central Park, is taken care of better. The toilet didn't work, it had holes in the carpet, and more. The elevators were slow or didn't work. The best was the waiter who insisted on charging me for my free breakfast. I will not be staying here again at any price

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is...clean and safe.”
Reviews.Author: Adjo1
Reviews.Content: Park Central sits between Times Square and Central Park. If you are visiting NYC on a budget, this is a solid option. It was pretty clean and safe. This is a touristy area, so you are close to shopping and broadway shows. The lobby is hipper (paint, lighting and clever art) than the rooms.The rooms are small and there is traffic noise-so prepare yourself. We paid around $380.00 per night for a double.This is a no frills option-there is no turn down, warm cookies, coffee or mini fridge. Any requests we had we handled quickly (extra towels, TV not working on arrival). The staff was friendly and helpful. There is a lobby with a bar and restaurant. We tried and liked both just fine. I still struggle with the price of hotel rooms in NYC. If you find yourself doing the same, well, just get over it-its NYC! About the area...walk outside and go right to Times Square. There are a remarkable number of police officers and cars. I felt pretty safe all of the times we were there. It is super crowded,but if you should see it at least once. There are lots of places to eats and shop. I am not sure that there aren't better restaurants elsewhere in NY. Lots of chains. If you are looking for unique, they is plenty of that elsewhere. Beware the pedicabs....they are crazy expensive. To the left is Central Park. This is world class people watching. With a comfy chair and some food, I could hang here for hours. The weather was beautiful, so the park was packed. You see every variety of person, hear languages from around the world. We even saw a guy smoke pot in front of everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Why Bother? A little dissapointed....”
Reviews.Author: klocco1
Reviews.Content: Why Bother? A little disappointed. I want to first say that this hotel was one I found checking through Expedia.com on a last minute basis to stay Thursday 10/6-10/8 and it was available with a AAA discount. Average night cost was $260.00. The hotel was nicely located south of Central Park (3 blocks) on 7th Ave., and 55-56th Street. Short walk and you are in the park! There is a Starbucks with FREE wifi right next door on 7th & 55th street. FREE!!!! Remember that! The outside was nice, had nice signage to let you know where you are, huge lobby, lots of seating areas. The lobby was huge, was a little impersonal but a great place to meet if you were traveling with a big party. Different elevators served different floors; however, the guests did not seem to grasp this concept. You had to push the floor you wanted and it would indicate what elevator would be yours and it would ONLY go to the floor you pushed. Seriously, people had a hard time understanding this. We had many people get on the elevator and start getting upset that it wouldn't stop at their floor. The elevators were not working when we were there and people were trapped in one of them. We had to go up and down the stairs, and it was good we were only on the 8th floor. What I liked: Room was large and comfortable Bed was comfortable Steps from Central Park Starbucks next door had free wifi (hotel charged you $14.10 each day) Nice area (you could see the lights of Times Square down 7th Avenue but didn’t hear the noise) Quiet hotel Convenient to Yellow line N Q R train, and on 8th Avenue, 1 2 & 3 Red Train What I didn’t like: Elevators hot, small and not working Bad service checking in (ignored us waiting in line) called for pillows, never answered Phone in Room 842 when we pushed room service button, gave us the restaurant (we made sure we were pushing the right button)! Small bathroom with no exhaust fan -- it got hot in there! Tub and bathroom looked like it needed cleaned Closet missing safe, holes in the wall and mix matched carpet Stairways smelled (and we had to use the stairways) Wifi is $14.10 each day Cleaning carts always parked in the hallway, one always outside of our room All this said, I don’t think I would stay here again. Too many other hotels that provide you with a more “welcome” to our hotel attitude, instead of a “why are you here?” attitude.

Reviews.Title: “bad service”
Reviews.Author: gldts
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed with the service of the hotel, they had a parcel delivered for me and they lost it and was never recovered, the item cost me over $360 and they did not make any effort to recover or reimburse me for my loss. I am very upset and the manager did not even get involved.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to visit NYC”
Reviews.Author: 928Traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall, I was very satisfied with my stay. Unless you're trying to be near a specific location (such as Grand Central), there really aren't many better locations to stay if you're visiting NYC as a tourist. While obviously an older property, management has done their part to keep it updated and have renovated the hotel to compete with newer/more modern hotels. The lobby in particular is quite modern. All areas I noticed were very clean and inviting. They have a great computerized "Smart" elevator system that minimizes wait times. The room, while small (typical for NYC), was quite comfortable and functional. They have complimentary coffee makers and refrigerators upon request, but I don't see why they don't just include this in every room (particularly the coffee maker). One annoyance was the high fee to use the hotel's internet. I realize upscale hotels use this as another source of revenue, but in this day and age, it's absurd for this to not be included.All-in-all, it's a great value, in a good location, and has accommodating service. I wouldn't rate it as 4-stars, but it's a solid 3.5.

Reviews.Title: “Love it Love it Love it”
Reviews.Author: justm3x
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have stayed here 3 times now and its a lovely hotel, friendly staff and so central to everything. Love the fact that when I can't sleep it feels safe enough that I can get up and go for a walk at 3am and get myself a coffee in one of the local shops. I would recently recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “BED Bugs! stay away!”
Reviews.Author: d v
Reviews.Content: Stayed at PC for 2 weeks on a business .. wifi- $17 dollars a day, no service for cell phone in room, walked out of hotel one morning to see a blow up mouse saying that hotel was infested with bed bugs, the management did not send out a memo to reassure or let customers know about what was going on with the situation..i checked out immediately. previously before checkout when switching rooms due to reception service, management wouldn't send bellman to help with luggageS due to people checking in and out was first priority..Do not waste your money on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary courtesy, great location, adequate facilities”
Reviews.Author: GigiMinneapolis_MN
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by our stay at the Park Central, especially after reading some recent Trip Advisor reviews of the hotel. Most noteworthy was the unfailing courtesy and helpfulness of all staff with whom we interacted -- front desk, concierge, doorman, managers and restaurant and bar personnel. The concierge was especially helpful when the baseball game that brought us to the city was rained out and we needed last-minute dinner plans for 10. The lobby is very modern, large and comfortable and was a good gathering spot for our group. Our room was large by New York standards and clean if somewhat worn. Beds were comfortable, linens were crisp and towels were soft. Our air conditioner seemed a little underpowered. The street noise was considerable in our fourth floor room, but we enjoyed our streetscape view, and previous trips to New York have conditioned us to expect sirens and horn honking. The location is hard to beat -- just a few blocks to Central Park, Lincoln Center, MoMA, the shops of Fifth Avenue and much more. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great staff, rooms need upgrade”
Reviews.Author: clams5
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, nice lobby, helpful desk and concierge staff. Room service was good, on time, and delivered professionally. But boy, these rooms are getting tired and need an upgrade. Desk phone was broken in more than one way - stuck on pulse dial, for example. No desk light. Laptop power required crawling under the desk to reach the wall socket. Lights in bathroom had an electrical buzz that was really annoying. Shower curtain was a little scary. Air conditioning system was ancient and loud. Bed stood out as comfortable and relatively new, and the other furniture was okay.

Reviews.Title: “I was not impressed...”
Reviews.Author: phizbin
Reviews.Content: This is my first negative review - and it is mild. The room was clean, but the shower faucet leaked so bad it woke me up a few times. The elevator placement is odd - there were elevators right next to my room, but we had to walk in a big "U" shape to get to the ones that were operational. I found the staff to be a bit cold - not the "golly we're glad you're here" that this midwesterner expects... The plus side is that the decor is modern - the price is fair, and the location is excellent...

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay...”
Reviews.Author: Dejan317
Reviews.Content: We choice this hotel on advise from our friend which stayed in this hotel one year before. The location of the hotel is great. You have everything in reach. The rooms are ok, they were clean and we had everything we need. Only thing I missed was free Internet. I hate when I need to pay for it. If you dont want to spend to much for a hotel this hotel is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, modern with some old world touches, great location”
Reviews.Author: jcsfla
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 3 times and loved it each time. The rooms are classic NYC (read:small), but the location and feel of the hotel are great. If you need to catch the subway, there are multiple lines within 1000 feet of the hotel. This is my preferred hotel when I go to NYC because the price is usually reasonable and the location couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Bad as People Say”
Reviews.Author: NC2NYC
Reviews.Content: I used to commute to NY for work once a month, so I've stayed pretty much everywhere. I traveled the week of 9/11/11 though, and with room rates upwards of $600 a night, I tried Priceline and was able to book this hotel at about a third of that. Since I did the name your own price, I didn't have a choice in this hotel, and after I read the reviews, I really started to get worried. NY has had an epidemic of bed bugs in the last year, and any hotel that says they haven't had any is probably lying. But still, there were so many reports at this hotel I began to get worried. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. I took all the standard precautions in room 944, stripped the bed (the mattresses are now encased in a zipper, which is standard practice for preventing the spread of bedbugs) and I pulled the headboard off the wall, turned over the upholstered chair, etc and didn't see any signs of them. Other than a lot of dust (the room could use a spring cleaning), I didn't see anything bad. I took precautions by keeping my clothes and stuff off the floor, and I didn't bring anything home either. The room was fairly comfortable, and it was definitely quiet. The air conditioner worked fine. The elevator system is a little weird, but you get used to it quickly. This hotel could improve quite a bit by taking some small steps: recarpet the hallways, don't store the maid carts in the hallways, don't charge for internet access (really this is stupid that any hotel charges anymore), add a small coffee maker to the rooms, and don't charge $3.75 per bag for luggage (again, just unnecessary). The lines at checkout were long, but because my room was pre-paid through Priceline, I had no problems at all. Fixing the kiosk in the lobby would be a great help in cutting down the line. The location was excellent; right near many good restaurants, and right on top of the NQR subway line (which is a major artery to Times Square, Herald Square, and pretty much anywhere you want to go in NYC). So... definitely not 3.5 star, more like 1.5 or 2, but a decent stay if you can get it at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “good location, clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: triplovee
Reviews.Content: we stay here almost every time we go to NYC, about twice a year. It's a wonderful location, easy access to just about anywhere on the island. It's a very quiet hotel (we've had trouble with loud neighbors at other NY hotels) and the beds are comfortable. There's nothing very fancy about this hotel, it's just clean and comfortable. Usually the best rates in town.

Reviews.Title: “Moldy shower curtains, non working equipment”
Reviews.Author: cindy k
Reviews.Content: When you first enter the Park Central, your hopes of a beautiful room kick in. The Lobby is unique with all the black, white and gray. Very comfortable seating areas are velor covered and comfortable. Then reality sets in. There always seemed to be a long line to check in or out. I will say it seems the hotel did try to alleviate it by having multiple people working on said line but it was slow moving. Our group arrived at about 3:30pm and many of the rooms were not ready for occupancy. When we finally got the keys, we were greatly disappointed. What is purported to be renovated rooms obviously did not reach our floor. The carpet was worn in the hallways, shower curtain was moldy, air conditioner did not keep the room cool, there were 2 phones in the room and neither of them could be counted on to work and the alarm clock was broken. We had to go out into the hall to call the desk. Oh yes, internet was $14.10 per day so many people went down to the lobby because a local coffee shop's wifi signal was strong enough to use there. No matter what time of the day it was there was always someone utilizing this. The restaurant and bar in the lobby were both very nice with a delicious sounding menu but expensive even for New York. Needless to say, we did not frequent either one because of the prices. I will say this, the staff was nice and tried to accommodate the client as much as possible but I believe that most of the problems are out of their control.

Reviews.Title: “Urgent Maintenance Required”
Reviews.Author: muscledtraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel could not have asked for a better location. Hop skip and jump from Central Park South entrance The fashion boutiques etc...It is a huge with probably 60+ rooms on each floor or side of the wing in a tall building. There is a queue for everything. Check in, check out, elevators etc...The lobby is full of people either waiting for an early check in or waiting to kill time to go to the airport. When you go up to the floors you realize that this hotel must have had its last renovation in the eighties. Everything looks dated the carpets, fixtures, furniture etc... The only thing going for it is the size. Difficult to find this size of a guest room in Manhattan unless you are a Grand Hyatt somewhere. But it feels bare. The bathroom had no hand towels just 4 bath towels kept. Very sub standard toiletries and bad lighting. The air conditioner seemed like it was installed when the hotel was made with a broken controls panel and a burning smell that erupted when used for prolonged period of time. It is cheaper compared to other hotels in the vicinity but there are solid grounds why they should not be charging a premium.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a little TLC, but a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Reddon14
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week, and was a little worried after reading the reviews. I have to say, I had no issues with check in/check out, and in fact, the front desk staff was more than accommodating. They allowed us to check in at 0800 after driving thru the night from Detroit when our flight got canceled due to the hurricane. Overall, the hotel is decent, and the location is great. The hallways and rooms are starting to show their age and are in need of some TLC before too long. Definitely not a 4 star hotel, but a good 3 star for sure. I can't comment on the on site restaurant as we never ate there. Way to much to choose from around the area. Would I go back?? Perhaps. But I'm guessing there is better bang for your buck in the area.

Reviews.Title: “horrible service”
Reviews.Author: 7wonderstraveler
Reviews.Content: The room smelled as if someone left damp clothes locked in the room for weeks. I could not handle the smell and asked to be moved. I could only talk to one person at the desk because the others were useless. They charged the credit card when we canceled the 3rd night due to Hurricane Irene. The location was great and I hope to never go to NYC again. I have traveled all over the world and love something about every place I go, however, I don't feel that way about NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great option in midtown”
Reviews.Author: Sergio_SM
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed at Park Central hotel for 8 nights when in NYC. The hotel has been renovated and our room was very nice (good size for midtown's standards).
