The location is excelent. Very close to Broadway theaters, the Central Park, the Carnegie Hall, nice restaurants and subway stations. Also, very quiet and clean room, with excelent beds. The main drawback was the front desk service, which was a bit rude. All in all, it has a very good value for money, specially when staying more than 5 nights - we had a discounted price for that.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location at a reasonable price (for NYC)”
Reviews.Author: CSS2009
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious and comfortable, but the real treat was the staff. The bell hop who helped us with our bags was a wonderful ambassador, and the concierge was very helpful in suggesting restaurants to meet our needs. The location-- close to Columbus Circle, and a few short blocks for Central Park-- was ideal. The only negative was a rather long wait to check in at mid day on a Tuesday. Otherwise we were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: finlandese49
Reviews.Content: A little confusing information of this hotel before the trip. We spent few days there in March, me, my wife and our adult daughter. We took the hotel due to excellent location near the Times square and theaters, Central park and MOMA. Excellent spot, we could easile reach all these walking. The room for us three was spacious, a little worn out, but clean. The bathrom was big but oldfashioned as often in States.The cleaners came sometimes late afternoon, when You possibly wanted some rest befor going to theater. There was almost consistently elevator jam because of too many rooms anf floors and to few lifts. The WIFI in the room was only at extra cost, however, it was freee, if yo took the machine to lobby near the meeting rooms... The personnel were friendly, at least in the breakfast restaurant. Breakfast buffet was great with everything you need, a littel busy atmosphere, but nice views to a busy street, you couls feel the hasty ambiance of the big city . We could even make the reservation in a reasonable price with the breakfast included. All in all, more positive than negative : Great location and good breakfast, but waiting at the lifts. No sign of red bugs or other wcket things

Reviews.Title: “we loved this hotel...the location was great...a couple of blocks from central park and a 10min walk to time square..”
Reviews.Author: pvdmore
Reviews.Content: this hotel was a pre-cruise stay(Hol-America cruise)..perfect choice...about 3/4 mile to the ship dock and the taxi charge was only 3.50usd. excellent location..would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings....”
Reviews.Author: J9hodson
Reviews.Content: Great location, cannot be faulted. Staff could be abrupt when busy and stressed. Yes to big queues at reception- all the time! Alcoholic drinks in the hotel were very expensive and it's a shame because the bar area and restaurant were lovely and we would have spent more time and money there had it been reasonable. The rooms- our 1st room (437) was dreadful, more like a hobbit hole- no daylight, air con was pathetic, window wouldn't open, smelly and dingy- we did make reception aware on day 2 by using a comment card but nothing was done, by day 4 we could stand it no longer and asked for a new room, the hotel obliged immediately and we relocated to room 1720- same size but had a window that opened, air con and daylight. The room was a squeeze for 4 adults but we didn't spend much time there so not a big issue, the shower was good, mouldy bathroom ceiling and sometimes the maid cleaned and sometimes she didn't bother! Bed bugs are are problem in some rooms, but we were OK. Breakfast was great but go early as they don't tend to restock- $31 for an eat all you can- quite pricey compared with deli over the road! Highly recommend Fluffys bakery and coffee shop next door for cheaper prices. Grayline bus tour was excellent and definately hire bikes to tour Central Park. Would go back to NYC, not this hotel but one in this location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MrsRobbo75
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights. The rooms are standard size for New York..a king sized bed, wardrobe, desk and en-suite. The shower is amazing, very powerful. Hairdryer is good although it would take a while to use if you have long hair. Toiletries supplied were not the best quality so take your own. The room was clean and there was a daily housekeeping service. The hotel is located a couple of blocks from Times Square and Central Park. Very well situated to use as a base for sightseeing and shopping. I would recommend taking the Grayline bus trips early on your holiday as a good way of seeing the city. The nearest bus stop is located one block down from the hotel. This was my first visit to New York and I am already planning the next, and would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel. Great loacation”
Reviews.Author: thelizard1061
Reviews.Content: Been to NY for a sports holiday and there were around 250 of us as a group. As British people abroad expect a breakfast (not usual in the US I know!) we got one, which was good and varied. Drinks were expensive though in the bar. Wi-fi was too. Rooms didn't have tea/coffee making facilites which I thought was unusual. Staff were ok, seemed to be quite helpful but I know some of the party would have different views on this, The queues at reception were at times very long, but that's normal for a big place like this. It was about 15 minutes walk to Time Square and Broadway, so really handy for the touristy stuff. Smack opposite Carnegie Hall too. We were there when Hurricane Irene made her appearnace, resulting in the streets being deserted for a while which was kind of strange for 'the city that never sleeps.' It did, for sure. Overall its not a bad place to stay, clean enough, comfortable and just, well, normal. Not somewhere you would say, 'wow, its brilliant here' and not a place you'd say, never again.' As average a place as I think you'd get; that said I would come back for sure.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: EmilyNYC_5
Reviews.Content: Started off the stay not in a good way when they gave us a stinky room, smelled like an ashtray. When we went to the lobby to ask to change a room they told us to wait in the room and wait for the manager. We waited and waited and called and were told they the manager was on the way. after waiting longer than expected and no one showing up, we went to the lobby again and they just switched the rooms right away without giving us a good explanation of why we had to wait and no one showed up. Upon checking into the new room, there were no shampoos, etc.....asked the hotel maid and instead of bringing it for us she gave me a dirty look, made some sounds and made me follow her around the hall to the end of another hall for me to pick it up myself and walk back. We also parked the car with their valet service thinking it would be the most convenient thing to do but when it was time to check out, they wouldn't check me out via tv or phone because my parking ticket had to be validated at the front desk so I had to wait in the mile long line of people checking in to have the parking ticket signed. Hotel, please get it together and provide better service. The only pleasant people working there for the guys at the front of the hotel. Thanks for your nice service. As a New Yorker, I would hope NYC tourists would have better experience staying in our city.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it's money and the hotel had "better" times.”
Reviews.Author: Alex823
Reviews.Content: For the money we paid we did not get the service which should have been appropiate. Room: Even though the room was spacious it was not clean. We found several insects in corners of the room and the dust layer in some places was just incredible. Some rooms have a walk-in wardrobe which is great ... just that there is no light in them! Even though there is a plug for a bulb they have decided to not put one in! When we asked why there is no bulb they just said that they do not put one no more... Bathroom: Bathroom size is average. You only get a shower and it all looks a bit old. Service: I was very unhappy wiht the service I received. In the lobby were huge queues! Even if you just wanted to ask somethin you had to wait in line with people who wanted to check in! The 3 times I went I was treated unfriendly 2. Also the room service was highly disapointing. Every day its a surprise. Sometimes you get showergel but no shampoo and vice verca. In the restaurant everyone but one gentleman were unfriendly and the breakfast was not very tasty and consisted every day of the same. Internet also is not free and if you do not want to pay 14 dollars a day you bhave to go to starbucks which is luckily next door. The only good thing of this hotel is its location. Its right by a subway station and very close to central park and times square. This hotel seems to have once been a great hotel but it isnt what it used to be. It does not deserve 4 stars! Not recommendable to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: clm285
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at Park Central and were very pleased. Great location - short walk to Times Square, theatre district, Central Park and the subway is right there. Check in was a bit slow...the patrons ahead of us were very chatty and the desk clerks had trouble moving them along. But once it was our turn it was very efficient. The room was very clean, fresh sheets were put on every day, and the bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have slept in. I requested non-feather pillows and they were brought up right away. It was very quiet, we were down a side hallway on the 23 floor and never heard our neighbors. Wifi was expensive, $15 per day, but it worked well. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: ldennis70
Reviews.Content: Lena checked us in, and got us settled early so we had the whole day to enjoy. We were treated with nothing but friendliness, and all questions were answered with the utmost politness, from the door men, to the bell man. Our room was clean, and well maintained. We asked them to check the ac, and the maintenence man was there with in 15 min.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel-right on 7th Avenue”
Reviews.Author: Jessica1206
Reviews.Content: Hotel is right where all the action is! Walking distance to Central Park and Times Square. Hotel staff is helpful-sometimes there is a long line to check-in/check-out. That can be frustrating. We have been there several times, my kids love staying there since its close to everything. The hotel can be a bit pricy sometimes. Therefore plan in advance! Rooms are nice-spacious.

Reviews.Title: “HATED IT - Definitely NOT 4 stars!”
Reviews.Author: Tempest F
Reviews.Content: This hotel would have been great if it were listed accurately as a 2 star hotel. The air conditioning does NOT cool the hotel rooms. The water pressure sucks. The lines are always long because they are constantly understaffed. The walls appear old and mildewy with orange water draining stains. The sheets didn't even feel clean. It was honestly a horrible experience. I mean nothing is 4 star - even the phones are outdated. I will never stay here again and would NEVER recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Book through their site with the "PARKING PACKAGE" for best deal when driving into the city.”
Reviews.Author: Swimmin_Mama
Reviews.Content: The "PARKING PACKAGE" was the benefit that put this hotel above others when booking. I didn't find it listed on Orbitz or Travelocity or others, only through their web site at http://www.parkcentralny.com/Specials I drove into the city before check-in time. They parked my car and stored my luggage while we shopped around town(walking distance). When we came back in the evening to clean up before seeing a Broadway show (walking distance), we picked up our bags and checked into our room. If you arrive before noon there is a $3.50/bag fee. The next day we checked out, stored our bags again (at $3.50 per bag), then were able to experience another full day in the city before retrieving our bags and car to head home. I can not believe the savings with the parking package! Any other parking garage in the city can charge from $40 - $50 per day for parking. That's $100 extra I could spend shopping in the city! Woo! The room rates were very reasonable too - around $250 for the weeknight for two double beds. That's including the $100 value in parking! Nothing fancy for the rooms - just a regular clean room with a TV. Sheets were nice and comfortable, room was very clean, housekeeping was very pleasant when asked for extra towels. Sometimes there was a wait for the elevators - only two elevators for each side of the building. And there were lines to wait to check in - but nothing unreasonable. I thought I'd be buying a Metro pass and taking the subway to Chinatown, but there was enough shopping in walking distance between Grand Central Station and Central Park to fill my two days! I didn't use the wi-fi rates, there were enough free wi-fi spots in the city for me to get my email, etc. There's a concierge in the lobby that can book your Broadway tickets or simply walk over to Times Square around 1:00 for last minute deals for that evening's unsold seats. Download TKTS app on iPhones to see tickets availability. Have a list of 3-4 shows you want to see while waiting in line. Once at the ticket window you get best available seating for that show. We bought orchestra seating at 40% off! Some shows don't sell at TKTS, like Lion King, but a good selection is available every day. Bottom line - I'll be back!!! There's so much to see and do in the city. This was a great value for a great visit.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel, unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Dubai5555
Reviews.Content: we stayed here on August 2nd. Large line for check in, completely impersonal staff. Charge for holding bags if you arrive before check in time. Much better hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, central position, but people are not so kind....”
Reviews.Author: deborap7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in front of Central Park so it is a very good position. The interior is very luxurious but there is one thing that I didn't bear...When we were about to pay our bill the concierge man pretended to be paid for the entire objects into the bar-room but we didn't take anything from that!! In the end we have pay the real amount but the concierge was not very kind with us!

Reviews.Title: “No frills, but Central!”
Reviews.Author: DMCManchester
Reviews.Content: This place is always busy! The lobby, out front, not so much the restaurant...but it is centrally located and very "utilitarian" . The rooms and bath are unremarkable but the staff is pretty friendly. One neat element - as you approach the elevator banks, you can tap your floor onto an electronic screen and you will be directed to the elevator that will take you quickly. It saves time and crowding, as there are always people waiting for an elevator. Then when you get on your "assigned" car, your floor is already punched. Neat! And if y ou search, you can often get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Sara G
Reviews.Content: Let me start this review by saying, I have been to New York City numerous times and have never been a hotel as bad as this one. I went to NYC with a friend who had never been to NY before, and when we got to the hotel there were no rooms available. From there, we left our luggage and came back three hours later to be placed in a room. We requested when booking our hotel for a higher room, and the man who helped us at the front desk was less than knowledgable or helpful. I don't like feeling like I'm being spoken down to and he definitely did that. When we were finally put in a room, it had to be the most disgusting room I have ever been in. I am pretty sure staying in a Hostel or at the YMCA would have been better, I almost feel like it is an insult comparing them to this hotel. The room was absolutely filthy, I refused to take off my shoes because the floors were so nasty. The window coverings were disgusting and falling apart, in the shower there was another person's pubic hair, and caked up toothpaste in the sink. I went to the front desk to complain about the quality of the room and the Front Desk Manager kept telling me that she would be with me in just a minute. After twenty minutes of waiting she finally came and spoke with me. She spent less than two minutes talking to, seemed put off that I was even requesting a room change. When I told her the bed didn't seem like a standard king, her response was "well it is." And another lady walked up next to her and rolled her eyes at me. They moved me to another room, and it was very clear that someone had smoked in this room. While it is suppose to be a smoke-free hotel, it was very obvious that smoking had taken place in this room. When I called the front desk, they were put off, all they wanted to do was spray the room, despite my telling them I have severe allergies and this would trigger them. They finally moved us again, however, the room was still less than standard. There was sticky parts to the floor, we no longer had a view that had been requested instead were looking at the interior 4 walls of the hotel. I requested on Saturday night an extra blanket, and it never showed up. I'm a teacher who was looking at a nice last weekend before school started in NYC, instead this hotel all but ruined my time. I will never stay here again, it was a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “One of my best stays in Midtown!”
Reviews.Author: ShortcutShari
Reviews.Content: I was leery from the reviews, but I couldn't have been happier. I had a Superior King room and it was HUGE in comparison to most properties I've stayed in Midtown. King bed, desk, sitting area, and room to spare. The beds were more comfortable than they should have been because I was not inclined to get up in the morning! The recent renovation was well worth it. The property is modern and clean. My only "complaints" would be that the elevators by my room were not functional, so I had to walk all the way around to the other side of the elevator bank when coming or going, and that the maid carts were left in the hallways all the time (although covered at night). Just a little tacky. I would definate request to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Carlos A
Reviews.Content: this hotel is kinda bad because when we went the elevator didnt work and the hotel has some littel attention to his clients the only good of this is near everything

Reviews.Title: “great location good hotel”
Reviews.Author: gammo
Reviews.Content: Got a suite for two nights at this hotel last year and i had no complaints. The rooms were a bit dimly lit but the toilet/bath was perfect, beds were comfortable and the sitting area was more than adequate. The view from our window was the boutique hotel next door..The dreams hotel..none too elegant a building! The restaurant at the hotel was ok, meals were formulaic but not disappointing nor very pleasing..on the expensive side. However, the proximity to Central Park, Carnegie hall and many excellent restaurants and deli"s was a huge plus. An altogether more enjoyable address than the rash of hotels in the Times Square area!

Reviews.Title: “Very Average - not coming back”
Reviews.Author: PittsburghBounce
Reviews.Content: Long check in lines, unfriendly and unhelpful staff, and a tired feel to this hotel make this a low choice in New York City. Lobby nice but for some reason always crowded. Everything an extra including checking baggage and Internet. Front desk was understaffed and undertrained in customer service. Rooms had a worn out feel although clean. Most staff seemed annoyed by guest questions. Restaurant closed outside seating early and clearly wanted to close even though plenty of guests wanted to eat and drink. Overall very average and very disappointing. Will not stay here again. I believe the hotel has been sold - maybe that is why staff was apathetic.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Leopetruska
Reviews.Content: Very confortable and Nice Luxury place, for a reasonable price. I got a good deal, and I have a surprise when I arrived there. I thank that is a poor and old place because the rate is less that than other with the same star rating. New rooms, clean and good space. The bath is small but new and clean, and it offers all things that you need to use on a bath. Just 1 and 1/2 block from Central Park and 5 or 6 from Times Square. There's a Metro Station on the 55th street with the 7th avenue, just dowstairs on the hotel corner. The unique problem is because I sent some packages to the hotel and I left some suitcases before get my flight, and both were charged. Very fast elevators and a very nice lobby, the people are very attention. And there's a portuguese concierge there. I didn't eat the breakfast but the price is higher than the option around the lodge, there's so many. One Starbucks in the same building with free internet. You can get a limo for the price of old cab and for more than two, It's better than the shuttle. The internet is charged on all hotel, but you can get signal from Starbucks on the lobby near the elevator on the left.

Reviews.Title: “Waste of money!”
Reviews.Author: Ldag86
Reviews.Content: Service/staff was terrible. Least helpful staff possible. Conceirge was gone early in the night. No one could help with dinner suggestions. The only suggestion was to use a computer by the front desk. Our room was DISGUSTING!! Small, humid, a/c wasn't working, bathroom had mold on tile and shower curtain. Smelled moldy. The bathroom had hair all over the floor, toilet and shower. Two of the three lights in the room were broken. The ONLY good thing about this hotel was the location. We had to argue for over a half hour about getting a new room. After the typical excuses, like no rooms available, we put up enough fuss to get a new room (front desk lady said she had to steal it from someone else and that she would be in trouble- so if we were fine with that we could have the room) I would never come back or recommend this place. Horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Rip-off”
Reviews.Author: mimsw
Reviews.Content: This is clearly one New York hotel to avoid. First of all, it simply isn't 4-Star as advertised. My room was dank and dirty and had an overwhelming disgusting smell of cheap room deodorant. The bedside lamps didn't work, the phone didn't work, the wallpaper was dirty and scuffed, the carpet was dirty with some amazing stains, the origins of which I want to avoid. Staff members came up and completely replaced the lamp assembly and explained that even if I switched rooms, I could expect the same "room freshening fragrance." The costs are also very high. Internet is over $14 per day, breakfast was over $25 for two eggs and bacon, and there was an appalling $3.75 PER BAG charge to leave bags for a few hours. I was incredulous after reading some of the reviews that said "good for the money," but then realized that much (if not most) of the clientele are Europeans paying with Euros (little do they know how much better they could do with their money) or simply don't have high standards for hotels (Funky smells, but much time do you spend in the room anyway?"). The good points? Well, several of the staff were very friendly and helpful, including front desk, bellmen and the three different people it took to get my room in shape. With a little effort, Park Central could achieve three-star quality, but for the total cost of the stay, it gets a very low rating from me.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service great, but hotel average...”
Reviews.Author: motherbored
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Park Central while doing business in the area. My arrival could not have been more perfect. I was greeted by a friendly valet who immediately took my bags and escorted me to the front desk to check in. The desk clerk, Ellen, could not have been nicer, nor more efficient. She even upgraded my room for no particular reason. My room was located within a bank of rooms in the interior of the hotel. The window looked out at the inside four tightly grouped brick walls--nothing interesting at all. The hallways were a bit dark and musty. My room look like it was just getting to the point where the hotel should consider renovated and redecorating--not bad, but not crisp. A little musty and worn. The bed was comfortable and the room was surprisingly quiet, especially since it was next to the ice and vending machines and elevator. The room space was ample, but the bathroom was a bit small. The amenities in the rooms were okay: a safe, weak air conditioning, one sink, a tight shower, no tub, no refrigerator, no free wifi, two phones, hair dryer, flat-screen TV, and iron. I had an awful experience with the room service food--my recommendation would be to eat elsewhere. Location great in the heart of all the New York action.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Trevcon54
Reviews.Content: I read that this was a four star hotel. It was a 2 star at best. The rooms are very small. The a/c was adequate, but don't expect room to get too cool. It is impossible to get anyone to answer the phone when you call the hotel number, both from inside the hotel and outside. They charge to hold your bags if your room is not ready or if you check out and want to do last minute sightseeing before your trip home. States it is located in Times Square, but is at least 10 blocks away. I personally will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but watch your credit card bill”
Reviews.Author: Dean K
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, rooms clean, service great. No complaints.....EXCEPT (there's always one of those isn't there?). After I received my credit card bill I had been chanrged $129 more than was on my receipt from check out. Fortunately I had my paperwork so when I called they fixed it quickly with no hassle. Be careful and pay attention to your credit card statement after the fact and be sure you were charged correctly. Other than that it's a nice place in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Have always had a good stay!”
Reviews.Author: DenverEyeGal
Reviews.Content: I'm not quite sure what all of the complaints are about! I stayed at this hotel for the second time in March and I have enjoyed my stay both times. The rooms are clean and reasonably roomy for New York City and the price hasn't ever been outrageous (by NYC standards). It is fairly conveniently located though Taxis can be hard to come by. I haven't ever needed anything special from the staff but they have always been kind upon check in and check out. If I had to come up with a complaint it would be that the hotel bar was not open very late and the bartender was less than friendly, but it certainly didn't impact my stay. I will more than likely stay at this hotel again as it always seems to be at a decent price and I can give up being in the middle of Times Square to save the money and still be in a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Accomodations, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Erin0325
Reviews.Content: I almost cancelled my stay at Park Central after reading some of the other reviews. My husband and I were taking a romantic vacation to NYC and I wanted to find something on the line of nice and budget friendly, I think the Park Central nailed it. You cannot beat the location. You can see Times Square and Central Park from the hotel. Plus, it is right above a metro line so you have instant access to the entire city. We arrived at 1 and were given a room right away, even though check in wasn't until 4. (We were also given a late check out upon departure with no hassles) The accomodations were clean- no bugs or stains. The room did have a bit of a funky odor but it was easy to look past. We asked for two extra towels and got them immediately. We didn't utilize the staff because we already had our agenda planned. But this place was fine. The bed was comfortable and the shower had great pressure. How much time are most people in the room anyways? It was perfect for what we wanted- a central location, not a lot of fuss, decent price. I would definitely stay again. And for the price, you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “A palace price for a motel service, message sent to the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: PigeonsaNew-York
Reviews.Content: To whom it may concern, For your information we would like to thank you for the worst stay we never had in North America for years. We are totally unhappy with our stay in your hotel for the following reasons. - Queeing for every single request, for an approximative answer, most of the time,“ it's not me but the other desk or person" The most wellknown word in your hotel : "Sorry Sir ! Cann't help it". - Arriving at 1pm, we were told we were pre-checked and have to come bac after 4pm for comple check-in at 4pm. The luggage were store at $1.50 each but paid $3.75 each. - 1st time we opened the bedroom‘s door : it smelled like something's is rottening in. - The safe was out of order. - The bedsheets looked clean but stained on several places in both beds. - The bedroom was as damp as a swamp, after 3 weeks in Florida we clearly can identify what means « damp ». - The AC didn't blow cool and dry air, but a very luke warm and damp one. I opened the top and saw that some water’s leaking from the tap and corroding the pipes. At home all of our belongings were damp and smelling rotten. My wife spent her weekend washing and ironing. - Towels : 3 for 4 every single day, after requesting an extra one to your agent, "Sorry Sir...I'll report it and send you one!" Never received and nothing improved. After having noticed these failures we asked and requested to your front desk agent another bedroom, the answer was exactly what we expected from : "You just paid for a superior room located between the 3rd and 17th floor. We won't do nothing because the hotel is sold out. If you want a different room at a higher floor, the only difference is the coffee machine and the rate. - About the Internet access at $ 14.20 which is a real shop lifting. I subscribe to 2 days + 1 day = $ 42.60, final invoice $ 96.-. A $ 54... connection was added to it. We've got one pc and nothing else. After arguiing and showing our good faith your agent accepted to reduce the bill of $ 28.40 and keeping the other figures in, what a thieve ! We finally paid for what we used, 3 days. Tourists are just suckers !!! « Sorry Sir, New-York City is very expensive ! » - But least but not last on wednesday my wife and my daughter were having itchings in their head that were checked in the first coming pharmacy-> HOUSE LICE. Without adding any bed bugs. We were suprised to see that inflatable rat in front of the hotel every single day of our stay informing us and your guests about bed bugs infections in your place. After chatting with the person in charge of the inflated rat, we were informed about house lice, stange for an establishment of your quality, sold in Europ as a 4*.

Reviews.Title: “Not a nice place for $257 per night!!”
Reviews.Author: bajagirl2010
Reviews.Content: I know space is at a premium in NYC but this place was bad!. Hallways smelled awful, the room carpet was so gross I didnt want to walk barefoot, chair had paint stains on it, the shower was a stall with a curtain that didnt even reach the floor. They did offer a buffet breakfast at the adjoining restaurant which was very nice. We stayed one night, ate breakfast and checked out. The staff gave good service ( ie; check in and out) but seemed to hate their job as much as I hated their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: jennimcdonald
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I was listening to the Timeshare spiel at The Manhattan Club, and they give a rebate after you listen to the spiel, sort of. Lobby was full of people waiting. I thought because it was Tuesday NYC in summer might not be that bad. It was busy. There were younger teens-20 year olds asleep on the couches and it was dark. We could not check in until 4pm and at 3:58 they said it was not ready, but if we switched to an inside room with no view we could move in right then. So we did. The room was small. I got extremely clusterphobic, which I've not experienced in a room before. There was mildew in the bathroom grout, but clean. There was a blow up rat with handouts about bed bugs in front of the hotel. The staff said it had to do with a union issue...I'm paranoid about bed bugs, so we inspected the room and found nothing. Hotel location is nice. i would not call this 4 stars. Maybe 3 stars...I would probably not stay here again because there are so many other choices and this was blah.

Reviews.Title: “We love it. Amazing hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: DanuCM
Reviews.Content: It's near the most important buildings and places to visit in Manhattan. Chrysler; Empire State; Central Park, Broadway. It worth!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Icount4u
Reviews.Content: Dirty! Unkept! Rundown! While the lobby is modern and bright it is not a representation of the rooms. If this is a 4 star hotel I would not want to stay in a lower rated hotel. The inflated Bedbug outside the hotel did nothing to improve the experience! While the staff were very courteous and understanding nothing was done. I would never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: RCWashington
Reviews.Content: When you're paying the lowest price in the neighborhood for a "4 star" hotel, be realistic: it probably isn't really a 4 star like the ones that are charging double the price. It was better than most of the true 3-star hotels in midtown. The lobby is spacious and modern, there are bellmen ready to help with your luggage or taxis is you want help, the hallways are fresh enough though not beautiful, and the rooms and bathrooms are very small & no view but fresh, renovated nicely, good quality linens, mattress & tv. The maids were great and provided us with plenty of towels and shampoos. We got a rate of little over 200 from priceline for nights that most of the Hilton & Marriott budget properties were sold out and the others were well over 300, so I really have no complaints. The high-tech elevator system (you MUST pre-select your floor when you call the elevator in the lobby) and no coffee maker were a bit of an annoyance, but the hairdryer worked really well, and there's a Starbucks on the corner and a decent (though not really cheap) diner for breakfast across the street. Nearby on 55th street between 7th & 6th Avenues I had a really good experience at New York Nail & Spa on the north side of the street. It is an above average walk-in nail salon including a real day spa. The day spa part is not at the amenities level of the Eliz Arden or Bliss, but those places are more expensive & require appointments -- & I have trouble making a facial enough of a priority to plan ahead. It is still quite nice inside with real treatment rooms for the facials & massages, and a pleasant lounge with a little cafe. I had a pedicure & facial with Christine, and both were wonderful. Would highly recommend as an impulse splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here at your peril”
Reviews.Author: michelle_gandy
Reviews.Content: The ONLY thing going for this hotel really is the location, so ONLY stay here if thats the ONLY thing thats important to you. The Wellington is accross the road and the Sheraton and Hilton are nearby so its not your only option. There are loads of others too. My 13 year old son is well travelled and he quoted "how could you bring me here its the most disgusting hotel I have ever stayed in" Wallpaper was peeling off the walls, there was a contstant smell of mildew and mould, curtains were falling off the rail. No proper douvet cover, just 2 sheets between the douvet. The bathroom just didnt feel clean. If you do stay here you might wish to bring your cleaning liquid with you. some of the lights didnt work, no fan in the bathroom and the room overall had little light and was dingy. No way is this hotel a 4 star. We got an early flight so we needed to leave our bags somewhere before booking in at 4pm. We were there at 11am and were told it would be $3.75 for each bag until 12.00pm if we wanted to hold on till 12.00 we would be charged $1.50. I have stayed at loads of hotels and have never been charged for our bags to be stored!!! On the last day we waited till 12.00 so we would only have to pay $1.50 for each bag (we did have 4) only to be told that checking out guests had to pay full price of $3.75. The hotel wanted extra for everything... bags ...internet... list goes on And as far as customer service... dont expect any, receptionists are rude and so are the maids and there is no one to offer help with the bags if you needed it. I had no service and refused to leave any tip. I get the feeling that all the staff are not enjoying their jobs at all and its passed on to the customer. Also on our first day we were not allowed to use the hotel restroom till we had our room and this was activated by your room key. another guest let me in but this was also disgusting and smelt bad. On our last day, outside the hotel there was an inflateable rat with a sign saying the hotel had bedbugs and stay there at your peril! We had just checked out and quite frankly were releived that we had. I think the owners of this hotel are greedy, dont look after their staff, and think customer service is a thing of the past. they should think again if they wish to rely soley on their location. We were not the only guests that felt like this. While we were waiting for our lift to the airport we could overhear guests saying similar stories. This hotel is overpriced, over star rated and strongly over due a refurbish!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and rooms however concierge and service fairly poor”
Reviews.Author: Monique2402685455265
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Park Central for 9 nights. The rooms were great clean, spacious and enough facilities in room except for no mini bar which I found a great disappointment. The location of the Hotel was exceptional walking distance to everything. However, when it came to the service in the hotel it was lacking. No one ever answered the phones was on hold for ages, asked for a fork to the room was told we would be charged thought that was ridiculous. Concierge showed terrible service were rude and not helpful at all. They would be trying to help 3 people at once they may have thought this was being productive and helping everyone but it made it worse ignoring you and not answering your questions at all. Hotel had no pool either, we were in NYC when it was very hot would have been nice to have somewhere to go by the water.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Guest Relations!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bruta1ty
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon, and when we tried calling the front desk to confirm there was no answer all 3 times. When we got there the price was $300 more then then what was on the paper sent out to us. We went down to talk to someone about this, who promised they would correct, and adjust it. When we checked out there was no correction made, and when I went to get the receipt from the lady at the counter, she yanked it from my hand telling me she was not giving it to me. When I asked to speak to manager, the two women were more concerned about some plane crash they heard about then taking care of us, and other customers. There was no plane crash, it just over shot the runway and everybody was allright, I checked. A 5 night stay cost, with parking was over $2000, which was supposed to be only $1600. My advise is spend the little bit more and book the Essex House, and be treated like royalty, instead of of an outdated, with deplorable conditions. Who wants to walk into a hotel room, with that kind of cost to find a roll away bed bed just inside your door, and hair in the sink and bathtub???

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pauline722
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night with 2 friends for my 30th Birthday. The lobby is very nice and check in was quick. The room was basic. I did read other reviews where it was said the lobby was upgraded but not the rooms and you can see this. It was a very hot day and the a/c didnt do much to cool down the room. We asked at reception for shampoo & conditioner and was told someone would bring it up to us. Half hour later I received a call asking did we receive our amenties which we had not. Eventually they arrived, however it was too late as my friend had to shower so we could go out. All in all the hotel was fine for 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off.”
Reviews.Author: Sucho
Reviews.Content: Checking in we were told our room wasn't ready. We asked again at the next counter and they gave us our room. Staff isn't well trained and depending upon who you speak with you get different answers. The room was dirty and dusty with hair in the shower. The hallway didn't looknlike it had seen a vacuum in days. It took 10 minutes to get down to the lobby via the elevator . This happened on several occasions. The day we left there was an inflatable rat 20 ft. tall outside the hotel protesting the hotel for having bed bugs and for being greedy. The inflatable pretty much sums up our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: ListowelMotel
Reviews.Content: We are still in and hardly wait to check out.This place is $35.00 motel in Canada Nothing in room is working.Location is nice but the rest is garbage for $300 a night We had 12 service calls in 2 days. I'm the owner of Motel myself and trust me when I rate this place 1star and this is location

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing, drab and definitely NOT 4 star”
Reviews.Author: JeromeSydney
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located and that is the only good point. The rooms are poorly maintained and dark and dingy. The service is poor and overall this is NOT a 4 star hotel and it is an inappropriate rating. A lot has to be done to bring this hotel up to standard. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was my 3rd stay and it didn't disappoint.”
Reviews.Author: dap_25
Reviews.Content: My first stay was as a couple, my second stay with a friend and this stay was with my kids. The hotel was suitable on all 3 occasions. The location is superb - Central Park a couple of blocks uptown, Broadway one block west, Times square a few blocks downtown and subway stops aplenty nearby. The staff were all friendly and accommodating and our room (although not as spacious as other rooms I've stayed in) was still clean and comfortable. As far as value for money goes - I don't think you can beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kmp89
Reviews.Content: Myself and my best friend stayed at this hotel for my 21st birthday in February 2010. We were delayed 36 hours and thought we would have a problem checking in. We rung the hotel in advanced and explained the situation, they were very accommodating and didn't charge us for the night we didn't stay at the hotel. I had read several reviews saying the service at reception was slow and unfriendly, however upon arrival it was quick and the service was fantastic. The only problem we had concerned our breakfast coupons! We had to go back the next day and get the correct ones. The breakfast each morning was delicious with mini boxes of cereal, make your own waffles and a small fried section. Just right to start you off when you are going to be busy shopping or sight seeing in NY! The hotels location was perfect, a short walk around the corner from Central Park and around a 5 minute walk into Times Square. There is also a subway station on the side of the hotel which is very handy. The room we booked was a double double. The beds were very comfy and it was a very spacious room! Each day our room was cleaned and the toiletries were replenished. The only fault I could see was the remote control to the TV had been hidden underneath one of the beds! Overall this is a wonderful hotel and I cannot wait to book it again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: kiki55101
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in November 2009 with my 8 year old son. It was a great location - right across the street from Carnegie Hall, just 2 blocks from Central Park, and a short walk to Times Square. We came to town for the Macy's parade, and this was the perfect location. The balloons passed right in front of our window...truly the trip of a lifetime! Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great view, great value, great location, great customer service!”
Reviews.Author: drbak
Reviews.Content: Within a block of Carnegie Deli, geat bagel place called Fluffy's acroos from the deli, great location, and a big beautiful room. The day we left there was a big blow-up bedbug "alert" outside of the hotel, but our room, bed, and stay was perfect. Teh staff was great, even though we were late checking out, due to a slow cab ride back to the hotel after sight-seeing. The manager was very helpful and there was no extra cost for our tardiness. I will stay at this hotel again. If you are concerend about bugs, check first but I saw none. Barbara K

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, very confortable.”
Reviews.Author: MonicaCavallari
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent. Our bedroom was big and the bed fantastic! It was everything good. The only negative thing was a rude recepcionist.

Reviews.Title: “Average quality, very good location, practical business hotel, but not for pleasure...”
Reviews.Author: rokcu
Reviews.Content: Now, that's an interesting hotel. In the middle of Manhattan, with guests coming in and out like ants. This is a half-tired hotel, with old infrastructure but everything more or less works. There is always a queue at the reception, so the service is never good, only OK. Rooms are small, but comfortable and clean. I got a really good rate from them so I stayed there. It was very close to the addresses where I had meetings, so it worked great for me. To be frank, I would never stay there if it was a pleasure trip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, gorgeous hotel- fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Briony86
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the best location, walk out the door and you can see times square, walk the other way and it's central park. it is a clean & gorgeous looking hotel, i cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: FrannieT89
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Park Central for 10 days just last month. After seeing some bad reviews I was concerned but found the hotel to be fine. The rooms are basic but they’re clean and comfortable and I found the staff to be helpful and friendly. The only problem we encountered was the shower; it was either scorching hot or freezing cold but the bath worked fine. The location is perfection!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, horrible bed”
Reviews.Author: jjjjjjjewell
Reviews.Content: The hotel was okay overall, conveniently located near Central Park. But the bed was downright horrible: saggy and hard, the pillows smelled like old men. Yuck. Believe it or not, I ended up sleeping sideways across the bed up under the headboard... the only place I could find a smidgeon of firmness. I'd give this hotel a better rating if they upgraded beds & bedding.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not a great room for the price”
Reviews.Author: robsaint
Reviews.Content: Front desk where not all that friendly compared with other Hotels we stayed at. Room was crapped with 4 people. No fridge and Safe did not work properly. Room smelt each time we got back from somewhere and you could not ajust the aircon. Hotel is in a fantastic location, a few blocks from Central park and not far from Time Square and not far from subway stops. Lifts are slow and you have to pick the floor before you get into the lift.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in 25 years of traveling”
Reviews.Author: Edel6106
Reviews.Content: Looks are deceiving! Elevators don not work or slow at best. Rooms are damp and smell like dirty pillows, furniture chipped and aging. room service doesn't answer the phone safety deposit box doesn't work bugs in bathroom . Bathrooms are filthy. When manager was called they never got back to me. To top all of this off everyday a huge blowup rat was placed in front on the sidewalk to protest the bedbugs at park central.......no way is this a 4star hotel it is criminal what they charge it is a flea bag hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luggage Room Charges are unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: durban41
Reviews.Content: We arrived at noon and had to check our baggage into the luggage room until check in time of 4 pm. We were shocked that there was a charge of $3.75 per item checked in. This has never happened to us before.

Reviews.Title: “Big room, could be cleaner”
Reviews.Author: clarkman99
Reviews.Content: I am staying here until Sat. Rooms are nice size excellent location. They charge for wi-fi but if you sit across from the concierge you can use the conniption from Tessiere for free. We got our 2 double bed room for 204.00 a night by clicking the banner off of Trip advisor. I would recommend this hotel if you can get it for under 275.00 a night. Needs new carpeting and a little TLC as it smells a bit musty when you get off elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was not good”
Reviews.Author: wmverdon
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through priceline.com and bid on the room amount. Unfortuneatly, we did not have a say in the hotel by doing it that way. It was an old hotel, that is not the bad part. One of the clerks at the desk made us feel like second class citizens because we had a discounted rate and gave us a room with a view of the top of another room! IT was horrible. My daughter and my first visit to NY, it would have been nice to see the streets. The ONLY good thing about this hotel was the location. The halls smelled musty and as big as this hotel was, the elevators were only running two cars at each point, it was slow!

Reviews.Title: “Great location...but that was the only thing great about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsAnderson0221
Reviews.Content: If you are looking simply for a great location but don't care much about service, then this is the hotel for you. It is located 2 blocks from Central Park South and a few blocks from Times Square, Fifth Ave and Hells Kitchen. There is also easy access to 57th St subway stop just steps outside the hotel. If you are concerned with service and amenities I would not recommend this hotel! The customer service is mediocre at best and that is an average of all the personnel I encountered. The person checking me in was rude, cold and combative. I was quoted one rate, she gave me another rate and basically said "if you don't remember the name of the person you spoke with then it is what it is"..... And the rest of the staff, Concierge, Doorman just didn't act like they really enjoyed working there. The only nice person was the Manager, Elizabeth, and even her cheeriness couldn't overshadow the rest of the attitudes I encountered. I received an upgrade but was "accidentally" put in a regular room located right across from the elevators with a closet sized bathroom and a view of a water tank on the neighboring building. Some upgrade! When I called the front desk clerk and informed her of this her response was "well, we are surround by buildings, this is NY and none of the rooms have a view." An uninformed response from an uninformed employee. I returned to the front desk and was thankfully helped by Elizabeth who gave me the correct upgraded room; which coincedentally had a view of 7th Avenue. The regular rooms are tiny and ordinary. And all rooms are clean but a little old and tired looking. I travel to NY once a month for business, but after this experience I will choose another hotel in the neighborhood. There are several other great choices that are $10-$20 more per night, but where you can get the amenities and service of a chain hotel (think Hampton Inn, Four Points Sheraton!).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but expensive and not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: shannonmarie018
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because my friend recommended it to me, the location was wonderful, but for what I got the room was very pricey. I paid $133 for a King Bed, and added the parking package and paid over $40 for my car to be stored in their parking garage, along with an array of city taxes so my room came to $202. There are cleaning carts in the halls 24/7 and the bathroom, like many other reviews I've seen on here, had mold in the tub and mold in the sink. The room was very dated and felt very dingy. The checkout process was very obnoxious. I was told to allow 30 minutes to get my car back, even though the parking lot is directly accross and down the street. I checked out, gave them my parking ticket, and was told my car would be out front shortly. I don't know if the man at the desk forgot to call or what, but I ended up waiting almost an hour for my car and we were running on a very tight schedule. I sat in the lobby waiting, watching other couples pick up their cars, I had all of our bags piled near us, NO ONE ever offered to help us with our bags, I went back to the desk to ask where my car was, the girl was very rude and told me it would be out front in 2 minutes, it took longer than 2 minutes. When the valet pulled up the car he was very rude, never said anything. I don't think I'd ever stay here again, between the rude valet service and the dirty bathroom it just feels like a rip off. And the hotel looks so nice downstairs, it's very deceiving.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing impression”
Reviews.Author: plzgoaway
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at hotel and didn't see one employee at the front desk with a friendly face. Not one employee acknowledged our presence at front desk. Hotel lobby very dark, not inviting at all. Location was good, room was decent size and clean. Would not return, just didn't feel welcomed. There are too many other hotel that want your business

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Trodders
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were told it would not be possible to have a twin room for the 3 of us as the hotel was fully booked. We were then told that we could have a rollaway bed for an extra cost of $70 per night despite having requested a twin bed room on booking. We eventually offered the rollaway bed free of charge. Everything costs extra, luggage storage, wi fi you name it. The room itself was fine but would probably stay somewhere less touristy next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: ruddski1
Reviews.Content: Booked on tripadvisor and Had a good stay here over the 4th of July weekend. Hotel is getting older and they nickel and dime you for everything, although most irritating was charging to hold my luggage. Hotel staff was great and my room was clean when I arrived and cleaned well everday. The location is perfect, halfway between Times Square and Central park. The elevator uses a computer to run efficiently, you press your floor on a computer screen and it tells you what elevator to wait for, although first time was a little confusing it worked very well. There is a Central parking garage (not associated with hotel) on 55th and broadway that you can print internet coupons for $30 for overnight parking and it is a 2 minute walk. I stayed three nights and paid $90 instead of about $130

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiving”
Reviews.Author: banker84
Reviews.Content: Looking at this hotel online, it definetly looks 4 star, once there, check in was easy and quick but the bomb dropped once the elevator opened to our floor. Filthy carpet, cigarette smell and broken carts were the halls. Rooms were dark, dingy and not "welcomingly" clean. I may be picky as I am very clean at home but stained lampshades, ceilings and carpets are dirty for anyone. I was also concerned about the charge to hold bags and WIFI. If you are on a budget and not a neat freak stay there as the location is great. If you are looking for a 4 star, this is not it. We did not have too much contact with staff but they were fine.

Reviews.Title: “We'll never be back and we'll ask for everyone to stay away”
Reviews.Author: dabomb_85
Reviews.Content: The most ridiculous service one can ever come across for a 4 star rated hotel. I had dropped off my baggage in the morning due to check in time being 4pm. I came back to the hotel @ about 6.30pm, checked in and went back to get my luggage. I had to wait for 15 minutes at the luggage counter and no one showed up at the counter. Thus I decided to walk behind your counter and see if I could find someone. There was a gentleman in the back counting money and asked me to wait till he was done. I had already waited for 15 minutes+ by this time and I was still asked to wait for more. This is ridiculous. You charge for storing luggage which no other hotel does and make a customer wait for such a long period on top of that. Anyways once he came out, he gave me a lecture “when you go to the bank, you don’t walk behind the counter asking the teller to serve you even after we have posted a sign for no one to walk beyond this point etc etc etc”. I did not go to this hotel to hear his BS. When you charge a customer for a service, customer expects timely service. I felt like I was abused at this time, even though it wasn’t my fault. Secondly going up to the room the television was turned on and very loud and the remote never worked. So I called the operator and asked for another remote to be delivered in order for me to be able to turn down the volume and use the television. She said someone would come up immediately to give me another remote. An hour went by and no one showed up. I called up a 2nd time and she assured that she was sending someone again. No one showed up this time either. Finally I disconnected the television due to it being so loud. No one showed up to get the remote changed for the entire 2 days when I stayed there. This is very good service. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: DianaID19
Reviews.Content: You can't ask for a better location midtown. And our one bedroom at the cheapest price available on the 9th floor was clean, roomy and comfortable. The parking packages provides an excellent value. Other than slow elevators - leave lots of time - and somewhat harried front desk - at these rates an excellent value for the price. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated but no soul”
Reviews.Author: CasperSydney
Reviews.Content: I was advised for this first trip to New York to stay up town and as close to Central Park as I could afford, so Park Central was chosen. It certainly is close to Times Square and Broadway and not far from the up market shops of fith avenue, so full marks for position and prce was not too bad. Staff on reception however were not particularly helpful and less than friendly or interested for that matter. On the 20th floor with conceirge service we found that room had no view and that hairdryer was broken. The hair dryer was fixed fairly promptly but bed and mattress was one of the poorest on our 7 week vacation. One side of the queen bed had completely collapsed. We asked that this be fixed and an attempt was made by the maid service but essentially the bed needed replacing and the "fixing" amounted to some object being placed under the bed to support it which did not work at all and so one person kept sliding off the bed . No new room was offerred and no apology that the bed was broken and issue inadequately resolved. Bathroom was large but a cockroach made the size seem irrelevant after the bed fiasco. Bedroom decor was pleasant but indifference of staff and cold and uninviting foyer with limited seating set the scene for New York Central Park being all image but no soul or heart.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: nreigle
Reviews.Content: We toured a time share next door and they arranged for us to stay at this hotel. We paid $200 a night which was a discounted price, I believe. The room was very small and hard to move around in. Pathways were very narrow. The view was nice as we could see Times Square. We were there the week before Easter and the hotel was filled with school groups. They took over the downstairs lobby completely, so we were not able to use that area at all. They kept our bags for us before we checked in, but we had to pay a fee. The location was good as it was very close to Central Park and Times Square. There were affordable local eateries nearby. The hotel restaurant was too expensive for breakfast or lunch. Access to internet was $15 a day. No thanks, I went to the Starbucks down the street and got wifi for free. I don't think I would choose to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, Quiet, Spacious & Good Value for NY!”
Reviews.Author: love29travel
Reviews.Content: Little did I know but my stay in Park Central was my best trip to NY so far. My review might be a little biased because I got engaged there but I'm sure I can find a helpful comment or two about the hotel! Unfortunately our welcome wasn't the best as when we arrived in the morning we were not able to check in until 4pm. This is normal in most hotels but I would normally expect to be reminded beforehand if we've just come from a long haul flight...also this isn't really what my boyfriend wanted to hear when he was carrying around a diamond ring! Perhaps it was the lack of a warm welcome that put us on a bad start, I do understand that it was a busy time to arrive but you would still expect a happy face behind the desk. Anyway, when we did check in later that day we were sent to a room with a broken safe. This seemed to take a long time to sort out as we had to wait for maintenance to attempt to fix it first. It would have been far better if they had just moved us to a new room (note to hotel manager). I wouldn't let the above put you off (just remember you can't check in until late afternoon). So here are my positive thoughts....once we settled in and the room was sorted the hotel was perfect for us. We absolutely loved being so close to the park! It was snowing when we went but they seemed to do such a good job of clearing the paths and roads you hardly noticed the snow on the ground! The hotel room was really good value, very clean and had lots of room. I found the bed very comfy which is very important for us! The room was bigger then what we have experienced at the W hotel. There are a few really nice breakfast places nearby and we managed to find everything we wanted to visit in walking distance. The only real negative I have about this hotel is that they charge you to store your bag once you checkout. I've never been charged before as this is normally complimentary. If you're looking for clean, quiet and a nice modern room near Central park then I would absolutely recommend Park Central for short breaks in New York!

Reviews.Title: “great location!!”
Reviews.Author: pjfoley
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to every thing you'll want to see in new york half way between times square and central park and just minutes away from all your favourite shows on broadway. The rooms are very comfortable and very reasonably priced the staff are friendly and very accomadating. We've booked again for November.

Reviews.Title: “We Love it”
Reviews.Author: edpersonnel
Reviews.Content: Great service...Really good service. The front desk were very accomodating to our needs. At night we had a friend who has fallen ill. Called them and they immediately brought us water. Really really helpful throughout! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will be back. It was our third time there.”
Reviews.Author: roman022
Reviews.Content: The best hotel for vacation. In the middle of the city. Near all. Choose with brekfast included, its excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Hotel itself is a solid 3.5”
Reviews.Author: sneaks23
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for the past 2 days. Generally, I was pleased. If they do a little more they get 4 stars. Here's my take. PROS: * Awesome location, just a hop, skip, and jump to Central Park * Fast elevators! * Size of room is pretty decent for NYC standards * Pretty respectable gym! Better than what I expected CONS: * Service was hit and miss. Some were really nice while others had an attitude. It was strange. I called down for a blanket and toothpaste that was supposedly "on its way" but it never showed up. I called back and finally they sent it, but the little things matter. * Cost for saving my luggage. Not a big deal, but it seemed a little tacky. I arrived at the hotel and 1p and they couldn't give me my room, but they said I could save my bag. I didn't realize they'd charge. Again, its the little things. * I brought my own MIFI card, so I can't comment on the Internet access. But - I suspect - they charge for it in the room. Again, its a pretty good hotel provided you get a good rate. If not, for the price I'd recommend a Holiday Inn Express or a Hampton Inn in NYC. If they can improve their serve, I wouldn't hesitate giving them 4 solid stars.

Reviews.Title: “Stay only if the price is right and you can't afford better”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterista
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Central in May. We chose this hotel in spite of the reviews in tripadvisor because of the price; most of the hotels we checked had much higher rates that week. Check-in and check-out were quick, there were no long lines. We booked a room for a week through Booking; to our (unpleasant) surprise as soon as we checked in they charged our credit card for the whole stay. The rooms are rather old but not too bad for NYC. It was a cold and rainy week in May and the air-conditioner was on, even when we turned it off, it still blew some cool wind into the room. When we complained we were told it can't be turned off completely. However there was an electric fan on the floor of our, so perhaps someone who had previously stayed at the room found the air-conditioner insufficient in the hot and humid NYC summer; that's just conjecture of-course, but I think those planning to stay there in summer might want to look into this further. The elevators to the lobby in the morning required a very long wait, partly because by the time they reached our floor they were very full. One morning we waited over fifteen minutes. We finally understood that at times like that it's much quicker to take the elevator up (they are empty then) and come down again with it. The same is true in the evening when many guests are going out to dinner or the theater. We were told that they charge for wi-fi per device, so if we wanted to connect our two smart phones to wi-fi we will be charged for each one seperately. There is a nice coffee shop next to the hotel, with good coffee, tasty sandwiches and pastries, good wi-fi, polite and efficient servers. In conclusion I would say, book this hotel if and only if the price is right. Don't expect much and you won't be too disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: happytmo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Thurs.-Sun. The room was very nice, clean, and comfy. We asked for a quiet room so they gave us one on the 24th floor. They also gave us a roll-away at no charge. This compensated for the fact that we had to pay $3.75 per piece of luggage when we got there, for them to store our luggage until we could check in around 3. Staff was somewhat friendly. I waited in line at the front desk longer than I would have liked a few times. The concierge service was good. Great location. 2 streets south of Central Park. About 10 minutes from Times SQ. 7th Ave is a great location. We felt safe and there are plenty of places right there to grab some food.

Reviews.Title: “What a DEAL!”
Reviews.Author: KBRSmith
Reviews.Content: One of my co-workers always stays here when he's in NYC and recommended it to me. I took my daughter to NYC for the weekend. The first night she picked the hotel/location (GEM Hotel- What a NIGHTMARE) and the second night I picked (Park Central). After paying $300 for the GEM hotel which stuck us in a basement in a closet room with basically no window, we were more than excited when we got to our Park Central room. It was a corner room, very spacious, and had 3 windows. One of the windows gave us a beautiful view of Times Square without the noise of actually staying in Times Square. The price we paid for this 17th floor treasure room on a Saturday night could not be beat! The hotel is in a great location and is even one of the stops on the Gray Line Tour Bus! The room was clean and the customer service was fabulous. Overall, I'd definitely recommend this treasure to anyone and I'm making this my hotel of choice when I travel back to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Stinky, musty rooms. I would not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: AmarJ
Reviews.Content: I ended up at this hotel by booking a Secret 4-star Hotel deal on Expedia. I was so disappointed with what I ended up with. This was not a 4-star hotel by any means, perhaps the lobby is fancy but the rooms are musty, grimy, the corridor smelled of cigarettes and there were huge sticky stains on the carpets. Oh and the toilet didn't flush. I would not stay here again. Ever.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value at discount rate... otherwise a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Blek42
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a solid 3 star elsewhere. Location is as good as it gets. Subway stop on the corner, 7st is a great street to catch a quick cab downtown, a very short walk to central park and times square. The rooms are a bit out of date, but acceptable. Mattresses are old but are comfortable. Didn't have much interaction with hotel services. Definitely put the Do Not Disturb sign up if you don't want to be woken up in the morning. NO BED BUGS in our room on the 23rd floor. Overall a great place to stay when you can find the rooms at a discount. Hotel had rates of $150/night on Wed. for Friday arrival for their base room. Called early on the day of arrival to request upgraded room on higher floor and was obliged. Great place to stay for a cheap weekend in NYC. I would not pay the standard rate greater than $200 for this place. The rooms and service will likely let you down. I would only recommend this if a discounted rate was available. You can make an offer on priceline for this hotel at the 3 1/2 star level. Also, check nyc.bestparking.com for overnight parking discounts around the hotel. I paid $50 for 48+ hours, half the price offered by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience at Park Central New York”
Reviews.Author: Paul33324
Reviews.Content: I use TripAdvisor regularly to pick hotels, but I've never felt compelled to write a review before -- until we recently stayed at the Park Central NY and had a much different (that is, positive) experience compared to many of the recent reviews. When we arrived at the check in desk, there were only 2 standard rooms available, both with double beds. We had asked for a king bed, and the front desk clerk immediately upgraded us to a Concierge King room on the 25th floor. She was friendly and helpful, as were all the hotel staff we interacted with during our 3 night stay. Our room was relatively large (by NYC standards) and clean. Maid service was fine -- prompt, all soap/shampoo/towels/etc replenished every day. The furnishings, carpet, bathroom, etc were all nice -- not Ritz Carlton standards, but that's not what we expected for a 3.5 hotel. No evidence whatsoever of bed bugs, either in in our room or in any conversations we had or overheard with other guests. The location can't be beat, with a subway stop literally on the same corner as the hotel. Walk a few blocks north and you're in Central Park, a handful of blocks south and you're in Times Square. For the price and such a great location, we were very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A tad shabby”
Reviews.Author: artymom
Reviews.Content: It was Ok. We had a few glitches with checking in. Our room was not ready and then they gave away our room, and eventually they gave us a quiet room on a lower floor. It was resolved. My friends' bedding looked clean but there was someone else's hair on the sheets....not cool. They sent up housekeeping to change the bedding. It was resolved. Ultimately we slept well and our room was quiet and a nice size. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Second time there, and surelly wil be back.”
Reviews.Author: isatb
Reviews.Content: Great location, with many restaurants near by. Ask for a room on the refurnished side. The rooms are big and clean. There´s no free wi-fi, but you can "borrow" it from the starbucks right next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: ednalmj
Reviews.Content: We were unable to get into our rooms until after 4 pm. We came in on a 10:00 airplane and had to pay to hold our bags until our room was ready. Not sure why we couldn't check in until so late. Also, we also had to pay extra for a room with 2 double beds instead of 1 King size bed. It would have been better if there was a flat rate instead of a nightly rate for the room upgrade. We didnt have any problems with the room - housekeeping was not up to par. Check-out was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Location, price and commodity”
Reviews.Author: WaiPRUSA
Reviews.Content: I have to start by saying that I stayed in a hotel right in front of this one, and the difference is the Earth to the Moon. It is located about two blocks from Central Park, and just over thirteen from Time Square. An easy access to a subway station, and with plenty of places to eat or to have a drink. It has a very good looking lobby, and even better rooms. The room as well as the bed where both comfortable, big, and great looking. Also, it had a 40 inch flat screen tv. I had a partial view of Central Park and Carnegie Hall. The next time that I visit NYC I will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I was worried after reading the negative reviews, but it was fine.”
Reviews.Author: ACAV
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights for our anniversary and it was fine. We got a really great deal using the Expedia Unpublished Rate hotel service so if we had paid more maybe we would have been pickier. Yes, the rooms are dated, but the only issue I had was the elevators. We were on the 5th floor so we just took the stairs most of the time. No bedbugs or anything like the horror stories posted in some of the other reviews. Maybe we were just lucky? Having said that, if I was staying there on a business trip, I would have expected a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Good but a little dated...”
Reviews.Author: bluecomet
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, close to Times Square which was excellent. The foyer is laid out nicely and the restaurant serves good wholesome breakfasts. On the down side the rooms, although clean, are VERY worn and dated - it was a real let down to an otherwise nice hotel. We arrived very early in the morning after travelling overnight and the guy on the front desk got us a room straight way (check in is usually 3 or 4pm in the afternoon). This extra level of customer appreciation was much appreciated and the kind gesture would be the main reason why I would return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing, one to avoid”
Reviews.Author: tomkoz
Reviews.Content: I travel to NY one week in every four on business. I often try new hotel and encourage my staff to do the same. I stayed at the Park Central for the first time last week. I found it very disappointing. The reception area is fine, but anything above this is tired, bland and grubby. the rooms smell of cigarette smoke and the air con is no better. I asked to change rooms but the staff were not interested in helping I could go on... I left town feeling very disappointed having paid large hotel bill one to avoid

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: planeando2010
Reviews.Content: Best location, however watch out women!! too dim lght in your bathroom, never enough for make up!! not too much water preasure. VERY COMFORTABLE BED!!!!!! no free internet in rooms (too bad)

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: infinatetraveler
Reviews.Content: We made our first trip to NYC and were forunate to find this hotel close to Central park , theater district, subway, food etc. The rooms were well cared for and the staff / service was terrific!

Reviews.Title: “OK. Less grand than then pictures”
Reviews.Author: deepaksji
Reviews.Content: Spent one night (thank God). Got out of the elevators and the room corridors were dank and musty. Oh Oh!! Room itself was OK. Bathroom and room clean but both had a very "tired" look - grouting coming off, veneer missing in room table. Had one small hand soap for both bath and wash basin. The elevators were inordinately slow - fortunately, I was deemed a mere mortal and thus given one of the lower floor rooms. For once I was thankful I was considered "lower-than-Thou", and so I was able to use the emergency stairwell. Huge check-out line, so just gave my "key" to the concierge, so hopefully paid just the $ 230 (inc AAA discount). Massive $ 14 + tax for 24 hrs of internet - No-No. Fine for a night, but fortunately it WAS for a night.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel pluses do not outweigh the negatives”
Reviews.Author: trinaFortWayne
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel recently on a trip with a large group from our church. Our room smelled strongly of mold and dust and the smell never improved, even after the daily "cleaning". The most difficult part of our hotel stay was the fact that the air conditioning did not appear to work at all in our room; although we had the AC cranked to high speed and the coolest setting possible, our room temperature continued to hover at 82 degrees, day and night. Cleaning was less than stellar also; our ice bucket was never emptied and it appeared that the only cleaning done in the room was to replace the towels and to make the beds. There was a whopping $14 a night charge for internet usage in the room. On the positive side... beds were comfortable, no bedbugs that we were aware of (we checked after previous issues reported here in TA). Location of hotel was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Aprehensive before arrival”
Reviews.Author: CliffPortTalbot
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reports I was having doubts about my booking.These doubts quiklley dispelled when we chcked in at about 10pm front desk staffwere friendly and helpful.Our room on the 18th floor was clean and very comfortable .Ther was a fillter coffee maker which was replenised every day.After a day discovering New York it was good to come back to the welcoming hotel bar where all the servers were very friendly. Thr Park Central was recomended to me by a friend who had stayed there in November I have no hestation in recomending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but a marginal 3 stars”
Reviews.Author: wrldgrl22
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and very central to Times Square, shopping and restaurants. You can also get to the Park and Columbus Circle, where you can rent bikes. Cleanliness = just okay.

Reviews.Title: “2 stars at best - bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: robsyr09
