Reviews.Content: the star rating on this hotel in inflated. exaggerating the star rating is the latest thing with on line travel sites. the hotel is dark and dirty. it has bed bugs. it is a 2 star property on it's best day

Reviews.Title: “Park central : nothing works and very rude staff”
Reviews.Author: RossDave
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Park Central hotel for 7 nights : what a nightmare!!! Nothings seems to work there.The shower didn't work and we could not take it out from its holder ,everythime we used the shower as there was a leak in the bath the bathroom floor became a swimming pool,we had 3 phones in the room none of them worked,the curtains were broken and very dirty,the iron was disgusting and wasn't possible to iron even a sock with that while the iron board was so dirty i refused to use it and iron on the little table instead,the lifts didn't work and when they did we had to wait ages for one of them.As soon as we arrived at the hotel they gave us a very small room facing a bricks wall while in our reservation we asked for a big room ( the type we paid for) and a room facing 7th avenue as the hotel gave us the chance to choose of course paying some extra money.We went back to the reception asking to change room with a copy of my reservation and their agreement ,the woman at the reception like all the rest of the staff could not give a toss and she sent us to the manager saying that anyway we had to have that room because they dind't have any other room available!!!We made the booking 4 months in advance!!!! The manager kindly changed the room which still didn't face the 7th avenue but was bigger .Another evening our electonic keys for the room didn't work we managed to call the reception from the corridor phone and they assuered us they would have sent someone ...we waited for half an hour and then we had to go downstairs, the security they told us the nobody ever told them we had a problem with our keys!!!!Last day we were ready to pack everything and go downstairs for the check out : our safe box didn't work we had to call for someone to come and open it : it took about 2 hours and so we arrived late for the check out for something that had nothing to do with us ,the manager wanted to charge us for checking out late!!!!!!On top of all of that last morning my partner could not have a shower as the water was coming out black and full of dirt , while we were on the lifts we heard other people complaining about the water or the lack of water at all and so we started to exchnave views about the hotel,we were 9 people in the lift and NO one was happy with the hotel staff or management. Everytime we asked information or for a taxi at the hotel ,the staff always answered in a rude manner most of the times without listening and carrying on reading or chatting with someone else.The treatment we received in this hotel is AWFUL .And please don't take the black taxi in front of the hotel,the hotel staff tries hard to make you take the black taxi instead of the yellow .The yellow taxis are cheaper MUCH cheaper only once we took a black taxi and we were litterally ripped off : 35 dollars instead of the usual 15 and the driver spent all the time trying to sell us tours and things and as soon as we said we were not interested his manners became very rude .I travelled a lot but I have never experienced such a lack of good manners and such a poor management and service.Please avoid this hotel if you can .

Reviews.Title: “Worst service in Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: YaldaM
Reviews.Content: Not quite sure what is the basis and criteria for hotels' number of stars, but this hotel would not rate higher than 2 stars if it was defined by quality of services and amenities - Not to mention value for money!!! This is a place that charges you for any possible services that they provide you, including keeping your luguage for couple of hours after you check out! In fact they charge higher than Penn station, so you're much better off to just go there and leave your luguage! Also any access to the internet is gonna cost you a fortune. There is wireless in the room, and you have to pay per 24 hours, but it gets disconnected after 20 hours! Alternatively you can use their business centre which is the most expensive per minute internet access you can find in the whole Manhattan. This is wile there is a cafe next door with free internet access! The fitness room is very small and under equiped. In addition to the above, staff are extremely unfriendly and sometimes even rude! All in all, a very unpleasant experience. If you have an option, avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Tippy1311
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous as we got closer to our holiday on May 24th after reading some of the reviews here. But thank goodness we had absolutely no issues. Although we four women in one room didn't spend much time in the hotel other than to sleep, the time we did spend there was great. The mohitos in the lounge served by John were the best we have ever had. He was a wonderful bartender and assisted in getting a rush on our room (although we did stay to enjoy a few more of them). Extra towels were delivered within 5 minutes. We brought along a lint roller to check for bed bugs, but found no evidence. None of us had any problems. The beds were so comfortable we slept for 12 hours straight the first night (well the long travel day and the mohitos probably helped). The toilet 'rocked' a little, and there was mold in one corner of the bathroom - nothing that a little javex couldn't fix. The location was near everything, and the stop for hop on hop off buses for 3 different routes of Manhattan was 1 block down the street. This was our first trip to the NYC and will very likely be returning with out husbands next time. Our plan is to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best avoided”
Reviews.Author: LondonDiesel
Reviews.Content: The Hotel room was dark and dingy, and the curtains badly need cleaning. the whole place is clearly overdue refurbishment. The rooms were noisy with very poor sound insulation - I could even hear the rooms next door turn their light switches off! In addition, there was a strong smell of tobacco, despite the fact that the Hotel is meant to be non-smoking. Elevators were inadequate, and a number of them were not working. No seating available for client meetings. Very poor value for money all round. The location is great; shame the place is such a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: mubis
Reviews.Content: The room was so cold and when we asked to have heating on, guest relations told us that it is not their decision, the maintenance decide to switch on or off the heating. We were ill by the time we checked/out from the hotel. Location is great but if you cannot sleep, no worth staying at a good location. The water was so week at the bathroom and unfortunately the service except at the bar was unbelievably poor. Porters calculate how much they get tip before they give any service. Internet and business center usage is so expensive, be careful before you use business center. The hotel is so busy, so they do not care about guests requests.

Reviews.Title: “Pass on this hotel”
Reviews.Author: incumeg
Reviews.Content: Dirty sheets. Ac was not working when we got to the room. Staff was not helpful. Couldn't get anyone to answer the phone when calling downstairs. Overall def would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Angels845
Reviews.Content: The room was very comfortable, however the room location was not ideal. The window over looks an empty space where air conditioner were. There were no city view from there.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs and Bad Guest Relations”
Reviews.Author: ExecTravel2011
Reviews.Content: We traveled as a group on business to New York this past week. Our preferred Midtown Manhattan hotels were completely booked so we took a chance on Park Central. The rates were extremely high for what it was but Park Central knows they have a good location so they charge higher rates when other hotels are full. Some of the staff was nice and helpful, most avoided eye contact so you would not ask them for help. All of the above could have been excused but then the bedbug bites appeared. My arm has a row of bites from my wrist to my shoulder. Before we travelled we checked the Bedbug Registry but Park Central employees (via phone) assured me that the reports were unfounded and that they had taken preventative measures. Very disappointed and very upset. Will never stay here or at their other locations ever again. When I call to report it they do not want to hear it so I have been passed along to different people in "customer service" until I hang up because I am tired of holding. Park Central could be great but they choose to make money off of being in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best choice for the money”
Reviews.Author: genfur
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a beautiful exterior, but it is disappointing from there. They claim to be four star, but it is really three star. The hotel is older and shows wear. Service is poor...after three requests for a toothbrush from three different people I was finally brought a razor! Front desk was only mildly helpful or friendly. Our room was okay, but drinking glasses were very dirty, no conditioner in room and no wash cloths! I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault it!”
Reviews.Author: HelenC7955
Reviews.Content: We have just returned to London from a week in New York staying at the Park Central Hotel. This has bee our fourth visit there and I cannot faul it. It is in an excellent location, all the staff, and particularly the concierge staff, went out of their way to be helpful. The only comment I would make is that perhaps the rooms could do with a lick of paint however there was no problem with the cleanliness. We will certainly return

Reviews.Title: “excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: 255060Brian
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 11 nights and were most impressed with all aspects of this hotel. Our room was very well presented most comfortable ,quiet, and well serviced.The hotel staff very friendly and helpfull at all times.The location a few minutes walk to Broadway, and Central Park and the cost of our stay most reasonable.I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone considering a stay in NYC

Reviews.Title: “Decent value for Manhattan...great location...everything else subpar.”
Reviews.Author: Richiana
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here during a work trip during days where many of my usual NYC hotels were overpriced and highly expensive so I saw this one through a search engine site and booked it. I did so purely for it's location - and indeed, the location is great. Only a few blocks from Central Park and basically centralized in the heart of Manhattan, it is perfect. The hotel itself is subpar. The service was decent at the front desk, but I had trouble logging onto the WIFI in my room (wasn't a problem with my computer, I think I was just in bad range of the signal). The staff kept passing me to different people and after being put on hold for 15 minutes, I just hung up. I had to go down to the lobby to get any internet access. The rooms themselves need a desparate overhaul, both for appearance and cleanliness purposes. The carpets were dirty, the A/C system was very outdated and it seemed like it was either freezing or hot in there. It reminds you of rooms at the Days Inn, which isn't neccessarily that bad but for the $200+ you're probably paying, it's a shame. When I checked out at 4AM to catch a cab to Penn Station, the Valet gave me a look like he didn't even want to go outside to hail a cab for me. Overall a poor experience; the location is great, so if you're stuck with a budget this isn't a bad option. In the end, how much time are you going to spend in your hotel room while you're in New York City? But there are better options.

Reviews.Title: “A three-starred hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: AnnaNatalia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a nice location, but for a 4-starred hotel the room does not meet the standard. No fridge is available and one of the lamps is not working either. Don't expect for a 4-starred service either. We told the receptionist that the ice machine was not working on our floor. We were told that the machine will only be fixed one week after and were told to get the ice from other floor.

Reviews.Title: “Needs refurbished and cleaned, but staff was great.”
Reviews.Author: spuchta
Reviews.Content: The first night I stayed in the hotel, I first noted how the room really needed to be refurbished (dirty curtains, scuff marks on the wall, old furnishings, etc.), but thought it wasn't really too bad for the cost of the hotel. I made the mistake of waiting until the next morning to check out the shower. It was completely disgusting. Not only had the grout look like it had never been cleaned (moldy!), there was some kind of patch/sticker on the wall and another sticker on the drain. This shower had obviously not been cleaned in a long time. The mirror obviously had not been either as when I got out, you could see where some kids had drawn a beautiful stick figure drawing in the mirror in the steam. I then packed my bags to go to the front desk to ask for a different room for my second night. I talked to Elizabeth C. and she handled the situation perfectly. She apologized profusely and had me check with her later in the day for a new room. When I returned in the afternoon, she switched me to another room, which was 10x better than the last. It seemed larger since there was an actual desk instead of a small table (terrible for a business traveler), and the bathroom was much nicer and cleaner! The staff definitely saved the stay for me! Kudos to Elizabeth and staff, but please refurbish these rooms as soon as you are able!

Reviews.Title: “Huge disappointment. The quality and service were awful”
Reviews.Author: Liberty2011
Reviews.Content: There was a bank of elevators out. It took up to 15mins at times just to get down from the lobby. We reserved 2 rooms. In one the telephone didn't work and in the other the TV was broken. We waited 5 hours for fresh towels to be delivered to the room. Some of the front desk staff were rude, but have to say some were nice. There was a union dispute going on while we were there and they had huge inflatable rat outside and the people spoke of bedbugs. It was a terrible experience thinking the rooms had bed bugs!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location very poor service”
Reviews.Author: Martinmallia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location however the service was very poor, staff at the front desk very unfriendly,rooms not cleaned. Pity cause this hotel is in a great location

Reviews.Title: “Old, unfriendly, poor”
Reviews.Author: tzvety
Reviews.Content: Old furnurure, rood staff and crazy prices for a 3 * hotel. Takes forever to check in and check out. I hated the arrogance of the consierge

Reviews.Title: “worst service ever”
Reviews.Author: kimbo22_11
Reviews.Content: i would have to say that this was the most obnoxious hotel i have ever stayed at , even worse than the hotel Pennsylvania witch is a 2 star hotel that makes you feel like fining a dead body under your bed wouldn't be a surprise . on my first day here i spent over 7 hours in the lobby waiting after taking a red eye from california and when i was finally given my room ket at exactly 4 pm the very latest they guarantee it at i was greeted bye the maid still cleaning my room so i sat in the hall way for an additional 20 min . i was never given a room service menu and even after requesting one several times ended up having to go down stairs and personally pick it up . as for my in room breakfast i hung the request on my door at 9 pm and when i woke up the next morning 30 min late ... with no breakfast i checked the door and the menu was still hanging on my door ! so i called to get my breakfast , although they accommodated me bye serving breakfast after breakfast hours , they did not comp it and also got my order wrong . the maid service is absolutely horrible . they will knock and knock , dont even bother putting a do not disturb sign up . and be careful with your personal items . although my jewelry was not stolen , my make up removing baby wipes were as well as my perfume being used . furthermore they were unable to charge my card correctly it took 3 trips to the front desk to get hat settled . and this is only some of it . overall i would have to say that this was worse than staying at a motel 6 . or maybe a super 8 . but its defiantly not worth your money or time . i think i spent more time in the lobby trying to help these people do their jobs then in time square enjoying my vacation . even after the endless annoyances and problems they have yet to offer to comp one thing . and i know im not the only one , meeting eyes with people in my hall after they come back from a nice day to find out that its 5 pm and the maid still hasnt cleaned their room or because shes knocking on the door every 15 min . speaking of the maid she just called me now . i have a do not disturb sign on my door . i was planning on sleeping in but have already been disturbed 3 x bye the telephone . also i see people in the lobby on a daily basis sleeping and miserable waiting for their room . if your going to stay here to expect to check i until 5pm , dont plan on sleeping in or having a clean room when you get back from going out or getting your room service . i would never recommend this hotel to anyone ,

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time!”
Reviews.Author: dohoff
Reviews.Content: Spent my first weekend in New York City and stayed at The Park Central and can't recommend it highly enough. My room on the 20th floor was spotlessly clean (and for those of you who, like me, are worried about bedbugs - there wasn't one to be found!), the staff is unfailing cheerful and polite. The hotel is in a perfect location and the room rates (for New York City) are excellent. If I am fortunate enough to make it back to New York City, I'll definitely be staying at The Park Central

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectaions”
Reviews.Author: onedsla
Reviews.Content: Great location. Efficient check-in, but only from 4pm. (We were able to keep the room until 3pm without any issue.) Room was clean, of reasonable quality and very quiet (15th floor). A little small, but it is NYC! We chose this hotel as the rate was fantastic, so expectations weren't too high going in, hence suitably impressed by the value. Only downside was having to phone back when the crib we requested on check-in wasn't delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - great location - wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Taposhc
Reviews.Content: Was in New York with family on vacation. The rooms were very well appointed, comfortable beds, very clean bathrooms - lot of towels. Restaurant was not for teenagers but good menu. Staff always ready to help.

Reviews.Title: “location worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Mica0
Reviews.Content: From April3-6, my mom and myself stayed at the Park Central Hotel in NY City. The location was fantastic! About a 10 min walk to Central Park, and less than that to Times Square. Its located on 7th Avenue and right next door to the famous Carnegie Deli, and across the street from Rays the best pizza in NY. The prices are high and they cater to business ppl, but we had 30% off our stay through a "canadian special" through the hotel. Book directly with the hotel to ensure you get a deal, and a quiet room. Our room was on the third floor and in the back, never heard a peep, and the room itself though small was very clean and updated. Save your money and dont eat breakfast at the hotel, there are four or five breakfast places just down the street. Or splurge and go to Sarabeths on 5th Ave and Central Park South, yummm! Would stay there again, especially if theres a special sale!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing experience in an otherwise fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: jhelmgol1
Reviews.Content: I am just completing this trip to the Park Central Hotel which I've stayed at numerous times before. usually it is fine -- well-located, relatively inexpensive and the rooms are fine. But this time I arrived at 1 AM and while they had my reservation, they had no rooms ready. Amazingly, there were 4-5 other parties also being told the same thing -- no rooms clean -- all had resos, but the hotel simply was unprepared. What bothered me beyond that was that they woman at the front desk, and the manager, didn't seem to calibrate that it was 1 AM and they told me it would be 2 hours for a room. Those 2 hours represented, in my case, about 1/3 of my total hotel time. Very little empathy. They did eventually get me a room (an hour and a half later), but did not comp it. So, while this hotel is convenient and well-located, it sometimes misses the boat completely

Reviews.Title: “Ok but tired”
Reviews.Author: Everden99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights in April. The room only had one small window which overlooked a rather disgusting roof top with air con and rubbish and did not let in any natural light so the lighting was generally poor. The curtains refused to pull and we had to tie these together. The air con had no temperature control and so the room was cold although we didn't particularly mind this. In general the room was tired looking and could really do with a deep clean. There were no coffee making facilities which I would have expected. It's an ok place to crash for sightseeing and its location is good from that point of view.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - not great room”
Reviews.Author: seethekids
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. The website is deceptive. The lobby has been re-done, but the rooms are old and very small. Room was ready early - yay. Room was not very clean - nay. Windows opened but looked into a bricked in area with garbage on the ground. Bathroom had very little light, shower was tiled and tiny and no exhaust fan. Also not too clean. Not a good deal for the money. Won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, safe + clean....... price + service - meh....”
Reviews.Author: Red_Three
Reviews.Content: Paid about £700 for a twin room with 2 double beds for 5 nights I was really impressed when we stepped out of the cab to the hotel. Its 2 blocks down from central park, with several subways stations only minutes away- excellent location. The hotel building itself is huge and the lobby was very impressive and new, but once you get beyond this point you realise the hotel itself is a bit dated. Our room was clean, airy, comfortable beds. Flat screen tv. Now the moans, firstly the lift was faulty- the lift closest to our room would bring us up, but wouldn't let us ride it down from the 3rd floor- so we would either have to take th e stairs or walk to the otherside of the building for the other lift. Moan 2- i still can't believe in this day and age that some places still charge extortionate prices for internet access. I think they wanted $15 per 24 hrs for access, or you could use the hotel computers which actually have slots for you to insert dollar bills ,i think it was about $5 for 10 minutes! Moan 3- yep the service was not great. When i was leaving one of the concierges kept pushing me to take a cab direct to newark airport. When i said i was planning to take the train from Penn station he said if i did that i would still have to get a cab from newark station to the airport. This of course was complete rubbish and i ignored him, but its shocking to think that either this guy didn't know how to get to the airport (surely basic info for someone working in a hotel) or he was trying to hustle me. Overall- price is pretty much average for nyc (but i'm only giving it 2 stars for the outrageous internet costs) , i'd stay here again as it was safe, clean and in an excellent location. Service i was not so much impressed with.

Reviews.Title: “very bad service”
Reviews.Author: aboutthathotel
Reviews.Content: The agents were not helpful, friendly, or caring. The check in was not welcoming at all. The room smelled bad, and the concierge was interested in his computer more than he was of the people in front of him.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidHJ29
Reviews.Content: Wow! As you arrive at the hotel it looks fairly grand and the Foyer that welcomes you is no different. Sumptuous sofas and great modern art on the walls, the first impression of this hotel is great. Easy check in (at 3.45pm) with no queues and helpful staff and offered assistance (which we declined) just added to a pleasurable start to the holiday. The room was large and airy with a view (9th floor facing south) of the Barclays building and street below. The bed was comfy and all linen was clean. The bathroom was a touch small but very functional, I would have liked to have a bath but there was only a half bath/shower, no great issues. The bar was pleasant with knowledgeable bar tenders, the restaurant well priced with good food. We even got a "Welcome voucher" for money off our drinks! I would definitely stay in this hotel again and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Ninjahk
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed four nights at Park Central, and was very pleased with our stay! I was a bit worried after reading some of the previous reviews here, but found none of things to be an issue for us. Both the check-in and check-out was quickly done. The elevator-system I actually found to very smart. Press your floor and find the elevator going there - by separating the guests into different elevators one didn't have to stop at every floor on the way up. The hallway was ok. And the room was very nice and very spacious with a little hallway making room for all our suitcases and shopping bags. The bathroom seemed nice and clean. Big and very comfy bed. Flatscreen tv, a dressing table and two chairs. View to the street, from the side. Couldn't find any flaws, but I'm not one going around looking for it either. I have no idea how it looked like underneath the lampshades etc. The room looked and felt nice and clean. I have also seen people complain about having to pay for internet access, but as long as there was a good and free connection in the lobby (were there also was comfortable couches to sit in), I had no problem with that. We even found a free open network in our room that would work from time to time. And the best part of the hotel - the location! Walking distance to Fifth avenue, Colombus Circle, Central Park, Times Square etc., just great! Overall, for the price we paid we were very pleased with our stay. We would recommend it to others and definitely stay there again ourselves the next time we're in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!!”
Reviews.Author: angesouthport
Reviews.Content: Ideal for 3 subways close by, 10 blocks from Time Square 2 from Central Park, just really a lovely hotel. Only negative side was being woken up by housekeeping at 8 am. Im sure else were they start at 10 am

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room in an excelent location”
Reviews.Author: wester28
Reviews.Content: I spent 11 nights in the Park Central Hotel and I had an excellent experience there. I stayed in the two double beds bedroom and it was very comfortable. The room is big and has more space than other similar hotels. The bathroom is also spacoius. And the location is just perfect, close to both Times Square and Central Park. Many good restaurants and cafés are also few steps from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: L123g
Reviews.Content: Great location and value for money but you get what you pay for....a very old out of date hotel with old bedrooms and everything else that goes with it. The hotel is one of the cheapest to stay in in new York...under £100 a night and we had a massive room on 10th floor. Its all you need for a city break when u are out all day exploring the great city.

Reviews.Title: “So pleased!”
Reviews.Author: MegPar11
Reviews.Content: My mother and I recently traveled to NYC and stayed at the Park Central for 5 nights. We received fabulous service from the Park Central staff from the moment we checked in. We were pleasantly greeted and our check in was quick and easy, as well as our checkout. Our room was very comfortable and clean. The rooms could use a bit of a touch up but otherwise were nice. Concierge, Alexandra in particular, was very, very helpful! She got us tickets to a great show for a reasonable price and gave us some tips for the city as well. The location would not be better with many coffee shops and delicatessens just steps away. Central park is practically right outside the door and time square is a short walk away. My mother and I had a fabulous time and would recommend the Park Central to family and friends. We may even return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pleasant staff, room disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sctraveler13
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 3-31 and departed on 4-4. We checked in early and were suprised to find that there was a charge to store our bags. Apparently the hotel covers part of this cost for bags stored at check in, but not at check out. We were in room 750. It did not meet our expectations. The wall had holes, the carpet was stained, and the dresser broken. The bathroom was fine and towels good, the beds were somewhat comfortable and the bedding adequate, the TV a large, flat screen. There is no air in these rooms and you really cannot control the heat. We opened the window to get air in the room which was uncomfortably warm. There are subway stops all around this hotel. Check in and check out was very smooth. The concierge did provide helpful information. There are a lot of very reasonable restaurants in this area. There is no frig in the room, no coffee pot. The restaurant is expensive and they charge almost $15 a day for wi-fi. I would think twice about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “The most comfortable sleep I have ever had!”
Reviews.Author: bacigirl85
Reviews.Content: I usually checkwith Trip Advisor before booking any hotel. This time I booked Park Central because they had availability and I was booking at the very last minute. After booking I decided to check Trip Advisor since I never really heard of Park Central. After reading the reviews, which in large part, were not the most favorable, I began doubting my choice. But I quickly discovered I would have made a big mistake if I canceled. My first contact was with Vito who could not have been more professional,more accomodating, just a real pleasure to deal with. When I explained to him I would be running in a half-marathon and requested a later check-out time, he had no problem accomodating me. Vito also assured me I would have a great room, and he was right. The room does get a little stuffy, but it did not interfere with a great night's sleep. It was very quiet, and you could barely hear any noise beyond your own room. The bed itself was really the most comfortable I have ever slept in, and I have been to many,many hotels in and out of the country several times. The pillows were comfortable, blankets and sheets as well. The room was very clean. It would have been nice to have a coffee maker, but I don't think too many NY hotels have that amenitie. Location is great. Right across from Carnegie Hall, and few blocks from Central Park. Truthfully, I do not understand the bad rap this hotel has gotten. From the moment you walk in your greeted with smiling faces(an extra plug for Germaine (baggage guy) in the back of the lobby. There are fresh apples in the bowls along the check-in area. This will be my "go-to" hotel in the future. Thank you, Vito!

Reviews.Title: “Families beware”
Reviews.Author: richardaviv
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms with interleading doors online. We arrived 12pm and had to check our baggage in with the hotel as the rooms are only ready around 3pm. We were surprised to see that the hotel charges for each bag for this service. When we returned to check in we were told that the hotel did not have two interjoining rooms. Apparently there are only 15 in the whole hotel. It was not clear to us how these rooms are assigned given we were there early on the day of check in. Instead we were put into two adjoining rooms opposite the elevator. The noise both from the corridor and banging in adjoining and upstairs rooms was unbearable. The safe in our room was malfunctioning and would lock but not open necessitating a wait for hotel staff to come extract its contents. The toilet leaked on the floor when flushed, but this seemed acceptable to hotel staff. Ony after much unhappiness and discussion with the hotel manager were we finally moved (after 2 days) to interleading rooms, only to find the door between the two rooms was locked. My advice is that there are many excellent hotels in new york- this is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “I am yet to receive an response!!”
Reviews.Author: Snare1974
Reviews.Content: Dear Sir/Madam I arrived at your hotel on the 17th March, was given a room with two double beds (this is what I booked) but this was supposed to be a renovated room? This clearly was not with tired room decoration and stained lampshades this room clearly hadn’t been renovated for a number of years, I vacated the room immediately and requested a room change at reception, I was given a room with a king size bed (instead of two double beds) on the 24 floor room 2408 this room was supposed to be a “renovated” room once again this was not with peeling paper around the window, cigarette butts on the window ledge, scuffs on the walls, paint work that was chipped & a walk way through to the bedroom from the door to fit a child through due to the bedside table being put in the way & no large towels in room upon arrival. Myself and my mother were very tired from flying from the UK so we accepted the room. But this wasn’t the end of the disappointment, during the stay are linen wasn’t changed it clearly states in your literature in the rooms that this is done every 3 days, the room wasn’t vacuumed during our stay, glasses were left dirty, You can’t regulate the heating at all the room is like a Furness, we slept with the windows open all night & had them open while we were in the room during the day. Also I chose your hotel for the gym facility, the cross trainers are in a serious need of service as the squeak & keep getting stuck which then make them hard to use properly! and hardly none of the TV’s work on any of the gym equipment, Upon check out I was credited $50 for my complaint, I feel this clearly isn’t enough for the dissatisfaction!! Me and my Mum paid over $1200 for our stay with you, I am very disappointed in your service & rooms, I have stayed in your hotel before & have recommended your hotel on previous occasions, I would like to just put this down to bad luck but after a considerable amount coming out of my bank account for our stay I would seriously like a further amount refunded to make me feel like I seriously haven’t been ripped off!! Please can you advise?

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Adequate for Large Group”
Reviews.Author: kufford
Reviews.Content: Hotel guests included many large travel groups (including ours). This was great for us; might not be great at times for individual travelers or families because of the noise and commotion created by the groups. I'd suggest requesting a room away from any student groups. Concierge, bellman, front desk staff were very accommodating. Housekeeping (for special requests - extra towels etc) was hit and miss. Our rooms were clean, and they were basic but not tiny - roomy enough for two adults or four students. Comfortable beds. Some of our group had bathrooms with broken or missing hair dryers. Room temperature was difficult to control. Location is excellent--across the street from Carnegie Hall, walking distance to Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, 5th Avenue shopping, Wide variety of eating establishments close by.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed by the location!”
Reviews.Author: Marti5498
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night stay. The excellent location more than makes up for the lackluster hotel. We found the staff to be pleasant and check-in and check-out speedy. Our room was actually ready 2 hours early. Our room was spacious by NY standards, comfortable, quiet and reasonably clean. Location is perfect with easy walk to Central Park, Times Square, Broadway, and easy access to subway. The hotel lacks some of the extras we have become accustomed to at other NY hotels. No complimentary baggage hold ($3 plus per bag), no complimentary bottled water (available at giftshop for $1.50). The heating system and lighting in our room was horrible. The heater basically has two settings HOT and OFF. No way to just circulate air. The lighting in all areas of the room including the bathroom extremely dim. Having said that at the right price we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Business Practices”
Reviews.Author: CRG12345
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room here though Priceline for March 23rd and am already extremely disappointed. I have used Priceline on many occasions, booked a room for a reasonable rate, call the hotel to request the type of room I need and have NEVER had any issues. I called this hotel and they want to charge me $40 for the benefit of a room with two double beds. I understand and accept the risk that I may not receive my preferred room if it is not available but they have plenty of rooms available. After they add on the $40 upgrade fee I am paying more to stay here than if I simply went to their website and booked a room. This is an absolute scam and a terrible way to do business. I will never stay here again and will never use Priceline again as this is a terrible way to do business. It does not matter how great this hotel may or may not be I could never recommend a hotel that engages in a bait and switch. They are more concerned with gathering fees than providing good customer services.

Reviews.Title: “New York, New York”
Reviews.Author: Sheriff598
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New York and was planned at the last minute. The hotel was in a great location and was very modern. The restroom was small, but was very clean. The overall stay was awesome and provided a great first trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Central, comfortable, clean.”
Reviews.Author: 261621Rose
Reviews.Content: Look, this hotel seems to get bagged out alot. We thought that it was really comfortable and clean. We left very satisfied. Its so central to everything. Times square is just a few blocks away, which makes it close enough, but not too close. Nice stroll for the evening dinner. We were lucky enough to get a room facing 7th Ave. Being country girls, this view was city life perfected! As for the room, Beds were comfy, Bathroom was clean, and we used the air-con to cool down. Not so sure about room service since we were out seeing the sights as much as possible, but check-in, check-out were prompt and helpful. The ONLY downside was the lack of towel rail for a hand towel at the sink (how minor!) and the electrical plugs looked a bit dodgy. Prices were what you could expect in NY, but I think we got 1 night free cos we stayed 4.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth every penny, great location, excellent service....”
Reviews.Author: sun_lover028
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location between park central and times square. Staff were very good and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Manager very responsive”
Reviews.Author: travljunkie123
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Priceline.com through name your price and had to cancel for personal reasons. Priceline.com refused to cancel my reservation and also refused to escalate. I called and spoke to the manager Chris Pazmina and explained my situation and he was so very accommodating and said he would be happy to refund my reservation in full after receiving a call from Priceline. I was so impressed with Mr. Pazmina's customer service particularly after being so poorly treated by Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadtoomuch
Reviews.Content: Second stay at the Park Central in the last couple of years. It's a busy hotel and one that's apparently very popular with international tourists (a plus in my book as it creates a wonderful level of excitement in the public spaces). It certainly is one of the older NYC hotels, and she's showing her age, especially in the rooms. They're clean and comfortable -- for sure -- but a bit dated and "worn around the edges." The heating/air-conditioning system is definitely mid-20th century. The room was stuffy and warm when I checked in but the windows open -- a rarity among NYC hotels -- so I was able to get comfortable quickly. The service was fine. Very good, in fact. Front desk, concierge, bar and restaurant staff were friendly, attentive and efficient without being officious. I felt quite welcomed and at home. The bar was a bit sterile but otherwise enjoyable. The hotel restaurant was a bit steep in price for dinner, but lunch seemed fairly priced and well-done. Only a couple of concerns and there were minor: 1) No coffee-maker in the rooms? That seems to be standard these days. 2) $28 for the breakfast buffet in the hotel restaurant? That seems a bit excessive given the limited items on the buffet. For that much, I would have liked a made-to-order omelet station. Luckily, there are a couple of breakfast places within one block of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: 57Cato
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be very nice. Besides the central location (5 min walk to Central Park, 15 min walk to Times Square), the staff was warm and friendly, the room was large and comfortable, everything was spotless, and they offered a very good price for the area. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unresponsive”
Reviews.Author: 2244bluffrd
Reviews.Content: I left my cell phone in my room while at dinner & a play. The next morning I realized my phone was missing. I spent an hour filing a report with a Security Officer. It has now been 8 months & I've heard nothing from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, safe location for reasonable value with decent clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: desertwood
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over the xmas holidays with my small children. The lobby is extremely modern and warm and impressive. The room was decent and slightly dated but still of a good standard. We had a courtyard view room which was dark of natural light given the lay of the surrounding buildings.The check in staff and door men were extremely helpful (more so than the few times i saw the concierge).

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay, HORRIBLE Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: printgirl08
Reviews.Content: I came with a school group to this hotel to see the armory show. The hotel is nice, the rooms were clean although worn. The location was fantastic, but the customer service was terrible. I have not stayed at a place that had workers as rude as here. No one knew what was going on, none of them were willing to help much. They were just incredibly rude and acted like anything we needed (which was not much at all) was a complete waste of their time and small amount of energy needed. You had to pay if you wanted internet access and parking at their special rate was $43 a day, which I was glad we called ahead because we parked at Seacaucus Junction, NJ and rode the train in for $18/day. I will not stay here again unless I have too.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Bed, Clean room, No Bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: wee_moo
Reviews.Content: Readng reviews prior to our trip, i was VERY concerned and almost wanted to change hotels, but thought, hey, not going to be in room very long anyway, so didnt and i am glad! Hotel room was really big, loads of room and the bed was huge and VERY comfortable, difficult to get out of in the morning!! I was concerned about bedbugs due to a report on here that said there was some, but we never had any!! Room was clean and we were never woken early by housekeeping - one day we were in our room later than usual and we asked if they could come back and it was no problem at all! Not sure what time check in is, but when we arrived at 1.30pm, we were told no room was ready for us and we could store our bags and to come back at 3pm, which was a slight niggle (espesh as we then had to pay to store our bags, only a few dollars, but still! We had paid for the hotel room upfront, which wasnt ready so had to store our bags or drag them round NY with us until 3pm and we were expected to pick up the cost of this?!) Concierge desk was excellent - can get you tickets to shows, give you advice and directions and although we only askd about a couple of things, i seemed like they would have the answer to anything!! Very friendly and helpful. Safe in the hotel room provided peace of mind and was easy to work - really cannot fault the hotel or its staff! Location was excellent with times square just a few blocks away - wait till you see it, what a sight to behold. Totally suggest you get the New York City pass if you are planning on a lot of sightseeing - we paid $190 each for 3 day pass incl 3 day hop on/hop off bus and couldn't have got more value for money, got in loads of sightseeing and would have easily spent a good $200 more if not for the passes. I It is also good as you don't have to guesstimate how much money you may need for food, sightseein, buses etc with this - all you wll need is food money. If you are only planning on doing a couple of things, maybe not so much value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Not so good...Room too hot!”
Reviews.Author: gumbo1107
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel after read some decent reviews of this hotel. We arrived earlier than the check in time(4pm) so we need to leave our bags at the hotel which I have to pay $3.75 per bag.... I stayed at so many hotel in the city and never once have to pay the fee to store my bags. and $3.75 per bag???? that's outrageous!! When we checked in, they "upgrade" us to the concierge king room on 20th floor. The room has no view whatsoever. and like the other review said the room is very hot. even when you turn the temperature to the coolest all it is come out from there is warm air!! We didn't get any sleep at all due to this hot , barely breath climate! room was dated and somewhat not thoroughly clean. We checked out the next day and of course , we have to pay $15.00 to store our bags( $3.75 each,remember?) so we can spend one full day in the city without carrying our bags with us everywhere. NEVER AGAIN with this HOTEL!! and I will tell anyone I know about this bad experience. STAY AWAY! Oh! no free wifi neither. They charge everything obviously!

Reviews.Title: “Good Mid Market Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JamesUK26
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend in NYC staying in Park Central, previously stayed here 2 years ago in an "upgraded/bigger room" this time (in part maybe to late/midnight check in) no option offered and room was signficantly smaller on 12th rather than 24th floor...front desk check in/check out were very short and barely made eye contact throughout the whole process. Hotel lobby/bar area has been renovated in last couple of years but renovation stops there. Rooms are dated particularly bathroom and certainly look their age however Bed was very comfortable (with no bed bugs...despite the big inflatable rat outside the hotel one day we stayed advertising words to the effect) and HD TV with good selection of channels. Housekeeping is very intermittent with one night our room not being cleaned until circa 8 pm at night (Do not disturb was not placed on the door throughout the duration of the day). Location is very good for midtown and quick subway access via 57 st Station, making all principle sites readily accessible. Little things to be aware which are midly annoying: Constant borderline harrasment from hotel employees around checkin/check out times requesting if you want cabs (with the view of leading you to the more expensive town car/private hire options sitting outside), and the fact you have to pay 4 $ plus "tip" to store bags if your flight leaves after checkout....something I believe all hotels should (and do in Europe at least) offer for free...aware this is quite common in the US though. With the horrific prices of NY hotels at times at circa £ 100 a night you really can't go wrong with this hotel and would certainly return however if it creaps up to the £ 200+ a night (which I have seen it does) then I would be inclined to shop around as there are certainly some areas for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: Kico_mei
Reviews.Content: For sure not a 4 atara hotel. Good location, but terrible service, and in front of the hotel had an alert of bugs and rats in the hotel. Rooms without a temperature control.

Reviews.Title: “great location and value”
Reviews.Author: cisca900
Reviews.Content: Our family travelled to NYC in late February- early march 2011, for our family vacation. We were very impressed with the location and surprised with the rates. Out of all the hotels we stayed at in the United States, this was the best one. Our room was clean and spacious and quiet. We'll certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Room was to warm to sleep”
Reviews.Author: whendu866
Reviews.Content: Our stay in this hotel was not great. The hotel staff was great, but the room size was rather small. The biggest problem we had was the temperture in the room. It was so hot that we had to spend two (2) nights sleeping with the window open on the 24th floor. When we complained, they sent up a fan. We left that in the window, but the room never really cooled down even with the heat turned off. The only thing they did for us at check out was say sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Location superb! Courteous, helpful staff;ample, tidy room;clean bed/bath, but didn't vacuum room or hall.”
Reviews.Author: Jisha
Reviews.Content: Super location two blocks from Central Park. Directly across the street from Carnagie Hall. Walking distance to Times Square/Teater Dist., Rockefeller Center, MOMA, MET,Guggenheim, Lincoln Center, Hell's Kitchen. Subway outside door. Several coffee shops, delis, bakeries, bars, restaurants in immediate vacinity. Much shopping close by on Park, Madison, 5th, etc. Professional, attentive, responsive staff. Rooms were very spacious. For the most part hotel was clean, but I think they need to replace, or perhaps just use their vacuums. Our room was not vacuumed for 3 days, and it did not appear to have been vacuumed after the previous guests either. The hall was similar, with a long strand of dental floss on the carpet in the middle of the hall all week. However, bathroom seemed clean, as did bedding, and we found no evidence of bed bugs--trust me, I looked! No real "views" to speak of, higher rooms can see some of Times Square, but that's about it. Inside facing rooms are quiet, but lousy view. We've been to NYC many times and this was the best for price, location, staff. Don't bother with priceline, etc. Go straight to hotel website and you can do just as well on price, and will be not locked in, except for 24 hours in advance. We paid $384 including all taxes (and they are hefty in NYC...4 different taxes on hotel rooms) for 3 nights. Would stay here again but next time I would insist they come vacuum my room. The place is a little worn (I described it as what I imagined the carpeting/furnishing of the Titanic was like--before it went down)--I just had to think European style (older, lived in), except much larger rooms, and then I was cool with Park Central. Great food we found: Ariana's Afagan on 9th betw.52/53; Gyu-Kaku in Midtown or East Village; Empanada Mama 9th bet. 51/52; Tisserie right next door to Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific value in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: bostonterrier
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here, and it was great. We got upgraded from a king to two doubles by Fred (very nice front desk guy). He gave us a quiet room, nicely renovated -- flat screen tv, spacious bathroom, comfy beds, coffee maker. The location is the best for touring Manhattan sites--a bit far far from Greenwich Village and Soho, but 15 minutes by subway works, too. Super greek restaurant, Molyvos, across the street and Fluffy's Bakery. Around the corner from Carnegie Deli...what's not to love about this place?

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by previous poor reviews.”
Reviews.Author: philzt
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back after a 4 night stay. Hotel is perfectly acceptable particularly bearing in mind the cost. Great location only 5 mins walk from Times square. We were on a 4 day trip to see the sights and enjoy the social side of NYC, so a good clean hotel is all that is required to tick the boxes. Rooms are more than adequate for the purpose required ie sleep and shower.

Reviews.Title: “3 good things about this hotel: 1. Location 2. Location and 3. Location :-)”
Reviews.Author: rd_hegde
Reviews.Content: ....that about sums up my experience of this hotel. The location is excellent. Its in mid-town Manhattan, with Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Times Square and the shopping districk of 5th Avenue within easy reach. The service wasn't great, though. Though I had a booking, some confusion led to a 2 hour wait when I landed there after a red eye (quite literally) flight. Room service used to forget to replenish one or the other stuff required for coffee-either the coffee, creamer or sugar. When I asked for it, I was told that the hotel doesn't provide creamer for coffee! Rather, impolite, I think! The concierge was good and they cheerfully provided me directions and a subway map when asked.

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury hotel but it does the job. Stay here for the GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: app05156
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Park Central. While the hotel seems a little worn in the public areas (nothing terrible but not that brand new feel), the location on 56th and 7th cannot be beat. Two blocks from the park, 5 or 6 to Times Square, and 100 feet to the Carnegie deli. The room was perfect size, clean and the bed was very comfortable. If you want to stay in the city this is the place

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoriTheo
Reviews.Content: When I saw that this was a fairly inexpensive hotel in NYC, I was a little nervous about the cleanliness, service and size of the room. We were pleasantly surprised. Not your most luxurious hotel in the city, but very clean and nice. Staff was very friendly. Room was very clean and pretty big for NYC rooms. Nothing but great things to say about the Park Central. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: irshcladda
Reviews.Content: I found Park Central on hotels.com, & the rates seemed reasonable for the location. I was going there for my g/f's 28th birthday and wanted it to be very special for her. When I called to make the reservation, the desk person talked me into the "Times Square View" room which given the occasion seemed like a nice upgrade. When we finally checked in , our Time Square View Room was a window facing the back of another hotel. When I called to complain/change rooms, they told me there were NO MORE Times Square Rooms. Having reservations at a restaurant and other things to do in the city for the night, we were stuck beteween a rock and a hard place. I went to turn A/C on, because it was very warm in the hotel/room..and it DIDN'T WORK. Went to grab the iron and there was an ironing board, but NO iron. The water coming form the sink was "cloudy" in a glass it was poured into. Upon check out the next day, I mentioned all of the above to the manager. He charged me a standard rate for the room instead of the "Times Square View" rate, & offered us free coffe and pastries inside their restaurant. The room was small, and certainly not worth it for the lack of amenities I found inside it. There are lots of other places to stay in NYC, and I will make sure to pick any one of them over the Park Central the next time I go.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Gemma2011
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th visit to New York and I stayed at the Park Central Hotel from the 13th February to the 18th of February with my Mum on a visit to New York. Prior to travelling to New York i had read the reviews on this website and was very worried about staying at the Park Central Hotel. Do not believe all the negative reviews on this website the hotel was excellent.I have very high standards and had stayed at the hotel Sofitel which is 5 star at London Heathrow Airport the night before my flight to NYC. When we arrived at the Park Central Hotel check in was easy and welcoming by the staff at the desk. Staff were friendly and were lovely to chat to. The room itself was lovely. We had two double beds in our room which were very comfortable and bedding was clean and fresh. The room i found was big, roomy and bigger than other hotels i had previously stayed in, in New York. The room in the Park Central contained plenty of storage space which was very handy for clothes and shopping. I also thought it was excellent that the hotel room contained a safe which was free of charge as other hotels i have stayed in, in NYC have contained no safe or other hotels have charged me for this service. The bathroom in our room was also very nice, clean and the shower was excellent. Clean extra towels were given to us each day which was great. The elevators in the hotel were also amazing very up to date and modern. I liked the fact that on every floor there were vending machines with a selection of drinks which was so handy. The lobby itself was contemporary and stylish and the staff in the lobby were very helpful in providing us with transport to JFK airport on the last day. Generally i felt very safe in this hotel and the location was excellent. Being next to two subway stations transportation to everywhere in New York was easy and it was nice being in the centre of everything yet at the same time being next to Central Park. I would definantly stay at this hotel again. The hotel provided me with an excellent base and was the best hotel i have stayed at out of four that i have been too in New York. I would say the only thing that the hotel could provide to improve service would be to have a tea/coffee making facility in the room and maybe a fridge for storing bottled water otherwise everything else was perfect. I would like to say a huge thank you to the staff at the Park Central who helped provide a quality stay on our trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: ZebP
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel right in midtown this is it. Close to Central Park, Times Square, Carnige Hall etc... Nothing too special, overall the room was clean, bed was comfy (no bed bugs). I booked one night for $96. I'd stay again but wouldn't pay over $150 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay and look forward to staying again.”
Reviews.Author: Kathee1
Reviews.Content: I love the location. It is in the middle of everything. The customer service representatives were very professional, courteous and expeditious in getting their customers checked in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: brainman
Reviews.Content: Found a discount rate on their web site for a king room on a higher floor, breakfast included. Was much, much cheaper than other hotels in the area. Requested room facing inward, not much to see but very quiet for NY. With the air cleaner in the room turned to low, was very quiet and comfortable, and no bedbugs! Breakfast was OK, not many choices and almost impossible to get a glass of water from the waitstaff (had to ask 4 times), but was included in price for room. If bought separately may be too expensive. Subway stop very close to hotel. Gave me later checkout than usual to wait for status of my flight out of LGA during the storm, desk staff were very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: dizzylizzie55
Reviews.Content: Was very happy with our experience at this hotel. The rooms are a good size, very clean, with comfortable beds and a TV with more channels that you could ever watch! Very quiet for a New York hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful and booked us a taxi to the airport on our final day. The location is perfect for sightseeing - very close to a subway station, a 5 minute walk from Central Park and Times Square and a little further to te Empire State Building and Rockafeller Centre. Close to lots of cafes, bars and restaurants etc. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: 101dalmations
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in December. There was trash behind the night stand. The edges of the hem of the sheer drapes at the window was visibly dirty and unsightly. The woman at the front desk was rude. Check-out time is noon. I had a do not disturb card on the door, but at 10:30 a.m. while I was in the shower, the maid knocked on the door. There is no free wireless in the rooms. Expect to pay $14.00 per night. You can get free wireless if you hold your laptop on your lap on a bench in the lobby by connecting to the coffee shop in the next building. I won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Andy_Wilson_Wilmslow
Reviews.Content: I often see some bad reviews for this hotel so I had to write my own. Firstly, the location can't be beaten (few blocks from Central Park and Times Square). The hotel is clean and the staff friendly. I've stayed here many times and always recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in a perfectly located hotel”
Reviews.Author: J-So101
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed two nights at Park Central and while I was nervous after reading bad reviews, we had a lovely stay with absolutely no problems. The hotel has the feel of an Eastern European business hotel (and I mean that in a good way). It is not fancy and feels slightly worn, but our room was very large by New York standards, clean, and had everything we needed: comfortable bed, nice TV, hairdryer. The walls were a bit thin - we could occasionally hear the neighbors' TV, but it was never a problem and did not affect our sleep or comfort. The hotel has a large lobby where you can access free Internet from the coffee shops next door, a lobby bar, and friendly concierge. The location is excellent for tourists. It is just two blocks from the SW entrance to the 57th St/7th Ave subway stop, far enough from Times Square to avoid crowds, walking distance to MOMA and many other sites. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great location”
Reviews.Author: bamanumberone
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location close to times square central park and the subway.The service was good. We had the breakfast every morning and the food was good--standard buffet breakfast. The rooms where clean and large by NY standards

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel and staff.”
Reviews.Author: elijahtrotsky
Reviews.Content: I'm very impressed with the Park Central. Extremely reasonable price (got it on Priceline, stayed an extra day due to cancelled winter flight) manager Lina gave me a very reasonable price for the day I stayed because of inclement weather and cancelled flights. Room was spectacular, clean and roomy. Staff was A+. Location is ofcourse perfect. 5 stars by me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and good facilities”
Reviews.Author: wonda_womn
Reviews.Content: This place is a great location for all the touristy things close to south central park. It is about a 5 minute walk to times square and a 2 minute walk to central park. It is a large hotel and was very busy whilst we were there. It is half a minute fromt he tube station and had all the facilites that a large hotel should have. The restaurant was nice, but there are heaps more around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Third Room was Close enough to the Charm”
Reviews.Author: laurengucsb
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay here in October and reviewed the hotel very favorably back then. I was in town with 15 colleagues in January and we had gotten a great group rate to stay at this hotel, including upgraded rooms (which should have been the same room type I stayed in back in November). The hotel has a great location near our office and with hotel rates so high in NYC, we were happy to find an affordable option, especially one I could recommend firsthand from my last stay. Unfortunately it was an absolute disaster. I arrived at about 1am Monday morning, got checked in, went up to a room and straight to the bathroom only to find it had not been cleaned (see photo). Whatever was in there had been sitting for a while and the bowl looked all around. There were also hairs on the bathroom floor, several, which just made me feel that the room had not been cleaned. I immediately went downstairs and said that room was not acceptable. Btw, the room size and quality was MUCH worse than what I experienced in the upgraded room before. I was given another room, no apology for the problem in the first room, although I was told to call downstairs to let them know if the room was okay. But that point I was exhausted and just needed to get some sleep, so when I got in the room and the toilet was clean (although there was still a hair on the bathroom floor), I just made sure to check the matress and sheets for bedbugs (no signs of everything) before going to bed. Overall, both of the rooms were smaller than I had been in and overall looked very dingy, old and in general like they need a good cleaned (for example, don't lose the remote behind the nightstand, it's filthy back there!, I didn't want to walk on the carpet barefooted). If it was only me, I probably wouldn't stayed in the second room without an issue. I have never changed rooms for such a problem in the past and I spent more than 50 nights a year in hotels of all star levels. I was mortified when I got to work though and heard that nearly every colleague I was staying with had had pretty bad problems. I couldn't believe this had happened after my good stay before! I took notes of all the problems and called my hotel contact at lunch to say we all needed to be in better rooms or we'd be checking out. Here are the problems that were shared with me: toilet wouldn't flush (2 people, one it was fixed for), shower wouldn't drain (several people), hair on the floor, generally not up to a clean standard, phone was broken, remote was missing from one of the rooms, sheets were dirty and had to be changed on one room. I was shocked that there were such problems. My colleagues and I have reasonable expectations of having a clean room where things work -- nothing fancy, just that. When I called, and all throughout my dealings with the hotel, I really don't have many complaints. They seemed shocked to hear about the problems and really tried to help. While it did take a bit of back and forth, and it still wasn't great when we moved rooms, I have to say that they handled it pretty well. I first talked to my contact who I had negotiated the rates with. I found out that only a few of us were in the negotiated deluxe rooms -- i said we all needed to be in the rooms and she said that she could upgrade me to a suite, but they were sold out of deluxe rooms... what?! that's what we PAID to be in! I told her she needed to refund our entire bill and we'd be moving hotels... well, then the GM called back and said he would move us all Not sure where the rooms magically came from. I got put in a nice suite, clean, good size, I had no complaints. Some of my colleagues were fine with their new rooms, although there was still a handful who said there was no apparent difference between the Deluxe room and the other room they were in (no cleaner, no newer, no bigger, etc), although at least everything worked in the room. This was pretty disappointing. I met with the GM and we did work out a better deal, but overall it was such a disappointing experience that the hotel just was not up to a good standard. If it was just my room that needed to be changed, that would be one thing. I know things happen, but when 90% of my group was appalled by their room, had to change rooms up to 3 times, that's just unacceptable. It's too bad b/c I need to plan a lot of trainings in NYC and we're not taking any chances this time and staying at the W instead. Even in the suite I was in, there was a dull sound of a dishwasher/washer just outside of the back corner of the room (24th fl). If my husband was with me, he probably wouldn't have had any problem sleeping, but it was obnoxious to me and I had to wear earplugs. Overall, I feel that once the issue was elevated, they were trying to help and were quick in responding and trying to find a solution. Definitely made concessions that helped but at the end of the day, we weren't in the rooms we were supposed to be in, and even when we were, there were problems with them, even several days in and after talking to everyone. Management has to clean up for poor front desk and housekeeping staff. checkout was fast and were able to stick to what they promised. bottom line, really depends on the room. i've now stayed in two very solid rooms for the price, but also saw 2 that were unacceptable, along with all those that were unacceptable to my colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: EduTravelerMidwest
Reviews.Content: For the price, I think this hotel is a good deal. You can find good prices on Priceline or even directly on their site. We checked extensively for for bed bugs and did not find any. We found the hotel to be quite clean PROS: + Good value for money + Great location - very close to Times Square and Central Park + Very clean CONS - No real light-blocking curtain (makes you wake up earlier than you may want) - Have to pay $3.75 for luggage check, it isn't free OTHER FACTS - 4 P.M. Check-in time but you can get there early

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: fsk70
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Park Central many times over the last 10 years. This was a bad experience. I had a business dinner to go to and when I got to my room there was no hot water not even warm water. I did not have time to do anything about it as I had to leave. I returned to my room at 10:00 and all night long a machine was running as well as the traffic until 3:30 in the morning in the room across from my room. I didn't sleep at all only to have to leave without a shower. When I checked out I told them about the water and as one said oh we are sorry the manager turned his head. The service in the restaurant for coffee was terrible. Never again

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ricky53
Reviews.Content: Had a King Concierge suite for one night....really nice! Cannot think of one negative thing about the room. Their little kiosks down in the lobby would not work for airline check-in, and we couldn't check out via the TV either. Did check out with the telephone. Every employee we talked to seemed very nice and helpful. Super location; attended Carnegie Hall, dined at the Redeye Grill and ate breakfast at the Carnegie Deli --- ALL very close. Then walked down to Broadway after the show. Would've walked the other direction to Central Park the next morning, but weather was too cold.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: r0xii
Reviews.Content: I stayed here back in 2009, I would love to go back again sadly the prices have gone up a lot since I went! I was a bit disappointed we had to pay $100 on each room when we arrived although you do get this back when you leave. I had a problem with my room card, but they soon fixed the machine on the door seeing as it wouldn't lock. Apart from this the hotel was great, right in the centre of NY with just a short walk to times square. It's also right by the subway which is extremely useful. Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Clogged toilets, dirty sheets, broken showers, bad service - AVOID!”
Reviews.Author: SFZoo
Reviews.Content: I'm not even sure where to start. I stayed at the Park Central this week for a business trip and was disappointed (and pretty disgusted) on every level. I entered my room on the 11th floor on Sunday afternoon to find that the toilet was stopped-up (with someone else's business) and although I called twice to have it resolved, no one ever came to my room. I later took a shower and the drain was completely plugged, causing the tub to fill to the brim with filthy water from the pipes. There were dark, curly hairs all over the room - in the sheets, on the floor, in the sink, in the tub - so it obviously hadn't been cleaned before I got in. There was dirt in the corners of the floors, stains on the furniture and lamp shades and missing light bulbs on the lamps. I finally packed my belongings on the second morning and requested a room change. The reception desk did not apologize for the errors, nor did they offer me a new room. After much convincing, the guy at the desk told me they "might" have a new room available later that night and that I should store my bags. I went into the office that morning to find that all 12 of my colleagues had experienced similar problems - dirty sheets, dirty bathrooms, stopped-up toilets and clogged showers. Needless to say, the sanitary conditions of this hotel are no where near adequate for the price they charge. All that said, the hotel manager offered to move the entire group rooms to "upgraded" rooms (which ended up being the same exact room on a different floor). While my second room's toilet worked, it smelled like someone had chain-smoked in there for a week (this is a non smoking hotel) and I had to sleep with the window open each night. Our further complaints to the manager about these issues were disregarded and ignored. After surviving four nights here, I couldn't be happier to leave. I can only hope that my company gets a partial refund for the distress this place caused us. There are hundreds of hotels in New York and many at competitive rates right now. Don't waste your time and money on this place -- you can do much, much better.

Reviews.Title: “had the best time in the best room in the best location!”
Reviews.Author: RhiiandDrew
Reviews.Content: Date of stay from the 12th-17 december :) this is the second time i have stayed in park central last visit was 07 and i found the hotel fine, but a tad basic and my other traveller had problems with the room service but apart from that everything was fine. On this visit i and my boyfriend started looking at reviews and i was so scared reading the bad reviews on here, about staff rudeness, dirty bathrooms, smells, robbing, and not getting your moneys worth. Well, all the bad reviews must have stayed at a different hotel, it was perfect! i was hoping as it was the christmas period the hotel would have festive decorations, and whilst walking into the lobby it had several false xmas trees with white lights very cute :) due to BA loosing our bags when checking in we asked the person at the desk to keep a record and they should be getting deliverd later on in the evening she did ask if we needed any help with our bags atleast 3 times but we just laughed it off she may of had a long day. When asked if we needed 2 room keys we where told we where staying on the 20th floor! By reading reviews on here i do remember someone saying about asking for a room from the 16-26th floor as there better and more 'renevated' The lifts are better than last time and where instantly fast even though the hotel was packed in the lobby at all times, stepping out the decor was nice and we noted the room we where staying i (we loved it!) 2021 was a corner room, when entering it the bed was huge, maybe a superior king? but mainly i know of the room sizes anyway from the last visit but this was something else, we had 2 huge windows each looking out around broadway & leading to times square, from the north window we could see a huge wicked poster and the building around where so nice, if you lay in bed you could see a building (dont ask not sure, green triangle roof) all light up was very nice. After reading about bed bugs we checked everything, it was fine, spotless, big television coffee maker, desk, 2 telephones, armchair, 2 bed side tables and lights, and the bathroom was spotless (made sure to check for instant hot water) all park central complimetary things around the room, a walk in (kind of) closet with a safe, coathangers, iron, and 2 extra pillows and a little quilt, the bed had about 6 pillows on it though and it was very comfy to lye in, my boyfriend did complain however he woke up in the night quite cold and had to turn the heating on which was simple anyway. Room cleaning daily if required and lifts to go down where very quick. Because of the luggage still missing the front desk where very helpful by ringing jfk and also leaving our room phone messages of any progress, the doorman (big Al) greeted you every morning asking if we needed a cab he then recommended us to go get breakfast in the brooklyn diner (everyone go its really good and will fill you up all day - ask for pink lemonade its the best). One night we arrived back around 2am and where greeted by a very much alert member of staff saying good morning yet the bar was closed drinks could be brought up to the room haha! As for the staff's manners they where so polite and helpful we booked a shuttle to get from the hotel to JFK no problem with it and it was very cheap, we paid $5 to hold our luggage for an hour and 1/2 and after a trip to carneige deli (cheescake!) we where allowed to check out at 1pm instead of 12. It was a perfect trip and the location well, that is one of the main reasons we chose this hotel and around the christmas period with all the street decorations its loverly, not to mention the christmas cottage directly oppostie the main entrance, its a must if your bringing back trinket things. Times square is like 5 minutes away yet you cant hear anything at night nor in the hotel, we enjoyed it that much were already looking to go back and we may ask for the same room! :) It wasnt just look at getting the room all in all the hotel was brilliant along with the staff and also the little corner shop located by the lifts and back entrance the man working there was so helpful in advising on medicine for my boyfriends fever - advil. Wish we got them over here. Great hotel, no problems, amazing location & amazing room. New York we love thee.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting hotel!”
Reviews.Author: madhatter72
Reviews.Content: The elevators smelled like raw sewage. The appearance of the hallways and rooms is very tired and worn. Everything looked, felt, and smelled dirty. I would definitely not recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to NYC. I am still disgusted by the thought of staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced but barely any flaws!”
Reviews.Author: Lauryn4u2nv
