Reviews.Content: Me and a friend stayed here for 10 days in August 2009 (i couldnt select 2009 from the drop down above) anyway, we got to the hotel, and approached the desk - the clerk asked for the debit card i booked with, i told her that i will be paid from work on the Wednesday (we arrived on the Sunday) but no, she said they "needed to hold the money" which i can understand, but we were british and were hardly going to do a runner. So, we couldnt check in (and she had no words of wisdom or no helpful advice!!) Ended up having to pay for a phonecard to ring home - called my dad who had to go through the palarva (excuse the spelling) of scanning his credit card and drivers license over to the hotel via email so my dad had to foot the bill & me pay him back. FINALLY got into our room - was very spacious and clean, brilliant sized bathroom and they had a safe!! The TV was at the end of the bed and we were able to watch Family Guy and Criminal Minds (my 2 fave shows) Bathroom had a large sink, a bath & shower and a wall length mirror above the sink - there was also a mirror on the bathroom door which helped me get up close to do my eye make up! We had an issue with the coffee pot - it was in the bathroom (electrics & water do not mix) me, being British had no clue how to work the coffee pot, i managed to spill water and coffee in the bathroom and was too scared to turn off the electrics so we ran to reception and asked for help. They swiftly sent up a maintenance man who sorted it out within seconds and a fantastic maid who replaced our coffee and condiments and who also we had to force her to take our tip. She was amazing!! Was a club opposite the hotel - didnt hear a peep from it though. No smoking in the rooms either, it was a long trip from the room down to outside for a cigarette oh and the lifts are rather confusing - odds and evens more or less!! When we stayed there, there was scaffolding all around it, didnt bother me, i was hardly there. Location wise it was good - subway right on the corner - took us to statue of liberty and Soho. Round the corner from Carniege Hall and we walked it to 5th ave and Madison, however, we made the mistake of walking to find Forever 21 & ended up by Macy's (Macy's was like lower down manhattan!) On our 2nd day we walked to Natural History Museum - we took the route past Columbus circle and straight down past Central Park (i had to stop on the way back to gawp at the Dakota building - amazing!) Central Park itself is HUGE, we couldnt get around it, so we went to Whole Foods at Columbus Circle and picked up sushi and sat in the park to rest our feet. You can also buy a metro card and i think its for 5 days (i forgot, dont quote me) on the subway which is soooo worth it, get one on the first day!! I have relatives who live in Lower East, we took a cab there, cost next to nothing! All in all, i love New York City, if i had the money, i'd move there. Amazing city, amazing people and amazing food (Ray's pizza!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Central, Convenient, Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Kyleesmilee
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel would be hard to be beaten. Central Park, Times Square and other places are within exceptionally easy walks, and the tourist buses are very nearly outside the door, while the subway is directly underneath you. Great cafe's and restaurants are across the road or within a minute's walk (I DO NOT however reccomend dining at Patsy's Italian Restaruant). Regarding the hotel, my mother and I shared a room with two double beds on the foruth floor from 19th to 23rd December 2010. It was very clean and the beds comfortable however there was no facilities to make tea or coffee in your room which is disappointing. It's not the Ritz but it's not tragic either and for the price in central New York I think it's excellent. It was noisy with a lot of traffic etc from the side-street we looked out onto so I do reccomend bringing ear plugs. One other area we were very disappointed with was that we had requested that we NOT be given a room with one of those (locked) interconnecting doors which lead to another room however this is exactly what we got and had to put up with the couple in the next rooms spoilt child acting up when we were trying to sleep, however as we had been so anxious on arrival to check the beds for bugs we had already wrecked the beds by the time we noticed the door, and finding no bed-bugs decided we had better leave things well alone! Regarding customer service, we found the cleaning staff to be very friendly and helpful, much more so than some of the young female front desk staff who (with the exception of the ladies at the tourist/theatre booking etc desk) seemed to forget that they wouldn't have a job if it wasn't for hotel customers. Someone did charge a days worth of meals to our room from the hotel restaurant to the effect of an extra $100 however the male frontdesk staff member did not argue with us regarding this and amended the bill. All in all, we would both definately reccomend the hotel for convenience, comfort and price, and we experienced NO BEDBUGS from our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: breekers12
Reviews.Content: Spent the evening of December 30th with my wife. It was a last minute trip and I booked this hotel through Hotwire. Once the hotel name was communicated I checked out the mixed reviews on Trip Advisor and was not sure if I would like this hotel. I was quickly convinced that it was a good choice. At check in we were greeted by Michael. His positive upbeat personality was freshing and he encourage us to ask many questions. His knowledge of the area was exceptional. I requested a room in the recently remodeled section and he assigned us a room on the 25th floor which was one level from the top floor. The room was immaculate, the temperature perfect, and the view was exceptional. Our corner room overlooked the two directions of the city and we were able to see the river between the skyscrappers. The elevator system was very efficient and we never had to wait more that a few moments for a car. The entire staff was very helpful and aimed to please. I would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Really Quite Pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: sunandsealuvr
Reviews.Content: I booked a room on priceline for $90/night . After reading the reviews on Tripadvisor I was really worried that I had booked us a room in hell itself! Honestly though, we had a delightful time - all our interactions with the staff were very good, We had a room on the 17th floor (I think this may have been one of the non renovated rooms) - that being said - there wasn't anything wrong with the room other than very minor cosmetic issues (like the bathroom grout patched in a slightly different color). I was very nervous about bed bugs so I inspected the mattress and bedding to look for any signs - didn't find a thing (the mattress looked new and felt like a dream). The room itself was clean and the shower had plenty of pressure.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice stay, clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: kgj28
Reviews.Content: We stayed here, even though we read the bad reviews and we were not disappointed, the room was clean, spacious and close to everything. It is only about three block from Central park, right next door to a Starbucks, the fitness center is well stocked and the staff were helpful and friendly, if we decide to return to New York, we will stay here again. Only negative thing, they charge you for Wi-Fi. Not cool. Most other places are free, and it doesn't make sense especially if you are next door to a coffee house.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge King on 20th floor – great location and value”
Reviews.Author: WhitHawaii
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Park Central Dec 16-20 and were pleased with the hotel. I’m glad I didn’t let a few of the negative reviews keep me away. What I noticed on them and then found to be true is that it depends on your room. If you’re on the Concierge level or above, the experience is a good one and the value is there, too. We had a Concierge King on the 20th floor that was large and had nice views. It had its own heater that we controlled, so the temperature was fine. Noise from the street was minimal and didn’t bother us at all. I’m guessing that it was renovated within the past few years. Location is superb. The front desk was pleasant and helpful. The Concierge was helpful, too. We arrived about an hour early and were quickly given a room. The night before departure we asked for a late checkout (1pm) and they granted it without any push back or fuss. I’m a deal hunter, so I don’t know if I’ll stay here again. This time, we got a bigger and superior room at a much better rate (roughly avg. $240/night), so it was definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central - a first room nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Talbs16
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we noticed the location and lobby were excelent. The concierge and front desk was efficent and fast. It wasn't until we got to our room we realized we had entered a dirty hotel. The sheets in one bed had all different types of hairs in it, the other bed had an unidentified dry crusty stain, which I could only be lead to believe to be one thing that I will not share on this forum. The bathroom had red nail polish all over the sink and counters and the room had a mildew odor that was embarrassing for a hotel that claimes to be 3.5 stars. To top it all off there was a dried up piece of boogie and snot on the wall by the beds. We phoned and received no apology, just the "you want the sheets cleaned", well what about all the other messy stuff, that smell wont go away with the sheets. We demanded a room change and when describing to the bell hop what happened, he said "I'm just the bell hop!" and offered no convenience to help with bags or offer an apology on behalf of the hotel. The service in the restaurant was extremely slow, but the food and ambience was decent.

Reviews.Title: “What a travesty!”
Reviews.Author: Grazor
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this place or return. Its shabby and tired. The rooms are atrocious and are very very basic and certainly mine was in dire need of some paint. The place is run down. As a non smoker, I managed to get a room that someone had used for smoking, which meant my clothes smelt of smoke. Sleeping was an issue because of the smoke smell . While the staff at reception as quite helpful, it took way too long to get checked in. at almost $400 per night so much is lacking. Oh yes one final point, the cheap sods will charge you $3.75 to check each bag. That is truly offensive.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: GZMOA
Reviews.Content: the location of the hotel is appropriate. just near the central park in midtown. 1 min to subway. the hotel is a big nice one however our room is very very cold. The people in the reception also told us that they have nothing to do but just could give us extra blankets. Although the hotel is warm enough we had problems with our radiator. We are also told that this big hotel did not have any seperate heater. I will not prefer this hotel again and do not recommend anyone. .

Reviews.Title: “It's pretty nice, rooms are well kept, good location, .but the staff is cold”
Reviews.Author: rlmartin4729
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and nice, and the beds were very comfortable. The location is across the street from a subway station, and Rockafellers Square, Radio CIty, 5th avenue, Times square, and Central Park are all within walking distance. The staff is very rigid and doesn't go out of their wayt, but the conciere desk is very helpful

Reviews.Title: “New York Attitude and No management Attention”
Reviews.Author: frankellis63
Reviews.Content: What a pity that a hotel in this splendid location is full of staff who don't like to be pestered and have no desire to deal with customers. Everything in this hotel is an extra. I was not surprised 'no late check outs' since we were charged $3.75 per bag for 2 hrs storage and of course this was nothing to do with the hotel. There is a complete absence of management, no friedly care and no business facilities. I was never charged $25/day for a coffee machine and internet access before. There are no real facililities for business people. This is Las Vegas or Blackpool. So don't expect too much for the 4 star rating. It's tired and the 'superior' rooms are economy standard at best. Upgrade and swallow hard. It's New York/London prices and full of attitude. Within 150 yards 3 places to visit, Russian Tearooms, Italian restaurant Trattoria Delle' Arte and Carnegie Delhi. Wow!! Much better service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Location”
Reviews.Author: Irishstraw
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights with my sister for a shopping/sightseeing excursion to New York. Got a great deal on a double room through via Trip Advisor web site and thus my review will be more biased based on price paid. Hotel entrance gives one impression of a much more modern hotel and once you step out of the elevator, it is likely stepping into a totally different place which is definitely a disappointment. Hallways are narrow and dark. The room itself was, as expected, an very average room with two doubles but it was very clean and free of bedbugs which was a relief. We did a complete check of bed, sheets and between mattresses with no signs of the little critters and no bites in the morning. We did find the room temperatures too hot at times but as there was no air conditioning running in hotel, the only way we could cool it down was to open the windows. The service desk offered to send up a fan and a service man came within 20 minutes of our complaint to show us how to open the windows. We were happy enough with this resolution. The service was excellent in the hotel, check-in was fast and pleasant, the concierge was extremely helpful in assisting us in best ways of getting to airport and the cleaning staff were always very pleasant in the hallways. We did not eat at the hotel. The location is the best feature of this hotel, walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, Broadway, 5th Avenue - you can't beat it. Metro Stations very close by and surrounded by many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good location very poor service”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan_Rio
Reviews.Content: Very poor room service - after 35 minutes trying to order a meal I gave up.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable holidays”
Reviews.Author: GulzhanK
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel before 2pm, which is the check-in time as per official website. Nevertheless, we got the room as soon as we arrived. Receptions and all hotel staff were very friendly and supportive. Concierge service deserves a separate mention. They were really great in helping choose the best deals and options in the NYC, especially for those first time NYC travelers like ourselves. The room (standard double) was very clean, and neat. Bedsheets and towels were changes daily and bathroom supplies were provided just in time. The view from the window was nothing, as there was an office building and you could actually see people sitting at desks. But it did no really matter, since we did not spend much time in the hotel room. Our room was the last down the hall and it actually was on 56th Street, which intersects with 7th ave. What we liked the most about the hotel was its location, just minutes away from Times Square, Broadway and other famous attractions. A metro station was just around the corner and not far from Port Authority and Penn Station. Suffice to say our average taxi fare to get to other attractions was USD6-USD15. Overall, Park Central is a nice place to stay when you're traveling with friends/families/ or on a business trip. I will recommend this hotel to friends and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What the photos don't tell you...”
Reviews.Author: Sperkins15
Reviews.Content: Words cannot express how terrible our stay was at the Park Central. We usually stay at the Double Tree in Times Square; however, thanks to last-minute planning, a room was not available. The photos on the Park Central website and Expedia seemed pleasant enough, but my, hoe photos lie. Upon arrival, we waited an hour for a roll-away bed that never arrived. During that time, we noticed the broken curtains, broken shower faucet, and worst of all, the broken lock on the door. We politely explained to the receptionist that broken showers amd curtains were one thing, but that we couldnt live with a broken lock. They refused to offer another room claiming to be at full capacity. However, the security officer that came to fix the door took a lock from another room in order to fix ours clearly meaning another room was empty. That experience in addition to constantly asking for towels and wash rags resulted in a very unhappy stay. We'll definitely be sticking to the Double Tree from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great for parade”
Reviews.Author: zebratravels
Reviews.Content: Booked a partial view room for the Macy's parade and had an excellent time at this hotel. No bed bugs (we stripped the bed multiple times). Rooms with king beds are very large with a seperate sitting area. Bathrooms are dated and the stoppers need to be replaced, but tolerable. Amazing location! cityhouse restaurant on site is delicious and prices can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location - and a really nice hotel - dont listen to negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: jen362
Reviews.Content: We got a great package deal with this hotel and it seemed like excellent value for money. The hotel looked ncie and seemed to be in a great location, so we booked it. However, I was a bit worried baout the negative reviews on Trip Advisor so my expectations were not very high. However, we were very nicely surprised! The hotel looks great from the outside and the lobby is lovely and trendy and clean. I did worry a little when checking in when we were told we may have to wait a while to be allocated a King Size bed which we had paid for because the hotel was struggling to accomodate everyone. However, instead of waiting around we opted to check in staright away and were allocated a room on the 4th floor with 2 double beds. The room was great, clean and modern with 2 comfty beds and a large tv. The bathroom was also nice clean and bright. No mould or dirtiness in the room - maybe we were just lucky but we were really pleased with service and the room. We didnt really deal with the staff much but we didnt really need to. The location is the best thing about this hotel just a couple of blocks from Central Park (left) and a little further walk to Times Sq (to the right). We were glad we werent located directly in Times sq which was too crowded and hectic - this location was perfection! Dont listen to the negative reviews, this hotel was great value nice and comfortable and everything we needed. Try it.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate location, Value for money”
Reviews.Author: rdar
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Park Central in October for 10 nights which allowed us to get the discounted rate. For our first trip to NYC we could not believe our luck with this hotel. The location was even better than we were expecting. Really close to all the tourist attractions such as central park, broadyway, times square and everything else we were looking for we found within a couple blocks of our hotel (restaurants, bars etc) . There is a very convenient subway station right under the hotel which makes a huge difference to tired sore feet!. I've heard of rooms being small in NYC but ours was perfect, plenty of room for two people. Clean and tidy, good comfy beds and pillows. Lovely gentleman at concierge helped us get broadway tickets to a good show and recommend restaurants to our liking close by the theatre. If I had to say anything negative about this place it would only be that we were unable to adjust the airconditioner in our room and were too hot some nights and the price for having laundry done appeared exorbitant. (we ended up going to a laundromat) If staying here I highly recommend McGees Irish Pub on 55th st near 8th for great food, great service and drinks. We often did the short walk to and from this pub from Park Central. Also on the same street just across the road from the famed International Soup Kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Valentina - concierage extraordinaire!!!”
Reviews.Author: MalmoGia
Reviews.Content: Our entourage stayed at Park Central in October for a business trip. Our trip would not have been as smooth and entertaining if it was not for the AMAZING service and attention we received from Valentina at the conceriege desk!!! We cannot speak highly enough of her professionalism, her attention to our needs, her ability to ascertain what we might need that we hadn't thought of or planned for, her ability to speak the languages that our group spoke, and her gracious and energetic personality which all made us feel like kings and queens. Not only did she attend to our business needs, but she took the time to get to know us to determine what personal things we wanted to do in the city as well to have the best experience in New York City as possible. And DID we!!!! Thank you Valentina!! You made our trip the finest!! We highly recommend Park Central hotel overall, but Valentina's attention and service put them top of the map!!!! Thank you! Sincerely, Happy Group from Europe!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: volubilis
Reviews.Content: Usually we stay at the Marriott Marquis. Last week i went to NYC with my family to run the NYCmarathon. My "marathon package" included the Park Central. I was worried after reading many comments about this hotel. But we had a pleasant surprise. A) Great location; B) Front desk and staff very friendly and usefull; C) Room (twin bed) comfortable,clean and spacious (for the NYC standard); D) No bed bugs. I reccomend the Park Central!

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience from end to end.”
Reviews.Author: jonathanrapierson
Reviews.Content: We spent several days at this place and would not recommend. Internet was down for almost entire stay and hotel staff could not be bothered with even an apology. The lobby was wall-to-wall people trying to get on the Internet from an adjoining coffee shop with free wireless. A front desk person by the name of Angela, told the hordes of people standing in line to stop crowding her. Everyone was patiently queued and not in any way infringing on her space, leaving a respectable distance between them and the client being served. Everyone just decamped, her wrath was so intimidating. Suffice to say, the service is terrible. I will say that the housekeeping staff was terrific, however, and the room was okay--nothing special--but fine. The lack of basic services--even basic kindnesses--was stunning, however. Would never come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: cooksmom
Reviews.Content: started at arrival no one offered to even take bags, lobby is dark and gloomy, counter people were not friendly or helpful. The hotel said they had turned off air conditioning. we asked for a fan at reception but had to call ourselves to get one. the room was diffently not worth the price very small bathroom barely big enough for one person. the walls were dirty ,mold in tub. Had to wait up to ten minutes for elevators. meeting space in basement . charge for meeting food and coffee too high. had two glasses of tea in restaurant came to twelve dollars. The only thing good about this hotel is location, but in my opion location is not everything

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: SwissCIS
Reviews.Content: Given the location, the price we paid, the beautiful exterior and swank lobby, I expected the rooms to be of a certain standard. The rooms were pretty bare, generic, dirty, our phone didn't work and the bathtub was clogged the entire time of our stay. Definitely will not come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Jenny186233
Reviews.Content: Room was dirty. You could write your name in the dust. Cleaners were sent up to put things right , but days later I still found a huge clump of someone else's hair. We didn't eat there at all as we couldn't face it. Every night there was a downandout sleeping on the setees in the lobby. You don't expect that when you are paying a lot of money for your room.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms, at least for NYC”
Reviews.Author: laurengucsb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of three that are the 'recommended' hotels by my company due to it's close proximity to our NYC office. At a time when NYC hotel rates were through the roof, I was happy with the price I paid, although it's still ridiculous compared to other cities. Based on another reviewer's advice, I recommended a room on a high floor which worked out very well. These rooms must have been renovated and I'm not sure if I got an upgrade or not, but the room was huge by NYC standards. It was right across from the elevators which I didn't really like, but it ended up being okay. There was a decent size closet when you enter the room, with a safe, then the bed which was pretty comfortable, but very clean (3-piece sheets, etc) and then a fairly spacious sitting area with the desk and TV. The bathroom was fine, not fantastic, but plenty of counter space. My main complaint about the hotel is that the air is impossible to find. After calling down several time with them giving me detailed info, I finally found the little slot that you have to touch just right in order for the top to pop up to allow you to change it. I was freezing when I woke up the first morning (I had arrived very late at night so didn't fully explore the room) and after pulling back the curtains, I realized that there was a full door to the outside of the building that wasn't locked and therefore was cracked just the slightest bit open, letting in cold air. This is extremely dangerous regardless and I checked each night to make sure that door was secured, but I'm surprised they can have that on the 21st floor to begin with. I had trouble getting the internet to work and later learned it was an issue with my laptop, but there is an outside number to call and I've never had such helpful service. The location was perfect, a short walk to Madison and 5th avenues and although a bit farther, walking to Times Square isn't out. I was there for business so I didn't get to see actual distances to other places. I know it's very near to Central Park as well. I didn't eat or drink at the hotel - although they left water by the bed which was a nice touch, but there were plenty of places to choose from just outside the hotel. For the price I got during an otherwise expensive time, and the size and quality of the room, I would definitely consider this hotel again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “The mushroom room”
Reviews.Author: souris87
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel for a few days in the summer of 2009, and everything was fine, enough for us to go back at this same Hotel on the summer 2010. I don't know if this was due to the unusual heat or if we were assigned a particularly horrible room in the oldest part of the Hotel, but our stay this time was, to say the least, very unpleasant. The room reeked of humidity and smelled like dirty wet towels that were forgotten for a long time. The curtains had some mildew stains and it was not a relief to come back to this horrible and smelly room after a very hot day of walking and visiting. Our clothes did not stay fresh and crisp as you would like it to be when you begin your vacation. It was our last stay at this Hotel, and i would not recommend it to any of my friends. We baptised the room "the mushroom room" - "la chambre champignon" ! That says it all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location...pretty good facilities and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Perthfam_10
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Park Central - the excellent location just can't be beat. Minutes from Times Square and Central Park. Carnegie Hall is right across the road! Must say that our first stay probably rated better than the second for a number of reasons - airconditioner wasn't working properly in our room; we asked the front desk for a kettle but it never arrived!; the corridors were pretty noisy as the hotel seemed to be hosting a large number of school kids; my bed sunk down in the middle; and it would have been nicer if the hotel staff could have been a bit friendlier! But despite the above, we were overall happy with the hotel - good cleanliness; comfortable sized rooms; nice fitness centre (where you can "hook into" personal headphones for privacy; a checked bag service which was very convenient as we needed a place to store our bags aftre checking out; and of course the location! Minutes from attractions (we pretty much walked everywhere!) with many cafe's and restaurants literally a few doors down (we didn't fancy eating in the hotel). Our room had 2 double beds which was fine for us and our 2 kids (4 and 7). Would recommend to families.

Reviews.Title: “Horror in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: CHUCK21623
Reviews.Content: The first room (I think 749 or 739) was definitely NOT what I reserved and paid for. I have two e-mails from Annette Narine sent earlier this year comfirming I booked and paid for "a suite...you will have a king bed with a living room that comes with a pull out bed." Her words. What I got was a single room with two double beds. Additionally, the rug was dirty, the TV did not work, the curtain was wrinkled, the light was out by the closet, there were no additional blankets, the shower curtain rod was sagging, the shower curtain was cut, the shower head was loose and sprayed the bathroom, and the hair drier would cut out after only a few minutes. When I called the front desk to complain I was told by the female attendant that what we had was what we reserved and that the next upgrade would cost me an additional $800.00 per day. The next day (Monday) my wife went down to speak with a manager and was told there wasn"t one available!!!! However, one of the staff (I think her name started with a N) listened patiently to our problems and had us moved to room 2240. OK this was better but it still wasn't what I reserved and confirmed by Ms Narine YOUR reservations clerk. Additionally, the TV did not work, the alarm clock did not work, the safe was in a locked position and the curtains in the room were wrinkled. After these problems were ironed out (excepting the ratty curtains) I notice that the heater would not worked. I was told that according to hotel policy it would not be available until it was 42 degrees outside. Mind you the first days we were in Manhattan it was cold and rainy. Not 42 degrees but cold and we couldn't get any heat. Also, WiFi was available only in the lobby for $14.00 per day. I feel I was cheated by your hotel. I did not receive what I was promised and I paid more for what I got. I feel a fraud was perpetrated.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recocomend”
Reviews.Author: WillyMan69
Reviews.Content: Excelent location, very close to Time Square and 5th Ave. The service is great and very friendly. The room was bigger than we expected. I would stay again in my future trips to NY

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hugs4u
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Oct. 8-10 for a business trip, mixed with some leisure time, and I was so pleased with the location. Go out the front door and to the right for about 10 blocks and you are smack in the middle of Times Square and access to ALL the great theaters. Go out the door to the left and walk several blocks and you're at Columbus Circle and beautiful Central Park. There are restaurants galore all around, plenty of shopping opportunities from touristy stuff to swanky Fifth Ave. World renowned Carnegie Hall right across the street. Radio City Music Hall a quick walk. Easy access to the subway. Wonderful location! Rooms are perfectly fine, not plush but plenty roomy compared to many NYC hotels I've stayed in. Certainly clean and decent. No complaints, either, from the 10 other clients I brought in for this event. Staff was friendly and accommodating. I look forward to staying here for vacation in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expeceted”
Reviews.Author: suz236
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews, I was frightened that the rooms would be terrible. But they were nice. We had 2 double beds and ordered a roll-away. There was room for the beds and still room for the bags and to walk around. Cotton linens w/ feather pillows and foam pillows. The bath was tiled with granite sink area. Looks like the place had been mostly redone in the past several years. The staff was all very nice and helpful. The location was wonderful. Great deli's nearby. I took early walks and stopped for bagels, muffins and pancakes to bring back to the room. There was a small table with 2 chairs. The only thing we didn't like was the lobby. Looked a lot like a 1970's disco with black walls, low ceilings and wannabe art.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice lobby but room was dark, cramped and depressing!”
Reviews.Author: Yankees9
Reviews.Content: Despite the close proximity to Times Square and hip updated lobby , the room itself was so depressing that I would not stay here again. Very dark with one small window overlooking an interior rooftop. Old flourescent lights in the 2x2 bathroom making it impossible to even get close enough to mirror for makeup application. Not a room for those even slightly claustrophobic. Rate was $359 a night before taxes/fees to boot!

Reviews.Title: “Just hate being ripped off”
Reviews.Author: GHoult
Reviews.Content: This place is non descript- but in the end you never go back when you are just plain ripped off- $20 for a 40 second telephone call! When I queried it on checkout I was told "You should never use your hotel phone for an international call!" Well my view is that you should never steal money from anyone! Sorry- for $15 on a 4 night stay bill this hotel killed its chances with me and anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Nice localization, but AWFUL service”
Reviews.Author: Resthotqual
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Park Central Hotel for 10 days. I DON'T RECOMMEND, although it has some qualities: great localisation, good looking entrance,comfortable beds (but bad shower). They charge US$14/day for an internet connection!! Plus, the service is really DISAPPOINTING for a hotel: they forgot to replace the bathroom rug twice when they changed the towels & rug so I had to step on the floor after the bath. Their phone would ring several times during the night or day, but when you pick up, there was nobody on the line. The package room is managed to another company. This other company NEVER sent me any notice about any of the 6 packs I received. So I had to go to the package room everyday to verify the packs arrivals. Amazon sent one pack with ID Track number and everything proving it arrived, but the package room says they never received it! And if you complain to the hotel they say they have nothing to do with the Package Room as it belongs to another company. In short: AWFUL!!!! I don't recommend!!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Evka43
Reviews.Content: this is basic but modern hotel with great location in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for sightseeing - Grat Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Furfighter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week at the beginning of July , thank God for the air conditioning ! The room was large , clean and comfortable . Ditto for the bathroom . Staff were friendly and efficient , especially the concierge who organised ball game tickets and show tickets for us . So close to Times Square I felt this hotel was fantastic value for money , Starbucks on the corner - the only thing I cannot understand is charging for internet in this day and age ( $10 for 24 hours ) especially as there is a Starbucks on the corner ! No tea or coffee in the room and breakfast not included though .Quirky lift (elevator system ) but I knew about it before I arrived thanks to reports on here so it gave us no trouble ! Would stay here again and am happy to recommend . Walking distance to some great places to eat too - I cannot stress enough how good the location is for the price !

Reviews.Title: “Picky Traveler Gives Great Reviews!”
Reviews.Author: havelkafamily
Reviews.Content: Park Central is a great hotel to stay at with small children. It's perfectly located to Central Park, Theater District and Columbus Circle. Train station is next to hotel....perfect for traveling to lower Manhattan. I worried about staying at this hotel because of the negative reviews. If you stay on the 18th floor or above...you will find that the rooms are renovated. The key is to reserve a room on the Concierge level, 18th and above. We stayed in a suite which was perfect for our family.....13 month old and 7 year old. Beds were clean - - towels were soft, rooms are big by New York standards. I have stayed at this location before, back in 2008. I loved it then and I loved it this past trip. The staff was very sweet....I also was nice to them so that helps! We didn't buy the hotel breakfast. Instead we walked to near by convinient store and ordered to go. It was quick, food was good and great to walk outside with children first thing in the a.m. Don't hesitate to make reservations....I will say if you keep checking rates as your dates get closer you might find cheaper online rates. Make new reservation to lock in new rates, get your confirmation code via email. Then cancel old reservation and keep your cancellation codes via email. I had no trouble doing this....I wish I had not worried so much about staying here....I enjoyed the clean room, nice staff and excellent location! P.S. I worried about the guys next door who were having a party...I was able to hear them in the hallway....once I entered my room I couldn't hear the party, laughter, etc....I kept the air conditioning on low to drown out noises...I am a light sleeper. I couldn't hear them at all.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, expensive phones”
Reviews.Author: devon2010
Reviews.Content: Although the location was great the hotel clean and the service friendly the hotel completely rips of patrons who use their room phones. I was disgusted at the magnituide of a bill present at check-out. This issue needs to be highlighted as to save the next unsuspecting tourist from being ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel In PERFECT Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dubai-Mafia
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Park Central on a business trip back in March. Well the last time i stayed in NYC on a business trip was March 09 and i went to the pennsylvania and i was praying this hotel will be NOTHING like that! and it was not, it had clean nice large rooms with large TV's and nice bathroom's. Literaly a minute walk to central park and only 10 seconds to hooters which is next door. McDonald's etc. is 4 blocks down so a bit far and not too far from time square. Great hotel would recommend to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE STAFF”
Reviews.Author: traveler1363
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location and looks kind of cool at first sight in the lobby... but the staff and rooms were very disappointing for the price they charged! The cards never worked and had to be reprogrammed all week , after 5 days they agreed that the door lock may have a problem. They even let us in our room without our IDs or waiting to show them once inside!!! Bathroom had mold. The room was never done, one day we had to request it at 7pm, next day same thing. They said we had to request the cleaning to save on energy by hanging a tag on the door, which we did not have. I got really mad that they played like this with us. I understand they want to save energy on laundry but why paying 200$ if they are not doing our beds and cleaning the bathroom every day. They charged us to keep our baggages while waiting to have our room ready. I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: fofityfo
Reviews.Content: Poor customer service-only excuses. No amenities. Rooms are tired and worn out. Changed rooms due to cleanliness. Much better value for your money elsewhere. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “There are lots of great hotels in NY this is not one!”
Reviews.Author: jgdogwood
Reviews.Content: Bathroom was dirt, towels were like sandpaper, shampoo and soap were lousy, bed was noisy, fixtures in the bathroom were falling apart. Lousy Give your business to another establishment...... Love the thompson's starwoods, even Hilton over this place

Reviews.Title: “Great location for all the Big Apple's attractions”
Reviews.Author: Macrihanish
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here to see the sights of New York. Our room was a Concierge King on the 25th floor which was very quiet but smallish with only one small window. But it was clean and comfortable and we slept well. We didn't eat in the hotel but tried lots of places round about for breakfast and dinner. The concierge staff were very helpful and nothing was too much trouble. The hotel is ideally located for Times Square, Broadway and all the tourist buses stop nearby. We weren't very impressed with the city itself but this hotel was just right for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: bowlish
Reviews.Content: I book online and usually find a reduced rate. Have stayed here several times and always found the rooms to be clean and comfortable. I have never had a bad experience. An honest 31/2 stars. Location is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AussieTravelerDarwin
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews after making my booking I was a bit worried about how bad the hotel could be. When arriving at Park Central I was impressed with my room and the location was fantastic. The room was great exept for the aircon which barely worked and the curtains which wouldnt shut. these were minor problems. However I was shocked and very annoyed when housekeeping continued to barge into my room from as early as 8am continually waking me up. So I reacommend putting the "Do Not Disturb" sign on your door if you are jetlagged and after a sleepin. I also recommend the Restaurant for Dinner. Best meal I had in America!!

Reviews.Title: “I do not understand how this hotel has a...”
Reviews.Author: DrCino
Reviews.Content: I do not understand how this hotel has a 3 1/2 - 4 star rating Apatently they put all the money in the loby The rooms are average, walls are paper thin & the worst thing is begging housekeeping to clean your room!!! Location is the only thing good about this hotel, don't be fouled by the friendly staff, they're all talk no do

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Wedding Trip”
Reviews.Author: LorraineF1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was centrally located. The accomodations were fine. Small room, but walking distance to all attractions...

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: JenD_in_DC
Reviews.Content: Dirty, dingy and overpriced. I feel sorry for all the tourists they lure to the hotel. You can stay somewhere much nicer for half the price. I will say that the staff tried their best given the conditions.

Reviews.Title: “We were well received at this hotel our room was a bit small for the three of us we requested a bigger room and got one”
Reviews.Author: deicesman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at park central before and we were well looked after there so we booked it again. When we arrived we were looked after our room was a bit small so we requested a bigger one which we got and told if it was not suitable they would fix us up with another room. They were just great to us

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: oldfishes
Reviews.Content: Great location - within walking distance of Empire State, Crysler Building, Macys, Bloomingdales, Central Park, National History Museum, Carnegie Hall, 5th Ave etc. Near to a subway station and bus stops that service battery park for Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. Rooms - Large, very comfortable, cleaned daily, high quality bedding, no complimentary tea/coffee facilities but there is a Starbuks and an independent (highly recommended) coffee shop next to the hotel that do great breakfasts and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay in Park Central”
Reviews.Author: LynnWaterfordIre
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 6 night stay in Park Central Hotel, this is my 2nd time staying here and like the last time it was fantastic. There were 3 of us staying in the one room, the first room we got was a bit small and we weren`t totally happy with it, we went to reception and in a matter of minutes we were relocated to a bigger room, the girl on reception couldn`t be more helpful. Ignore all these bad reviews about this hotel, we had no problems with the elevators or staff or anything else in this hotel. We will be returning to Park Central again for another fantastic stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the website! Worst hotel I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Travelergal022
Reviews.Content: I saw photos of the website and thought this looked like a nice little boutique style hotel to stay in, right near Central Park. The ONLY good thing about this hotel is the location 2 blocks south of the park. However there are many other hotels in the same area that are a thousand times better like the Sheraton NY. This hotel looks old and is very depressing. The service is the worst I have EVER had and I would tell anyone reading this to run as far as you can from this pit! The service at this hotel was so bad, I am having trouble remembering ALL of the problems. Here are a few: 1. Upon check in -no one smiles and the ladies at the front desk are rude. Evelyn was so rude, that my extremely mild-mannered colleague about flew off the handle. 2. Every day after the room was "cleaned" we had to call to get towels, toilet paper, kleenex and glasses. The only thing they did was make up the bed. And often had to call up to 3 times, waiting around and they never came up with the missing items. 3. Went to change rooms because ours had so many problems and was on one of the lowest floors, which are usually the worst. After being told it was no problem, went downstairs and Evelyn said it would be $3.50 per bag to store our bags until the new room opened up...first of this news. Later when we returned, NO ONE blocked a room for us and stuck talking to the awful Evelyn again, she said they didn't really have double beds above the 8th floor - YEAH RIGHT! New room had barely working AC. 4. We were there for a trade show and the staff had never heard of it (the biggest of its kind in the country) and finally we saw a sign about it hidden in the back alley that gave the wrong location for shuttle pickup. 5. HERE's the topper.... We reserved a house car to get to the airport on our final day. They said it was all set for us and they take credit cards. Next morning, we went down and it was not there for 25 minutes. Then the driver who finally showed up got into a car accident on the way. A car hit the side right next to me. The driver NEVER apologized or asked if we were okay. It took over 45 minutes for a replacement to show, who also never apologized. We were almost an hour and half late to the airport, shaken from the accident, and still no apology...and they had the balls to charge us for the trip! Best part - the guy insisted we go inside the airport to get cash because he wouldn't take a credit card!! After they assured us they would. Then he finally said he would for a 10% fee!!!! One closing word, if any manager from the hotel reads this - you MUST talk to your staff about service...it is appalling. Also, what is with the elevator assignments ---what is the point? There are only 2 elevators for the lower floors and it doesn't know how many people are boarding it per floor, so it doesn't help. In fact, every single time I was on there, multiple people couldn't get off at their floor and didn't know why. The small sign explaining this procedure, that offers no value, was in English and most of the customers are European...think about it!

Reviews.Title: “Service so bad - I walked out before I even checked in”
Reviews.Author: Fred32242
Reviews.Content: The worse bullying hotel management I have even seen. Rude, dishonest, and repulsive. I have traveled over a 120 night a year for the last decade and this is the first time I have even walked out of a place. DISGUSTING

Reviews.Title: “You could not pay me to stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: George66052
Reviews.Content: I arrived late morning and politely asked if check-in was possible and received a stern "NO!" answer...."come back after 4pm." I checked in that afternoon and, while taking a shower, heard knocking at my door as apparently they assigned my room also to another guest. I advised this guest that I had just checked into the room but they had a key with the same room number. Then the front desk called and asked me to leave the room. I advised them that I already showered and un-packed so they let me stay. Later that day my keys did not work and, after going to front desk and discussing the day with a manager, I still received no apology. In addition, the air conditioning did not work properly and the room and hallways had a mildew smell and the toilet had to be flushed a number of times to work properly. The hotel gym looks impressive but the A/C was not functioning and most of the equipment was inferior quality and in need of repair. On a more positive note, the beds are comfortable and the location is good. I travel a lot with my company (we had 3 rooms at the hotel for 5 days each) and have rarely had such a negative experience. After having my keys malfunction for the 3rd or 4th time, I finally asked the front desk for some compendation. So they gave me a free breakfast buffet...sounds great! But the food was horrible.....and they charged me for 2 buffets upon checkout (which they obviously took off the bill). Next time I will pay a little more and find a hotel that is not dysfunctional.

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 on Central Park”
Reviews.Author: KarlyBobby
Reviews.Content: I even took pictures it was so bad! Earlier discriptions of dim lighting don't describe it enough. I took pictures of exposed light bulbs and mold around the sink and tub. The staff was dogmatic and condescending---very unaccomodating. Probably my worst stay on Central Park South.

Reviews.Title: “Here's a balanced review”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryPaul
Reviews.Content: I was wondering about this place after reading a review about bedbugs (!) None in my room, and I was there for 5 days. Here's the thing to keep in mind about Park Central: I had a two-bed hotel room for just over $200 per night--a deal in NYC near Central Park. It's not a 5 or 4-star hotel; it's a 3-star which is fine if you go there with that expectation. My room was clean and fine for the stay. If you're used to being catered to, it's not for you; if you're able and prefer to haul up your own bags to your room, you won't care about not being fussed over. If you want a view, you'll probably pay more than I did so keep that in mind as well. Internet: Don't buy it from the hotel; go to Starbucks or Tisserie (or sit in the hotel lobby and also log into those same networks for free.) Staff wasn't honest about that when I asked what people in the lobby were logging into. so that's a minus. Also negative; my room was one of those adjoining ones with a door; fine if you have quite neighbours, not if not. (Comfy beds btw.) On the plus side, very helpful concierge service. Also a plus, location. But don't buy food at the hotel or at the tourist restaurants if $ is a factor; buy breakfast from Sbux or Tisserie or Europa Cafe, or one of the many convenience stores that ring the hotel. For lunch and dinner, walk a couple blocks away from the main Times Square streets and find a non-tourist restaurant which will have better prices and superior food.I recommend Iguana's, just around the corner from the David Letterman show a few blocks (to the west of Park Central and on 8ave and 53rd or 52nd if I recall correctly). Lots of Central and South American tourists at PC; you can practice your Spanish and Portugese! Tip the maids; it's just the nice thing to do.

Reviews.Title: “WORST ROOM! STOLE MY IPOD TOUCH AT VALET PARKING!!”
Reviews.Author: farina123
Reviews.Content: Oh my G-D. If i had to sum up my stay at the Park Central it would go something like this. Terrible rooms, smelly and dingy, broken elevator. The location is great for the price obviously, if your willing to stay in a tiny room with a bed and tv at the foot of the bed. But that wasn't the worst part...I had payed for valet parking for 3 nights because I drove, and on the 4th day when I left i picked up my car and started driving back from NY to Toronto, I went into the compartment in my Lexus to put on my iPod and noticed it was MISSING. It was plugged into my car with wires and everything, what a disgusting hotel. So I called the parking service, and explained my story and they lied to my face, saying that they will file a report and start an investigation, without taking my name down. I asked for the manager and he said that he was on vacation, asked for the supervisor and he said he was on vacation. Anyways, the details are not important although I have told you most of them. But please, spend that extra $100.00 a night and do NOT stay at this hotel, if i could go back now I would stay at Novotel, a hotel that I have stayed at for many trips to New York, and decided the one time to stay at a different hotel and save myself some money. BAD IDEA!

Reviews.Title: “bad experiance”
Reviews.Author: mamlo7a
Reviews.Content: we send email and we call asking about early check in we didn't get email replay and the phone they tell us is ok for us to check in early but when we arrived we had to wait 6 hours to check in my kids was safaring and very tired every one can see the crowded lobby all are wafting for check in thay all was tired handaling thair bags im sure that their was allot of rooms available but the staff was not helpful also we had to pay 3 dalars for each item to keep our bags in the hotel stor where its subbos to be free the othor problem was the air conditions it was very unusiful and old it was almost 87 degree out side and maby the same inside room we ask for changing rooms but also it was the same problem so we had to sleep with that

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: RTWCRBrisVegas
Reviews.Content: Third visit to the Park Central in 18 months. This time I had a room on the W56th Street side. The slightly annoying lift problem, ofetn referred to does not seem to be an issue on this side. I rarely had to wait for the lift (elevator). The staff were efficient as always. Recommended. Good location, good price.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT GREAT GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Cazam87
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my mum and dad in a family room. We were on this trip for my 21st birthday. Hotel looks amazing from the outside. Great inside and the staff were great too. Room was cleaned everyday. A ncie big room. Didnt have a view but we didnt pay for one. Comfortable beds, nice bathroom and constant hot water which is what you want as it was very hot. I am going back there next month again with mum and dad and a friend for my dads 60th birthday. I am shocked at some of the bad reviews I have read and I am wondering if they have actually stayed at the same hotel as me. Excellent location, very helpful staff (arranging car back to airport and even posting my postcards) great room. What more could you ask for. Cant wait to go back next month. 3rd sept - 6th sept. Carrie-Anne Morrison

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location and great service!”
Reviews.Author: mom75019
Reviews.Content: Such a convenient location! Staff was attentive and pleasant. Room was very comfortable, nicely decorated and very clean. Elevators were staged for access for different floors decreasing waiting times.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Worst Hotels of our travels”
Reviews.Author: OllyFrenchie
Reviews.Content: This really is a wonderful hotel to look at, on the outside. As soon as you entire you are overwhelmed by this horrible dark black and depressing room with more than modern decorations. Not very suitable to the outside exterior nor the rooms. We arrived to the hotel and got our room and we specifically asked for a room as far away from the elevators as possible. We were given our key and we went up the horrible elevators that hardly work properly and discovered that our room was the room straight ahead from the elevators doors. We were furious and demanded a room further away so they did give us one. The moment we entered our new room the smell of mould and moisture overwhelmed us and made us heave. The floor was dirty and there was no room for luggage to be set down and opened! The curtains were covered in mould as the walls and the bath! We were appalled. The internet now is another bad thing. We were paying 15$ per day for internet which is a quarter of the price of what we pay at home for a month! And our internet was 5x much quicker. We started having problems with the internet because it kept cutting off at random moments and I lost some important work! The internet was freezing and cutting off constantly. We contacted reception 3 times that day telling them to sort out the problem and they said they would remove the charge and let us login again and they did that but it didn't change! They then expected us to sort the problem out ourselves with Tech Support. Luckily my son was good with technology and could understand everything to do but it isn't up to us to sort the problem out?! The hotel should sort this out. The next day, the same problem over and over again... We just gave up. We were surprised that they even made us pay for the internet, the hotel rooms were expensive so obviously we were expecting complimentary internet but $15 of all the prices! The room service was slow but nice and so was the restaurant. In general the worst hotel of our journey across the U.S.A.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs and horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: aleav
Reviews.Content: I posted a review a couple of weeks ago, and it disappeared. So here's another one: We arrived to Park Central Hotel in July, late at night. We had heard about bedbugs in the news, so we asked the front desk when we were checking in if they had had any reports. They said no. The first thing we did was check for bugs because we were all worried about it, and I did not want to bring bedbugs home with me. We checked under the mattress, and I found several bedbugs under the the bedskirt. When we checked the other bed, we found more bedbugs, droppings and eggs. Disgusted, we grabbed a few photos on my phone and we went down to the front desk. The night manager was retrieved and repeatedly told us he had never heard of bedbugs in his hotel and didn't believe us. We asked for a refund, and he said he would refund the week, but charge us for this night. We told him that was unacceptable. We told him the room was inhospitable and he kept repeating, "there are no bedbugs in this hotel." We offered to show him the room, he refused. We offered to show him my photos, he refused. It was a very unpleasant experience, made worse by extremely rude and horrific customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Good situation, as for services...”
Reviews.Author: Rosaperezparapar
Reviews.Content: Two days out of four we got to our room after a scorching day looking forward to a shower and a nice rest and the room was not done (one day at 18:00 and the other at 16:00). The second time it took them over one hour to get it ready... We used the business centre to print our boarding passes and there was no paper left in the printer , no one was there to take care of the room and it took them nearly one hour to "solve the problem"-because by that time the money we had paid to use the printer ($5 for 14 minutes) had been used up... The situation is very good, though and there is an ice machine on each floor- and it is very nice to have cool water when you want it . I think a hotel such as this one should offer free wi-fi to clients

Reviews.Title: “This hotel needs some work”
Reviews.Author: travelgirls2
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Park Central. The location was good for a trip to the city - very easy to get to many places. The hotel was a disappointment beyond that. The man who checked us in was very strange and sarcastic. Our room was ok - the carpet was worn and the view was awful. The bathroom fan didn't work and we didn't have a waste basket. We asked for one and all they did was put a garbage bag on the closet door. They were very skimpy with shampoo and soap. The beds were comfortable and it was quiet at night so we were able to get a good night's sleep. This could be a nice hotel - it just needs some serious updating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but average value and many improvements needed”
Reviews.Author: HongKongSunny
Reviews.Content: It has the potential to be a very good hotel but will need to raise its game to fulfill it. We reached the hotel at midnight after a long flight and were disappointed to see that there were no doormen on duty, so we dragged heavy cases through the revolving doors and to the check-in. Four elevators are consistently fast. Reception area wi-fi is good. The room was spacious for NY standards, but lacked charm. Few paintings and quite basic. TV channel selection was good. Bed was big (King size) but too soft for our liking, as you sunk in to the mattress. The AC was strong/good given the scorching hot weather, but the curtain lining was short and this allowed bright light into the room from early. Noise was acceptable, given we faced Times Sq about three blocks down, The bathroom was clean but overall very disappointing. The toilet flush was as loud/scary as on an airplane and there was Insufficient shelf space for storing toiletries. There was no hanging line for wet clothing and barely any rail space to hang wet towels. The bathroom didn't appear to have an extractor fan either. Shower head in bath was decrepid. In-house toiletries (which do not come with tamper seals) were the poorest quality we have ever experienced. We expected far better given we were paying an average $300 a night. The service was average throughout the four-night stay. The staff on concierge who help with tickets/tourist advice were the most helpful. Room service is expensive and stops at 10pm, Several diners, such as Cafe Europa, located nearby at street level offer much better value for breakfast/food than in-house. Location is the hotel's best feature. It sits above a metro station, and is no more than a 10-mins walk to Central Park, Rockefeller Centre, Times Square and Fifth Avenue. One warning: the hotel charges $3.75 a piece to store luggage after check out. This charge can be waived if you, like us, agree to take an airport taxi arranged through the hotel. We confirmed a price ($80 for Newark) which were assured included all taxes/tolls and again confirmed this with the driver before the start. When we reached Newark, the driver insisted we pay an extra 10pc to cover taxes. This reflects badly on the hotel. We feel cheated and would advise others to hail a taxi, as this would be cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SERVICE WILL BE BACK”
Reviews.Author: irishlady2010_10
Reviews.Content: Having booked our holiday through an airline and getting a good deal we werent expecting much. This was shortlived when we pulled up to the Park Central. Firstly you notice the haze of times square just a short walk away, but this is great as you get to stay in a quieter area away from the hussle and bussle! we were then greated by the manager of the hotel who made sure we felt welcomed and couldnt do enough for us even an error in bedroom types that was sorted out efficently. A couple of days later we were walking through the reception when I spotted the manager again and he made the effort to ensure everything was ok and helped us with transport back to airport. There was also a very helpful lady on information desk willing to help. The hotel although we werent in it much had everything you needed and more. This includes a modern office suite with internet, very clean modern rooms, friendly staff, a bar with great shirley temples!! and a steak restaurant. I would be back whenever I get round to another trip to the big apple.

Reviews.Title: “A great Location on the 7th Av. in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: NandaF
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable rooms Delicious Breakfast Next to a Sttarbuck's Cafe Close to Broadway Theaters Near Times Square

Reviews.Title: “Good location and decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: mitgon
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for NY. It's centrally located and it close to the subway. The rooms are decent (small but clean). They don't give you shampoos and lotions. But it's a good value. Don't pay for WiFi. Just go next door to the coffee shop.

Reviews.Title: “extremely helpful!”
Reviews.Author: GayleStourbridge
Reviews.Content: I have been organising a stay for my son and girlfriend to celebrate their 21st birthdays. The staff have been extremely courteous and helpful.. Most of the arrangements have been done by email and are a surprise to the guests, so not straight forward. My requests have been dealt with promptly and efficiently. I am very grateful to the staff _ Miguel, Denis, Mattia and Loriane in particular. I just hope the lucky couple realise the effort and appreciate it! Thank you for making this a really special occasion!!

Reviews.Title: “Just a place to park bags and enjoy NYC and sleep, nothing more”
Reviews.Author: DandD142
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd trip to NYC and first time with my kids (ages 14, 17, and 20). Location is great, but service was disappointing. We arrived 2 hours before the 4 pm check-in time and our room was not ready. Had to pay to leave our 5 bags until our room was ready (all small, carry-on type) with on-site service (a separate entity from the hotel). We never ate at the restaurant as there are so many choices nearby. Recommend "Fluffy's" across the street for quick, homemade, and inexpensive brkfst or light fare. Renowned Carnegie Deli is just across the street. Reception staff are surly. Concierge staff are overwhelmed - lineups every day, and reduced hours (no evenings in the week). No one asked about our stay. Since our room was prepaid (averaged $185/night for 2 Superior doubles booked well in advance), there was no comment or enquiry from the staff. On our last night, one of the kids found a beetle on the bed and captured it in an empty bottle. I will say that the beds were comfortable. We would have had to pay $18 US to leave our bags for one hour after checkout, so we decided to hang out in the lobby and bring our lunch there, while surfing the net with the free wi-fi available from the next door restaurant. That's another thing: if you want internet in your room, they charge an extra $14/day. Just felt nickel and dimed by this hotel. I paid less last year to stay at Sofitel during the same week, so I think if you plan in advance, there are other places that are so much better. I only booked the Park Central because they had rooms that had two double beds and this would accommodate us. I would not stay here again and I definitely would tell others to stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: tico22
Reviews.Content: We had ordered two double rooms at the hotel, and when arriving we discovered that the carpet on both rooms was really dirty, there was actually garbage lying around! Looked like someone had lived in the room for 14 days without vacuming. In one of the rooms the safe was broken off the wall and just thrown upside down on the ground with the stuff from the wall around. We complained and got two rooms which was OK. But I missed the coffe/tea machine, which usually is included in the cheapest hotels! The hotel decor in the rooms looks quite old-fashioned, but as long as it's clean that's fine with me. One thing was really annoying in this hotel: the elevators. Seemed like a madman was controlling the elevators when you got one at last... If it wasn't for the location I would never have chosen this hotel. The location is perfect - you can walk to Times Square and the Central Park in a few minutes. There is also a good breakfast restaurant on the other side of the road. And it is close to the very good italian restaurant Basso56. Next time I will choose a cheaper hotel and use my money on shopping instead :-)

Reviews.Title: “You Won't Find A Better Value in NYC”
Reviews.Author: BarrieTripper
Reviews.Content: You simply will not find a better value in NYC. Located just south of Central Park, the hotel is a short walk to just about everything...if you don't want to walk the subway is located right next to the hotel. My wife and I stayed for two nights at $150 per night. The room was very large by NYC standards, nicely but not extravagantly furnished and very clean. The A/C had to work overtime as it was close to 100 degrees outside during our stay. There is a Starbucks located right in the hotel and literally hundreds of restaurant and cafe choices within walking distance, including the famous Carnegie and Benash delis right next door and across the street. Check in and check out were seamless. We will definitely stay at the Park Central on our next trip to NYC...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but.....”
Reviews.Author: RJS_9
Reviews.Content: Couldn't find a more central location in NYC. Close to everything! Subway entrance right at side entrance. Check in was quick and efficient with a very polite receptionist. Whilst we were early, a room was immediatly made available. Must agree with other reviewers on their comments about the drab rooms. Our room was large and spacious but lacked a fold out suitcase stand and armchair that other rooms on our floor appeared to have.Note: the room does not have tea/coffee making facilities or bar fridge. Ic e is obtainable on each floor, although for the duration of our stay, the ice machines on our floor (10th) and the 9th were out of order. The furniture whilst appearing to be fairly new, was scuffed with chipped paint and appeared to be be in need of of some maintenance. My wife was appalled at the state of the shower curtain badly stained with mould; a phone call to guest relations resulted in a new curtain 4 hours later. Wish the same could be said with the other problems in the bathroom: mould in the grouting surrounding the bath and a light above the bath/shower that was inoperative from thesecond day of our stay and stayed that way until checkout on the fourth day. The light over the sink was a dull cold fluro. Their maintenance program really does need improving. Other than our initial contact with reception, there was no interaction with the staff, except on our final day when we again checked out - although their preferred method appears to be an automated machine. Upon checking out the in room menu, wa samazed to see a glass of wine was $13 plus tax, plus gratuity; this was fairly indicative of the absurd prices this hotel charges. $19 for two beers in the bar!!! Overall, this is just a tourist class hotel, with high prices. Only at a pinch would I recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rates, big rooms for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Pintpet
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Park Central. While the hotel seems a little worn in the public areas (nothing terrible but not that brand new feel), the location on 56th and 7th cannot be beat. Two blocks from the park, 5 or 6 to Times Square, and 100 feet to the Carnegie deli. The room was perfect size, clean and the bed was very comfortable. If you want to stay in the city this is the place

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a comfortable location”
Reviews.Author: ifbourg
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was clean and contemporary. The rooms were a good size, which is a bonus in New York. The Hotel was also very quite, I experienced minimal noise from the street and there was no corridor noise during my stay. Excellent position for exploring Manhattan. But,i was tires of the line at reception which was often long. Also we need much time to check in. Finally, i didn't like the charge of using the internet and the charge of leaving luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up!”
Reviews.Author: KKCanada1
Reviews.Content: We stayed over July 4th wkend. No complaints. The last time we stayed here was 5 years ago. This time was an even better experience. The hotel has been renovated since our last stay. It looks great, the lobby, rooms,etc. We had no issues w/ check in or check out. Can't beat the location - Central Park is just a few blocks away, Starbucks and the subway line right outside the door! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Book Directly to Park Central Hotel - Don't waste hours to surf for other hotel when you plan to visit NYC”
Reviews.Author: klh717
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time to surf for good hotel when we intend to visit a city because a good hotel will make you love that palce instantly. This could be a real headache though. Luckily my brother-in-law introduce me to this hotel... wow I would describe this hotel a real 5 star hotel right in the heart of NY City. All exciting venue to visit is just walking distance eg: Times Sq; Central Park; Theatre; 5th Ave etc etc & sub way is just Next to this hotel. I would also like to praise the Front Office Director Mr Denis for his excellent well capable Management to run this hotel so smoothly upon check in & check out. He could work 2 or more things at once, a real tip top Director to have him around though. I bought the Empire States express ticket from the concierge which is also very helpful with full of knowlegde on sight seeing & theatre show & time. Room is superb clean also thanks to the housekeeping staff who is very efficient too. Overall a Super Excellent Stay and would definitely recommend relative & friends there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMN1209
Reviews.Content: The hotel was centrally located to everything. Staff was helpful and courteous. Concierge. staff was very helpful.The only complaints were we had to request towels on Sunday afternoon it took about 20 minutes. The doorman was not very attentive, getting a taxi usually required you hailing your own. Not quite what we expected for a doorman.These two issues were very minor concerns . We had a corner room overlooking 8th, lovely size. Bed was comfortable, room and the bathroom were very clean and appeared to have been newly decorated. Flat screen tv, and the rooms were very quiet. A very short walk up 8th to Central Park. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Was there for Operative Gynecology Course- felt like my wallet got biopsied!”
Reviews.Author: gynechiatrist
Reviews.Content: While this has a nice location, the inside of the room reminded me of a bad Motel 8 in Appalachia. The room was grimey, the bathroom was moldy and the walls thin. I was overwhelmed with the smell of curry everytime I walked onto my floor. The elevators are inadequate to service the volume of guests. One of the hotels representatives berated one of the conference directors as I was waiting to ask a question. The conference was in December but the ballroom was HOT- and the "AC cannot keep up.." There are better hotels nearby. There are great delis nearby. The Greek Restaraunt , Molyvos, is across the street and is heavenly- I do reccommend it. Also the famous Carnegie Deli is just down the street. Not a bad walk to Broadway plays.

Reviews.Title: “To Enjoy New York staying at its heart.”
Reviews.Author: Gablu
Reviews.Content: This was personal tour with family to see New york and its vibrant life. I searched the hotel through net. This was at most reasonable rate that I could locate at a stone through distance from famous time square. This is located at the centre of Manhattan. All prominent sightseeing objects are at convinient distance. Plently of food joints close by. At night , from my hotel window I could gaze at the dazling neon lights of Times Square. Wonderful experience to cherish for ever.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel, good location- look for special offers”
Reviews.Author: cyclone-zh
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at this hotel in Sept 2008. Cleanliness was average at best, location great. Had a special offer which shaved some of the expensive room prices. Would recommend this hotel only to business travelers who do not care much about the place they stay. Not good for romantic travels- would make you look a bit shabby.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience!”
Reviews.Author: mbad2010
Reviews.Content: Location was good. Room was clean. Website claimed there was wi-fi in the rooms but there was a charge for it so I found that a bit misleading. My designer sunglasses went missing from the room. I did not take them outside at all during the 4 days we stayed there as I was using another pair. The entire glasses case with glasses included were picked up. Informed hotel security but all they did was file a report which was to be emailed to me (still not emailed it's been 3 days) and nothing has yet come out of it! I guess if you do plan on going there lock your valuables in the storage or just don't take them at all because who knows!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: yaffchi
Reviews.Content: Great location. Our room looked out on Times Square and every night we fell asleep when we look at the changing square lights. the staff was professional and ready to help. We forgot some clothes in the hotel and after a few days we received them. But despite the praise we weren't so happy - we could enter our room only at prescribed time . after aboout 11 hours of flight we had to sit in the lobby for almost 3 hours. Our room wasn't so clean , not always the cleaning lady suck the dust from the carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HorsleyPalf
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel for our 5 day trip, we loved this hotel. Huge rooms with 2 double beds, clean and quiet. The reception staff were excellent nothing was ever to much trouble, they were happy to change money for the phone, give directions, store luggage they were great. The hotel was in a great location 5-10 mins walk from Times Square but in a quiet spot. A tube station directly outside which was a great help. We felt very safe walking back to our hotel everynight, there were a number of great cafes nearby for breakfast, no need to book the hotel breakfast. Would stay again and recomment to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing”
Reviews.Author: travelfrequently40
Reviews.Content: If you want a great location with overpriced Best Western motif rooms, this is your spot. Don't be misled by the redone lobby - the rooms were depressing, poorly redone, and screamed "saving money - and not for the customer". It was a very unsatisfying experience and we won't be returning. Nothing about Park Central has the word "value" in it.

Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: justeda
