Reviews.Content: you can walk everywhere from this hotel. 5th ave. times square, broadway, central park, we even walked to rockfeller :)) the subway station is almost under the hotel, tho hop in hop off buses just stops in front of the hotel. room was comfortable and the prices were fine. next time we travell to ny we will probably choose this hotel again :)

Reviews.Title: “Good overall”
Reviews.Author: blackpig
Reviews.Content: Good overall hotel , could've been closer to 5th avenue but very good for walk in the park with the baby , the kids playground is amazing in central park and not far from the hotel. The rooms were of good size but the room service finished at 9.45 pm and we did ring at 9.35 and no one answered. I don't reccomend the hamburgers from the menu. We were very happy with the service and the rooms were satisfactory although quite dark. The bed was sooo confortable and the cot be provided for the baby was fine. The breakfast wasn't particularly good but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent stay!!! Completely worth it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EnidMike
Reviews.Content: The location and the price are just perfect!!!! There's a subway station like a minute away from the lateral doors and it's a walk distance from Central Park and Times Square. It has a subway restaurant and other cafeterias very near. The room was very clean, LCD TV, the bathroom was perfectly clean and the size of the room is very comfortable. The staff is very accessible and willing to help with any questions you might have. I'm definitively keeping this hotel as one of my favorites in NYC!!

Reviews.Title: “OK for the night”
Reviews.Author: telemark
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Park Central are the rates which are - for most of the time - pretty competitive. Then there's the location. I really like that part of Manhattan, pretty close to Central Park and Times Sq, yet ideally hooked up with bus and Subway connections crosstown as well as up- and downtown. The room was about as average as average can be. It's just the terribly smelly carped that I find disgusting. The bathroom was OK and so was the TV. More than $14 a day for WiFi is far too much (per device - Win7 users think about using your connected notebook as a virtual router!). And I did not like the $3.75 per bag charge for luggage storage once I checked out. Hey, folks, you better charge $5 per night more and provide this for free.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but functional”
Reviews.Author: MikeB_London_623
Reviews.Content: The Park Central has many things going for it: ideally located from a subway stop making transfers from JFK easy, short walk from many of the top locations including times square, empire state etc. On the down side we will remember this hotel mainly for its negative points: VERY long check in line. Whilst waiting in the line two members of staff appeared to ask if they could help but done nothing upon hearing that we wanted to check in. Any query at all just required too much time to resolve by the staff. Lied to by the staff. We wanted to change travelers cheques and were told since it was a holiday (memorial day) we could only change at most $100 per day. However on subsequent days the staff also refused to change anything beyond $100 $25 breakfast rip off. i really cant emphasis how much this should be avoided. Staff unwilling to help. We asked about a 3AM airport transfer to La Guardia the member of staff looked at us like we were crazy and told us she couldnt arrange anything. It was left to us to arrange it ourselves. The room cleaning was pretty patchy - cafetiere had not been washed in a VERY long time, glasses were not washed, used towels were left. Extremely pricey internet - it had been advertised to us as free at expedia Above all the price point of this hotel does not really match what the hotel offers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: dcbird
Reviews.Content: Since I got a room at the last minute for $100/night I feel I can't complain about the few things that made this hotel less than a 5-star experience. Yes, the check-in line was kind of long, and I was a bit put off at being charged $3.75 to store my luggage for a few hours after I had checked out. But these are little things. The room was clean and quiet. I would have liked the shower water to be a bit hotter, but that's a common problem in hotels, even expensive ones. As others have noted, the location is wonderful for access to everything, especially the theater district; yet you're not in the crush and noise of the heart of the Times Square area. I found the staff helpful and pleasant -- and I liked getting free, fresh apples from the check-in desk. All in all, a good deal, a pleasant stay, and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “lousy hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: desertcrow
Reviews.Content: I am not very demanding of my lodging, but in my opinion this is NOT a 3.5 star hotel. We had no bath mat, 1 set of towels each, poor amenities, and the sheets on the bed were so short that they didn't even cover the mattress, which is just plain gross. Fortunately the other bed had longer sheets. Unfortunately, that raises other questions. We also didn't have the extra blanket that was supposed to be in the room. There were 2 beds, but only one table between them, with the lighting all on it, fortunately I carry a headlamp so I could still read in bed. Really, it was not a good hotel, I would not pay much. The location was good, Blue Dog Cafe around the corner for Bfst and Lunch take away was GREAT. I do not usually make reviews, but I just had to say something about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews didnt match hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Tracey_NY
Reviews.Content: We first thought about this hotel when looking where to stay in NY but we found another so went with it. You may wonder why I am writing a review for this hotel then. Well we were due to fly out 15th April the day the Icelandic volcano erupted but our flight was cancelled I re-booked our whole trip twice. The second time the hotel we had booked couldn’t change our room to our new dates. I had enough and couldn’t really care where I stayed I was going to be in NEW YORK. This trip was for my 21st and I just wanted to get there. What put us off originally were the reviews for Park Central that the staff weren’t helpful, rooms weren’t clean, lift took ages, rooms not being ready on arrival, I could go on. Well these reviews didn’t match the hotel we turned up at. Lobby excellently decorated family members couldn’t believe what we paid to stay here they thought it should have been more. The hotel didn’t look that day decorated but there had been a redecoration before we arrived. Doormen more then helpful, a janitor always cleaning the floors making them shiny I saw him every day, lifts where a wee bit slow but only if you where in a hurry, in the morning the lifts where busy but it was the busiest part of the day, staff were helpful, room was huge for what we expected we had a window looking out to the stage doors of Carnegie Hall, it was quite as quite could be for New York, we got to get into our room before the stated check-in we must have checked in about 1.45pm and the stated check-in is 4.00pm. Location is great, we went on the movie tour and couldn’t believe how close we were to everything, you can see Times Square from the front door. Very good diner round the corner Brooklyn Diner (Even the Stars Visit) and the Cafe Metro also very good but Cafe Metro can be quite expensive. We walked everywhere apart from getting the Subway from the corner to Battery Park.(a bit far for me to walk) We are planning a further trip in the winter to experience a NY Christmas and also to look into apartments hopefully, and will be definitely staying at PARK CENTRAL again.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk: smile and say "Yes" and " I'll see what I can do", that's your job, really”
Reviews.Author: R_Danielsson
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay near Times Square, the park and MoMA, the Park Central is probably the best bang for your buck. But location is pretty much the only thing they've got that is much better than average. When we got to the hotel, after a 9 hour flight that was 4 hours delayed from the start, we pretty much just wanted to get checked in quickly and with a smile, get a bite to eat and go to sleep. What we got was a front desk that treated us like we were a bother rather than welcome guests. That kind of set the mood for the following days. The rest of the staff: house keeping, bellboys, room service and the car service made up for it somewhat though. Also, $14/day for WiFi... Come on, who charges separately for internet access these days? We got the infamous "brick wall-view", but since I knew this might be a possibility, it was more like a ironic joke (stay on the 19th floor and the view is... bricks) than a real inconvenience. At least we weren't disturbed by lights or traffic. We had dinner once at the restaurant in the hotel (Cityhouse), and all of us enjoyed it. It was early and it seemed lika a slow evening, so I'm guessing the service was a little better than normal. I might come back even if I'm not staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat The Location”
Reviews.Author: Standby_Hitchhiker
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, Fantastic Location !! In the middle of Midtown Manhattan, a few blocks from just about everything. Not too expensive, especially for the location. Room very comfortable, and large enough for 2. Valet parking is the same price as if you parked in a garage yourself. Air conditioner was a little anemic, but once the room cooled off, it stayed comfortable. I have stayed at the Empire and the Wellington (similar price), and Park Central has them beat. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: cmc1985
Reviews.Content: Ignore all the poor reviews on this hotel. We had a double double room which was clean and spacious for 4 adults. The foyer of the hotel is lovely. We found the staff helpful throughout our stay. The gym was a good size and well equipped compared to other hotels previously stayed in. The main selling point to the hotel is of course the location. It couldnt' be better if you tried. Just a couple of minutes walk to Central Park and a short walk to Times Square with the entrance to the tube next to the hotel.Would definitely recommend this hotel for a leisure stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean”
Reviews.Author: joyceadrianne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July for 2008 to see a couple games at Old Yankee Stadium and Shea Stadium. Upon arriving, we had to wait 3 hours for our room to be ready but once we go in, it was a normal sized room with a big screen T.V. Very Clean for what it was. Excellent location from everything you might want to do in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “I stayed at this hotel for about 10 days...”
Reviews.Author: MarySP
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for about 10 days last year with my husband. First thing I need to say is that the location is fantastic. That's the single reason why I would return there and recommend it to a friend. It's a few blocks away from the Central Park, Times Square and several Broadway theaters. But I need to report that the service is terrible. Rooms were clean and ok, but staff wasn't helpful at all. There were no towels at the room when we arrived. It took them 3 hours to deliver them to my room after my request. And there were several similar incidents throughout our stay. At the check out, the concierge asked how our stay was, and when we said it wasn't good, she just replied "too bad" - she didn't even bother to ask why!

Reviews.Title: “Ripped Off...Poor Service... Beware!!!”
Reviews.Author: freqtravels_10
Reviews.Content: Since this is the only avenue that looks like it recieves a reply. I am forced to share my ill will. I made reservations in February and cancelled well before the trip. I called to cancel over the phone and the agent said everything was taking care of. I then found over $1,200 in Park Cental charges on my account! I have called accounting and management serveral times only to be sent to voice mailboxes. One reservation agent even went so far as to tell me he was the Manager. After belaboring him with questions he quickly changed his story and told me that he was not even in the same building. He admitted to being an outside reservation agent! The lying and decent needs to stop. I hope this prompts Mr. Rush to call me back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location if you want Midtown, mediocre hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Cricket4445
Reviews.Content: The lobby belies a somewhat dated hotel behind the scenes. Staff service was all over the board from helpful to downright rude. I was not impressed with the cleanliness of the rooms either. Dust, hair in the bathroom, grungy carpeting all added to the feeling that things we're a bit slip shod. It felt like a 'cattle' hotel - designed to move the masses not cater to guests. The bar was ridiculously overpriced even by NYC standards and you will be charged to store your luggage before or after your stay. We were here for a small conference and honestly the 'ballroom' was dated, dirty, poorly lit and in a sub basement. The restrooms were about one notch above a gas station (in the woman's room only one door had a working lock). They were obviously not updated with the rest of the hotel. Not an inspiring place to learn something new! If you needed a place to stay centrally for a night or two, this would be okay, but with all the lodging options in a city the size of New York, I'd look elsewhere first. But note that I think the concierge service is a third party service not connected to the hotel so don't expect the staff there to even be able to tell you where things in the hotel are located. Oh, icing on the cake? The gap around the door in our room was big enough to see in and out of! Hey, a free peep show for people passing by in the hallway. ugh.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: pletzkeb
Reviews.Content: We recently spent one night at the Park Central after returning from a cruise. We arrived early, about 11:30 am, after getting off the ship. I had requested an early check-in. Our room wasn't ready, so we were upgraded to a suite. I was amazed at the size of the room for a New York hotel. We had a king size bed with flat screen TV. The sitting room had a large couch, 2 chairs and a flat screen TV. The bathroom was small, but they usually are. The room was very comfortable with upscale linens. We had a hard time connecting to the internet (yes, there is a charge), but once connected everything was fine. We had cocktails in the lobby bar. The bartender was very pleasant. Checkout was a breeze. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel!!! Would definately stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: IloveAmerica09
Reviews.Content: The Park Central hotel could not have been better. The location is superb, the room was a very decent size considering the price and location. There was no problem with the cleanliness of the room, staff were all friendly and I would definately stay here again without question. The only problem we had was the water did not get very hot so the showers were luke warm at best, but everything else was as you would expect from a hotel at this price and more. If I return to NYC I will stay here again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “top location”
Reviews.Author: erikjan64
Reviews.Content: although the hotel is located close to times square, it was also a quiet hotel, no noises during the night, friendly staff. The only thing we didn't like was that there was no free wifi, like in all the other hotels we stayed in during this trip, and that use of internet in the buisinessscentre is $ 20,= per hour !!! this hotel has no pool either.

Reviews.Title: “Motto for this hotel-a good stay never means having to say "I'm sorry"”
Reviews.Author: sstfam
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel unless you LIKE the following; -non-working or poorly working light fixtures -poorly working hairdryer in the bathroom -trash behind the furniture -poor customer at all levels (slow room service, housekeeping issues, check-in desk) -non-working elevators (one of two-did not work during half of our stay causing serious delays) -mildew in the shower -no natural light in the room -broken equipment in the fitness center Upon check in we had a multitude of issues with our rooms. Starting out with the trash behind the dresser (which was not cleaned up until 9pm that night after three calls to housekeeping and an eventual call to management). Mildew in the shower (which was eventually worked on however the stains remain which is a sign of inadequate upkeep). In the morning we thought there was an eclipse of the sun because our rooms were so dark however since we had interior rooms it turns out there is no natural light in the room. This is not disclosed on the website when booking your room-we eventually called our rooms the "batcave" because you would have to turn on most of the lights in your room during the day to see anything. We booked the rooms for five nights and paid over $2000 to the hotel and thought the service would be better. By the third day our room keys had expired because the desk personnel could not figure out how to program our keys for the entire five day stay. This was very inconvenient since we had arrived back at the hotel at 11pm and could not get into our rooms. After calling to the front desk they said security would have to come up to let us in (which was to be about 5 minutes). Waiting 20 minutes we were still not in our rooms and had to go back to the front desk to get the keys fixed. Considering we were traveling with an elderly parent this was very frustrating. Although the location is nice and we were eventually offered a slight adjustment (and I mean very slight) to our account there are much better options if you want to stay in this area of NYC. The Sheraton Towers are right down the street and have nice room with actual daylight. The Park Central clearly needs some major upgrades to the rooms and full disclosure on their website about what rooms you are booking (obviously exterior rooms have daylight). I would pay more for nicer rooms that had natural light and no mildew. Management is very good at saying "I'm sorry" however the follow-up is lacking. All I can say is that I'm sorry I stayed at this hotel....pay a little more and have a much better experience at a different hotel. If Park Central decides to response to this post they will once again say "I'm sorry"---the motto of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: acctspay103
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for one night, but very helpful staff. The a/c did not work but called front desk and within 10 minutes maintenance arrived and advised that a/c needed new motor so we had to switch rooms which was an inconvenience but could have been worse. Drove into City and valeted car - and had no problem. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “good location,good hotel nothing special but friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: daveh24seven
Reviews.Content: good hotel ,nothing special, would stay again because of location,buffet breakfast not good value

Reviews.Title: “The room had trash laying all around it upon check-in!”
Reviews.Author: bnormant
Reviews.Content: I checked in at 10:30pm. I would believe this would be plenty of time to have the room ready. Instead, after checking in and getting up to my room, I could see the bed was made and the towels hung up nicely, but there was trash scattered throughout the room. Empty Macy's bags on the bed, hand written notes on the dresser and side table, disposable razor and used toothbrush in the bathroom, long black hair in the tub, etc. I spent the first part of my night filling both Macy's bags with the trash I collected throughout the room, and the second part of my night trying to get to sleep after that very unpleasant experience. First thing in the morning, I brought it down to the front desk. They apologized and said they would have someone re-clean the room right away. I don't believe the maid came to my room once for the rest of my stay there. Which is actually fine with me because I was not about to leave a tip for the initial awful service. The Front desk asked if I had breakfast and I indicated I had not but that I had to get to work. He said that was too bad because he was going to offer me some complimentary breakfast. Apparently I could only be compensated for my troubles that morning and since I was busy I just lost out on it, even though I was staying in the hotel for another two nights. I mean come on, you can't offer me a voucher for another day? Do I really have to ask you to do that after the awful state of the room I had found? The quality of the room and the initial trash cleaning I had to do totally soured the whole stay. And there were other issues with the room as well. The cord for the side lamp was stretched across the corner of the room to the outlet which seems like a safety hazard. There is no temperature control on the unit by the window, so i was either freezing or too warm most of the time. The curtains were pretty see through and the heavy curtains don't pull closed so there is nothing to block the lights from outside. And since all the glasses had the covers off them, I didn't dare go get ice so I could even have a glass of water before bed. There was mold/mildew growing on the lip of the tub. It's like they spent a lot of money to make the lobby and lounge look great, but the rooms were like staying in a cheap motel, not a nice hotel. It was probably the worst experience I've had with a room. I have to be up in NYC another couple of times over the next 6 weeks, but needless to say I will not be staying here again. And in fact will be recounting my experiences with the Park Central on TripAdvisor.com, hotels.com, and expedia where I had made the reservation from in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for NYC”
Reviews.Author: PMSantos
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal ($165/night) on a superior room. The room was indeed very good and the hotel in general was nice. The location is unbeatable if you want to be close to Central Park, and the metro is around the corner. On the minus side, every extra is paid: you pay for internet, you pay $4 to store your bags for a few hours (for instance after you check out). This happens at every hotel in NYC, and is really annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: jimbo1249
Reviews.Content: We were just there a few days ago and even though it rained the whole time, our stay at the Park Central was outstanding. The rooms were very clean and the service was terrific. I will absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - thankyou.”
Reviews.Author: backseatflyer
Reviews.Content: An excellent stay for 4 days. Check in fast, friendly and helpful. We had made arrangements to upgrade to a suite if available and were given a high level one with a small roof terrace with views of Times Square. We were very comfortable. Didn't take breakfast but had an excellent dinner in the hotel restaurant on our last evening. Our suite and the public spaces we used were spotless and well maintained. I thought the lift system excellent. Frankly I cannot find fault with this hotel (I am a retired airline pilot so have seen a few hotels)-: ( and would aim to book here on any future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Park Central - Would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: cxguti
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week long stay at the Park Central Hotel and we were pleasantly surprised with our stay. We got an excellent rate - AAA discount plus an extra 30% off of our stay... The cheapest rate we could find for that location. We paid for a concierge king, so our hotel room was on the 22nd floor... Quiet as can be and far enough away from street noise. Also, the room was pretty good sized for the city. We had two concerns with the hotel based on previous comments from other travelers. The first was no hot water in the room... The first thing we did when we walked into our room was go into the bathroom and turn on the shower - hot water right away. That eliminated our first concern. Our second concern was the bed... Previous travelers noted that the beds were rock hard. Not the case in our room - we slept like babies the entire time we were there... The one complaint we have is that the heater in the room did not work. We were chilly one night and turned it on. It pushed out air, just not hot air... other than that night, we didn't need heat... and it wasn't a deal killer for us. The hotel staff was overall helpful. I needed a shower cap and extra hangers for the closets - we got them right away. Some of the staff was not terribly bright, but at least they were nice. And finally, you can't beat the location of this hotel! Walking distance to everything... And we have to recommend Hell's Kitchen for meals! We walked to Central Park, Hell's Kitchen, Theatre District, Times Square... and we had a hop on/hop off bus stop 1/2 a block away... As first-timers to the city, we loved our stay... and we'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: FMMG
Reviews.Content: Like a previous reviewer, we arrived at this hotel by accident rather than by design during the travel disruption caused by the volcano. We spent our last night in NYC here, before ( eventually ) getting our flight home ( our previous 2 flights were cancelled). We were very pleasantly surprised by the hotel experience. Location: great..very close to Central Park. Rooms: not luxurious but very clean & plenty of space. Public areas: plenty of seating, nice bar. Staff: very helpful & attentive. I couldn't really fault it & the price wasn't too bad either. We would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: dizzyy
Reviews.Content: Arrived here from another hotel during the travel disruptions from the volcano. Very helpful and pleasant staff. While rooms are a teeny little bit dated, overall a really great stay. Ate in the restaurant and the staff here were brilliant, and the food just delicious Very close to Central Park. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service combined with downright discusting rooms made this place a total nightmare; we went home early.”
Reviews.Author: Krhodey
Reviews.Content: The location was great. The lobby was nice. Once you stepped off the elevator, the halls stunk. Our room smelled of some horrible stench. There was mold growing in the bathroom, the ceiling of the room and all around the window. It was so bad we went home early because we couldn't stand to be there one more night. that's not even to mention the staff. Completely incompetent, rude and unhelpful. I have no idea why they were working in the "hospitality" industry. Literally the worst hotel I've ever stayed in and I've traveled the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: QueenMum
Reviews.Content: I didn't actually stay there but had friends visiting NYC and this is what happened.... A group of us wanted to surprise them with flowers and cocktails delivered to their room. It's easy to get champagne sent to a room, but cocktails are another matter. Karen from the concierge dept was fantastic in getting the flowers delivered for me. She then put me in touch with Mattia Miradoli Food & Bev Mgr, who somehow managed to have the fresh cocktails delivered moments after their arrival. Both Mattia and Karen called me in Washington state throughout the day to let me know the progress of the big surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: slinker001
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, excellent location and helpful staff. First off I don't need alot of hotel staff support, really just on check-in. I'm really just interested in the hotel room and location and those were excellent. The room was nice and nicely decorated, though it was a pretty small.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: RippedOff_10
Reviews.Content: Great location! The on site restaurant has good food and with large portions. Extremely comfortable beds, easy parking, nice bar, great views......nothing bad about this hotel!! However, I rented my room through PRICELINE.COM, only find out from other guests that they got lower rates elsewhere. Will never use PRICELINE.COM again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, great price”
Reviews.Author: Jewels07
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to New York City within the last 4 years and the best hotel we've stayed at thus far. Location was great for tourism (times square, central park, rockefeller center), price was affordable compared to other hotels in the area, and the rooms were large and comfortable. Repeat, our room was large- not easy to find at a good price. We had a horrible view of a brick building but we loved it because this meant no noise! We slept soundly and the bed was very comfortable also. We only had 2 complaints: there was black mold in the caulking in the shower (the kind that cannot be cleaned but needs to be replaced) and the elevator system was slow during peak times (I even waited 10 minutes before taking the stairs down many flights). Despite the mold issue, everything else appeared new and clean. The hotel staff was professional and friendly. You can also check your luggage for a fee if you arrive prior to check-in or are leaving well after you check-out. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant but did use the business center to print our boarding passes with ease (the airline check in system in the lobby was not working). We believe we have finally found our New York City hotel and plan on staying here again if the prices remain reasonable. Thank you for an enjoyable and stress free stay. Additional recommendation: Do not eat breakfast nearby due to extremely high prices and okay quality food. If you walk a few blocks west you can find wonderful places for breakfast and only pay $7 for an omlette-yes in NYC :) Otherwise 1 meal will cost you over $15 if you stay close around the hotel and the times square area.

Reviews.Title: “Thrilled with location and great bedding”
Reviews.Author: yorktownkids
Reviews.Content: I have a history of travel to NYC and NJ, but have rarely stayed in the city due to business needs conferences. This trip was with my 2 teenagers, and I was hesitant to pull the trigger and end up with a dump. What a pleasan suprise to discover this very central location with easy access to subways, Central Park, Time Sq etc. Great prices for the room - quiet, clean, helpful staff..... perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Nice public areas. The rooms were a bit basic but very clean.”
Reviews.Author: familyroadtripper
Reviews.Content: I went to the Park Central as a guest/chaperone of a school group that was performing at Carnegie Hall. The location of the hotel can't be beat. It is almost directly across the street from Hall, and it is centrally located a few blocks from Central Park and Times Square and relatively easy walking distance to most Midtown attractions (Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, Rockefeller Center, MOMA, etc.) A subway station is right outside the hotel. The public areas (the lobby, the meeting halls, the front desk area) were nicely appointed with comfortable couches in the lobby surrounded by large multi-colored silk screen prints/photos of Judy Garland. Although I didn't go to the restaurant or bar, they both seemed very nice. The rooms were clean and comfortable, but a bit on the basic. I did not have a coffee maker in my room (although some in our party did), and the decor reminded me of a motor hotel more than an in-town hotel. My main complaint was that the bathroom was VERY dark. I don't know what the wattage on the bulbs was in the bathroom light fixtures, but I had difficulty putting in my contact lenses. I flipped the switch for the shower light when I first arrived in the room but couldn't even tell there was a light in the shower. However, the bed was very comfortable, and the widescreen T.V. was nice. Overall, the Park Central is not particularly luxurious, but it is a nice place to stay if one is visiting Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: ConwayReiver
Reviews.Content: There are lots of differing reviews on this hotel, but I for one would go back. It all depends what you want from a hotel in a vast city - we did not spend too much time in it, other than sleeping, as we were only in NYC for 5 nights and there is so much to see. Yes, its busy, as is the whole of the City, but the staff were friendly & helpful. Its location is worth the price alone, only two blocks from Central Park. Good shower & surprisingly quiet at night, helped aswell. We bought tickets on the Gray Line tour buses for three days and although it seemed a little pricey at $256 for 4, it proved to be great value. We hopped off & on all over the place, the guides were brill and we enjoyed a super 2 hour night tour. However, be aware that the hotel bar is very pricey (unless your on business expenses !!) and the porters definately have a deal ongoing with the black sedans. We mistakenly agreed to their offer for a car to JFK for $55, as they stated this included tolls & tip. Needless to say, the driver paid no tolls ! If there are four of you, the yellow cabs are good value in Manhattan & to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect politeness, apologies or hot water.”
Reviews.Author: robmead
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival, we received a muted greeting with someone behind the reception counter, and were made to feel like we were putting her at an inconvenience by checking in. After receiving our key cards, we were given no instructions as to how to actually get to our room, and needed to ask another member of staff. Upon getting to the room, we got changed and went out for the evening, to try and enjoy the little time that we now had. The following morning, it turned out that we had no hot water, and again, due to our limited time, did what we could on the assumption that this was just a temporary blip on your part, and that you would not of checked us in to a room in which you knew there were problems. The following morning, when there was still no hot water available, I went down to reception to enquire. After speaking to other guests in the elevator, it turned out that nobody had been able to shower that day, and that no information was being easily offered by any staff. One woman even commented that the staff “just didn’t seem to care”. When I reached reception, I explained the situation and was told to talk to the manager. She didn’t apologise. The manager arrived, and again after I explained the situation (no apology offered). He informed me that they had been issues with the hot water in that part of the hotel over the weekend. When questioned as to why would you place a paying customer in a room which is known to have quite major issues, no appropriate response was given. I was then told that, if I could “hang around until mid-day” (this conversation was taking place at about 09:30), he could “probably sort something out”. I suggested to him that as I was on holiday, I might not want to spend half the day waiting for some hot water. Reluctantly, he then offered me a key to another room, where we could shower. This room was about as far away from ours as possible, and as it turned out, had a broken hair-dryer. My partner went to the front desk to let them know so that it could be repaired or replaced, and again no thanks or apology provided. As I left the shower room, I gave the key to a member of staff in reception, whose role seemed to be to point people to the front desk. I again explained my concerns with both the room and service. She had little to no interest and again, no apology. Despite formally writing to the hotel operations manager, as of yet, I have had no response or acknowledgement. On the plus side, the hotel is in a good location for Central Park, Time Sq etc, and just above a subway station, but despite this, I would never consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: worldlything
Reviews.Content: My daugher and I just returned from a vacation in the Big Apple. We were so pleased with the hotel and the staff. We were especially pleased with the location, everything we wanted to do was within walking distance or a short cab fare away. Good restuarants nearby for the budget minded traveler, like us, we found the Metro Cafe to be a reasonably priced place to eat when we wanted something affordable. Can't wait to return to the Park Central!

Reviews.Title: “too busy and crowdy”
Reviews.Author: alanpho2
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel overall, but too touristic and crowned; the checking and hall service is not at the same level of a 5 stars hotel; never had to queue in a raw to check in and have me been called forward... as I was queuing at post office; the breakfast at 25$ is overpriced as the quality and variety of food is poor. Very nice room and clean; comfortable bad; Internet was not working in all the rooms; I had colleagues experiencing the same problems; we have been given a phone number to call for fix it, but long time waiting someone to pick up the phone; good thing I had my blackberry with me..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price and value....”
Reviews.Author: travelfoolIndiana
Reviews.Content: I do agree that some of the poor reviews that this hotel has received must be from people used to staying in 6 star hotels. You won't get that here - you get what you pay for - which is a very fine 3+ star hotel. First the room - we reserved a 2 room suite for a family of 4 - great rates made this a good NYC deal at 40% off rack room rates. Not sure I would pay normal rates for the suite, but it was very nice. The separate bedroom and living room were perfect for us as we were traveling with 2 teen boys and needed the extra space. Queen bed was extremely comfortable, sofa pullout was fine for the kids, and the 2 flat screens were nice. We had no issues with an cleanliness - the rooms and bathroom were cleaned appropriately throughout our 3 night stay. Extra pillows, bedding and towels were brought up within 45 minutes our our request. Wake-up call was provided as requested. There is a large volume of people that stay at this hotel so the hotel lobby/elevator area can seem busy at times. However, I never waited longer than 1 minute for an elevator at any time, the concierge desk was helpful (and genuinely interested in helping), and the bellman notified us when our car arrived (we had arranged for a town car in advance - I suggest you do this too if you are concerned about what some of the other reviewers mention about deals between drivers/bellmen). The proximity to the subway is unbeatable. Literally you walk out the door, and the subway entrance is right on the corner. It provides access to the N-R-W-Q lines, which can easily connect you to any other lines you need. Nice cafe across the street for breakfast - Park Cafe - quick service and great food. Also appreciated the Subway (sandwich shop) located across the street for the late night munchies of teenagers. We did not utilize any of the bars or restaurants in the hotel. Didn't use the fitness facilities either but they are large and very nicely stocked with mulitple treadmills, elypticals, etc. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to others. We had NO issues with noise whatsoever - either from outside or other rooms. Also, appreciated the ability to open the windows a bit (hard stop at 3-4 inches) to allow fresh air in the room. This was a great value for the money (mind you 40% off rack room suite rates), and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Turning into a dump.”
Reviews.Author: Aupoil
Reviews.Content: I used to love this hotel but now it is turning into a dump. Besides taking cold showers and no apology and no explanation except "we are working on it", the hotel has a serious mold and plumbing smell problem. Not sure if they had a flood and didn't fix it properly, but it's bad. I moved to three different rooms and finally the last didn't have the odor but it was so deep into the carpet dirty -- it was unthinkable for a hotel charging over $ 200 a night. This hotel has a great location and for some reason they are NOT putting money into replacing wallpaper or carpets. My guess is that they are going to run it into the ground and then start all over again. The housekeeping dept. is in need of some serious training about what is clean. I

Reviews.Title: “I stayed there once and liked it but they...”
Reviews.Author: Annfhg
Reviews.Content: I stayed there once and liked it but they have changed. Dirty room (literally trash on the floor), mold growing on bathroom light and a completely soaking wet carpet caused me to request a room change at 1:30am. The manager didn't seem to believe me, no apology and no offer to have someone help move my luggage. In addition, there was an issue with the reservation. Lastly, a yellow cab driver told me they are the only hotel in town that has a deal with drivers of the black sedans--they try to get guests to use them or more $$. I got my own cab so that my driver wouldn't have to make a payout to the doorman. Won't be back ad encourage you to stay elsewhere too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SydneyFamilyof4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 7 night on a 2 week trip to New York. The room was clean and tidy albeit small but we had expectatioins that this was the case based on other reviews. On 2 occassions we had cold water showers, there seemed to be no reason for this according to the hotel but unfortunately it tainted our stay. To the hotels credit they did refund our internet connection fee for the inconvenience. Also found that you could not regulate the heating - it was way too hot in the room and then all of a sudden the heating would go off. During our stay my room card became defective and would not open the room door, apparently the hotels reservation system was down so for an entire day each time we went back to our room they had to send security up to let me in, and security were not quick. The hotel is in a great location if you want to be really touristy, all the restaurants cater for tourists and it is very close to Times Square and Central Park. For out second week we stayed at Murry Hill at the Affinia Dumont which was much better, very centrally located and a much better class of restaurant district.

Reviews.Title: “I would never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mmontem
Reviews.Content: Do not stay in this old and dingy midtown Manhattan Hotel. The rooms are old and small. My room key malfunctioned 5 times and all the front desk would do is give me a new key. My room phone never worked. They also charge $3.50 told hold on to bags at their conceirge service. I am going back to the hampton inn across the street ....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: xxabbiebrownxx
Reviews.Content: Do not listen to the snobs that have rated this hotel badly. This hotel was fantastic. The reception smells lovely and is all black marble flooring. Amenities are good, self service check in, modernised elevator system and all floors come with soda and ice machines. Beds are extra comfortable and all rooms come with large LCD TV's with cable, bath/shower, air con and are kept spotless daily from the maids. Location is great, 5 minute walk to both Times Sq and Central Park. Only a few minor complaints: some staff are a bit sour faced however most were very helpful. Our safe was broken, however we were allowed to either swap room or use a safe in reception. And the bar and restaurant in the hotel lobby are a bit pricey...but then again - so is the rest of Manhattan. So generally, this was an amazing hotel and I wouldn't hesitate to rebook. Some of the other reviews I've read have been a bit of a joke. I understand that some customer's get a bit of a raw deal but these reviews seem to be nitpickers and snobs. Book this hotel. You'll have a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! What a location”
Reviews.Author: chichi_amore
Reviews.Content: First of all I just want to say other reviews said the staff were not friendly or helpful...Oh my word it was the very opposite...They totally went out of their way to make sure we were looked after and did not get lost. The hotel is very clean and modern...The beds and pillow were better then home...We slept so well. The location is perfect 2 minutes to central park and 5 minutes to time square...Could not complain at all. Now for a few complaints...The lobby bar is sooooooooooooo expensive 2 rye and gingers and 2 glasses of red wine,(small glasses) $62.00 US too....The staff was rude and closed the bar way to early both nights.....I cannot express enough how RUDE the male bartender was to everyone even fellow staff....... And that was the end of the complaints. Go to the Chelsea Market if you get a chance it is in between 14th and 23d street, the food network is taped upstairs...It is a most from great food to shopping at a Bloomingdale's sample store to a wonderful wine store...It is such an experience. If you have anymore question just ask:}

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: TraveliNorway
Reviews.Content: the hotel looks better from the outside than the inside, but the location is very good - close to central park, shopping, sightseeing etc. The rooms are a bit worn, e.g. the chair in our room was worn out and should have been replaced and we had a concierge room. The size of the room is good for Manhattan, and the noise I guess is the same everywhere this central. We didn't try the breakfast, but went to cafe Metro just a few metres down the street. There's a Starbucks next to the hotel and two delis on the next corner. I agree with some of the other posts about the service, it's not good at all. Even the doorman was rude to me when I got back from shopping. All in all, for the price we paid through their website, the value was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you would want from a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Londoner_1988
Reviews.Content: Before my arrival i read up a few review's on here and i was pretty worried about what i'd put myself in for. Luckily had a brilliant time. On arrival i was served quickly and pleasantly at reception. The receptionist was friendly and helpful as were any other staff over my 5 nights at the hotel. Room's were cleaned every day with new towels and sheets provided. To be honest i was on holiday so i didn't spend lengthy periods of time in the hotel. Basically the bed was comfortable, flat screen tv's provided and generally a nice room to stay in. The hotel is VERY good value for money comparing to other hotels in the area and the position of the hotel was just perfect. 3 blocks (2 minute walk) from central park and about 6 blocks (5 minutes) from times square. Will definatly stay here again next time i'm in New York

Reviews.Title: “Great place all around”
Reviews.Author: dbdToronto
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveller to NYC and have stayed @ Park Central many times now. The service I have recieved has been top notch. Rooms are of great value with very comftorable beds and linen. Location is excellent for business and even better to take in many of New Yorks finest attractions. Could use a free wi fi area however but the starbucks next door can solve this. I look forward to many continiued stays. Dennis

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy2727
Reviews.Content: Booked online via Hotwire, and was placed into this hotel for a four-night solo vacation. Very quick and professional check in. Room was clean; king bed comfortable; bathroom small but adequate. On check-in the room lacked facecloths plus ironing board & iron, but both were delivered promptly when I notified the front desk. Elevators take a bit of figuring out, but worked okay. Bell clerk was very helpful with directions. Business center was adequate though you pay by the minute for all computers/printers etc and it adds up pretty quickly. Enjoyed the free apples at front desk! No tea/coffee maker in the room, but there are plenty of late night delis and coffee shops nearby. Extremely convenient for Carnegie Hall, subway, Times Square, Broadway theaters, Letterman show, Central Park and the MOMA. The "Park Cafe" across the road at 7th and 55th is a classic NY coffee shop; comedian Jackie Mason held court there while I was visiting. If you like him, you'll like it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Memories from a Wonderful Trip”
Reviews.Author: snax555
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last month and we had an excellent time! This hotel is in the perfect location, especially for what we like to do. We had an easy check in and received a very spacious corner room. We never heard any hallway noise, which has sometimes been a problem in the past. The front desk staff was very friendly to us. The restaurant serves a beautiful breakfast and we dined in the same restaurant for dinner two nights of our trip. So great! We will hopefully go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: dp7net
Reviews.Content: I was extremely nicely welcomed by the front office director Mr. Zalki... then went to my room and found a beautiful cozy bed to relax and have a nap after a long international flight... (I took a shower before obviously, with very good water pressure)... The breakfast buffet had everything one could wish for... Mr. Zalki checked up on me during my entire stay... it was a real pleasure staying at the Park Central. The location was just perfect... Check out the map on their website...

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dublin_IrelandKate
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at this so called hotel I was shouted at by a man behind the reception desk. Apparently I was standing in the wrong position I had to move an inch to the right LOL. A horrible way to treat a person, never mind a paying guest! This is not an isolated case it happens a lot at this hotel or boot camp. And don't even try to complain because you won't get any satisfaction! It's a joke of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel experience in the last 20 years of travel”
Reviews.Author: samhnoh
Reviews.Content: Simply said, the people here have no interest in providing service. There was no hot water every morning (for the days we stayed)!! They kept saying there was technical difficulties. Granted there can be technical difficulties, the managers kept pushing the problem up to the next higher level manager, eventually ending up to an "invisible" manager. This higher manager never showed up, never returned messages...in the 20 some years of hotel stay, I've never seen such a hotel that showed absolutely no interest in serving their customers!! Never stay in this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Cold shower!”
Reviews.Author: ireland1014
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in the Park Central hotel. The location of the hotel is excellent, the cleanliness and appearance is also as one should expect. However after the first day there we had no hot water in our room. We brought this to the attention of the manager who gave a 99% certainty this would be sorted by morning. It wasn't! We had cold water for the remainder of our stay in the hotel without the offer of a room with hot water. I find this lack of initiative very poor. While we were offered complimentary breakfast, it was disappointing to see it charged on our final bill, and not nice to have to make front desk aware of this! The hotel is a fine hotel in a great area, but going a week with out hot water seems primitive in such a large well serviced city , disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “very unorganized and bad service”
Reviews.Author: fabulousgreece
Reviews.Content: We have booked this hotel through internet and when we got here we did not get the room we had asked. WE asked for two single beds and got one king size. When we asked the staff to change room, they kept saying that the hotel manager had to decide (!) and the manager was never there! so we ended up staying in the same room. Not reccomended, it seemed that their only interest was how to get money from you. We also found dirt in the bathroom from previous guests. Disgusting!

Reviews.Title: “not the best but ok”
Reviews.Author: KIA2146
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights as a base to see New York.not a freindly welcome arrived at midday and was told to come back after 4pm asked if there was somewhere to leave our cases told yes but would have to pay.room was clean, tidy but basic no extras i:e coffee-tea facilities

Reviews.Title: “Too much smoke!”
Reviews.Author: reviewer87
Reviews.Content: Although I was assured that I had a non smoking room on a non smoking floor, both nights I was overrun by the strong odor of Pot being smoked in the room next door. This was reported both times with a request to move to a non smoking area. They assured me they would send security up but did not move my room. The location was great! The sheets were never changed over the three night stay and there was not a trash can in the bathroom. Charging $15.00 each day for internet and $3.50 to leave a bag for an hour or two was just an insult. I would rather have these costs up front in the price of the room if necessary so I know what I will be paying. I understand for New York the prices are good and the location is great but you do need to know what you may be in for staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!!!”
Reviews.Author: AmiGil
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 9 nights and we are very satisfied with the hotel. Great location, clean rooms and, good price(offer 950 kr per night) nice staff. There was an issue when my brother and sister inlaw came to check in. They were supposed to check in early in the morning because their flight landed early. The hotel were informed about this. When they turned up there was no room ready for them so it took some hours before they got the room. But the hotel didn´t charge for this first night so it was ok. The breakfustbuffé was expensive but good. But if you compare to how much you will pay for a bagel, coffe and orange juice at Metro just outside the hotel you pay almost the same as the buffe, so I recommend the buffe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren413
Reviews.Content: The area is one of the safer, cleaner ones in NYC. Sandwiched in between times square and central park it is easy to get to many of the tourist locations by just walking. We got a great non-refundable deal which the lady checking us in kindly upgraded from a king size bed to two singles free of charge, because they had more of those rooms. It was a little noisy at night but you're in the city that never sleeps so what do you expect. The rooms were clean, decently spacious, and well heated which was important in the winter, especially during a snow storm! Although the carpet at the entry way was tearing up a bit that was really the only drawback of the room, and i don't think there was a minibar but you don't spend a whole lot of time in it anyways. The hotel will hold your bags prior and after check in/out for a fee per bag. It was a dollar and change during the week (thursday) and it went up to over three dollars on the weekend. I was impressed with the hotel overall and enjoyed my time there. If the prices aren't too high without the nonrefundable deal then it is totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel bargain, not a bargain hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkLBoston
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at Park Central and it has improved. The room was clean, large for New York. Beds are comfortable and nicely styled. Bathroom is clean and well but not luxuriously furnished. Large flat-screen TV with good cable channel selection, and local channels in HD. Check-in experience was excellent with friendly, helpful staff. Elevators are a bit confusing but computerized to provide fairly quick service. Rooms are quiet but an in-room thermostat would be nice. Concierge service, room service, small restaurant. Subway is a block away. The Park Central is not a luxury hotel but both times I stayed there I thought it was well worth the price and the first place I'll look at on my next NY trip. One complaint: a $15 internet fee, to me, is the equivalent of "no internet service" and should be a thing of the past for all hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: LadyLV
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for visiting New York. It is very close to Central park and Times Square and there is a subway station right outside so you can go anywhere in New York easily.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!! Our second stay”
Reviews.Author: tonocris
Reviews.Content: My first time at this hotel was in July 2008. My husband, my kids and I were starting our vacation with 4 days at the Park Central. Unfortunately, we had to check out the next morning and go home because of a death in the family. The next summer, we decided to go back and stayed at the Park Central again for 5 days. We had a room facing 7th ave. and we had a wonderful stay. All the staff that we dealt with, the Valet Parking guy, front desk staff, housekeeping were all polite and smiling and said "Hello" as you walked by. The location of the hotel is amazing. You are right in the middle of everything. Look one way down the street and there is Times Square, look the other way and there is Central Park and the Subway entrance is right outside. We had a wonderful stay at Park Central and will most definately stay there again on our next trip to New York. I have recommended this property to many of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, underrated gem right around the corner from Times Square”
Reviews.Author: RP1809
Reviews.Content: I visited New York for Christmas in 2008 with my partner for seven nights. I didn’t originally want to stay at this hotel but was running out of time to book it and this was the only one within my price range as they had an offer on. It was the best choice I made as all the others I was wishing to stay at turned out to be awful and the Park Central was great. It’s only a couple of blocks from Times Square and everything is within walking distance. The exterior display looks quite posh at night when all lit up and the lobby was really clean and elegant. The staff were really helpful, especially the concierge who helped us find shops and other attractions nearby. We didn’t have to wait anytime at all for check in but they told us we could have an upgraded room as no non-smoking rooms were available, or wait 45 minutes for the standard room. Obviously we took the upgrade. We had two double beds and it was a generous sized room and bathroom, much nicer than the ones I had been looking at before booking it. I found the hotels décor all quite contemporary as well which I prefer, unlike most of the other hotels. Our safe wasn’t working so I called reception who sent someone up straight away and fixed it. I was a bit disappointed with the view from our room but to be honest unless you pay for a Times Square view room you won’t be able to see much in any hotel in New York. The room was cleaned everyday while we were out and fresh towels left. As we were here for Christmas I was glad the staff were all festive and friendly. They had a piano player some nights in the lobby which was nice also and I just generally found the hotel brilliant, especially as I was so dubious at staying there. I recommended it to a friend when I returned home who then stayed there and also loved it. I’m going back to New York next year but as I booked through Virgin and they don’t offer this hotel I’m not staying there again, although I do want to, I’ll have to see if the next hotel is as good. I would definitely recommend the Park Central as you get good value for money when comparing it to other same rating hotels, plus for the price you won’t find a better place for location. Whatever you do don’t get a shuttle to take you to the hotel, was the worst part of any holiday I’ve ever had. The drivers changed twice, drove like lunatics, kept swapping people around, stuffed about 9 people in one shuttle, and it took two hours to get to the hotel. We got a hotel town car on the way back to JKF and it only took 45 minutes and was as cheap as getting a taxi. If going around Christmas make sure you go ice skating in central park, it was amazing and really festive. Also there is a Jekyll and Hyde restaurant nearby that put on a show while eating and is great fun. All the waiters/waitresses are in character and come round while you eat. We actually ended up going here for Xmas dinner – very untraditional but it was good.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Pat2Glasgow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for Central Park, shopping 2 blocks away with all the designer stores and times square a 5 minute stroll. Can't complain. Room a wee bit average but I didn't go to new york for the room - could be better, could be much worse. If we go back which I'm sure we will we'll book here again. RS, Glasgow

Reviews.Title: “World Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Itsmee1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the park Central the last week in Feburary, and found that this experiance was the best. From the moment I arrived, I was met by Lina, who directed me to the baggage check as I arrived,due to weather, a bit late for a meeting. Lina, upon my return, checked me in, summond Nestor the bellman and he showed me to my room. This was just the start of an unbelieveable Customer Service Experiance. The lounge "Bar Bella" staff was top notch, John the mixologist, and Pam the server made me feel as if I had been there numerous times. The Restaurant staff was courteous, helpful, and always had a smile on their faces. Upon Checkout I was assissted by Mike M., helped with my bags by Steve, and escorted to my cab to the airport by Allejandro. This was an absolutely magnificent hotel and staff. Everytime I caome to New York I will definitely stay here. I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, OK room, but poor service”
Reviews.Author: grumpyspencer
Reviews.Content: Great location near Times square and Central Park. Hotel room was clean and tidy with a good shower. Decor in the rooms could have been a bit smarter. The decor on hotel floor was a bit shabby. Strange lift system, you could only select one floor at a time?? Entrance to the lobby was dark, but I liked the pictures of Judy Garland. My biggest complaint is down to the staff. No friendly welcome, snobby, it felt like we were an inconvenience. After a long flight and long taxi ride it wasn't a great start to the holiday. Nice apples.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel & Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: snowyowl87
Reviews.Content: What can i say about this hotel..... as soon as we arrived, after a very long flight, the staff dealt with us promptly and were extremely friendly and inviting. The room was lovely, simple but clean and fresh. A safe was also provided in the room which was useful for passports etc. The location was excellent, a 3 minutes walk away from central park and 10 minutes from Times Square. Next door to the hotel is a lovely cafe "Tisserie" and a Starbucks, both of which came in handy for breakfast. Only thing was that the restaurant in the hotel was extremely expensive for an evening meal and a glass of wine was $13!!!!!!!! $48 for a bottle. Other than that we had a great time and we would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “this is a comfortable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: barkingway
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very comfortable and in a location convenient on foot to midtown Manhattan as well as other areas by nearby public transportation - the staff was friendly and helpful throughout our weekend stay - the hotel is very clean, and the 6th floor room we had was quiet - rooms are a bit smaller than those in some hotels but well maintained - this hotel is an excellent value for the price and I would recommend it to anyone - I found it on line and I am very glad I did !

Reviews.Title: “I've been to NYC a few times and have to...”
Reviews.Author: NazAndy
Reviews.Content: I've been to NYC a few times and have to say that this hotel is the best location . It's a ten minute walk from time square and in the midst of diners and other eateries. The room was a good size and clean. My only issues were... The staff as a whole were polite however a couple of foyer staff were rude and stand offish. Another factor was the hotel charge you for leaving luggage once checked out ( we had a few hours to kill before the flight). I have never been charged in New York or any other city/holiday.Those are my only grumbles as I love new York and would stay at this hotel again when I return. The bar has a great atmosphere with a decent wine list which is a bonus in NY as decent wine is hard to Find! And to make up for all the wine and food, the gym is pretty decent. Hope this helps, enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horrendous Customer Service Elevator not working”
Reviews.Author: fiddskodak
Reviews.Content: I booked this online and arrived with my boyfriend very tired. The front desk help was not very welcoming. We went to the elevator only to realize we couldn't access our floor from there. We went back tothe front desk to ask where to go..the lady accused me of not listening to her when she pointed me to the correct elevator. when we finally found it, there were loads of people in the elevators trying to get up to their floors. They were not working. Went back to the front desk and the lady then told me the elevators were working. I explained to her they were not and she very rudely told me to hold on & went in back & came out & told me they were now working. NO apologies for my inconveniences. We then went back to the elevators only the discover once again, they were not working. Lugging our stuff back and forth twice was enough for me. I cancelled my reservation and went across the street to stay. Don't recommend at all.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Issues”
Reviews.Author: flicklives
Reviews.Content: No one knows how to say i'm sorry at this place, and lord knows they should have the practice. I checked in at 6pm on 2/8. Lost my place in line thinking I could use the kiosk to check in. No go- it doesnt work if you booked online. Front desk manager saw this and said "oh yeah, it doesnt work". I had to get back on the check in line at the back (which was long because one of two agents had an endless chat with someone checking in. Literally ten minutes with one customer and they were laughing and having a ball. Meanwhile people are waiting with bags in hand to check in. The manager did nothing through this. I finally went to the desk and asked him to please complete the transaction. "oh, I'm everyone's punching bag, he whined". Give me a break. Of course I got lucky and got him. Gave me a room with two twins instead of the king i was guaranteed. Went back downstairs and got another room. Main light switch broken. TV remote broken. Took 30 minutes to get a new one. No one ever apologized for anything. It's too bad since the first time i stayed here i checked in earlier in the day and everyone was so much more professional. I told them I intended to be staying in NY every week for at least the next year. He didnt care. Unbelievable really.

Reviews.Title: “its actually great”
Reviews.Author: lazy-suzanne
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to write to say don't believe everything you read about this hotel. We stayed for a week and I have to say it was no where near as bad as some of the reviews would have you believe. the cleaning left a little to be desired insofaras they dusted around things and the plumbing was a little tricky but the bed linen and towels etc were impeccable. The hotel had everything you required, good breakfast clean sheets and towels excellent size room, comfy bed and two minutes from virtually anywhere in new york walking as well as by the subway we really felt we couldn't have asked much more from a hotel - the staff were efficient but not friendly but then this is a large hotel with many guests. We enjoyed our trip to new york and we enjoyed our stay in the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again next time in NYC”
Reviews.Author: sierra_auska
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 3 different hotels in NYC and was pleasantly surprised with Park Central. After coming from the Waldorf Astoria and wanting to stay one extra night in New York we didn't think anything would impress us, and going on the price we paid for the room, weren't expecting much. The location was fantastic, you're have everything you want from the city on your doorstep and the room was clean and comfortable, which was just what we needed. NYC is a place where, lets face it, you wont be spending too much time in the room, just a place to sleep, this ticked all the boxes

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value, old bathroom”
Reviews.Author: worldtrvlr8
Reviews.Content: The location could not be better for tourists. If you get a good rate, it's totally worth it. The rooms are very spacious, especially for NY. Our bathroom, however, was not up to the standard of the room and the rest of the hotel. There was quite a bit of mold. The bathroom lighting is rather dim. If the bathrooms were modernized, the overall experience would be greatly improved.

Reviews.Title: “Best bargain in NYC, hands down!!!”
Reviews.Author: norskman2
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a clean, comfortable place to stay in an excellent Midtown location, this is it. The Park Central is just blocks from Columbus Circle, Radio City Music Hall, Times Square and right across the street from Carnegie Hall. If you're a extremely picky four-star hotel kind of person you might find a few things to nitpick -- sure, the floor in the room is a little uneven, little things like an electrical outlet in the bathroom didn't work, the mattress wasn't plush, no desk, and the computerized elevators will drive you crazy. Walls were a litlle thin -- I could hear the TV next door a few times. But it's clean, comfortable and the value can't be beat. You can easily spend twice as much and not find as nice a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful Front of Office Staff”
Reviews.Author: JaniePet
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel in general but the room cleanliness left a lot to be desired with dust all up the walls and you did not want to move the bedside table - Yuk!! However the beds were very comfy and clean and for New York a good sized room. Beware the price of drinks in the bar - $30 for 2 gin and tonics! Had a problem with the room safe and after 4 asks to have it fixed with no show of a repair man we gave up. Front desk staff very business like and robotic but the information desk were VERY helpful. Good location as 2 blocks from Central Park one way and you could see Times Square in the other direction. Also right on top of subway with access to anywhere in the city. Very good Cafe opposite called Fluffy's for fantastic breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, dont expect too much”
Reviews.Author: Missy30_10
Reviews.Content: All in all its a really good location but you would'nt want to spend too much time in the hotel. The room had a weird smell an the bathroom was grotty. The room as quite big (superior) but the advantage of this hotel was where it was situated. A quick stroll and your right in the middle of Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Price, Perfect Location, Great Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: TL2010
Reviews.Content: My partner and I (plus 20+ family and friends) stayed at the Park Central for several days last week while in NYC for our wedding. I was VERY nervous about this stay since a) it was our wedding, b) we recommended the hotel to some very selective family and friends, and c) we had not seen the hotel since renovations were completed. Prior to arrival we hade some concerns: several of my guests complained about waiting on hold for very long periods when trying to reach in-house reservations. Once we checked-in to the hotel all my fears went away. The hotel is PERFECTLY located for tourists to NYC; just blocks from Central Park, and an easy walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and the entire theatre district, plus it has easy access to the subway to take you everywhere else. The lobby is modern, clean, and comfortable (you'll notice that EVERYONE hangs out on those couches!) and the front desk staff are helpful and welcoming. I especially appreciated that they had a rep/manager greeting everyone who even appraoched the front desk area and directing you to the appropriate person. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and more than I would expect for the price. I think all my guests would agree that this was the PERFECT hotel for our needs, and a great "home base" for our NYC Wedding.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: J0Gibs0n
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from Sun 17th Jan to fri 22nd. We arrived NY time 12:30 noon after an 8 hour flight to be greeted with a very cold welcome, we were told our room was not yet ready and a curtesy room was not avilable. After walking around in the cold and the pouring rain for a couple of hours we were told the room was still not ready and check in was not till 4p.m so we were not going to get into it before then no matter what.!! There were no tea or coffee facillities in the rooms and the view we had was of 4 brick walls. We could not tell if it was day or night , sunny or raining. Every morning we had to look up to the sky to see what the weather was like and we could not wait to leave the room. We stayed out all day as it was so depressing. When we went to check out we were not asked if we had enjoyed our stay, if we were happy or unhappy, if we had enjoyed our first trip to NY.. the staff were very unhospitable and cold. I would go to NY again as the place itself was FANTASTIC,there is so much to see and do that 5 days is just not enough..and the majority of American people we met and spoke with were lovely but this hotel is a definate NO NO and we would not recommend it to ANYONE .

Reviews.Title: “An excellent deal”
Reviews.Author: ulfj
Reviews.Content: Park Central has a perfect location, just opposite Carnegie Hall. It's close to Central Park and we walked to Times Square. Our room was big and with a great view (19th floor). The staff was helpful. The price was fantastic for a hotel in this class. We paid with all taxes less than $150 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: biggaplanet
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, the location is great. Cant understand with all the good reviews why the hotel still ranks low on Trip Advisor. Good location and walking distance to most attractions. Room size fine for a large city hotel. Did not get breakfast included in room rate which was a pity so used nearby cafes such as Carnegies.Would recommend highly to anyone seeking a good hotel in NY in a reasonable price range. Did not appreciate having to pay for the internet which was free in so many other hotels in the US.

Reviews.Title: “What a perfect place to stay in New York City”
Reviews.Author: musicbizperson77
Reviews.Content: Over 50 of us from the Georgetown Choral Society stayed at this hotel over the Martin Luther King Jr long weekend. As we were in town to participate in a concert at Lincoln Center, the location of this hotel at 56th and 7th was close to everything we needed - the concert hall, food, the theater district,museums, shopping, Central Park for walking as well easy access to the subway, bus, taxi and bus tours. The lobby is very inviting, the rooms very nicely appointed, and although there were many groups visiting ( including several large groups of teenagers ), the hotel was quiet for sleeping. The staff were very obliging and quick to assist. This hotel was certainly a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value for the location in the heart of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: lovenycSoCal
Reviews.Content: NYC travel for us has always meant 5+ star hotels on 5th avenue...yes, we have been spoiled, but the Park Central was on the parade route for the Thanksgiving Day Parade and we gave it a chance. We were pleasantly surprised. Entering the lobby, we were greeted with upbeat music and a friendly staff. Our room was clean and while simple in decor, it was clean. 12th floor location. We ate breakfast every morning in the restaurant and it was more than we expected. The water in our room was very hot (important to my husband) and our only complaint was the extra blankets...cheap. Reported to hotel and hopefully they are buying new ones. Overall, a great stay and we will return. Having a Starbucks steps away and Central Park only a few blocks away was perfect. It taught my husband that we don't need gilded furniture and a private butler to have a great time in NYC! :)

Reviews.Title: “Big, comfortable, impersonal, great location”
Reviews.Author: In50s
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 4 nights, months before we arrived. A few weeks before arriving we added two more days to bring it up to six consecutive nights. We rang to confirm the changes and were promised an e-mail confirmation; it never came. We reminded the desk staff of the bookings when we arrived and we were told we would have to check-out after 4 days and then check-in again for the final two nights. We thought perhaps we were in a third world country However; fantastic location – a few blocks from Broadway, a subway station right outside, lots of restaurants and bars in all directions, not far from Central Park and a walk to the best museums and galleries, and all night delis everywhere, so you don’t have to pay the hideous prices the hotel restaurant charges for breakfast. The rooms are spacious and well equipped, including a coffee maker. Beds are super comfortable, as are the pillows. Most rooms appeared to have at least some sort of city view. Those are the positives. Negatives: staff are officious and only barely polite. If friendly, helpful service is high on your agenda, forget it. The rooms are not particularly well-serviced. During our 6 day stay, we were lucky if the room was vacuumed twice. Coffee requisites were not automatically replaced - we had to call down to room service to be re-supplied with coffee for the machine. On our last but one day the room was not even serviced, although we were given a $50 reduction on the room rate for that day to compensate for this. Wifi connection is not free - costs about US$14 for 24 hours. With so many hotels offering free wifi, we found this rather ridiculous. All up however, the location of the Park Central makes up for just about everything. It also offers some excellent specials during the year, so plan ahead and keep an eye on websites.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel, excellent location, helpful friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: karoni
Reviews.Content: My daughter (23 years old) and I stayed at the Park Central hotel while spending a few days in Manhattan around Christmas time before our flight overseas.
