The location is perfect - walking distance to Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, etc. as well as right next to Carnegie Deli. The hotel has been completed renovated and everything is clean and new. We had a concierge room - the bed was so comfortable and the bathroom was spotless. The buffet breakfast had a multitude of offerings but the most important part of our stay was the staff. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. They took the extra step to make sure your questions were answered and your needs were addressed. We originally were going to stay at the Hilton or Sheraton but Park Central was located near by and better priced. We have recommended Park Central to our friends overseas who travel to NY and we will definitely stay at Park Central again on our next trip to NY. I wish I had pictures to show!

Reviews.Title: “PARK CENTRAL HOTEL - NEW YORK!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PIPU08
Reviews.Content: It's been my first time in New York City and I stayed at Park Central Hotel from 2nd to 8th January. When we arrived, seeing the building from the outside, our first thought was "WOW!! It's beautiful!!" The check in was faster than I thought and I can also say that the staff was very nice everytime I needed! We booked a superior king room that is a big, clean and very comfortable room. It exceeded our expectations! The only negative thing was the lack of a window in the bathroom, but it's a thing that in comparison to the rest wasn't so important! Our room was on the 15th floor from where we had a nice view! The hotel is located in a central area of the city. It's between Broadway, the 5th Avenue, Times Square and Central Park and the subway is very very close! For me and my husband has been a great experience, also thank to the Park Central Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Location / Hotel”
Reviews.Author: theimpi
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights at the Park Central, we were on the 21st Floor in a Twin Room. Room was clean, spacious and the bathroom was clean and modern (little small). The location is excellent, within 5 minutes walk, you are in time square, you are close to Macey's, Bloomingdales, Time Square, Central Pary, Natural History Museum, perfect, would stay there every time in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “All around ideal hotel for NYC sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Chela10
Reviews.Content: This is the second year in a row that we have stayed at Park Central Hotel, and when we return to NYC, we'll definitely stay there again. This year my husband and I were accompanied by our 14 year old granddaughter. We had 2 double beds and the room was large enough for the 3 of us. I had called ahead to have a coffee pot in the room, and we were pleasantly surprised to receive an upgrade for that service. Hotel is convenient for walking to cultural events and the subway is located at the corner. Having Starbucks next door was handy also. The Hotel room rates were reasonable; the beds were comfy, and the concierges where very helpful with information and directions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JAMIE123Manchester
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the New Years period from 28th Dec to 2nd Jan. Speedy checkin. We had a "Concierge King" room - which had a very comftable king size bed, flat screen T.V., nice bathroom with all mod cons & plenty of closet space. We were on the 24th floor. Our view was a wall - however it wasnt a problem as it was used for sleeping and getting ready for the day ahead! The room was £1600.00 for 5 nights, given the time of year i hardly find this expensive. The hotel is SMACK bang in the middle of Manhattan. If your looking for a GOOD hotel, close to the attractions then this is it. Its on 7th Av which runs right into Times Square and is two blocks south of central park! Could not fault this Hotel at all - when you check out make sure you save $70 as there are private drivers willing to take you to the Airport in those lovely big blacked out Escalades - a taxi costs $55 + tip .... so why not end it in a little style !?!? The Concierge desk wont tell you about these tho as they dont work for the Hotel - the doormen have a deal with them i think. Anyways to sum up - great Hotel - a must if your a first to New York and want to be right in the middle of it all!!! Iv stayed twice and have not had a single complaint!

Reviews.Title: “unbeatable location.”
Reviews.Author: DonaldandSheila
Reviews.Content: this is the second time we have stayed here in the last couple of years and wouldn't stay anywhere else. the lobby and bar have just been upgraded and i must say a fantastic job has been done. cannot really fault this hotel, great rooms, fantastic location and at a very reasonable price. if you are visiting new york and are looking for a good hotel in my opinion the park central is definitely worth consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for central park - clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Hamealdaeme
Reviews.Content: Great location for Central Park - directly across from Carnegie Hall and five minutes walk from Times Square - housekeeping staff very friendly and kept the two rooms we had spotless - very comfortable beds - we just wanted this as a base and would recommend for that - we had breakfast included but to be honest there are plenty of places on every street corner where you would get fresher better and cheaper. There is a buffet that is cooked on the day but a bit limp looking if you are not up at the crack of dawn. Personally I would not recommend NY in the winter. The freezing cold wind did hamper our site seeing a lot. Ok if you are only there for a few days and planning to jump in and out of yellow cabs - which need the address to get you there - we walked to Tiffany's after two drivers did not know where this was. Tips 15% in restaurants or more if already charged to the bill and $1 for every drink ordered in a bar. Lion King was fabulous. Would recommend Patsy's restaurant round the corner from Park Central Hotel will go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: 77nab
Reviews.Content: Large rooms, clean and well maintained Clean well equipt bathroom Free safe in room Excellent location Helpful informative staff Far better than was expected

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Billysouthwales
Reviews.Content: As the title says, Excellent location - decent hotel. Stayed here with my Wife on our first visit to New York. The hotel is between Times Square and Central Park, about a ten minute walk in either direction away. Plenty of bars and restaurants around, but I found these to be slightly more pricey because of the location. The tour bus licks up right by the hotel, so that's another advantage of staying here. Rooms were small, but clean. There were no surprises here. We arrived at 13.30, but they would not release the room until 15.00. That was OK because they let us check in and leave our bags (free). We went for a walk to Times Square. I have been to new york since and stayed further out (The Beekman, near to the UN Bulding over on 1st) but if this is your first time, and you want to be in an ideal location, this is the hotel for you. We didn't eat or drink at the Hotel, so I can't comment on this

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: andyRome_Italy
Reviews.Content: the hotel is perfectly located to enjoy a holiday in New York. the service is accurate and the rooms are comfortable and clean. I recommend everyone to stay in this beautiful hotel

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations”
Reviews.Author: fielding
Reviews.Content: Can't complain. The room was inexpensive (relatively), large enough, and tidy. Shower was hot. Basically just used the room to sleep and clean up, and that worked fine for the price. Terrible "view" though (a brick wall). Check in/out was smooth and courteous. Valet car service ($43) was prompt, no more than 10 minutes. This was Christmas and the hotel seemed quite full, largely with international travelers. Enjoyed that touch. I did not expect a fancy place and if you go in with that in mind, you really shouldn't have a problem here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; some systemic problems due to size”
Reviews.Author: mike110742
Reviews.Content: [This note to Priceline & other third-party guests precedes all my reviews of hotels I purchased through a 3rd party vendor] Like everyone else, 3rd-party customers read reviews and arrive with expectations; high attentiveness to guest needs is what distinguishes one 2-3-4 star from others. Third-party prices fill rooms, and provide the business with opportunities to sell services and win future customers. My advice: pay attention to reviews, articulate your needs clearly (both in advance and on arrival) and speak directly and immediately to management if your expectations are not met. If basic room needs are unmet, ask management for adjustment; if unresponsive, tell the 3rd-party vendor in writing; use snail mail to the company’s street address and direct to Customer Service VP. I’ve found them responsive. Talk to local management directly and pleasantly: they value meaningful guest feedback and often can use information you provide to correct persistent problems. Whatever rate you paid, be courteous and civil to a fault: it never helps to be confrontational. Commend with care what is commendable.] This is a Priceline 3.5 star and cost me about $95: 7 months in advance, probably would have been less 4 or 3 months ahead. COMMENDABLE: Smooth check-in, beginning with a Pre-check at noon, assignment of room at 2 PM, polite employees. Ellen was exceptional. Fresh apples at check-in. Luggage stored 12-2 for a fee per bag, discounted at checkin. King bed, wonderful bedding. Quiet interior room. Expensive ($14.04) but flawlessly operating internet service, wireless in room. GREAT midtown location. Lincoln Center and Fordham are six blocks; Carnegie Hall is across the street. Theatre-close. Simple amenities in bathroom, but clean with a working tub and shower, good hot water. SLPPY, TROUBLING and MAYBE FIXABLE: This is a huge hotel, 1000+ rooms. Elevators work on N side to 8th floor only, S side 9-25. Logic to this? Not explained at checkin, but it could be. Elevators controlled (sometimes) by touch-screen system outside, not by buttons inside, obviously confusing to many guests. Not explained at checkin, but it could be. My room was as far as it was possible to be from an elevator, possibly troubling to a customer who had difficulty walking. Cell phone signal reception allowed text messages but voice reception sloppy on interior rooms, fine in the lobby. That’s a structural problem of the hotel’s interference with voice data. Lobby is large, often filled with guests and luggage awaiting rooms or to depart. It’s noisy already, and piped in rock and pop--everywhere-- adds badly to the already-confusing din. Very expensive on site restaurant, but many options close by: all-day breakfast diner at 58th and 7th, Cosmic Diner at 8th and 52nd, Great American Health Bar (Fab) at 6th and 57th, all reasonable. Subway on corner of 55th. Starbucks on footprint, access from outside and crazy crowded, normal for a NYC Starbucks. Phone rates not published in room. Business center up stairs from lobby, difficult for a handicapped customer. 35c a minute, $5 minimum. JUST TROUBLING: A restaurant server engaged me in a verbal battle over a simple order: I just wanted fruit and two scrambled eggs. Not skillfully, he tried to blame the computer for not being able to take such an order and led me to the buffet, which I did not want. I can be told NO but battling a hotel guest is not acceptable. Details were reported in writing to the restaurant manager, since I believe this to be a training problem.

Reviews.Title: “Superb room and location”
Reviews.Author: ShahidaASingapore
Reviews.Content: A very short walk from Times Square, about 2 blocks from the infamous Lindy's cheesecake restaurant, right next door to Central Park, a few doors from Pick-a-Bagel. An absolutely superb location. The twin room we stayed in was HUGE. Each bed could have comfortably accommodated 2 bodies. Beds were super comfy. Overall, a terrific place to stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Beds were horrible”
Reviews.Author: mactokyo
Reviews.Content: I've heard this hotel looked down on guests from Asia hundreds of times. Actually they never answered any questions from Japanese guests in this site. But I did not experience any bad treat and allover service was quite OK. However the beds in our room were very old and horrible as many people said. Springs of them did not work at all and I did got serious pain in my back. If only the beds were better, our staying would have been little bit more comfortable. Or the reason I was given the room was I was from Asia?

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION FOR SIGHTSEEING”
Reviews.Author: dbreal
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several time and considerit a good value. Package deals can make it even better..We walk to most venues and enjoy the city. Consider the package deals. David and Jean Baskin

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: LM59
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Park Central was really nice. We were there for the blizzard of 09 and with this location, we could still do anything we wanted to. Our room on the 12th floor had no view and since there were rooms available after our second night, we moved to a room on the 23rd floor with an awesome view. The staff and concierge were very helpful. Location was excellent for everything from shopping to Central Park to broadway plays.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: GavT11
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the only positive you'll find throughout this review. The Park Central was nicely located for what our main reasons to visit New York this Christmas (2010). Central Park being right there, walking distance to the National History Museum, Rockafella and Times Square. However - if we're being honest, within reason everywhere is walkable in Manhattan. I'd recommend avoiding staying within 5th to 8th Avenues as you'll struggle to get a taxi to take you all the way back at the end of a long day - most offering at best to drop you 2 blocks away - Not alot much after 10 hours on your feet it would be a nice little luxury to get dropped at the door. The hotel itself - For our $1000 (3 nights) we got a small room (with no heat control), narrow corridors, smoke smelling bathroom and elevators that didn't work. The latter meaning taking the graffiti stairs including something resembling a dinosaur cross reindeer with big bright red genitals..... very nice. We got room service once and had to send it back as it was missing items and was cold. In fairness the hotel did replace and didn't charge us for it without us even suggesting. Actually the staff themselves we're friendly and helpful, especially those on the front desk. The breakfast is ridiculously over priced at $25 for basically scrambled eggs, sausages bacon and juice. A quick walk and you'll find plenty of cafe's with better deals. All in all I wouldn't go back to the Park Central and would be more inclined to try 1 of the more homely B&B's in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “They were a welcome relief after travel in the Snow Storm.”
Reviews.Author: gt6atlanta
Reviews.Content: After the cancel flight and delays with the Christmas Snow Storm, we welcomed the great service and help from the hotels staff. All of them went out of their way to make us feel welcome. This is the second time we have stayed at the Park Central and both times we were not disappointed. The location is perfect and the value is great.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home”
Reviews.Author: NonaChicago
Reviews.Content: RIght from the start , the staff at the Park Central were very friendly, especially Nilsa at the front desk. I have been to New York on many occasions and I always feel comfortable at the the Park Central. The room was clean and the restaurant food was good... A great deal on the breakfast special. I will definitely come back to the Park Central.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value with unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: atomic1973
Reviews.Content: We elected to travel to NYC for Christmas and had the benefit of being on the Park Central's e-mail list where I learned about incredible Holiday rates (paid 149 for Christmas Eve and 169 for Christmas Night). The staff was great at both check-in and check-out. Our room had a king size bed with flat screen TV (although it didn't get turned on) and was typical of New York City hotel rooms... not big but very well-appointed. We didn't use the fitness, business or restaurant facilities, but this was because of the nature of our trip, not any issue with any of the facilities. This was my second time staying at this hotel and will not be my last. The location (a few blocks North of Times Square and few blocks south of Central Park) cannot be beaten and the staff genuinely made me feel welcome. It also didn't hurt its cause that it is basically right beside the world-famous Carnegie Deli! :) A great experience that I am anxious to repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: tulip52
Reviews.Content: Talk about being "nickled & dimed to death"! We arrived early about 1 pm...room was not ready...ok that I can understand...but they actually charge $4.00 for each bag you want them to store!!! We finally were able to check in at 4pm to our room....really blah! Needs a complete overhaul. Paper thin walls...you can hear everything from the adjoining rooms and hallway. Oh and be very careful not to bump into the base of the beds covered deceitfully with a bed ruffle...there is a metal platform for the base that my husband proceeded to bump into & broke his toe. And for them to charge $14.99 per day for WIFI in this day and age is sooooo wrong!!! The only positive thing going for his hotel is the location...but there are so many other better options...don't stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gianni_482
Reviews.Content: The hotel was suggested by some friends and it has been a really pleasure staying at this location during my recent trip to New York. Quick check-in, nice room, clean and with a beautiful view. The experience at the restaurant was great at very affordable price and a very good preparation. I really suggest this hotel also keeping in consideration the greaT LOCATION.

Reviews.Title: “Never Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: G113
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Park Central for a few years now and we have never been disappointed with our experience. From our last stay they have updated the restaurant, bar and lobby and we were so pleased with all the new updates. Our room was very spacious and clean and all the staff from housekeeping, to maintenance to front desk were so friendly and helpful. As we stayed there before we were welcomed back with a welcome letter and box of chocolates from the gm, NICE TOUCH. The park central is our home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: carloverLasVegas
Reviews.Content: I was a Guest in the Hotel. Was in NY for an exhibition and chose the Hotel for it's location and price .The fact that the service in the Hotel was fantastic and the level of cleanliness in the Hotel was high,,,, breakfast had a wide veriety,,,,Exellent Hotel ,,,Just wanted to share my view. Paula

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs and overpriced breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ChitownMomma
Reviews.Content: I booked this room on Hotwire and got a rate of $129/night. Other colleagues of mine had stayed in this hotel, so if figured it would be OK. I checked in after 11 pm and although I had reserved a king bed, only twin beds were available. While I was not expecting the Ritz at this price, the appointments were showing their age. The towels were thiner than at other properties, and on the second day they did not replenish my washcloths. I could live with that However my greatest disappointments were to follow. On the last day I ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant. The buffet which was closer to what I have gotten at a Hampton Inn, and while I did not expect it to be free, I did expect a lot more for my $25. And since I have returned, I have been very uncomfortable with the numerous bed-bug bites I received from staying at the property. I travel all over the world, and stayed in many types of accommodations and have never been bitten up like I was last week. Apologies posted online are not enough. The hotel really needs to inspect their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: nino724sfd
Reviews.Content: Read pevious reviews and was a little skeptical until we arrived. Our hotel rate was very reasonable after comparing to other 3 star NY city hotel rates.We had no problems with Valet parking except the price ($43 per day), which is what the Hotel told me the garage charges. After looking around in our travels in the vicinity ,the rate was on par with other parking facilities in the area without valet service. Reception person was friendly and efficient. Check in was a breeze and our room #1043 was clean ,spacious and even had a view of the street below. Maids always asked if everything was OK and asked if there was anything we needed. Never heard any noise and elevators were fast and efficient. The location was terrific as we could walk to Times Square. Subway and buses were within 100 feet of the Hotel entrance. I think the bad reviewers expected the Waldorf Astoria or were probably trying to get some compensations from the Hotel.. Some people make it a habit of trying to get something for nothing. I know we will book at the Park Central on our next trip to NYC providing we receive a great rate as we did. Anthony Prince Liverpool New York

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kdyer1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from December 14 - 16 for my husband's birthday. We were a bit skeptical because of the negative reviews we had read, but it looked like it was in a good spot between TS and Central Park, and because of the value we decided to book it. Now don't get me wrong, this is not a five star hotel - the rooms and hallways were a bit worn and outdated, and the views are not that great, however everything was clean - linens, towels, and bathroom. The only small complaint we had was there was no temperature control in the room, so at night it got very warm and we had to open a window. The staff was very friendly and helpful to us, we never had an issue with front desk or concierge. The location was unbeatable for the price - less than a 10 minute walk to TS, just 3 blocks to Central Park and just two blocks from 5th Ave. A cab ride down to Greenwich Village was less than $15. If you are looking for a modern, upscale hotel with a view in NYC this is not the place for you. But, if you are looking for a basic, clean comfortable hotel with a nice lobby and bar in a fantastic location, this is it. It was well worth $200 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Smelled like Urine”
Reviews.Author: CMMAtlanta_GA
Reviews.Content: Great location, rude staff, room smelled of urine, thin walls. Every morning was awaken by the loud housekeepers out in the hall. Kiosk's not working properly. Had a great view of the courtyard (as the staff called it) cement roof of another building. Run down hotel, other than the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “I♥NY”
Reviews.Author: DianePou
Reviews.Content: What I loved best was its proximity to Central Park. The service and the amenities were excellent. I would highly recommend this to anyone who needs a place to stay in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience of My Life”
Reviews.Author: selective_focus
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, I had a completely awful experience at the Park Central New York. The first thing we were greeted with was a room that smelled pungently of urine. When we returned to the room, after being cleaned by staff, it still had a hideous odor of urine covered by bleach. We spent the rest of our two day stay wearing coats indoors as we could not be in the room without feeling faint without the windows being open. Next, as I painfully discovered in the shower, the washcloths were covered in hair. Finally, when we requested a blanket (as the windows were open and we were freezing), it took close to an hour and a half to finally receive a blanket. What I found to be most offense of all was the fact that when these complaints were brought to the attention of the hotel staff, in the form of a phone call and an e-mail to the manager, I was completely ignored and, to date, my issues have gone completely unaddressed by staff or management. What kind of business operating in the hospitality industry finds it acceptable to treat guests in this fashion? The rates are cheap--but beware. In the end, you may be better off spending another couple of dollars and staying at a hotel that treats its guests with a little more respect.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location!!!”
Reviews.Author: focculare
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 5 nights in november 2009, and all I have to say is this hotel is a great find... The location is superb, you're just 3 blocks away from Central park, 2 blocks away from the 5th Ave and Rockefeller Center, 5 blocks away from Times Square, so for someone that's looking for that kind of experience (first time travelers), it's as good as it gets. The hotel was great overall, I just would like to mention a couple of drawbacks, so that you're aware of them: Some of the rooms have bathtubs and some have showers, this as far as I know is pretty random. There are no safes in the rooms, no minibars, there's a little noise form the street in the first floors. Concierge and Room service are not available 24 hours, so if you get tho the hotel at 11:30 and you want to order something, you better go to a deli nearby. it has 2 entrances, on on 7th and one on 55th (this one is closed at night). That's about it. I highly recommend this hotel for first time travelers, or shopping addicts, who want an budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Rude Staff, Misleading Photos, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: WillieCapeTown
Reviews.Content: Other than location this hotels offers very little. We will not stay there again. The front desk staff was consistently rude and unhelpful with the exceptions far and few between. The concierge, maintenance and cleaners are more friendly and helpful. The best way to describe the room is a patched up. Do not let the photos on the website deceive you. The walkways and room smell of old carpets. Our room was next to a vending machine that made such a noise it had to be switched off when we complained. The towels in the bathroom were so old two of them tore while using them. Hot water is a problem between 07:00 and 08:30 in the morning. We ended up not showering during these times. We also often had to flush the toilet more than once. But my overriding memory of this hotel is the rude front desk staff. At times it threatened to completely ruin our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!! Even better staff and management!!!”
Reviews.Author: LizzieDublinDublin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights recently on my honeymoon and this hotel is perfect!!!! We were upgraded to an amazing suite on the 21st floor. We could see Times Square from our bedroom window!!The hotel is in the most perfect location to access all New York has to offer.. The staff were always extremely helpful and the concierge helped us with any questions we had on day trips etc.. We had a small problem with the heating and within two minutes the maintenance guy was up and had it all fixed... The lobby is really welcoming and the food was gorgeous... This hotel is perfect and brilliant value for anyone travelling to New York and the staff really make you feel so welcome.. I would highly recommend this hotel to all my friends and family! Dont be ripped off by overpriced hotels and keep your money for your holiday! Stay in the Park Central!!!!Great Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Tricky00
Reviews.Content: Found the staff100% helpful with our situations of early check in, storage , cleaning and help with the in rooom safe. Super service. Very pleasant. Room was clean, beds comfortable, clean, nice linen, and very nice room. Very busy hotel but quiet and very well organized staff. Lots of staff to ask questions of. Elavator was great with the touch screen. I missed in room coffee but lots of shops nearby, can think of 3 offhand that sold coffee and econnomical meals and snacks. And the Carnegie Deli almost next door. Great for people new to this city . Very happy with my choice of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good value”
Reviews.Author: ElineLee
Reviews.Content: Only 5 blocks from Time Square, not too close to the crowd, and near Central Park, the location was perfect. Subway station on the corner, just some steps from the hotel door. Not cheap, but considering NYC, it has a good value. I spent 10 days with my husband and they gave us a good guestroom, better than the standard for which we paid. The room was on the 21st floor, so we were distant from the noise streets and had a great view of the city and a piece of Hudson River too. Almost nothing to complaint. Just a little blocked drain and an incorrect account, but quickly solved. Next time in NYC, we will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky I didn't listen to negative reviews!”
Reviews.Author: marty451
Reviews.Content: I almost cancelled my reservation for the Park Central prior to my departure after reading the many negative reviews here but given the great price for 5 nights at just US$1,300 including taxes , I took the risk. After working for a week in LA, I went to New York for a bit of a break before heading back to Melbourne. It has been 13 years since my last visit there. After reading the many negative reviews, I prepared for the worst. I entered this large hotel and found the reception area nice, clean and spacious and the reception staff were very courteous and welcoming. Could this be the same hotel I was reading about on Tripadvisor? They gave me my room key for the 17th floor and I was very nervous as I entered the key to open the door. I thought, how bad can the room be? To my shocked surprise, the room was bigger than what I thought. The king size bed was massive, the widescreen TV was great and the room smelt nice. One last check was the bathroom and, lo and behold, not once trace of fungus or odour and, for New York and for a single, it was big enough. I will definitely be staying at this hotel again but I will be sure to get the same room as I heard other rooms on the lower levels may not be as nice. Given the rate, this hotel was a steal and the location was perfect. It was great to leave the hotel at 7.30pm and walk just five minutes to a Broadway play starring Bill Pullman and Julia Stiles starting at 8pm. Heaven! Only in New York!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Responsiveness of Staff”
Reviews.Author: maine6611
Reviews.Content: I actually did not stay in this hotel so I can't review. My daughter stayed in this hotel with a group from her school. She left a pair of UGG boots in her room. We immediately called the hotel upon her return. In the course of a week, I talked to 3 different people (Lost and Found, Front Desk personnel, etc) who never returned my calls after telling me they would check into the lost boots. The boots have not been found and we all know those boots didn't walk out of that hotel alone. It is a shame that I was not transferred to Hotel Security when I first called because perhaps they could have reached the person responsible for cleaning that room sooner. Four different occasions I called this hotel over the course of a week and no one ever returned the call. It is a shame there aren't measures in place to ensure that items left behind aren't returned to their owner. A pair of boots can't be slipped in to anyone's pocket and they didn't go down with the laundry. Additionally, they could not have been taken by the next guest in this room as they were left by the closet door where someone would have vacuumed. I have asked for reimbursement for my boots. A check for the purchase price of the boots is all I want and I don't think unreasonable to ask at all. The hotel should have security measures in place that eliminate the chance staff can walk out with guest items. Perhaps a sweet of the rooms by a Lost and Found supervisor after people check out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, miserable staff”
Reviews.Author: DODDSHOUSE
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights in this hotel , a group of 14 friends. Hotel is in a great location and rooms are cleaned to good standard. The housekeeping staff are very helpful and friendly but the reception staff are miserable and rude ( with the exception of Fred). They completely mixed up the booking and blamed everyone else but themselves for their incompetence. Everyone was charged a different rate if they experienced breakfast dining and they made no excuses for the different charges. We booked 2 triple rooms and 4 doubles and they took an extra $160 dollars from my sisters account for a third bed which had already been paid for without letting her know . She discovered they had taken the payment from her account when she got back home and she now has to try and get the money back. The conciege staff are no better. They might know a lot about New York but they know very little about good customer service! Having said all that, we still had a great time. You just have to be very careful to check your bill before you leave!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Karin_81
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 5 nights during our first visit to this great city. We were very satisfied with the hotel. The room was big enough, the bed was very comfortable and we also liked it that it was possible to open the window. We did not use much of the hotel services and didn't eat at the restaurant so I can't say much about that. The people who we spoke were very friendly and helpfull. The best thing was the location and value, Between Central Park and Times Square on 7th avenue. I have read some of the negative comments which made me a little worried, I fully agree with the positive comments.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel! Very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: MegLJ
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed this hotel very much! ALL the staff that we dealt with were very helpful & friendly. Karen at the Concierge desk is AWESOME!! She knows all about New York and has great recommendations! The Lobby is very nice and trendy. The rooms are comfortable. The guy out front that hails cabs for you (forgot his name!) is also great! A few recommendations - the bathrooms NEED vents - they get very hot and steamy after a shower! Also, the hostess at the restaurant should tell you that it is not included in your room, and that it is VERY pricey. The food is ok, but definitely not worth $30/person. I did not feel we got our moneys worth at the restaurant. Other then that - the place was great. A lot of reviews on here complain about the elevators, but I thought the system worked great! The location is perfect - about a 2 minute walk to Central Park and 10 minutes to Times Square. "The Irish Pub" across the street usually has a good crowd and is lot's of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in good but noice location”
Reviews.Author: Arctic_Ace
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in Park Central Hotel. Room was acceptable (150$/n), but some renovation would be nice to have (outdated rooms). Location was great but due the high traffic some noise can disrupt your sleep.

Reviews.Title: “I Recommend it !”
Reviews.Author: LGOV
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel is old, the rooms are ok, they are small just like all the hotels in Manhattan. Bathroom works very well, celaness is good, they offer HD TV. The most important attribute I think is the location, you are just a 10 min walk from Central Park, 5th Av or times square. It´s at the final stop of one of the metro yellow lines. Besides there are several options of restaurants around, for breakfast and/or dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, clean and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Londoncabby
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from this hotel. I was very pleased with my stay there. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Staff were very friendly, especially the concierge. Times Square was a 10 minute walk down 7th avenue, the shops on 5th were 10 minutes walk along 54th street. The metro is on the next block. The cost of staying at the hotel is middle of the road, and I think its good value.

Reviews.Title: “start spreadin' the news”
Reviews.Author: margomullen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 851 from Oct. 29 to Nov. 4, '09. No major problems. We were in town for the marathon. A few small items. We "get it" about the lobby remodel being "cutting edge" and "with it", but get rid of the crappy music. This happens a lot: millions put into a remodel and no thought at all into the music. Turn it down and how about some jazz, big band, or oldies?. Next, we had to call three times for a coffee pot and they didn't charge us, like they should have. Bathroom mold: just give each housekeeper a bottle of Tylex to spray on the moldy caulking. Reall simple, and it would make a difference. The free apples at the desk were a nice touch. We liked the hotel, the elevators, the location, the price. We would stay again, gladly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TracySmith2
Reviews.Content: Very modern posh hotel. Drinks and food quite expensive, but a very nice place to stay. Staff were very helpful and the rooms were very nice. Towels were changed every day and housekeeping staff were very good. The reception area and bar was very nice indeed. Can't really fault the place. No kettle in the room but Starbucks is next door.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Jan031
Reviews.Content: Couldn't really fault the hotel. Our room was spotless and the location fantastic. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: marta82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the park Central for 2 nights at the end of October and was quite disappointed with the hotel. Location is really great, so if this is what you are looking for, and you don't stay too many nights definitely go for it. It also was a good bargaign for us, since we found a 60% discount on booking.com. If you find an offer like this, considering the location, the hotel is definitely worth it. But I would never stay at Park Central for full rate. The hotel is quite old style, particularly room and bathroom. Nice and design lobby and bar. They have 3 small elevators (you see 5 people max) for 35 floors, and one was broken for the whole stay. Nothing special in the room (no fridge, nothing to boil water and make a tea, ...) nor amenities in the hotel. Wifi connection is very expensive. Check out is supposed to be at 12:00 but the morning we left the hotel, the cleaning man came to knock at our door THREE TIMES to know what time we planned to leave. The first time, since it was 8 in the morning and we where still sleeping, he even came into the room. One good point: there is a booking desk for broadway tickets/tour/restaurants and the woman is very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything.”
Reviews.Author: scottieLancashireUK
Reviews.Content: For somewhere to rest one's head in midtown without breaking the bank, the Park Central offers reasonable comfort and a location which is ideal. Everything is either within walking distance or accessible via 'bus or subway. Plenty of excellent etaing of every sort within a few blocks. Breakfast at Europa (two blocks up) is very civilised. Had pre-booked on line and there were no problems checking in. Room (11th floor) was fine) with adequate amenities and a clean bathroom. The only disadvantage of the room was a lack of natural light in daytime as it looked into the deep central well with only a blank facing wall to look at. The upside of this was that there was little traffic noise. One or two minor niggles (but not enough to spoil anything): * lack of tea / coffee making facilties in room * not enough lifts at certain times (four for the entire south end) * when I asked about movie listings at Concierge I was very curtly informed by a disinterested young man that they were not provided and I would have to use business centre to log on. * lack of free internet access on lobby or other area (quite standard in many European hotels) * Having to pay to leave luggage for day following checkout - this really should be part of the service. I have never been charged for this before. And in a similar vein was unable to use nearby rest room on collecting luggage as it required room card access. I mention these not to put anybody off staying but to pass on to the management which clearly does read these reviews. Overall the facilities were pretty good for the hotel's grading and position. With a few tweaks it could be an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rochrossi
Reviews.Content: When I got to the hotel I really liked it. The lobby was very nice and the check in was very quick and easy. My room was dirty, there was dust all over the carpet, the airconditioning did not work and the bathroom had hair in the tub and there was mold all over the ceiling. I wrote to the hotel and never received a response. If the board of health would have seen the bathroon ceiling they would have closed down the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally bad service”
Reviews.Author: marann26
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week. Upon arrival, handed cash for accomodation. We were then informed that 14.75% city taxes were not included which cost approximately 200dollars extra. This had not been on our documentation. Room was clean and basic. Location excellent. 5-10mins walk from times square and also near central park. On third day, received a call from hotel demanding 100dollars extra as a deposit. However, my 50dollars was taken from my credit card, and my friend did not receive her 50dollars back either. We left the room in very good condition, and did not use the mini bar etc for the duration of our stay. One staff member told us we were entitled to it all back, but upon collection the promise had been unfulfilled. When en route to JFK, i realised i'd forgotten my phone. I decided i'd call the hotel as soon as i got home (as i didn't have their number.) I had to call the hotel ELEVEN times. The communication skills of the staff were implorable. I was told on 4occasions that i'd be called back (which never happened), told on another occasion that the hotel wouldn't call back an international number. On another occasion i was hung up on-as soon as i called back another staff member gave out to me for hanging up on her colleague. I was livid. I have been on to the hotel for the past 3DAYS to get a simple answer . Over 72hours later, i was finally told my phone was not found-i wouldn't trust the staff at this hotel, as i'm 100% i left it there. I realise it was my own fault for leaving it there, but the false promises, lack of communication and disrespect was too much for me. I believe you can get better value for money in another hotel with just as good a location. False promises, new bills being added on, and a complete and utter incapable management would completely deter me from recommending this hotel to anyone. These people aren't capable of giving a simple answer, never mind running a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: ricard01
Reviews.Content: Park central hotel was one of the best experience i've ever had. The hotel is located in a great location with great views from Time Square. The rooms were clean and every single detail was there. Price very affordable. Customer service was great from the entrance to the people bringing your luggage up to your room. Especial consideration to the front office manager George Jacob. He was very kind, very helpful and very pleasant all time to us. I'm definitely coming back and i refer this hotel to anyone who wants to have an unique experience in the heart of NYC.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linda D
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights with my sister and thought it was great. I was apprehensive after reading some of the reviews, but on my arrival I was happy. The shower curtain rail was loose; I informed reception, within an hour it was fixed. I asked for fresh towels every day as there was no where to dry our towels; the fresh towels were delivered. It would have been nice for tea/coffee facilities, but I've stayed in many hotels that don't have them, plus starbucks is next door. We stayed on the 3rd floor so didn't have a probelm with the lift - we mainly used the stairs. I'd stay here again and happily recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay At This Hotel. They Are So Rude, Impolite And Don't Care About Its Guest”
Reviews.Author: Pike_BR
Reviews.Content: A friend stayed at this hotel a weekend on Oct, 2009, and shed asked to send some packages to her (totally 7) and she went to Front Desk and Luggage Room and they gave her just one package. I tried to help her calling to the hotel and I talked with several different guys, all of them are very rude, impolite, really don't care about any guest's request, etc... the others 6 packages were not gave to her... one of hotel's employee told me that they faced a system problem during that weekend, that's why they didn't give her pakcages but all time that she asked about her packages, nobody knew where they were. After she left the hotel, they found it and when I asked them to send the her stuffs to the new hotel that she was, they asked my credit card number to charge me the expenses but who did the fault was THE HOTEL, not me or my friend. Now we really don't know where are her packages... when we try to contact someone in this hotel, they said that the packages were sent to her but they don't even give us a tracking number. It is its obligation to send the packages to her address as a FREE DOMICILE shipment but they really don't care about it. Also once I talked to the Executive Office Assistant and I though she was able to help me because she represents the hotel but for my surprise, she was the most rude person that I'd talked in this hotel. Now she is trying to get her stuffs but no one there helps... so if you don't want have a bad experience, I really encourage you to NEVER stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: kanhai
Reviews.Content: Great location, over the NQR Subway. Found it a good base to get around. Good size rooms, however, the plumbing didn't work in the first room we were allocated. We moved to another room which was much older. We requested a move to a more updated room. We were asked to see a choice of rooms and we moved to a better one. The Starbucks is located on the corner of the hotel. Lot's of deli's around. We sampled some of them and thought they were all great. On checkout, the reception printed out our boarding passes which we thought was quite helpfull. Used the hotels black taxi to JFK on check-out. Got a good price and thought that it was a good treat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Room, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: 50scouple
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel...had a room on the 15th floor that was a good size facing the front of the hotel. It was nicely decorated, had a very comfortable king sized bed, seemed roomy from what I have heard about other hotels in NYC. We had a good rate as we booked early and were staying over five days. The location suited us perfectly as it is between Central park (a couple of blocks) and an easy walk to Broadway plays, Times Square and lots of restaurants. A subway stop is steps from the hotel entrance so that was very convenient. It didn't come with a coffee maker but we rented one for $10 which covered the week long stay. It has a nice fitness centre. The 2 people at the concierge's desk were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: helmoss
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel although the location was not as good as we expected. Timesquare was several blocks away. Dont take the black cabs outside hotel as we were told that because we were staying at the hotel we were entitled to a complimentary ride in his cab but he actually ended up charging us double what a yellow cab would have. Thank you to pamela working in the bar for being so friendly. Also the tall gentleman porter who looked after us while we were waiting for our cab to take us to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “"Do not stay at this hotel ....please !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bobbie1969
Reviews.Content: paid extortionate rates to stay in this hotel with my wife on the October Bank Holiday weekend. 1970's style room with a bathroom that needs an urgent cleaning. Low and behold for all the money you pay at this place, there is no complimentary tea & coffee and wi-fi access is charged at a daily extortionate rate. Honestly ....at least Attica State prison gives you complimentary coffee & a clean bathroom. Do not waste your money ......................very very poor

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: PaulHarte77
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel. I really loved it. Staff were so nice and friendly, Could not do enough for you. Room was clean big and comfortable. Highly recommend this hotel to everyone I know. It is so central to everything. 5 mins from everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT stay at the Park Central 870 Seventh Avenue in NYC”
Reviews.Author: texastravel3000
Reviews.Content: October 10, 2009 We booked for 3 nights and stayed 1 night for several reasons. The air conditioner had been detached by the hotel and with no air circulatiion the room smelled like a swamp. The bathroom was in deplorable condition, the shower was covered in mildew, the kleenex holder was in pieces and the toilet paper was sitting next to the sink because the dispenser was broken. We did complain the the management and they did nothing. The room was a $99.00 room at best and we paid $460. I felt cheated in every way. DO NOT stay at The Park Central 870 Seventh Avenue in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice - Great location”
Reviews.Author: happygolucky4
Reviews.Content: If you can take advantage of their website offer of 169.00 then you just can't beat this hotel.Considering the high price of everything in manhatten, this is absolutely the BEST deal out there!! You will read mixed reviews of this hotel and it's interesting because I will explain why. I think some floors and rooms are better than others. We just spent 3 nights here. We met up with my inlaws who flew in from England 3 days before us. We came from Chicago and met them there. They were in the lobby waiting for us when we arrived and came up to the room with us. We had the same level of room they did (a standard double) but on a much higher floor. When we stepped off the elevator my father in law said "This floor is much nicer than ours the carpet is plusher. When we got to the room the comparisons continued. We had ice bucket and glasses, a coffee maker and coffee and a desk and chair. He also said our lights were brighter? Well, I thought he was just being funny but when we went down to his room on the 5th floor I could see what he meant. It was the same room but it seemed older and shabbier. Our room was perfect. The bed was comfortable the pillows soft and it was absolutely SPOTLESS, I'm talking about the edges of the floor where the carpet met the wall. It looked brand new!. Also, the acid test for me is to walk around in a pair of white socks. That will tell you how clean a room is and trust me this was immaculate after 3 days the socks were still white. The bathroom was like new, no mold no dirt at all just shiny and clean. When ever we travel and get to a hotel room, my husband always says to me first thing "before I unpack are we staying?" Because if there is anything not right i always insist on moving and trust me its happened A LOT well within 10 seconds I had started to unpack. Another reviewer complained about the curtains not closing but if they had looked behind the sheers they would have seen the thick blackout shades which pull across and block out all the light. The windows have double pane glass so if you are up higher it is silent from street noise and that's something for manhatten. If I were paying the regular rate of up to 300 dollars a night then I would expect a fridge in the room and free internet but for the price I could live without. The location is absolutely phenomenal The lobby is on the dark side but that's just the style of the hotel go to their website and look at the pictures and they don't lie. It was a perfect stay and I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rest OK”
Reviews.Author: LadyAslan
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't be beat. Service was ok. There were 4 of us staying in one room but they kept giving us towels for 3. We requested extra several times but they didn't always come. We pre-requested a fridge and it wasn't there when we checked in. They also charged us $25 per day for the fridge when they had told us it was $25 for the whole stay. They took the charges off the bill though. Bathroom was a bit rundown: peeling wall paper, a little mold and weak water pressure. I think for the price and location though, it was a good deal. Not sure I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We thought the lifts were brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: ethy12
Reviews.Content: We asked for a room high up (19th floor) and were not disappointed- we had fantastic views and could see the lights of Times Square, it was relatively quiet in that particular corner of the hotel. We checked in early and there were no problems- but realise that will not be the case for everyone. We had coffee making facilities and the bed was comfortable. We thought the lifts were great, it took 2 minutes to get the hang of it - they are super quick and dont seem to stop at every floor- which saves lots of time. There is a safe in the room which is reassuring. There is a subway on the doorstep. Neraby restaurants include Nougatine@ Jean Georges- dont miss it and Mariella Pizza for a quick slice of fantastic pizza on the go. On the downside, the toiletries seemed poor quality and aren't topped up during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, everything else is OK.”
Reviews.Author: afuab
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night while having my apartment exterminated. The location was great and we got a good rate on Hotwire. The room was clean but the walls were a bit scuffed. The walls in the bathroom could use a good scrubbing to remove some mold stains but overall it was clean. The one major issue we had was that the beds appeared to be shorter than average. At 5'11" my feet were hanging off the edge of the bed. The luggage storage charge was bit annoying too.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: KevinLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on our return from a cruise, arrived at the hotel at around 11.00am rooms are not available until 16:00 hours, we were charged $1.50 per bag to leave are bags until the room was available. This is a perfect location on 7th avenue, 5 mins until central park and 10 mins to Times Square. This hotel is a "mansion block" hotel with a nice lobby area, we had a room on the 16th floor, the hallway and rooms on this floor were very dated and in need of an update. In our room the curtains were designed not to close so no protection from the sunlight? The staff do not have a great attitude and had a take it or leave it attitude, we could not believe the morning we checked out we were in the room at 09:30 when the room cleaner knocked on the door when I answered I was "told off" for not placing an "absolutely not" sign on the door, I have only ever used a do not disturb sign when sleeping in or I wanted to use it, not for the convenience of the room cleaner!! Then the worst part of the experience after checking out at noon, we were charged $3.75 per bag (we had 4) to leave them for two hours until our taxi to the airport!!!!!!!! I complained and was told this was not part of the hotel (yer right) and also all hotels did this in New York, we stayed at the Crown Plaza before our cruise and have stayed at other hotels and never had this. We were given two bags free of charge but as I explained to the guest relationships this was no way to build relationships with customers! Think twice before staying here if you have other options.

Reviews.Title: “Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious!”
Reviews.Author: ShotgunRider
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Reception staff were friendly and helpful even letting us check in a little early. Several people seemed to have problems with the lifts, but we found them to be very easy to use and efficient. The room was clean when we got there and was kept up to a good standard throughout our week long stay. The bed was comfy and BIG, plenty of storage space and an adundance of towels and toiletries. The only complaints we had were the lack of decent water pressure and no tea/ coffee making facilities in the room. I wasnt expecting to be charged for storing luggage after checking out but it was less than $4 so not the end of the world. The airline check-in facility was a nice touch. We had a corner room on the 11th floor and had great views towards Times Square, Central Park and my favourite, Carnegie Hall. It is very well located, the Park being practically on the doorstep and Times Sq being a short walk away. We recommend the Citysights NY tour, it was great value and very informative. Make sure you try La Parisienne for breakfast, just a couple of blocks towards Central Park, great pancakes, and the steak and eggs are to die for. I've recommended the Park Central to my sister for her holiday next year as I dont think you can beat it for value and location. We booked on Hotwire and got a great deal. I would be careful though, I heard that Albert Anastasia was shot in the barber shop :0 (Ask Google!)

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: gadgt69
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and really loved the place. Location is excellent, central park and time square within 10 minutes walk, we hardly used any public transport. Also just down the street is the carnegie deli which does the best and biggest cheesecake i have ever had!!! The hotel is modern, clean and the staff were helpful and polite. Sure the lift system is not typical but is that really a big deal? I never waited that long for a lift and they weren't slow (we were on the 20th floor) Room was cleaned every day and the bed was confortable. After another hotel had messed up our booking (morningside inn) we had little choice but to go to this hotel, i am soooo thankful to them as this hotel was perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY AT PARK CENTRAL”
Reviews.Author: reachme214
Reviews.Content: We took our mother for her first time to NY for her 65th birthday. We were excited about the whole idea. We decided to stay at a centrally location and willing to pay the price to be close to all the excitements. After checking in, we were very disappointed to find out that we had to SHARE A KING SIZE BED AMONG THE THREE OF US. . We booked over a month ahead of time and paid for 3 adults so we were surprised that they did not have a proper room reserved for us. We did requested two beds for the next day. We were glad to have 2 beds for the remaining of our stay so for the next few nights, we left tips for the cleaning lady hoping to have a clean room when we return. We were wrong, the cleaning ladies were outside our room every morning waiting for us to leave to collect the tips. Our beds were made and we got new towels but nothing else. Our ice bucket was never cleaned for the 7 nights, carpet not vacuumed, bathroom not cleaned, shower curtain smell. We stopped tipping after the 3rd nights. On this day, nothing was done in our room, no cleaning, no towels, no bed making, nothing.... We called the front desk, we had to wait over 2 hours just to get new towels. After arriving late to our room, having to wait for another 2 hour was long. The hallways on every floor had very strong dog smell. Staffs were not friendly. The only thing we like was the location. We will never stay at Park Central again. The pros and cons: Pros: The location. Cons: Smelly hallway, Smelly room, smelly shower curtain, old furniture, uncomfortable bed. small and slow elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: firstprc
Reviews.Content: Let's start with location - who could ask for anything better than this hotel offers. Easy walk to the Park, Columbus Cir, Times Square, etc. Additionally, the hotel has an extremely sophisticated look and rooms that, by NYC standards at least, are quite large. As far as the logistics of a hotel- cleanliness, promptness of service, navigatability, etc. - I have nothing but praise for them. Oh, and I found the staff to be professional, personable and courteous. I had a brief stay this trip but look forward to booking a room at the Park Central when I can stay a little longer.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Very Badly”
Reviews.Author: GayleGToronto
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel and recommended it but when my group (3 women including a senior) went to check into our rooms we were notified that the hotel was over booked and they were moving us to their other property near Times Square, the Paramount. When we complained about the location (as we wanted to be near the park and away from the chaos of TImes Square) and asked for compensation (because the Paramount is cheaper) we were skillfully moved out of the hotel lobby and asked to wait 10 minutes for a ride to the other hotel. All further attempts to communicate have been ignored.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but was room wasn't as clean as it could be”
Reviews.Author: liaf127
Reviews.Content: While the location of this hotel can't be beat for the price, the room I had left me wishing I spent a little more for a cleaner room. The shower has mold in several areas as does some of the bathroom walls. Generally the room doesn't feel as clean as it could be and being on the 8th floor with my window facing 55th St, the street noise and Saturday night club kept me awake late into the night. I doubt I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but in need of renovation.”
Reviews.Author: goin2travl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice in the last couple years. The first time they put us in a dark and dingy room and I immediately went back down to reception to ask for another room. I was pleasantly surprised when they gave us a much bigger corner room with a view of times square! The second time I stayed there, same situation even though I requested a corner room months in advance I was given a dingy, stained carpeted, moldy smelling room. They were not accommodating & could not give me another room because the hotel was full. BS. On the positive side, the location couldn't be better. All the Broadway shows are just around the corner & times square is walking distance. We never felt unsafe walking around at night and the subway is just steps away. Also the beds were pretty comfortable. Just be pushy with them to get a better room if you are given a dingy one. We found the best pizza in NY is Lombardi's! Try it! Also Carnegi deli is really good (best pastrami sandwiches) & it's pretty much next door.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, charge erroneously services”
Reviews.Author: Sken79
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is simply great. Few steps and you are in Time Square, fewer than that and you get Central Park. It is fairly clean and the people are kind. Very useful tourist information desk. I have only one thing for which I do not recommend this hotel: when I checked out there was a mistake in the bill that had been easily clarified at the reception desk (They charged me a meal that I did not have; eventually we find out that the signature in the bill was not the signature of mine but of someone else that gave the waiter the wrong room number.) The problem was that my credit card has been charge by the hotel twice, for the right amount and for an additional (I guess wrong) charge that was exactly the amount of the meal. I tried to contact them several time via the form of the website but I did received no reply at all. I only asked about the reason of that charge (for which they do not have any bill with my signature)! Actually the additional charge was less than 20 bucks, but what if they wrongly charged me for more? And why they do not reply to my emails... this is not good at all.

Reviews.Title: “Meh. It's not as bad as others say, but remains a very bad option in NYC.”
Reviews.Author: SFO-World-Traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights earlier this month and have nothing particularly nice to say about it. The hotel itself is very well-located which is the only plus. The lobby is newly renovated and decent but once you make way for the elevators, you quickly realize what kind of place you're staying in. The elevators are exceptionally slow - typical for an old hotel in any city, as this one is - and the corridors fairly small. My floor smelled like urine in the hallway for the 5 days I was there, not pleasant. The rooms are dingy and musty. Despite a fresh coat of paint and new carpet, the hotel looks scummy and more than well-worn. The shower had no pressure and minimally hot water, except the occasional flash of boiling-temp that made the shower a fun experience. I held up one of the glass tumblers before pouring myself a glass of bottled water to find lipstick and smear marks on it - clearly it had not been cleaned with anything more than a towel since I don' t know when. There is nothing that would ever compel me to stay in this hotel again. I was very disappointed and very grateful for my late nights in the office so I didn't have to spend more time than needed here.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: icenine1
Reviews.Content: Hotel, by FAR the most disgusting hotel have ever stayed at. There was MOLD ALL OVER (not just in the bathroom, but on the curtains!). The staff were a bunch of nasty jerks. Except the housekeeping women, they were nice. The best and most ridiculous story...my girlfriend sent me a fruit basket with specific instructions to deliver it to my room. Well, after working 17 hours straight I noticed a message on my phone (which did not work of course, and could not retrieve the message) - she told me about the basket....I called the lobby - no answer. I travel DOWNSTAIRS in my boxers and dress shoes and find someone who gets the basekt for me - and CHARGES ME $4 DOLLARS!!!! They said it was because they had to store it. The guy was nasty about it too. Also, menu says room service til 10pm...not true they close at 9:45 but do not reflect this on my menu. The bed is OLD and uncomfortable The elevators stink. The room smells. There is no signage in the lobby as to what is where. I hung a sign on my room for service please and nobody came til 4pm! There high speed internet access was SLOW. By far the worst hotel I have EVER stayed at - would rather have slept in Central Park with the homeless.

Reviews.Title: “For the money, go somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: top-yido
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife for seven nights. New York is brilliant. This hotel is OK, just OK. Got to the hotel at 1pm, tired but couldn't check in til 4pm. Room was ok but damp smell in the cupboard where clothes were to be hung. The condition of the room was that of an average hotel not what would be expected of a hotel where the average nightly cost was £180-£190 pounds. There was no bath only a shower. No tea/coffee making facilities, no fridge/bar in room. The mattrass had seen better days and was uncomfortable. The main problem was the view, or lack of. The room was in the middle of the hotel with a window looking out on to an inner courtyard and other rooms and permanently in darkness. It was necessary to have the lights on all day to see anything as virtually no daylight came in. Really if you are able to spend this sort of money shop around for something better I am sure you wouldn't have to look far.

Reviews.Title: “Dog Hotel”
Reviews.Author: moreover
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not very clean. We had to ask the maid to clean the bathroom really well. My biggest problem was the hotel never mentions that they allow dogs to stay there on its website. Nor, did the hotel advise you of this when you checked into it or gave an option of not sleeping on the same floor with dogs. I am a big dog lover but I do not want to stay in a hotel with dogs. Hotels are notorious for not being clean and dogs add their own germs to the environment. My friend has allergies and this was not a good environment for her. A hotel that allows dogs should advertise for all who do not want to or can not stay in that kind of environment. Also, the staff was rude and not very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Curlygirl10
Reviews.Content: I recently bought reservations via Priceline for the Park Central. Since it was my first time in New York City I had no expectations other than those given to me by other people. I was told our hotel room would be small and cramped and very expensive. And that since I had made my reservation on Priceline that I would get the worst room and treatment. I found the opposite to be true. The rooms were very spacious, clean and the hotel staff was very accomodating. Through Priceline you don't get to specify the type of room you want so I was told I would get stuck with a King-size bed unless we paid extra. This was not the case. The Front desk person asked if we'd like two double beds, I said yes and we were not charged extra. That in itself was a nice surprise. I loved it's central location and would definitely reccomend it to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Manhattan, minus the rip-off price tag”
Reviews.Author: sagethyme
Reviews.Content: We have never been to America, and were determined to find a hotel in NYC that would serve as an excellent base so we could walk everywhere, or get on the subway. When we arrived in NYC, we caught a bus and alighted at Port Authority Bus Terminal, and actually walked to the hotel, passing by Times Square. The room is more than sufficient! Large comfy bed and all the typical fixtures and appliances. Everything you associate with NYC is within reach of this hotel - Central Park, street fare, Times Square, Broadway, Cargnegie etc etc etc. Don't expect the staff to fall over you - we were actually quite happy to do our thing - we weren't in contact with staff much but the room was serviced daily, and this suited us just fine! If you need the subway, yellow line stop is right by the side entrance of the hotel. Happy travelling!!

Reviews.Title: “Location... Location... Location...”
Reviews.Author: CorkMar
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel after a long flight and an extra long wait in JFK at immigration and was longing to flop in a comfortable room! We had requested a non-smoking room - and our room smelled very strongly of smoke. Reception were unable to move us to another room that night as the hotel was fully booked but offered to freshen our room - so they opened a window!!!! The room was more than adequate in size - if a little shabby... We didnt eat or drink at the hotel so we cannot comment on the service or food there - but the concierge desk was very well manned (or womaned as the case maybe) and I found the staff there very informative and helpful. The location of this hotel is definately it's best selling point - there is a subway station located next to the hotel and there are numerous cafes located within a minutes walk. Also Times Square and Central Park are on your doorstep. Overall - a bit on the pricey side - but it's location compensates for any complaints we had

Reviews.Title: “I have never had a worse experience at a hotel”
Reviews.Author: bblnnt
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Park Central hotel was awful. From the moment I got there and had to deal with the mess they call "valet parking" I was annoyed. The staff at the front desk could not have been more rude. I have never seen anything like it- they acted like I was bothering them when I wanted to check-in, check-out or borrow a pen to sign for the food I had delivered. It is an expensive hotel too-- people are paying good money to stay there and the staff needs to be given a seminar on hospitality. The room smelled too, and felt dirty. The carpet hadn't been vaccumed the entire 5 days we were there. I never write reviews on anything but I am so angry about my experience there that I am taking the time to make sure everyone knows: DON'T STAY AT THE PARK CENTRAL, NY!!!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!”
Reviews.Author: nnJim
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely friendly. The lobby, the lounge and the room were spotless. We had booked online thru the hotel's website and had requested a suite upgrade if possible. We were given a huge (for New York) suite on the 25th floor staring right at Times Square for only $40 a night more. I have already booked our next trip at this hotel and will be returning any time our travel takes us to Manhatten.

Reviews.Title: “Good if the price is right!”
Reviews.Author: gill30
Reviews.Content: A group of six of us stayed here for six nights from Aug 31 to Sept 6. This was my second time to stay here and we got a spectacular rate of $88 plus tax per night. For a good deal the Park Central is good value. The location is brilliant, the beds are comfy, the rooms are a decent size. However there are a few issues which could be improved upon. Our room did smell a bit musty, not enough to request a move but noticeable. The room was always well cleaned, a few bucks to the maid always helps with this! The elevator system can be a pain but once you use the allocated lift isn't that big a deal. The public areas are decent enough. We were allowed to check in early on request which was nice. The front desk staff were pleasant on arrival. One of our group had the same issue of no towels in the room. The only thing that really annoyed me was when it came to check out. It transpired that the hotel had put a $100 per day hold on our card in addition to the cost of the room. As we were continuing our holiday afterwards this was very inconvenient. At no time were we informed that they would put this hold in place and as it was a holiday weekend it took a few days to clear. The lady I dealt with on checkout was very rude and unhelpful on this matter. All other staff we encountered were very pleasant. I was there the night the fire alarm went off and I was very satisfied with the system they have in place to keep guests informed. Its a shame they only make their announcements in english as I had to explain what was being said to some people who didn't speak english. Overall an ok stay though, I would probably return if I got the same deal in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but...”
Reviews.Author: Tyrajama
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, but the hotel needs some help. I arrived late, and was told they did not have the King room I reserved, so they would have to give me a room with 2 beds. I had reserved a non-smoking room, but the room I was given smelled very strongly like smoke - in fact, the entire hallway did. Most of the buttons on the phone didn't work, but I managed to call the front desk who told me I definitely had a non-smoking room and they were unable to move me. People were clearly smoking in the adjoining room, and the smoke came right under the door. The floor did not appear to be vacuumed. I ordered room service, which cost $53 for a salad, a grilled cheese, and bottled water, and the food was horrible. In the morning, after taking a shower, I discovered that they had forgotten to put towels in the room. Most of the furniture was worn and dirty. I paid over $400 a night to stay there (which I know is not extremely high by New York standards), but it was definitely not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bunnywhizz
Reviews.Content: Hi just got back from a six night stay at the Central Park Hotel. The location was great, being so close to Times Square and Central Park. Our room was suprisingly spacious with a great comfy bed. The lifts at the hotel are a bit slow with a stupid system which meant - say if you were going to floor 11 and the lift was set to go to floor 10, instead of you pressing 11 and going to 11 it would stop at 10 then return to the Lobby and then go back up to 11. ( If that makes any sense) But we did get the hang of it. The hotel did charge us to store our suitcase the day of departure which was a bit of a cheap trick but apart from that Id highly recommend the place.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for Money.”
Reviews.Author: amnobenda
Reviews.Content: Best location,excellent service.Best value Manhatten can offer at resonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location .....Great price ...Thoroughly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: TillyFloss52
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of August.Got a great deal on the internet Stayed in a Concierge King room.Keep looking on their website as prices are changing virtually every week(cancelled my first two reservations and rebooked as price kept changing ...almost 50% reduction on original price I was quoted) .Ideal location for most of the sights.All of the staff were great and had no problem with the lifts. Overall great value and would recommend this hotel !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantasitc location”
Reviews.Author: Kasia91
Reviews.Content: pluses: Subway entrance, in front of the hotel etrance. 3 min walk to the Central Park. 5 min walk to the Times Square. 7 min walk to 5h Avenue. Starbucks next door :P minuses: Bad elevator service. (There are many floors and we often had to get on our floor by feet) Very expensive breakfast. (25 $ per person)

Reviews.Title: “Abysmal Quality, waste of money, extremely rude staff”
Reviews.Author: gjsung
Reviews.Content: Ok, here is the story. The front of the hotel where you get dropped off is not bad considering its location, however it still lacks a drive way so you'd have to get off the road quickly with all your luggage. My family and I arrived a few hours early for check in, and it really annoyed me to find out that we had to store our luggage in a storage for $3.5 each. When we finally checked in, they gave us a corner room on the 4th floor where the hallway was extremely dirty and smelled like mold. To make things worse, they gave us a room with mold everywhere, non working Air conditioner, and the whole room smelled like armpit (literally). We got our room changed, where I found out that wireless internet was $14 a day. Overall, the stay there was absolutley abysmal considering the amount we pay, I would NEVER EVER recommend this hotel to anyone in my branch of connections. I don't even wanna tell you guys about the fight I had with the manager. I was SO disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Poor Ventilation”
Reviews.Author: Alicetas
