Reviews.Content: We were surprised by the size of our room, which was a little larger than we had expected for New York. The service varied, most staff were very professional and helpful, but one young lady at the check in was extremely rude to another customer when I was in line. Our room was humid, smelly, hot and over looked a service space that was littered with garbage. A view I will never miss. I asked if a drain and the air to be fixed and the drain worked after. The air worked okay for a day but just likely could not keep up with the humidity and the heat. We booked an internet special - and it included breakfast. The buffet was very good - but only if it is included. It was not a $25 breakfast. Take the stairs in the morning; getting an elevator is a long, long wait.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good price”
Reviews.Author: lilemoevie
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay at the hotel was good, it's NYC so you don't spend much time in your room other than to sleep!! The elevators are a bit weird but they ran quickly and we had no problems. The rooms could use some updating, there were water-marks on the ceiling and some of the wallpaper was peeling, carpets coming up etc, but the tv was a nice flat screen and the bed was comfortable. Walking distance to Times Square and we even walked down to the Gerswhin to see Wicked---which I HIGHLY reccommend! :0)

Reviews.Title: “Great place in a walking distance from Time Square!”
Reviews.Author: chutukova
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but could have been better. Overcharged my credit card, so I had a bit of a problem with that... But it seems to be kind of usual in the states. The hotel's situation was really great, though, as it was near everything. Great views of Manhattan, although some rooms could be a bit noisy. I liked it.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: sugarwuzhere
Reviews.Content: the hotel in a great location close to time square the staff was very friendly the elevators are small and our room was a little smelly the carpets where dirty and stained. all and all though it was a pretty nice hotel just a little pricey

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place!! (Overflowing toilet, people sleeping in lobby hallways...)”
Reviews.Author: joe2090
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Central New York for 3 nights in August as part of family vacation with 2 kids. The hotel was booked via Expedia. We found this hotel to be absolutely the worst value for the top dollars they are charging. I have found better service at 1 star motels charging $ 40/night than this place.This was the worst hotel experience we ever had in our life with some of the following issues : - Overflowing toilet : On our last day in the morning, the toilet started overflowing with dirty water spilling all over the bathroom floor. Despite repeated calls, nobody showed up at the room for almost 40 minutes. After 40 minutes, the plumber who showed up simply plunged the toilet but nobody came to clean the bathroom. Finally, the house cleaning showed up after another 30 minutes but did not carry any cleaning supplies. Since we had to catch the flight we simply had to pack up and leave the room without stepping into the bathroom. While I can understand that plumbing can malfunction, the management's response was absolutely pathetic. Manager and front desks simply did not want to deal with the situation in spite of repeated calls. - The hotel has benches between the lobby and guest elevator. We found that people were simply sleeping on these benches during the day and we had to pass them while going to our rooms. The people who were sleeping were NOT tourists or hotel guests but looked like homeless people from street who simply wanted to rest on a nice benches. It was evident that nobody from the hotel management was bothered about these sleeping people. We are paying top dollars for staying at a good place but the area looked more like an old Greyhound station. - When we checked in, the receptionist simply told us that there are no non-smoking rooms available. When I explained that they need to figure out how to provide me a room, the receptionist simply went inside and came back and gave us a non-smoking room. It was clear to me that the hotel had non-smoking rooms but the receptionist simply wanted to dump a smoking room on us. While the location for the hotel is good, the place has too many problems- non responsive management, lack of customer service, very small rooms. Please avoid this dump in NY at any cost. It simply not worth it- especially with the price you are paying. I am also surprised that Expedia is recommending this as one of the recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and good all round”
Reviews.Author: Runskipandjump
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights 12/13 August. Room was very clean. Bed was excellent and got two great nights' sleep. Had a good corner view of 7th Avenue. Reception staff did seem a litte unwelcoming initially on arrival, but once check-in done, they were very welcoming and friendly. Cleaning staff were lovely and gave us extra towels. Thought the bag leaving service was great and didn't mind paying for the convenience. Once we understood how the lifts work and get the right set for our floor, they weren't a problem at all. If you're travelling to the airport, my only tip would be check with the cars outside the hotel before getting the concierge to book the shuttle bus, which is much more expensive if there are a few in your party. The hotel arranged tickets for the Empire State Building and charged us the same price as if we'd bought them elsewhere. I'd happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location, RUDE staff, HIGH prices, OKAY room”
Reviews.Author: Toes-inthe-Sand-2day
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Park Central and will definetly be our last. I booked 3 rooms for August. I asked for early check in as some of our family were arriving earlier than the 4 pm check-in. When we arrived we noticed that the lobby had been completely redone, very nice, however it did not make up for the a**hole we had to deal with at check-in. We asked if our other family members had arrived and were told that was a security issue and he couldn't tell us. After a long arguement he did call their room and said there was no answer so either they hadn't checked in or they were out. ** We found out later our family had left an important message for us at the desk which we received they day we checked out!** We were told we had to return at 4 pm as our room wouldn't be ready until then but we could leave our bags in the "secure" area, however the FEE to do this is $3.75 per bag. I'm thinking with the $200+ per night per room (plus extra for internet) we were paying this was a bit ridiculous. We ended up having to speak to a manager and she put us in a room that was ready (not the original one intenede for us) so everyone with us stored their luggage there. The room smelled bad, the bathroom was moldy, the shower handle was broken, the tub plug didn't work, the sink plug didn't work. The room was tiny and the King bed didn't quite look big enough, The view was the other side of the hotel - brick with windows all around and an empty "pit" in the centre. I asked the cleaning staff to please exchange the feather pillows for foam, I was told to ask the front desk, which I did. We were there for 4 nights - I NEVER got a foam pillow (I exchanged one with other family) nothing ever gets fixed and it is very annoying. The only thing that was good was the breakfast, hot and cold choices but expensive at $35 each. Our favorite waiter was Winston, he was the friendliest guy there - I think they should give him a job at the front desk :) So while the location was great, it isn't enough to make me return a third time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly staff but not a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: euroboyde
Reviews.Content: Stayed with this hotel for 7 days and it is a pretty decent hotel, I wouldn’t call it cheap or expensive, probably around the mid average price if you can find a good deal that is. The Lobby is really nice, really large and spacious! Clean and tidy! But beware even with a huge long reception desk there is always a long queue, standing in line and having opened ears you hear pretty amazing things and many many complaints by guests. My room was ok, on the 24th floor, fabulous view!!! I wouldn’t exactly call it a birds eye view, If you tilted you head you would see a bit of the upper east side other than that your direct view was another building! The room was known as a large Concierge King a disabled one I might add, large and just renovated. I paid between $300 - $599 as the price was different each day. Some of the lamp sockets were broken which was already known by the technicians and receptionists but yeah the still decided to stick someone in there and plus the shower holder was broken so having a shower in one hand and a soap in the other wasn’t very practical! After one complaint I got a free breakfast, the first experience of breakfast in the hotel was also the last, I only feel sorry for those who actually pre paid breakfast as an extra! There is a business centre so you can email, book and print your own stuff i.e. shows on Broadway! Concierge was also ok; they do their job but charge high prices doing it. The lifts always get stuck so if you are afraid of small spaces maybe its best you should book on a lower floor. I remember this hotel more of been stuck in the lift cramped with another 6 people somewhere on the 11th floor for 6 hours on new years eve, something to do with the outer door not opening nor could they open it. I guess you can say those memories are priceless. The staff I do have to say are very friendly especially the night staff, I got some really good tips about new York and Haarlem from the cleaners, the night porters and receptionists and really nice down to earth people to chat to. Honestly the staff does their job and they really do a good one at it.

Reviews.Title: “Oh boy, newer going back there.”
Reviews.Author: JampDeSign
Reviews.Content: The doors and elevator didnt work, there was mould in the bathroom. The noise of the cleening personal in the morning was frustrating. They took dubble internet fee, even if they promised to fix it earlier. I had to correkt them on check out! So I will not go back there again and I will not recommend it for enybody. Not on that price for 200$ at night.

Reviews.Title: “great location - shame about the service!”
Reviews.Author: Ridgestride
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location! Reasonably priced! Good gym! The only issue was that the cleaners did not once vaccuum our room once! We stayed there 8 nights and nearly every day i asked someone to fix the plug on our bath and it was never done! i had to D.I.Y it! Also the toilet did not flush unless you held the lever for about 30 seconds! Also air con was dodgy and i was promised it would be fixed. It never was! Also the charged for baggage storage - first time ive ever come across this - it was a bit of a low blow! Also the taxi driver who was supposed to drive us to the airport the day we left was a driver used by the hotel (his name was eric i think), had a disagreement with us - so he decied to call me the F word and an SOB!!! I know its NYC but come on!

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: seiva
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel two hours before the check-in time and they checked me in right away. The room is spacious and comfortable (great bed). The safe, however, didn't work at all... The AC worked well and the flatscreen TV was nice. The bathroom was clean, but it got too steamy, for the lack of ventilation. The elevators were easy to use, but I must say that I had read about it here beforehand, so I didn't have problems. Some people were confused and there was always someone lloking lost in front of them. The location is the best thing about PC, by far. Several subway stations nearby, bus stops and walking distance to 5th Ave, Central Park, Times Square and so on. Would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - and perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: elipse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Park Central Hotel for three nights and were very pleased with our stay. For tourists the location is all you can ask for. Walking distance to Central Park, Broadway, 5th Avenue, Times Square…. The room was comfy and clean, and spacious enough for a family with two children of 7 and 9 years. The services at front desk was very good, both when we arrived and when we checked out. The only thing we could complain about was the air-conditioning in our room. It made an h**l of lot of noise. And the cold wind stood out of it. We had to fasten the curtains with a clothes pin to keep them together and keep the room a little less windy. But when we go back to New York in a few years we’re definitely staying at Park Central again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel with a good location”
Reviews.Author: Jonna_1
Reviews.Content: Location was very good and beds were ok. The smell in the room was horrible and the floor was wet in front of the window.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: ahiggins385
Reviews.Content: When I booked this room for such a great price, I was skeptical. I had never stayed in a hotel in NY, and had heard horror stories. I was pleasantly surprised with the Park Central Hotel. I was in NY for a wedding, and it proved to be a great location. Right near Carnegie Hall, very walkable to Central Park, Times Square, etc. Room was surprisingly spacious. I would definitely recommend it to anyone going to NY for the weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location and price”
Reviews.Author: riverice7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Central Hotel the week of July 9. I stayed 3 nights and 4 days. The price was good and the room was sqeaky clean. I had a soft bed and great view from the 12th floor. The restaurant offered good food and incredible service. You step outside and you are blocks from everything!! the tour buses even stop in front of the hotel. You can't beat it. Note to the hotel manager: the lobby should have a sign at the counter like: Please wait here- somewhere in the middle of the long desk counter.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: 2009Kiwi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in early July. Check-in was great - fast and easy. Our room was suprisingly spacious (I'd heard NYC rooms were generally small) and we were able to easily fit our two big suitcases and walk around with plenty of room. We had a King bed that was pretty comfortable with lots of pillows. There was also a desk & chair and an armchair. The flat-screen TV was nice. We didn't notice any street noise from our room. The bathroom was a decent size and pretty clean, although the shower hasn't been cleaned completely because I could see some shampoo or soap residue on the shower wall. The bathroom products were cheap-looking and didn't include conditioner, but we had brought our own anyway. There was no fan in the bathroom which meant it got pretty steamy. The AC worked really well and cooled the room down very quickly. There was a safe in the closet, but we had trouble unlocking it twice and had to call security up to fix it. They were really prompt (less than 5 mins) each time so that was good, but we decided not to use the safe anymore after that, as it was too much hassle. Elevators were fine - we never had to wait more than a minute. The location of this hotel is awesome for a tourist. 5 mins walk to Times Square and 2-3 mins to the South end of Central Park. Subway stations right outside the hotel. Also a Starbucks & Subway sandwich shop on the same block. Lots of cafes and souvenir shops close by. Overall, we thought this hotel was excellent value. We booked directly on the hotel website and paid a very low price. We searched a lot and couldn't find any other Manhattan hotels in the same price range. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others looking for good value.

Reviews.Title: “Camp beds”
Reviews.Author: arielsmile
Reviews.Content: I made our 3 night booking on the Park Central website, I booked a Times Sq View room for 3 adults. I paid extra for the view. When we arrived and saw the room, view was good - but only one bed ! So off I went to queue again at reservations to be told that another bed would be brought to us, it would be a fold away bed! I explained that our teenage daughter needed a 'real' bed and that was my requirements on the booking form. I was directed to 'George, Manager' this was a waste of time, I showed him my paperwork requesting 3 beds he as much as said us Europeans were too fussy. I was getting nowhere with him, I pointed out that I paid extra for a view and now it seems we will get a brick wall view because I want real beds in the room! I was too tired to put my points across anymore and walked away, he was condescending and I was not up for it. So thats what we got beds to suit adults with a brick wall view, no coffee making facilities which were in the other room and paid extra for it ! Good points - maid service daily if you want it. Bathroom, a little old and tired, door of which was grubby maybe a lick of paint or just a simple wash down. Location - great

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SarahClelland
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and get checked in hassle free. We were a little disappointed with the view from our room as we had requested at the time of the booking a room with a view but the only view we had was the hotel walls. The room size was fine for us and the bathroom was standard. The rooms were cleaned daily with fresh towels provided. The rooms have heating/AC which worked perfect for us. There have been a lot of comments about the elevators which were didnt think were a problem at all, half the battle is understanding how they work which isn't rocket science! The staff were friendly enough as we had asked for help on the subway and one particular guy was more than happy to help. We never ate at the hotel as it appeared a little overpriced but that seems to be the same with all hotels. Location is brilliant, a 5 minute walk from the very busy times square and a 10 minute walk from central park. The subway is also located right outside the hotel. Lots of delis and other places to eat on your doorstep so very handy. Overall, i would certainly recommend this hotel and we were very pleased with our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Location Great, Rooms Are TINY!”
Reviews.Author: hotelsnob96
Reviews.Content: Typical 3 star hotel, nothing special. Great location though! The rooms are tiny, two doubles :( The ice machine/vending were not working on three floors we tried. Cheap for new york though. The worst place I stayed in NYC, try the Affinia Manhattan or Embassy Suites, same prices but MUCH better!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: FunTravel2114
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in NYC and was not sure on which hotel to stay at. I am glad I chose this one. Hotel is located about 3 blocks from Central Park, Right next to the subway out the back door, very close to 5th Ave for shopping and Time Square is close enough to walk to. Rooms were your basic and housekeeping had are room cleaned by 11:00 every day. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. We got into NYC around 12:00 and we were able to check in and get a room early. I recommend staying here and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: GaryDoc
Reviews.Content: My wife and i have only just recently returned from a week staying here and it was a great hotel,clean,comfortable and as for the loaction well it couldnt be any finer.Everything about our stay was great. I just dont know why some people bother to go on holiday if all they have to do is moan If i were to have a little moan then it would be to say that when we booked through an external agency, they gave us an "all -included" price and said that we would need to pay no tax, only the price showed on the booking.When we checked out, the hotel had charged us an extra $200 which we were not happy about..maybe someone from management could have a look at this for me?

Reviews.Title: “If you're willing to overlook some minor details, the Park Central is a fantastic place to stay while you're in NYC.”
Reviews.Author: KobayashiVacationers
Reviews.Content: (Date of stay - June 29-July 4) Having read the hotel reviews before I got there, I was expecting the worst. This hotel seemed like the best deal out of all the other packages that I looked at on Expedia, and the location was the best for our needs as well. It is close (5-10min walk) to TImes Square AND Central Park, it's right by the theatre district, there's a subway stop right beside the hotel, there are restaurants galore within a 2 minute walk, it was perfect for us. As soon as we got there, we did notice that the scaffolding on the outside was still there but it really didn't obstruct our view of the hotel and if anything, it was nice because it provided some cover from the rain while we were there. The lobby is bright, air-conditioned, and clean and no matter what time of day we came and went it was never crowded. We arrived just after 4pm, and there were a few people ahead of us checking in but we didn't wait more than a minute or two before they opened up another desk to help us. I had booked a Superior room with a King size bed through Expedia because the room with the double beds was going to be an extra $150. I asked if they had any rooms with double beds available and was upgraded at no extra cost, with no hassles. Everyone greeted me by name, and they were extremely friendly and helpful. Now, the elevators, they are a major pain in the butt until you figure out how to work them. There are two bays of elevators at opposite ends of the lobby, one serves the lower floors and the other is for the higher floors. You have to select your floor from the touchpad at ground level, and the computer will dispatch an elevator to you. HOWEVER, that elevator is not necessarily going to be the fastest one. You CANNOT hop into the next available elevator and press the buttons from inside because it will NOT work. You MUST summon the elevator using the touchpad. It is annoying and very slow, but it's better than taking the stairs (which you can't even do because the door is locked at ground level). The room itself was beautiful. Standard size for hotel rooms, and quite large for your typical NY hotel room. We had a large flat screen tv in the room with HD cable. There were no large bath towels in our room when we arrived, but someone came by to check to see how we settled in and they sent up some towels for us immediately. The AC in our room only had one temperature setting - COLD. We turned it off before going to dinner so it was pleasant by the time we went to bed. Not a big deal, it's better than no AC at all. The beds were comfortable, rooms were kept VERY clean. There was always hot water no matter what time of day we showered, which was nice. The drain in the tub was a little sluggish. The water was definitely hottest in the mornings though. The blackout curtains in the room were great to keep out the morning sun for the days when we wanted to sleep in. The room was also amazingly quiet for being on the 4th floor. We didn't have a great view (we could see Hooters and the parking lot next door, that's about it) but who wants to sit in their room and stare out their window all day? We used our in-room safe for our valuables, it is available free of charge. They also have more safes down at the front desk. The safe did get stuck once, inexplicably, and security was a little slow getting back to us but they had it fixed in no time. They were very friendly and apologetic. INTERNET, well, that was a royal pain. It is very expensive ($14.04/day). You can choose between LAN or wireless internet, neither of which are very fast or reliable. I wouldn't recommend paying for the internet, trust me, it's not worth it. You'll spend half your time hitting refresh, and the other half the time screaming at your laptop. There is a business centre available if you need to print or fax anything, but internet there is $0.30/minute with a minimum charge of $5, and printing/copying/faxing is $1/sheet. Not worth it! I didn't use the gym but my brother did, he said it wasn't half bad for a hotel gym, had a few treadmills, elliptical, weight machine, bike, etc. Lastly, our package was supposed to include the buffet breakfast at the hotel restaurant. I believe it was called the Park Cafe? It is right in the lobby. Not very big, so would be very slow at peak times but it opens at 6:30am and goes until 11. We only ate there once, but the food was quite good. Service is slowwww but it was free, so whatever! They did charge the meal to our room ($61!) but when I checked out they reversed the charges for us with a smile and a big apology. Speaking of check-out, in order to speed up the process, they slip a copy of your invoice under your door the morning of your check-out and if everything is in order, you can actually check out using your television. In the menu there is a guest-services link and if you follow the prompts not only can you check on the status of your account throughout your stay, you can quickly and efficiently check out from the comfort of your own room. All in all, the positives outweighed the little negatives and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice place to stay while visiting NYC. Make sure you visit the Carnegie Deli right next door for the best deli sandwiches and cheesecake in the world! Just don't go at peak hours or you'll be waiting in a line that goes all the way down 7th Ave. It's open from 6:30am-4am daily.

Reviews.Title: “My birthday and America's too!”
Reviews.Author: July1Ct
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and were able to check in at 1:00! (I called ahead) We wanted to make the most of our stay so right after checking in we headed out to explore the city. The location is great! The subway is right next to the hotel, Times Square is a few blocks away and so is Central Park! We purchased the New York City Pass for 2 days and made it to so many sites using the Greyline Sight Seeing buses. I would definitely recommend planning out your sights then hopping on and off the bus to explore as many as you can! The bus has tour guides that tell you all about the history of the bldgs, parks, attractions, etc. It rained on and off on our trip but thanks to the free rain ponchos we stayed up top and weathered the rain drops to enjoy the tour. The parking was expensive since we didn't need the car, maybe next time we'll park it off site a few blocks for a cheaper rate or take the train.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Great value for Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: henrychen
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel. The rooms are clean, and the service is very good. It was significantly cheaper than some of the more expensive ones in the city. I thought it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Rates”
Reviews.Author: grosenbaum
Reviews.Content: On the corner with a yellow subway line and a Starbucks! What more could you ask for? Its within easy walking distance of Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Carnegie Hall... just to name a few. Room rates were good and there were just a few minor issues such as our keys quit working late one night for no reason and there is a charge for the internet which says you pay for 24 hours at a time... but you don't. I paid for many days thinking the trip was covered, but on the last day, I had to buy another day at 4pm.. which should have been good for 24 hours. It wasn't... the next morning, it wanted me to buy another day. But minor stuff. Overall... a great location and a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: blimele
Reviews.Content: Together with friends we were for one full week in the Park Central hotel in NY. The room was fine, the staff throughout the hotel was always polite but not effective when a problem arises... at check-in we had to wait for two hours at five in the afternoon because the room was not ready. Also by mid week we had to change the room because the door lock was not working. Location was proximate to a lot of great theaters and restaurants and very easy to get around town.

Reviews.Title: “Mid Town Find”
Reviews.Author: tablesedge
Reviews.Content: Reasonable rates, clean, great sheets, centrally located, but out of the fray.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service!”
Reviews.Author: artistNewHampshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days, three nights and found all the staff cheerful as well as helpful. The room was clean but as reported before the bathrooms have no ventilation.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: white4208
Reviews.Content: Four of us spent six nights at Park Central. The staff was friendly, helpful, and their sense of humor was great. This hotel is the perfect place to stay in New York. It's easy to walk to Time Square and Central Park. Subway stations are on the corner. Broadway is just a few blocks away. The only draw back of the hotel was the elevators. They were slow when the hotel was busy. However, if you stay on the 3rd or 4th floor the stairs are not bad. Also, look for the service elevators. The staff will help you use them when the regular elevators are busy. If I go back to New York City, I will definitely stay at Park Central Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location close to Broadway, Times Square and Central Park”
Reviews.Author: Ocahan
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were recommended this Hotel by a friend who had recently stayed there, we were told it was 3.5 star and a great location which were very true. When we arrived we discovered the hotel was undergoing renovations and was covered in scaffolding over the exterior which was a little off putting but none-the-less wasn't inconvenient to us. We booked online and chose from memory a superior room with king size bed but on arrival were offered a room with 2 double beds, we had to complain and were upgraded to what we had ordered although the reception staff seemed quite bothered by our complaint. Our superior room was recently renovated and clean, we had a very comfortable bed with fresh, crisp linen. We had a nice meal at the Hotel Restaurant one night. The Hotel had a tourist information/booking desk and there was a fabulous lady there I think called Maureen who had incredible knowledge of the sights to see including some little gems that weren't so famous. The hotel was also conveniently located with a subway entrance on the corner of the hotel. Our stay here was comfortable and as noted close to Broadway, Times Square and Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MNTraveler01
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent! Walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, Theater District, Rockefeller Center, Empire State Building. Plenty of decent restaurants very close to the hotel, Ben Ash Deli across the street was very good although a little spendy. There is also a Starbucks right next door for those who can't go without their morning coffee! The room was much bigger than we expected to see in NYC. The room itself could have used some updating but was very comfortable overall with a large bathroom. All the hotel staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. Check-in and out took only a few mins each and the people at the concierge desk were wonderful as we purchased tickets to a few different events from them. Only complaint was the broken safe in our room. We called front desk about it and they sent someone up within minutes. He said it could not be fixed but we could get a different room with a working safe or use the safes they have downstairs. Not wanting to give up our room with a view of Times Square, we chose the second option. We had an excellent stay at the Park Central and would stay again when returning to New York!

Reviews.Title: “Manky”
Reviews.Author: minnie_n
Reviews.Content: I found the service efficient and fine, but the room was pretty manky. The furniture was pretty beat up and the carpet, although vacuumed, seemed pretty dirty. The bathroom's shower curtain was moldy and there was shower gel or something stuck on to it. The biggest problem is the lack of ventilation. There are no controls for air circulation, not even an air vent for the bathroom, which is desperately needed. The location is good, but the moldy shower curtain was a huge turn-off to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly and unhelpful staff - bad service but good location”
Reviews.Author: Kevmay
Reviews.Content: Apologies for this lengthy review but we were completely fed up by Park Central. Please read on before you make any booking with this hotel. Their service is definitely a huge disappointment - right from the moment we booked the hotel room. We booked through their on-line system for non-refundable special rate. The booking went through but they claimed that AMEX payment was declined so they cancelled the booking without first checking with us, and then asked us to give them our credit card details within 48 hours to reinstate the booking. I would have thought any decent hotel would have the courtesy to check with their customers before cancelling the booking? Anyway, we went ahead because it was getting close to the time of our trip and we couldn't be bothered to check out other hotels. The room is a bit old and run down, water pressure from the shower was quite low, but given the special rate we got (USD 162 tax inclusive), we can live with that. High speed internet in room, but at a charge of USD14.99 per day. Storage of luggage at USD 3.75 per piece per day - even for same day pick-up within 2 hours! We stayed in the hotel for one night, left for Canada for 5 days and then return to the hotel - that costs us USD18.75 already! Expensive - but we accepted that's NYC. While we appreciate hotel is after all a money making business, we were truly annoyed when the hotel staff made money by deceit. When we asked for directions to Newark Airport, the front desk staff told us that we can't take yellow cab as the airport is in New Jersey. He said that we MUST book a car to the airport and he can arrange for that. The car hire costs USD$85. We later found out from yellow cab driver that yellow cab can take us there at flat rate of USD65 plus toll of USD8! I can accept that car hire through hotel will be more expensive, but to lie about yellow cab not allowed to go to Newark Airport is absolutely not acceptable. The hotel staff has no integrity and is simply ripping tourists off! As if that's not enough, when we returned from Canada we asked for late check out at 12:30 (normal check out time is 12:00, so we were only asking for 30 mins extension), we were bluntly turned down. Just another 15 mins? "Absolutely NO, our hotel is FULLY booked!" So much for their quality service they claim they are offering their guests. Then we asked how much is the approximate charge of yellow cab to JFK terminal, the front desk staff told us that we need to book a car and it would cost USD85. When we returned to our room and checked on the internet, we found out that yellow cab charges a flat rate of USD 45 plus toll of USD5. We tried to call the front desk from our room to cancel the booking. Neither the operator nor the conceirge picked up the phone, it took us 45 minutes to finally get through to the front desk. The lady said their concierge closes at night and therefore no one would pick up! I told her that we want to cancel our car booking, she said she couldn't do that because the bell man would call the driver direct to place the booking. She would need to track down the bell man to cancel the booking. She asked me whether I know the name if the bell man - I told her that we place the booking with front desk not the bell man, how would I know his name???? I ask her to put one of the bell men on the phone so that I can leave a message for the cancellation and she again said she can't as there is only 1 bell man on duty at night. uhhhh???? If there is only 1 bell man on duty - how difficult would that be to track down the bell man who placed the order in less than an hour ago? This is just incredibly illogical?!!!!! Anyway, I told her to leave a message to the bell man to cancel the booking. When we left the hotel the next day and tried to get a yellow cab, a bell man asked us where we are going and we told him JFK. He asked whether we have booked a car, we said we did but we had cancelled the booking the night before. He said the car had arrived and he offered to cut the price from USD85 to USD 55 right away ( I guess the $30 is how much he or the hotel made out of our booking!) I insisted on taking yellow cab and the bell man started to yell at the cab driver for taking away his business, and then came the bodily contact! Another incredible demonstration of their service - bell man picking a fight with cab driver right in the face of a hotel guest!!!! Several other cab drivers stopped by to offer support to my cab driver. The bell man continued to yell and scream as our cab pulled away from the hotel. Our stay in the hotel was a terrible experience - worst that I ever had! We have black-listed this hotel and will never go back again. Recommend a friend to stay there? NEVER!!!!!!!!!!! I do hope that the hotel management would pick up this review and respond. I wonder what explanation they can give...

Reviews.Title: “A great base of operations!”
Reviews.Author: Redsparow1
Reviews.Content: Located just a few blocks from the heart of Time Square this hotel is reasonably priced for the area at $159 a night. We were pleased to find that we were right in the middle of the action, just a few blocks from Broadway, and there is a NY sight seeing bus stop right outside the door. The concierge desk was okay, not great. The rooms are plain approaching bare bones, but if you are looking for somewhere that is clean, affordable, and spacious enough that you can stretch out a bit, then look no further. The hotel was undergoing some serious renovations while we were there, so it may be getting a major face lift. We were happy with our stay and would return if we could get the room for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base to explore midtown”
Reviews.Author: JADEScotland
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in multiple hotels in New York and was very impressed by both the quality and location on the Park Central. It is about a 10/15 minute walk to Time Square and a 10 minute walk to Central Park. Although the rooms are nothing extraordinary they were clean and functional and a perfect base to explore the city. The bar was a little pricey (even for New York!). There was a Starbucks next door and multiple diners on the same block. It is a great base for a touristy trip to New York but a little too central if you want to explore the more unusual parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, functional, central, friendly with no frills.”
Reviews.Author: Scottymac910
Reviews.Content: The Park Central is an ideal base to push out and explore NYC, the hotel doesn't have many bells and whistles, but it isn't meant to. It's great value and located right in the heart of the action. The staff are as friendly as New Yorkers tend to be, the rooms are clean, reasonably spacious and functional. The check in is efficient and hassle free, the doormen are helpful, knowledgeable and will grab you a cab for a small tip. From the hotel you are a few blocks away from 5th Avenue, Columbus Circle, Central Park, Times Square, Hells Kitchen, Subways, the Port Authority, Restaurants and Shops Galore. All within easy walking distance. My advice is if you are going to NYC to hit the shops, bars,restaurants, theatres and attractions, and are considering the Park Central, go for it. It is a place to lay your head and you can spend your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms not too bad”
Reviews.Author: gobluegirl
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying not a lot of time was spent in the hotel, the location itself was a great base for touring the city. You’re within walking distance of Central Park, Broadway, Times Square, and Rockefeller Center. There is a subway station outside the side door of the hotel and there is also another one just up 7th avenue. The room was spacious, especially for a NYC hotel, the beds were comfy and we had a brand new flat screen TV. The bathroom was quite big as well, no problems here, the showers were warm and the shower head was powerful. The lobby was going under a renovation, but it didn’t really affect us too much. What I didn’t like was being on the third floor, there was three night clubs directly across from us and at 4:00 am I want to go to sleep and not be disturbed by drunken people. Other than that I had no complaints. There is Starbucks right outside the front door, Carnegie Deli is a mere 30 steps away and is fantabulous. We closed out every night at a bar called Names and Faces, it’s at 54th and 7th. Great bartenders, good bard food and not too bad prices. I would stay here again; I would just request to be on a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisSenora
Reviews.Content: I went with my husband recently to NYC. He for business, mine leisure. We stayed at 2 different hotels. Park Central was the first. We liked this hotel. The location was great, the room was always clean and updated, bathroom very roomy. Coffee pot in room and ice down the hall. Our breakfast was included at a very reasonable price for a big city. The second hotel we stayed at charged $28.00 each for breakfast. Staff was VERY helpful and pleasant. We walked everywhere from this location. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “good price, good location, good hotel, great weekend”
Reviews.Author: ttocs58
Reviews.Content: Since I havent been to NYC for 15 years and my wife has never been there at all, wanted to make sure we were in a central location to be able to walk to most sights and areas, and the Park Central is perfectly situated with that in mind (stayed for a long weekend). The hotel is a huge beast but it's got everything you'd need to make a stay worthwhile...we had a clean quiet room with a comfy bed and a bathtub to soak away the foot aches after walking for 8 hours a day. It was easy to check in and out, and the in-house concierges (there's several of them) were patient and provided helpful suggestions without any attitude. Buy some bagels and have breakfast in central park (2 minute walk) to start your day and have a great time!!! The price was fantastic (through Expedia-got 300$ savings booking flight and hotel together) and the Park Central was a perfect place to crash after our adventures.

Reviews.Title: “Please do not waste your money on this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kaz2001
Reviews.Content: Good location, pity that is such a terrible hotel. From the moment we checked in we could not wait to check out! Staff are unfriendly, food is terrible, rooms are small and very dated and dark. PLEASE DO NOT RESERVE HERE. I used to live in New York and it was close to where i worked and always thought it looked really nice I made the mistake of booking it as it looks good on the outside but thats where it ends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: wafs1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip for work. The staff was helpful, I had a nice room, it was on the small side and the view was horrible, but everything was very clean. It was not loud and I had no problems staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, not so good service.”
Reviews.Author: fferraz
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week at this hotel and we liked it. The location is just perfect, very close to Times Square, Broadway, Columbus Circle, etc, and 2 blocks from Central Park. The room was very nice, very comfortable and with a lot of space, nice bathroom and was always very clean. The TV was very nice too. Now the only problems we had: our room heater was not working properly and even after I warned them twice about it, nobody did anything to fix it and not even sent me a message explaining why. Also the restaurant staff (same as breakfast) is very unprepared and unprofessional, they are not polite and the price there is too high. We always had breakfast elsewhere. Bottom line is: the price of this hotel was great for its location and its accommodations, but don't go expecting a class A service.

Reviews.Title: “We will go back, we liked this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dgaspar
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in mid March, this Hotel is very good, no complain, everything clean, the room perfect, the bath okay, the elevators very well organized, in my opinion, to be more efficient, the people must be more patient and take the one that was assigned by the computerized system. For a tourist who loves New York, the location is excellent, the sightseeing buses stop at 100 yards, the subway is around the corner, Central Park is at two blocks, plenty of Delis and restaurants to dinner at walking distance. We had only problem, we were at low season, the Hotel was half empty; we paid for a concierge room at the 22nd floor with the promise of a view to Times square, and got a view of a wall of bricks and windows, great disappointment. A friend, who paid less, for a 5th floor superior king room, had a view on 6th Avenue. Apart of that we are very happy with the choice and the value. Of course, I will recommend this Hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location - large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Costa_Alves
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has an excelent location on the 7th avenue and just 500 mts from the cosmopolitan times square and in the front of the Carnegie Hall. the room was very large with 2 king beds (we were only a couple on the room) big plasma tv. cleaned every day. the decoration is a bit old fashioned. The location is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “From someone who's lived in NYC...”
Reviews.Author: JYCtraveler
Reviews.Content: I lived in NYC for 7 years prior to our visit April 2009. We got a really good rate on the hotel so I was expecting a pretty small, somewhat dingy hotel (as we had stayed at a 1/2 star lower hotel a year ago and it was small and dingy). It actually turned out to be a very nice hotel w/a beautiful lobby, okay excercise room and very clean rooms. The photos make the rooms look old, but actually it's more modern looking in real life. The room was not super big, but there was a king size bed, 2 chairs, a desk and flat screen tv and we didn't feel overcrowded... plus, this is NY and if you've ever seen most people's apartments in NY, you wouldn't think this was that small. The location is great, I used to work a block away and this is centrally located. W/in blocks are Central Park south, Carnegie Hall, the Time Warner building, Times Square, 5th Ave shopping. 2 downsides: no in room fridge, it's $25 to rent a crib, they charge by the hour to hold your bags. Carnegie Deli is right next door, famous for it's delicous, huge deli sandwiches. Yes, the sandwiches are $15, but the portions are huge. Btw, we walked across the Brooklyn Bridge and ate at Grimaldi's Pizza, it's the best pizza you can get. Totally worth the trip to Brooklyn. Instead of spending $40 from JFK to the city ($70 from the city to JFK, yes it's higher going to the airport), I would recommend taking the AirTran from Penn Station. It's easy and so much cheaper. Good luck and have fun!

Reviews.Title: “What do people expect/”
Reviews.Author: Clashcityrockers
Reviews.Content: Having kept an eye on the reviews on this site over the past few month, i arrived at Park Central on 23 April wondering quite what to expect. What i actually got was: a very clean, spacious room; friendly and helpful service and a great, great location. I really don't know what people expect these days; this hotel is hardly the most expensive and, in my opinion, was well worth the money. The fact that you can be in Central park within two minutes from leaving the front door is good enough for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great position, excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: EnglandLibrarian
Reviews.Content: Always stay at this hotel since discovering it 10 years ago. Great position for both shopping and site seeing. Good sized clean and comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Held Hostage - No Air”
Reviews.Author: anwa
Reviews.Content: No Kidding! We were on a family vacay and late May was a little warm. No in room controls and management refused to turn on main control. We were told to prop open the window which only allowed 6 inches of air in the room. Tension was building...staff were rude and even looked mad when you approached - kind of like prison gaurds. After one night stay, we did something bold...we checked out - first time in our lives we ever did that. As we looked back at the curtains blowing from the windows they appeared to be almost waving at us. We were the lucky ones, because as we drove further down away from the hotel, you could see small electric fans in some windows. Unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in a good value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: RTWCRBrisVegas
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful. Yes the lifts were slow, but the hotel has done the best they can. You know the lifts are slow, so plan ahead! One dollar a day for the chambermaid works wonders in having your room cleaned when you want and getting extra towels etc. The rooms were a good size and contained all the usual things. Bathrooms clean and spacious with ample hot water. Location was excellent and there are many cafes etc nearby. Can thoroughly recommend Petrossian (182 W57th) for beakfast and fabbo coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough hotel”
Reviews.Author: gambit76
Reviews.Content: Nothing spectacular about this hotel. The location is a little far from mid-town so you may want to avoid if you prefer to be closer to Time Square. It is good value though if you get the right price as the rooms are decent and the hotel is clean.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location everything else is a bonus”
Reviews.Author: moosey95
Reviews.Content: I stopped at this hotel for 5 days mid march. I was staying her with my mum and although I had booked a king size room when we checked in we asked for 2 queens instead and they made this happen without any fuss. We stayed in room 505 which is on the 5th floor, it had a good view of 7th Avenue with Carnegie Hall just to the left of the hotel and times square a short walk to the right. We had a bit of trouble operating the safe but we rang reception about this and within minutes a very nice and helpful secruity gaurd arrived at sorted us out. The room was a brilliant size. The beds were a nice size and comfotable. There was a nice size closet with the safe (which you dont have to pay to use like some hotels in Europe). The bathroom was also a good size. The room was extremely clean and I have high standards. We had no problem with the lifts never waited more than a few minutes which i think is more than understandable for a hotel with 20 odd floors. All the staff we spoke to were very friendly and helpful. We spoke to a few of the housekeeping staff who were friendly and liked chatting to us. The hotel is in the best location possible. Most tourist destinations are either a short walk or a subway ride away. There are subway stations located close to the hotel depending on where you want to go. Times Square is about 10 minutes slow walk right out of the hotel. Broadway is behind the hotel. Fifth Avenue is just a 10-15 min walk. As is Rockerfeller Centre which by the way is a big must. Get the sunrise and sunset ticket for just $10 more than a normal day ticket it is well worth it. You get the most amazing views of manhattan. And you have two days to use the sunset ticket. It was the best thing we did. We heard from other tourists that the view from Rockerfeller is better than Empire state and much less busy. There are so many places to eat around the hotel although the closer you are to Times Square the more expensive it is.Apparently there are some great places to eat along 9th Avenue although we didnt eat there. We found a great deli to the left of the hotel (opposite Carnegie Hall) on the last day. It was much cheaper and had better produce than the ones further right of the hotel. We were very impressed with the hotel and would definatly stay there again and recommend it to anyone going there. If anyone wants any tips or has any questions about the hotel feel free to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but the rooms are not kept up.”
Reviews.Author: JMCHawaii
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Park Central with my son's band group that was performing at Carnegie. The location of the hotel to everything was excellent but the rooms are not kept up. Lobby we very nice however I wish they paid as much attention to the rooms as well. Maybe there isn't enough help to really clean the room but I had a large crack on the ceiling over my bed and mildew in the bathroom. Several of our light bulbs were burnt out but maintenance replaced them after we asked. My sheets were old with torn areas on them. Pretty gross they don't replace old sheets. I don't think for the whole week we were there that they changed our bedding.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever booked”
Reviews.Author: jjanninnee
Reviews.Content: I had to change my room 3 times because of how small and unclean they were. The 3rd room they gave me was the best of the worst. It was tiny, dirty and had 3 locks and a chain on the door which didnt make me feel too safe. The icing on the cake, was finding a dead cockroach belly up on the rug--which I didn't walk bare foot on for fear of what was on it. The only positive was that the hotel is in a very convenient location; however, there are plenty of better hotels in the area that are clean and worth the extra few dollars.

Reviews.Title: “I really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tnightgirl
Reviews.Content: My only downside...was...about me personally and not about the hotel. I have stayed in midtown so much...I really like being away from the touristy stuff at this point. But, the price was right and the hotel ser vices were great and in the end...there are ways to avoid the tourist and have a great time! Plus there is a subway line just outside the door of this hotel....and it proves to be convenient...if you want or need it! The room was clean, the mattresses...may need to be replaced...but not at the point that i found too uncomfortable. The noise from the street was present...but it is a city...and this should be expected. Check in and out was great...and overall friendly service all around.

Reviews.Title: “There is ZERO customer service at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: marklong
Reviews.Content: Our company had booked this hotel on a recent business trip to NYC. While we had actually stayed here once before with no problems, this next trip proved entirely different. When we checked in we let them know we'd couldn't stay the second night which we had prepaid for... the front desk clerk said no problem we won't bill you. When our credit card bill came the next month we saw they had billed us for the two nights. I called and spoke with a front desk clerk, general manager, and accounting all to no avail. They still will not give us our money back!! The general manager has been completely unwilling to compromise.You would think the Park Central wants to retain existing customers instead of driving away. The bottom line is this. Stay here at your own risk. If something goes wrong, good luck ever getting it resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Eugene_OregonMustang
Reviews.Content: Park Central is in a perfect location -- close to Central Park, Times Square, the Museum of Modern Art, etc. Our room was clean and spacious enough, but the service was so horrific that it definitely put a damper on our vacation. One night an alarm was going off in the next room. When we called the front desk to alert them about it, they did nothing. Finally, after the fourth call, a security officer arrived, but his attitude was nothing short of rude. A subsequent complaint to the general manager was ignored. Needless to say, I will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor customer service!”
Reviews.Author: mlgvt48
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel three times in the last 6 months. It is conveniently located and the rooms are decent especially for the price. However the management is now treating me very poorly with regards to follow up on a parking ticket that I got because of their error. I drove to NY on my last visit and a bus was parked in front of the hotel when I arrived so I had to stop in the taxi stand. I got out of my car and flagged down the doorman and told him I wanted valet parking, showed him where my car was and gave him my keys. Later on that evening I got a call from a manager informing me that I got a ticket because the doorman ending up leaving my car there too long and that the hotel would take care of the ticket. I never say the summons until I got one in the mail several weeks later. I then called the hotel and after several attempts to figure out who the right person was to speak to I was directed to security. They told me they understood and would take care of it. Well they didn't and I just got a Notice of Impending Default. They will not return my phone calls and they do not appear to want to help me despite the fact that they caused the ticket and agreed to pay it. Boycott this place!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise, especially for the money.”
Reviews.Author: omninfogirl
Reviews.Content: My then boyfriend and I went to NYC to visit college friends...which was planned by him and needless to say upon arriving in NYC their space was not really going to work for 3 days of crashing at their place. I found Park Central, in what felt like the 11th hour. I ordered through hotwire and got 3 nights at 110 a night, which was a steal for a hotel in NYC, at least in my opinion. We didn't get in until about 3am, clearly very late. They had overbooked, not shocked, and we were shocked...it worked they upgraded us to as suite, for free, which was about 600 or so a night, from what the sign said in the hotel room. I heard their basic room leaves a lot to be desired, but I didn't experience it. They had higher end products in the room. We had a living room, whirlpool tub, with sitting area, plush robes, and we had a very plush bed with nice sheets. Also 2 40''+ lcd tvs in the living room and bedroom area. We also had a 22nd floor view of times square. My only qualm is the room was sort of small for all that was going on in it, and although very updated that couch was the quality of a mid-rate doctor's off lounge, at best. The concierge was nothing but nice, they were able to find us airport shuttle service at a very reasonable price, 35 to JFK in a limo, I over heard others paying 50 + Our room was clean, but not FRESH, in that it definitely had that "this room was smoked in for years feel". For what we paid and what we got upgrade wise, I cannot really complain. Pros: if you can get an upgrade *always remember to ask, take it, as the other rooms i hear are quiite closet-like. service was exceptional, the lobby was very nice and they held our luggage after we checked out as our flight was a red eye that evening, can't forget LOCATION! Cons: probably room size, some stuff they cut corners on and i heard a lot of people that had traditional phone in reservations have a lot of problems.

Reviews.Title: “Here's the Scoop”
Reviews.Author: CtTraveler12345
Reviews.Content: O.K. Here's the scoop. We stayed 5 days and 4 nights. We go to NYC once a year for business (with the whole family and colleagues). We have stayed at hotels along Time Square (always expensive..always dirty carpet). I booked our rooms online through the hotel website with the early bird special ..which included breakfast for 149.00 per night. Wow...what a deal...last year we paid 300.00 a night along Time Square. When we first arrived, they gave us a room on the fourth floor. We told the African American gentleman that we wanted double beds instead of the super king that was reserved and that we would like to check the room. We went up and the room stunk and looked well used....so we immediately went back down and told a nice young lady that it was not going to work. Then we had room 1508 which had a view of the lights on Time Square. We thought OK ..this will work. The first night my husband wanted to hook up to the internet and the in room wire connection would not work. We were afraid to do anything online with the wifi. Also, the air conditioner/heater unit did not work...and the lamp on the desk did not work....and no fans in the bathrooms. The window, however, did open...but was too noisy at night. We called the next morning to tell them of the electrical problems and that we wanted another room. She told us to check back with them at 4:00 pm to see what rooms were available. She wanted us to check our bags in at the desk but I told her that we would just leave everything by the closet door. We went down to eat breakfast and it was scrumptious!!! It made up for any problems that we may have had. An American Breakfast Buffet with Fruit!!!! We got back at 6:00 pm and the same lady gave us room number 1602 (a large handicapped room). It was very clean and quiet. It seemed the higher that we went the better it got. We did not have a view in room 1602 but it did not matter...because it was so clean and quiet. I would give the hotel 5 stars....if we did not have to go through the first night and the fourth floor dump. I will have to say this...when we went to check the room on the 4th floor...we waited forever... for the elevator...I went downstairs ....while my spouse...waited...by the time that I went to the desk...changed keys...I noticed no spousey...so I hit the 4th floor button. The elevator does not work on the fourth floor...still waiting....yikes!!!!! So if you stay away from the fourth floor and go up as high as possible...your stay will be perfect....and no room 1508 for the internet or AC!!!!

Reviews.Title: “hair on walls of shower!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: irishtraveller81
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived things did not go well. The receptionist was extremely rude and unfriendly. we asked to pay our bill in full in cash to which he demanded a 150 dollar deposit on top. Yet when we ordered room service they wouldn't take it against the deposit, they wanted cash for that as well. Then to my horror the first time I had a shower I discovered long hairs on the wall from the previous occupants. We politely asked them to make sure the bathroom was properly cleaned and was met with not so much as an apology or an ounce of caring. when we got back 6 hours later the hairs were still there. We cleaned it ourselves in the end. The room was so dark you had to have the light on all the time. The staff didn't so much as smile at us thewhole time we were there. The only good thing about this hotel was the location extremely near central park and times square which was brilliant and perfect for first time in new york

Reviews.Title: “We could not ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: MissKienza
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were looking for a weekend getaway to NYC and visit some friends in town. It wasn't easy finding a nice, descent looking and most of all inexpensive hotel (specially in Manhattan) I was fearing not to find the hotel to our expectations. My fears dissapeared once we arrived and noticed that the hotel was just what we needed! I belive the best feature of this hotel is it's location, just 3 blocks from Times Square and 2 from Central Park. I may agree on some of the other reviews about the customer service or lack of profesionalism...since there was a small glitch with our hotel room, but no biggie. And the elevator at peak hours...it can get crowded, so either wait or take the stairs, Ah! and local calls aren't free! so maybe use the lobby phone instead of the room's. Other than that we had no complaints as we practially used the room to crash after a long day of sightseeing and shopping. The beds were comfortable, (I miss the pillows lol!) the atmosphere was quiet and no funny smells were found in the room. I strongly recomend Park Central Hotel! Kitchener, ON - Canada

Reviews.Title: “no problems would stay again in a seconed”
Reviews.Author: tinarosea
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the Saturday round 1.30pm, got keys to room straight away, staff very friendly, girl on help desk was great, room was cleaned every day, perfect, only thing i would say was would loved to have had Coffee making facilities, but every thing else was perfect. Drank in bar once on last day, expensive, never ate at hotel, used to go get coffee from starbucks next door and take up to room, lofts never once had a problem, great location great staff and moved go again and recommend to anyone/everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: tnorena
Reviews.Content: awful service, had a few complaints, when i went to speak to someone they never even responded!!! have absolutkey zero customer service skills and were never accomadating! oh and the bar there, exactly the same.. in addition to the staff looking like they rolled out of bed and came to work, they cursed in front of me and my spouse as if they had no regard for us there. i would NEVER stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: likestotravel63
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. The service was great; the staff was all very friendly and helpful. The room we stayed in was spacious, clean and tastefully decorated with an excellent view. The bathroom was also very clean and spacious. The location is the best, close to everything in Mid-Town Manhattan. You couldn't ask for a better location. The breakfast buffet was also excellent. it offered a good variety and a nice view. The price was also very reasonable. I went with my 12 year old son for a weekend getaway and we will definitely return to the Park Central the next time we visit NYC. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You'd be mad not to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Dipsy66
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights with a friend and got a great deal from the hotel's website which included breakfast. Room was large and airy with 2 double beds and very clean, the only tiny downsize was the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room but with so many places nearby to eat & drink and a cafe/bar in the hotel (not to mention one of 751 Starbucks next door!) it really wasn't an issue. Staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel even has a car service if you don't want to take a taxi to the airport. Central location couldn't have been better, you can see Times Square from outside the hotel and Central Park was only minutes away. Great diner across the road & hotel breakfast was unlimited with a great range of hot & cold choices. This hotel was the cherry on the cake of our brilliant holiday.

Reviews.Title: “I miss the Westin!!!”
Reviews.Author: ROA2OBX
Reviews.Content: Maybe I'm spoiled, typically when we travel to NYC we stay at the Westin. however, someone else in my family made these arrangements and cost was a big issue with several people in our group. The proximity to Central Park is the only thing it had going for it. The front desk had a 4pm check-in..VERY FIRM. I have a hard time believing EVERY ROOM was occupied and that they ALL wouldn't be ready until 4?? To add insult to insult, they would gladly hold our bags for $4/bag. Since we had 5 rooms booked, we quickly learned, that some had "extras" like coffeemakers and some didn't. The hotel was rundown and noisy. The restaurant/bar was very over-priced...even by NYC hotel standards. We were there for a family vacation, and did not let the hotel detract from our time together, but I will NEVER stay there again, nor would I recommend, there are several other "economical" choices in Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: FGO
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excelent, five minute walk from central park and times square and right next to the subway. The reception was always crawded so the attention was not very good. The rooms are big and comfortable but the bathroom had no heat so we literally froze everytime we entered. The day we left, we had to check out in the morning but since our flight left at night they offered us a place to store our luggage while we waited. After a couple of hours we went to pick it up, and surprise!! they charged us per hour per bag. Nobody said anything to us before and we ended up paying a considerable amount of money. I would only recomend this hotel for the location

Reviews.Title: “Location great, hotel okay”
Reviews.Author: CaperMac
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in early March. Check-in is at 4:00, but we arrived at 2:00. We had booked a "Concierge King" - according to the website, they are on floors 18-25 and have better views. We were told a king wasn't ready, but we could have a double queen right away if we wanted. No problem, we said we'd wait. We were told to try again in an hour. We did, and a 2nd clerk told us our room wasn't ready; try again at 4:00. We returned at 4:00, were served by a different clerk again who gave us our key, and then we got to our room to find we had been placed in a double queen! Back to the lobby we went; we were told the hotel was full, sorry for the confusion, and were given a regular King room on the 10th floor and had a view of a brick wall. Oh well. Our room was clean, the bed comfortable, the housekeeping staff very nice. Our room was in need of a some maintenance; the hairdryer was off the wall, one outlet was off the wall, one of the lamps was really hard to turn on and off, and the clock radio didn't work at all. Cosmetic things, mostly, but a little disappointing that they would be left like that. Considering I got the room for $118 US/night and it included a full buffet breakfast for both of us (which we really enjoyed), I think it was worth it. The location is excellent; Times Square is just a few blocks away (walk within 10 minutes), you can see Central Park from the front of the hotel, and Seventh Avenue is quite lively in the evening. We felt quite safe the entire time. A subway stop is right by the hotel. I can usually overlook the little things, like broken clocks; however, no matter how nice the hotel or good the deal is, when I feel as though I have not received what I booked and/or paid for, it makes it hard to give the hotel a great rating.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed every minute of stay”
Reviews.Author: ScunthorpePhil
Reviews.Content: enjoyed every minute of my four day stay.the hotel was clean ,service excellent,staff very friendly and helpful.the hotel is ideally situated for Times Suare,broadway and central park.close by are shops and dining establishments.Many other points of interest were in easy walking distance.A good all round location.There was no noise disturbance in room.phil &Lorna ,Scunthorpe,UK

Reviews.Title: “Through the snow to an amazing vacation.”
Reviews.Author: travelingwhilbury
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to spend much time elaborating on the location of the Park Central. It is in the middle of everything that you could possibly want to see. However, I want to talk about the amazing staff that we encountered at Park Central. We were scheduled to stay there from March 2 to March 5 which we nearly missed because of the storms raging the eastern states. We ended up driving to Boston (original flight was scheduled out of Bangor), flying out of there, and still making it for our first night in NYC. After hearing about our adventure, especially as it was the first vacation my boyfriend and I were taking together, the lady at the front desk upgraded our room to one with a better view. She didn't have to, and we didn't ask, but we were so happy that she was kind enough to think of that. If you can ask for a specific room, I highly recommend Rm 1805. She upgraded us to a room where we could look left and see Central Park, and look right to see Times Square. Amazing. Both of us know where we are going to stay the next time we go to New York- Park Central!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: dwn_ryan41
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was clean, the staff was polite and friendly. The location was very convenient. Very affordable as well.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!!!”
Reviews.Author: HURRICANEPhilly
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Central for 2 nights - Sunday and Monday. Check in was easy, staff was nice. Hotel was full of groups but nice and clean. The hotel is older which is evident in the halls. The room was bigger than expected. Very clean. Bathroom was big and clean. Nice ammennities. I was really happy. We had a double, double room. I will stay here again. It is perfect location across from Carnegie Hall and a block and a half from Letterman studios. Just a couple block from Times Square. Nice bar and nice restuarant in the lobby as well.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every min”
Reviews.Author: LynnWaterfordIre
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from staying in the Park Central hotel for 6 nights with my parents, this is my third time in New york and i would def go back and stay in this hotel it was perfect in everyway. When we arrived our room wasnt ready but we knew this might happen as it states this on their website that check in is frm 4pm so we just went next door to have a coffee in starbucks. When we got to our room it was perfect 2 nice size beds ,plasma tv, lovely clean bathroom coffee making facilites it was just perfect. Location was even better when you step out of the front door and turn to your right times square was hitting us in the face, we were only a 5 mins walk from there and if u turned left you were right into central park it was just perfect. We stayed on the breakfast package which saved us a fortune, you can have whatever you like from a hot breakfast to cereals, fruit, pastries, waffles, and juices. We also ate in the restaurant for dinner twice and both times the food was fantastic. There is nothing in this hotel that i could fault, the staff were very friendly and would help you out if you needed any info from sightseeing to eating out. If your looking for a central hotel thats always busy with people coming and going this is the perfect hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Location, good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BECOM
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as we were told it was centrally located and it definatrly was; there was a subway on the corner to take you to the upper or lower ides, and more importantly it was less than 2 minutes walk from Central Park and as you leave the hotel Carnegie Hall faces you to to your right is Time Square within a 5 minute walk. I would definately rate this hotel for its location, price and uitability for those people wanting to be able to walk to the main tourist attractions. The hotel itself wa clean enough and the room serviced every day to a high standard, when we go back to new york next year for a 5 day trip we will book this hotel. On a balanced review though I must admit that there was no tea/cofee facilities in the rooms nor the hotel, and thus you had to buy your own. However ther is a stand outside elling decent enough cofee and tea for $1.30 and a whole wealth eateries around the hotel to explore - I would recomend Fluffys for a breakfast bagel, and the cofee shop next door called something like Carnegie hall Cakes sold the worlds best cheesecake, even if it is $12 a slice with tax! on the subjec of tax New York it a city where a different tax is levied on everything so please ceck, and if you go to the big department stores go to te buest service area and get your tax free card to ensre you dont pa the taxes! All in all New York is a great place to stay and if you want a hotel with a great location and an affordable price Park Central is worth stying at if you do not plan to hang around the hotel and want to actually enjoy New York!

Reviews.Title: “Best Weekend Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Jason G
Reviews.Content: My now fiance and I spent a weekend at Park Central and it was incredible. We got an amazing deal through their own website which was nearly 50% of what they typically charge.For the best rate check their website. The hotel is in probably the best location in NYC 2 blocks south from Central Park and approximately 7-10 blocks north of Times Square and then another 2-4 blocks from Rockefeller Center. The rooms were just big enough and were very clean. I would recommend this for anyone it was a great place to stay and very affordable especially in NYC! It was a truly unforgettable weekend especially because we got engaged in Central Park ...I'll never forget it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: momnrs
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Stepped out of elevator on 5th floor and cigarette smell strong in hall and room even though room non-smoking.Changed rooms cause room not very clean. Got to 2nd room on the 6th floor no cigarette smell but it was not ready. Left our bags in closet and came back hours later. Room ready but carpet not vacuumed well and small blood stains on carpet. Bathroom clean but smelled sour. Too exhausted to change again so wore shoes and avoided stain. Bed comfortable with nice linens. Large flat screen T.V. Street view recommended. On check-out left bags for a few hours and it cost 3.75 per bag. For check-in leaving bags 1.50 per bag. Room service ends 10pm. Elevators very slow. All in all location made it worth the stay. Subway across the street. Theaters and Times square close but not too close. Good cafe for coffee and pastries etc .next door. Felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Bet”
Reviews.Author: dfctrip
Reviews.Content: This is the second time in 6 months my family has spent a brief sojourn at this hotel. As others have noted, the location is excellent as the hotel is truly "central" to all Manhattan has to offer. Walk to Central Park, Times Square, Columbus Circle, Rockefeller Center. Hop the subway just outside the door to anywhere in NYC. During both our first and second stays, the staff was very friendly and accommodating. On our first visit, my daughter left her music player in the room (we discovered after checking out) and we were pleased that Hotel Security was able to retrieve this valuable item. On our second visit, a mistake was made and the room we were assigned already had guests in it. For the trouble, we were given 2 full complimentary breakfasts for the next day. We found our King bedded room to be more spacious than one with 2 doubles, but both rooms had ample living space and were CLEAN. Housekeeping did a fine job. Further, the hotel is quiet! We never experienced hallway or street noise. For both of our stays, we had a wonderful rate through an internet site of less that $150 per night. For this price, we would happily return to the Park Central as our NYC home.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, clean rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelCumbrian
