Reviews.Content: Comfortable beds, clean rooms and very helpful staff made our stay most enjoyable. The hotel is in a great location - 400 metres from Central Park, across the road from Carnegie Hall and a twelve minute walk from Times Square. There is a tour bus stop twenty feet away where you can get a blue bus to take you on a downtown, hop on/hop off tour taking in all the major sites such as Empire State, Statue of Liberty, Rockefeller Centre and more. Don't eat breakfast in the hotel though, it is very expensive and there are plenty of cheaper places to eat an excellent breakfast within 100 metres (we ate at the Parisienne which was good value). There are dedicated machines in reception for checking in for your flights home and the guest desk will print off your boarding passes. the only downside for us was the noisy room cleaning staff in the mornings. They chatted loudly in the corridors from early on. Otherwise an excellent value-for-money hotel and would definitely stay there again. My 16 year old daughter thought it was excellent as it was within 50 metres of an Ugg boot store.

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent”
Reviews.Author: Polokildare
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week. We found the staff very helpful the room cleaned daily. The location is perfect for sightseeing, shopping and Broadwayb shows. Breakfast was noy included in our deal and we thought it was alittle expensive but a great selection of food. the bar was lovely for a nightcap. We will certainly use this hotel when we visit New York again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location and great hotel for city break”
Reviews.Author: V1X86
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through expedia.com and was unsure of the hotel due to reviews on trip advisor. Arrived at the hotel at night and was greated by the amazing lights and sights of times sqaure which is just about 5 blocks from the hotel. Upon arriving at the room on the 11 floor we were amazed by the size of the room and also the size of the bed! Had no problems with any house keeping always clean when we arrived back at the hotel in the evening after a long day walking around New York. Enjoyed every day in this hotel and can not wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my time here”
Reviews.Author: littlemonks1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location,5 mjns from time square and 2 mins from central park.The staff was friendly and helpfull.The bar staff and restaurant staff are great would do anything for you. The room was big with a big flat tv (GREAT). The room service was great they was in our room everyday. I found the lifts where ok at times but they can get busy around about checking in time 4PM. I would go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No problems....Fantastic stay, would recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: Boog77
Reviews.Content: I have no idea why this hotel has received bad reviews. Service was fantastic and friendly at all times. Room was extremely spacious and clean and there were no problems with housekeeping. I am also confused regarding all the negative comments about the lifts! Never waited more than 15-20 seconds for a lift and we were there for a week. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay, albeit a bit basic”
Reviews.Author: LondonCatfish
Reviews.Content: Having read recent reviews I think we may have been lucky. We were warned that hotel rooms in NY were small, but we were pleasantly suprised as it was a good size. We got a kingsize bed, which was lovely and comfortable and the room was clean and quite. The facilities in the room are basic, e.g no coffee/tea making facilities, poor toiletries (we had 2 conditioners and 2 body wash. The shampoo arrived on the 3rd day, after we'd bought some) and the hairdryer is very dated and cuts out when it gets hot, so bring your own. But really, these were very minor things and overall we enjoyed staying in the room. We never experienced rudeness from the staff but then again, we didn't have many dealings with them. The breakfast was expensive so we avoided it, but we ate there one evening and opted for their set menu for the night which was a lot cheaper than chosing from the menu. We had steak for the main course which was the best steak we've eaten, especially as it would have been the cheap cut. We tried to do the same thing at a very popular and recommended Rosie O'gradys restaurant along the road and it was terrible. If you want a hotel that is in a good location and you only want it to get a good comfortable nights sleep, then we'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Buko
Reviews.Content: As previously stated in other reviews House Keeping is very hit and miss. We had two rooms one of which did not have the bed made after the first night. The toilet was not clean and had evidence of the previous occupants left in it!! The bath was dirty. The shower gels etc were not re-newed. IF YOUR A NON SMOKER DO NOT HAVE A ROOM ON THE 5TH FLOOR. The reason being, it appears, is that half of this floor is reserved for smokers and with the air con system non smoking rooms ARE affected. When we left all clothing had to be washed due to smoke smell. The corridors on this floor stink of smoke. We did not eat at the hotel but looking at their prices they are comparable with what we were paying out and about. You pay for the location which is superb. The bed we had was comfy and the room was warm. No in room tea or coffee making facilities, which we are used to in the UK. If your used to used to catching buses you'll love this place as you wait ages for a lift and then two come together. Would stay there again due to location.

Reviews.Title: “All about location”
Reviews.Author: chasethecheese
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Park Central. We thought our room was a decent size for a King in Manhatten, definately comapred to what you get in Europe. We had a chair and a desk and a large flatscreen television. We did not have a remote though and couldn't be bothered enquiring about one. Everything seemed clean (except for the pair of undies under the bed) and the bed was so soft - better than home. The bathroom was functional, but the staff seemed to have trouble replacing the shower products, as we ended up woth 4 body lotions, so I suggest taking your own. There is an ice machine on each floor (no fridge in room) and a drinks vendor, but wasn't working. The elevators here are terrible, out of the 4 available maybe 2 were working. Sometimes it could take 5 minutes to get one from your floor. From the lobby they have a silly system whereby you press your floor and get told which one to go to - ignore this and just get in the next one available. The bar/restaurant attached is expensive ($9 for a bottle of Bud) and the bar makes final call at midnight. The concierge office was quite helpful for us. This hotel is all about price and location. we originally booked about August 08 for about $135 a night, but realising a week before we left the price was only $100, we cancelled (allowable free up until day before) and rebooked at the new price - a saving of about $200. I think I overheard the price if you were to show up on the day was still only $109. Dont forget to add all the taxes to these prices (and for NY accomodation there are a lot). The location is on 7th between 55th and 56th Streets. Upon leaving the front door - looking right you can see the ball they drop in times square on New Years Eve on 43rd St, and looking left 3 blocks away is Central Park where the horse and carriage rides go from (The south end is close to the ice skating too). Across the road is Carnegie Hall and on the next block is the "worlds best" Carnegie Deli where many famous people are pictured and they sell a club sandwich with a pound of meat for about $22. We would have gone but the queue was always very long when we were in the area. The closest subway station is next door, but if you walk 2 blocks south to 53rd St the E line subway goes towards JFK airport (change at the stop before Jamaica and follow signs for Airtrain). The Airtrain is $5 and the subway $2 - takes just over an hour and very cheap. If you have heavy luggage there are stairs at 53rd st station though. There is also a stop for the Citysights Hop on/off bus 2 blocks north which we did, and other local buses I assume. Overall I think the hotel is set-up purely as a base for holiday makers as the city has so much more to offer, but for the price and location there isn't too much to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, shame about the check-in staff”
Reviews.Author: Ldnlad25
Reviews.Content: Booked our trip through Expedia at, what I consider a good rate for the area (£170 for 2 nights). We arrived at the hotel and must admit the hotel is very well presented from the outside. My only main negative experience we received was the front desk. At check-in we were greeted by a very rude member of staff who said our request of a king room, as booked, would not be humoured and we would have to have a twin. I was very angry at this...why would I want twin beds when we are on a romantic weekend!?! The member of staff said room type is never guaranteed and therefore we will have to have a twin. I was not having any of it, and pointed out we had booked a double and we would not accept a twin under any circumstances... After much huffing from the member of staff he said he would get a double room cleaned and that we would have to wait two hours or a room. I'd like to point out that we were checking in at 7pm! He said we could leave our bags but it would be $3.50 for the two bags. We did this reluctantly and went for a quick look around Times Square which is literally 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Went back to the hotel at 9pm and was checked into our double room with no aggravation. Noted that the person who had served us originally was no longer at the desk (thank goodness as my blood had boiled at his rudeness). Got to the room and I was very pleasantly surprised at the size of the room. Bed was huge and very comfy and the bathroom was clean and had everything you need. As mentioned before on reviews, this hotel meets a 3* room standard so as long as your not expecting anything else you'll be fine. Ice machine and drinks machine just outside the room but noticed no noises from people using them. TV was good, plenty of channels to keep you entertained should you need it. Never ate in the hotel but from what I could see it seemed a rip-off ($25.00 each for breakfast). Go somewhere else and eat there. The bar is small but very nicely appointed. Lots of candles and really warm and cosy. Bar staff very nice and they make a great Long Island Ice Tea (if you don't mind $36 for 2 drinks). Concierge were very helpful with any questions we had. Room was cleaned to a good standard and have no complaints there. Check out was easy and quick. So, overall, as long as you don't get the bad service form the check-in staff I think you'll have a good experience of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating”
Reviews.Author: ILoveLouey
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD: Location, price (hard to beat $100/night in Manhattan!), stylish rooms. THE BAD: Crowded lobby, unfriendly & sparse staff, low standards, slow & disfunctional elevators, bad housekeeping. -We were assigned two rooms before our final room which upon entering discovered they hadn't received housekeeping from the previous guests. -Typical to always see a line of guests in the lobby waiting to be helped at the front desk. Front desk was always understaffed. -Tipped housekeeping $10/day (trying to avoid neglect read about in previous reviews), and STILL didn't get crap. Looked like it was up to whoever was cleaning that day which things got done. -Heard horror stories about elevators every day from other guests. Also experienced problems ourselves. *Read all the bad reviews before I went but still wanted to take advantage of the cheap rate. I really thought I'd get lucky and not experience what I read about. No such luck. I really did experience what other reviewers complained about. Pretty bad.

Reviews.Title: “good location but noisy and rude”
Reviews.Author: flop25
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 9 nights, On the day we arrived we had to change room because it was dirty and some of the things in the room were broken (eg: safebox) It was a very very noisy hotel, And after staying for 10 days we had to pay $ 4 for each bag we left just for about 2 hours until we went to the airport!!!! Some of the people at the front desk were specially rude. The location is amazing, and the rooms are confortable.

Reviews.Title: “Where did everyone else stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: JSB52
Reviews.Content: Went to NYC for a birthday trip with my girlfriend 23rd -28th Jan. As has been said many times before the absolute best feature of this hotel is its location. Five minutes from central park, 5 minutes from Broadway/Time Square, 5 minutes from main midtown shopping on 6th/5th Ave and subway stations right outside the hotel. We got a very good deal through an online travel site (flights+hotel for £1100 total). This good price is why after we read some not so good reviews on tripadvisor we didn’t mind that much. After all you get what you pay for. On arrival the hotel seemed nice and modern, if dark in the reception. Checking in was no problem around 5pm and the room was fine. Exactly what I would expect from a 3 STAR hotel. Nothing wonderful, but just good quality adequate furnishings and decor. Admittedly we never ate at the hotel (but why would you in New York!) The cafe Europa and the little deli that made its own bread a couple of blocks in the direction of central park were great for a simple breakfast and there’s plenty of other dinners/restaurants nearby to sample. We never had any problems with rude staff and found all our questions/requests answered/met to a standard we were happy with. Checking out was easy and quick and we were offered a hotel taxi to JFK. This was a good idea. JFK to Manhattan is a flat fare $45 plus tolls (~$55 including tip) The trip back to JFK is metered not a flat fare so the chances of the meter ticking over while we sat in NYC traffic would add to the cost. The hotel SUV was spacious, comfortable and at $60 flat fare- value for money. Park Central is not the Plaza or the Ritz, it’s a normal 3-star hotel and if your willing to take it as that and not expect 4 star services and features then its a great place to base a trip to New York City. After all you get what you pay for, like it or lump it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and would go back!!”
Reviews.Author: James_Ellis86
Reviews.Content: I went to new york on the 5th nov 2008 and stayed at the park central hotel on 7th av and 56th st. we arrived in newark airport at 12 noon so when we got to are hotel we was very tired. as we pulled up to the hotel there was a porter waiting to get or bags from us. we arrived at the hotel about 1.30pm and not soposed to get cheaked in to our room till 4 pm, because we was very tired from a 8 hour flight we decided to ask can we check in early. the staff was very understanding and found us a room that was availble and checked us in straight away. when we got to our room we decided to go asllep for a little bit to get over the flight. At about 7.30pm my girlfriend woke me up to a loud siren going off, at first i thought it was the safe of something and it went off so i went back asleep, next thing i knew it was going off again so i decided to go out into the corridor to see what was going on, when i opened the door the whole corridor was full of smoke and had a very bad burning smell. next thing we knew the whole of the hotel was evacuated because there was a fire on our floor. we was all in the lobby for about 3 hours and then we got let back to our rooms after about 16 fire trucks and 60 firefighters solved the problem, bad start but from then the hotel was great and when we arranged to get taken to the airport from the hotel staff there was a limousine waiting for us which put a great end to an amazing trip to new york.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: dcgirlinnyc
Reviews.Content: We used to live in NY and came back for a weekend to see friends. The Park Central has a good location, and offered a decent rate. That's about the extent of the good. When we arrived, the front desk clerk, Angela, was incredibly rude. We were early, and she told us a room was ready. About 10 seconds later, she said that one of her fellow clerks had just booked it, so it wasn't. ...OK. Strangely disorganized. Then, she said she could check us in early. I asked how that would help (as in, if the room wasn't ready, what would it matter? simply curious, not rude at all) and she barked, "I'm TRYING to help you!" She then insisted that I remove my ID from my wallet, though I was struggling to get it out, because she HAD to have it on the desk next to her rather than look at it through the plastic window. Doesn't seem like a big deal, but I've stayed at a lot of hotels, and it was odd. We were guests, and she treated us like our presence was a massive inconvenience. A woman we spoke to later, whose name I didn't get, also needed to see ID but didn't seem to care that it was in my wallet. We went to drop off our bags since we were going out for the afternoon and the room wasn't ready, and were told we had to pay to have them held, though we were guests at the hotel. As my husband said ... it's just "chintzy." It just seems like they go out of their way to nickel-and-dime the guests. The room was fine. No coffee maker, tiny shower, no extra blankets, etc. Completely bare-bones. The elevators creaked - loudly - all day and night. Also, as other reviewers have stated, a 10-minute wait for them is more common than not. When I entered the hotel one day, someone was stuck in the elevator and maintenance was trying to get her out. A few other things. As we were waiting for the elevator (as usual), two employees were arguing loudly right next to us. Just very unprofessional in front of paying guests. The soda machine didn't work. Many of these things wouldn't be a big deal on their own, but combined, they just left a bad taste in our mouths. If you're so excited about NYC that all you care about is a good location, stay here. If you'd like to be treated humanely in a place that doesn't seem to be in disrepair, don't. We'd never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect Location...”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedExplorer
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8th Jan - 12th Jan 2009 This Hotel is the best location possible for anyone visitng New York for the first time. We went for a week to celebrate my birthday and it was just fantastic the city is amazing. The staff were friendly, the room was a good size & clean, we had read reviews of the bathroom lighting being poor but we were on the 12th floor and had absolutley no complaints on this hotel. Its just 2 blocks up from Time Square and 2 blocks down from Central Park, there are plenty of Subway stations within a few minutes walk of the hotel. We recommend you eat at as Patis & Vendo in the Meatpacking distrcit. (DO NOT EAT AT KITTICHAI, they gave me food poisoning and offered me free lunch as compensation, very odd - why would you eat where you got ill??) This hotel is excellent and a reasonable rate for the great location. We will be sure to stay here again on our next visit to New York!

Reviews.Title: “great location and price”
Reviews.Author: cliff1788
Reviews.Content: Wife and I just returned from a weekend trip to Park Central. The purpose of the trip was to celebrate a friends birthday. 10 couples stayed at PCNY. After reading some reviews I was nervous. the planning phase of the trip was rocky as the rates we were quoted changed 3 times.The second time we never received a confirmation so we had to rebook...at another rate. The service during the booking phase was far below par for any hotel. When we checked in we were told that we had 2 seperate reservations....both at different rates. We took the cheaper one and the guy behind the counter was nice about it. The room itself was small but cozy. Bedding was good and the maid service was prompt. The location of the hotel is its best feature. The mid town address is really close to everything. It was always easy to get a cab and there are great places to eat very close to the hotel. There is also a Duane Reed (SP??) Drug store about a block away so we stocked up on Diet Coke and water at the store rather than pay $6 for a diet coke in the restaurant. Our floor did have a vending machine but it did not work. My stay was pleasant but I did see some things that I must warn about. First off...the waitress in the bar was horribly rude. apparently you cannot take a cup of coffe or a bottle of water into the bar area or she will be fired...or so she said in a sharp tone. The concierge was less than friendly but it think she was over worked. One day I left the hotel at 8 am and she gave me quick directions. When I returned that evening around 6 she was still working. This hotel looked like it was popular with large groups. The groups really kept the concierge very busy. Fortunately we traveled with people who were familiar with the city so we did not really need the concierge services. If you will need Concierge services be VERY aware that this may become an issue for you. The elevator comments you may have read are factual. The room temprature comments are factual...but we found the outdated AC/Heating system was OK to control. And last...our room 2027 had no view but it was VERY quiet. We were happy with this trade off. Overall I would give this place a 6.5 out of 10. I would stay here again for what we paid...which was $169/night the first time we booked...then it went to $98 per night...and the final price was about $112 per night. Next time we will probably spend a little more $$ and try another place.

Reviews.Title: “Missing Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: TVEXEC
Reviews.Content: Park Central NY is in an ideal location, just steps from Times Square, Central Park, and so much more. Other than the location, there's not much going for it. During our visit, no one welcomed us to the hotel, the doorman and bell captain were nowhere to be found, and the front desk clerk was disinterested. It was a quiet time in NY, given the economy, weather, and all -- so we would have expected a warm welcome. But hospitality doesn't seem to be a strong suit here. Rooms are adequate, though noisy (room-to-room and hallway noise is considerable). Rooms and bathrooms were clean. But the lack of attention to guests was astounding. With just a little bit of attention to guest relations, this hotel could be a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: karlgco
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights in early January for business. The room was booked by a colleague and I was honestly horrified when I saw the room rate...I figured we were staying in a dump for that rate. :'} But, this hotel is a favorite of some of our traveling companions and was highly recommeded. For the money, I can't imagine a better choce. As others have noted, the location is phenomenal. The room is small for other cities, but perfectly expected for NYC. It is certainly not a luxury selection, but it is comfortable and clean. I spent a good amount of time in the room working and I wasn't overly crowded. I didn't bother with the restaurant as there are so many great choices for all your meals around the hotel. Seems like a shame to eat hotel food when in NYC. The only minor complaint was that housekeeping didn't do such a great job the first day. No soap, floor had not been vaccuumed, coffee maker left dirty and un-emptied, no privacy hanger left in room. I called their customer service line and politely explained. The next service was much better. Sure, the elevators are slow and crowded, but I have experienced this in other older hotels. I had a room on the 25th floor, so even when I had to wait, I always got a spot on the hotel. Felt sorry for folks on lower floors with their luggage trying to get down. Make sure you get a room on the top floors or consider checking out very early and checking your bags if the wait is too much of an inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Average with confused staff”
Reviews.Author: olliePhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: We selected an "all-in-one" package deal to include breakfast, free self parking and 30% discount at the hotel bar. The accomodations, food were fine. The location is great. The hotel is very centrally located close to everything you want to see as a tourist. The hotel staff had no idea about the promotion package which we found on their website and we were repeatedly asked/challenged about the specifics of our package. I luckily printed out a detailed confirmation page whenever I booked it online because I had to present thepage to staff at least four times and they made 2 copies of it while we there. It got a little ridiculous. However, the deal was great and made the stay extrmely affordable. Reccommend printing out the confirmation sheet with the details of your package or you will likely not receive all that you signed up for.

Reviews.Title: “What A Nightmare...”
Reviews.Author: ConnecticutTravels
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a nice hotel located centrally in New York City, close to Central Park, Columbus Circle, and a subway line. Park Central seemed to be a perfect match to my needs, and with an advertised online price of $99, how could you not love that, right? I had read reviews on Hotels.com and although some thought that the rooms were a bit small, everyone reviewing kept raving about the location, and the value for the price. Well, none of that matters when the reservation you've made is not honored. Upon arriving at the front desk around 2pm on a Friday afternoon, the front desk clerk asked me to step out of line and walked me down the hallway to the manager's desk where there were two men and a woman waiting in front of me. What we were all being told is that there was a problem with the hotel's website when the reservation was made and that the hotel was oversold by 80 rooms. They had made arrangements for us at another hotel in the city (The Carlton on Madison Avenue - a BEAUTIFUL hotel, but certainly NOT anywhere near the locations listed above that were central to our trip), but after parking in a garage next to Park Central, the hotel only offered us $20 to get our vehicle out of the garage and NO transportation to The Carlton. The attitude of the employees of Park Central seemed to indicate that this was not out of the ordinary for this hotel, and although apologies were offered for our inconvenience, I think you can understand how disappointed we were to not be staying where we had a reservation, but also to not be notified that there was a problem BEFORE our arrival. The hotel had both my cell phone number and Email address and no attempt to contact me prior to my arrival had been made. I would gladly have driven to The Carlton instead, but to park in a garage in Manhattan and only be offered the $20 to get the car out (what we would have been charged for our half hour at the garage) is completely unacceptable. I wish I could give you details about the room as Park Central looked to be an older yet beautiful hotel, but we never got to see the room. When you're staying at a better hotel while on a trip for pleasure, I think that the hotel's service is every bit as important as its physical attrbutes, but when a hotel can't live up to its end of the bargain, the very least a hotel can do is to own up to its mistake, Park Central failed to do this.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central - A Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: PosseSF
Reviews.Content: My buddy & I spent 6 hrs. @ our local coffee house reviewing hotels on various sites for our trip to NYC. My friend & I booked a 6-day stay (12/17-12/22) at the Park Central; many reviews were great, other were hate, but we'd give it a shot. We arrived, we're greeted by Saleem, a friendly counter clerk. He was fast, polite & answered all our questions. We got to our room (#1029), (2) double-beds, facing the dreaded center core of the bldg. (no view which is often the norm in NY from what I'm told) & the faceplate on the closet safe had been torn off; so couldn't use the safe, which we needed. I called & spoke to a rep, requesting another room due to the safe issue; she said there weren't any. My friend called & spoke to a man who understood the problem, he patched us thru to Customer Manager. My friend explained having to use the Concierge safe was impractical. The CM said they did have another room; come down to the desk. We did & Wa-lah, Saleem had us in another room (#1119) in a New York minute. We get to our new room; again double beds, slightly larger with a view of the city, a fridge & a safe that worked. We discovered the TV did not work. We called & in 5 minutes a maintenance rep showed up & fixed the problem in a jiffy; back plug was out of the set. Each day our room was cleaned & all our questions were answered by the staff. They were all polite to us. I needed to print some itinerary stuff & they promptly directed us to the Business Center. We'd leave our room and the housekeepers were all smiles and wished a good day. The one draw back is the new elevator system; you enter your floor on a keypad & it assigns an elevator. One problem, it doesn't ask the # in your party, so as folks arrive to the elevators, everyone is assigned the same one. You'd have 20 folks to one elevator which doesn't work out well. We had one overloaded and it ground it's way to the lobby. They are still working the kinks on this. As we reached the lobby one morning, there were some suits standing & chatting; turns out the elevator company. Having experience in Risk Management I later contacted the hotel on my return home and spoke to the manager who works with the elevator service. I identified some flaws in the system; that while it was great to push your floor and be assigned a particular car, everyone was being assigned the same car, out of 4 elevators. Additionally, the same keypad is out in the front lobby, allowing bored kids to push buttons, or adults to push their floor, but then be side tracked and not use the elevator. Once a floor is picked on the keypad, it automatically lights up the button in the elevator. So, if many folks don't show up, the remaining passengers are left to stop on floors where no one is getting off. Since the system doesn't ask for # of passengers in your group, the Hotel is overloading the elevator. From a Risk Management point of view, were they prepared to be sued when one elevator, being overweight, snaps free or just shuts down trapping folks. You could hear a pin drop. The rep actually heard what I said, took notes and asked if it was okay to contact me for follow up questions or thoughts. Hey, sure, why not. The Park Central is not the Ritz Carlton, which I have stayed in other cities, even here in SF, and was not impressed. Now, the InterContinental impresses me anytime. But anyway, The Park Central is and older hotel, but I found it clean, remodeled on our floors, the Business Center, Gym area and others. The lobby was nice and truly everyone was pleasant to us and accommodated us quickly. Don't eat at the hotel restaurant; THE LINE IS JUST TOO LONG FOR AVERAGE FOOD. Go over to the Brooklyn Diner or Europa down the block, great food and good prices. Another tip I tell all; TIP YOUR HOUSEKEEPER DAILY. Don't assume you have the same housekeeper each day. Many folks tip the last day or when they pay. You're assuming the HK getting all the tip on the last day will share or even if that HK was the one that cleaned your room all week. Plus you assume the Hotel will pass the money along to housekeeping. I was given this tip years ago and it has resulted in; returning in the evening with the bed turned down and chocolates on my pillow, larger towels, a bath robe, better toiletries, extra blanket, flowers on the table, and my belongings always stayed put. I even once found my dirty clothes laundered. This trip, we tipped each day, and we'd return to Thank You notes, wishing us well, thanking us for our generosity & with God Bless, and we got newer larger bath towels (though not necessary as we opted for the clean choice; same linens for stay to reduce water use) These folks don't get paid well and they do a lot, so return the favor and ensure your HK get's their tip. All in all, it was a nice stay at the Park Central. I would recommend it as it's close to everything, clean, polite staff, etc.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mjayBoston
Reviews.Content: I was able to book only one night at this hotel and that was enough for me. Luckily I got a special rate (half off) on the price of $280 but I was disappointed with my stay and would never have paid full price. We went to NYC to see the Xmas decorations and this hotel seemed to be a good deal because breakfast was included free of charge. However, it's a few blocks away from Times Square but only 3 blocks from Central Park. The hotel lobby was pretty and spacious but there was always a long line at the front desk. The clerk did mention that we needed to use the machines around the lobby to find which elevator to get on to our floor. The hotel room was okay but seemed shabby. There was no frig, no microwave, no extra blankets and only 2 tiny bottles of shampoo & lotion. We only had 3 bath towels between the 2 of us and no washcloth or handtowel. The bed was comfortable though, there were extra fluffy pillows, and an alarm clock. We woke up the next morning to the fire alarm blaring and 5 firetrucks pulling up in front of the hotel (false alarm). The breakfast was in their cafe and had a variety of food but they "accidentially" charged me for my breakfast because they had a "glitch" in their computer. Their buffet breakfast charge was $61 for 2 people! Unbelievable! They then wanted to charge me $5 to print out my reservation on their computer as my proof of the free breakfast. I refused and they were able to "waive" the charge. I usually don't check out because of the lines at the front desk but this time I did via the phone and went down to the desk to get my receipt and there was the charge for breakfast again! I finally had to speak to management to get the charge reversed. So here's hoping that charge doesn't just magically appear again on my credit card. I would definitely recommend checking your bill before leaving. I realize that this hotel is in the heart of the city but for the price, this hotel was nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & Room But Too Crowded”
Reviews.Author: Janeptown
Reviews.Content: The price was reasonable for NYC and prime location. The room was comfortable and well equipped. We were disappointed because support services were overwhelmed by the guests. The 'free' breakfast is a big draw but the wait for dining is 30 minutes or more in a line snaking thru the lobby. The restaurant serves about 60 people but there are 945 rooms in the hotel!!! The elevators wait to get up to your room is fine. But, coming down the wait for an elevator is at least 10 minutes and often 15-20 minutes. Several packed elevators stop, but there is no room for more guests. We walked down 15 flights several times. We were also annoyed to pay for bag storage on the day we checked out. The hotel provides voucher for early check-ins but not on checkout days.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: jules736
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at much better quality hotels than Park Central, and paid less. A cold, dark room with a continuous draught coming through the window made it unbearable to sleep on that side of the bed. The hotel is clearly unable to cope with the amount of people staying there. Our first morning we foolishly queued for an hour for breakfast only to find food had run out and orange juice was watered down. Real bargain for $30 each, eh?The restaurant needs to be quadruple its current size to cope with demand. There was a battered old hoover left outside our door for the duration of the stay; ironic considering the room had clearly not been shown a hoover or a duster for some time. I wrote my name in the dust on the tv screen. In the city that never sleeps, room service finishes at 10pm at Park Central. On the plus side, great cardio-vascular workout every day rather than endure the 15 minute wait for the lift. Blocked toilet and lights that worked intermittently. Don't be fooled by the flash lobby area. Dire.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: jessicanorris21
Reviews.Content: My Dad booked us to stay at the park central hotel over the weekend of 28th November for my 18th Birthday. We arrived to what appeared to be a very classy hotel in a superb location right next to central park and we were not let down by what we found inside either. The foyer looked beautiful with all the festive decorations and the staff on the door were very welcoming. We arrived rather early because of the flight timings but this was not a problem as the lady on reception was happy to check us in. I must say unfortunately i cannot remember the name of the lady on reception that helped us with our check in but she was extremely helpful throughout our stay. We were given a choice of rooms which was excellent as the first room that we were shown was not exactly what we wanted (it was our first time to the big apple so we wanted a good view out the window) and the receptionist was more than happy to give us another room higher up which was a superb room! It meant waiting a little bit of waiting around for the room to be cleaned but we were more than happy to shop for a few hours :) Overall the hotel was very accomodating and we really enjoyed our stay, thankyou to all of the staff that made my birthday weekend very special! tourist information was also very helpful to us as we were new to the subway.

Reviews.Title: “You Would Be Surprised”
Reviews.Author: jjstives
Reviews.Content: For a very good hotel in New York City during the pre-Christmas week, this was a really great deal. I booked this through Hot Wire and was concerned when I read some less than great reviews, but got inside info from my brother who said he had stayed there before and it was fine. After hoofing the 20 blocks up 7th Avenue in Christmas gawker pedestrian traffic and near freezing weather, I was happy just to get inside. The lobby was splendid by most NYC hotel standards and check in for a prepaid room was fast and the reception cordial. I took the elevator up to the 25th floor after having to get out of the car and find the code that allows you to pick your floor and then an assigned car. No big deal, but reception missed telling me about this. I encountered other mystified travelers who had the same problem. As I put my key into the door, I heard a woman's voice inside the room sasy: "Who's dat?" I said: "the guest assigned to this room," and went in to find two maids goofing off in the easy chairs. They said they were "just finishing up the room," but they clearly didn't expect me. The rest of the 2 night stay went fine. The room was as good or better than ones I have found in major chain hotels at three times the Hotwire price. Flatscreen TV, coffee maker, nice king bed with linens that fit, plenty of new towels, marble top on bathroom sink, clean, new shower curtain, plenty of hot water and not a bad view either. The key here is that at $109 a night, plus tax and fees, the hotel is in a great location: a few blocks from Central Park and 59th Street, reasonable walk to Grand Central and Penn Station, plenty of nearby delis and restaurants and overall, a great place to stay. Great deal if you can get it. I would love to stay there again, but I'll bet I don't find this rate again!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at the Park Central!”
Reviews.Author: GirlsfromJAX
Reviews.Content: Second time ok! Had our adjoining rooms as requested. House keeping needs some serious help....dirty glasses remained in room until we took them out ourselves....found some items behind the dresser...you could see when going from room to room....that no one should have had to see....again....house keeping! But none the less....a great place to stay. Location is just above the N, Q , R, W line....making it very easy to get around.....staff always gracious and friendly.....baggage check no problem $1.50 per bag....not bad if you have to pay! Would stay again...but would prefer housekeeping doing a better job!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place for the money”
Reviews.Author: niceone60
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel through Hotel Club and got a great price per night....$161. The room was clean and good sized for NYC. The staff was helpful on check in, but not so helpful the next morning. They do run their desk staff ragged which I think is the reason for the snippy attitude that morning. The bed was comfortable, but the heating/AC unit was terrible. The room was too hot and I couldn't get the cool air to work to cool it down. Made sleeping a bit difficult in such a hot room. Loved the flat screen TV. I would recommend avoiding the lounge as drink prices are outrageous! $14 for a cocktail is just a bit too pricey for my liking. The smell when entering the lobby is a bit offensive, not even sure what the smell was. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: travel4funAlabama
Reviews.Content: The Park Central is a nice place to stay. I just returned from a girls weekend trip.The location is great, the staff was very friendly,we had no problems.The rooms were a little small but from what I hear this is normal in NYC.Location is walking distance to all major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Dust Mites?”
Reviews.Author: stephanie_cate
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Central for nearly a week on business. I booked the room at a fairly good discount directly from the hotel website and I wasn't expecting anything fancy, just a decent place to sleep. I had a rather bad experience: First off, I needed to extend my stay an extra night and when I asked about the possibility, the front desk staff was rude and said that there was absolutely no availability. However, upon checking the HOTEL'S OWN WEBSITE, it appeared there were many rooms available. I booked directly online and then went back to the front desk with the reservation and asked to keep the same room. They did not apologize for the mistake and it took a long 10 minutes of persuasion just to be able to keep the same room. Clearly, this hotel has some major organizational and service problems. Secondly, the power went out during the last day of my stay and the staff was quite rude and unhelpful about resolving or explaining the problem. They were strict on check out times despite the fact that it was impossible to see or take a hot shower. Finally, I have never been allergic to anything but after staying a few nights in this hotel, I had to go the emergency room because of a severe allergic reaction caused by something I came in contact with in this hotel, the doctor said it was most likely dust mites. I called the hotel and asked for explanation and once again they were rude and unhelpful, someone just transferred me to security. I called back many times with no resolve; it was clear that this hotel has too many organizational problems to be of good service to its guests. I would not reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “simply the most bad mannered staff i've ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: Pauliof
Reviews.Content: simply the most bad mannered staff i've ever encountered, with the exception of the two nice chaps working at the front door.. overpriced, rude, bad mannered uncaring staff, avoid at all costs...

Reviews.Title: “Very bad hotel, NO service and not clean!”
Reviews.Author: dabje
Reviews.Content: We have vistited NY for the NYC marathon, and stayed for a week. Unfortunatly we stayed in the Park Central Hotel. The rooms were terribel, they were dirty, and the bathrooms even more. The bathrooms, hade lots of stains, nailclippings (disgusting) and mold shower curtains. Beyons that lots of dust, and i believe they last vaccumed the room about 3 months ago. The managemnet and the reception employees, were extremely impolite. Not willing to provide any service, and they were very arogant. In addition to this, the lobby was teribly busy, wioth l;ots of people, not belonging there. There was no security and no-one seems to care about safety of any other guest related issues. The elevators, were througout the whole week in maintance, therfore there were very long waits (upto 15 minutes). We will never go back to this hotel! The only nice thing about this hotel, is the location, as it is 2 blocks away from the park, and near timessquare!

Reviews.Title: “paying too much for a hotel with so much problems”
Reviews.Author: eronen
Reviews.Content: Although I've reserved a "refurbished" room had several problems: 1. bathroom wasn't clean - drapes were moldy 2. shower tap came out of the wall 3. could only partially transfer the water from the lower tap to the upper one. 4. Elevators - always a problem in this hotel. you can wait for like 8-10 minutes for an elevator if you are in one of the top floors 5. room was just too dark (maybe few lamps were missing)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: IL0veNY2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Central hotel in New York for 5 Nights and loved every second of it. The hotel was incredible...No faults what so ever! The staff were very polite and always willing to help. As for the location well...it was seconds away from Central Park, Times Square & Broadway. Overall, I had the best time of my life and was devasted to be leaving. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: newdeal09
Reviews.Content: I am quite shocked at many of the negative reviews. This is a great hotel - great price, prime location, and large rooms. Our rooms were very clean and huge. Its rare to find NY hotels with large rooms. The rates are incredibly low. The hotel is quite. This is an above average NY hotel. This hotel's room are bigger than some of the NY 5 star hotels. We checked in early both times. Our first stay we left our bags without charge and second stay checked out late- 3pm! No additional charge. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel. In fact, we loved the hotel so much after our first stay the week of October 20th that we returned.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own light bulbs”
Reviews.Author: DCtraveler5712
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights and couldn't wait to check out. The first room I got had mold in the bathroom, torn wall paper, broken flickering bathroom lights, only a sheer curtain covering the window so the people in the building across from me were in plain view (and I assume they could see me too), and was very noisy due to the street. After numerous complaints was finally given another room. Within minutes of being re-assigned a room another very embarrassed couple walked into my room as I was packing to move to the next room. The hotel could not give me 3 minutes to pack my bags? The next room had stains on the walls and was so dark I could barely see (bring your own lamp if you need to apply make-up for a night on the town). After talking to other guests I learned that all the rooms are quite dark. There was no cell phone reception so used the hotel phone to make a 4 minute call home and was charged $10. Was awoken in the middle of the night by vacuuming in the hall.

Reviews.Title: “Fix the elevators!”
Reviews.Author: Parks_and_plays
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before, because nearby hotels with the same type of comfortable rooms cost a lot more. The location is terrific. But the elevators are a chronic problem and have gotten worse. This weekend, only one or sometimes two of the elevators were working. During the morning "rush," an elevator took many minutes to come at all. It was stopping, full, at every floor, where exasperated people stood with luggage and nowhere to go. The only real way to get down was to use the service elevators, and streams of people did that. The management had posted no signs about the service outage, no apologies, no explanations, no nothing. My advice: Stay here -- the price is right -- but if you need to use the elevators from 7-10 a.m., scout out the service elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun in amazing NYC”
Reviews.Author: ZAH26
Reviews.Content: we stayed at hotel park central for 8 nights with our two teenage daughters. we booked a 'superior double double' sleeps four. what we recieved was a dark, small and narrow room with two queen size beds. not even the kids fitted the beds, parents slept almost beside the bed... food was not tested, because of nearby delis, which were excellent. elevators were like snails: we had to wait for 15 mins for the only elevator which worked out of four. heating worked only if the house keeping decided doing so. employees at front desk were very friendly and kind even if workload was big. the location of the hotel is superb, several steps from times sq, moma, 5th ave or from central park. door keepers are also very kind to aid in transfer to jfk. internet was only available in the room but with extremely low bps rate for 14 dollars per day. bathroom was dark and old fashioned. water came in the shower very slow, toilet must have been pumped several times. one small bottle of shower gel was offered every day for 4 persons. absolutely no fun for teenage kids in the hotel building. nice fitness room available. hotel lobby is elegant, building old fashioned but nice, cleaning and maintanance could be better. all employees were very friendly. overall opinion: price for value is poor (price is for new york average)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, some of the front desk staff should be politer”
Reviews.Author: YITZHAKSFARAD
Reviews.Content: We booked our room for six nights. Upon our arrival, we were told the hotel was booked out, and were assigned a higher category room (355) with no charge. The following day, we were put up in an excellent one (2512). However, due to the heavy rain in NYC three days after, we had two leaks in the room, which prevented us from sleeping there and we were relocated. On that occasion, in room 1833. Staff was very sympathetic and helped us a lot. The biggest and most outrageous situation, after all this ordeal was the moment we checked out. I literally strove to explain to the receptionist (code number '17') what happened over our stay with a view at making sure that no extra charges would be made to us. To our surprise, she told me she did not want to hear about it, handed me the bill for revision. No thanks, no nothing after paying almost $2000. I know this is just a bad attitude from one person, but needless to say that, sometimes, the last impression is what counts and this, unfortunately, may make all the hotel good souvenirs fade away. I leave up to the readers to judge by themselves what happened to us.

Reviews.Title: “So-So”
Reviews.Author: hughby
Reviews.Content: The lobby was very nice. The people were, for the most part, pretty nice. The actual room, left a little to be desired. The bathroom was pretty gross. Mold in the shower. We had no air conditioning and the room was very hot and musty. There were several switch plates and electrical outlets that were either broken or did not work at all. The food in the restaraunt was not good at all! Pop machine was broken on our floor.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: anon8888
Reviews.Content: this was my second time staying at the park central. I went to check in and was told check in is at 4 pm. I offered to pay more and they said there was nothing available. ok. i understand, i was given a ticket to check my bags. I then found out i have to pay!!! what hotel do you have to pay to check your bags?! I chose to hold on to my computer, as that was an extra bag and asked for a password for wifi. Nope, there is no wifi available, you can only use their computers in the business room. As for the rooms itself they are bland, need to be updated, and a little dirty in appearance. DONT STAY here. there are many other GOOD hotels in nyc that offer good customer service and are much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: irish616
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with 2 other friends for a girly week of sight seeing, eating & drinking. The hotel suprised us when we got there as we got a great deal on the room so we weren't expecting the "ritz". The first impression was great. We couldn't check in straight away so we went into the bar. We were met by an incredibly friendly Irish barman who was from our neck of the woods. He gave us few tips on travelling around the city and what to see. When checked in, we found the room (2double beds) to be spacious and clean. The hotel is in great location, not too busy/noisy yet close enough by foot to see great attractions - especially Central Park. We had one issue with the room that was dealt with immediatly and with great efficiency. I didn't have too much dealings with the hotel staff other than checking in/out but they were friendly enough - they did their job!! There's nice places to eat close to the hotel (the restaurant in hotel is slightly expensive), and subway is only short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BenP
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 day stay this last weekend. We were more than thrilled with this hotel. The room was very nice and the staff were very cordial. We stood in line for check-in for about 3 minutes, no kidding. The room was recentaly remodeled. The windows did keep out the noise and the A/C worked very well, yes in Oct. Housekeeping did a great job and had the room made up by 10:00 every morning. The only complaint I had was the overpriced hotel bar. Don't go there, there are lots of bars within a block. The location is a great plus.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel on a budget--will use again”
Reviews.Author: Mooma
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Park Central Hotel for 5 nights and overall was very pleased with it. It is an older hotel and could use some cosmetic work but other than that had no major complaints. I was on the 16th floor in a corner room (1621) with two double beds. The room was average sized and the bathroom was quite small, but everything was clean (and no bugs of any description). The wallpaper was a bit tired and the bathroom sink was cracked but apart from that the room was in good repair. I had read the reports of slow elevators so was braced for the worst but apart from one morning around 10 a.m. when we had to wait about 3 minutes for an elevator, we did not wait more than 30 seconds. The staff was friendly and helpful. This is not a "honeymoon hotel" nor a luxury property. The real draw of Park Central is its fantastic location. It is situated diagonally across from Carnegie Hall on Seventh Ave, a 10-15 minute walk from 5th Ave., Central Park, Times Square, and Restaurant Row. It is almost impossible to find a hotel as centrally located for under $400 per night. I would note that the hotel bar is nothing special and quite overpriced. We did not eat at the restaurant nor did we get to go to the Russian Tea Room which is steps away. We did have breakfast at the Carnegie Deli. I had the largest omelet I've ever seen and my friend had a bagel which came with what amounted to half a package of cream cheese. We also had breakfast at the Park Cafe, which was very good and less expensive (but smaller portions) and Fluffy's (the cheapest option, with plastic cutlery and paper plates). We had dinner one night at Molyvos, a Greek restaurant across the street, but I would not recommend it. The food was vastly overpriced and the portions were small and just not that good.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced - Rude Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: KittyAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in September on business. When I checked in at the front desk, I specifically reminded the clerk-who lacked any form of personality- that I did not want a room by the elevators (due to noise from people getting on / off.) When I got to my room, I was directly across from the elevator! I called down to the front desk, and they said there were no more rooms of my type (King Bed) available. I selected the concierge rate for $50 more per night as I thought there would be some sort of evening snack / morning breakfast. I called the front desk again to inquire, and was told there was no lounge. When I asked what was included in the concierge rate, they said I would be able to have a free breakfast in the restaurant at the hotel. Well, the breakfast buffet (included eggs, cereal, pastries, juice, coffee, bacon, etc.), was only $18. Therefore, they completely overcharged for the "concierge" aspect of the room! I agree with others that it is in a decent location, but I will never stay here again due to feeling like I was completely ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central Hotel - stay away!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkunhappy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights this month, and had to change rooms twice! There were cochroaches in one room, mold in the next and the staff were not friendly, only one person named George. We would never recommend this hotel and won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Getting a bit tired of this tired looking hotel”
Reviews.Author: Houziwang
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Park Central on business. This is probably my 5th and last stay at the hotel. Although its location is very good the hotel is starting to feel its age and I think this is true of the staff also. It's always been a good port of call for me in New York as it's easy for me to find my bearings from there however I think It's time to try somewhere else. Check in is always a problem. You either have to join a lengthy queue or, if there is no queue, the receptionist goes walkabout so you still end up queuing. This is not an exaggeration, 5 check-ins and I've never experienced anything else. The reception, bar and restaurant areas are all quite nicely laid out which only serves as a disappointment when you find your room. Leaky ceilings in the bathroom are not uncommon and the decor and furnishings are tired. The windows don't keep out any noise or draughts whatsoever. The internet connection needs a bit of DIY to get it working (basically disconnect the modem glued to the table and plug your laptop straight into the wall socket) and at $15 a night for connection it's pretty pricey compared with other hotels. The bar in the hotel is also quite pricey. More than one customer complained about their bill in the space of one hour when I was there. Across the street past the Wellington and the Deli is an Irish Bar (conveniently called 'Irish Bar'). This is always a friendly place, it's pretty small and plays a good cross section of music. For snacks on the go there's the 55th street deli, to sit down I'd recommend the deli directly opposite called Benash. There's also the famous Carnegie Deli (next to the 55th street deli) which has signed photos of loads of famous people (presidents etc) on its walls. How this place got its reputation I don't know as the food was nothing special although the portions were extremely large. All in all, the hotel's in a good location and if you just use it as a base and don't expect a high level of comfort then it's ideal although there are cheaper hotels of similar standard in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: nosupper
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here early Oct 08 for four nights. As has already been stated its in a good location if you want to be in a touristy location close to Times Square and Central Park and on top of a tube stop for connections to lower Manhattan. It was one of the more reasonably priced (in NY anyway!) hotels we found and for our money we got a good sized room, which was clean, quiet and comfortable. All the lifts worked and the only complaint I had was that there was no way of controlling the room temp. However, if this hotel is in your budget I would recommend it - trust me you wont see much of it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SabrinaC54
Reviews.Content: My husband and i went to NYC for our anniversary Aug 21-26th and stayed at the park central. What a great hotel. 1st of all if you are going to NYC to relax think again. . We were in our room to sleep and thats about it. The beds were great. Nice and firm we stayed in a standard room. RM 1404. and we were very pleased. It was very clean, no mold like i read in some reviews. It did have a slight smokey smell (even though we were in a non smoking room) but nothing overbearing. We never at at the hotel. Cafe Metro one block north or south is a GREAT breakfast place. The location of this hotel is what makes it FABULOUS! exit the hotel and go left.... there is central park . Exit the hotel and go right there is times square. The subway is right infront as well. for the price you couldnt beat the park central. If and when we return to NYC we will most likely go back unless we stay in a different part of town. the front desk was very helpful and the concierge helped us with reservations. the only downfall is that sometimes you had to wait 10-15 to be able to speak to them. all in all it was a great resting pleace when you finally did rest, in the city that never sleeps. oh and a good tip.... we booked through the hotel since they say they offer the lowest price guarenteed. we didnt find a lower price through anyone else.... and i looked hard.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gir2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the park central for one week in early september and were happy with our choice of hotel. The hotel was recommended by a friend who had been there a few weeks earkly. I was quite worried as we had seen some bad reviews, and although it was my first time in New york, i certainly dont have low standards in the type of hotel i stay in so we were satisfied with the park central hotel. We did pay a high enough price for staying a week, but we had looked around a bit and most others seemed to be along the same price and i would have rathered stay somewhere a friend had recommended and get somewhere decent. When we arrived we checked in no problem. The original room we were put in was slightly cramped but nicely furnished and most importantly it was clean. There was a slight glitch as the air conditioning was broken, but we phoned the front desk and they immediately gave us the room next door, which was a lot more spacious but had the same amount of furniture in it, just a different layout. Both the rooms and bathrooms were clean and we never had any problems with how the housekeeping was done. The only problem we encountered during our stay was with they key card for the room. On 3 seperate occasions they key stopped working. The second time it happened i was advised this was because of the fact that i kept it in the same bag as my cell phone and credit card, which i found hard to believe considering most people staying in NYC are going to be carrying either both or one or the other, and also this had never happened in any other hotel ive stayed in! Also, on the third occasion it stopped working we had kept the key in the bottom of a suitcase while we went on an overnight trip, so it hadnt been near either a phone or a credit card! Apart from this minor problem i would certainly recommend the hotel. From other reviews maybe it is a bit hit and miss, but if you are on a sightseeing holiday (i have no idea for business trips!) i think its a great place to stay. The hotel is 2 mins from central park and a 5 min walk from times square. Its just off broadway and there is a subway station right beside it. We found the staff very friendly and helpful, especially for organising tickets to places and tours. I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Outinthemiddaysun
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a business trip at the end of August 2008. The hotel is extremely well located for Central Park, Times Square and all the midtown attractions. Loads of restaurants nearby, plus health food shops, all night pharmacies and tourist tat. There is plenty of space out front for the cabs to pull in. I didn't see any porters to help you with your bags the whole time I was there, so be prepared to carry them yourself. The lobby is large, but it needed to be as it was heaving with people the whole time, both independent travellers and big tour groups. Check-in was straighforward, if a bit lengthy - the staff seemed to be on a go-slow, but they were reasonably friendly for a New York hotel. My colleagues got standard rooms, which were fine - not huge, but also not a bad size for central NY. I arrived quite late due to delayed flights, and got upgraded to a suite, which was positively palatial. There were 3 rooms: a sitting room with sofas, and plasma screen, plus fridge, coffee machine and microwave. Then an internal lobby with writing desk, leading to the enormous bedroom, with windows on 2 sides, and marvellous views of the surrounding skyscrapers. Another TV in here for watching in bed. Finally, the bathroom, which was really very nice. It obviously wasn't especially new, but it was in excellent condition, with clean grouting, nice marble surfaces, and a big bathtub / shower over, with plenty of fluffy towels. The aircon worked well - I blasted it during the day to keep the room cool, then turned it down at night as it was quite noisy. The windows were double glazed, and kept out almost all the traffic noise - you would never know you were in central NY, it's the first hotel in NY I've ever slept in and not needed earplugs. We did have breakfast in the hotel one day - it was nice, with plenty of variety, but the cost was extortionate. I'd recommend going just down the road for pancakes and eggs instead. Check out was also slow, as you have to nip in between the big groups, but again, the staff were friendly and helpful. My only niggle was with the lifts - they were quite slow, and there didn't quite seem to be enough of them, so it was a few minutes wait around breakfast time to go up and down. But this was a minor issue, and I thought the rest of the hotel was fine. It isn't perhaps as nice as some other nearby hotels, but it was much cheaper, and to be honest, I prefer that. For the price we paid, I'd definitely use it again, because the location is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, TERRIBLE hotel”
Reviews.Author: moveleft
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for four nights while on a business trip to NYC. When you have to wait almost a half hour to check into a Manhattan hotel at 11:30 PM, you know you're not in for a great stay. I am convinced that those who gave this hotel positive reviews either have very low standards or have never stayed anywhere else in NYC. First, the place is no bargain. When room rates start north of $400/night, I expect better than a 30 minute wait, outwardly surly front desk staff and a claim that the room type I selected (and they confirmed, with a late check in guarantee) was no longer available. After refusing to accept a lesser room (without a reduction in the room rate), the manager (who I requested complete my check-in after the shoddy service from the clerk) suddenly "found" the proper room type for me. Of course, it really didn't matter. While the rooms are a bit larger than the norm for NYC, they are spartan, poorly decorated and not in any way set up for business travel. There are no amenities to speak of, terrible bedding, rough towels and an all around "rough around the edges" feel to all the furnishings. The housekeeping staff could use a refresher course in the fine art of housekeeping. The outdated AC units rattle all night and the curtains never quite close enough to shut out the morning light. Hotel staff runs the gamut from incompetent to indifferent to outright rude. If you need internet access, head to the Starbucks on the corner. The "wi-fi" is so slow that it made me long for the days of dial up...yes, it was that bad. While the location is great, there is nothing about this hotel worth the price. Stay at the nearby Le Parker Meridien of you want a great hotel in the same area. In any other city The Park Central would be called a Days Inn...and that's an insult to Days Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated”
Reviews.Author: Vinegarhill
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated just a five minute walk up from the pandemonium of Time Square so you can pop in an out of the mayhem at will. Its less that that to get the oasis of Central Park. The hotel reception and concierge were very helpful and the bar staff pleasant. Not much I can add re the hotel, its another one that does what is says on the packet, we generally enjoyed the hotel and its location. We also love New York - there is something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Will not go back : (”
Reviews.Author: BensysMama
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Park Central hotel in NYC for 6 days in September. We were quite impressed when we walked into the hotel lobby, but were quickly unimpressed by the front desk guy who acted as though we were bothering him by checking in. out of about 4 front desk workers i spoke to over the duration of our stay, 1 was pleasant. The room did not have a coffee maker or anything extra to make the stay more welcoming. just shampoo and soap, not even a shower cap. but that isn't a big deal, but when you pay $400/night, you think you'd be getting the best of the best..but i guess it is New York after all and it is waaay more expensive. What was a big deal, was our first day of housekeeping, someone went into my suitcase and stole my favorite skirt! i didn't notice until the next morning when i went in to get dressed for the day and realized it was gone. We searched every inch of the room for it. We contacted security who was really friendly and said that this does happen. I had my suitcase closed, but not zipped...so be sure to zip and lock it! i've traveled all over the world and stayed at all levels of hotels and never experienced this. we kept the room locked and security ensured that no one would enter our room without a supervisor. we asked that we not have our room serviced again. well the next day not one, but two people tried to enter our room while we were in there! I told front desk who didn't seem to care. In the end all we got was $100 off our $400/night room for a "guest complaint". they wouldn't even comp the one movie we rented on the tv. terrible! barely covers the cost of the item that was stolen. i'm just glad more wasn't taken from me or my mom. On a positive note...Conceirge was AWESOME!!! which we later found out were not employees of the hotel, but a hired company placed in the hotel. they were FANTASTIC!! best service ever! heck i'd go to the hotel just for info! definitely not to stay. Room service was crazy expensive. so we never ate at the hotel so i can't judge the food, but it must be good for that price! I would stay somewhere else next time for sure, because of the theft. the location was pretty good. although i would recommend staying on the other side of Times Square, where you are more central to everything. Good luck in your hotel search!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: edtealdi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a fantastic spot for sightseeing, at a much lower price than the two Sheratons and Hilton nearby. The drawback is it is not nearly as nice. The lobby is nice, even though it does immediately feel like the "tourist storage container" it unfortunately is. Too crammed with people. We had a lower floor room, which was sad and shabby, but very large. We were in NYC to be tourists (it was my girlfriend's first time there), so it was OK as we spent very little time there. Breakfast was not good, the service terrible and the waiting time unacceptable. After the first day, we went to the Sheraton for breakfast every subsequent day. NYC hotel prices are notoriously extortionate, so it seemed like a wise choice to go for the Park Central. I think we did it a bit too much on the cheap, though. I won't be going back: it's worth being ripped off a little bit more to be in a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It Was Okay”
Reviews.Author: Antonia08
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night as a last minute NYC trip. Hotel was nice, clean room, but for a King Size bed very small. The front desk people were very nice & helpful. the only problem I had was when we booked the room we were not advised of the contstruction being done to the face of the hotel. It was a bit noisy during the morning hours. Other then that it was an Ok trip.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: JenReading
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from staying at the Park Central hotel and after reading some of the reviews was a bit worried. We found the hotel to be brilliant, no complaints at all. Lifts were fine, check in and out was fine, air con fine, employees pleasant and helpful and rooms were clean. View was a brick wall, but then we didn't spend much time in the room to worry about that. If you are looking for somewhere to eat there are loads of delis etc, but we did like the food at the maison restaurant (which is if you come out of the hotel turn right). Location is brilliant about 10 min walk to time square and 10 minute walk to central park. We flew into Newark and got on the liberty bus to Port authority which cost $25 each return and then we got a taxi to the hotel which is about $6. I would return there no problem. If you would like more info please contact me.

Reviews.Title: “BAD experience”
Reviews.Author: Sherry08
Reviews.Content: We had booked 2 rooms. Our friends had upgraded to a concierge room which they found out meant they had a coffee maker in the room for an extra $70.00 per night. I am not exaggerating. This was the case. We looked at each other's rooms and discovered that the only difference between the 2 rooms was that the more expensive room was SMALLER, had a coffee maker, and was seven floors higher...which meant absolutely nothing as both rooms looked directly across into other rooms...absolutely no view. The rooms were very small especially the "concierge" one. When we told the staff that we wanted to change the upgraded room to a regular room as they could not possibly believe that this was ok...we were met by blank stares and told they couldn't do anything about it until the other manager came in in the morning...but no matter what we would be charged the higher rate for the first night. This hotel was not at all special and not that clean... so ...frustrated... we told them we were leaving. We went down the street to the Sheraton New York where we stayed in a very nice room for less money than this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Check your bill!”
Reviews.Author: e23_8
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Great location. 2. Quick check-in and check-out. Cons: 1. Air-con was loud and the lid on our control panel was stuck so we couldn't change the temperature. 2. You have to pay when you leave your bags at the concierge - US$3.50 a bag! 3. This is the huge deal-breaker. When I returned home and received my credit card bill, I was charged an extra night's stay which I did not authorise! I emailed the hotel twice in the last 5 days and have yet to receive any form of acknowledgement that they are looking into the matter! I will keep trying and hope to get some resolution!

Reviews.Title: “A great location and a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: auale
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 nights in this hotel during our first trip to NY. As a group of 9 people (3 families with children, from 7 to 9 y.o.) we found the location very good, in the middle of Theater Discrict which means a lot of shops and restaurants always open and 10 minutes wals away from 5th avenue and Central Park. The hotel was very nice and with big rooms. The concierge was nice enough to find all the 3 rooms in the same floor. We were at the 7th, but if you manage find one on higher level to reduce street noises. Breakfast was not included and pretty expensilve (25$ pro people) but there are a lot pf places around where you can have it at a more reasonable price (look for the Au Bon Pain shop that is 3 minutes walk away). The metro station is really under the hotel so it's very useful to get it. Surely we'll come back there in our next trip to NY

Reviews.Title: “No Air Conditioning during the July heat wave!”
Reviews.Author: TX_Julie
Reviews.Content: I went to NYC in early July for a job interview. The company paid for my travel and booked this hotel. When I got there, the room was HOT. It was during the heat wave and so I thought it was just going to take a while to cool off. When I called the front desk, I was told that the air conditioning was broken, but that this wasn't "nearly as bad as yesterday." I tried to make it work, even by opening the windows. It was just miserable. I went downstairs to try and get a refund and waited for over an hour in the angry mob. The manager agreed to refund me, but since it was paid through Travelocity, it would just show up as a refund on this company's credit card, and I still wouldn't have a place to sleep for the night. I asked if they would help me get another room. No. Finally, at about 11:00 and after talking with Travelocity, I decided to stick it out. Then, the general manager from the front desk called me and said that he had issued me a refund already since I wanted to check out, and I would have to repay this or leave. OMG, this was such a hassle! The next day, I had to put on a business suit and panty hose in the sweltering heat (still no a/c) and no, needless to say I did not get the job. I will NEVER ever stay at the Park Central again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: roxipod
Reviews.Content: Aside from a good location, nothing at all to rave about. First of all, they didn't trace our reservation so we were double-charged in the end. Second, they gave us an already-occupied room at first! Other: total absence of help with luggage, broken elevators, rude and unhelpful staff all around, non-existent air con. For us, it was one of the worst value-for-money ratios to date worldwide (we travel very frequently for business and holiday).

Reviews.Title: “Hit or Miss”
Reviews.Author: ConradDC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice. First time got a junior suite on a high floor with a view. The room had been recently renovated at the time and was all I could ask for. Second (and last) time got a cramped, musty, smelly hole on a lower floor looking onto a brick wall. Front desk was overwhelmed and of course unable to help when we requested a change. Frankly the experience was the opposite of the previous visit. Won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ive stayed in in a long while”
Reviews.Author: carinabramley
Reviews.Content: ok, i booked this hotel as it was in a very good deal on a website, and was far too good to turn down. Wasnt until after booking it that i read the reviews and started to worry, it really isnt written up as a great place on here. Boy was i to be surprised! We arrived at 1930 on a thursday evening, walked straight up to the front desk, no Q's and checked in. This took less than 3 minutes.
