Then we were pointed in the direction of the lifts, and within 4 more mins we were in our room, number 738. The lifts had signs up saying apologies for delays but they are renovating them, and i have to say, we didnt wait once for a lift, pushed the button and one arrived pretty much straight away. We soon found that there are a couple of elevator shafts in this hotel and if you have your back to the reception desk, then take the corridoor on the left and follow it round, that lift section is really quick. The room itself was a quad room, 2 large double beds, a bathroom and a huge cupboard. the bathroom was big, a full size bath, big sink and a toilet. It was cleaned daily, as the bath took a little while to drain when having a shower, (approx 3 mins after getting out and tunring the water flow off) and fresh towels put in the room each day, altho they do ask you to reuse them, but if you dont want to, just leave them in a heap and they get changed daily. The comlpimentary toiletries were replenished each day too. There were 2 plug sockets in the bathroom and a hairdryer. Be warned with the hairdryer, if you have anything longer than eye level it will take a while to dry it with this. Mine is shoulder length and very thick, but with the humidity out there it frizzed very quick anyhow, so only used it to dry off the excess water! So nothing wrong with the bathroom. Enter the bedroom. There are no ceiling lights, only stand alone ones, 2 taller ones and 2 table top ones on the bed side table. These created plenty of light. There is a closet in the bedrooms, and to describe the amount of space, i would say you could easily get approx 15 fully grown adults in it! It was huge. As there were 4 of us sharing a room, i actually used it to get changed when the bathroom was being used, and i had more than enough room! There was an ironing board and iron in it, a safe, and two hanging rails with hangers. There were also spare blankets and pillows in there. Perfect. There was a large flat screen tv in our room, and it had a lot of channels, we had no probs finding anything to watch!! There is an ice bucket and glasses on the desk too next to the tv, but no kettle or tea/coffee/biscuits in the room. If you are there on business, there is also another table with chairs there you can use. The air con, a lot of people on here have complained about it, i really dont see why. We were in NYC while outside temps were in the late 30's, and we put it on high while out during the day and when we came in, it was nice and cool, we turned it down a bit while in the room as it became a bit nippy and if you are in the bed next to it, can be a bit blowy! (but as i wasnt in that bed, it really didnt bother me at all!!) The unit itself was located under the window, and certainly done waht it was there to do, cooled the room right down, so no complaints at all about it from me. The beds. they were lovely. The pillows so comfy, i slept nearly as good as i do in my own bed, and if it hadnt been for the other 3 in the room snoring, id have slept better! The sheets were changed every 2 days, and were all lovely and clean, there was a small burn mark, but nothing to complain about as i know that those sheets are done in bulk and can burn slightly when dried if not done properly, and the throw they put over the bed covered it anyway! You cant get under the bed, so im not sure how people have said that they are disgusting, and to be honest, why would you want to look undera bed in a hotel??? It also appeared to be hoovered every day, i didnt once find crumbs or mess on the floor. After all the previous reviews on here, i can understand why someone would be so worried about it, but dont be, this hotel is perfect, and for the price, i was so impressed, i even tipped the maid!!! The staff in the hotel were very kind, we only really interacted with them 3 times. Arrival, which the lady was very pleasant, then to check check out time (12pm, but we managed 1pm at no extra cost) and to actually check out. All the staff we saw were very nice. Our homeward flight wasn't until 2135 on a tuesday evening, so as we had managed to secure a 1pm check out for free, we then stored our bags in their luggage store at $3.50 per bag. The hotel arranged a taxy to take us to JFK later that night and that cost us $65 with a $20 tip on top, which i didnt think too bad as there were 4 of us, and on previous visits to NYC, had paid over $80 in a yellow cab to get to the airport! If you want a late check out, between 12pm and 3pm is a $75 charge and any time after 3pm they charge you a whole days rate, which i think is a little excessive, but thankfully we didnt use it! The lobby of the hotel was very clean and tidy, we sat there for a couple of hours before our flight as we were so tired and worn right out from a very action packed holiday and no one asked us to move or questioned us. There are comfy sofas to sit on and a shop if you want anything. Can not fault this hotel at all, loved it. Please dont worry about staying here, its all you could want and more. We didnt use the internet service, or either of the 2 restaurants that are in it, but they all looked and sounded great! We ate a a few of the nearby delis and cafes. Cafe metro is great for a quick brekkie, and the deli on the corner by the hotel does really good cooked food and lots of little snacks and drinks that you can take back to your room. There is a subway opposite the hotel and a christmas shop! Central park is 3 blocks away, and times square is a 5 minute walk away, you can see it from outside the hotel! There are always taxis waiting outside if you need them, and concierge is there to help at all hours, with special deals on theatre tickets! Would i stay here again, definately, and i would really look forward to it! Any questions, please dont hesitate to ask, but if you have any doubts about this hotel, them put them aside, im a fussy person, and i cant fault it in any way shape or form. The best hotel in a long long time for comfort, cleanliness and location. What more can you ask??????

Reviews.Title: “Renovated rooms but far from..”
Reviews.Author: Rejseprof
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 6 nights at the Park Central Hotel as I had it recommended from a friend. But it did not live up to my expectations. My room was suppose to be newly renovated but that was really difficult to see. The air condition was an old larming machine in the corner and the bath room was really torn down. The room was rather dirty and although I am used to various standard at hotels worldwide I felt that paying close to 300 $ per night you should at least expect a clean room. When complaining at the front desk the reaction from the rather unfriendly personnel was negative and I had to remain in the room. Attemps to improve cleaning seemed to fail or this was just the standard of the hotel! My room was located at 18th floor and since only one levator was in work during that week you had wait for up to 20 minutes to get up or down. The only really positive thing to say about this hotel is the location - close to Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scottyr1977
Reviews.Content: I like many others was nervous when booking my stay at this hotel but my overall experience couldn't be further from it. To put it simply, this hotel is absolutely fine if you come to NYC to hang out and enjoy the city. If you wish to stay at a 5* hotel, then pay it. I took comfort when the Singapore Airlines air hostesses were seen staying there, which being arguably one of the best airlines in the world, says plenty. Overall, I found the rooms had plenty of space with a nice large flat screen TV. The room service was prompt and helpful and the rooms were cleaned everyday. THe only thing I found with it was the strange smell when walking into the lobby - perhaps the type of cleaning agent used, but I got used to it. The hotel prides itself on its service and for the price per night, it is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Most Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mark2Tex
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights at the Park Central and thoroughly enjoyed it. We had checked it out on a previous visit and thought it would fit our needs nicely. The rooms are fairly large for a NYC 3 star hotel. The KSB and pillows were most comfortable and the LCD TV is a bonus. The location is excellent; easy walking to the theatre and shopping districts and subway stops just one block away. We recommend a small restaurant "Parisenne" just 2 blocks north for a very good inexpensive breakfast. It is always interesting reading reviews; some love a place others hate it. While we required minimal interface with the hotel staff , those we talked with were very helpful and friendly. We did not find the elevators to be a problem as some previous reviews. Of course when 20-25 people queue up for an elevator you got to expect to wait a while. But they did not seem slow and they do have signs saying they are upgrading their elevators. Using the hotel web page we got a free night for staying more than 5 nights so the rooms averaged less than $260 a night including taxes which for midtown Manhattan in the summer is a bargain. We would defintiely stay again and since our son now lives in Manhattan, probably will. On a previous visit we stayed at the Salisbury around the corner and also recommend it; it was not available for this trip. It doesn't have the large lobby and restaurant facilities of the PC but the rooms and value are terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: DCTravel10
Reviews.Content: I'm glad I did not read the reviews here before we went... Overall, we had a few problems but the location and price could not have been better for a weekend in July. PROS: 1. Location, location, location 2. Price 3. Clean CONS: 1. No valet upon arrival as advertised. We stood in front of the hotel for ~5-10 minutes then gave up and found a garage on our own. A bell hop popped out once but seemed uninterested in why we were standing in front of the hotel. 2. The room smelled musty and the AC seemed to only be blowing air in from outside (the fan). Luckily it cooled off at night. We asked to have someone look at the AC several times - even called the operator, front desk and the "complaint" line multiple times late at night, upon our return to the room, but we couldn't get anyone to pick up the phone. Uopn check out the front desk said that at 10:30 the previous night engineering 'fixed' the AC. We couldn't tell it was fixed but they gave us a discount on the price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, great location”
Reviews.Author: westtexgeo
Reviews.Content: Like many of the previous reviews, I'd agree that location is the biggest plus for this hotel, but all things considered, it was also a pretty good value...for NYC. The location speaks for itself...3 blocks from Central Park, a few blocks from Times Square and the Broadway theaters and a subway station right outside the door. Many shops, delis and restaurants within a block or two. The room size, though average by national standards, was above average for NYC with more than enough room for our base-of-operations. The room was clean and well appointed...no complaints. The only problem was that the AC, though on 'high', barely kept the room comfortable, but to be honest, others in our party did not have the same problem. The fitness center got raves from my wife for being clean and equipped with new machines. Personally, I never made it down to the fitness center, but did walk over to the Park for some very pleasant early-morning jogs. I booked through the hotel's website and got a discount for staying more than 3 nights, which made the average rate very competitive. All in all, I would certainly consider the Park Central for our next trip to Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for an average hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Getawaygirlok
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned from a week in this hotel. I'll be honest after reading the latest reviews about this hotel I was TERRIFIED to stay at Park Central. I even looked into changing hotels the day before we left. Ultimately, I am glad that I didn't spend more money to stay somewhere else. We have stayed in NYC several times all in different hotels. We have stayed in one that was worse and stayed in better. I am a bargain vacation planner and I got a good deal on this hotel through Travelocity. If I had to do it again I'd probably try to find somewhere else for a similar price **only if** the location was as good as Park Central. This hotel is average. Our room wasn't as bad as some of the other reviews but it wasn't amazing either. The upside is that it really is in a GREAT location. If you go to NYC to spend time in the hotel I suggest staying somewhere else. If you want to go to NYC to be out and about in the city then this might be the place for you. The room provides an OK bed and decent size bathroom and room. Apparently, we were lucky and didn't have trouble with the elevators or maid service. The hotel served its purpose for our trip: somewhere to sleep, shower and get ready. I never felt uncomfortable or unsafe. If you can get this hotel for a good price I'd say go for it...if not then try to find another hotel. We had good luck w/ the staff as well. We only had one employee that was rude to us. She was at the concierge desk and got VERY SNIPPY when I asked about tours at Ground Zero. It obviously hit a nerve with her. Her response was offensive to us because the 9/11 attacks effected all of us not just New Yorkers. She told me there are "no tours and nothing to see there" she told us that it was "just a construction site". I thought it was disgraceful for her to say that because that site will never be 'just a construction site". FYI: There are walking tours provided through the 9/11 museum called "Tribute" . It is located on the south side of the site and we were VERY glad that we took the time to go!

Reviews.Title: “Relatively Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Becky139
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel a couple weeks ago with my family (Mom and Sister). Here are the pros and cons: Pros: GREAT location (could walk to Times Square, Central Park, etc), friendly staff, attractive rooms and lobby Cons: Room smelled old and musty, WAY overpriced for what you get, small room Overall, it was a nice stay. I'm not sure if I would reconmend it, but the location enough is reason to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, would definately stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Ordena
Reviews.Content: I too had some trepedations after some of the reviews here, so we were very pleasantly surprised and relieved to have a different experience than some have had, so much so, not only do we recommend this hotel, but we would book to stay there again. I would like to let you know why..... We arrived earlier than anticipated and bell hops were outside ready to help with luggage, but without any small bills to tip, we declined, no probs, we were not hassled. The entrance foyer and lounge was spotless and smelled so good! - over the weeks holiday we realised they must have had some kind of aroma pumped through the air con. The air con worked fine. Yes the staff were a bit frosty, but this isn't Disneyland, its a busy hotel, they were polite and professional, just didn't have wall to wall grins, but thats ok. The downside was the 4 pm check in, but we knew that in advance, and they have a secure area for luggage so fine, we went out! We booked two rooms with twin doubles for our family, we have two 16 year old boys, and the rooms were spotlessly clean, fresh towels, modern, full air con and a safe. No probs. Beds made, bathrooms cleaned every day. The rooms were a good size and great TV channels too. The bathrooms were also a good size and stock contantly stocked up daily. Yes, the 4 lifts only have two working in each bank of 4, and the strange thing is that the apology sign is screwed to the wall...a bit permanent we thought, but don't let this spoil your holiday. We took the stairs down and the lifts up, just you wait a bit longer sometimes. Not as long as the hour..oh yes...an hour, just to go down in the lift from the top of the Empire State! so the hotel we got used to, far less a wait I can tell you. We asked for a fan for our boys room and within 30 minutes we had it. The drinks machine took my money and no coke, within 15 minutes a drink was delivered to me to replace it. The hotel is in a brilliant spot, near to subway, cabs, central park, etc., but thank the lord a walking distance away from the noisy and smelly Times Square. Stay here and don't let slow lifts ruin your holiday. We had a fantastic time and would definately book this hotel again, it was good value for money. You want 5 star? book it and pay the price. Any problem we had or query was quickly answered and found the staff helpful. The security staff there are fantastic, all the staff very smart and professional. If you don't like your room, tell them and they will do everything to move you if they can, we know, we saw it happen. This is a good hotel. Their website does not do them justice, search the net and find other photos and reviews, its a big hotel, with a nice modern interior. Many we passed in NY made us glad we had booked at this hotel. Enjoy, go bite the apple.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bette08
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I've just returned from a week long stay at this hotel. We were slightly apprehensive about staying here having read some of the recent reviews, however our fears were unfounded! We throughyly enjoyed outrwhole stay. The room was clean, spacious, quiet and well air conditioned. The staff were friendly and helpful whenever we had an enquiry - they were particularly helpful assisting us when our luggage was lost at the airport. Overall I would recommend this hotel to my friends - especially if booking through Expedia. PS I would say if you are planning on going to see a show dont buy tickets at the desk in the hotel as they dont offer reduced tickets and add on a substantial booking fee - there are great deals to be had at the TKTs desk off Time Square or the Tourist information centre in Time Square.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Adamxr1
Reviews.Content: Having read many of the reviews before my wife and I stayed here I was a little concerned at some of the negative reviews. This is usaully not me as I am only interested in the consensus which appeared to be, on the whole it was a good hotel. Here is my balanced and accurate review of the hotel. As others have commented the location of the hotel is perfect, there is a subway right outside the hotel and from there you can get anywhere. Also, as it is on 7th Ave its easy to get a cab. The hotel is within walking distance of most of the sights i.e. Empire State Building, Rockafella centre and as the name suggests very close to Central Park. It also is located near lots of restaurants, deli's and bars. The reception area is immaculate and very smart looking, wer checked in quickly and fine at 4pm, your room may not be ready before then. The room was perfect in size and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept in on my travels. This with the huge flatscreen TV was more than acceptable for what we paid. The bathroom was fine and the maid service was very good too. We were never disturbed by the maids and they were always quick to tidy the room up if we had slept in and gone out later. The a/c was bit old and a bit noisy but really not a big deal as it worked and the room was cool. I did notice the comments about reception staff being rude or 'less than friendly'. Well to be honest people need to get over this and stop being so picky. YES I have been in hotels where the staff are more friendly and YES there was the odd member of staff on the reception who could have been more polite but this is NEW YORK for goodness sake - most people you speak to are very direct and 'to the point' -thats just the way they are in NYC. If they were 'direct' with me I was 'direct' with them. In essence most of the bad comments aimed at reception are clearly down to just two guys who out of a team of 10 people work daily - they just need to cheer up and smile a bit but thats really all there is too it- its no big deal. The rest of the recpetion staff were fine. The hotel is fine, really. Its only a base and a place to shower/sleep for gawd sake and a hotel in NYC and should be nothing more than that in this great city - the less time you spend in your hotel the better- there is too much to see and do to waste time moaning about the hotel. If there was something really bad about this hotel I would have spotted it but I think some people are just too fussy sometimes when writing reviews! The Park Central hotel does have faults if you are picky enough to look for them but if you want a good hotel, thats clean, well positioned and comfortable this place is fine for what you pay. You can pay a lot more if you want the best but whats the point. Again, this hotel is FINE. PS Refuse offers of 'taxi's' from the hotel staff as they are just trying to get you to take an expensive limosine run by the hotel to wherever you want to go. Just insist on a yellow cab and you'll be fine. PPS Best deals I found were through Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Hated hated it!!!”
Reviews.Author: zazou10
Reviews.Content: If you are thinking about staying here do yourself a favor and DON'T. I stayed at this hotel once last year and I remember complaining about the A/C..they had told me back then that it was a temporary thing. When I recently stayed there in June paying around $420.00/night the A/C was practically nonexistent....it was ridiculously hot in the rooms. The staff was not helpful at all and you can see obvious signs wear and tear around the hotel...(ex exposed sockets, peeling wallpaper..). And the icing on the cake was when I saw a happy little cockroach roaming around the room...Even if they gave me a free room I wouldn't stay there..

Reviews.Title: “We were there for ten days, part of it during no air-conditioning.”
Reviews.Author: Billshell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in NY for medical treatments. We had booked the Park Central Hotel off their own website to get the 20% off for staying over 5 nights. The first few nights the air-conditioning wasn't working. We were told several times that it would be fixed soon. I had an IV in my arm, so I went to talk to customer service. They sent a fan up to my room a few hours later. The fan helped a lot, but it still wasn't air-conditioning. The third day we spoke to the manager, who was very polite and being bombarded by several people, including us. I wrote a long letter to her and suggested how they should handle the situation. That night the air was back on. The rest of the stay was great. I don't think it was as dirty as people said. The cleaning ladies were really friendly. They did run out of small towels at times, but there were a lot of people there. We just helped ourselves to the linen closet in the hall and grabbed whatever we needed. A bellhop was also available to take our things upstairs when we got there. He was very friendly also. I didn't encounter anyone being outright rude, but I did feel they should have communicated better right from the start of the air-conditioning problem, and I told them that. After searching for hotels for a long time in NY, you have to expect that you won't get as much for the money as somewhere else. That's just a given. Overall, it was a good experience. The room was a fair size, compared to many others that are incredibly small. I felt the staff was friendly. The restaurant there is way too pricey, as well as the room service. The location is wonderful. It's close to Times Square, but not too close to be uncomfortable with all the noise and crowds. It was so close to Central Park. We also liked that we could walk easily to Columbus Circle where there's a Whole Foods Store in the Time Warner building. We bought some groceries there for lunch to save money. It's also right next to the subway, so it was easy to go anywhere. The only problem is that the city closes some of its entrances on the weekend--that's irritating. The best part was when we checked out. We asked for a later check-out and they let us check out at 3:30 without paying anything extra, probably because of what we had been through with the air-conditioning. They also took off about $400 from our bill. I think when you're faced with a problem in the hotel like that, you need to be persistent, but still controlled. They responded very well to us. In the end, it paid for us to sweat out the three days. The rest of the time was great! We would go there again, but we'd probably call ahead first to see if the air-conditioning is working.

Reviews.Title: “Small - Hot - Rude / thats all”
Reviews.Author: tex99
Reviews.Content: Where do I start. 1. No bellman to assist with 4 peoples luggage 2. Room had no towels on arrival @ 5 pm 3. Bathtub had hair in drain 4. A/C...non operational 5. Rude staff when asked to review problems. 6. No response when conplained over Hotel website after trip. You book it...you can expect the same. I travel 40 weeks out the year, never have had this bad of an exprience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Asian_French_Chick
Reviews.Content: Right next to the subway and very close to all attractions. Rooms are good size for New York. Sound isolation was really good. We were next to the elevator and never heard a "ding" Go to the Starbucks on 56th (less than a block away), the one attached to the hotel is way to inefficient for a busy place. Internet is more than $14/day, pay Tmobile $9.99 at Starbucks Elevator are super slow.

Reviews.Title: “**CAUTIION** STAY AWAY...... DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: InTheBizPro
Reviews.Content: We took a group of 34 college students to perform at Carnegie Hall in mid-June 2008. The entire air conditioning system for the hotel was non-operational. All of the rooms in the hotel were without air conditioning, and simple ventilation was impossible as all room windows were sealed closed and unable to be opened. It was truly a miserable experience. There were several hundred people (performers) in this hotel during this week stay. Some travelers were very fortunate and left for other better hotels in the immediate area. Our groups could not leave due to the number of rooms required to accommodate everyone. The bedroom carpet in the Presidential Suite was soaking wet and was unable to be walked on. After three calls over a four hour period a maintenance worker finally showed-up with a mop instead of a wet-vac. The carpet remained soaked for three days and the smell of wet, soggy & moldy carpet was beginning to become unbearable. Most of the front desk personnel were extremely rude, condescending and belligerent and continually displayed an "I really don't care" attitude. "You want to stay here, then this is the way it's gonna be" Room service dishes and restaurant catering dishes/trash were left in the room for three days without being removed. When the maid was asked about removing them, she stated that it was room service's responsibility to remove the dishes and trash - not hers. A room burglary and theft of jewelry from one of the performer's rooms in this hotel really put a damper on our overall experience. All of these issues were discussed in person with the hotel's Sales Manager- Ms. Pooja Pendse, who promised to adjust our final hotel bill due to all of the above. THIS NEVER HAPPENED !! There are several other similar and/or much nicer hotels for the same money in the immediate area who want your business and are willing to work for and earn it. At this hotel, from the executive management office - to the front desk personnel - to the people who clean your rooms - NO ONE CARES !! CAUTION>>>>>>>> Stay away from this hotel - you will certainly waste your money and most certainly be very disappointed !

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: robgates
Reviews.Content: I booked the Park Central New York after looking at several hotels in midtown Manhattan that were close to Carnegie Hall. I booked a concierge room with a king size bed from Wednesday, June 11, 2008 - Monday, June 16, 2008. From the pictures on the website, the hotel looked comfortable and clean. When I arrived at the hotel, it seemed hot in the lobby but I figured that it was just me because I had been walking with all of my luggage. When I got to the room, I realized that it wasn't me. The air conditioning was out in the room. The fan was on in the air conditioning unit, but it was blowing out air that was room temperature (which was easily 90 degrees). I spoke with the lady at the front desk about the lack of air conditioning in my room and I asked her if I could be moved. She stated that the air conditioning was out in the entire hotel so it would do no good to be moved. I asked her when the air would be fixed and she said that she had no idea. She went on to say that the air had been out for over a week and they are just taking it day-to-day at this point. The temperature in the hotel was the topic of conversation for every guest that I encountered in the elevators and the lobby. People were checking out of this hotel as quickly as they could. Although I was uncomfortable, I tried to make the best of it and see if I could sleep in the room. Due to the high temperature and the fact that there was absolutely no air circulation, I was not able to fall asleep for hours. I lay in bed most of the night sticking to the sheets, tossing and turning in vain to find a cooler spot. By the next morning, I realized that I was not going to be able to stay in this hotel for 4 more days. So, I checked on the Wellington Hotel across the street. They had air conditioning that worked and the rooms were clean and comfortable and they were over $100 less per night than the rooms at the Park Central New York. So, I checked in at the Wellington on Thursday, June 12, 2008 and checked out from the Park Central New York on the same afternoon. When I told the gentleman at the front desk of the Park Central New York that I was checking out due to the air conditioning, he said that he understood. Then, he told me that the hotel would be charging me for my entire reservation with the exception of Sunday night. My original reservation was for Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. I was checking out on Thursday afternoon and the gentleman at the front desk actually said the hotel was going to charge me for 4 nights that I was not sleeping in the hotel. I couldn't believe it. I demanded to speak to the hotel manager and stated that I wasn't going to be paying. The gentleman at the front desk went back to speak with his manager and then came back to tell me that the hotel would not charge me for Friday, Saturday, and Sunday night. However, they were still going to charge me for Wednesday and Thursday night. I still couldn't believe that they were going to charge me for a night that I had not stayed. Then, I saw the rate that they intended to charge me. They were charging me $400/night. When I had booked the room on the website, I had booked a concierge room. The website has a promotion where you get 20% if you stay for 5 or more nights. The total reservation came to $1,700 for 5 nights. I could not understand how the hotel was now charging me $853 for just 2 nights. I told the gentleman at the front desk that I was not even given a concierge room with a king size bed as I had requested in my reservation because one was not available when I checked in at 7:30 PM on Wednesday night. He went back to speak with his manager about my rate and stated that they would take $100 off of my charge for Thursday night. So, my final bill for staying in this hotel for 1 night in a room that was not air conditioned and did not have a king size bed as reserved and was not a concierge room as reserved was $753. This is complete and total highway robbery. I would also like to mention that the wireless Internet in the room I stayed in was not working and neither were 3 out of the 5 lamps in the room. I would also like to mention that the linens on the beds were stained with what looked like dried blood. There was no bellhop to assist us with our luggage when we checked in either. The elevators were extremely slow, but the hotel has signs up that say that they are renovating the elevators. From the dust on those signs, I would say that they have been up for months. After having such a bad experience with the Park Central New York, I contacted my parents and my sister and her husband who were planning to check into the Park Central New York the next day. I told them to cancel their reservations immediately because the hotel had no air conditioning and because of the horrible service. They cancelled their reservations 24 hours before they arrived, but the Park Central New York still charged them for their entire 2-day reservations. My family is now going through the chargeback process with their banks to have these charges reversed. I would like to mention that I checked into the Wellington Hotel across the street from the Park Central New York hotel on Thursday afternoon. The room there was extremely clean and comfortable, my room was larger, had an Italian marble bathroom, a walk-in closet, an incredible view of Times Square and my total bill for a 4 night stay was only $1,052. It is hard to believe that the Park Central New York would act like they did and charge what they did when there is a better hotel that costs less money directly across the street. Frankly, I'm surprised that the Park Central New York hotel is even still in business. My advice to anyone who is planning on staying at the Park Central New York hotel is to stay at the Hotel Wellington. You'll be much more comfortable there and pay less money for your stay and there is absolutely no difference in the geographic location since the hotels are across the street from each other. Please avoid the Park Central New York hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crystalsk8s
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. No air conditioning during a heat wave. Rooms had a fan unit but you could not set the temp and it never blew out cool air. Rooms were dirty and moldy smelling. Mold on ceilings and mirrors. Dirty carpet. One room the bed sheets were not clean. We switched rooms 5 times. One room, the toilet leaked all over the bathroom floor.All hallways smelled of smoke and were very hot. No cold water in vending machines,staff told us to buy water in the gift shop, but the gift shop was out of water too.Saw numerous guest bringing fans up to their rooms.Was told by the staff if we wanted a fan we had to go buy one, just like the other guest. Internet never worked the 5 days we were there. Staff was very rude.Had to ask maid several times for towels,ice bucket liner,glasses, etc...Tried to call every number to get towels, and they never answered the phone.Had to make numerous trips downstairs for things the maid never brought.When I asked why they never answered the phone the manager said they had so many complaints to deal with that they didn't have time to take phone calls.Staff was extremely rude.Slept on cushions on the floor for 4 night because the mattress on the pull out bed in suite was so thin you could feel the metal coils through it, but at least that suite didn't smell of mildew. Tried to change hotels but every thing was book for the 5 days we needed a room. Horrible hotel. Stay at your own risk and call 311 to complain. I think it's a health hazard to not have air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Hot...Hot...Hot”
Reviews.Author: BuffynTexas
Reviews.Content: Where do I start???? First, we were in NYC during the hottest few days in many years-June 7-10. We were there for a graduation ceremony, so we had no choice in the dates. The room was quite nice--to start--but on the second day when it was over 100 outside, we had no air conditioning to speak of, unless, you call the sputtering of luke warm air as a comfort..which for 2 days we were thankful for any air. Then the elevators went on strike along with the air conditioners. Three flights of stairs can be good for you but not in the heat and not when you are 80 years old, like my mom! With the price of food in NYC, it would seem a no brainer that the hotels have a small refrigerator but --nope--no frig. and no microwave--guess the electricity would take away from the air conditioner, plus, people might try to use the frig to cool the room. Oh, we did ask if they had fans available but we were told they had given out all the ones in the hotel BUT we could go buy one and they would reimburse us the cost. As for the other advertised aminities like the hair dryer - it was non-functioning, the light over the shower - nope, showering in the dark made the heat better or at least we claimed it did! Now with all the negative said: the managers and staff were very nice and we know they had no control over the air conditioning problems, plus, they did adjust our bill, which didn't help with the unbearable heat but at least we didn't feel like we were taken for a frightening ride...like the taxi ride from the airport to the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty rooms, broken air conditioning, broken elevators and bad management”
Reviews.Author: RJMLondon
Reviews.Content: We took three rooms at this hotel for a boys weekend in New York in June 2008. Upon checking in, we were told by the front desk that the air conditioning was not working and that “for our convenience” we could buy ourselves a fan and the hotel would reimburse us. The hotel refused to provide us with fans – they expected us to buy them. It was 88 degrees in New York and we had to sleep with the windows and curtains open to make the rooms bearable. This meant we got woken up each dawn by the daylight and the noise of the city outside. Some of us were put in smoking rooms, despite booking non-smoking rooms several months in advance. The corridors and the room stank of cigarettes. All three of our rooms had dirty linen, ranging from cigarette marks in the sheets and pillows, through to disgusting yellow stains on one of the duvets that looked liked someone had thrown a curry over the bed. Several of the elevators were out of service and we had to use the stairs up to the seventh floor. When we complained to the manager, he refused to do anything, saying that the elevators were fine and that getting fans for the rooms “just isn’t going to happen”. He refused a refund or any form of discount. I have never seen a hotel manager less concerned with the wellbeing of his guests. This place relies on its location and tourists for its business. It is clearly not worried about repeat custom. Which is lucky, because we are never going back.

Reviews.Title: “NO AIR CONDITIONING!!! Tried to cancel but they charged me anyway.”
Reviews.Author: nickolai03
Reviews.Content: All the bad reviews you've read are true. You really get the feeling that the staff could give a crap about you or your experience there. I tried to cancel for the following night but since it was 6pm (2 hours past the 4pm cutoff they charged me another $328 for another night). Trying to get to bed at night was awful- the heat was unbearable. Obviously, they didn't do the right thing and let us out of the agreement (since they didn't hold up there end of the bargain) but instead they took advantage of me and many other guests who wanted to go to a hotel that had air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Inonia”
Reviews.Author: inonia
Reviews.Content: Their internal controls are awful - they lost my booking and after 2 months charged 300 USD from my credit card without any authorization for fake booking.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central Ghost Town!”
Reviews.Author: wouldtraveless
Reviews.Content: You mean the Park Central Ghost Town. Lack of employees and the few that were there were no where to be found. Rooms have been remodeled and are quite large for the city, close to 850 square feet, but the air conditioning is horrible and non working. Vintage old wall units never been cleaned. Even in the lobby and common areas. I heard many complain during my short stay. Great location if your not going to be in your room until after midnight. No security anyone could walk into the elevators 24/7. I was price gouged but you can expect it in this tourist central location. Would not go back unless it was in the winter. If you plan on staying dont expect service and you wont find anyone to complain to about it.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: MissouriHuskers
Reviews.Content: First the good: The location is excellent! Park Central is central to some of New York City's most famous locations. It is just a few blocks from Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Ed Sullivan Theatre, Broadway theatres, and Carnegie Hall. In addition, the double-decker sight seeing busses have a pick-up location right outside of the hotel. There is also a subway stop just outside of one of the doors. The area is nice and my husband and I felt completely comfortable walking late at night. The lobby is nice, as are the rooms. The rooms are good sized, by New York City standards, and are tastefully decorated. The bathrooms are plenty big enough. The bad: The elevators are PAINFULLY slow. It seems to be more of a problem when going down than when going up. I have no idea why, but that was our assessment of the situation. HOWEVER, they are supposedly upgrading their elevators and we did see a crew doing what appeared to be some signficant construction. So maybe this situation will rectify itself soon. We were only on the 6th floor, so we often took the stairs down, which really wasn't a big deal. If you plan to use the Internet, plan again. It is expensive, and like the elevators, painfully slow. The ugly, and I mean ugly: When we arrived to the hotel on Saturday, we checked into our room and turned on the air conditoning. When we returned late that night, the room was defintely cooler, but not the frigid cold that you often get when in hotel rooms that are cooled with individual units. We noticed this, but proceeded to bed. When we woke up Sunday, the room felt somewhat cool, but the unit didn't seem to be pumping out cold air. When we returned that night, it was obvious that the air was not working. We called the front desk, who told us that indeed the air was not working and that they were hoping to have the situation resolved soon and asked for our patience. My husband and I understood and dealt with the situation. Needless to say, the next morning, the room was VERY hot, as during our stay New York City was having record heat. We got ready for the day and were confident that all would be resolved when we returned that afternoon in order to freshen up for dinner. No such luck. It was still hot and now humidity was starting to settle in. Again, we inquired and again were told that it was broken, being repaired, but they believed that it would be on when we returned for the evening. We we returned from dinner, still no air. By Tuesday morning when we had only gotten about 2 hours of sleep because of the heat, I demanded that something be done. I talked to a manager named Denis who became loud during our conversation and attracted the attention of others checking in. He told me to call Orbitz and that something would be worked out, but he was pretty rude about it, even though I felt that I was being pretty courteous and polite. We did call Orbitz and they managed to get us $422 refunded, which apparently is the equivalent of 50% off of three nights of our stay. Many people have complained about the staff being rude; however, with the exception of Denis, my husband and I never found this to be the case. We always made it a point to great them by name and ask how they were before starting into our conversation. All in all, because of the location, I would consider staying here again, particulary if I knew that the temperature would be controlled.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central Hotel terrible management”
Reviews.Author: vernette
Reviews.Content: The first night we arrived and came back to hotel, room door ajar, radio blaring and showerhead sitting on side of tub. Asked to be moved and comped. They agreed 2nd and 3rd nights no AC, heat wave 97 degrees. Hotel mgmt "Dennis" never available, no offers or assistance to move you to a new hotel. Lobby full of very angry people. After going through 3 different people and demanding a refund they did so. Also did not comp me on first night as promised, once again had to stand in line with other angry customers to get my bill adjusted. Maid svc awful. No clean linens on bed. Dirty walls. I would have been just as comfortable sleeping on a bench in Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Crap hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zonda1
Reviews.Content: This was the worst experience we have ever had at a hotel. The air conditioning was turned off to do some work. We were told it had broken down and that they were working on it. They did not even offer us water, this came during the heatwave June 7th - 9th. The rooms were not really clean and the blind in the bathroom had mold all over it and the elevators did not always work, its a long walk upstairs when there's a heatwave. We do not recommend this hotel at all. The people on duty at the guest relations desk were not interested in anyones complaints, there were many complaints regarding the A/C and other things.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place. Bad service.”
Reviews.Author: bobotron
Reviews.Content: I got a good deal on this hotel on the Web with airfare, etc. It is in a great location, curb appeal is nice, the lobby and rooms are on par for a descent place in NYC. BUT... The elevators hardly ever worked. Especially coming back down. Luckily we were only on the 4th floor and ended up taking the stairs most of the time to get out. Apparently the "elevator repair" signs have been up for quite a while now. And the $15 a day internet was so painfully slow, I could not even load a single page in less than 5 minutes. I eventually gave up and went to a local pub and hooked into someone's wifi. (I think it was called Rumors? Good pub.) The shower drain was too slow and so the shower would fill up with a few inches of water at every shower. So we asked for a new room. They asked we bring all our luggage back downstairs to storage so we could be "checked out" before we get checked "back in". Well we got the new room 15 minutes later and took all our luggage back up to the same 4th floor. And yes, the shower was still the same problem. We wouldn't have moved if they had just told us that's just the way it is. And in the new room, the air was also not working either. So I guess we were downgraded. So if you are looking for a nice looking hotel in a great location for a fair deal, then maybe this is for you. But if you are staying for more than a couple days and you expect everything to actually work correctly, than I don't think this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience for loyal guest”
Reviews.Author: limric
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here for business for almost five years and have referred several colleagues. In the past two years, the service, cleanliness, and just about everything has deteriorated continually. Because of the terrific location, I have overlooked a lot of bad experiences. My stay on May 22, 2008 put an end to that. I was booked into a horrible, dirty room on the third floor with an adjoining wall to an elevator that wasn't working properly and made a terrible scraping noise each time the elevator was operating. I called the front desk for almost 30 minutes with no one answering the phone. I went downstairs to talk to the manager on duty, who could not have been less interested in my problem and went further to say that since I had been allowed to check in prior to 4:00--I was stuck with that room and I should feel lucky to have it. He insisted there were no other rooms available, even after I went back to my room and checked on the hotel reservation site--there were plenty of rooms and the rate was $50 less than I was paying. I spoke again to the manager, who at this point became belligerent and actually smirked at me! He was clearly enjoying his position of power. I will not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, We would absolutely go back!!”
Reviews.Author: Nate_Melissa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights a couple weeks ago and we loved it. The location was fantastic for our first visit to New York. Our room was clean and good size. I was a little hesistant upon reading all the bad reviews but after staying here I realize most people are just very picky. This is not a 5 star hotel. Alot of people reviewed badly cause the check in time is 4pm, and they got upset that they couldnt check in earlier, that the elevators were slow, or the people were rude. Well you know before going that the check in is 4pm. I found everything to be sufficient and the staff to be polite. The hotel bar was very convenient and John was a great bartender and very friendly. And its New York City, you need to spend very little time in your hotel anyways! We would absolutely go back!!

Reviews.Title: “This is a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Freakzilla316
Reviews.Content: This is the second time i have stayed at this hotel ,and it wont be the last. The guy on the desk was very nice, had a laugh and a joke while checking us in. We was early, it was 2pm, but there was a room ready, he said it was a slightly larger room on the 11th floor, but it was a disabled room with no bath, he said as long as we didn't mind no bath we could have it, we took it. There was no real view, we could just see 7th Ave and the park cafe over the road, nothing much else, but i didn't mind, i'd gone to New York to enjoy the city not the hotel view. The hotel is in a great location, about 3 blocks from Central park, about 6 from Times square, Subway around the corner and there are lots of places to eat near by and lots of shows on your doorstep. we did find the hotel bar a little expensive, but most hotel bars are, this was simply solved by not drinking in there and going somewhere else! There was a nice little Irish bar about 2 blocks away. Overall i enjoyed my stay and will definitely return to this hotel There are 2 other things i;d like to say. First, People moaning about turning up at 1pm and there been no room available...Check in is at 4pm, if a room is available, they will give you one, just like they did me, if no room is ready, just wait, you;ve only paid for the room from 4pm, you can't have it if its not ready! And second ,theres a restaurant near times square called Maxies, me and my girl friend went to it, it was so bad we sent the whole lot back and didn't pay, i have never done this, it was by far the worst meal i have ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: txrelaw
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Central for four nights on my first trip to NYC and would not hesitate to stay there again. The location cannot be beat. It's adjacent to the subway, close to many great dining choices (including the Carnegie Deli and Redeye Grill - yum!) and is within walking distance of Central Park and Columbus Cicle. I enjoyed going for walks around the park knowing that I was in a nice area and that the hotel was close. The rates were very reasonable, and the room was surprisingly spacious and had a comfortable bed and flat screen tv. I enjoyed the restaurant and bar downstairs although they can be pricey. Overall, if you're looking for a convenient place to stay at a good price, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: beachloverami
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying at the Park Central for the second time. This hotel is in a perfect location for New York visitors. There is a subway stop right outside. Many restaurants are within 1 block, it is easy to walk to central park, times square and most theatres. The rooms are quite large for ny standards and the bed and bedding is very comfortable. This time we had an inside room. We really liked it because we heard no street noise. The conceirge desk was much kinder this time around. THe baggae check is helpful and inexpensive. On any return trips to NY we will look at the Park Central first.

Reviews.Title: “CHEAP, CLEAN, LOTS OF PRIVACY AND EXELLENT LOCATION!!”
Reviews.Author: lewlea
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Park Central in January 2008 for 6 days, it was our first trip to New York and we loved every minute of it! The hotel was brilliant for what we needed. It was clean, with a large comfy bed, warm and quiet. The shower had hot water and was immaculate and the towels were fluffy! also room security was good. what else is needed?? Like most people would be, we were worried after reading negative reviews on here. There was really no need to worry. The location of the hotel was fab, on 7th ave just 2 blocks from Time Square which was around a 5min walk. Everything we wanted to be close to was within walking distance, Broadway, restaurants, SHOPPING!!! there is a subway station just around the corner and there are touts for the greyline tour buses all along the avenue. Also central park is just to the right of the hotel. The hotel restaurant didn't look all that, we didn't eat there but why would you with so many great places to eat in little italy, china town and so on. Alot of people have mentioned rude staff, i didnt experience any probs but then what else do you expect from american new yorkers?! they are known for their abruptness! We weren't bothered once by the staff, and the cleaners were friendly whenever we passed. also they always waited until we had left the room before entering (no early wake up calls, cleaners letting themselves in! ) We really enjoyed ourselves here, we were in a great location, but not too close!! I would def stay here again, and would hate to stay on top of Time Square, with the hustle and bustle, i can't imagine getting a peaceful night sleep there!! This hotel is by no means luxurious, or one of the best ive stayed in. but it is a wonderful city hotel and I would have payed alot more than i did to stay there. xxx Lea, London

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff...”
Reviews.Author: MiraCT
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week ago. Rude front desk. Broken shower handle - hard to turn the shower on and off. Had told them before booking directly with them that we need a 2 hr delayed check out only then will we reserve a room. They said no problem at all. On the day, the rude front desk person refused even though they had made an official note of it. Told her the shower handle was broken.. she had no response, no apologies, just an 'Oh!' Never staying here again, even though we go to NYC every month - will stick to our usual hotels, except this time we needed one near Lincoln Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything!!!”
Reviews.Author: Staceyu1507
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights at the end of April. The location is great - I was very impressed that central park is literally on your doorstep and we could walk to most of the major attractions such as Time Square and Rockefeller. The Grey Line tours which is a must to any new tourist to New York was located just outside which only added to the convenience. The hotel itself was clean and tastefully decorated. Our room had two lovely large double beds but I was a little dissapointed with the lack of view (we looked out at Hooters accross the street) although I accept this is a big city so to be expected. My major gripe with the hotel is the lack of room amenities, no kettle for tea, coffee or even water and no mini bar. However the bar was expensive but conveniently located for a quick pre-dinner drink. Overall I liked this hotel and may even consider going back when we re-visit New York. The rates were excellent , the amenities were clean but best of all was the location. However if you are going to New York for more than sight seeing and the hotel is important to you then I would look at a more luxurious resort get away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mqkuznitz
Reviews.Content: It was my daughters 18th birthday celebration. We arrived at the hotel Saturday morning 10:30. A very helpful man named, Mike, checked us in and told us that they would give us a call if our room was going to be available earlier than 4 PM. We received a call about 2 PM and returned to the hotel for a quick check in at the front desk, Our room was on the 11th floor and a great room. Comfy bed, pillows and large. Great location, helpful and friendly staff.. Thanks so much for a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fine !”
Reviews.Author: AdeleandDavid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in November 07 this was a girly weekend away so this was just our base for washing and sleeping. It was fine the room was clean, spacious, hotel bar quite expensive (but dont drink there if you dont want to), staff fine and helpful recommending local restaurants and bars, trying to get us tables at various restaurants. We ate breakfast at the cafe (carnegie? its linked directly to another hotel) directly across the road, food great, we then tried breakfast elsewhere, which wasnt as good and service not as friendly. This hotel is perfect for what we wanted and yes it is only a 3 star so if you wanted a perfect gorgeous hotel go for a 5 star, for a shopping and sightseeing trip this hotel was brilliant as centrally located right near Central Park and approx. 2 blocks from 5th ave - if I remember correctly, and 10 minutes walk from theatre land. And yes we would all stay there again !

Reviews.Title: “Worst staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: WalterMIT
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 1pm in the front desk after coming from Boston. When we tried to check in the lady in the front desk said check in time was 4pm. We found that strange since we had called the hotel just hours before asking if a friend had already checked in and they told us no because check in was only 2pm. When I told the lady that, she was basically said I was lying. We came back later (6pm) and started the check in process again, this time a man (Emanuel) in the front desk. No smiles again, but at that point I couldn't care less. When he started the process and was about to give me my key, my friend came behind and said his last name hoping to start his check in process. The guy without looking at our face pointed to other desk. So my wife asked if he could not do our friend's check in and he simply answered with a lot of attitude (and with a very loud voice) that he was not finished yet. I simply asked why all that attitude, that was enough for the guy to start screaming at me saying "I don't have to take this [--]" and left me there, standing, without my room keys. Then he called the manager himself and when the manager came he again started screaming with him telling that he would not proceed with our check in. Unbelievable! I though I was at "Candid Camera", but unfortunately that was all real. The location was ok, the room was old and stinky. Don't stay in this hotel unless is your last choice and you don't care about being screamed by people that is suppose to please you.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel marred by unacceptably rude staff”
Reviews.Author: LondonbrideLondon
Reviews.Content: Arriving exhausted at midday from London we were greeted by a stone-faced receptionist who told us that we could not check in until 4pm, which seemed unusual for a hotel. When we queried if there was anything we could do to get a room earlier, she blankly repeated that there was no checking in until 4pm as though we were there for her convenience. There was no apology, conciliatory gesture, welcome or smile and we were extermely taken aback by her rude manner. We had emailed days days before from England to request a non smoking room with a good view and noone had replied, and we had then called the hotel and been told our rquest had been noted but when we asked the recpetionist she did not seem to recognise this and said we had not been allocated a room and she could not promise anything because rooms were allocated first come first served after 4pm. Adding to the bizarre first impression, the lobby was filled with totally inappropriate techno-pop music relayed at ear splitting volume which did not lend itself to a relaxing environment and created a sense of impersonallity and discomfort. We had to take our luggage to a store room ourselves and had no option but to go out and try to fill time until we could check in. Although we were keen to see NY, we were dying to freshen up and rest after a very long journey so this was not fun, plus we were so concerned by the terrible welcome from the hotel that we became worried that if the staff were so dismissive, the room would be terrible too. Around 2.30 pm we were dropping with tiredness so we decided to go back in hope that a room might have come up. We queued for a receptionist for about 10 minutes - people around us were getting very edgy and there was an atmosphere of stress all around. Finally we got to the front and a man told us again we could not check in till 4. We collapsed in the terrible hotel bar balring TV and loud music and an indifferent waiter. Finally at 3pm we asked again if a room had become available and this time were told one had, again with no smile, apology or welcome. When we opened the door to our room on 12th floor we were very relieved as it did turn out to be fine - ok view, quite large, modern style. However the cleanliness was not really up to scratch - the carpet hadn't been vacuumed and there were a few small hairs in the bath. Room service was overpriced even before taxes and extra charges and wifi was slow. There was building work going on right outside our window and although we were out every day after that first day and waking early so it didn't prove a real issue for us, it would have stopped us sleeping any later than 8am and the hotel staff we asked about it told us it was only for one day which was not the case. The lifts were really slow and on one occasiona taxi driver purporting to work for the hotel fleeced us into using his cab instead of a yellow taxi, promising it was the same rate, but it turned out to be about 50% more expensive. We were amused to note on the desk in our room a card from a manager saying the hotel strived to impress guests! It said they emailed all guests after their stay to check they were happy but we are still waiting. The overall stay was just acceptable in the end, the location was excellent and other staff eg our maid were more polite, but the overall impression was of a hotel which simply did not care what guests' experiences were so long as they have got your money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Tobinyon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Central April 15-17, 3 of us girls in our 40's and 50's sharing 1 room with double beds on the 5th floor. Found the hotel staff to be very accommodating and helpful. Arrived early so was able to check our baggage for free in the baggage check area. When yo check out you can store you luggage but there is a $3 fee per bag to do this but it still is a great service. Great location to everything for we wanted it to be comvenient to Lincoln Center and Rockefeller center. We did not eat at the hotel but there is a Starbuck right there and just across the block is Carnegie Deli and down from there the Stage Deli. Subway very convenient. Rate was high for the night for we booked ahead of time but they do offer some specials so check their website. Room was average with amble room for 3 people. Bathroom a good size and the beds were the best part. Room could use some sprucing up and the heat/air conditioner did not work and looked ancient. On the 5th floor we could here some of the street traffic but it wasn't too bad. Overall a very good time and experience and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Norwegiantraveller
Reviews.Content: An average hotel on a great location

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: msrw
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Park Central in March '08. Was very worried about it as some of the reviews on here are very negative. We checked in the hotel about 2.30pm, no problems what so ever, room was ready, we didn't have to wait to be seen to, person on the desk was polite and helpful. The room was bigger then i imagined, loads of space to fill with shopping bags. Bed was very comfortable. Bathroom was a good size, only negative thing being that the shower was not powerful at all, but this wasn't a big issue. Room was cleaned every day to a very good standard. Lifts were slow at times. Obviously more so at peek times of the day, but this didn't bother us too much. Location of the hotel was perfect! Few min walk to Times square or Central Park, 5th avenue and all the major attractions. The booking desk was very helpful, even booking some restaurants for us and answering our questions and suggesting things to do. There is a Starbucks right next to the hotel and a subway across the road, plenty of other places to eat a few feet from the hotel. We didnt spend a great amount of time in the actual hotel, we knew from the beginning it would just be a place for us to sleep and wash really but we were no way disappointed. There are a lot of negative reports on here but i can truly say that we had a great stay and would not hesitate in coming back here and would defo recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “not so great!!!”
Reviews.Author: bell51
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from staying 5 nights at the Park Central, I have to say that I would not recommend this hotel. After an early landing from JFK, we were made to wait until the designated check in time of 4pm, there was absolutely no compromise, we could have opted to put our luggage in the store.... for a charge, but decided against that as eveybody else had the same idea!! We were not given a smoking room as requested, and had to wait until 4pm the next day to change rooms, therefore a chunk of our sightseeing time was lost. We found only one pleasant person on reception, the rest were totally uninterested in us. The rooms were very tired and needed updating, the bathroom was very dark (even with the lights on!), the windows were absolutely filthy, not that the view was anything to write home about!! although it was clean, and the beds were comfortable. We were charged $6 for 2 coffees in the breakfast room (the deli next door charged us $2.50). When we went to print our bording cards for our return flight in the 'business' suite, the machine just ate up the dollars. The location wasn't bad, there is a subway right on the corner. All in all, if you have a choice choose another hotel. I would not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Central Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Drominch
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this hotel. Our first trip to new york and we were delighted with the location which is very central and in a nice area. Service was good, rates were reasonable and room was good - clean, decent decor and well maintained while we were there. The hotel has a decent free gymn, bar and restaurant (which are fairly expensive, but lots of other places nearby). There is a subway stop right by the hotel, and it is a 5 min walk to broadway/fifth avenue and only a few hundred yeards to central park. Based on our stay I recommend park central highly etc.

Reviews.Title: “Besides Location, forget it!”
Reviews.Author: BTA
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night 4/11. The Good: 1) Location. Right on 7th avenue. 1 block from Carnegie Hall and the Stage Deli The Ugly: 1) Check in was supposedly at 4. Were not able to obtain room key until 4:20. Took over 10 minutes to get up to the 19th floor. Only 2 of 4 elevator banks were operating. Wife had to change her clothes in a two stall bathroom to avoid being late for a 4:30 meeting! 2) Room was very small for over $300 for the night 3) Under bed had not been vacumed from prior visitor. 4) Shower wouldn't drain. 5) Thermostat on HCAC wouldn't control the temperature any cooler than 73 degrees. 6) Light fixtures in bathroom rusted 7) Went to check out and have our bags stored so we could grab a bite to eat before we departed NYC. Management would not grant a courtesy voucher to store 2 bags for an hour (even though we had been greatly inconvenienced the previous day). They wanted $3.50 to store the 2 bags. Don't waste your money on this hotel. There are much better ones in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Great Destination- Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: Heelloo
Reviews.Content: We were staying the for 6 nights there. The location was very good because you could see times square. When we checked in the staff was rude and finally when we got got our hotel room there were two things wrong. Firstly the sheets of the bed was nasty and the radiatior gave out cold instead of hot air. So we desided to call a person to fix our radiator and ee what was wrong with it. It took the person about 30 minutes to come to ur room (room 405). When he arrived he just said 'wait a minute the radiator needs time to warm up' and we told him that the sheets of the bed were nasty so he called another person up. The person finally came and she said the nastyness of the sheets were' stains. It is a very bad hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.Would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Mac24Scotland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our needs.Staff very helpful.Rooms clean.Bathroom good size.Beds very comfy.Great view from window (17th floor)The location is excellant for a first time visit.Right on Broadway just up from Times Square.Easy to find again at the end of a busy day.Next to some excellant diners and deli.Eating out for breakfast was great fun and a real NY experience.Use of internet to check in for return flights.Overall we found this hotel to be excellant value for a city centre base. The MacLeay family Scotland

Reviews.Title: “central, but felt not great for the money.”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolTruly
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel this year, hotel very impressive on internet and even when we arrived from the front and the foyer, however room disapointing, looking out onto what we could describe as the middle of the hotel just brick walls. there was also no coffee facilites, we saw others going across the road in the morning for a coffee and bringing it back to the hotel, felt this was bad considering the hotel was in our opinion expensive. despite this the hotel ws central, very convienent for transport and something to eat which was ideal for us as we only had a short stay. however the most anoying was that there was one heater in the bedroom and this did not work, at times it was very cold, as it was february. we were going to complain but as we only had two nights stay felt it wasnt worth the hastle, however this was still not exceptable. wouldnt recommend this hotel, especially when there are plenty to choose from that may offer a better service in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Traveller2478
Reviews.Content: I was in NY for a conference where colleagues stayed at other hotels such as the Hilton, Sheraton(s) and Marquis; the Park Central was the most expensive and had the least amenities (no coffee-making facilities in the room, Internet was $13 a day -- you can use the wireless network in the Sheraton for free). The service was dreadful; the key to my room didn't work on day 1 so after taking the interminable lift back to the lobby, the new key didn't work either. I asked a passing porter who checked the key and called security to help. Thirty minutes later they hadn't arrived so I went back to the lobby. I was told security were on a shift change. You get the picture. One day the internet wasn't working, the line I was given to call to check the problem suggested I "get the hotel to give me a new cable". Down I went to the desk only to be told that there had been problems all day and they were aware of it. For the best part of $300-a-day, stay somewhere else, you are wasting your money staying here.

Reviews.Title: “loved park central”
Reviews.Author: mary083
Reviews.Content: park central is a lovely hotel in new york, near central park and within walking distance of times square. it also has a gym which i used each morning. i will return to park central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Louthman
Reviews.Content: I booked a room with 2 Double beds in November 07 for Mar 08 in this Hotel, but when we arrived they had no rooms of that type available so we were put into a room with 1 King Bed, this would not work. I contacted the Manager who was not very helpful and we were put into a slightly larger room with 1 King Bed for the 1 night. The next day I contacted the manager again to get moved into the room which I booked orginially and was told that none would be available until 4pm and that we must check out of our current room before 11am which left us with no room for half the day. The room we stayed in on the first night did not cost as much as the room book orginally but the Hotel would not refund the difference....this does not make sense. The breakfast is very over priced at approx $30 per head?????????. Do not believe a word the Manager/Reception Staff/Doormen tell you........it will only end up costing you more and benefit the Hotel Staff in some way. This Place is an Overpriced B&B who employ Thieves in suites..............

Reviews.Title: “An unfortunate incident...”
Reviews.Author: cici-la
Reviews.Content: We called the hotel to book the room and were able to reserve a room with two double beds for a great rate of 129-99/night (depending on wkday or wkend). When we arrived, the hotel did not have the room we wanted available so we had to go into a room with a single King bed which did not work for us at all and had to order a cot brought into the room. This change made the room extremely tight. The plumbing was awful so there was no pressure in the shower. Moved to a better room the next day but when we went to pick up the car, we noticed the radio had been tampered with, there were magazines in the car that did not belong to us and money was stolen from the locked glove compartment! Complained to the hotel but management replied that they were not responsible for what the parking attendants did since they don't work directly for the hotel (externally contracted). This last one may be our fault, left an expensive coat and pair of uggs in a bag in the room right before checkout and called back to see if it was retreived...of course they weren't. The only great thing about the stay was the location of the hotel. It was close to everything we wanted to do in the city.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: norcalpeggy
Reviews.Content: My husbands co-worker recommended this hotel for our trip at Christmas time. My husband booked it and then we looked at the on-line reviews and were a little worried. Fortunately our experience was great, contrary to some of the negative reviews we read. The staff at the hotel was courteous, our room immaculate, and the location was superb for our first visit. Our room was fairly large, quiet and extremely comfortable. The furnishings were lovely, flat screen tv, and a comfortable bed with down pillows. I would hate to see someone stay away from this hotel based on the other bad reviews, because our experience was so good. The location is a huge plus, but you don't have to give up any comfort to stay here. Central Park is just two blocks away, there is a subway entrance just outside the hotel, Rockefeller Center and Time Square are a few blocks away. And the price was unbeatable for the quality of what we got. I would recommend this to anyone, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Park Central New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisHughes
Reviews.Content: Despite the many negative reviews of this hotel, we had a great time during our 5-day stay. Our "superior" room was very large by normal standards with additional room that could have a further queen-sized bed. Check-in was completed without any trouble and took probably less than two minutes from entering the hotel lobby. All the staff were very efficient and eager to please (this is the USA after all). Our room was next to the emergency staircase which meant it was probably larger than normal (room number X57 where X = floor number is probably worth asking for,). This hotel is in an excellent location being only a few blocks from 5th Avenue, Rockfeller Center etc. and next to 57St subway station. The hotel has a limosine service to the airports (JFK - $60) which we shared with other hotel guests. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great rates, great location”
Reviews.Author: angibee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is steps away from Central Park, a few blocks from Broadway, right beside Carnegie Hall. If you want to see the city, this is the place to stay. I could not believe the price: $110,00 walk-in rate. However, if we had booked the hotel through the internet, we would have gotten also breakfast included. You can have internet access for $12.00/24 hrs.The hotel is clean, furniture is modern and the staff friendly. Good food in the restaurant. Lots of restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Leenda324
Reviews.Content: First, the good: The property's location is primo -- 57th & 7th -- catty-corner from Carnegie Hall, just blocks from Central Park and walking distance to Times Square, Fifth Avenue shopping, great restaurants and more. The well-equipped fitness center is a plus, and includes ellipticals, stationary bikes, treadmills, Nautilus weight machines and free weights. I booked a superior king room on Expedia and was very disappointed upon arrival to be put in a standard double room on the 7th floor. My neighbors were noisy -- to the extent I needed to wear earplugs -- and then when I returned to the hotel midday after some business meetings were over, was dismayed by how noisy the housekeeping staff was. I was also a bit annoyed to find housekeeping had taken shortcuts -- not replacing glasses, for instance, but putting new covers on them (toothpaste residue told the tale.) Internet connectivity costs $12.95 a day and was slow -- I was double-charged for each day upon check out, but that was quickly resolved. None of the typical amenities such as in-room coffee maker, etc., but the decor was spare and elegant, everything was clean and my stay was ok. I just didn't feel as if the staff was willing to do whatever it took to care for guests. When compared to similar properties where I've stayed in midtown -- the Hilton Garden Inn in Times Square and the Comfort Inn Manhattan, I wouldn't return. On the other hand, it's not a bad property at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choise”
Reviews.Author: Hawkeye3
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this Hotel (4 nights). It was included as part of a flight/hotel package we found on Expedia.
