For a mid-town NY hotel, and at the price (est. $175 night), it is an excellent choice. We had a large room, well furnished and well maintained. The Park Cafe across the street is very good for breakfast. The is a subway entrance on the side of the property (55th St).

Reviews.Title: “An okay choice”
Reviews.Author: Sam456
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights when we got in there was no queue line but the staff was quite rude and when we went to our room we had a great view of a brick wall and some of the wallpaper was peeling off on some electrical outlets.The room was a bit small also, the location though was great because it was a very close walk to Time Square (Less than 5 mins) and Central Park( about 10 mins) overall the hotel was a pretty average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel location, clean, but slow lifts!”
Reviews.Author: paulabelfast5
Reviews.Content: This hotel was better than I expected, the room was a great size for NY and was v clean. staff were all friendly, and the restaurant had great food for dinner one night when we were too tired from shopping! v close to central park, and 5th avenue / times sq both only about a 5-10 minute walk away. rooms were quiet which was great for a good nights sleep! downside was lifts were terribly slow, and the stairs were not well laid out - no sign to say ground floor - but the lifts are under construction so should be ok soon. concierge staff were all great, v helpful, and brilliant tips for where to get good reasonable food nearby - we were recommended a fabulous little italian place off times sq, def going back! best meal of the week, wish we'd used their advice more!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: chromeo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Central while on our honeymoon in NY. The hotel is situated perfectly in the heart of midtown Manhattan, which means within walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, the list goes on and on. It is also convenient to the subway to make a quick jaunt down or uptown. The service and cleanliness was great and we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Central, Park Central”
Reviews.Author: Little_Way_Down
Reviews.Content: I must have spent the best part of 2 full days researching hotels in New York. While we were on a budget, I also didn't want to end up in a dive!! I decided on the Park Central because of the location and the price, I booked direct through the web site and managed to get a king room for just over $200 a night which was right at the top end of our budget. After I'd booked it, I was worried about some of the reviews about service and the state of the rooms and considered several times if I should pay a bit more or take a hotel further out from Manhattan. In the end I decided to stick with the hotel as most hotels have good and bad reviews and at worst we could check out after a night. So, on to the hotel!! We checked in about 7pm on Saturday, no queues and the guy (Chris) was quite chatty and welcoming. We got in the lift (no queues here either) and went up to our room on the 9th floor. The room was big and as clean as any hotel we'd stayed in before. The bathroom was also as big as you'd expect and quite new and very clean, shower was fine with the usual bottles of shampoo and bars of soap, box of tissues etc. The bed was HUGE and very very comfy! Plenty of pillows, sheets and blankets. Good sized room safe which was free plus an iron and board. All in all, everything we needed. Our room was inside facing so no view but that meant it was very quiet and we slept well after a day in the city on our feet. The location is, as others have said, fantastic. There is a subway station right outside the hotel which was the best way to get around (we wished we'd bought a 7 day pass as this would have saved us money) There's a wide range of places to eat all around the hotel, from restaurants to diners to delis at all hours of the day, our favourite was the Applejack Diner for breakfast, about $15 to $20 for 2 of us. We couldn't fault the housekeeping, our room was cleaned and tidied well each day, clean towels etc. for which we left a tip. When we checked out the guy was a bit surly but all was done quickly with no billing issues. So, to sum up and based on our stay; I found what I was looking for (not too expensive but not a dive), great location to explore the city, I'd stay there again and recommend it to family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “Check That Billing !”
Reviews.Author: Capeandisland
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel a little better than adequate. The rate was good; too good to be true apparently. When we got our bill from AMX there was a $ 99.00 addition under micellaneous. After the torture of trying to find someone to talk to on the phone we were told it was a "fumigation fee" because someone had smoked in the non-smoking room we requested. Interesting. My partner and I are NON-SMOKERS. We are now in the process of having our doctors supply affidavit that we are in fact non-smokers to AMX. I would rather have paid the additional $99.00 to stay in a better hotel and avoid the time and energy we are spending to fix this little mess. Next time we will.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Cliffords
Reviews.Content: Just returned back from staying 5 nights at The Park Central Hotel. I was a bit worried as i was checking trip advisor after i booked and there were loads of bad reviews, but i should never have worried. Hotel is fab, check in was very quick we arrived at about 4.30pm, i must admit the reception staff are miserable its like they are making a effort to be nice, but didn't worry me as long as the rooms were nice. We stayed on the 17th floor and had a great view of Times Square. Rooms were large, bathrooms on the small side but had a very powerful shower. Rooms were very clean and warm. we never ate or drank in the hotel so can't comment on these. The location of the hotel is fantastic, 5 minutes walk into times square a couple of minutes to central park and another 5 minutes to all the shops. would recommend going to Soho we only found it on our last day had great shops there. Would recommend the park central for anyone who wants to stay near broadway and times square.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wai to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: stephenie
Reviews.Content: Just back this morning from a 6night stay in this hotel, I would highly recommend it to anybody going to new york and i will definitly be returning! Location was ideal, to the right was time square (fantastic view from our room, 16th floor), to the left was central park and straight ahead was 5th avenue (abercrombie & Fitch, tiffenys etc., just two blocks away). Subway station right beside the hotel, they are so safe and fast, we travelled everywere on them. The room was gorgeous, so clean and fresh!!! It was very cold in the room all the time! However as we never reported this to staff we have our self to blame! After a busy day when we returned to the room it was always tidy, clean and bed made, exactly what you need after a day of shopping! Ive never slept in a more comfortable bed, we sank into it every night. I hav absolutly no complaints about the hotel, i will definitly return! one thing you should be aware of, when we were leaving the hotel the door man insisted on getting us a taxi, this was fine but he then brought us around the side of the hotel were black car's are waiting to bring you to the airport, they are independent drivers and will charge you a fortune! we changed our mind at the last minute and went with a yellow cab as a set rate to the airport was stated on the outside of the taxi - always use the YELLOW CABS!!!! On the first day or two i reccommend you get on the tour bus around downtown (depending on the sites you want to see). It is a great holiday and i cant wait to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great rates, nice rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: mike_g30
Reviews.Content: I've stayed about 25 nights in the last few months at the Park Central Hotel. It is in a great location for tourists, as well as the many office buildings nearby. It has entrances on 3 sides, making it much nicer to get in and out when its snowing or a cab drops you off on the wrong end... The rooms are large for NYC. Bathrooms are decent sized - I've had varying sizes... The rooms are somewhat modern, comfortable, and clean. The views are meh/ok, better if you're above 18-20th floor and facing south (times sq). I generally find their rates to be $30-60 cheaper per night than nearby hotels. The only negative things I can say is no free internet (but I've yet to find anywhere in NYC with that), and the elevators are slow. Slow as in, I've taken the stairs from the 8th floor down slow.... apparently they're working on them.

Reviews.Title: “Just right!”
Reviews.Author: MJJ81
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a perfect location. Some of the staff were a little unfriendly but in contrast others were very helpful. The only thing I would fault is the carpets were a little dirty and the wallpaper was peeling. We were given a smoking room when we requested a non-smoking but they happily moved us to a much better room the next day. All the cafes around the Hotel are great. For shopping I definitely recommend Soho, we made the mistake of sticking around 5th Avenue which is much more expensive. We discovered Soho on out last day so if you're there for shopping go there first! H&M is brilliant - they have 2 and it's all so cheap it's unbelievable. I also recommend the Sex and the City Tour if you like the programme, it's so much fun and you see a a different side to New York. I had a great stay, loved the food, the people, the hotel, the atmosphere. Definitely recommend this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend...”
Reviews.Author: jenninoone
Reviews.Content: We had been recommended this hotel and we were not let down. The location is brilliant, just seconds from Central Park, and around 5-10 mins walk from many of the key attractions. The room was better than we expected, great size, clean. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “new york new york”
Reviews.Author: cleagh
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 3 nights in jan and must say we had a lovely stay with no poblems. There were no queues at check in and our room was ready on arrival even though we were 3 hours early for check in, room was nice and clean with 2 large double beds no complaints about the bathroom either....didnt eat in the hotel but did have a few drinks in the bar...which were expensive. Theatre tickets are usually cheaper if u buy them directly from the box office where the show is we got tickets for our show front row for $26.50 each...we basically just went to shop and enjoy new york and not to sit around in our hotel looking for faults we got an excellent price for the location which we booked on the hotel website...had already stayed in fitzpatricks grand central but this beats it for a cheaper alternative and will def go back again to this hotel next year.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: cfaggie01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Central Dec. 16th-20th. This was my second stay at this hotel - the first being in 2002. I was a little worried after reading some of the reviews, but once again, it was a great stay. Our flight was canceled due to weather so we called to let them know we would be checking in later than planned. The person on the phone & the lady at check-in were both very helpful. We had a very clean, nice-sized room on the 6th floor. It was cleaned/straightened daily & always restocked with plenty of towels (it does make a difference when you tip for a job well done). Yes, the elevators were slow at times, but it was never a problem for us...it gave us a chance to rest our aching feet after the miles of walking we had done! The location is perfect!! I have recommended the hotel to friends & will definitely stay there again the next time I am in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay.”
Reviews.Author: weekender012
Reviews.Content: We all have different expectations when it comes to hotels. My wife and I stayed at The Park Central in late January. As others have said, the locations was absolutely great. Unlike others, however, our stay was fine. No staff member was rude, the concierge went out of thier way to help us, the room was very clean, and there were never lines for the elevators. I even spoke to the person who was to clean our room and she was very kind. I left a tip every day and our room was cleaned to above most standards. We didn't use the restaurant or the bar, so I can't comment on them. Overall, no, it isn't a five star hotel, but I wasn't paying five star prices either. take the comments with a grain of salt and don't be affraid to stay at the Park Central. It was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Orrible Service!”
Reviews.Author: StellaVenice
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one week. After a long line at ceck in...first room they gave me was not cleaned yet (!) in the second room a couple has just cecked in right before me (!!) third room toilet did not flush (!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: jasper15
Reviews.Content: great hotel, unfriendly front desk staff, but nice concierge and bellmen. good location and clean and love the fitness center. would definitely go back! walk everywhere- so close to everything

Reviews.Title: “Not Not Not”
Reviews.Author: JJJJJJ1
Reviews.Content: Really bad, incompetent staff, rooms not really good. Is not good value for money. I got charged in my credit card twice and a nightmare to solve it.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Average !!”
Reviews.Author: Movingmike
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to New York so can only compare with hotels elsewhere. Arrived at 8:30pm on a Saturday night for 4 night stay to be told that the room would not be ready for a further hour !!! Finally got into the room and basically crashed out after being up for 18 hours. In the morning was awaken by a whining noise, eventually finding the source to be a service elevator drive room adjacent to our room. On checking the room found the toilet damaged, the doors of the wardrobe and bathroom in need of lubrication. The wallpaper was damaged in both bedroom and bathroom. There was a rusted vent cover over the window and the curtain bracket was damaged. I asked at the front desk for a change of room which was addressed immediately. The new room was excellent with a very comfortable bed and plenty of space and a large TV. I'm not sure if it's standard in New York hotels that there are no coffee making facilities but I found it strange to see so many people going to Starbucks next door and then queue for the lifts to take the drinks back to the room !!! As stated in previous reviews the location makes the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: johnnyboy1959
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in early Jan on pleasure trip with my wife and two daughters (21 and 18). Very impressed with hotel location - just 10 mins walk from Central Park, Times Square, Broadway and 5th Ave. Unlike some other reviewers, I found the staff helpful and friendly. Yes the hotel could do with a little sprucing up and new lifts, but if you're not spending all day there it's just fine. Rooms are comfortable (large for a city hotel, I thought), and very clean. Plenty of delis and restaurants nearby give plenty of eating options. Would recommend Angelo's Pizzeria on 57th Street down by Carnegie Hall, and breakfast at Carnegie Deli in next block to hotel (although I believe other delis nearby are also good). Overall, a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Beems
Reviews.Content: We just got back last night from a 4 day stay in NYC. After reading some of the reviews online about this hotel, I was skeptical.....however, everything was great! The location is perfect for shopping, times square, museums and the subway. The hotel lobby is beautiful and the staff was great (especially Michael). The rooms were big for NYC and clean. Housekeeping came everyday. There is a nice restaurant, bar and gift shop in the hotel, not to mention that Carngie and Stage Deli are next door. I would definitely stay here again. If you are visiting NYC with kids....check out Spotlight Live in Times Square. Great Kareoke with back up singers. My kids had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a Three Star Hotel in Central New York”
Reviews.Author: uktraveller009
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay here (we booked through the hotel's own website having got flights with lastminutedotcom) and were impressed with the location. You're 15mins walk from Central Park and 10mins the other direction from Times Square - ideal for tourist travellers like us. Right outside are guys in yellow anoraks selling tickets for city bus tours - get the $49 all-round town trip and ask them to make it for 3days - we did this and toured uptown (inc Harlem) one day, downtown (inc SoHo) the next and Brooklyn the final day. Great value and you can hop on and off. The hotel staff were pretty unfriendly but that seems typical of NYC. Our room was non-smoking but smelt of smoke as you walked in - not enough to be a problem though unless you had an allergy to cigarette smoke. Reasonable size room but only a 30cm gap between end of the bed and a tv table so you need to be slim or climb over the bed if you're sleeping on the left! Good bathroom - not luxurious but provided 3 hand towels, 4 bath towels and two face flannels as well as shampoo, body lotion and bar of soap. Didn't eat at the hotel as it looked expensive and there are loads of places to eat within 1min. Check prices outside the eateries though as they vary A LOT - we paid $50 one night for a burger and a wrap, a coke and one beer which was a rip off. One thing about NY this time of year - take the warmest clothes you have and wear a hat, gloves, scarf, thermal underwear and 3 pairs of socks all the time or you'll freeze; it's unfunny how cold the place is.

Reviews.Title: “Room 705 - bathroom freezing”
Reviews.Author: MitchUK
Reviews.Content: Rooms not available on check-in. Had to wait over 1 hour for room to be cleaned. Room 705 - spacious and comfy bed, BUT bathroom was absolutely freezing with icy draft through windows. Reception staff/duty manager - not very helpful. Gave impression that they just wanted to get rid of you. Breakfast good and good location. Would not use again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a very happy experience”
Reviews.Author: Duettist96
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before, 3 years ago, and things have worsened. I would agree - the front desk is woefully undermanned and the attitude less than friendly. The rooms are fine, I suppose, but the shower was antiquated and little more than a dribble of water with a rather manky plastic curtain. No bath, so the overall effect was of a tiny room with no space for sponge bags etc. No noise from the mext room, but the corridor noise was tiresome and intrusive. The location is excellent, but everything else is expensive and not justified. MUCH better food at La Quotidienne for breakfast than at the hotel. Overall, I would always go back to the Salisbury on W 57th. This time they were full. I was disappointed, since I had really been looking forward to staying in this hotel again. The salisbury is a little faded but it's not trying to be more than it is.

Reviews.Title: “An”
Reviews.Author: demc1982
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in the heart of the Big Apple then I would highly recommend the Park Central Hotel. Located just a few minutes walk from Central Park, Times Square, Broadway theatres, 5th Avenue shopping and Rockefeller Center. There is also a subway stop (N/R/Q/W trains) by the hotel entrance. The room was larger than average for a Manhattan hotel, very clean, although the alarm clock was broken. A good sized bathroom. Despite some of the other reviews I found the front desk staff to be friendly and helpful. One word of warning: Do not use the telephone in the room, buy a phone card. The costs are astronomical, international calls work out at nearly $10/minute and national calls about $1.50/minute.

Reviews.Title: “What a deplorable hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: RobertoS_oPaulo
Reviews.Content: Well...The location is great!! I guess that is the only good thing about this hotel, since it is the only thing that doesn´t depend on its staff. when I asked for some kind of information from the front desk, the receptionists were incredibly impolite. I had to stay there for one week , since it would be hard for me to get another hotel room. When I arrived there, I had to wait for almost two hours , although I had reserved the room. When I tried to ask why it was taking so long, I was told off by one of the staff members. ( Can you believe that?? ).Well, the room was dirty, the room service was too expensive and you have to wait forever . So, if you want good service or at least some respect, stay away from this disgusting hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - recommended!”
Reviews.Author: nomis1963
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in New York - especially those wanting to be near 'Theatre land', Times Square and many other leading 'attractions'. Our family (2 adults and 2 children) had a spacious and very clean room, with an adequately sized bathroom en-suite. The service at the front desk and in concierge was first class, polite and friendly. All other facilities were great. We had absolutely no problems in the 7 nights that we stayed there, and I got the impression that had we had them, they would have been sorted out straight away! My wife says that I am very 'fussy' - so if I'm telling you that I would stay there agaim without hesitation - it must have been good!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location!”
Reviews.Author: bstar54
Reviews.Content: I booked the midweek midwinter special online and it was well worth it. The front desk staff was not pleasant, but that is the only thing I can find fault with at this hotel. Conceirge service was awesome. They answered all kinds of questions from how to get around to where to eat. Very friendly and helpful. Our room was cleaned while we were out, and they even picked up my son's dirty socks off of the floor. We had a view of 55th street that was nice. Beds are super comfy, and the TV was nice too. You just can't beat the location of this hotel. For the price, it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Quellman
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic location. It was only about 15-20 from LGA to start with. Central Park is 1 block away. Times square is 2 blocks. Broadway is right there. 5th avenue is 2 blocks away. The proximity to so many NY attractions like Times Square, Broadway, Art Museums, History Museum, Carnegie Hall, and Central Park- makes it so you don't need cab fare for much until you want to visit the south end of the island. It is about 3 miles. Cons- Elevators were being serviced so it would be a pain to get to your room if you were on a lower floor. Also, I never got a clock in the room to replace the broken one, but I wasn't charged. Concierge wasn't open too late so try and plan ahead. Pros- Proximity to attractions, very clean rooms, subway and cabs close by. Starbucks is in the corner of the building. Thick walls, I never heard a neighbor.

Reviews.Title: “Rudest Employees Ever Encountered”
Reviews.Author: pwallis
Reviews.Content: We arrived at midnight, and didn't get to our room until nearly 1:30. There was one person working the desk, but a manager was on duty, plus another person doing what we presumed was paperwork at the other end of the counter. After waiting nearly 20 minutes (there was only one family ahead of us in what was proving to be a long, long line of tired travelers) I approached the woman doing paperwork, and asked if there was someone who could assist getting all these people checked in. She pointed her finger at me, said "Get back in line and stand over there, you'll be called!" The manager had gone in the back, despite a line of people in his lobby. We waited nearly 30 minutes more!! If we had known ANYWHERE else to go, we would have left, but the room had been booked thru a travel agent, and already paid for. Once we finally got to the desk, I asked the clerk why the manager didn't come out and help, and she just ignored me, never made eye contract at all, just acted very impatient. Never welcomed us to the hotel, never said "enjoy your stay", never apologized for the long wait, nothing. Just acted like all the guests were HUGE intrusions in her evening. We returned from Montreal on Christmas night and again was booked into this hotel, and were dreading the experience. Our second experience there was only marginally better. Not so long a wait, but the same surly, rude desk clerks. The rooms were okay, but the room the first night smelled strongly of paint. I would never stay in this hotel again, and have notifed the travel agent to avoid it at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Location, Great City!”
Reviews.Author: paulie_chops
Reviews.Content: Got cheap flights to New York (thanks Zoom) just before Christmas and had a fantastic time. New York hotels are expensive (like any big city) but we got some great prices booking direct with the hotel (£115 per night). The hotel is in a great location, just two blocks from Central Park, a subway station just outside the door and with walking distance of the Rockerfeller Centre, Times Square, Macy's etc. Staff were all polite and helpful and the lobby is large, relaxed and pretty smart. The rest of the hotel and our room was clean, plenty of room, an LCD TV and everything worked. Its not a luxury hotel but it is clean, tidy, really comfortable beds and made for a nice stay. Loved our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler95
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice. Beds are wonderfully comfortable. Location is terrific--walking distance to Central Park, all Broadway Theaters, an easy cab ride from Penn Station. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience at Park Central”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaTraveler10
Reviews.Content: We don't usually give reviews but are compelled to give one based on our experience (2 night stay) at Park Central Hotel. For those of you considering booking this hotel, please keep these things in mind. The hotel room we stayed at was dirty when we checked in. Floor was not vacuumed and there were some food spills at the doorway that weren't cleaned up. Needless to say cleaniness didn't appear to be a priority for this hotel and neither was guest service. We asked for the room to be vacumed after we checked in and no one bothered to show up. The room was very small and was stuffy with not much air circulation. Needless to say it was not comfortable at all. The 4th floor hallway where we stayed has a stench, smelled like mold. There was this painter painting the hallway wall during the busiest time of the day when we and other guests were going about. It just showed this hotel management has complete disregard for the hotel guests. If you are unlucky to get a room on the 4th floor on the same side as the elevator. Don't look out your window because it is not a pretty sight. It overlooks a roof with a lot of construction debris and trash. Will never, ever go back to this hotel again. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location but Hotel Left a Lot to Be Desired”
Reviews.Author: ChefAnn
Reviews.Content: We just returned from NYC for a thrilling, 4-day trip. We chose the Park Central purely due to its close proximity to our destinations. And while the location DID prove to be perfect, the hotel does have several drawbacks: -> ROOMS are decent size and yes, we also got a lovely view of a brick wall, but hey...it's New York, not Maui! Thought the mattresses were good and we all slept well. We also noticed it got a bit stuffy the last night, but you can always crack a window open for some fresh air. -> SERVICE was not really good at all. We waited forever to check in. We also found the maid service to be poor. The first morning, they did come in, clean up, make the beds and provided new towels. Day two...zip! They emptied the one waste basket in the bathroom and that was it! The beds were not made and we did not have any clean towels. -> NOISE levels were also a concern. We had an adjoining room and the walls seemed paper thin. The family next to us were very loud and had a boisterous toddler. Thankfully, they seemed to retire early. But if you were stuck next door to a late night party crowd, you'd be in bad shape. ->PLUMBING was terrible. Our sink did not drain well and the last day our toilet backed up. NOT GOOD! -> ELEVATOR service was bad. They have just two elevators servicing seven floors and they were jam packed all the time. Half the time we ended up taking the stairs. Imagine the remaining floors experienced the same trouble. -> GLASSES! Several weeks ago, a friend forwarded me an undercover video showing maids at a big hotel chain washing glasses with glass cleaner or worse, just rinsing them and wiping them with dirty rags. I was sickened to see that the Park Central still has glassware. Although it may very well be 100% cleaned, I still wish I had brought some plastic cups along just to be on the safe side. All in all, I would say if you are not planning to spend much time in your hotel room, this is an OK place to stay, especially if location is important to you. Otherwise, if you're looking for great service and peace and quiet, this is most definitely not the place!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable location”
Reviews.Author: gazm
Reviews.Content: I am yet another person who wonders where the negative reviews about this hotel come from. I stayed here for 4 nights just before christmas and found the hotel to be very good value and in as good a location as you can find if you want to be central to the sites of Manhattan. A subway station is steps away from the door meaning the whole area is only minutes away ,eg two minutes to Times Square. Did not eat at the hotel but nearby dining options are too numerous to mention. No problems at all with check in or check out. Room cleaned every day without any specific request.Luggage stored for free on check in day and for a small fee at check out. All in all a great hotel to which I would return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: CherylRN13
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Park Central for our mother/daughter bonding getaway and the room was very nice for the cost. We got in on a holiday special, and spent 50% less per night than the regular cost. We were very happy with our stay. Check-in was speedy (we were early so we stored our luggage for free) and set out to investigate the city. When we got back at 3:30p we were happy to find that our room was ready. The staff was very friendly and quick to help with directions and other assistance as necessary. The little giftshop in the back lobby was wonderful as I needed Advil and bandaids! (Don't forget to pack these as you WILL need them and they are pricey in a hotel giftshop). This hotel is so convenient to everything...we did the carriage ride (a little pricey but definitely a must-do at least once), we used a car twice (drivers both very friendly), cabs a couple of times, (some cabbies would not take us where we needed to go for whatever reason), saw GREASE (wonderful!). Overall it was a very nice couple of days with my daughter and we walked many miles. I would recommend the Park Central during special offers (for those on a tighter budget), and I would book here again on a future stay (during a price special). The flat screen TV was nice, the shower was weak (needs more power) it took a long time to wash hair, toilet seat needed repair, and hair dryer was broken off the wall (I used my own that I brought anyway). I would not let these issues deter you from staying here. It was clean and room service (cleaning) was prompt. A very good experience!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best value hotels in New York”
Reviews.Author: Yibbert
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is located very centrally and the rooms are suprisingly big. The views are amazing and the staff are plesent and efficient. It does feel a big inpersonal but it is perfect for the average tourist. Again the location is amazing and on the subway. I have returned to this hotel on a number of occasions and have always found he great.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: TAJNewcastle
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Park Central for 5 nights in December and I have absolutely no complaints. Check in was fast and the staff were very helpful and friendly. The hotel lobby was all decorated with xmas trees and very inviting. Our room had 2 double beds and an adequate bathroom, it was clean and we had a good view from our window. The beds are really comfortable and the hotel is in an excellent location for sightseeing. The hotel bar is really nice and again the staff are very friendly. We ordered room service one night and the food that arrived wasnt very nice and very expensive but thats the only bad thing I would say about this hotel. Breakfast at Lindys diner down the street was excellent, I would recommend it. All in all, how long do u really spend in your hotel anyway? Youre in New York, get out there and stop complaining!!!

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault it!”
Reviews.Author: PhilDerby
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the other reviews on this hotel, I was rather wary about what to expect, although I knew this hotel was in an excellent location. I have to say, I could not find anything to complain about regarding this hotel. On arriving at the front desk, the staff were totally customer focussed. There was no queue to register; I asked for 2 rooms, on thesame floor, one with a double bed, one with twin beds, both with views overlooking 7th Ave - I got exactly that! Both rooms were clean, spacious and well decorated. We stayed for 3 nights and had a great vacation. When we go back to NYC, we will definitely be staying here again, and are recommending this hotel to our freinds.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel for the budget”
Reviews.Author: savannah606
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were nearly put off by all the bad reviews, but the deal on a weeks stay was too good to miss as our first trip to the USA. Hotel exceeded my low expectations in every way, amazingly polite and friendly staff - checked straight into the room at 2pm no waiting at all. The staff were helpful on all sorts of matters that might worry a first time visitor to new york and were better than in many 5* hotels. Large clean king bed, big room, big bathroom, big tv. The hotel gym was small but very modern and clean and an added bonus. I would advise against buying drinks in the bar as they were pricey but everything else suited perfectly. Location is superb, just perfect in my opinion if your doing a mix of theatre, shopping and sites you couldn't be better placed. Of course, there are more expensive, better hotels, but for the savings - well worth it in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Very Comfy Beds-Service Good”
Reviews.Author: mowgeli
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a NYC getaway in November. Stayed 4 nights at Park Central. The hotel was in a "can't be beat" location for NYC. The Gray Line siteseeing buses stop right at your door. Subway access for almost any line you need is either right at the corner or a very short block away. You are literally 3 blocks from Central Park. Starbucks right beside the lobby. Great little breakfast spot- cheap and quick right across the street- I believe it is called the Park Cafe. Also you have Europa Cafe just at the corner of 7/57. Great little bar/restaurant (french themed) one block over for martinis at 6/57th.You can walk everywhere from here. The hotel smells great the moment you slide through the revolving door. Clean and busy lobby. Service was completely fine for me at the front desk. In fact I made a joke about the comments on this site and they were aware and appeared to be taking the issue seriously. There was a problem with another client's luggage being lost at the baggage check, but the fellow made such a scene that security was called. The baggage check is run by a separate business, so just be aware of that. We had no problems- well taken care of. The room was clean, spacious for NYC standards and the bed was just perfect after a long day of siteseeing. The water pressure in the shower was a bit light, but passable. The maid I believe stole some hair product I left on the counter. This was very odd to me. She took nothing of value- just that. Perhaps she accidently threw it out???? Anyway- hide your hair products! Elevators- just a bit slow, but I have seen much worse. Overall, this was a great place to stay for the price. You get an unbeatable location and in NYC it's always location, location, location. Don't worry about this place at all. I would definitely stay here again anytime I come back to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “A great time for all!”
Reviews.Author: Jhelms2002
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I felt the hotel was just fine. We were concerned despite all the reviews. I was pleasantly surprised. It was not the nicest place I have stayed but by far not the worst. It was very clean, and comfortable even for 4 women. We had to call for more towels and recieved them quickly. They continued to leave us a stack of extras. We did not eat in the cafe' below but the food smelled yummy. We had the bellman take our luggage up from storage and they were there within 15 minutes. I would certainly consider staying there again. The location is great. Walk straight down the street to Times Square. Carnegie Hall is across the street, Central Park is 2 blocks away. The shops on 5th is great shopping at 2 streets over. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine”
Reviews.Author: backhomeagain
Reviews.Content: The reviews for this hotel seem so hit and miss we were worried what it would be like. We had a double room on the 7th floor and found it clean, tidy and comfortable. Although the decor looked a little dated, it wasn't shabby or dirty. Bed linen was spotless. I particularly checked the bathroom but no sign of mould anywhere and room service was efficient and left us clean again every morning. I guess it might depend what housekeeping team you have been allocated. We didn't find the lifts particularly slow either. The staff were fine- pleasant enough, not slow. I would have expected to pay for left luggage and $3.50 (only about £1.70) much cheaper than in the UK where you usually pay the equivalent of $8 (£4) at the main rail stations. The doorman organised a hotel car back to JFK for $55 inclusive of tolls etc. only $6 more than the official taxi fare in from the airport, worth the peace of mind. Before we travelled we heard of someone who was charged over $70 from a cab hailed in the street. The only downside was that the air con unit only blew out warm air. As it was Nov, it was easy enough to open the window. We faced into the 'courtyard' which was the brick wall someone else mentions and had no problems with noise- it was pretty typical for a central city hotel. The location was fantastic. We walked everywhere from here (5th Ave, Central Park, Times Sq, Macys) and only travelled on one of the open topped bus tours which, incidentally, stop outside the Park Central which is great on the way home. If you get a good rate under $200 a night, then location makes it value for money. One thing- the famous Carnegie Deli is next door. Rude and overpriced. Skip it and get a nicer, cheaper breakfast from Cafe Metro on the other side of the road towards Times Sq.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Aileendavies
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, good location. Also porters very helpful with bags and booking taxi for us on our last day, although the cynic in me says this was more in anticipation of their tip as there was no help available with the bags on the night we checked in. On arrival had to wait an inordinately long time for an extra bed (which had been pre-ordered) in the room. When after several trips to receiption it finally arrived, I had to make it up msyelf! Found the manager Dennis to be the least accommodating member of staff - and that's saying something! He conducted several telephone conversations whilst we were trying to talk to him. Rooms stuffy and very hot and not clean. Had a cockroach join me in the shower one morning and on the last day my horrified children saw at least another two. And they must have become very fond of us as one travelled home to Dublin in my suitcase with me. Unless it has major upgrading and a change of managerial staff, I would not recommend this hotel to anybody. It marred what was otherwise a very enjoyable first trip to New York for myself and my teenage daughters.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: sharon_sandom
Reviews.Content: Booked via Expedia and stayed 22-27 November 2007. Overall, not a pleasant experience for over $200 a night. The main negative points were: Wrong room allocated and would not change despite documentary proof of booking. View of brick wall. Room cleaned at 9pm after numerous complaints. Manager Dennis had a bad attitude and very poor communication skills. Dead flowers left in lobby. Charged $3.50 per item to store luggage Unreasonably slow elevators (20min from 10th floor to lobby typical at peak). Hot water turned off one afternoon. Airport Taxi booked but rate twice offical rate. Positive Points: Good location. In this case, you don't even get what you paid for! I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent at best”
Reviews.Author: dal13
Reviews.Content: Good priced? Yes, but be warned you get what you pay for and in this case that means terrible service. Our second room was clean, but the first was a disaster (stained comfortor, mold in sink, broken glass on floor just outisde room door). It is a good location if you want be near central park and times square. But this does not make up for lack of service on their part. When the part of our party checked in on Friday there was no one, I mean no one, behind the desk for 15 minutes. Then when someone did show up it took another 30 minutes to check in. One may say that 15 minutes is not that long to wait but when you are paying $300 a night that is unacceptable. Spend a little more and go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!!!”
Reviews.Author: CharKent
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at the Park Central Hotel in New York and absolutley loved it! The rooms were a good size and clean and the bed was huge!!! The tv was massive and me and my partner were very pleased with everything! The Hotel is right near Broadway but not to close that its noisy! I read reviews on here for alot of hotels before I went out there and I am so glad I choose here! I am def going back next Christmas time and will be staying here again! Dont be put off by reviews on here Im very fussy where I go and stay and believe me if you stay here youl have no problems youl love it we did!:-)xxxx

Reviews.Title: “Work in progress all the night!!!”
Reviews.Author: crigrasso
Reviews.Content: We pay a lot of money (500$ for night and more) but was impossible to sleep!!!! There was work in progress DURING ALL THE NIGHT on the face of the hotel buliding (stop only weekend) near my window and along all the building and I had to buy ears cork! I I protested but was useless, The only good thing of this hotel is the position, very good

Reviews.Title: “Terrbile experience”
Reviews.Author: Saygi
Reviews.Content: The employees ( front desk and Manager) are rude, unprofessional and not accommodating at all. First time in ten years ( I travel 2-3 times a month ) I have ever seen such bad service. It's a shame that hotels like this consider themselves good customer service. I would never recommend this Hotel to anyone. Especially with that personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Mold, Mildew and Dirt”
Reviews.Author: rovergirl15
Reviews.Content: My friend and I arrived at 3pm on a Wednesday afternoon and spent until 7:30 pm trying to get an acceptable room. 5 rooms later until a barely acceptable room appeared. All the rooms had mold in the grout and around the tub all over. Filthy marks and handprints all over the hotel room. Mold growing on the curtains in the window. When the supervisor from housekeeping came to 'personally inspect' our room, I asked her if her bath/shower looked like this at home and she looked at me horrified and said 'no'. I asked her if she would shower or bath in the presented bath/shower and again she stated 'no' so I asked her why they would expect us to. Management was appalling. The corporate junior twinkie finally came and tried to make things right. Only recieved $40 dollars a night off our $439.00 a night rate.....wow! Tried to get more seeing it was so disgusting but we got the 'I'm not authorized to do that" speech. Truly terrible hotel. The only thing going for it is it's location but unless you are willing to sleep and bathe in a germ infested room, don't even think about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Run far, far away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lousviews
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped out of our car and into the Park Central Hotel, we were treated poorly. I travel extensively and understand that people "have bad days" but the negative attitude was evident throughout the entire hotel, from the bellman, to reservationist, and general management to the dirty floors and decaying, urine smelling encrusted walls of the facility (which needs a huge renovation). The rooms were run down and extremely dirty, the A/C did not work, the phone was pulled out from the wall unit, and there was an stench that lingered throughout the room. There was mold and mildew on the tub and tile in the bathroom and after requesting a new room, the manager told us that it was not mold but the "grout reacting to the cleaning solution which made it look like mold" After requesting another room, the Front Desk Manager told us there were no more rooms available in our "room class" and we had to either take the room available or upgrade to a suite for an additional charge. We ended up leaving the hotel and staying at another hotel - which is exactly what you should do -- do NOT stay at this hotel. To make matters worse, when I received my credit card statement, Park Central had charged 2 nights stay and has refused to reconcile this.

Reviews.Title: “no complaints from the Roberts family, Wirral, UK”
Reviews.Author: BibleP
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Nov 2006 for 3 nights. We didnt find any fault with the hotel to be honest. We checked in quickly (maybe as it was 10pm). The room was smallish (to be expected in NY). Great big comfortable bed, though and we were at the back of the hotel so had no problems sleeping and great blackout curtains anyway! Perfect location to get to see everything. Park Cafe and Carnegie Deli very close by and both do fab breakfasts. Ate breakfast one morning in the hotel (only because hubby wanted to try eggs benedict), It was an average help yourself buffet, bit overpriced but ok. Red buses stop more or less outside and getting a taxi is easy esp with the help of the doorman (you cant miss him), fab! All in all, i would stay there again tho we are going back to NY this year but staying at a different hotel as there are so many to try.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: TBR13
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in 3 different hotels in NYC this year and this one is, by far, the worst experience we have had. The staff is rude and unaccomodating. We were 4 women traveling together with about 6 suitcases upon arrival, and noone would assist us with our bags. We were charged 3.50 per bag to store our luggage until our room was ready. The room was "okay", but very hot. We requested a fan twice. The second time we requested the fan, we were told very rudely, "we don't have any fans." Rude, Rude, Rude. The elevators were not all working so we had to wait in line to get upstairs everytime we tried to go up to our room. The bathroom in our room was tiny...but that is something we can deal with. The customer service at this place is horrible. And you can't just blame it on the fact that everyone thinks NYC folks are rude. Like I said, We have stayed at the Crowne Plaza and the Waldorf Astoria and had top notch service and the staff was extra friendly and went overboard to accomodate us in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Little to offer except location-- poor value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Frequenttraveler96
Reviews.Content: Am about to wrap up a 3 day long stay here. As someone who travels quite a bit, I was extremely disappointed by what is offered, particularly at this price point (+$550 for a room with king sized bed.) What was wrong? Where to start... - Inattentive, surly staff (from the young man who checked me in and told me, falsely, that no rooms with king sized beds were available and that I would have to take a room with twin beds-- despite the fact that I had booked well in advance. (After seeing the room and complaining, they miraculously found me a better room) to the concierge who was too busy telling one of the other staff about her date than to attend to guests) - Small, poorly equipped/kept rooms for the price (the 1st room had no table and dirty sheets and the second, while bigger, was lacking a clock and one of the phones was inoperable; hotel does not subscribe to any of the movie channels such as HBO) - Poorly working infrastructure (elevator banks not working, paint peeling from walls in the hallway and rooms) Although I'm returning to NY next week for work, I will NOT be coming back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central - Acceptable, but very pricey”
Reviews.Author: dlmyvette
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Central Hotel, NY November 3-5. In total for only 2 nights we spent a little over 1K. Our room had a King bed and since there were 3 of us, they gave us a roll out bed free of charge! The hotel itself was clean and room was clean as well! The room is small, but for 3 people (all adults) was acceptable. The only thing I wasn't too thrilled about was that the rooms were extremely hot. We called the front desk and they advised that the entire building is set for heat so there isn't any adjustments that can be done for the individual rooms. Therefore, we were stuck with the windows open the entire time so that we could get in some cooler air into the room. Still with the windows open, it was still somewhat warm, but survivable. We had to ask for extra blankets for one of our guests and the front desk had someone up very quickly. The hotel is located very close to the subway and there is a Starbucks next door. It is walking distance about 1 mile to Time Square and there are several places to eat nearby. All in all, I would recommend this place to others. I found that price was a bit expensive, but in NYC it is almost impossible to find places for less in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “some aspects very good but let down by front desk”
Reviews.Author: aoife_37
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of good things about this hotel but there are quite a few negative ones as well. Location is excellent. Hotel rooms are kept spotlessly clean , linen and towels are perfect and the cleaning people are really friendly and helpful. Hotel show signs of high use. In particular the airco unit iin our room was falling apart and refused to do anything but heat the room. Lights turned off late at night in the corridors ( to save electricity ? ) make the long walk to your room really creepy. Its a long walk because not all the elevators work which means long queues to get down to the lower levels. Watch out for the cucumber and aloe body lotion which is actually smelling of sweet almond. More cost-saving? Internet service is not dependable. The absolute worst thing about this hotel is the checkin desk. The first day I checked in I watched two separate groups have arguments at the counter that they didn't get the rooms they'd booked. They were not being helped in any way by the people at the counter and I have to say my own experience was extremely poor when we attempted to pay with more than one credit card at checkout. One card was charged twice and the receptionist was very sulky about changing it. This hotel also charges per piece for storing luggage for the day.

Reviews.Title: “good location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: kosampler
Reviews.Content: stayed here for four nights must be a good hotel as we didn,t need to contact any one about our stay good location close to central park and times square would recomend the following ,park cafe across the street ,great breakfast, the red bus tour which you get at times square,helicopter ride by helicopter flight services inc book this online before you go as you just cant walk in off the street and expect seats spare ,the lion king at the minskof theatre brilliant show also just enjoy the city new york is just amazing

Reviews.Title: “A special place . . .”
Reviews.Author: wayulooktonige
Reviews.Content: Having read several reviews, both negative and positive, I felt obliged to offer my opinions of our stay here. On arrival, we found the staff co-operative and friendly. The elevator was quick despite the apologies for any delays due to renovation. Our room was excellent. The king sized bed was extremely comfortable, the bathroom was very clean and the widescreen TV was impressive. We couldn't hear a thing outside, presumably because our room was not facing 7th Ave. Staff at the restaurant and in the lobby on our departure were once more accommodating and efficient. The hotel is in a brilliant location, just a stone's throw from Central Park and a brief stroll down to Times Square. Nearby we found an excellent Irish Bar called Carney's and had a fantastic, value for money breakfast at 'la Parisienne' restaurant on 7th Ave. on the way to Central Park. Our holiday in this fantastic city was definitely enhanced by our stay at the Park Central Hotel. Nigel and Lisa, Lancashire, England

Reviews.Title: “The worst service I have received in a while!”
Reviews.Author: sielay
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one week, and quite frankly, it will be the last time we stay here. The customer service was shocking! You phone up the number that they have for the business centre to ask them a question and they have no clue and tell you you have to go there and find out for yourself. You call to fix the air con and they dont turn up. You need to use the internet and the service is down. May be it was just bad luck, but it certainly wasnt the 9 out of ten or above that they strive for on their marketing materials!

Reviews.Title: “Superior King Room reservation not honored”
Reviews.Author: adoreballet
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room by direct telephone to their reservationist early in September for 3 nights over a weekend in mid October. I wanted a specious guest room as advertised on their website. I was quoted a price for a standard room but opted to upgrade to a Superior King. When we got there late Friday night from our flight from the West Coast I was told that we would be given a “corner room,” and my reservation for a superior room was meaningless. Their policy for room accommodations was “first come, first served.” Our corner room was small and beatup looking. The wallpaper was peeling and the bathroom door wouldn’t shut completely. It reeked of smoke but a nonsmoking sign had been placed in the room. On the upside, the location was good and it was quite.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay At Park Central”
Reviews.Author: oldfaithful74
Reviews.Content: I booked the Park Central Hotel on line only a couple of weeks before we travelled to NYC and was a little unsure what to expect based on the mixed reviews....... But me and the missus loved our stay at the Park Central. The location is fantastic - just inbetween Central Park and Times Square. The rooms were well sized and very clean. The key thing for us wasa the bed was massive and very comfortable (which is a necessity after spending three days walking around and seeing the sights!) The staff were nice and helpful. All in all, I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: BGI99
Reviews.Content: There was nothing specail about this hotel. The rooms were below average and looked a little old, however they were very clean. I would recommend this hotel only if a rock bottom price was achieved or if you are not too fussy. I stayed here for 2 nights while attending a conference and although it suited its purpose I dont think I would stay here for a personal trip. Check in ok and check out also ok.......

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kooksy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Good location and good price. I will be staying here again. The rooms are a good size the NYC. I didn't eat in the hotel, only used the concierge to book some theatre tickets and he was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Big Midtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Buben
Reviews.Content: NYC in the Fall of 2007 has been an expensive place to travel to on business. This hotel room cost a shocking $500 (booked at last minute for work). It is a pretty basic place (think the equivalent of a Ramada Inn being put near Times Square). Location is near Times Square, and if this is where you want to be, it's not a bad location. Room was a little grungy, and the service at the desk was terrible (there were at least 10 people in line for check in at around 8 pm, and only two people helping, while I saw three or so others lounging about and gossiping.) This place struck me as the kind of place bus tours would book or that you would get if you booked a cheap package deal. I can't say anything extremely bad about it -- but it was just a place to stay and not an experience.

Reviews.Title: “Even better this time”
Reviews.Author: Valensander
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Central again and was not dissapointed! The room we got was even better than last time: Spacious, very clean, good bathroom and flat-screen TV. The location is perfect and after seeing the pictures of hotelrooms in other hotels: very, very good quality for a reasonable price in New York. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you like good service”
Reviews.Author: thaurbangypsy
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment! Considering how much this hotel cost you’d think the least you could get was a friendly check in! My stay here was a stressful one and if it weren’t for the front desk director who was helpful upon check out, I would have nothing good to say. Although the hotel is close to many NY sites (Times Square, Broadway, etc.) I would not recommend it. The rooms are small and noisy (you can hear your neighbours next door sneezing, coughing and more!), the windows do not open, the bathroom left many luxuries including large towels to be desired. The elevators are very slow so if you stay remember to leave your room 5 minutes early – you will be waiting for at least that. Nearby site photos are included.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oslextor
Reviews.Content: We (a family of 12 - 6 adults and 6 children, travelling from Spain and Denmark) stay in the hotel four nights in Easter. We were a little bit worried after reading some of the negative reviews. But we had a great stay. We checked in quite fast and without problems. The rooms were fine. Clean, good beds, big tv. We were 12, ages 4 to 75, and none of us had a single compain during the stay. We had just spent some days in the Hilton in Washington DC, and the kids thought this hotel was much better. Great location. We ate breakfast at the hotel and it was ok. The only minus was that they tried to charg eus the breakfast, although this was include din the rooms price. But the hotel solved the problem inmediately. They have a service desk and all our questions were attended fast, precisely and with a smile. If I go back to NY I will definetively stay again the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: jonesm99
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days at the Park Central and had a great stay. It's a couple of blocks south of Central Park and a few blocks north of Times Square and Broadway. There are a lot of great restauarant choices around as well. The hotel was clean and well maintained. No noise complaints either (except a little traffic noise, but that's hard to escape in New York!). There were 3 or 4 different subway entrances within a couple of blocks of the hotel. We had a great time there!

Reviews.Title: “Drab Dark but not so dreadful”
Reviews.Author: 2409NELLIE
Reviews.Content: Re reading previous reviews I have to agree with most of them. Yes it is a very tired and drab mediocre hotel.I also agree that it isn't the worst I have stayed in but it is the most OVERPRICED hotel that I have.Our room was dark in fact you had to put a light on at any time of day,the bathrooms were worn out ,needed a renovation desperately.The carpets were in a sorry and aged looking state and the towels a fraction on the grey side. But it,s not all BAD.The beds are reasonably comfy(pillows really comfy)TV huge.LOCATION THE BEST.!!Within easy reach of mostly everything that you could want.What it really boils down to is how long are you going to stay in there.We spent very little time in our room and were exhausted when we did get in so to us it was'nt that important.But if you have intentions of lounging around --Stay Away--it's not for you.I did many hours of research looking for hotel rooms and this was one of the cheapest for a 3 star for the period we wanted.I cannot comment on the front desk had very little to do with them.Also did not eat in the dining room as I had read it was not so good but I never saw more than 6 people in there.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not brilliant.”
Reviews.Author: Hammertime63
Reviews.Content: On first arriving at the hotel it looked quite nice though a little dated. Checking in was fast and simple with the staff being more friendly than some comments on this forum would suggest. We booked a Supreme double double, where they got the supreme bit from I will never know, very basic is what comes to mind. On first entering our room we was both taken aback of how dirty the room actually was, mold on the bathroom ceiling and what looked like pubic airs in the bath, before unpacking there was only one thing in mind and that was to get out of this room ASAP. I immediately went to the check in desk, told them the problems and straight away without any arguments was given another room by the very helpful Woman behind the desk, this one was ten times cleaner than the previous. I think maybe they must try get rid of this room all the time hoping that some poor guest will just accept it, No 344 I think it was so beware!. After all this our stay was ok, although one day we did have one uninvited guest, a Mr Cockroach, he didnt last that long I hasten to add and he didnt return, maybe he went back to room 344 where he would have been more suited. Room service could have been better, we had to request for the room to be vacuumed, if we had'nt I think they would have left it all week. Room service trolleys are left in the corridors all the time day and night, even when not being used, I would have thought there are storage areas for these but obviously not. Because there is no Tea and Coffee making facilities in the rooms there were lots of take-away bags left outside the rooms which in my opinion is the reason for the cockroaches. This was our forth stay in the big apple and just as enjoyable as all the others, nothing would have ruined this trip for us, New York is just fantastic. As hotels go there is plenty of room for improvement, theres worse to be had and definately better ones, we stayed at the Hilton for Christmas and that was fantastic, the Park Central is, I'm afraid, passable but not brilliant. Will we return?, only if the better ones are full.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job, nice location”
Reviews.Author: ElaineCSmith
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a group of 3 at the Park Central Hotel for 5 nights in mid September... Although we had a little delay with checking in, the member of staff on hand was most helpful (she later turned out to be one of very few who actually was). After finally getting into our room, I found it to be of reasonable size and very clean. We had two 'double' beds that were actually a bit smaller than I first thought they'd be but would still sleep two petite people comfortably. In addition, after one or two nights, I began to notice the room was very damp feeling - perhaps an ode to the outside humidity but nonetheless quite irritating. The hotel was in a great location, with many deli's and shops near-by... not to mention being a stone's throw away from Central Park and Times Square etc. On the whole, the service was reasonable but I'd have expected a little more for the price. Also, not all of the staff were as helpful as they could have been. Frankly, one or two could do with being re-trained in customer service/relations. To sum up, I'd say its a better idea to shop around a bit for other hotels in this price range, however, for sheer location its probably worth what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “bad experience for a very steep price”
Reviews.Author: advisor91
Reviews.Content: Service is not great (some nice people but useless).I was sent first to a room already occupied (door opened, bed undone and a laptop on the desk!!).I mentionned that to the front desk but got unnoticed. The telephone in the other room did not work properly and the operator did not answered (I could only dial operator). Went downstairs to be told to go to the restaurant to order my dinner. Did that and waited an hour to get the meal I ordered. The food was bad (looked like canteen foodl) and the accompanying bread was from the day before ( cost of the meal 35$!!). The room was noisy (the air conditioning was close to the bed!). The only good things are the confortable bed (if you wear ear plugs) , the nice TV and a nice location. The gym is nice too. Conclusion: avoid unless you do not mind to pay 495$ a night. Avoid the restaurant of the hotel (priority number 1)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lthomso4
Reviews.Content: We booked the Park Central Hotel last minute through expedia when we arrived in New York after checking in and then checking out of the Wellington Hotel within five minutes. Minutes after booking we crossed the road and were amazed to see that our booking had already been received and processed by the hotel. We got a great deal a King Deluxe room which was spacious, modern and clean. This is a three star hotel and I would certainly recommend booking the King Sized Room. Faultless hotel which was a pleasure to return to after long days sightseeing and shopping ....

Reviews.Title: “Not Perfect but very good for the price.”
Reviews.Author: rayboy
Reviews.Content: Hotel was not without issues but I thought it was an excellent value and nice location. Pros: Price, room size, lobby, ammenities, some service. Con's: Fees for business center, hair dryer only works on low, spotty service when calling front desk, left off top sheet when making the bed, bit pricey at the attached bar. Bottom line: Nice location and a good property for the price. Service very good in some ways and spotty in others but they seem to be trying. Rooms large by NYC standards and clean, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Curled Lip...”
Reviews.Author: johneddavies
Reviews.Content: What in god's name do people want? My wife and I stayed here twice because it's a perfectly decent, pleasant, convenient hotel. I thought it was just nice, as in a nice cup of tea nice. I'm incredulous regarding the damning reviews.... Hell's teeth ... It's fine. Non whinging Brits don't worry. It's a lot better than a 2* b and B in LLandudno .... I need a drink ........

Reviews.Title: “All things considered - a good choice!”
Reviews.Author: DRJHalifax_Canada
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights late Aug. 2007. Front desk very accommodating - asked for non-smoking room on higher floor (superior double) with a view and got it - stayed on 15th floor. Room was very clean (except for a bit of mould on the sheer drapes above the air conditioning Unit). Asked for extra towels and got them every day. Soaps and shampoos were replenished daily, along with extra kleenex and toilet tissue. The bed was comfortable, room-size adequate and flat screen TV was a nice touch. The Location was excellent - close proximity to Central Park, subways, Times Square, St. Pat's Cathedral, & too many delis to mention. I was a little leary of this Hotel because of some of the reviews, but I would definitely stay here again. Minor problem with the elevator and the one time there was a major delay, there was a phone on the table in front of the elevator and there was immediate assistance. Concierge desk very friendly and helpful. All this for approx. $200 a night! (Thanks, Expedia & booking about a month ahead). Only other negative was there being no temperature control in the room, it was extremely warm in New York and the temp in the room was OK, but could have been just a bit cooler. All in all - a very good hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Acceptable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: DonGregorio
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine. I stayed 5 nights Everything worked good and the room was comfortable. It wasn't the best nor worst hotel I've ever been in , but I certainly wouldn't say anything bad about it. Beds were good. Don't mistake the housekeeping staff as rude. I think most guests treat them pretty poorly. A little chit-chat and they're like your long lost family! We had regular, good housekeeping service each day. Hotel has good central location in Manhattan. Subway stop on the corner, others within a couple of blocks. I didn't try the restaurant, from the menu it looked expensive ($17.00 for bacon & eggs). Go to the Cafe Europa a block north toward the park- you can get a nice breakfast there pretty cheap. Ray's pizza is catty-corner across the street. Friendly staff and really good pizza! Lot of small deli's within a block or two to pick up a beer and German chocolate on the way back to the room, too. Also, before buying the hotel's wireless internet access, check the available networks on your computer from your room. Midtown Manhattan is full of WAP's, I logged on to someone's unsecured network and did all my browsing for free!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CommodoreK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Park Central Hotel from 8/19-8/23, 2007. - We arrived around noon on Sunday, our room wasn't ready, but we did a pre-check-in and checked our bags for free - The room size was ample, King bed was extremely comfortable, TV was very good, bathroom and shower good, maid service good, desk, lounge staff and bellmen helpful and friendly - The location of the hotel is excellent: Subway lines, decent restaurants, Late Show w/Letterman, Central Park/carriage rides are all within 3 blocks, Rockefeller Center, 5th Ave shopping, Times Square are all within 15-30 minutes walking, we even walked to the Whitney Museum through Central Park - about 30 minutes. - We checked out at 5:30am and cabs were already lined up outside for the ride to LaGuardia

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rahil190
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, not too far from Times Square, 3 blocks from Central Park, Letterman Show around the corner, subway/restraunts all close by. Hotel Lobby is nice, staff courteous, rooms were clean and comfortable beds. The negatives are that the rooms are kinda small and there is nothing impressive or memorable about the rooms themselves. Would stay at hotel again if I got a good room rate.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, will be back”
Reviews.Author: NJSteph24
Reviews.Content: stayed at Park Central July 6-7, traveling for fun. $200 total including all taxes. I had a room on the second to last floor (I had requested a room above 7th floor as I heard these were un-renovated yet at the time). The room was very spacious for NYC with a king bed and a flat screen tv and a little nook for work. Bathroom was new and clean, bed was very comfortable. I was happy with the cleanliness of the room, and it looked exactly like the pictures on the website. The staff was helpful during check-in and check out. Location was great in midtown, and I liked the little panini shops on the street with delicious canolis for inexpensive lunches (about 7 for delicious panini and a drink). The elevators took a long time bec. they were working on them, but that didn't bother me. I will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good & Not So Good”
Reviews.Author: FCAT247
Reviews.Content: Park Central was not the best hotel I've stayed , but is was not the worst . Because of where it's located we expected much better. The hotel is close to EVERYTHING and there was always something going on, even America's Next Top Model auditions. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Kudos to Kurt! I was disappointed that there were not the same amenities that I find in the hotels in the south, i.e. free internet, coffee pots in the rooms, excellent maid service. I would recommend this hotel if you just need a place to sleep (the beds were wonderful) , bathe, and change clothes. But if you are looking for space and luxury, look some place else.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel...but a little creepy...”
Reviews.Author: gladm26
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The location couldn't be any better...steps from Central Park, Times Square, Fifth Avenue, Radio City, Rockefeller Plaza....loved it! Yet, during my stay creepy things happended in our room...blankets lifted off our bed in the night and felt like you were being constantly stared at...other than that it was a awesome hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: sportsman39
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at the Sheraton NY when in NY. I expected The Park Central to be equal to or better than this one. I found the room small, the staff very dis-courteous, and had trouble every day getting towels, etc. I found the park central very over rated. I wouldn't give it more than two stars. It is certainly not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Guest Service below par”
Reviews.Author: sweetestsin
Reviews.Content: This was a mother-daughter trip to NY. We arrived early and were able to checkin, however after unpacking we noticed mold on the bedroom ceiling. We were leaving for lunch but stopped at the desk to inform them. They said they could move us to a new room and they would 'ready that room for another guest' . No apology or concern shown and the fact that we were told they would just place another guest into that room was concerning (bad enough another guest will just be put into the room, but don't share that fact with the other guests!) [we dealt with a Mr. Williams who seemed to possibly be a Guest Services Manager but obviously needs futher training on guest relations]. The new room wasn't ready but they let us store our bags complimentary (we had to store them after checking out at a rate of $3.75/bag!!!!!). I had forgotten a toothbrush, but when we returned to the hotel that night the front desk brought a complimentary one up to my room (when I answered the door the person just handed me the toothbrush while talking on his cell phone and walked away.. usually I would tip for a delivery like this..). When I went to wash my face there were no face cloths. My mother said there were also no face cloths when she had stayed the year before. I called down to the desk, and the front desk agent seemed quite annoyed that I was calling with another request.. but after a large sigh said he would send them up. They never came.... until 9am the next morning. The second morning of our stay, the used face clothes had been taken away, but never replaced... at this point, we just decided to use the handtowels as face cloths. The Park Central and its team definitely failed my expectations but the hotel itself and location were good, other than the feeling that we were staying at a hotel that could care less about their guests... (maybe because this is a high traffic hotel and they are not concerned with encouraging repeat guests or bad reviews). The rooms were ok, the first one was small, but the second was larger and the flat screens are nice. Bellmen and doormen are very helpful. Next year we'll be staying at the Sheraton New York. Tip: if you are going to be going to LAG airport, the Park Central offers a car service that is approx $45 including toll charge, tip, etc. Taking a taxi will work out to be almost equivalent, minus the better car, air conditioning, etc.... so opt for the car service!

Reviews.Title: “minimalist”
Reviews.Author: AlfredAustria
Reviews.Content: I spent 8 nights in a not too big room with an acceptable bathroom. It is a kind of minimalist hotel with in my opinion good furniture. Check in and check out was great (but you really should ask for a room to the streets). My room was cleaned every day between 11and 12(tip). Elevators were no problem. Tha staff was friendly and the bartender helpful. The building is old but with a certain style. There is one thing I want to point out: the complete block is under construction during summertime.Really ugly. Avoid the restaurant, there are better ones around( don't go to Benash). But the main thing I finally was comfortable with this house is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: af847
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of bad reviews of this hotel. I was a little concerned about staying there. But it was great! Beautiful lobby, efficient service, friendly staff and - best of all: nice room! I mean the room was BIG when compared to what you normally get in NY. Everything was clean. Sure, a tiny bit of wallpaper was peeling off in the bathroom. But so what - who even cares? The room was comfy and quiet. Can't beat the location. I'd definately stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected, at all”
Reviews.Author: Lady_Jedi
Reviews.Content: Please take what I have to say & use it how you wish. I/we, travel a lot, but what seems to be important or irritating to one person, may not matter to another. The Park Central is located in a lovely section, near Central Park, Columbus Circle & Carnegie Hall. In hearing this, I assumed it would be more upscale & the service would have been outstanding. I was wrong. The website does a wonderful job of supplying an interactive map for your navigation to various sights & sounds of the area. The hotel staff, however doesn't really care if you have enjoyed your stay, or if you need any help. We arrived early, about noon, which we knew we would, but that was out of our control. The lobby was full of people waiting to check in or waiting on transportation from checking out. The lobby actually looked like it was being used as some type of refugee shelter due to the number of people waiting with all of their luggage. There wasn't anywhere to sit, or really stand comfortably. We were told that our room wouldn't be available until 4pm, which in itself is rediculous, but what can you do?
