They stored our luggage for us, and we headed out to investigate the area. My husband has been here for business a number of times. This the first time for myself & my daughter. We window shopped up & down 5th avenue for 4 hours, then headed back to the hotel to check in. We were tired, (had been awake since 3am to travel) and wanted to freshen up & change our clothing. Again, we were told that our room wasn't ready. It was now after 4pm. The three of us sat in the lobby lounge waiting. After about an hour of waiting, and of course a beverage, because "you cannot just sit there, you have to order something", we were told our room was ready. We went up to our room, which was nothing spectacular. Our "view" was of a brick wall for the neighboring building. The closet door couldn't be opend all the way, as it would hit the bed. The bathroom was roomy, but offered nothing in the way of vanity space, I had to shut the lid on the toilet & use that as a holding place for my facial cleansers & cosmetics while getting ready. We went back out, enjoied our time, then went back to the hotel to sleep. The heat/air conditioning was not working properly. The room was very stuffy, so my husband looked at it and discovered the filter was so clogged that no air could flow. He removed the filter, set it off to the side, and we had air flow, and some comfort. After traveling & staying out as late as we did our first day, we didn't wake up early. At 10am the cleaning staff would have barged into our room if we hadn't had the latch flipped, which is interesting to me since I had to wait until after 5pm the night before to even get into a room. They didn't knock on the door or anything. I am accustomed to a knock or tap on the door, someone saying that they are from the cleaning staff or something, and waiting for a response. Not at Park Central Hotel, they just barge in, unannounced. When I got to the door I appologized and said that we were still sleeping. She snapped at me & said, "You are supposed to put the "thing" on the door. I have to make a report of who is in & who is out!" I apologized again, put the do not disturb on the door, told her we didn't need anything or cleaning for that day. So, we got up and started our day. When we returned to the hotel, they had been in the room!! Even after the conversation earlier, they still went in our room. It wasn't cleaned though. The trash hadn't been emptied, the filter for the heating & air was still sitting right in front of the unit & the coffee supplies were not replentished, they had even left a 1/2 drank coffee on the desk! The next day we went out, specificly said we wanted our room cleaned, and again, only half done, no coffee supplies, but they had cleaned the coffee area & coffee maker, air filter still in the same spot as before. Our last day, Monday, my husband had his meetings, & our daughter & I were on our own. She & I headed off to Chinatown & Little Italy. It was rainy that day, very rainy, the entire day, but we weren't going to miss these shopping opportunities. Spent our day out, got back to the hotel about 8pm, to find the air filter still in the same spot, the coffee supplies not replentished, and the trash very very full. We wanted to order "New York Style Pizza" & stay in for the night, getting ready to leave in the morning. So I called the consierge desk, which ony has 8-5 hours and it was about 8:30pm. So then I called the front desk to get their suggestion on where to order from. I waited on hold for 5 minutes, the lady came back on & gave me a name & number, I thanked her, we hung up. My daughter & I discussed our days events for about 15/20 minutes then decided ro order our pizza. The number the front desk gave me had been disconnected. SO, not too much help thier either. This was the only time I called the front desk our entire stay, so they failed completely. The cleaning staff didn't fail completely, but they did fail, in my opinion. Remember, this is only my opinion, someone else may not even mention some of what I found to be bothersome. It is all perspective. Would I stay in this hotel again? I don't know. This was set up for us by the company my husband had meetings with. The city is wonderful, there is so much to see & do, literally never sleeps. One other thing I would like to mention is that I have always heard how New Yorkers are rude. This is completely incorrect. At least from the experience I had. The people we encountered that were rude were the other tourists. This was a very interesting discovery to me. Every New Yorker that we encountered, outside of Park Central Hotel was polite, helpful and at least smiling & cheerful. I didn't encounter any gruff persons, other then inside the hotel. As far as getting my "New York Style" Pizza, we had pizza, but I am not sure if it was a classic noew york style, you know?

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: ChloehAustralia
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent business traveller to NYC and I was booked into this hotel by our travel agent. It is old, dirty, the heating does not working properly and the staff and rude. This is a two star backpacker standard accomondation. Stay away, pictures on website deceptive.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mel1707
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Central for 4 nights in Feb this year. After reading all the TripAdvisor reviews we werent expecting much, but it was in our budget ($220 per night on expedia). Well we were so suprised! What a fantastic hotel! We arrived 5 hours before check in and they made a room available to us immediately. The room was rather large with new carpet and furniture and a great flat screen TV, however, who really goes to New York to watch Tv? The location was probably the best in the city, within minutes to both Times Square and Central Park. We did not eat at the restaurant as it seemed expensive, but there were some great deli's and diners just down the street and a Starbucks next door. I am a very picky traveller, who is very particular about cleanliness, but I would not fault the Park Central for a moment, its the only place I'd stay when returning to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: LuxHols
Reviews.Content: A friend and I got a great deal to stay here for 5 nights a few years ago by contacting the hotel directly. It was 2003 (catching up on reviews at the moment) when we stayed there so it may have changed for better or worse since then. The twin room we got was very comfortable and clean and the bathroom was very big. We were facing the street so the noise was loud but that is to be expected in NY. We ate out every night so didn't sample the menu in the hotel though we did check the place out and felt we got better value for our meals out. I find that most of the prices in NY are very high for places that are overated and you could be paying hundreds for a terrible place. For the price we paid at the time for the Park Central it was well worth it and if I got a similar price (or even a bit more) I wouldn't mind staying here again when if I visit NY.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: dem1an
Reviews.Content: The customer service is terrible at this hotel. From arrogant customer diservice to negligence of service requests to being cheap on replacing the soap in your room. I'd rather stay at a budget Hampton Inn. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Park Central”
Reviews.Author: PopsBeBe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were visiting in Conn. and won tickets to the David Letterman Show, so we decided to spend the night in New York. I found Park Central on the internet and got a great last minute deal. Our stay was very pleasant. We needed towels, and they were brought promptly to our room. The staff was pleasant and friendly. Our room was plenty spacious. There's a great restaurant across the street on the corner named Park Cafe, and they have delicious food, reasonably priced. The hotel is close to the Theatre District, and Carnegie Hall is across the street. We walked everywhere we needed to go and also took a night tour of NYC on the Gray-line Bus Tour. I highly recommend this hotel. Photos are attached.

Reviews.Title: “staff at Park Central went over and beyond”
Reviews.Author: pierreTexas
Reviews.Content: we stayed for four nights last week and the young woman in the business center went beyond the call of duty to help us with a travel request. Also the hotel staff took care of an unusual need when one of our pillows from home was accidentally taken with the laundry. They searched the linens for us and returned the pillow to our room promptly. The hotel is clean and is in a great location and all of the employees were friendly and helpful. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Large TV and Comfy Bed”
Reviews.Author: SmilingOwl
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation at The Manhattan Club that was messed up by their staff. Before we could get it straight, we found ourselves here for a couple of nights. Once straightened out, we moved into our room at the Manhattan Club and wanted to return to this one! Our room was large and clean and the bed was very comfortable. The TV was a nice new larger one in the room...bathroom was clean and towels were nice. I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing for a comfortable stay in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: hdblue
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business for 2 days. The room was ok, nothing special. The rooms and the hotel are a bit dated and worn. The bed was a little uncomfortable and a little old. The AC works but if you like a cool room it isnt going to get there. The hotel is in a good location and the rates are pretty good for a NY city hotel, but you arent going to be very impressed with the hotel. Its not a bad hotel but you would expect a little more based on what the web site looks like. If you can do some bargin shopping for better time square hotels you should, there are some fantastic hotels in the area, this isnt one of them. You wont be completely disappointed but there is nothing at this hotel that will impress you either. All the little things you look for in a full service hotel such as a newspaper in the morning, your bill under the door, furnishings in good order and reliable internet are not here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sashleah
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to NYC and my wife's second time and we decided to find somewhere which was closer to Central Park as my wife never made it there on her last visit. The hotel was situated 3 blocks from Central Park (Kinda in the hotel name) and it had everything we needed. We were staying for a week and I looked for hotel sizes due to the length of our stay and this was the biggest room for our budget. The room was on the 12th floor and was remarkably quiet. The room had a great queen size bed, a medium sized bathroom which was fine with plenty hot water, a safe in the room, a flat screen TV with pay per view movies (useful when jet lagged) and air conditioning. The rooms were very clean and the staff were very helpful. The great thing about this hotel is the location. You are about 10 minute walk to Time Square, 2 minutes from broadway, 5 minutes from the peaceful sorroundings of Central Park. The uptown and downtown bus tour stops right outside the front door which is handy after a day of sight seeing. The best thing about the location of the hotel is the subway station as soon as you walk outside. you can get any train downtown and they are cheap and safe. There are great 24 hour diners nearby and for that kickstart in the morning, a Starbucks next door and the hotel staff were OK with you taking the coffee to your room. I would definately stay here when we return to New York as it was a great base for our fantastic trip.

Reviews.Title: “big rooms!”
Reviews.Author: dublingirlIreland
Reviews.Content: i have been to new york four times and i have stayed in this hotel twice, in feb 06 and jan 07. the first time wth my boyfriend and the second time with three girlfriends. both of these times our plan was to sightsee, shop, shop, go out to the theatre and bars. i would and have recommended this hotel to friends. the rooms are very big by new york standards. and we had a LOT of shopping!! its not fancy but who goes to new york to sit in their hotel room?? i would consider this hotel to be good value for money especially considering the location. right along a main avenue, two mins walk to central pk and five mins to time sq., tourist bus stops outside, subway is on the corner. had one small problem, when i and my three friends were there in Jan 07 we booked two twin rooms, however two of us received a double room. i was glad we were changing it as the room did not look good, ceiling paint hanging off etc. the two rooms that we did get were perfect though, two double beds in each and lots of space. never ate in the restaraunt in this hotel, seems pricey, but then we were happy to go to a different restaraunt every night just to experience new york dining!! all in all, perfect for couples looking to explore the city and friends on a shopping/sightseeing holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2Busy2
Reviews.Content: Though my room looked clean at first I discovered it was beyond dirty. My sheet had fresh blood smears and used towels hidden on the bottom rack. It's almost impossible to get managment's attention and when you do you wish you hadn't. The front door staff could use some customer service training but the bell and security staff were great. Not to mention the professionalism of the some of the front desk staff and Mr. Williams, who is the only person in mgmt that seems to care about the guests. As one of the hotel workers stated, "I wouldn't stay here for anything." I suggest you take that advice.

Reviews.Title: “Car damaged by Valet service”
Reviews.Author: ta_m17Massacusetts
Reviews.Content: We discovered at checkout time that our new car had a dent in the side. The valet service claimed it was there when we dropped it off. They refused to re-imburse for the damage. They did not inspect the car and ask us to signoff on any damage at dropoff ( which there was none ). The hotel did not offer any useful assistance with this matter.

Reviews.Title: “More than OK”
Reviews.Author: kaleg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in April when visiting New York for a family wedding. I was slightly apprehensive as although I usually find US hotel star ratings to be better than their equivalent in the UK ( e.g. a US 4 * will be more like a UK 5* ) we did have a dreadful experience last year of a Washington 3* hotel that I am sure would not merit any rating whatsoever here in the UK! However I need not have worried. We got what we had requested - 2 double beds in a non-smoking room. It was not on a high floor but I had not asked for it to be as I didn't intend to fly across the Atlantic to spend a weekend staring out of a window! The room was large, clean and in a good state of repair. Some people seem to expect hotels to re-decorate a room especially for their visit. True it wasn't ready for us on arrival at 2pm which would have been welcome as we were just a little tired and grubby but it was ready at 4pm as we were promised. The first night we were disturbed a bit by what we later found to be the metal plates on the road as vehicles passed over them but that cannot be blamed on the hotel. When we stayed at the Park Central there were lots of teenage American youngsters staying ( I believe there was a choir competition at Carnegie Hall ). On our last night a group of them gathered in the corridor talking and laughing until nearly 1am. I'm pretty sure they were not drunk but simply in high spirits and with young abandon did not realise they were creating a disturbance. Again this was not the fault of the hotel. However I phoned Reception who apologised and said that they would sort it. Within 5 minutes we heard a Security man politely point out to the youngsters that they were making too much noise and they immediately disbanded. My only bad thing to say is that when we were in the lobby with our suitcases having checked out we were approached or should I say pestered by several of the hotel's porters offering to get us a taxi to the airport at prices that I knew to be far in excess of the official Yellow Cab rate. They tried to tell us that the fixed fare only applied from JFK, not to it. To be honest they were a real nuisance and the hotel should 'rein in' their employees who are obviously out to fleece the hotel''s guests. We however asked the doorman to pull a cab over and of course the fare was the official fixed rate. All in all this hotel is more than OK and I'm speaking as a fussy middle aged Brit!

Reviews.Title: “Park Central was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: jatee1
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend in New York and I had the opportunity to stay at the GORGEOUS Park Central Hotel on 7th Avenue. The attendants were quite polite and helpful and my room (a king with a sizable sitting area) was clean and spacious. Apparently, the hotel is in the middle of some upgrading (construction was going on right in front of the elevators during the worst possible time during the day), but all things considered, it was great! I was admittedly concerned after reading some other reviews, but I need not have been. For as much time as I spent in the hotel, I was MORE than pleased!!! And given the rates for other hotels I've had the opportunity to stay in during other NY trips, I DEFINITELY know I had a great deal! ($189 per night!!!!)

Reviews.Title: “not happy”
Reviews.Author: booking6
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel since a trade show was being held in the basement. The room looks okay but quickly the problems show. Worn out towels, tired mattress, few electrical outlets, long walk to ice machine, hear the neighbors easily, loud slamming doors. My key stopped working midway through the stay, which was especially a hassle since the elevators are so slow. I waited 15 minutes for it to arrive...while a line of my floor developed waiting their turn to squeeze into the crowded elevator. One of the four elevators seems permanatly broken. Drywall work was being done on the lobby level so debris was scattered all of the elevator and tracked through the carpet on each floor as people exited the elevator. The ballroom area is a disaster. Complete disarray, smells awful. Rumor is this area used to house a swimming pool...I belive it. $1.25 to dial a 1800 number. A couple of odd things happened with security in my room...certainly unsettling. There are many better choices in New York. Avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “more than fine”
Reviews.Author: 123travelAustralia
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Park Central for 5 days and nights and were pleased with the experience. We arrived early at 2pm and were given complimentary tickets for the baggage storage, usually $3 per item (note they do charge you should you need this facility on the day you check out) The guys outside are classic new yorkers, a bit rough round the edges but dont you need to be if you spend your day managing the in and outs of a busy midtown hotel? They were happy to provide subway directions and useful advice on getting to the airports. Our room was clean and tidy with good size bathroom, big tv and comfy bed. The cleaning staff were all pleasant and happy to clean your room late in the day for those of us with jetlag! There is some renovation going on but it doesnt impact on your stay and should you ever need assistance in your room, the response is speedy,(we lost the key to our suitcase and they arrived in minutes to unlock it for us) In my opinion this is a steady, safe bet for a hotel in midtown, its near to the subway and really close to Times Square which can either be a good or bad thing depending on what you like! Central Park is just a 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “great location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: gudinuf
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for six nights in November of last year and I have to say I was very impressed. Having lived in Manhattan before I was expecting the worst, especially after reading the reviews on here but I was presently surprised. We booked a king room and that was what we got. It was on the 10th floor but didn't have a view. It was very clean, with a great flat screen lcd. The staff were also very helpful. The only point I'd take issue with is the bathroom, compared to the rest of the room it wasn't great. Very old fashioned and seemed to have plastic finishes on the counter tops. Looked very cheap and nasty. Also, the light in the bath didn't work and despite pointing it out a few times to reception they didn't fix it. As it wasn't a big deal however we let it lie. All in all a great hotel, as you're only going to be resting your head in NYC it was perfect, and for the nights we needed to stay in it was also perfect. I really would recommend people to stay here, just make sure you book a superior room and make sure you get it.

Reviews.Title: “HELL HOLE!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shebaNewYork
Reviews.Content: This is possibly the worst hotel on the planet. First of all, they say check in is at 4pm. We got there at 445 to an ugly lobby packed with weary travelers. We waited on line to check in and when we finally got to a front desk person he said the rooms were not ready yet. We then waited on line again and tried to check in at exactly 456 and he said that the rooms were STILL not ready, that we would have to wait on line AGAIN. It was unbelievable and the staff was beyond rude, downright mean. At about 415 we asked if we could just get a refund and they laughed at us. When they finally got us to our room at about 445 it was not at all the room we had booked (which was supposed to have a king sized bed and a pullout couch, it just had a bed). Not only was it not the room we payed for but, it had cob webs hanging from every corner of the ceiling, wall paper peeling off the walls, and crusty stains on the carpet. Gross, vile, horrible hotel. Would rather sleep on a bench in central park then ever give this overpriced flop house my money ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go in there!!”
Reviews.Author: ipesqueira
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a package to be delivered to me, they lost it. I called after I was there (6 nights) and could get music for 1 hour after the MANAGER and every single staff member says hust 1 moment please. Unbelievable!! I paid up to 419 for a corporate rate room (in therory the very good ones). First night a terrible sound would not let us sleep all night. I have stayed in better 80 dollar hotels and in much more client oriented 10 dollar youth hostels. do not go in there. do not be fooled by the web page or the location. any midtown hotel will heve such location and 20 year old kid can put nice pictures of central park, even when you are far away from having the slightest view of it.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: AmerBamer
Reviews.Content: Arrived to the hotel to find the alarm clock blaring and my window wide open, which wouldn't have been a problem, except for the fact that there was one very large fly in the room. No wash cloths provided, but front desk did respond to request for some. One phone (the one by the bed) was not plugged in and I could not reach the jack to plug it in. Tub was badly stopped up and although I placed two requests to have it fixed, it was worse the 2nd night. Bathroom was very small, although fairly clean. Nice, large flat screen TV. Check in/out was a little slow, but not terrible. Restaurant downstairs was very good for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Bondman1
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, I want to say that I use this website frequently when planning travel. It is truly the most honest way to hear the truth about places, shows, etc. and I thank the people who take the time out to complete these reviews. That being said, I thought it was imperative that I share this recent stay at the Park Central NY with all of you. My co-worker and I recently traveled to New York on a business trip and ended up booking a room at the Park Central. We frequently travel to New York on business and it presented a great location close our business in midtown Manhattan. That was about the only positive that I can associate with this hotel during my trip. Upon arrival, we come to find out that our reserved king/non-smoking rooms were given away to another party and that all they had available were twin bed non-smoking rooms. Of course, these rooms were located in the construction zone on the lowest floor possible. There was only one working elevator in this section and it took us about 15 minutes just to get up to our floor. First, my co-worker entered his room and it smelled like someone's dirty sock. It was also very small and dirty. My room was a little cleaner so I promptly went to sleep. Waking up in the morning presented little surprises...many of them. I got up out of bed, turned on the light in the bathroom, and roaches ran like lightning. I immediately went downstairs and reported this to the staff who magically had a king non-smoking room appear in the new tower (this of coarse wasn’t available 5 hours prior) which immediately which I moved to. The newer room wasn't as bad as the old room, but if any other hotel had availability in midtown, i would have immediately left. We both paid over 400 dollars a night to stay here. That will never happen again. I hope this helps you select your hotel when traveling to New York. Between the smells, noise, staff, and yes bugs, I will definitely opt to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: Stephwilde
Reviews.Content: New York was the last leg of our four month trip around the world and I wanted to make it special after staying in dodgy hostels for four months! The lobby of the hotel is fantastic, beautiful marble sweeping floors and well presented conceirge, reception etc. However our first stumbling block was that at 1400 we could not check in as the room wasn't ready despite this being the given time we had received for check in. But we put our baggage in the starage room, (which by the way if you wish to do so after check out there is a charge per item), and went exploring. When we finally got into our room it was a good size, nicely laid out and superficially clean but there was damp patches all over the place. I know this may seem 'picky' but considering we had paid £80 per night and we had previously stayed in a 'hostel' 20 blocks away for £30 a night in which the rooms were on the same level minus the damp! I felt a bit cheated. When I say superficially cleaned, the surface was clean but the room was grubby, dust settled in areas and marked walls etc. The other complaint I had was on the morning of check out the maid was knocking on the door from 9 am, (despite check out only being noon) reminding us that we were checking out that morning! However I didn;t complain about the damp and I suppose if I had of done the hotel would have changed rooms. I wouldn't stay in this hotel again quite simply because the Hostel I stayed at in New York was just as good for what I would use it for; sleeping and showering in. IF you are looking for a special hotel in new york pay a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, Hotel not so great”
Reviews.Author: PrimusLand
Reviews.Content: I loved the location because you are in the heart of everything from shopping to broadway. I was not so pleased with the hotel. I was there for four nights and the experience was terrible. I have traveled extensively in the U.S. and never have I been treated as if I was not there. The lobby was nicely decorated, but that is the only positive thing I have to say. The staff was not polite. When I asked questions it was if I was a bother. When I called for service, it seems as if I was a bother.Once I called about the internet connection and no one ever showed up for repair. The rooms were small and SO COLD. I asked if there was anyway that I could get heat in the room and I was told "no." After constantly calling and complaining, the serviceman brought a small vented heater. This is the worse experience I ever had in a hotel. It is the experience in traveling that makes it so great and if the hotel is not a great place the trip is downhill.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central, NYC. Good location-Mediocre experience”
Reviews.Author: Flunie
Reviews.Content: We just got back from New York after a family reunion weekend. My folks booked rooms for us at this hotel, and since they were paying, there was not much choice in the matter. Truthfully, the location was ideal. Close to the theatre district, close to Times Square, right next to a major subway line, and very easy access to taxis. Our first impression was good. The doorman took care of our luggage and whisked us to the front desk. We were greeted with a smile and checked in quickly. We had asked for two adjoining rooms, which they did not accomodate, but we were only 3 doors away. The Bellman escorted us to our rooms. Neither room had card keys that worked, so the Bellman let us in with his Master key and went back down to get us proper key cards. The rooms were OK. Reasonably spacious for New York, with two double beds (we asked for that), a view of the street, decent bathroom, decent closet with a safe and a flat screen TV. The decor was tired, and there were some stains and marks on walls and in the bathroom. But no real big problem. Other issues: One of the elevator banks was under repair, so it took a while to get an elevator. My in-room phone's handset was broken, so I had to communicate exclusively by speaker-phone. The room rate was $250 which I gather is cheap by NYC standards, so I suppose you get roughly what you pay for. The lobby was nice, although constantly busy, and on our departure day, they charged us $3 per stored bag until we had to leave for our flight home. We had a nice weekend and did not spend much time in the room, so it was not a hardship, and the location was really ideal. PS: Had the worst brunch/meal I've ever had in my entire life at a place called Frederick's on Lexington near 28th St. Avoid it like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “If you have a choice, do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: SASBoston
Reviews.Content: I was charged an egregious amount to stay at the Park Central for one night. My choices were limited as there were very few available hotel rooms in New York for that evening. And I would definitely rate the experience I had at Park Central from start to finish as below average. One of the few positives I can think of was the quick and easy check in. And now for the negatives…the room I was given was in a section of the building with bad signals for my cell phone/blackberry. I was forced to go down to the lobby to get a signal and make my calls from there. Perhaps the hotel isn’t to blame for this, but obviously this was not very convenient for me. The room was very dark and depressing and in some serious need of updating. The paint was chipping on the floor boards and the shower had mold growing in it as well as other people’s hair left all over. The lighting at the sink/vanity area was very poor. The drapes had stains on them. However, despite of all of the obvious aesthetic weaknesses of the property, the most disturbing part of my experience was dealing with the customer service. I only stayed one night (thankfully), but as I was leaving my room I realized that they did not slip the invoice under my door for an expedient check out process. I was forced to do an old-fashion check out at the front desk, however, there was a line with about a dozen people in it at 7:30 AM and I needed to get to my meeting across town so I could not wait in the line. A few hours later, I called the hotel to let them know that I had left and to request they send me my receipt via fax. It took me over an hour to even connect with anybody. When I finally demanded to speak with “Guest Relations,” I was greeted by a very rude man. He very reluctantly helped me with my request to check out and have my receipt faxed to me. Overall, it was just not the experience I had hoped for when paying that kind of price and I will never stay at the Park Central again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, Good location”
Reviews.Author: YOO_U
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 10 days at Park Central Hotel. All in all, the hotel was very good and served its purpose. We will seriously consider staying in this hotel again. Here is a summary: Pros: -------- 1) Great location: very close to all subway lines, close to central park and to fifth avenue shopping district, close to Columbus circle. The area is also very nice. 2) The room was quite big (in Manhattan standard). 3) The furniture were nice. The facilities were very clean and modern. We really liked the room. 4) The gym is well equipped. Cons: --------- 1) Water pressure in the shower isn't satisfies. 2) The A/C is centrally controlled. That means that someone else decides what temperature will be in your room. You can control only on the fan speed. Hope this review was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Lobby...rooms need some work.”
Reviews.Author: Schwinn140
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for anything uptown or you crazy shoppers looking to hit 5th ave. Unfortunately, the rooms are a bit dated and run down. I had a corner room where I could literally see rusting and aging of the walls around the windows. The flat screen tv is a nice touch but i was hoping for a bit more. Not terrible but not superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, loved New York”
Reviews.Author: RICKDallas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Central Hotel April 18th -22nd 2007. I thought it was a great place to stay. We had a great time running around the city. The Hotel was in a convenient location to Time square, central park and great shopping on 5th Avenue. Lots of restaurants around as well. I found our room to be larger than expected. Everything was in working order and clean. We had a problem with a shade in the bathroom window that had torn. We called the front desk and they had it fixed before we came back to the room. It is not the fanciest hotel in the city but I thought it was a good value. New York can be really pricey. It was beautiful weather when we were there so we had the windows open in the room most of the time. If there was one thing to complain about it would be the noise out on the streets. It really is not the hotel's fault though ,as this is busy New York after all. There was a metal plate covering a place in the road and you could hear the banging from that most of the day and night. Also lots of siren noise from fire trucks and police through the night. It was our first time in New York and it was awesome. Everybody was really nice. There is so much to do , you come back not having done half the things you set out to do. Also, go see Hairspay on Broadway, WE LOVED IT! Alfredo is a great place to have lunch or dinner. If you have questions feel free to email me at RARNIM@AOL.COM.

Reviews.Title: “Was I at the same hotel as other reviewers?”
Reviews.Author: Oysterworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Central 13-18 April; a party of 6 over 3 rooms. We booked the rooms (Superior King) in January directly over the hotel's website as not only did we get the best rates, but we were also able to add specific requests such as a room on a high floor etc. Then the panic began to set in. True, there are plenty of excellent reviews on here, but you seem to be swayed by the negative reviews for some reason. The video of the overflowing toilet posted to youtube really scared me! If I was going on my own, I would not have been bothered but was booking on behalf of 5 others and I didn't want any trouble landing on my lap! Given the price, we decided to stick with the Park Central. Location was the overiding factor and you can't get much better in NYC, especially at this price. For £80-100 per room per day, the hotel easily surpasses anything you would get in London or any other major world city. Checked in at 3pm with no problem and no queue. This on a weekend just after Easter and also full of choirs performing at Carnegie Hall across the road. Many have complained about the check-in procedure, but it was civil and quick and I would have expected a much longer wait for a 900-room hotel. As for the comments about the New York attitude by some of the staff, you have to realise you are in New York; it goes with the territory and believe me you get the same 'tude' in Macys, Barneys and the Russian Tea Rooms! Best of all, because of my special requests via the hotel reservation site, all 3 rooms were upgraded to Concierge rooms above the 18th floor (many thaks to Savio the Reservations Manager for being true to his word in keeping to my wishes); the view of Times Square from the room window more than made up for the 7 hour flight from the UK. The rooms were clean, well decorated, clean and fresh bedding, and quality towels. If I had a couple of slight niggles, they would be the lifts that seemed to take an age to arrive in the lobby (one was out of action for renovation) and the lack of a lobby scene. The lobby could be made use of for socialising and the drinks in the hotel bar bordered on the expensive side. Saying that we didn't come to NYC for 5 days and nights in the hotel, but its nice to meet up with fellow travellers every now and again. Subway entrance is right next to hotel and the Gray Line sightseeing bus stops moreorless outside. Breakfast places on your doorstep (I'd recommend the Stage but leave enough room for the Pancakes!). 'The Irish Pub' across the road on 55th was a great place for a drink into the small hours. So was in I in the right hotel? Given some of the negative reviews, I don't think I was. The Park Central is an excellent tourist hotel. Well worth the money and I would have no trouble in recommending it to my friends. As for my enemies, I'm keeping this a closely guarded secret from them.

Reviews.Title: “very good experience here”
Reviews.Author: Bijoux404
Reviews.Content: We (family of three, including a 9 year old) stayed here the first week in April. We arrived before lunch, and were directed to check our luggage and given complimentary tickets for luggage check from the front desk. We were told to come back after 4 to check in. Based on comments from this site that really worried me, we came back at 4 and were given a non-smoking king room with a roll away at no extra charge. I had been worried about the bed configuration since the booking site we used would not guarantee it (I think Expedia but do not remember.) The room was very large so that we had plenty of room even with the rollaway bed. The bathroom was also large. Everything was clean and comfortable. The bed and linens were very comfortable, although the rollaway was not. I had a few other very minor irritations: *The sink and tub did not drain adequately but this seems a common problem for hotels. *The airline had delayed a piece of my luggage. I had to ask if it had arrived, and go to get it (10PM). Then I was told that it was in luggage check, and they charged me $3. They said luggage storage was a separate company and not complimentary. I've never been charged before for retrieving luggage an airline delivered, usually it just appears in the room; this seemed odd and unbusinesslike. *One of the concierges we dealt with was rude and arrogant (but the others were fine.) Overall I give this hotel good marks for a comfortable family stay. We were always happy to get back there at the end of our long walks. There is no coffee pot but there is a Starbucks next door. A subway stop is around the corner, and a stop for another subway line is about a block away. You can walk through Central Park to the playground, carousel, Strawberry fields and museum of natural history, walk to MOMA, and walk to Times Square. There is a decent inexpensive deli, Fluffy's, across the intersection but I would avoid the other deli, BenAsh, as overpriced for what you get. I was fairly worried after reading other people's reviews on this site, but really, it was a fine stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: The_Rochdalien
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights over Easter. The hotel is good value for New York, being in a Prime location - opposite Carnegie Hall, a few blocks from Times Sq and Central Park. There are some great deli bars and restaurants in the area of the hotel. The hotel was clean and well presented though it could be considered that the green approach has been taken a little too far with patched up bed linen. Staff were efficient and friendly. The business centre offers internet facilities at a (high) cost - this was the only downside we could find - there was a wifi \ cable connection in the room for business users however. Overall, we would heartily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade Letdown”
Reviews.Author: chefamy
Reviews.Content: The Park Central Hotel's website in no way represents the hotel. There are pictures of modern black marble bathrooms and a stylish looking lobby that does not exist. We were supposedly given an upgrade. The room felt like a Holiday Inn with polyester sheets, a phone that did'nt work and a shower that leaked all over the bathroom and into the hallway. On the upside, the bed was comfortable and the location is great for theater and museum goers. But I cannot recommend this hotel and will never return. It is way too expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Better_than_home
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Park Central during the first week of November 2006. Having read the mixed reviews on this site we were slightly nervous, but we needn't have been, the hotel was great. The location is perfect, a couple of blocks from Central Park and from Broadway, and most importantly only a few minutes walk from Tiffanys!!! The room was great value for money, good size and facilities and we had a great view. The only negative I can give is that our keycards for our room failed to work on a daily basis. And the reception staff kept blaming us - we heard numerous reasons - we'd kept the cards too close to our visa cards, we'd been to too many shops so the security sensors had 'de-activated' our cards..... really annoying having to trudge back and forth to Reception to get a new card. Other than that, can't fault the hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Treasure”
Reviews.Author: slapjak
Reviews.Content: This hotel was truly a treasure! The hotel staff was so wonderful and they accomodated our room preferences and requests. We arrived at 8:00 a.m because we had an early flight and it wasn't a problem with the hotel at all. The hotel held onto our luggage until our room was ready and we were ready to see New York City. The lobby was really large and nicely decorated. We never had to wait in any lines to check-in or out and every staff member was friendly and courteous. Even the housekeepers greeted us in the hallways and the staff always asked if we needed any help. There were plenty of elevators and we never had to wait for one. The room was nicely decorated with really large windows overlooking Carnegie Hall and the bed was a dream. It was the perfect end to a New York day! The pillows were so fluffy that we felt like we were sleeping on a cloud. The bathroom had plenty of space and there was a closet for all of our luggage. The plasma t.v. was awesome too. The hotel was located in a great place. It was walking distance to everything but you couldn't hear the hustle and bustle of the busy streets. Everything was literally at our doorstep! I will definitely stay at the Park Central when I go back to New York City!

Reviews.Title: “How much risk are you prepared to take?”
Reviews.Author: LuciaWarwick
Reviews.Content: I booked into this hotel with my husband and my parents for 3 nights despite reading mixed reviews. We decided to give the hotel the benefit of the doubt and I wish we had not bothered. We have stayed in many hotels on our travels and without any doubt this one was simply the worst. The attitude of the hotel staff including the managers was very upsetting to say the least. Somebody should give them a basic lesson on customer service and civility! The way they deal with their customers leaves a very bad taste in one's mouth. Our room had few problems with it e.g. overflowing toilet, overheating etc. To cut a long story short we were told to keep the windows open (in the middle of NYC) if we were hot. The room was not very clean and the bathroom floor was covered in previous visitor's hair. Yes, the location is very good, but there are plenty other hotels in NYC with similarly good location. I appreciate that some people have more positive things to say about this hotel however, I would advise you to keep away from this place, unless you are thick-skinned and do not mind taking risks.

Reviews.Title: “had a great experience”
Reviews.Author: jennypea76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Park Central over Easter weekend. we had an excellent experience but I also think we got lucky. we arrived at 8AM on April 7th and knew our room wouldn't be ready but wanted to check our luggage and walk about town. the front desk gentleman was very friendly and he had my emailed request for a quiet room in front of him so I didn't even have to remind them. I guess because I mentioned I was pregnant he gave us a room that looked like it was designed for handicapped/wheechair customers. so it was HUGE! our bathroom was massive, the bedroom was massive and it had a sitting area and desk (though i would have liked a coffee maker). we were on the 15th floor and only paid the standard fair but we felt we got ample space. it smelled a bit musty but you only noticed it when you walked in. Our room had none of the peeling wallpaper or dirty ceilings that I had read about on here... and trust me I looked. it was spotless. the room was ready on time and I found everyone at the hotel very helpful. it was a very busy weekend being Easter but we were pleased with the service overall. No complaints. it really sounds like there are some better rooms and some worse rooms here, and we were lucky to get a top notch one along with some great service, my only real complaint was that the consierge gave us the wrong subway directions to Yankee Stadium when we were going to a game and would have sent us on the wrong train had we not checked with the subway conductor and been set straight.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic New York Experience !!!”
Reviews.Author: twister21
Reviews.Content: Before booking we decided to read the reviews on Park Central and where a little concerned about some of them! Thankfully we had no problems at the hotel what so ever! We checked in at 2pm and was relieved to find our room was ready. We had a superior double-double room on the 7th floor. The beds are very comfy and clean. Although the room itself was a bit small we weren’t bothered as we were out all day and only came back to the hotel to sleep then up again early the next day! The best feature of the hotel is its location! In the distance of two blocks you have starbucks, delies, restaurants, drug stores, tourist info centre, hooters (great burgers) subway and times square is only a 10/15min walk! We stayed for 7 days and where thoroughly impressed with the hotel and service. Our major New York highlights where Sopranos Tour, Top of Rockafella, NY Waterway tour, Natural History Museum and of course the restaurants, try Carmines on 44th its fantastic value and great food, if you love you’re steaks go to Gallagher’s on 52nd! If you want to be in a central location look no further than the Park Central we will fully recommended and will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: AnaMadalena
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 nights stay at the Park Central. The hotel has a fantastic location and we had a quick check-in and check-out without problems. Some staff are professional but not warm. We asked for a room with a view but the receptionist only ask her collegue: give me a dbl room for 4 nights. So, very impersonal. Some staff is not nice. Have to improve.

Reviews.Title: “HATED this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: matarsakzendeh
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at least twenty times in midtown over the years, at different hotels, this hotel has just about the worse service of any I have been to. The filth in the rooms and bathrooms aside, there were so many problems at this place that all it has to recommend it is LOCATION. But with so many hotels in NYC midtown, I'd stay away from this one at all costs. You can get a great location at too many other places to bother with this one. If pricelining, be careful to avoid the region this falls in (if it is still on priceline). When we arrived, around 5 pm, our room was not ready. We had a prepaid room and I had already called a number of times to confirm arrival time. Little effort was made for the room to be made ready in a timely fashion, and in fact we did not get in the room for another three hours, along with many other guests hanging out in the lobby - waiting. We were told we could not leave our luggage there while waiting (so we could go get something to eat) unless we paid! The attitude at the desk throughout all this was amazing. It was as if we had inconvenienced THEM. The idea that they promise a 3 pm check-in and are not at all perturbed that they have forty guests hanging out waiting for rooms to be cleaned was reflective of their attitude toward guests. The dirty room we got (carpet had spills all over, bathroom was not clean, dust everywhere) did have its bed made the next day, but shampoo, soap, coffee were not replaced. What is more, we no longer had towels in the room. They forgot those. Getting some towels to the room took four phone calls and a couple hours wait, because noone at this hotel could be bothered to deliver anything to the rooms. I know one can't expect much for service in NYC, but this hotel is deplorable. Stay at the OMNI, or Millenium Broadway, or Hilton Times Square when staying in Midtown. Avoid Park Central at all cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: Osbotravelers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Park Central New York over the Easter weekend (Apr 5-Apr 8, 2007). We arrived at the hotel at approximately 2:30pm. The lobby was bustling with people. We approached the check in desk and Fred the front desk agent checked us in finding us a room although a little skeptical at first he would find us one. We were treated to a room on the 18th floor and although I thought we would definitley be high enough to get some sort of view it turned out that we had a view of the courtyard. The room itself was "large" by New York standards. There was a desk which had a coffee pot, telephone and directory on it. Beside that was the bureau with an ice bucket and flat screen television (husband loved it!). There were some scuff marks on the walls probably from suitcases, but no markings anywhere else in the room. The bed was such a comfort especially after spending the day walking around New York City. There were four pillows on the bed and a lovely duvet. Definitely the best part of the room. The bathroom was a bit cramped, but was clean and mould free. We had lots of clean towels, and there was shampoo and soap available to us. We had lunch in the hotel restaurant. I had the hamburger and my husband the turkey sandwich. The service in the restaurant was good - but nobody followed up to make sure our meals were ok, and it took forever to get the bill. The food was ok - but we could have gone out and had a better meal somewhere outside the hotel. The hotel itself is a short walk to Broadway theatres and shopping. David Letterman's studio is literally a two minute walk from the hotel. We only took a cab once and that was to get to Littly Italy - other than that we walked everywhere. We felt extremely safe. The nice thing about the hotel is it's just outside the hustle and bustle of the Broadway crowds, so it's really quiet at night. Restaurants near by we tried and liked: Breakfast - Junior's, Maison and Park Cafe Supper - Angelo's Pizza, Sardi's, Olive Garden The only complaint we had about this hotel was the concierge service. We spoke to one (Eastern European woman) and she was so unhelpful! She actually gave us the wrong directions to one place. Other than that little blip, we would most definitely recommend this property to anyone visiting New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - average room - so-so customer service”
Reviews.Author: efuss
Reviews.Content: Arrived early Sunday morning, well before check out but they let you check in early without a room just to get the paperwork out of the way. Grabbed a bite across the street at Park Cafe' and watied a bit. They got us in a room by 1:30, which was nice. The room was ok. Nothing spectacular, but not disappointing. It was warm the first day and the ac only blew warm air, but we kept a window cracked and it was fine. The bed was huge, but not that comfortable. The sheets had a couple of holes in them and the comforter was a little worn. I've paid less for better beds in Marriott and Hilton/Hampton properties. The location was great. Subway on the corner, Starbucks next door and close enough to walk to plenty - Central Park, Times Square, Rockafeller Center, 5th Ave, etc. Plenty of food options nearby as well. Most of the staff was less than responsive. The lobby is always busy and any time I spoke to a staff member they had an attitude of indifference. They seemed bored, which may explain why the lobby was always busy - it got backed up becaue no one was in a hurry to get things done. When our driver dropped us off on arrival, the doorman ignored us until we had unloaded everything and were wallking in the door. Our driver, who we have used before and will use every time we come to NY said they usually ignore you unless you use a driver they booked. I called for an additional pillow at 11:00pm and it took 3 calls and 40 minutes to get one. I asked the concierge if he had heard about a walking tour that I had read about and he basically grunted "no" and turned around leaving me standing at the counter as if I were bothering him. One morning housekeeping knocked on the door (in spite of the Do Not Disturb sign) to ask if we wanted service today. On our last day I called at 11:00 and asked for a 12:30 check out and at noon someone knocked on the door wanting to know when we would be checking out. The lady working in the store off the lobby was a bright spot and should be promoted based on her great attitude. I got a decent rate for the area - averaged $195/night for 5 nights through the hotel website, but I was not impressed enough to ever return to this property. Think twice before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!!”
Reviews.Author: DenDi
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip in December 06 for a 4 night New York fix. We booked Park Central based on the positive reviews, as we all see things very differently. We checked in at 10.45pm and were treated gracefully and respectfully. We had no room requests and were allocated Room 915. Fantastic for the price we paid. Very large, clean and sound proofed with the most comfortable bed in New York City!!! We were also given a 1pm checkout for which there is no extra charge other than $3 per bag for storage. As previously mentioned, the location is exceptional. Starbucks is very convenient, however, the little local delhi over the road is mint!! You can get anything for a quick breakfast/coffee to start your day for a fraction of the price. We paid for the bus loop ($39 each for 24 hours). We found ourselves wasting valuable time waiting for the very busy buses so decided to yellow cab it for the rest of the stay. Much quicker, less hassle and very cheap.....even with a tip. $9 to Greenwich Village/Chelsea and about $6-8 for running around the city shopping!!!!!!! We tried the subway for an experience (and a laugh) and the staff directed us perfectly for this cost effective and insightful journey. We booked the Empire State Building on line as it said you don't have to queue with pre-booked tickets. WRONG!! We still had to join the back of the 3 hour queue so don't fall for that one! (And that was on the official website). However, do pay the extra for the Skytrain as it was such fun and very informative. Our only complaint about our trip was that it wasn't long enough and the days were far too short. Park Central is very large and impersonal, but hey, it was our holiday and no one elses and we would return tomorrow without doubt. We paid £550 each with Expedia for fantastic flights with Air France and 4 nights of heaven. We hope our review is of use in your holiday choice.

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: sle79
Reviews.Content: My family of two boys 16 and 9, and a hubby, checked in on a 3rd floor room around 4PM. No smoking room. I requested a higher floor but glad I didnt just because I read the review before this one. Two queen sized beds. Very comfortable. Flat screen TV was nice at night. Quiet at night where we were. Close to Central Park. We rode the Carosel in the park. My 9 year old rode on his Heely's in the park and had a blast. We walked to FAO Scwarz which was also close by. I highly recommened going to the Stage Deli for breakfast. Carnegie Deli waitress was rude. The restaurant at the hotel was of course overpriced and the food, not good. We loved Ellen's Stardust diner at 1650 Broadway. Singing waiters was worth the 30 minute wait to get in before a show. Arrive at 5:30 PM to get seated by 6PM. The Park Central is a great location and an employee behind the counter helped me figure out where to buy cheap mens khakis since they were forgotten at home! I found the room to be cleaned every day, but the maids did not give out the shampoo/soap samples every day so I advise to bring your own. I used the AAA discount which helped on cost too. I would return here.

Reviews.Title: “Average room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Climate_Guy
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at the Park Central from March 31st - April 4th, 2007. It was the least expensive 3-star hotel we could find in Manhatten, and it was still $165/night - and that was a deal! The room was very small, and the bathroom very tiny. The room was simple and clean. The bed was pretty comfortable and the large flat-screen tv was a nice plus. The room appeared a bit worn, wall paper was peeling along the cracks and the carpet was shabby in spots. It was a room. Clean and simple. The hotel staff was friendly-ish. We didn't eat in the hotel, so I cannot judge it. The only odd thing, the elevators are VERY slow. The Park Central has a great location. A block off of Broadway, two blocks from Central Park and about 6 blocks from Times Square. It is right on, or a matter of blocks away from Subway stations that go any direction you want. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We actually checked out and switched hotels”
Reviews.Author: cuteusername
Reviews.Content: My teenage son and I checked in on March 29th just after midnight. I was handed a key to a room on the 6th floor with no comment, even though I had reserved a room on floor 18 or higher (directly with the hotel no less) which is a different price level. When I pointed this out, the night manager came out and said they could move us to one of those rooms the following day. (He was very apologetic - I get the feeling the staff knows the place needs work.) Still, I'm not a big fan of packing up and moving rooms, and I was offered a lower rate for that night - but had I not pointed out the descripancy myself, I'm sure I would've paid for the higher level room. However, upon being brought to our room, I quickly started calling other hotels. The entire hall and room smelled strongly of mold and mildew. Inside the room, which looked at a grey wall and had no light whatsoever, the fabric wall covering was lifting off about a three foot section of the wall. The paint was badly chipped and peeling, especially around the vent by the window, and the bathroom was, wel, rickety. We couldn't find another hotel for that night, but we booked one for the next nights of our stay and went to sleep. I will say that beds were very comfortable. But it was in the morning that we discovered the worst feature of this hotel - absolutely paper thin walls. We heard our neighbor's entire phone call, flipping channels on the TV, using the blow-dryer, etc... all as if she was IN OUR room. It was that loud. There was no way to continue sleeping. Yes, it's true you get what you pay for, and it's possible there are some nicer, non-mildewy rooms elsewhere in the hotel. But sometimes it's truly worth paying a bit more. I'm happy to say we loved the hotel we moved to, but I selfishly don't want it to become so popular we can never get a room!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a first visit to NYC”
Reviews.Author: ajinternational
Reviews.Content: First visit to New York, and chose Park Central due to location and price - booked direct with the hotel through their website which seemed to offer the cheapest rate. Emailed the hotel prior to arrival to confirm the booking, which they did, and to request a room on a higher level. Arrived at the hotel about 1pm, and to my surprise were able to check straight into the room – I’d read people have had to wait till well after check in time to get into their rooms. Allocated room on 9th floor; floors 18 and upwards are the premium ‘concierge rooms’, but I’d expected to be a little higher since I’d emailed the request in advance – requested a non smoking room so maybe it had something to do with that... Room was clean, widescreen TV at end of bed was added bonus. Rooms looked recently decorated, but done in such a hurry that the attention to detail seems to be lacking (wallpaper looked like it was peeling off in places!), and there was a panel of the ceiling that was mouldy/rusting. The heater was annoying; it gets the room hot very quickly, so you put it off, then it gets cold again quickly ... The bed, however, was huge, and may be the most comfortable bed I’ve ever slept in! Hotel is in a perfect location; 5 minutes left is Central Park, and 10 minutes right is Times Square - MoMa and 5th Avenue are nearby too. There’s a subway station on the corner below the hotel (and a Starbucks!). For breakfast there’s the Park Café directly opposite and Maison just down the road on the way to Times Square. Loads of places in the area for dinner (Molyvos opposite looks nice, but expensive!) Checkout (12pm) was quick – there was a long queue at reception, but we got a print out under the door the night before which meant all we had to do was return the key cards. Did get a phone call at 11am basically asking ‘When you getting out!?’ which did seem quite rude. On the whole was a good base for visiting New York - and relaxing in the beds after a long day sightseeing/shopping was something to look forward to!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location, Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: SJDWestMidlands
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for a friends 40th Birthday, arrived at 2.30pm from Birmingham to be told our room would be ready at 4pm. That was not a problem, we did mention that we had sent a number of e-mails stating we needed 2 rooms next door to eachother because some of the party ( 8 of us) needed our support. We arrived back at the hotel at 4.30pm to be told only 1 room was ready. All 8 of us waitied in the 1 room and noticed the room nextdoor had still not been cleaned! At 6pm I spoke to the manager who was as bad as all the other staff at the hotel. In the end we were given 2 rooms on the same floor but at the opposire end of the hotel from eachother. Everything else with the hotel was ok? The location was fab for Central Park, Time Sq, 5th Avenue and the Subway.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: bdrb
Reviews.Content: When my husband told me we were staying in this hotel, straight away I came onto Trip Advisor so suss it out. No sooner had I read all the comments I wanted to cancel, I did not want to stay in this hotel but as there was a group of us I decicded not to be a diva and go along. Husband was playing in Carneige Hall so convience wise it suited. We arrived on the 17th March but had to stay in the Shelton as Park Central was booked out. We checked out of Shelton (amazing hotel) at about 9.30am the following morning expecting to be leaving our bags in Park Central for late check in (according to other reviews) but low and behold our rooms were ready!! Couldnt believe it, the staff could not of been nicer to us. Our room was on the 17th floor right outside the lift, we didnt hear any noise from this, were not disturbed at all from it, I was at the beginning a little concerned with this but no problems. Two things that I was a slight bit disappointed in was the size of the bathroom and there was no coffee / tea facilites but other then this it was brillant!! We are going back again in 3 months and will be booking this hotel again. The singing artist that was with us got one of the suites on the top floor, we went to check it out and it was gorgeous...the views were fantastic, esp at night! As I said going back & cant wait...couldnt recommend it highly enough!!

Reviews.Title: “A find place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wcm18
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights March 22-25. Check in on Thursday around 6 was a breeze, maybe 5 minutes tops. The room was standard. It was large for a NY room but had nothing special. There were some marks on the wall and a few scratches in the shower but overall, the room was good. If you plan on spending all your time in the room when you're in New York, it is probably not the best hotel in the city but it is an ample hotel. Stay here for great location and decent rooms at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic- just what we wanted!”
Reviews.Author: southlondonerSE27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a four night stay in this hotel through Expedia. We just wanted a centrally located hotel that would provide us with a comfortable base for sightseeing over our five day trip to New York. Park Central was perfect for this and we were very happy with the location and the standard of service offered. We paid @£350 for two people for four nights and We think what we received was excellent value. The room was clean and very comfortable with a king size bed (no holes in the linen!). The room was cleaned every day and soap and towels replaced as per usual. We were on the ninth floor and did not experience any troubling traffic /other noise. The ice machine was also positioned outside our room ( convenient for the champagne bucket) but we were not disturbed by this at all- perhaps we were the only ones to be using it- so this was no problem. We spent most of our days walking/touring the delights of Manhattan and beyond, so did not spend too much time in the hotel. But we could not fault Park Central in providing a comfortable base for our sightseeing and the provision of a large flat screen TV positioned at the end of the kingsized bed was a bonus at the end of a busy day walking, eating, walking etc. As there were so many great places to eat so close to the hotel we did not utilise the hotel restaurant (although a member of staff at the 'Spotted Pig' pub/restaurant in Greenwich Village recommended the hamburgers at Park Central) so we cannot comment. The only slight niggle was that there was no tea making facilitiy in the room- and our travel kettle did not work on the different USA voltage. However, there was a Starbucks conveniently located just outside of the hotel and they provided great service and huge cups of tea for approx £1, so this was not really an issue. This is a large hotel and always busy- so we were not suprised to have to wait a few minutes to be checked in. But this process was executed smoothly and swiftly ( we had pre-booked) when we reached the front desk. We checked in around 4pm New York time so cannot comment on service at other times of the day. We had such a fantastic time we cannot wait to return and will be eager to come back to Park Central.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Zeldafitz
Reviews.Content: I was all set to cancel my reservation after reading the negative reviews, but I am glad I didn't- it wasn't bad at all! I arrived early last Wed. for a 4 night stay. They gave me a free voucher to store my luggage.When I finally checked in that evening I was given a room on the 14th floor. Maybe I got lucky, but it was fine, clean and not too small. Yes, the bathroom was a bit dim, but no evidence of mold as others have reported. Towels were ample and the bed very comfortable. My clock radio didn't work and they immediately sent up a replacement. The staff was nice- one of them even fixed my cell phone for me. It's a very busy place and it was packed, but no problems waiting for elevators. The location,as others have said ,is terriffic. For the price I would stay here again, keeping my fingers crossed that I would get the same level of satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “great location but disgusting room and bad service”
Reviews.Author: youngphilly
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location but its room was so nasty. So understaffed and they simply don't really care about your needs. Please find some other hotels nearby!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location / Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: VinoMan_DC
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend at the Park Central while we were in town for an event at Carnegie Hall. The proximity to Carnegie and the rest of the mid-town attractions was hard to beat. Unlike some reviewers, we experienced great friendliness and courteous service from all the staff we met. The room was small but adequate - typical for NYC. One complaint -- the HVAC system did not work properly and it was always blowing hot air so we had to open the windows to cool things down with the accompanying street noise. Not much of a lounge scene here though -- or at least not while we were there. I would describe the hotel as nice, clean, well-priced and boring. Definitely stay here primarily for the convenient location, not the atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Park Central”
Reviews.Author: mercury714
Reviews.Content: Stayed in June 2006. Hotel was older, but updated. Customer Service was below average. They locked us out of our room by mistake along with numerous other people, but not a big deal. Keycard/Computer error. Since that time they have been charging my credit card randomly for phantom stays. They charged me $700 beans in October 2006 and now again in February 2007. REPEATED calls to management you get voicemail and NO return calls. Credit card company is not much better. They advise Park Central can continue to charge these phantom stays forever. I must now wait until I win the second dispute and then cancel my card. What a major pain. I recommend you stay somewhere else. Oh yea and the credit card company is Bank of America. Hotels.com booked it, but not their fault. Hotels.com in fact was great.

Reviews.Title: “Suite and Sour”
Reviews.Author: Diverkitty
Reviews.Content: The secret to this hotel is check in at 4pm. DO NOT, under any circumstances try to check in after 10.30pm until the night staff from manager, receptionist to janitor has gone on a customer relation course. I asked for non-smoking room and got smoky room (1723) in smoky corridor with peeling paint on the room ceiling and badly patched in corner from a previous flood, dirty sheets (the maid was putting them on the bed when I arrived at room and told me without prompting that the marks were not dried blood but nail varnish and white duvet cover was covered in black marks which cleaners can't get out!), no heating (it was -15 outside and you could see breath in room) and no working safe when I arrived at 11.30pm. My friends booked a twin (and again we weren't aware it's not guarantee'd even when you pay extra for it) and were given a king with option of z-bed when they complained. This was delivered at 1am with no sheets. This is not the welcome you want after a 7 hour flight and we were told because we'd pre-paid - they couldn't change our rooms! Security told me mine was one of 90 rooms without a working safe and I was to use the safety deposit box in main reception for the 6 nights I was staying. Not on. We went down the following day (same surly night staff) and were told if we really insisted on moving to what we'd booked and expected to find (right no of beds, working heating and safes!) then we should come back at 4pm when reservations allocate rooms. We went back at 3pm and it was the daytime staff who were on. They were so helpful and friendly the difference was unbelievable. I now understand why this hotel gets two totally different reviews. They were apologetic, couldn't do enough for us and let us see the new rooms before we took them (at that point we realised the couple in front of us changing rooms as well were the people who arrived with us the previous night). The concierges were extremely helpful with tips and advice and it's worth getting them to book your transport back to airport - we saved money and travelled in style! Despite the 1st night disaster, I would stay in this hotel again - the new rooms (922 and 862) were lovely and clean with fresh sheets, sinkable pillows, fresh towels and shampoos every day with pleasant housekeeping staff. I would just make sure I arrive for a 4pm check-in! Maintenance dept could do with pulling up it's socks along with the night staff but other than that, can't find fault with rest of stay and hotel is in fabulous location - opposite Carnegie Hall, on 57th St Metro station and Carnegie Deli is just next door. Don't forget to stop off at Stage Deli for the biggest slice of cheesecake I've ever seen - one portion fed 4 girlies - beware!

Reviews.Title: “great location, shame about the . . .”
Reviews.Author: The-Wild-Rovers
Reviews.Content: Very handy for Central Park but initial impressions were that the hotel is grubby and very tired, e.g. one of our plug sockets was hanging off the wall. Some of the staff seemed unhelpful and disinterested - unless trying to persuade us to book a stretch limo for any given journey!

Reviews.Title: “No wonder the Foyer is busy morning, noon and night !”
Reviews.Author: Owen39
Reviews.Content: No wonder the Foyer of the Park Central Hotel is bustling with travellers, morning, noon and night. This indicates what a popular hotel this is. I rented a single room for two weeks. The room is basic, small, BUT is clean and modern. They provide a nice, big comfortable bed with lots of linen. A nice modern bathroom with easy to use shower and nice decor for the washbasins and clean towels every day. They provide a great big Flatscreen TV which is a bonus. Also, the maids clean the rooms every day, providing new linen and towels and soaps. If you are out and about sightseeing all day, and want to come home to a nice, clean basic room with all modern amenities...you got to try the Park Central Hotel. Perfect for budget travellers who want a nice, small, decent room with cleanliness and good amentities. Well done Park Central. Only problem is....some of the Reservations Staff need Customer Service retraining, especially when it comes to dealing with room mixups and NOT PASSING MESSAGES ON. Owen Loney, Sydney, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Simple”
Reviews.Author: hoteler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid Feb 2007 & had worried about the mixed reviews so I asked for a room on a high floor. Didn't get that because I checked in quite late, so I ended up on the 3rd floor (same floor as the fitness center). Despite this, the room was very clean & I didn't change rooms the next nite, though that was offered to me as an option. The room (see photos) was a little oddly shaped & narrow, so that the TV/dresser faced the closet which was between the 2 beds, but who goes to NY to watch TV? One of the phones had some issues but I didn't use it much. Could have used a coffee maker/fridge, and some more hooks in the bathroom (didn't post any b/c they're all similar to other photos), but my stay was fine - it was like any other corporate type hotel. I didn't think it was noisy, the staff who helped me check in/out were friendly, and it was a great price for a great location. Other friends did have some issues with their rooms, so maybe if there's a problem ask to switch rooms, but don't rule this out b/c there are good rooms. And I think if you're friendly to them they'll be friendly to you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Everything about it!”
Reviews.Author: saffy255
Reviews.Content: My 1st trip to New York for many years was a fabulous one! The hotel was amazing... I had read previous reviews on this site, and was expecting my room not to be cleaned, unhelpful staff, a dreadful check in and no towels. How pleaseantly suprised I was! I arrived at about 1pm, and my friend whom I was visiting with was already checked in, but nowhere to be seen. The check in staff (with no queue!) searched for my friend's room, and confirmed he was staying there, and then allowed me to check in my bags into storage while I waited for him. They ordered me coffee (I'd been on a horrendous flight!) and allowed me to charge it to my room when they could ascertain what name I'd been booked in under! The staff were, at all times so helpful... I couldn't see any sign of that notorious New Yorker dismissal, and my room was cleaned every day. Admittedly, some days it was cleaned better than others, but on the whole, it was far better than I could have done in the time they have available! The lobby was always a hive of activity, with plenty of comings and goings, but was always clean and tidy. The concierge were amazing - they booked us a table at a great Chinese restaurant that they had recommended, and were even able to tell me where to buy some candy I'd been trying to find for a gift. There are two great deli's across the street, we preferred the Benash deli... wonderful pancakes! The location of the Park Central was as fabulous as it looked on the map - we walked very little - opting for cabs - as they were so cheap in comparrison to the UK. The Doorman of the hotel ALWAYS able to get you a cab easily. The best bits of the hotel? The view as you looked to the right as you leave the hotel... Times Square, all of a 5 minute walk away, and for a bit of R&R in a fast paced city, Central park only a 2 minute walk away in the opposite direction. Would I stay there again? Would I ever!

Reviews.Title: “Worried over nothing”
Reviews.Author: GrantsOnTour
Reviews.Content: We (my wife and I) arrived in NYC on the 8th Feb and stayed for 5 nights. We went to see and experience NYC not sit in a hotel and we more than achieved our aim, however we read some reviews and were worried about what we were walking into with regards Park Central. On our arrival we were pleasantly surprised after arriving several hours early and given complimentary free luggage tickets while we waited for a superior king room on the 15th floor.
