For the price this hotel was well worth the money espcially as all other hotels with similiar services were far more expensive. Room had a large flat screen TV was clean with maid service daily, had a huge comfy bed, shallow bath and perfectly adaquate shower. An iron & board in the cupboard and safe (only thing missing was a kettle) Location was perfect, step out the rotating doors look left Central Park, look right Times Square. Only meters to your right there is a Starbucks and Subway to take you anywhere. The area is surrounded by cafe's, diners and restruants. Note the hotel bar and restruant is on the expensive side. Staff were written down in a lot of reviews, we found them very helpfull and friendly enough. We strongly recommend this hotel and would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LJSumner
Reviews.Content: Five good reasons to stay in the Park Central: 1. Within walking distance of Central Park, the Empire State Building, Macy's, Bloomingdale's, Times Square, Broadway, FAO Schwartz and the Rockefeller Center; 2. Several subway stations nearby; 3. Clean, warm rooms; 4. Helpful, polite staff; 5. Many reasonably-priced restaurants and cafes nearby. The rooms were a little dark and did not have facilities to make tea or coffee, but this was relatively minor. I would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Staff not the friendliest. Room fine.”
Reviews.Author: betsywanderlust
Reviews.Content: Great location, handy for broadway and times square. Bed comfortable. Room fine. Staff not the friendliest but it is New York so you can expect that from time to time. Would I stay there again? If it was cheaper. Overall I was satisfied with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location & Very Clean!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: oliviaLondon
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at the "Park Central" for 4 nights between the 25th & 29th of Jan. We arrived 2 hrs early to check in but that was no problem, there was a room available straight away! We had requested a high floor which was not availble on our package but they upgraded us anyway at no extra charge. This was a great start to our holiday and we could start exploring within half an hour! We didnt really spend much time in the hotel but every evening when we got back, our room was emmaculate with fresh towels & bedding. The bed was huge & really comfy. Location was perfect with easy reach to "times square" & "central park". We went all over the place either by subway,Taxi ( if we were running late) or by foot & we covered everywhere from lower east side, tribeca, soho and ground zero without any problems. The concierge was very helpful, they gave advice on restaurants, taxis to airport etc... Overall i would recommend this place to anyone who wants to make the most out of exploring New york. It is not flash or trendy but it is clean, comfortable and in an amazing location!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: D'Arcy-Carter
Reviews.Content: For my 21st I decided that a trip to the big apple would be a great way to see it through! We stayed at Park Central hotel...and in my opinion you couldn’t ask for a better location on the rates we got our room for. First step out of the hotel, take a look right and you can see thee famous Times Square. Everything you need is on the doorstep even the subway station which we used religiously as a way of getting around the city... (Our poor feet suffered). The hotel was great, we were not aware that the twin rooms was not a guarantee on arrival, so when we did arrive and there wasn’t one available, mum and I were a little disappointed. However explaining to them that I did not fancy spending my 21st birthday sharing a bed with my mother - they on the next night promptly upgraded us to a luxury twin suit which we were very impressed with. Staff can be surly at times (New Yorkers pah!), the hotel was very clean & tidy, cleaners do a fantastic job. I would recommend this hotel to all and when I return I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Trust the Maids”
Reviews.Author: unclebizzy
Reviews.Content: My stay was fine; however, when I packed up and left, I accidently left behind a few things of mine, including a pair of really expensive shoes. When I called the hotel, it was difficult to get someone to respond to my issue. It took 3 days for them to get back with me. Then they told me that I did leave a few things, but no signs of any shoes. I am positive the maids took my shoes since everything else showed up in the lost and found. My advise, anything you leave behind that's valuable in this hotel, count it as lost for good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Clair&Dave
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - 2 blocks from Central Park and 4 blocks from Times Sq - everything is on your doorstep. Check in was easy no problems whatso ever. Room very clean - was quite noisy but what do you expect from staying in NYC. Room was cleaned everyday we were there. Did not use bar or restaurant as there are so many other places in NY to be going to. Very friendly staff from receptionist to concierge to cleaner. We had a flat screen tv in our room. Rooms were a good size and we paid an excellent price so nothing to complain about and would definately go back. Slight niggle would be it would have been nice to have tea/coffee making facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Scottishsusan
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend have just returned from this hotel on 5th February after staying 3 nights. Our room was on the seventh floor, which although there was not a great view the room itself was excellent - two double beds, large TV (not that we had time to watch it) and reasonable size bathroom - room was also very clean and cleaned each day by a very cheerful maid. Only down side was no kettle/coffee maker in the room - I was prepared and took travel kettle - there is however a Starbucks next door and lots of other deli's/coffee shops nearby. We found all staff in the hotel very pleasant and helpful when you wanted to know anything and left you alone when you didnt! A previous stay was at the Wellington Hotel across the road - which obviously had the same location but room half the size and no where near as pleasant. Would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a central location and somewhere pleasant to sleep and change in. Our floor was seventh floor and this looked like it had all been reasonably recently refurbished. No hesitation in returning here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place for price!”
Reviews.Author: patientviking
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just stayed two nights in this hotel for ~$139 a night (plus ~$30 for taxes and fees) It was such a nice hotel for the price that I just had to write about it. First, this hotel is a three star hotel so don't think you will be overwhelmed with beauty and service. This isn't that type of hotel. However, the hotel is very nice and pretty clean. The lobby is nicely designed with a bar and restaurant to the right as you walk in. Check-in was smooth but you will need to wait in line for a little bit. The staff does their job and are very willing to help you if you ask. Do not expect them go out of their way to offer help unless you ask. The room we had reserved was a Superior room - 1 King. The room was a very decent size for New York City and extremely clean. It had one king bed with a desk, arm chair, 32" wide screen tv (very nice!!), double door closet with 10 hangers, a personal safe (free!), and a Ironing board/iron (didn't get to use it). The room had internet access (wireless and wired) for an additional fee (it was ~$11 for 24hrs). The in room movies range from $10-$18. The bathroom had a shower tub with adjustable shower head. The shower pressure and hot water were adequate. My girlfriend had quite the run in with the hair dryer as it ate part of her hair but she survived! I, on the other hand, had no problem :). There was some noise from the street but it wasn't bad from our room on the 9th floor. Only a honking truck woke us up one night. The room was warm without the heat on. Considering it was very cold out we were extremely thankful when coming back from the outside. It is centrally located to many attractions and we enjoyed walking the short distance or hoping on the nearby subway. I would definitely stay there again for the price! My girlfriend thought it was a great place to stay and I received many kudos for my selection (thanks to what everyone else said on tripadvisor!)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel for its location”
Reviews.Author: KiwiNY
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at this hotel in January and was really impressed with the location. It was my first trip to New York and I wanted a hotel that was within easy access of public transport and Central Park/Museum Mile. Hotel was also easy walking to Broadway and 5th Avenue shopping. The Carnegie Deli is down the street and good value for eating. The room was clean and tidy and quiet. I had a great view down towards Broadway - so worth asking for a good room. Room had a coffee making facility and a safe. Early check in was no problem - and they stored bags for free. Would stay again and highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not great”
Reviews.Author: OriginalShoegal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are just back from the Park Central Hotel and as the previous review suggests its a great location, really close to Central Park and lots of pubs and bars. The only concern that we had was the no-smoking room stank of cigarettes, the room was a little shabby and grubby and there was the slight problem of a cockroach in the bath tub - twice! The hotel staff are friendly enough and we managed to get a great deal for the hotel so we got what we paid for . Its great for sleeping but not much else, dont expect to be blown away, but fine if you are travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value and location”
Reviews.Author: MrsD-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the park central from jan 25th-28th and had a fantastic time. It enjoys a perfect location- a short walk to Times Sq, Broadway and central park. Lots of restaurants and bars also within walking distance. Our room was massive with two vvvvv comfy beds and a large plasma Tv. Room was clean and quiet. Maid visited every day and we had clean towels etc. This is not the Waldorf astoria, its not that opulent or grand- but if you are going to new york to see the sights and experience the atmosphere this hotel is a great choice. This would be a 4 star by Uk standards- so any brits thinking about staying here- take it frm me its great!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: DespiCos
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Central for 10 nights from the 5th-15th of January. After reading all those bad reviews with my fiance we were really worried about what we were going to face and even considered cancelling our booking. I just don't understand where all those bad comments came from! Check-in only took a few minutes, the room was really nice and modern with a flat screen TV, very clean and the housekeeper was very nice and friendly. The location is excellent, a few blocks away from Times Square, Central Park and a 15-20 mins walk to 5th Avenue (for those who want to go shopping) and the subway station is just down the corner. There are many delis around for breakfast, lunch or dinner and a Starbucks is conviniently located just under the hotel. So, to those people making so many bad comments just relax and enjoy yourselves cause all those bad reviews make it sound as if we didn't stay at the same hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LJFNI
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night stay at the Park Central Hotel. We were a bit worried after reading some of the reviews, but we did not experience any of the problems mentioned! We arrived at the hotel at about 2pm and were able to check in to our room immediately. The reception staff were very helpful. We booked through expedia and had requested a superior king room with a view. We got the superior king room but not the view! The reception staff said that we could move the next day to a room with a view but we didn't bother! Glad we didn't move because the room we had was lovely - very clean and quiet - plus we were hardly in the room!! The rrom was cleaned every day and we got clean towels! One thing I would say is bring your own hairdryer as the one in the hotel isn't very powerful!! The hotel is about a 5-10 min walk from Times Square and about 5 min walk from Central Park. There are subway stations all around the which once you get used to using are handy! You can have breakfast in the hotel - but there are so many places all around the hotel to eat you don't have to! We would stay in this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: jennings01uk
Reviews.Content: 5 of us spent 6 days here at the start of Xmas holiday period, it was fabulous. Hotel check-in staff very polite, check in was not busy at all and as we had three rooms the receptionist went to the trouble of getting us all rooms close together, the only person in a room by themselves got allocated the largest room much to their delight. Found staff extremely helpful, obviously if you have attitude with them you are going to get attitude back. You get more with honey than vinegar!! If you are planning a short trip would suggest you get the first flight from London to NYC, it will get you into NYC around 2:30pm, more time for sightseeing. Loved NYC as usual but would point out a couple of thing. If anyone is thinking of going to Tavern on the Green (Central Park) for lunch - DON'T!! We went for brunch, spent nearly $500 for 5 people and ended up with food poisoning. Not good, they have a "just pack em in and throw em out" attitude, not what I would expect but at least the decorations were nice. If you are sightseeing you get a great view of the Empire State from Rockafeller Plaza observation desk, personally preferred it to the view from ES. Allow plenty of time for the return journey to the airport, especially if travelling back from JFK can take anything up to 2 hours from downtown to airport in traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Great location poor accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Adelef1fan
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Park central and have really mixed feelings about this hotel. The location was the best bit, right in the thick of midtown manhatten. The rooms were poor to say the least! I never complain about anything but felt I had to on this occasion. we upgraded to a concierge room which cost an extra £200 for 4 nights, the room was so dusty you could write your name in the dust, the hair dryer was clogged up with muck and wouldn't work until we had picked it all out (not a pleasurable experience) and the lovely bathrobes were none existant! Our compaints fell on deaf ears so we just got on with it as we didn't want it to ruin our trip. Its a real shame as the hotel's location is excellent . I have no idea what the other 900 rooms were like but ours was a real let down.

Reviews.Title: “absolutly loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sarahpMacclesfield
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 10th jan to 15th and absolutly loved everything about the hotel. We arrived at 2pm and even though check in wasn't till 4 they had a room straight away. By accident they gave my friend and i a king size bed, but we asked for it to be changed to a double room and right away it was changed to a double king size room for the same price and they were more than happy to do it and very appologetic. The room was spacious, clean massive tv and extremely comfortable. Everyone who worked there was so friendly and helpful. Information desk gave us all the information that we asked for. Location was excellent with fith ave only 10 minute walk times square 5 minute walk, empire state building 15 - 20 minute walk. One thing i would deffinatly reccomend is visiting woodbury common if you want some amazing deals (even better that nyc shops) on clothing, ask information about it, it costs $38 pp but well worth it and you can stay till 9 at night. You will be exusted by the end of the day though. For somewhere to have breakfast visit le parker meridion just around the corner from park central hotel. i can honestly say it was the best breakfast i have ever had in my life! Although slightly expensive you get more than your moneys worth. i reccomend blueberry pancakes and hot chocolate, they were absolutly perfect! One more thing to say about the hotel is to take the town car that they arrange for you when returning to the airport. it costs $60 dollers, you would pay $55 for a taxi. We were lucky, the concierge got us a limo for the same price without us asking so we were quite happy about that one! Anyway i can honestly say that i couldn't have been happier with the hotel and i did nearly change it from reading the reviews but for the price you pay you get so much more for your money than you expect, i am definatly making it a yearly trip and i will definatly be staying at the park central next time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and Fantastic New York, some hotel troubles”
Reviews.Author: TheDutchToutch
Reviews.Content: We (5 persons) stayed in the hotel from 10 jan till jan 15. Location: very good, near subway, Broadway, in fact everything you can walk. We dit this one day and take the subway for the other days to visit Brooklyn, Coney Island etc. Ofcourse lots of things to visit: shopping, NBA store, 5th Avenue, Staten Island ferry (free), Empire State Building, the tragedy you feel on Ground Zero, unbelievable and unforgettable, China Town for watches and handbags :) , SOHO, the financial center, Colombus, so many things. We don't used breakfast or dining in the hotel because there are lots of restaurant for breakfast, fastfood and dining. Disappointed things of the hotel: Check-in; everything went wrong at checkin. I give my vouchers but that was not necassary. Later at checkout the troubles begin. The rooms were on 10th en 15th floor. The room on the 15th floor has no view except agains a wall. I think that the hotel has a poor service in cleaning the rooms. In the 4 nights stay we had three times trouble. 2nd night: Room was not cleaned, beds were not done, towels were still on the floor, no clean towels. Because we were going out again they had the time to clean the room, making the beds and clean towels. When we came back it was done, except the towels. After a call they brougt clean towels. 3rd night: no towels , after another call new towels 4th night: exactly the same as mentioned at 2nd night, but because we visit a Knicks basketball game we came back late and the room was not cleaned, no towels etc. After 45 minutes (it was night-time) somebody was checking my complain. I asked the manager to come up but he refused, and in fact i was very p... I ask the manager what he was thinking about to solve this: he offered me a breakfast. That was no option, we were with 5. Then he offered a compensation for $ 30,00. At checking out there was a another problem. The reception want to charge my creditcard but i know for sure that the payment was done by the travel agency. Somebody else told that i must pay the bill and must declare the costs at my travel agency and walked away. Because my state of irritation was high i asked very friendly ofcourse ( Excuse Me) the person to come back and explain better or find a solution. Then the manager was on the reception and with some clicks he showed the personell that the payment already was made! Strange. Ofcourse I told the manager about the complains. Well he knew the situation and the 30 dollar compensation. (per day or for the whole period is not clear and i don't care) Now i'm waiting for this refund; will it come or not?? I already informed my travel agency. I think that a huge hotel is not working anymore with little hand-written papers what the cleaners were using. The lady who inspected the room wondered that the room was occcupied, because the litte paper says: not occupied. Ok, this is my review. Don't forget and i realize: this are incidents. But very irritating when you think staying in a nice hotel. It not so difficult to solve this, motivate your people. Wait; i remember one other thing: From JFK Airport to the hotel: there is no shuttle-service, but you can take a yellow cab, fixed costs: 45 dollar. When you go back one of the doorkeepers asked if we need a taxi. The answer on my question how much it was: 80 dollars. I told him that i paid 45 dollars from JFK to the Hotel. That was too much money i think. An other doormen asked me the same question: I asked how much: he said 65 dollars. An other option is to take the subway en the jfk train. We decided to go for the 65 dollar cab. After waiting for 10-15 minutes the waiting was not soo bad; because we did not get a yellow minivan cab but a very nice white stretched limo!!!! So now i know that a stretched limo is not only for the rich people. This was a very nice ending of our stay in Amazing New York

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: alb1pgs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at Park Central. We arrives at 4.15pm on Thursay and only had to wait a couple of minutes to check in. This process took literally a couple of minutes and we were straight in our room. When we arrived in our room I was extremely surprised. Before travelling I had read numerous terrible reviews of this hotel and was a little wary to say the least. I can now honestly say some people must expect way to much. The room was clean, spacious enough for the two of us, large king size bed, large bathroom, lotsof towels. Just lovely. Everyday when we returned to our room it lovely again, there were clean towels and it looked as it had when we checked in. We did not use the restaurant or the gym so I cannot comment on these. All of this we good but the best bit was the location. We did not have to use a taxi the whole time we were there and the only time we used the subway was to go to the statue of liberty. Times square was a 5 to 10 min walk as was fifth ave, rockafella centre. Central park was a 5 min walk if that, ESB was about a 15 min walk. We loved every minute of our trip to NY including this fab hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great, if not perfect, Option!”
Reviews.Author: ChachieWC
Reviews.Content: All of what other reviewers write about the excellent location of the Park Central are true, so I will skip any extended narrative about what a good location it is - it's great! We were very pleased with the Park Central. Our experiences with staff were consistently friendly and helpful - everyone from the front desk personnel, to the door men, to the cleaning staff. They truly went out of their way to try and be accommodating. Only the bartender in the hotel bar seemed grumpy, but she may not even be a hotel employee. And, our room was well-sized and well-cleaned during our three day visit. Everywhere in the hotel seemed clean, in very good condition, and well-equipped to handle the huge amount of guests they welcome on a daily basis. Also, we used the hotel's shuttle to LaGuardia Airport when leaving, which cost $45 and offered a much more comfortable experience for two couples to ride in a spacious, comfortable SUV rather than a cramped cab. I only offer two ideas of where the hotel could have more greatly met our needs/expectations. First, we arrived into the city several hours before check-in. They didn't have our room ready, which we absolutely understood. They do offer a luggage check room for $3 a bag, which seems fair and we had no problems with using it. However, the other couple in our party, who arrived two hours after us, were offered a voucher for free luggage check for their bags. We were under the same reservation (though in separate rooms), so I have no idea why our friends received this perk and we did not. But, when inquiring about checking in early, definitely ask the front desk if they can offer you a voucher for free baggage check if your room isn't ready. It would have saved us $12. Second, I am usually a great sleeper but had difficultly sleeping in the hotel for two reasons. First, I believe our room was near some kind of generator or water pump station for the hotel, and there was a regular mechanical noise throughout most of the night that kept me up. Second (and I realize this sounds silly), but the hotel beds have the noisest sheets I have ever experienced. Every little move my husband or I made was well-amplified because of these sheets. Otherwise, the bed was quite comfy. And, I would definitely stay in this hotel again. It provides a great starting place from which to see Manhattan, and in a friendly, accommodating, comfortable atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “What is the fuss?”
Reviews.Author: Epsomite
Reviews.Content: I don't know what all the fuss is about! My husband and I stayed here in December, on a trip to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary and I must say I was apprehensive to say the least. But what a gem. Lovely room on 19th floor, clean, comfy bed, top breakfast and curtious staff. The Xmas decs were tasteful and the lobby inviting. Ignore the kiljoys. we have stayed in top hotels all over the world and this was a pleasent city hotel. It does exactly what it says on the tin!! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “I guess it was okay”
Reviews.Author: paluvsnyc
Reviews.Content: Hotel is old and the rooms are run down. Had asked for a refurbished room upon making the reservation but didn't receive one. Stayed on a Wednesday night, which wasn't busy, so it wouldn't have hurt them to give us a nicer room. We did have to change rooms once due to street noise, dirty sheets, and hairs in toliet. Both rooms were the same condition on 6th and 7th floors Staff was nice, especially the man at checkout. Location was the best thing the hotel had going for it. Parking at $39/24 hours was also a good deal. We didn't arrive until 9:30 pm Wednesday night, and checked out at 8:00 am Thurday but didn't leave the city until 4:00 pm and only had to pay the $39. So many hotels base their rates on the time of check-out and then pro-rate the other hours your car is parked. Probably wouldn't stay here again just because of the room conditions. Wall paper peeling, dusty, especially in the corners, ripped and dirty sheets, scuffed walls. I think the hotel could really profit if it did a renovations to their rooms. Also we did not have a flat panel TV in either room like the site states.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: lazerfloyd87
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Park Central I stayed one week from Jan 3rd to 10th. DONT listen to all the complaining idiots because they are probably the mangers of all the other hotels in the area and want to write a bad review about the hotel cus they are jealous. The hotel was eveything you could ask for if you are touring NYC then its a nice clean well tidied daily hotel to come back and rest your feet. If you are on business there are big conference rooms and the room had 3 ports for internet access. I was given a good room with a view of times sq just email them a couple of days before you go and ask for a nice view thats what i did and they gave me one! Massive comfortable beds 4 big pillows giant flat screen tv safe in room big wardrobe clean sizeable bathroom and room tidied everyday by the poliet maids. The concierge desk on the ground floor are a great help from Theatre tickets to boat cruises helicopter rides you ask them anything about New York they know all about it. Easy check in at anytime and easy check out at anytime lovely restaurant on ground floor theres like five coffee shops all on the same street i suggest fluffy's that was nice. Overall a wonderful hotel and we had a great trip this hotel should be way higher on the popularity index trust me this is a great hotel in the middle of manhattan however your just 1 min away from times sq and 1 min away from Central Park so the street u are on is quiet. Great Hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: KandyKorn143
Reviews.Content: If you like being told that your reservation isn't really a reservation and only a request then you'll be fine. We arrived with confirmation in hand which read "Superior King, Smoking." The front desk girl claimed that any reservation is a request and upon arrival you will get whatever the hotel has available, no matter what rate you paid! We were put in a double room which was filthy! The next day we were told to come back at 4 p.m. and our proper room would be ready. We had to leave in the middle of shopping to go back to the hotel and the room still wasn't what we had reserved! Our baggage sat in the store room and we were roomless for an entire day. No where to put our shopping, no where to change clothes...we finally were upgraded after a lengthy discussion with the manager after a third desk girl told us that our reservation was just a "request." Even the executive suites were filthy with mold and peeling paint covering the walls. Great location if you're willing to slum it. I've stayed in cleaner youth hostels.

Reviews.Title: “We did'nt expect this...”
Reviews.Author: Berten
Reviews.Content: After reading all the pros'n'cons about the hotel, I was very positively surprised with the stay. After driving for weeks around the U.S. My friend and I didn't exactly look fresh and was eager to stay in something else than a motel for a change. We arrived 2 hours earlier than check-in time. That was not a problem (because we're non-us?). An older gentleman greeted us welcome after 2 min. in line waiting (Friday). I asked for a "nice room for a change" and quickly told about our journey. "Of course - always" he said and checked us in to a refurbished room in 22nd floor with a great view and really nice beds, LCD-TV and nice bathroom. The room was bigger and cleaner than average in NY. We stayed for 3 days and no problems at all. Of course you cannot have dinner nearby - since they'll rip you off, but we did order some cocktails in the lobby which were good. Upon departure they stored our luggage at the usual rates, was over so helpful about getting us a private car to take us to JFK (saved at least $50 on that one). It all went so fast, we almost didn't have time to re-pack a little before taking the long flight home. We paid $230 and from a European view it's well worth that - and some more.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location and Good Value for Money...”
Reviews.Author: brlee80
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife just got back from a 4 night trip to New York (Jan 3rd - 7th 2007). The hotel could not be better located: 6 blocks from Times Square - when you step outside the front of the hotel and look right the Neon of Times Square hits you in the face. The hotel is opposite Carnegie Hall and a short walk to Rockefeller Centre as well as 3 blocks from Central Park. 5th avenue with all its shops is also a 10 minute walk away. The rooms are also fine. I am pretty fussy when it comes to hotels and i cant really complain about this one. The lobby is inviting, check in was a breeze, as was check out. There is a small bar which was also very nice but a tad expensive. The only minor gripe i have is with expedia. We booked a 'Superior King' room but on arrival was given a double room ( with 2 double beds ) which were pretty small double beds (feet were hanging out of the end) but they were very very comfortable. However the girl who checked us in did give us the option to change to the king the next day if we wanted so no issue with the hotel. For £60 a night you cant go wrong with this hotel so i would recommend it to anyone and would stay there again. We didnt eat breakfast or dinner in the hotel so cant comment on that but what i did see of the restaraunt it looked pretty nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Transportina
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in quite a few US hotels I had high expectations of this one. The lobby areas are quite nice but I was disappointed with the rooms which definitely need some updating. The worst thing about the hotel is the lifts (or elevators for the Americans!). We waited for absolutely ages every time and often when the lift did eventually arrive it was full. On the day we checked out, we had to carry our cases down several flights of stairs after giving up on the lifts. That said, the staff we very polite and friendly and the location really is good. The rooms are comfortable enough but I have to say I'd try somewhere different next time.

Reviews.Title: “NYC-Park Central”
Reviews.Author: monscha
Reviews.Content: Our family has had opportunites to travel both domestically and internationally and our stay at this hotel was okay, but we had some problems. But first, the location could not be better, close to the shopping, Central Park, Times Square, museums or subway. A very strong point for the hotel. Our room was not ready at the check in time (4:00 pm), we waiting in the lobby with many other travelers. When we arrived at our room (standard with two double beds) and attempted to enter it was occupied by another family. We proceeded to the desk for a new room. This took another 15 minutes, and when we went to our new room, the keys did not work. The front desk staff did not ask for the original room keys back, we had them our entire stay. The room was not cleaned by housekeeping one day. Our bathroom had mold-mildew on the walls, and wallpaper was peeling in the room. Overall, awesome location, poor customer service, and a overpriced experiece.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterCookie
Reviews.Content: First of all I have to comment on the fantastic location of this hotel !! Opposite Carnagie Hall and minutes away from 5th Avenue and Broadway. I stayed in what must have been a standard twin room as it looked quite different from the pictures shown on the hotel website !!! Still, the room although basic was very clean and comfortable. I did however find a problem with the lack of plug sockets available. I needed to use my hairdryer as the one supplied which was in the bathroom wasn't adequate. I found that the sockets that were available seemed somewhat dangerous by British standards in that they weren't correctly secured to the walls with parts exposed. I only ate in the restaurant once and that was for breakfast. The food was somewhat overpriced however the service was first class....the staff were very attentive. All in all I would recommend the hotel and would stay again but perhaps in an upgraded room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice price, clean room, GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: KarlaP
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Park Central 3 hours before official check in time and the clerk, without hesitation, got us into a room that met all of our requests. The elevator situation is a little odd, we had to use one bank to go down and another bank of elevators to go up. I think this has something to do with work going on in the hotel. It really was no big deal at all. Our room was very clean and spacious for a NYC hotel. The beds and pillows were so comfortable and the facilities were clean. We had a problem with the bathtub handle and it was repaired within 15 minutes of our phone call to the front desk. The location is AWESOME...Close to just about everything you want to see. The subway stop is right at 57th and 7th if you needed to head downtown for shopping or sightseeing. The restaurant was a bit pricey so we never ate there. Too many other wonderful places to eat at a better price. This was my 2nd visit to the city and I would definitely stay at the Park Central again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: mdobie
Reviews.Content: Really liked this hotel. Charming lobby and attractive rooms. Lighting in bathroom was poor and hallways could be updated but overall, I would stay there again. The location is great and is literally in the middle of the island. It seemed that I could get almost anywhere within a 10 to 25 minute walk. I could be in Times Square in 5 minutes, Theater District in 10 minutes, and Central Park in 8. Soho or Uptown was a quick subway ride away. There are also at least 5 great eating choices in the same block ranging from inexpensive to nice dining.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Piki123
Reviews.Content: We booked a Superior King room from the Hotel website for the best rate and had the chance to submit an extra request at the same time, not really expecting anything we asked for "A good view". When we arrived at the hotel we were told to head to the 24th floor and as our hopes had anticipated we were greeted with an awesome view of Times Square from both of our windows. The room was spacious, impeccably clean and had a great homely feel about it as well as a massive TV. The king bed was probably one of the best that I've slept in, beautiful pillows and sheets which were changed at least once during our 5 night stay. The cleaner did a brilliant job, we always came back to a spotless room with new clean glasses, empty bins and shampoo refills a plenty. Similarly the staff on the concierge desk and at the main reception were helpful and friendly with no problems at all. There are only two picky niggles I can find about this hotel, one was the fact that they only had coffee making facilities in the room, (Us Brits like Tea too!) and the other is something that's completely out of the hotel's control, more of a general annoyance; Everything we touched in the room gave us a static shock. I don't know if it was the sheets or just the general NYness (We received several all over the city!) After a while it started to get on our nerves! The hotel also had a great location, we walked to the Rockefeller, Empire State Building, Times Square, Madison Square Garden and the Mid-town Heliport to name but a few. Overall, a great looking hotel in a perfect central location. One of the best that you'll find for the price and comes highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: cihlarova
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned about staying here due to the few not so great reviews but decided that the majority of reviews were good so booked anyway. When we got there, as some people had experienced, neither of our rooms were ready and we were told to come back later. OK so thats not a great start but its only a big problem if you make it one. We just stored our luggage free of charge at the hotel and went out!!! When we came back the rooms were ready and they turned out to be really nice! They were a good size and cleaned daily. There were 3 girls in our room and plenty of fresh towels were left for us every day. Its a perfect location and we all had such a great stay there. The majority of the staff were pleasant and helpful and the housekeeping staff were lovely!!! I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: westender
Reviews.Content: It was four years ago when we stayed here. It's a hotel to lay your head for the evening. The room was clean and the security was good. When you're paying such a small amount of money to be centrally located in NYC there really isn't much wrong with it. When you're on a city break you're hardly in your room so as far as having a comfortable bed and cleanliness was concerned, this hotel dertainly did the job. Room was small though.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: RamblingGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend last week and we had no complaints at all. The staff were helpful, our room was huge, the beds were the most comfortable ever and the room was really quiet considering it's on 7th Ave. The location is also perfect. There were only a couple of minor faults - we didn't get towels until 8pm due to a laundry problem and we would have liked tea and coffee facilities in the room but these were not big problems and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. It also seemed really good value. Well worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need major updating”
Reviews.Author: blks
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Park Central are in need of major updating and cleaning. Three of us stayed here for a 2 night business trip and we agreed that all three rooms need work. Wall paper peeling in the rooms and bathrooms; bathroom showers have mold; one room has cracks in the ceiling. The location of the hotel and comfort of the bedding were great.........but, honestly, the room conditions were the worst I have stayed in for years.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL. Swansea, Wales UK”
Reviews.Author: mjfd
Reviews.Content: A group of us (4 girls) have just returned from the park central and havn't got a bad word to say about the hotel, from the time we arrived the staff were extremley helpful and friendly,our room wasn't ready when we arrived which was no problem as we were just so excited to be in NYC and couldnt wait to get outside! The 4 of us stayed in one room which was a tidy size, the beds were comfortable and it was clean which was the most inportant thing. One of us managed to brake the shower which we rang reception and a plumber was sent straight away and the problem sorted within an hour. As there were 4 girls the only thing i really could complain about is we only had 2 mirrors and it took us slightly longer to get ready than we had planned!! overall our stay at the park central was excellent and id def go back hopfully next year...

Reviews.Title: “heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: holidaymaster
Reviews.Content: Wow!!! this hotel for a 3 star is excellent, clean, friendly staff, nice atmosphere, big neat modern rooms with a excellent location- times square at your doorstep. We loved this hotel, stayed 20-22 november- it was wicked, such big, clean rooms, and not pricey for new york at all. could not fault it. comfortable- you could just sty in hotel!!!! definately one to book- we paid 90 pound per night!! not bad in the busiet part of the new york holiday season!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location -we want to go back”
Reviews.Author: RamblerUK_Kent
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Arriving for the first time in New York on a four nights stay, we were given a 'superior room - 1 king' on the 24th floor! Amazing views and enough space in the bedroom and bathroom for the two of us and many shopping bags by the end of the holiday! The staff were great, from the quick check-in, to helping us book city tours and restaurant reservations and even the extra speedy check-out with cab ordered for us to the airport. This hotel can boast an excellent location, just far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Broadway and Times Square so that you can relax. It's a 5-10 mins walk to these locations. Its a couple of blocks from Central Park and even a couple of blocks from the shopping strip of 5th Ave. We would certainly go back. There is a Starbucks next door for your early morning caffeine and toasted bagel. We ate in the hotel restaurant on the first night and were slightly disappointed. There are far better choices and value for money only a stones throw away. For our last night we splashed out and can highly recommend 'The View Lounge' for dinner at the top of the Marriott on Broadway. It's a revolving restaurant with great night views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: FannyBrice
Reviews.Content: We would definetely stay there again, if rates stay reasonable. Location is great - walking distance to Central Park and Times Square. Though we had expected a bit more from a newly renovated room, rooms were reasonably clean. Can't complain about bathroom cleanness. There are only two negative points worth mentioning: They charge 3 USD per piece per day for storing your bags after check out. They also charge 1.25 USD per call, if you are using an (international) prepaid calling card from your room. Overall I'd rate the Park Central as a pretty good tourist class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would stay again, recommended.”
Reviews.Author: DarrenandVick
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel, and had a very pleasant experience despite being a little worried about all the previous poor reviews of the hotel/service. We were initially allocated a room on the 23rd floor. The 23rd floor had an area cordoned off for some renovation work, so we asked to change room as we didn't want to be disturbed by any works going on. The front desk staff were very helpful and gladly allocated us another room on a different floor. The room itself was modern and elegantly appointed, with an extremely large, clean, comfortable bed with new bedsheets and large LCD TV. We would guess that some modernisation has been carried out in the last few years. The room was serviced daily and plenty of clean towels provided. The sheets were always clean and crisp with not a hole in sight! The location of the room was also really quiet as it was in the middle of the building away from any traffic noise (which we would choose again over having a room with a view). If we visit New York again, we would not hesitate to stay at Park Central Hotel, and will be recommending this place to our friends. Yes, the room service is pricey, but you don't have to have it as there are plenty of reasonably priced deli's and cafe's on the doorstep for breakfast you'll be spoilt for choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lousy Customer Service/Staff”
Reviews.Author: TracieHu
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the location of the Park Central. It's close to everything - including a QNRW subway station and is surrounded by good restaurants, delis, diners etc. The rooms are large and clean and if you get a room at the back of the building you won't hear a thing at night. Having said that..... the staff are deplorable! They made a mistake with our booking - we were booked in from the 11th to the 18th November. They were expecting us on the 1st because of a clerical error. Luckily I had brought all the confirmation emails etc with me, otherwise I'm guessing we would have been out of luck. They had charged my credit card $407 as a penalty before we got there and it took us the entire week to get it back. Their 'Guest Services' was a complete joke. We were ignored, fobbed off, blanked, talked down to... they had an envelope for us at the desk for 4 days and nobody told us until we went to them!!! Everyone else we saw at 'Guest Services' or at the check in desks seemed to be complaining about a problem with their booking. The Concierge was awful. We gave us asking them for advice on getting to the airport and sorted it out ourselves. And finally the room service is a rip off. We were charged over $20 for a bowl of bran flakes with milk. If you stay here be prepared for the complete lack of anything resembling service or friendliness from the staff and you won't be disappointed. And buy your bran flakes and milk in the deli downstairs and save yourself a small fortune.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: AbbyWyatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for four nights. We had never visited New York before and our main criteria was a centrally located hotel - the main reason we booked this one. Like many others I was worried after reading the review on here. These were however unfounded for us. Ok, so the decor could use a little 'freshen' up but it was clean and comfortable and made an excellent base for seeing what Manhattan has to offer. You cannot fault the location at all. Just dont bother with the cafe new york in the hotel, overpriced and the food is nothing to write home about either. All in all, a terrific trip and I wouldnt hesitate to stay here again - if youre booked in, dont worry! If you're just looking for a comfortable base for your stay in New York you wont be disappointed with the Park Central. Also found staff to be very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Will Never Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Rottie_Guy
Reviews.Content: Front desk personel was EXTREMELY rude and ruined my entire stay. Check-in person, Helen, was rude from the moment I arrived. Because of this person, who the hotel insists on employing, I will never stay there again and insist that no personel from my company ever book a room there.

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to return here”
Reviews.Author: juew1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned form here after a 5 night stay, after reading the horrible reviews we went equipped with airfreshener for musty rooms, extra curtain shower rings (I kid you not) extra shampoo's, shower gels, towels my mum even packed sheets!!!!!! What a waste of time no funny smells, 25 curtain rings (yes we counted them) abundance towels (everyday I might add) extra shampoos etc enough for a family of 20 to be precise and fresh crisp clean sheets and not a hole in sight. there where 4 of us in our room and although we couldnt do the conga around it we found it spacious enough, very clean and just what we needed. I dont know what these people had to complain about. We checked in at 4p.m in super fast time with welcomes from everyone, so we where quite nervous about going up to the room we thought they where trying to hide something evil and murky about where we where staying, we where very pleased with everything about the hotel, from porter to concierge to room service to reception and the bar staff where very efficent and seemed to love there job and couldnt do enough for us. the only thing we would of loved in the room is tea making facilities, but we found a phone call and 10 minutes later we had the best cup of tea of the day.... As for the location we couldnt have picked a better place just a few blocks to the left Central Park then a few blocks to the right Times Square. If you want the best breakfast around go to Brooklyn Diner 1st left out of the hotel we loved it and returned 3 times the food and service is excellent a bit pricey ($66) for 4 of us but well worth it mmmmmm..For a cheap and cheerful brekky turn right out of hotel and 2/3 blocks down theres the 810 Deli the food here is great too and sooooooooo much to choose from ($38) for 4.... For meals in the evening we loved The Castle which is across the road and about 2/3 blocks right (round the corner from the Irish Bar ) the food here was scrumptious. Just be careful at all places you eat, they sometimes add the tip onto your bill, so just check before leaving a tip. So many things to do in just a short time, you should really go on the tour buses we booked 2 day passes on our 2nd day, they take you all around Manhatton and you can hop on and off everywhere, the buses run every 15 mins so you never wait long for 1 to come along. I f you love shopping your in the right town, we had to buy 3 extra cases,thats all our xmas shopping done... When you go to Macys go to customer service and ask for discount card if your from out of the country your entitled to an 11% discount on most items in store its great.. woodbury common is a must, Timberland boots for adults and kids are $40. Juicy Couiture jogging suits for $180 and lots anlots more, when we arrived at the bus station on our return we had no joy with cabs so hopped on a rickshaw back it was great we where all wrapped up and where home in no time. Then to 5th avenue where all the great names are, go into Tiffanys the decore is amazing. For make up and perfumes SEphora is the shop to go,they sell Dior, Clinique, Mac etc and there nearly all half pice compared to the UK, I drove my family mad, as I couldnt walk past 1 without buying something. We didnt visit the top of the empire state as 2 hours was just too long to waste so we went to the top of the rock wow wow wow its fantastic the views are unbelievable, we went as the sun was setting amazing... If you like a little more adventure you really must go on a helicopter ride we only went on the 7 minute ride but wished we had gone on the longer 1.. For those who like easier rides jump on the Statton ferry its free and takes about 40 minutes there and back you get to see the empire state with amazing views behind her... Well as you can guess we loved New York and Park Central, so much so my parents are booking to go back in April and I'm returning for Xmas next year... Have fun and take comfy shoes......

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: xstatix
Reviews.Content: This hotel really isn't too bad. The location is pretty central--a few blocks from central park, the time warner center and a few minutes from Times Square. The staff is friendly and helpful. The amenities are clean. The room we stayed in was just renovated so everything was new. It's not too spacious though and this was a suite room. The hotel is pretty busy so expect to hear a lot of noise within the hotel, whether it be traffic (streets) or people in the hallways/lobby. The walls are not paper-thin but I wouldn't say sound proof either. This is my second stay at this hotel. My first trip was the same "neutral" experience. Truthfully, the hotel wasn't really part of my stay much because I was out in New York most of the time and was only be in the hotel to sleep and drop my stuff (shopping) off. So if you're not picky, I would say this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: WayneandSam
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for all sightseeing attractions, located between Central Park & Times Square. All major attractions well within walking distance. Check in was smooth and friendly. We used the knowledge of the concierge, Keith, who was really friendly & genuine - a real help. He advised us on restaurants and shopping trips, along with the best shows to see. The bar staff within the hotel were fantastic, real chatty and genuine. Rooms were huge, with a massive bed, really comfy, great pillows, perfect for a proper sleep after a heavy day shopping. Clean & regularly serviced. Massive LCD TV, although I bet it won't be on much!!! :-) TKTS is ideal for on the day cut price tickets, just off Times Square, approx. savings 50%!!!! The hop on, hop off sightseeing bus is great, the tour guides are hilarious & the two day ticket is well worth the money. Woodbury Common is perfect for bargain designer clothes, you will need a full day, see your concierge for booking & advice. Take a horse & carriage round Central Pk, this is a real pleasure after a hard day shopping and a great way to relax. Empire State Building at night is a real WOW moment, got to be done. Take the Staten Island Ferry, its free & you get a great view of the Statue of Liberty along with the skyline of Manhatten., takes about 40minutes round trip. Use the yellow cabs and don't be fooled into using any hotel private cars, even if they tell you your ride back to JFK will be metered - it is, but shouldn't cost any more than the flat rate on the way to the hotel. Beware about using the hotel room telephones, 1 call back to the UK cost us approx. £40 sterling for 7 minutes!!!!!!!!! Over £130 pounds on phone calls. Overall, what an excellent hotel, with great staff in the best city in the World. Ps. Be prepared for a lot of walking, so much to cram in & do, even the comfiest shoes hurt your feet!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Walking Distance to all Things Good but Hotel Not So Nice”
Reviews.Author: meowlover
Reviews.Content: My company paid for me to stay at the Park Central and it was over $400 a night. If I had paid that out of my pocket; I would have been down at the front desk complaining alot. BUT, since I was there on business, I had less time and energy to worry about the following things: 1) towels are scratchy and not near enuough of them in bathroom - no wash cloth til third night. I almost locked a few in my safe to make sure I had extras in case I needed them. The ammenities for shower are very subpar (soap are the HOJO kind and the combo shampoo/condit bottle is sad). 2) The shower has a fair amount of mold/grossness in the tiles - needs to be regrouted. It would take 20 minutes and they really need to spend their time on things like this so people like me would consider going back on my own dime. 3) Construction was loud and started early in morning. Sounds like a jackhammer or airgun in the stairwells? It got me me up every day. No need for an alarm clock at this hotel. 4) No room service menu in room, no room service after 11:00, no bottled water in room, no minibar, burned out bulb in bathroom, very weird throw pillows (plastic-y) 5) Very nice theater ticket agent desk in lobby 6) NO snootiness - like I see in lots of other NY hotels - maids and bellmen were nice - albeit a bit clueless about etiquette and did not let you go in the elevator first as they jammed their carts in, etc. They seemed to be hungry for tips everywhere you looked but I did not overtip cus I hate that! 7) No coffee/tea in room - so you were running downstairs alot and it is a HUGE hotel. 8) GREAT location So ---- if I were paying my own way I would NOT pay more than $170 a night for this hotel (watch out for all the taxes as it really jacks up the price) - the location is really good if you like to walk in the park and go to shows - and that is the only reason I would ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “Early morning construction”
Reviews.Author: ssim228
Reviews.Content: Hotel had a construction crew start jack hammering before 8:00 am. Management made no effort to notify guests or move us to another wing while crew was working. Front desk claimed to have no knowledge of work being done. Constantly had to ask for linens because maids did not leave the basic washcloths and handtowels.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, below average hotel”
Reviews.Author: hempest
Reviews.Content: Positives at this place were few and far between, but location was good, only a couple blocks from time square, and the beds were very clean and comfortable. Thats where the positives end. At $300 per night, you wouldn't expect to get nickle and dimed on things such as luggage storeage, which is $3 PER ITEM. Luckily I got a parking spot out front, so it was a non-issue..but frustrating nevertheless as we had 7 bags for 4 people. THis was at 2:00 pm, and our room was not going to be ready to check in until 4:00. Thats as late a check in as I've ever seen in a hotel anywhere in the world. The concierge was completely unhelpful with regards to anything. They did not know parking regulations for the Columbus Day holiday, they could not recommend a place to eat. In fact, they seemed very impatient with anyone who would ask them a question...I'm not sure why they were there. The room we got smelled of mildew, and was very musty. The clean, comfy beds were a plus, and I ended up with a decent night sleep, but for $300..you can certainly do MUCH better.

Reviews.Title: “Great New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vel2006
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Central Park for 7 nights at the end of September. The location is ideal. You can walk to all the sights. There are loads of diners and delis nearby. The room was large, had a huge TV and the linen and towels were clean. The bathroom was also very clean. The gym is a plus. Check in took a few mins at 3pm and we found all the staff to be friendly and helpful. Only negative aspect is that we only got a bar of soap rather than showergel in bathroom. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “my worst hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: millieg
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the biggest hotel disappointment. Dirty rooms, dirty bathrooms, small, thin towels with holes. chipped paint and terrible service.Changed room once. The 2nd room was not as dirty. Good location and nice lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Location isn't everything”
Reviews.Author: crnp73
Reviews.Content: This is an example of a hotel that looks pretty good on paper, but the real experience is quite different. We have stayed in many NYC hotels, and this is the first one we would never recommend. Check in took about 20 minutes and we were given a room that "for some reason won't come up on the computer". Bad sign. We walked miles to our room because they had recently stopped sending the near elevators to our floor. Every employee we encountered begged us to complain to the management about this problem. The room was fine at first glance. A nice flat screen TV and a bed that had spotless white linens seemed welcoming. The general appearance of the room, though can best be described as shabby. Nothing seemed fresh. The curtains only covered the 2/3 of the window, leaving thin sheers in the center which did nothing to block out the bright city lights for a night of restful sleep. The biggest shock was the bathroom. One tiny bottle of shampoo/conditioner was the sum total of "ammenities" and the curtain over the bathroom window consisted of an old shower curtain hung sideways and cut in half, held up by bent coat hangers. The first full day of our stay we left the room at 8 a.m. and returned at 9 p.m.to find the room had not been touched by housekeeping: The bed still unmade, the towels still on the bathroom floor. We immediately called the front desk and they promptly sent up a surly housekeeper who was furious at having to make up the room at that hour. She literally kicked our sheets across the floor and glared at us the entire time she was there. Meanwhile, we had complained about the makeshift shower curtain drape at the front desk and they did not seem to understand why this was a problem. It was a weekend and they shrugged and told us to tell a manager on Monday. When we returned to our room the next night we found someone's rubber cleaning glove had been left in our sink. I guess we should have just been happy that housekeeping had made an appearance, but it was not pleasant wondering how many toilets that glove had cleaned before coming to a rest in our sink. Again we approached the front desk, and again, they really did not care. The only positive comment I can make about the room is that the bed was very comfortable. The nicest employee we encountered was the bellman who helped us with our luggage as we left. We go to NYC frequently and we will NEVER again stay in the Park Central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Whyalla
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at Park Central on our first visit to New York. The room was spacious with a big screen TV and iron & ironing board. Our room had a view over Seventh Av and it was great to observe the NYC hustle & bustle but there was no noise for sleeping. The location with close proximity to the premier sights - Times Sq, Fifth Av, Central Park and also the subway station made this the perfect spot. The tour desk attendants were also most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ezza3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in September and were pleased with the location .Our room was clean and comfortable and a good size.Lots of sights and attractions were in easy walking distance and underground stations nearby Don't be afraid to use these are they are very straight forward.Only a couple of blocks from Central Park which is very pleasant.Don't miss Carnegies deli just a few doors along.All in all I would recommend this hotel for a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large room, excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: mfg1
Reviews.Content: All of the negative reviews had me worried about a recent business stay at the Park Central Hotel. But aside from a few customer service glitches, the experience there was excellent. First of all, the location is perfect -- a few blocks from the park, a few blocks from Times Square, a few blocks from Fifth Avenue...you couldn't ask for more. The concierge level room I had was big and nicely appointed, the bed was comfortable, the linens were first rate, and the plasma screen t.v. was a nice bonus. The only negative is that room service ends at 10 p.m., which seems rather ridiculous in New York City, where people are out incredibly late. Customer service is spotty -- some of the staff were incredibly helpful, some were indifferent...but overall, this was a nice room in a great location for a reasonable rate. You can't ask for more than that.

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: J&JMacTravelers
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned at reading the reviews of the Park Central Hotel before going and after booking the room. We couldn't have been mored pleased with our stay, the hotel, staff and our room. The location is fantastic, close to everything, you would want to do or have a way of going, bus, subway, etc. The staff was wonderful, we got an early checkin, and late checkout. Our room was clean, very nice. We had a nice view of the city also. Just requested and got it. The staff, from checking in to the housekeeping were very hospitable, I would only say that the hotel bar was a bit steep in price, but very nice as were the bar personnel. We would highly recommend staying at the Park Central when you visit New York. Just remember, when you are nice, people are nice back.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ASK01002
Reviews.Content: I got a fabulous deal on their website. Hotel is good value and convenient location. I had a good time, wonder why there are so many negative reviews about it.

Reviews.Title: “great location, short on details”
Reviews.Author: johnnyblast
Reviews.Content: Overall, we enjoyed our stay there. But the lack of attention to detail for example; burned out lights, no washclothes, then an abundance , then the next day, nothing -became frustrating. The location is great but they need to brush up on attention to customer complaints and even better, take time to check things more thoroughly BEFORE the guests move in and complain. It would also be a great gesture if they offered amenities like shaving cream , toothpaste to those travellers who are not allowed to bring those items with them due to security. The cost for these items is too high when purchased at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Should've Taken the Negative Reviews More Seriously!!!”
Reviews.Author: T_Norton
Reviews.Content: Prior to booking my reservation, I checked several websites to determine if the Park Central was somewhere I wanted to stay. Since the reviews seemed somewhat mixed, I took a step out on faith and made reservations at this hotel...BAD DECISION! I stayed over Labor Day weekend and since I had a late flight did not arrive until approx. 1:30 a.m. To my dismay there was a large group of people seated in the lobby with their luggage when I walked through the door. Upon walking up to the reservation desk to check-in I was instantly told that there was a problem and the manager would have to speak with me before I could check-in. After watching him sashay back and forth on his cell phone for about 5 minutes, the manager finally walked up to the desk to assist--only to walk away 30 seconds later to do something else!!! The situation really became outrageous however when the manager issued hotel keys to a couple who had walked in an estimated 15 minutes after me despite the fact that I had been waiting patiently. Of course, when I interjected he had the nerve to react toward me as though I were the one who had committed an offense. He claimed that he didn't know the reason I was standing at the counter despite the fact that he has just walked away minutes earlier and I had told him I needed to check in; then upon giving him my name he claimed he didn't have record of my reservation. After pulling out my confirmation, he miraculously located the reservation, but then claimed that the computer didn't have me arriving until the Saturday. Considering the fact that is was 2 a.m., it was Saturday, but he had the nerve to get snippy and say that check in wasn't until 3 p.m.--which was irrelevant since the confirmation was printed in black and white and clearly indication that I had made reservations for a Friday arrival. Furthermore, upon issuing my key, Mr. Personality put me in a room with one double bed, despite the fact that I had paid extra for two, and it was not dependent on availability at the time of my check in. When I complained at this point I was told that there were no more rooms with double beds and I would have to take the issue up with Hotels.com. Upon question however I was advised that I could change rooms the following day, but Mr. Personality made sure to NOT notate my reservation to make sure that I would be able to do so with ease. After finally getting a room, I did find stray hairs in the hotel bathroom and there were holes in the bed sheets, but after switching rooms the following day, the remainder of my stay went pretty well--and I agree that the location is AWESOME. I guess that give the hotel an advantage in terms of serving up horrible service whenever they feel like it. In hindsight, the rest of the staff seemed pretty gracious, but first impressions are lasting impressions and I don't think I'll be staying at the Park Central again. If I have to pay extra money to receive more commendable service, then so be it. P.S. Turns out that since it was raining (remnants from Tropical Storm Ernesto), several of the rooms were leaking and the people who were seated in the lobby upon my arrival were graciously waiting to be moved to new rooms. The manager never did personally relay any of this information to anyone while they were checking in, despite the fact that they were using a system where the agent at the desk was instantly advising everyone that there was a problem in the hotel and the manager needed to have a word with them. I just happened to overhear the agent relay this information to someone in the line behind me. I'm not sure how long the people waited to get new rooms, or how long they had already waited, but I left them downstairs, and it didn't seem like the staff was too interested in servicing their needs.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything.”
Reviews.Author: MissNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the first week of august, which ended up being the most expensive week of the year to get a room. I was thrilled with the Park Central. It was exceptionally clean and everyone from the concierge to the housekeeping was very nice and helpful. It is in the best location. If you go right out of the main entrance, it is a 10 minute walk to times square. If you turn left, you can be to Central Park in 5 minutes. There is not a better location than the Park Central. You can walk to 5th avenue shops in 15 to 20 minutes and Rockafeller Center is only a short walk as well. There is a Starbucks right next door. There are tons of great places to eat near this hotel. I have been to hundreds of restaurants in new york and have found a few to be the very best. 810 Deli and Cafe on 8th Ave. between 40th and 45 St. is excellent. It is quick and cheap, but the food is fabulous. If you are looking for somewhere good in chinatown, XO is probably the best general Chinese restaurant. It is run by a Chinese couple and although they don't speak much English, it's easy to order and the food is wonderful and very authentic. Check in is not until around 3:00, but they keep your bags for only $3 a bag, which is cheap for nyc. Also, if you want to see a Broadway Show, especially if it is your first time I highly reccomend Hairspray. It is fabulous. It is by far my favorite one and i know people of all ages love this for the costumes and music. I hope this has been helpful. And have fun in the best city in the world.....

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: onetravelerinoh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the end of July. We arrived early in the morning (8:30a.m.) with the advanced promise of "early check-in". We had a meeting to be at by 1:00 pm. When we got there were were informed that early check in was not available. At 4:00 p.m. most of us were still setting there waiting for our rooms. I stay at a lot of hotels, but I had never been to New York before. I was expecting plush, but am NOT used to luxury. The room was, unfortunately, neither plush NOR luxurious. It was a tiny, dirty room. The carpets were not swept, the linens were dirty, the mattresses were filthy, there were bugs crawling all over the bathroom floor. There was no fan in the tiny, shoebox of a bathroom, so when you took a shower you stepped out into The Fog and there was no way to air it out except with time. When we asked for them to change the bed sheets they didn't come. When we complained to the manager they finally did come and put 4 sets of sheets on, including on the pillow cases. We assume this is for their ease when we check out - they can just remove the top sheet and viola'...clean sheets for the next guest. Disgusting. One of couples we were with flushed their toilet and had the waste back up into their sink. The staff at the front desk was the rudest staff I have ever encountered at a hotel, but the cleaning staffed seemed friendly enough - even though almost none of them spoke english. The gift shop can fit one person in it at a time, and should not even be called a gift shop. It was a very bad experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money & pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Guy_Maxwell
Reviews.Content: I can only speak as I found, and the Park Central Hotel proved to be an excellent choice for a short business trip to NY. Check-in was smooth & efficient, and the room was clean, spacious (in relation to my standard UK standards) and comfortable. The LCD TV was a great little perk. The only downsides were that there seemed to be some problem with their computer system which meant that I couldn't charge drinks to my room bill, and also that the gym was closed during my stay. However, the overall experience was very pleasant, and given its location the price was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Too Big for its Own Good”
Reviews.Author: gel2001
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so big, it loses the human touch. There was no mini-bar or even hot drink making facilities in the room. The website states a charge of $70 dollars for checking in before 4pm but this did not seem to be the case. One of the controllers was missing on the air conditioning system. If you preferred to have the windows open, they were of sash style but only opened a couple of inches. We asked for our room to be changed because the first room was next to a chilled drinks machine which hummed very loudly all night. We were moved to a room diaginally across the hallway where the view was of a brick enclosed opening - almost like being at the bottom of a well - daylight could not even get in. I wanted to dial a toll-free number but the operator told me that even though the call was toll-free, the hotel would still charge me $1.45 for making the call. I stayed at the hotel 9-12 August 2006 and would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for the family.”
Reviews.Author: vfar
Reviews.Content: Great location. Three subway stations within a block, family restaurants nearby and across the street from Carnegie Hall. Clean and affordable. We stayed four days with wife and two teenagers and we all liked it.

Reviews.Title: “no complaints”
Reviews.Author: NackyNoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for part business/part pleasure. When my friends came to stay for a long weekend there were 3 of us in twin room (2 double beds) which was perfect. Both the bedroom and en-suite were modern and clean, and reasonably quiet - perfect for when you just need somewhere to lay your head at night, and get washed in the morning! The location was fab, I spent most of my time walking around town, it's in between Times Square and Central Park, so close to everything! And there's a subway right outside the side door. Would definitely go back again if visiting for a long weekend of shopping and dining!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: IMWeasel
Reviews.Content: Booked a double room at this hotel for a week, when we checked in, double wasn't available until the next day so they gave us a king instead. When we complained, stating we actually wanted 2 separate beds, they offered a cot, which was a tiny foldup single bed, this in fact took 6 hours to arrive in our room after checkin, after which point we were very tired and jet lagged. Staff were incredibly unsympathetic and said that because we prepaid through expedia there was nothing they could do to offer a separate room for the night (we were told to read the small print!), or even a discount for the inconvenience. After begging with the front desk to actually get another room for the night (I have back trouble), they managed to conjure up a double room. Moved our luggage into the new room, only to discover air conditioner leaked water onto the carpet, the safe didn't work and the tv didn't have a remote control and worst because we prepaid for the week we couldn't check out and move to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Photos misleading - Overrated”
Reviews.Author: allseasonworld
Reviews.Content: After a few days at the New York Hilton...which we loved...we splurged on a room for our last night at the Park Central which was twice the price. We couldn't check into our room until after 6:00 and were charged per bag that they kept for us during the time we waited. The hallways and room were very dirty - not vacuumed and smelled very strongly of smoke. The smell was so strong all of our clothes carried the scent after a night in the room. The phone was broken in our room. The ceiling plaster was falling down towards the window. The bathroom wasn't very clean. The drapes were falling off the rod and wouldn't open or close but were knotted to stay in place. On top of that the hotel manager was not helpful at all during our stay but instead encouraged us to provide feedback later...so here it is... In general it was a miserable experience and a complete waste of money. Save your travel dollars and miss the Park Central Hotel. There are many many other terrific options.

Reviews.Title: “Give yourself a break and pay the extra for nicer hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelingmomofca
Reviews.Content: Last week, we spent three night at the hotel. First of all let me tell you the positives... great location!, our room was available - n/s w/2 doubles, when we arrived.The beds are good and the pillows are comfortable. Again the location makes this hotel. Here are the negatives of the hotel. It is a tourist hotel and many people are in out of their doors... are room had tagging on the walls, it appeared there was an attempt to bleach it out but it was still very noticeable. There were flies in the lobby and in our room. The towels for our room were kept to the min. Shampoos and soaps were not replenished. The room was dirty. The guests before us had french fries and fries were in the room around the table and on the floor. Last bit, we went to the concierge for assistance. The mid.age woman appeared bothered by us asking for dinner reservations and a particular spot. Did not come across resourceful... they could save the money and allow the guest to look up spots on the internet. Overall, the location is great. Don't expect to sit around and relax at this hotel. If you want to lounge select another hotel... if you are there just to sleep and shower than this spot is acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting hotel”
Reviews.Author: educatur
Reviews.Content: Staff was inattentive, unaccomodating, rude. Room wasn't ready. Had a confirmed double with two double beds.
