They refused to give us a place to shower while we waited for hours until it was ready. Manager was rude and unhelpful. Room was dirty, with bugs, torn wallpaper, broken headboard with nails sticking out of it. When we came home from dinner at 11:30pm, the toilet had overflowed into the room so that there were several inches of water in the bathroom and the carpet in the bedroom was soaked. When I called down to the front desk, they did not respond. When I called the manager, he refused to move us. Almost 45 minutes later a maitenance man came up with towels and when he saw the mess said "Dude, you guys need to change rooms." So he called the manager and the maitenance man somehow convinced him to give us another room, which the manager had told us was not free. When I tried to check out the next morning, the computers were down, and they couldn't even figure out how to give me a receipt. They offered to fax it to me, but never did. It was the worst hotel experience I've ever had anywhere in the world. Super 8 or Motel 6 are luxury hotels in comparison. There are lots of midtown hotels in this price point -- it was $300 a night. Don't Stay Here !

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the Park Central”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Central from July 5 - 8 with my two teenagers and we found it suited us perfectly. We knew the location was great but had read some reviews that were a bit negative. On the contrary, the room was clean, a good size and had recently been updated. The TV screen was larger than I've ever seen in a hotel room which is a real bonus because in New York City you don't even need to be watching much TV. Beds were comfortable - we slept great. Toured the city by day and ate breakfasts at the Metro Deli nearby. No complaints about service from the front desk and the maids were very friendly when we saw them in the hallway. I thought the concierge might charge a bit more than the nearby Visitor Centre for the Gray Line bus tour but this was not the case. Highly recommend the 48 hr hop on hop off pass with Gray Line. My two teens & I found the bus a wonderful way to see the sights and learn all of kinds of neat info about NYC. I would stay here again. It took a few days for it to really sink in that we were walking distance to so many things. Would definitely spend more time exploring Central Park next time.

Reviews.Title: “good location...that's about it...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located steps from both Central Park and times square and right around the corner from the theatre district. That's about all it has going for it. From the very beginning we found the service to be abysmal. The check-in staff was cold and very unhelpful. check-in time was 4 o'clock and we arrived at 3:30. We were informed that we could store our bags for three dollars each, or have a seat in the dark crowded lobby until our room was available. (we took our bags and got some lunch). The rooms are small and marginally clean. The lighting is terrible throughout and the tables are small. There was only one bank of working elevators, which was a long haul from our room. The concierge was rude and unhelpful, only recommending the hotel restaraunt(sure sign of a bad hotel). The TV check-out system did not work. Surprise, Surprise. This hotel needs new management. Until some drastic changes take place, I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wanted to provide a quick review since I've started using Trip Advisor as part of my travel planning. Hotel is reasonably priced for what you get, and is located between Times Square and Central Park, within walking distance of both. Good cab service in this part of NYC, so we left the car with the valet and the bags with the hotel ($3 per piece) when we arrived early afternoon. Got 50% show tickets at the TKTS booth in Times Square, and then had a quick bite to eat prior to the matinee. When we arrived back at the hotel around 6pm, our room was ready and we had no problems getting settled in and then having a great dinner using Zagat's, Michellen and gayot to find the kind of restaurant you don't have back at home. Checkout was 12 noon the next day, so no rush getting out of the hotel for us. Turned out to be a nice visit to NYC, although from the looks of some of the people sitting in the lobby they either had nothing to do until the 4pm check-in time, and even afterwards. NYC is a good place to have some plans before your arrive, since there are hundreds of options once you get there but this hotel does a pretty good job of putting you in the middle of things. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: a very good location ang a good standard room. the staff could be more polite.but apart from that an exellent first visit to new york and would stay here again even if it is just for the location. and the air con was a life saver one day it was 95 degrees with 100% humidity but the room was it was more like 65. the bed was the best i ever slept in and the plasma tv says at all.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location in a Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: f100zardoz
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a seven night stay in the ' park central hotel'..The taxi fare from J.F.K. to the hotel was $45 + tolls, for a total of $50. This is a set rate from J.F.K. to manhatton. The lobby of the hotel is impressive with no problims checking in and plenty of staff to help. I stayed on the ninth floor and was plesently suprised to find a large {by n.y.c. standards} bright room witha a king size bed and an l.c.d. t.v. The bathroom was also clean and a good size. The location of the hotel is perfect !!!. Walk out of the main doors and look left, your looking at central park..look right, and thats time square. At two corners of the hotel are subway stations. These are great for traveling downtown {brooklyn bridge, battery park, wall street, groud zero, little italy, ferries, chinatown e.t.c.}. Go down to the subway, buy a ticket for $2 and follow the signs for'downtown/brooklyn'. There is a great little diner you might try out for breakfast called 'the parisian', walk towards central park, it's on your left. The hotel has a free gym for guests and a nice bar. I thought the bar closed too early at 11.30. Overall a nice clean hotel with a great location..recommended..hope you found this useful, thanks Michael.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Nothing Else To Recommend”
Reviews.Author: young7898
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this place, as I felt that some of the previous reviews sounded a bit petty. However, despite the excellent location it would be very difficult to recommend this hotel to anyone else, or to envision staying there again. It's not absolutely terrible, but just crummy enough to warrant serious hesitation. We really didn't have any serious problems during our three night stay, but can easily imagine that if we had, they would not have been rectified. The only issue that we did complain about (a lack of fresh towels) was treated with disdain, and then ignored, by the maid. However a different maid gave us five fresh towels and an apology when we brought it up again. Good points - location / reasonable room rate (for New York). Bad points - poor maid service response / erratic elevators / very small room.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: rdc
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights at the Park Central. Nice hotel in good central midtown Manhattan location. We had a superior king room with superb bed and decent amount of space. Staff all friendly and helpful. We didn't test out the restuarant food as wanted to get out and sample as much of the city as possible. Would recomend and certainly if i'm back in NYC would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our experience was great!”
Reviews.Author: mazzyk
Reviews.Content: After reading the previous reviews I was naturally hesitant as they did not portray a particularly favourable hotel. But some of the reviews seemed OK and the location suited us so I booked direct through the hotel's own website. I had a look through other sites (Hotels, Octopustravel etc) and the price seemed fine. Average $250/night inc all taxes and charges. We arrived 1 June for a w/end visit. This was my mother's first visit to NY so I had requested a high floor if possible. Chris who checked us in was very professional and efficient - noted our request and was able to give us a complimentary upgrade to the 22nd floor (we later discovered that my mother wasn't too keen on heights!). Room was perfectly fine - good size - bathroom perfectly adequate too. TV was lovely size. I had asked for a smoking room as my mother smokes occasionally and I thought it may be difficult to find somewhere to smoke (she wouldn't have felt comfortable smoking on the streets). In the end she didn't smoke anyway, but the room did have a smokey air about it during our stay - but I figure if you get a smoking room you should expect this. They can't fumigate a room and eradicate all smoke smells after each guest! Location was great - moments from Central Park and Columbus Circle (10 mins walk?). Times Square 5-10 mins the other direction. We had booked tickets for the Hop On- Hop Off bus tour (great value for tourists by the way, worked out as $44 per person - unlimited hop on/off for 48 hours and a choice of 4 tours to keep you occupied). The ticket office was 5-10 mins away and the Uptown Loop tour drops off at the front door of the hotel. Didn't use the restaurant facilities - who would when there are so many places to try in NY?! Although there is a little diner-type place on the way to Central Park - can't remember the name (French?) but is staffed by mature people who all seemd to be Greek. Very very friendly and so cheap! I would definitely stay here again when visiting NY (although I do try and stay in different places just for the experience) and would definitely recommend to anyone wanting a central location at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location could not be better and getting a great deal (124 canadian a night off expedia.ca). The hotel is right next to the subway so its one train to the statue of liberty. The park is left out the door and times square can be seen as its on 7th ave. All very easy walking distance. Two issue I had were the safe needed its battery changing and the security person was very slow to act. And the non smoking room previous person did have a smoker (who broke the hotel policy)! To be fair there was a guy checking the rooms with a deodorising spray. 32 inch LG lcd tv in the room and a king size bed. Shower okay and bathroom nice and clean. Aircon very effective. Banks close by and a foreign exchange place. No breakfast but then again there are loads of cafe's less than 1 block away. 5 stars as I got such a good price for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience of My Life”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because it was the only one with availability for my husband and I and our two children. I can see why. I realize we weren't staying at the Ritz but for $550 a night, one expects some basic comforts and courtesies. The first night, we had a room with a wonderful view on the 17th floor like we had asked for and yes, the plasma TV is nice. But the room was HOT! We fiddled with the air and cranked it down as low as it would go...barely a breeze blowing out. Wake up all through the night in puddles of sweat. Call front desk next morning to request it to be fixed or have a room change. On hold forever, finally told that they would send someone up. Nobody comes. Call again, finally a maintenance man comes up who doesn't speak English. Fiddles with it for about 30 seconds, tells us to close the drapes and let it run and then leaves. We go out and come back in the evening to a room just as hot. Call front desk again, getting more frustrated now looking forward to another night of this. Am told to open the window. I said for $550 a night, I'm not opening a window...it's JUNE! Another maintenance man comes up, says it needs an overhaul, nothing he can do. He calls the front desk and tells them how hot it really is and that the only thing opening the window will do is let out any little bit of cool air the unit might be blowing out. Told, sorry, hotel is booked, nothing we can do. I charge myself down and find a manager. Explain to him the situation and that I have been asking for a room change since that morning and it shouldn't have taken all day to get to this. In addition, I explain to him that my daughter has severe allergies and breaks out in itchy hives when she sweats. Magically he finds another room. I ask him about compensation for all of this and he says "you booked through an online service so I can't do a rate adjustment, I don't even know what your rate is". And not at all apologetic. So we drag our bags and our two sleepy little ones at midnight to another room which was not serviced by the same elevators. In other words, we had to get on one set, disembark on floor 3, travel across the hotel, get on a different set and go back up to floor 6...huh? New room is cooler but now we have a view of 4 walls that made me feel like an enclosed prisoner. Seriously, I almost felt a panick attack in there. And gone was the nice plasma TV. And gone was a vanity in the bathroom. Now what we had was just a sink...a freestanding one...with no counter at all. And a broken drain in the bathtub. Oh, and when housekeeping came, they removed all our towels and left us with NONE. No towels at all. Oh, and when I went to ask the concierge for some assistance, she was in the middle of what was obviously a personal call and as I was standing there, gestured with her hand for me to wait without even looking up and making eye contact. I finally had to give up and walk away. When we were in upstate New York earlier in this vacation, we stayed at a $90 a night motor inn that treated us like royalty and we wanted for nothing. Here for $550 a night you get treated like a nuisance and don't even get the bare necessities. I have noticed some reviews stating how wonderful their experience was and implying that maybe those of us who had bad experiences expected too much or even deserved the rude treatment. Lucky for you because I can assure you that if you had the experience most of us had you would understand. I'm sick to my stomach over the money we spent here and dread opening that credit card statement.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central...Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After staying at 2 lousy hotels on the same trip the park central was quite a relief. Very clean rooms and bathrooms and comfy beds. The view from our window wasn't very great and the air conditioning had no controls but other than that our stay was excellent. The location is only 2 blocks from time square which was a plus. The other hotels in time square are very expensive 300+ a night. The park central was quite the steal in such an expensive area. I loved it. I am definitely staying here when I come back to New York

Reviews.Title: “Hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: timster_1000
Reviews.Content: You pays your money, you takes your choice. Well, my company paid $600 for two nights, $300 for one night and $250 for the last night. That averages at $437.50 per night. Now, for that sort of cash, you'd expect something pretty darn good. As it happened, the company I work for footed the bill so I never really exuded any real emotion about the stay. Objectively looking back, it really isn't value for money - and that is generally the yard stick for how most people rate a place. Checking in was proficient, extending my stay by a further night took 15 long minutes by an employee who initially approached me when I was queuing up - 10 out of 10 for courtesy; 5 out of 10 for making the extension. I don't expect much in a New York hotel room. Having stayed in W Hotel (Lexington) and Sherington Manhatten (for which I consider to be equivalently priced), the room was reasonably sized. The hotel booking was made at the last minute, hence I got a building view with two queen sized beds. I couldn't be bothered to stick them together to make them a super super king size one, but the potential was there. There was a nauseating smell in the corridors. The maid did a lousy job (I just didn't have the right denomination of dollar bills, I promise). She kept on replacing my dirty towels...with my dirty towels. A soap bar and little else in the way of complimentary toiletries. TV was alright, with enough pointless channels to pass the time by. The dinner menu was missing from the booklet and besides, the kitchen closes at 10pm I later found out - wouldn't you think they could profit from making it 24hrs like most of the city is open for? Dry cleaning did the same day service for the price of overnight, which was a pleasant surprise. The ironing board/iron was handy and there were enough wardrobe space and drawers to even accommodate my wife should she have accompanied me - to put her clothes in... I only had breakfast at their cafe each day. One is seated reasonably quickly and the buffet is small, but very tasty. So far I have not been impressed with New York hotels. It's like they've spent all their money on a plush lobby and failed to deliver on the rooms (the place you spend most of your time). The maid service was terrible - ok i failed to tip - but folding my dirty towels for me to use again day after day is not on and the decor needs modernising. Watch out for the lifts - they take an age to arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here ”
Reviews.Author: Tampa24601
Reviews.Content: We had confirmed a room with two beds. We arrived at 2 PM on the day of our reservation and we were told that there were no rooms available with two beds until 4 PM so we could either check our bags and hang out or get a room with one bed and a roll away. We took that option. The room was a spacious cornor room. The shower (room 1706) had a full window to the outside with NO covering. This was not acceptable to my wife or daughter to take a shower in full view of the folks in the building accross the street. The housekeeper told me that she knew about it and that I (not she) should call the front desk. I called the front desk and spoke with the day manager. He said that he would take care of it. We rested and then freshened up. No one had come to the room, so on the way out, I went to the desk and the staff person said that he would take care of it and I reminded him about the rollaway. We left the hotel. We returned three hours later. No rollaway bed and no window covering. I went down to speak with the evening manager. He appeared to be appalled as this was my third request. He assured me that he would take care of it. We went to a show. Got back at midnight. Nothing changed. No rollaway bed. No covering on the window in the shower. I went and spoke with the night manager. The best that he could offer was another room. So, at 12:30 AM we moved rooms to a small room with peeling paint, peeling wall paper (room 2009), a too short shower curtain (flooded the floor) and got the rollaway bed at 1 AM. And yes, they charged me full rack rate for this hospitality. If you have a choice, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: NickPembina
Reviews.Content: While I have read the many negative reviews, I can tell you that our experience was the opposite. The location was great. The rooms were ample. We even decided to eat in the restaurant on the main floor, which we found to be fairly priced, with a high quality. This hotel has been given a bad rap. Try it and see for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy!”
Reviews.Author: vkb_10
Reviews.Content: Called the hotel directly to make a reservation for 3 nights. Booked a Superior room with a king size bed and a city view. My husband and I arrive at 3;15 to check in . We are told that the only room available , did not have a city view. We said that we would pay for a larger room or a suite. The hotel receptionist, said that all rooms were the same in size. We asked what view it had, and were told the wall of the next building. If we wanted another room we would have to wait until 4pm. (we just arrived from a 5 hour flight,not adding waiting for luggage and the commute to the city). We asked if we could view the room. We were told in order to view it we would have to check in, and if we did not like it to come back down. We had to lug our luggage because the bell boys would not be responsible for it. The room, was not a room. I stretched out my arms and could touch the walls. It was dark , grey and humid. We went back downstairs, and there was a long queu of people checking in. I did not go back to the gentlemen who had attended me because he was busy, so I went to his colleague. She said If we wanted another room we would have to wait until 4:15pm, I asked her then why was everyone else checking in. She said she would hold a city view room for us on the 14th floor, which was bigger. I asked where can I leave my bags while I get something to eat. They said they did not have storage and that I would have to take my bags next door, to be stored, at $3 per bag. I returned around 7pm, and the first gentlemen who had waited on us, asked me how he could be of help. I told him he had helped us earlier and we were returning because we rerfused to pay $400 for a hole in the wall. He mentioned that I did not return to him to let him know. I told him that his colleague reserved us a room. He looked and could not find anything, he left to the back, and after 15 minutes returned and gave us a room. When I got upstairs, the door was wide open , the curtains were thrown on the floor, and there was a strong smell of amonia. I tried to call downstairs, and the phone did not work. I went downstairs and he seemed annoyed to see me. I told him if he was able to sleep in that room with that smell for 3 nights I would pay his vacation. I told him it was unacceptable . He somehow found another room, which was slightly bigger, but still no city view. We checked out the following morning, where we waited 30 minutes for the elevator(only one of the three was working) The housekeepers said there was no one they could call or make aware of the situation. Her advice was to take the elevator going up.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central...A Friendly walk in the Park”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from New York where we stayed at The Park Central Hotel on June 1-2,2006 just wanted to tell you, our stay was a great experience. Can't beat the location, check-in and check-out no problems, room was clean and loved the flat screen TV. Every staff member we met, even in just passing, greeted us with a smile and a friendly hello........very impressive! The hotel security was present and appreciated.......Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Park Central”
Reviews.Author: K65
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nights at the Park Central Hotel in NYC. The best what we can say about this Hotel is the location, only 2 blocks from Central Park right opposite from Carnegie Hall. Roomsize was average, but don't expect a quiet room. NYC is noisy and there's no way to escape that noise. Service in this Hotel is poor, although our room was clean and smelled fresh. There seem to be some problems with the bathtowels. It makes no sense to replace 2 big bathtowels with 2 small ones or even only 2 washclothes. The staff is rather unaware of that. Concierge Service is not worth mentioning. And beware of their offer to arrange a private limousine service to and from JFK for you. The bell captain takes 30% of the charge als pocket money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent my 40th birthday in New York and stayed at Park Central. The bed was very comfortable. The television was a nice touch. I was served cookies and stawberries as I waited to check in. I would recommend the hotel as the location is convenient. I did not have to take a taxi to broadway shows. There was a great restaurant two blocks away and several bakeries and delies.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on this site, I was a bit apprehensive about my 2-night stay at the Park Central. However, I must say that I was pleasantly suprised by my experience there. While I don't consider myself to be especially spoiled, I've never been one to stay at a Motel 6, either. Contrary to some of the reports posted on this site, the common areas of the property and the room in which I stayed were modern, freshly-renovated and clean, and the front-desk personnel were friendly and efficient. I did not experience any undue delays at the elevator, check-in, or check-out. Overall, I'd rate the Park Central a very strong 3 stars. I can only guess that some of the people who have recently reported less-than-satisfying experiences at this hotel either stayed prior to the completion of the hotel's refurbishing and/or a management change, or were expecting a suite at the Peninsula.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - worst hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_Overseas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had just finished 7 weeks travel and this has been our worst hotel experience. We had to travel to NY at short notice as our son was hospitalized. We booked for two nights. After flying for 24 hours from New Zealand we arrived to check in a 1am Sunday morning. We were informed that our room was not available as the hotel had over booked its rooms. Front desk staff advised us that they had booked us in at a nearby hotel for the first night and gave us directions to walk there with our suitcases. We found the front desk staff unapologetic about the overbooking, condescending and unsympathetic to our need to sleep. Returning to the Park Central the next day we were given Room 2023. We found the noise of the adjoining room’s plumbing very intrusive, noisier than our bathroom (thought it was the alarm clock going off at 6:30am!). Walls are not sound-proof as we could hear animated conversations between a couple and their young child in the next room. We were very surprised to see the coffee making facilities set up in the bathroom. Not hygienic. Not a happy experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Good Breafast - Shame about the rest”
Reviews.Author: Grezzer
Reviews.Content: We read all the reviews before booking at this hotel. We still thought hey, good price and good location. Knowing we weren't going to be in the hotel much we booked it. For the first two nights we were woken up by the next room's TV blaring out. The paper thin walls and unlockable adjoining door made this are poor start to the stay. We still tried to make the best of it though. Met up with the other couple we had travelled with and they introduced us to the Sauna - their room! Heating was jammed on at 33 degrees and they were finally moved after numerous complaints and phone calls to reception - Not the swiftest response to a customer issue. To be fair, the hotel was undergoing some major cosmetic works and many of the systems were being turned on and off so problems were likely to occur, just wished we had been told about this before we travelled. Security were effective and finally dealt with the guest who played their TV at near full volume between the hours of 1am and 5am. Most of the staff were helpful, particularly the cleaning staff. Maintenance were non existent. Watch out for the bag boys who try to steam roll you in to Limos on every taxi journey. One tip here - If you are leaving NY for the Airport durig rush hour, a Limo is very good value. Central Park to JFK was $50 in the Limo (space and A/C etc) but the journey took nearly two hours owing to traffic. Well worth the money... If you do decide to stay here the upside is great location, very good breakfast, good prices for NY and reasonably good size rooms. Views are restricted if you get one at all but you shouldn't be too put off. You simply need to stand strong when making your issue heard. They will put it right and after the refurb I am sure it will be much better!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, well worth the money and time!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was very sceptical about this hotel, after I read reviews about it on expedia and on tripadvisor but once I got into the lobby and saw the size of it to what is shown on expedia doesn’t do it justice. Check in/Check out was very swift. We had a concierge king room booked, located on floor 18 we got what we asked for...king size bed and 32inch LCD T.V with 50+ T.V channels. The room size was good, (easily fitted 3 big luggage bags, all my wife’s!) also very clean and comfortable. Housekeeping did a commendable job. Got all the simple ammenities, i.e...coffee, toiletries, extra towels. Every member of staff which I came into contact with were very friendly and polite. Reception and concierge service was fantastic, gave me tips about finding restuarants and broadway shows. We didn’t eat inside the hotel’s resturant, as we wanted to explore the city, but across the street on W 56, there’s a great place for breakfast...Teleon cafe. Breakfast for 2 for under $10. Times Square, Central Park & Broadway are literally 2 minutes from the hotel, 5th Avenue and Rockefeller Centre where about 5 mins from the hotel. All-in-all for first time NY visitors I was very pleased that I booked this hotel. At first I wasn’t too sure but I will surely book this hotel when-ever me and my wife visit NY again! For meals, trying eating out. Expecially when visting in the spring, as most deli’s and resturants are open early and close very late. Also to get in all of NY sites, try walking from your hotel. Many of the top attractions are within Midtown, around the hotel and 7th Avenue. For the very fit, walk straight down 7th Avenue, past Times Square and you will first come to Macy’s then MSG (Madison Square Garden) and then finally Ground Zero. This takes about 30 mins but its worth it!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT for the price”
Reviews.Author: DavyGGG
Reviews.Content: Cannot beleive the bad reviews. Stayed one night May 12. Had a very large, clean room on the 14th floor. Could not ask for more. Would come back again. GREAT LOCATION

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Wilbur1994
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the terrible reviews of this hotel we were a little worried about what we would find, especially when it isn't cheap to stay there. We arrived late but were immediately upgraded without asking to a suite as a non smoking room was unavailable. The room we were given the next day on the 19th floor was modern, clean and had great views. (This was a superior room with a king bed as booked) We asked for a coffee machine and it was provided, same goes for an extra blanket. The staff all over the hotel were pleasant, helpful and courteous (makes me wonder when I read other reviews now). The hotel is in a great area for Central Park, Times Square and 5th Ave. Plenty of shops and deli's nearby. As it is near Times Square it is in the hub of the tourist district and the crowds on 7th can be a bit intense at times so not for those looking for a quiet area although there was no problem sleeping. All in all we enjoyed staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Actually not too bad - get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Cread1974
Reviews.Content: The great thing about the hotel is the location and having read some of the previous reviews I knew what to expect. The rooms do need redecorating and the bathroom is dated but on the plus side the beds are very comfortable and basically you get what you pay for! I didnt eat at the hotel so can't comment on the food but to be honest we spent most of our time sightseeing and eating out. Overall - not too bad and I have stayed in much worse places!

Reviews.Title: “Decent... in the end!”
Reviews.Author: kansel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Central for 4 nights in May 2006. The room we eventually ended up in was excellent - spacious, clean, 2 double beds, LCD TV - no complaints. Unfortunately we were given a duff room to start with which is why the Park Central only receives a 3 star rating. The first room we were allocated was on 6th floor. The wallpaper was peeling off the wall, sockets hanging from the wall, was generally shabby and smelt very musty - I think it was damp. We persevered for one night but on 2nd night requested a transfer and were moved to a room on 17th floor which was excellent. Can't fault the staff - moved us without any hassle. Bellmen always helpful as was the concierge. Be careful though, theatre ticket prices they were quoting were higher than you can buy on ---. Location of the hotel is unbeatable - walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, Columbus Circle, Lincoln Center and of course the shops! At the end we had a great stay at the Park Central - shame about the first night in the duff room.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Alternative”
Reviews.Author: dopplersmash
Reviews.Content: With an early-morning meeting the next day at a hotel a block or so away, I was in need of a more budget-friendly, but still nice, hotel in the vicinity. After reading very mixed reviews here, I was very interested to experience the Park Central for myself. I am glad that I did. The room was exactly as reserved online with a king bed. The LCD TV was a very nice touch. For New York City, the size of the room was above average. The location is excellent and I found no issue with noise level where I was staying. The front-desk staff tends to recite a standard speech upon checking in, so while I would not give them the award for most outgoing and friendly, I didn't find them rude either. Truthfully, checking in at the end of the day, all I really wanted is to get my key. I guess I could pay another $100-$150 and get perkiness from the staff of a neighboring hotel, but I was very satisfied with the accommondations and location of Park Central.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lynseyH
Reviews.Content: The best feature of this hotel is it's wonderful location, just 2 short blocks from Central Park, only a 5 minute walk down the street to Times Square and a subway station right outside. This was the second time we've stayed there and have been impressed both times. Staff were friendly and the rooms were a really good size and clean. Only problems we've had both times was the heating - it doesn't seem to be controlled in the room and it's quite cold in winter. No tea/coffee facilities but there's a starbucks right next door so we didn't mind. Would definately recommend staying here

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: sandiegotravelers7
Reviews.Content: Two of us stayed at the Park Central in mid April. We had some concerns before we arrived based on some of the reviews. Fortunately, we did not find any of the issues that others complained about. The lobby area was very spacious and clean. The desk staff was polite and helpful. The room was spacious and clean. The closet was a nice size and loved the flat screen TV. Was the experience perfect? No, but if you want that then stay at the Ritz Carlton or Trump Towers and pay 4 times the cost. Yes, you do have to pay $3 per bag for them to storge your luggage for the day, the restaurant was very overpriced and two elevators were not operational. However, these very very minor inconveniences that had little impact on our trip. I stayed at a Hampton Inn in NYC last year and the room was slightly larger than a small closet and was awful. I recommend that you not eat your meals at the hotel restaurants since there are so many other good places close by. Remember that the food in NYC is expensive so expect to pay more than you would pay a a local restaurant in your home town. Two great finds for food................Across the stree and a 1/2 block over is Fluffy's Cafe and Deli. They have great food and it is reasonably prices for breakfast and lunch. Great pastries too. Yes, it is small and crowded but well worth it. Another good place that is all over NYC is Metro Cafe. They have a very large menu and is cafeteria style food. They have great soups that change daily and is reasonably priced. I would definately stay at the Park Central again and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “In a word, Yukkk!!!”
Reviews.Author: cassboett
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in and very expensive!! We checked in, our first room was not made up and the bathroom was flooded (or just used for a shower!) and towels all over the floor (and it had a very musty smell). I had to go down to the lobby to get the key for the second room, which the toilet did not work at all. I had to go down again, get a key for the third room, which was OK. Granted, the front desk clerk offered breakfast, but they don't serve until 7:00 am. (we were leaving earlier). This is a "pack 'em in" hotel, the restaurant closes at 9:45 pm and does not open for breakfast until 7:00 am. Rooms are small. We ordered room service, they add the tip to the check-15%. The food was average at best. For $289.00 a night, I will go the extra money and stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Not to shabby depending on your needs...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to NYC and stayed there with my girlfriend. While we chose this hotel for the location and the price, we got what we paid for. The hotel's public areas were always clean and the staff was very pleasant whenever I had a question or a request, although there was a touch of mold on the shower curtain (room 1030) That being said, this hotyel is VERY popular with tour groups and school groups. There were literally HUNDREDS of kids between the ages of 14 and 17 hanging out in the lobby at all times. Could it be that because of the hotel's close proximity (across the street) to Carnegie Hall? Perhaps...but after a long day of walking around Manhattan or coming back from a great dinner, the last thing you want to hear is hundrerds of teenage girls shrieking about or the guys just lounging about taking up space. Anyway, if you don't mind distractions I described above this hotel is in a perfect location and provides rooms at a rate that is not as astronomical as other hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible staff attitude and no hot water”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked a package on-line for a king room with continental breakfast for 4 nights. That package costs US$140 more than just a king room. Upon checking in, we were told we cannot have any breakfast because the on-line booking agency did not tell the hotel breakfast is included. We showed them our bookingg sheets and payments but still the hotel refused to provide breakfast. Their words were "it is something you have to sort out with your on-line booking agency, it is none of our business". After much negotiations with the manager on duty and another staff on the reservations desk and showing them all the paperwork, they reluctantly said they would issue a breakfast voucher. There was not even a hint of apology for the hassle for the guests. Also there is no water kettle provided. If you want a cup of tea you can order from room service or from the cafe. Or you can order hot water as room service at a charge, or hire a coffee maker at a charge. So bad luck to those of you who wants a cup of herbal tea. We have to buy a kettle and that works out to be far cheaper than any of the options the hotel provides. Never again this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved New York, But Park Central Hotel ?”
Reviews.Author: Allen From Virginia
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel on a Sunday morning around 9am after a short flight from Norfolk, Va. As soon as the door to the cab opened at the front door of the hotel, boom a hand out to take the bag to the front door, boom a second hand out for the bag to make it to the check in desk, we got checked in and asked if they had a place to store our bags, sure go down that hall and they can help you in the little room past the elevators. Now with the price of a room you think they could store your bags for free!;boom $3.00 per bag. We were hungry went to the lobby to eat, I got 2 eggs, bacon,toast,coffe, juice; boom $22.95. I recommend to walk across the street to eat- Great little place around $6.00 and you get more, breakfast, lunch,dinner.. We went to New York to see our son play at carneige hall that was across the street by one block and very close, very beautiful.. To walk to Times Square and Macys is really nice, and not that far, wear good shoes.. buggy rides up the street from the hotel at central park,20 minute ride $50.00.. After arriving back to the hotel finally got to see the room, very clean, flat screen tv's, clean restrooms, a/c heat didn't work, buttons broken had to open windows for cooler air, Needed ice for the bucket, found that everyone of those machines on each floor were broken, called front desk they said go to the bar in the lobby, again for the price of the room I have to go down 10 floors for ice.. Pictures you see posted of the nice light fixtures in the lobby carpets & nice furniture, that ain't happening. Website is better looking than the hotel. Never again my traveling friends.. Allen

Reviews.Title: “Much more than I expected.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Desperate for a room due to an impromptu trip to NYC (mind you on a saturday night, surprisingly and scary at first, because it was the last hotel i tried and the only with availabilty (this all occured around 11pm)), I went through about 35 hotels, before I tried this place. I was skeptical. Any hotel near all the "Hot spots" and fancy items is going to cost more and have less to offer, but surprisingly this hotel offered more at 139 dollars a night than I'd ever expect. Although, my experience is unique they treated me right. Firstly, we got in very late so they overbooked the room we were in, I became nervous, she gave us keys we went upstairs...not realizing that we were going to a suite, we now got to stay in a 399/night suite for 139. It was clean, goregous view (22nd floor), clean, and clean again, trust me some NYC hotels no matter the price are dirty, lovely clean white linens, huge bed, and two televisions, LCD large. I hear the internet was a rip off, I didn't bring a computer, I was on vacation and avoided the internet at all costs on this trip, but if you're looking for free internet, you're not going to find it at this place. The second best part was leaving, only because we had planned to take subway to airtrain for our flight, but the head bell hop I believe? he managed to get us a sweet ride for under 50 dollars, to JFK and let us stop two places on the way! Mind you this was during rush hour/shop time and should have cost at least 75-90 dollars. Now, some may think these reasons are not satifactory...given the fact that I'm a punk rock girl traveling with her punk rock bf, and we look less than professional and financially stable, we were not discriminated against at all, problems I've always had at hotels, even though appearance is quite opposite to my bank account. I felt as if I was treated as a guest/customer and not some urchine they wanted to usher out of the place quickly and quietly. Thumbs up if I stay in this part of NYC again, this will be the first place I look up, even if I don't get a room upgade.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a brilliant hotel! You walk out of the main entrance and look right, you can see Time Square (5 minute walk), if you go left your 5 minutes from Central Park. The staff at the hotel were polite, kind and helpful. The room was spacious and had everything you would wish for (except tea making facilities!) We were a little concerned about what the room would be like after reading some reviews, but we needn't have worried as it was plenty big enough. We will certainly be coming back to New York and with out a doubt be returning to Park Central!

Reviews.Title: “Shady management staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend and I were driving to NY to spend the weekend. We called the hotel and put a room on hold. After encountering bad traffic we realized that we would not be able to make it all the way to NY. When we tried to call back to the hotel to remove the hold, we were told that they couldn't cancel the reservation because the reservation center was closed(where we had just made the reservation). We were told to call back the next day. When we called the next day we were told that we would be charged for the room. We have been through a painful ordeal trying to discuss the issue with the hotel management. I highly recommend staying away from this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful! It is located only 3 blocks south of Central Park. 14 blocks north of time square, and a couple blocks away from all of the broadway theaters. right next to the hotel there are several restaurants, and bakeries. the best thing about the hotel is as soon as you step outside and look to your right you can see time square with all of the advertisements. the location of this hotel is acceptional. I stayed on the 9th floor. The room was huge (compared to some of the other hotel rooms in New York). It even had a flat screen tv! I was shocked! I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Park Central for 4 nights. I couldn't have asked for a better location! To the left (4 blocks) was Central Park where I took a great horse and carriage ride. To the left was Times Square. Right outside the hotel was a subway system which was very convenient. I wouldn't recommend taking the subway too often, as you will miss some great shopping and woderful cafe's. I have only a few negative things I could say about Park Central. First, I was in a smoking room. As soon as the elevator opened on the floor, I could smell it. It smelled like a club, no ventilation in the hallway so no way for the smell to escape. But, hey, I asked for a smoking room so my fault entirely. The room did not smell of smoke, thank goodness. Second, the housekeepers put the heat on full blast every time they cleaned the room, so it was very hot. Thankfully, I could turn it down (I read that a lot of rooms in NYC don't have this). The windows opened so I could cool the room down a bit, so I'm not really complaining about it. Third, the ironing board was broken and it took quite some time for a new one to be delivered. I would recommend checking it out before you really need it, because the replacement iron was also broken and I had to wait again, just as long for a new one. Forth, check your bill. I had two rooms booked for myself and some family members. Both rooms were charged for long distance calls we didn't make. The check-out desk took the charges off without a problem, but if you don't know to tell them to, you will get stuck paying them. The concierge desk had several staff members. One was very helpful and the other acted like I was bothering her. But, you can get tickets for the theater and many other attractions from them, at a discount. Remember that, because they don't advertise that, you just have to ask. When asking for a good restaurant, I was surprised that they didn't mention their own hotel restaurant, so I didn't try it. Lindy's was a great cafe but a little pricey. I paid $23 for a piece of cheesecake and a cup of coffee (with free refills). Be aware, a lot of places in NYC do not give free refills on any drinks, and at $3.50 a glass, it can add up quickly. I have to say, I had a great time. I didn't encounter too many rude New Yorkers like I expected. Most of them were very helpful and friendly. Even at the airport when everyone was busy, before I even had a chance to read the signs to find my way, 4 different people asked me where I was going and pointed out the way. Very friendly. Overall, the excitement of the city and the great time I had made up for any shortcomings at the hotel. I would stay there again, most definately.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great!”
Reviews.Author: BBinVA
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many upscale NYC hotels and this is the best! Much better than the InterContinental, Hilton and Helmsley. The location is great and service is friendly but efficient. I stayed on the 24th floor, which appears to have just been renovated. The room was sparkling clean, roomy, and the big plasma tv was a bonus. The best part was the bed, which was sooo comfortable with crisp white linens, duvet and very comfortable pillows. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 04302010a
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in the hotel end of february.. Had been on this site and read mixed reviews of hotel, but I am delkighted to say that we found it absolutely fantastic! Room was very clean and had everything we needed. Service was great (reception, bar, concierge) We had no problems at all.. Would definatley stay there again and would recommend the hotel to people who are looking for a central location to stay in Manhattan. Only 2 blocks from Central Park and a 5 minute walk to Times Square! Must mention the great LCD television!

Reviews.Title: “Park Central Hotel New York”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Park Central. We were a little concerned after reading the reviews about the hotel but can honestly say that this hotel was fine. It is in a great location, within walking distance to Central Park and Times Square, and the bus stops right outside the hotel. The decor was a bit dull but bedding and bathroom was very clean. The staff also seemed very friendly and helpful. The cost of this hotel was very reasonable, and for the price we couldn't have really asked for more. Would definately recommend this hotel for its location and would not worry about saying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience in NYC”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked a very group at the hotel and were given the worst service I have seen in a hotel to date. It took hours to get everyone into a hotel room. We were checked into rooms that were already occupied, rooms that were not clean and rooms that did not meet our reservation requests (singles instead of doubles, etc). The staff was extremley rude (to say the least) and unapologetic. Rooms were left without towels, with broken lamps and more. When are room was "cleaned," all trash and dirty dishes were left in the room. This was by far the worst hotel experience I have had in New York or anywhere else. Their supposedly "bargain" prices get you nothing but a headache.

Reviews.Title: “Stay only if you get a great deal and can deal with rude staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived from California at 1am, after twice confirming our reservation in advance. It took until 3am to get into a room. We were originally given an occupied room, then a run-down, smoking room with a broken fan & hairdryer which was yanked out of the wall and left on the counter. After 24 hours and two more tries we finally got a room we wanted but that still had no fan. No face cloths were left even after repeated requests. Concierge was rude. Allen sent us to MOMA on a day it was closed, after telling us it was closed the day before. Construction outside our door began at 8am every day, even though the website we booked through said it had been remodeled last year. The beds were comfy and the location is great. The staff was so unhelpful and rude that it would have ruined our trip had we spent any more time in the hotel except to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped Off”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation on 3/1, early afternoon to stay at this "magnificent" hotel. At noon on 3/2, my flight to NY was cancelled due to ice storms. I called the hotel reservations desk to cancel. My call was transferred and all I heard was endless ringing. This process was repeated at least 5 times. The operator said they were busy and could not answer all of the calls. When I finally connected with the manager, 2 hours later, he said sorry. Their policy was inflexible. No Refund. No credit. Nothing. He did state that had I cancelled within 24 hours of making the reservation they would have issued a full refund. The problem, of course, is that no one with authority would answer their phone. I am a frequent traveler and this is the only time I have experienced such inflexibility. So if you make a reservation here, remember, you will also be serving as your own insurance policy for the full amount. Tell your friends. Tell the world.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler84
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Park Central. Got a great price on the room, which was very nice. Had a clean, well appointed room on the 21st floor. The only complaint is that all of the channels on the TV were not crystal clear. All in all the stay was great and I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great NYC option”
Reviews.Author: LittlePinkSequin
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Park Central was great. The hotel isn't very fancy, but it's nice enough, our room and bathroom were clean and comfortable, and the staff was helpful. Considering how much money other hotels cost, we thought this was a nice option. Also, staying in Times Square is horrible. This is right by Central Park (you can hear the horses trotting by at night) and even better, the hotel is right next to a subway entrance--very convenient. And you can eat at the Carnegie Deli and waddle back to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Not Worth It!!!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaMC79
Reviews.Content: The lobby was beautiful, but the room I stayed in(which I was told it would be a king bed but it was a double)was awful. The washroom walls were dirty, the stopper in the tub was broken and out of the drain, the toilet keep making a loud flushing noise about every 5 mins. The lamp had spider webs in them and they were very dusty!! The only positive things I have to say is the beds were comfy, the TV was a good size and the location is great. The room was so small and the temp in the room went from freezing cold to extremely hot overnight. I literally went to bed freezing and woke up sweating, even the hair dyer was old and weak. I will never in my life stay at the hotel again it was not even worth half the money I spent on this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay at Park Central”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through a blinded website - good price, but did not select this specific hotel. Like others, I read some of the negative reviews and approached my stay with much trepidation. The fears were unfounded and our stay was delightful. We arrived at 4 pm on a Sunday. Taking the advice of a previous reviewer, I asked for a room on an upper floor. The registration desk attendant was very solicitous and assigned us a room on the 25th floor. The room was clean, attactive, sizeable, and clearly had been renovated recently. The beds and sheets were comfortable, the bathroom was spotless. The maid service did a fine job every day (we stayed 3 nites). The bank of 4 elevators appeared to be new. They were speedy and prompt. The concierge provided helpful restaurant advice. Looking at the hallways on lower floors, it does appear that not all of the rooms have undergone renovation as yet. Would therefore echo the advice of others to ask for a room on an upper floor

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in a Lovely Hotel with Exceptionally helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Expedia had booked us into a dump of an appartment in the Lincoln Centre area. Fustration led my wife, who's 4oth Birthday it was, and I to seek an alternative hotel. Luck had it that we were walking past the Park Central, on spec we asked if they had any vacancies, expecting them to say no or yes they had but it was $200 +. To my delight George and Kirk sorted us with an excellent room for an excellent rate, I can not thank those chaps enough. They were friendly, professional and curtious and are sure to impress anyone who has dealings with them, trust me they are gentlemen of the highest standing. The room was on the 25th floor and is spacious, well decorated and matches any 4 star hotel I have stayed in. Our room had a brand new Plasma TV. Awesome!!!! The room is also very clean. The dining, although we only had breakfast, was excellent but a pit pricey. The hotel has a business centre, although our room had internet access. In addition there is a 24 hour fitness centre. This is a hotel I would recommend to anyone who likes quality at an affordable price. I know this sounds like someone from the hotel wrote this but it is not the case, these are my genuine findings for this hotel, if you want more info you can e mail me at tony@hughes609.freeserve.co.uk. Overall I'm very impressed, this is a hotel on the up and up, helped by staff who care this can only get better.

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Group of 9 women on shopping expedition. No problems as such with hotel only that in one of the rooms the cleaner decided to open a tube of pringles and help herself leaving what she didn't eat on the floor. What else could she have done that we didn't know about? Also a triple room was booked and we ended up with a room with king size bed and a childs bed, 5'6 by 2'6. Not the best for an adult. We asked for a room change, not available so asked for proof that we had paid our agent for a room that was not available - again not supplied as this would be deemed to make the hotel liable (were they not?) Customer relations manager - after speaking to us, told other people in the hotel that we had poisoned his mind. Not very good for customer relations. SPent the last morning at the hotel trying to get proof from them that we did not get what we had paid for - to no avail. Am in the process of trying to get some of my money back. Another couple who were also complaining arrived at the hotel at 9pm to find that the hotel had cancelled their reservation in January. With the hotel full they were left to find their own acomodation. Not the best when you've travelled all that way. They were told the front of desk manager couldn't see them as he was on the toilet and heard another manager tell the receptiion staff to tell them to go away. I would certianly not recommend this hotel to anyone due to the attitude of the senior members of staff. They were very rude, unhelpful and very unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “To be avoided at all costs.”
Reviews.Author: Peeqwar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is to be avoided at all costs. We arrived at 8pm (having made reservations for three rooms and having phoned and confirmed them in advance) and after waiting in line for an hour were told that the rooms were not ready as they didn't have any cleaning staff. We were asked to wait in the bar until 1am! As we'd travelled from the UK we had been awake at that point for 23 hours. The reception staff were rude, evasive, unhelpful, aggressive and even foul-mouthed. They basically told us that it was tough luck and we'd have to wait. All the European guests were left till last to be checked in and reception looked like a refugee area. When we finally got a room it was a dump. We'd requested a king size bed but got twin beds. The sheets weren't clean. The carpet was dirty. The safe didn't work. The internet connection didn't work. The light in the shower had water in it. The bathroom was mouldy. The shower handle was snapped off. The TV didn't work. I could go on and on but frankly it's too depressing to even think about it. In short, the Park Central is a pathetic excuse for a hotel filled with staff whose idea of customer service is to be rude and surly.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: St. Leonard's on sea. East Sussex
Reviews.Title: “not too bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews i was very nervous however good points first. The room had been newly refurbished, comfy king size bed, large flat screen tv, hot water, working lifts and some helpful staff. The down side, I was locked out of my room at 7am because a staff member had entered my credit card details wrongley and after much complaining we were given a complimentary breakfast. The room had peeling wallpaper and ceiling. There were never any face cloths supplied and the lighting in the room is dim even with every lamp on. The sedan I booked through the hotel was late, the lady on the desk could'nt had caredless.I'm glad we did'nt pay for the breakfast as it was luke warm. Some staff were lovley (thanks security and housekeeping) the rest acted as if they were doing us a favour letting us stay. There were numerous other guest complaining (glad I'm not the manager). Use this hotel only if you get a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: Judola
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Central beginning of Feb. I too was very nervous having booked this hotel and then saw the negative reviews on this website. My fears were unfounded. We stayed on the 19th floor - the room was big, the bed massive and lovely and everything was cleaned and tidied on a daily basis. The shower was not the best I have ever had but certainly not the worse either. Outside was Starbucks, 2 nearby diners, a pastry shop and 2 deli's either side (few minutes walk). Location was brilliant - had a view of Times Square. Staff were helpful and friendly. I would certainly recommend this hotel and happily stay there again. Looking at all the reviews I would say - ensure on check in that you are on a higher level.

Reviews.Title: “Are there two Park Central Hotels?”
Reviews.Author: AndrewT
Reviews.Content: So looking at these reviews I wondered what I was letting myself in for... First holiday with my girlfriend to a place that sounded like it was falling apart! Working for a travel company helps as I was able to get some fairly unbiased opinions. The room was of good size with no falling down wallpaper, etc... it did look like it had just been redone. The bed was comfortable, always a must and something you don't often find. Bathroom was good enough with a reasonably powerful shower - there must be a skill in getting these things to have a good heat, though why were the coffee making facilities in there?? Other than that the location was perfect, 5 minutes from everywhere and the staff reasonably polite though only dealt with them on check-in/out. One quibble was the cleaning, seemed to be quite random in what got left behind in terms of towels, coffee for the machine. A good low budget choice hotel, which must be doing up rooms as they go along...

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Park Central for two nights, Feb 8-10, 2006. Our room was modern, clean, quiet and well equipped. The staff was plesant and helpful. The location is great for walking or taking the subway. The recommendation for Applejack diner for breakfast was a good one. The recommendation for the nearby Ellen's Stardust Diner was great. It is a retro 50's diner with aspiring actors/actresses who are in 50's costume and have wonderful singing voices. It was a lot of fun. I will be happy too answer any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Please ignore all other reviews! This is everything you need to know!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before my girlfriend and I left for NY we read reviews about the Park Central hotel and weren't sure what to expect. Please don't listen to any reviews writing off this hotel as it was fantastic. There is basically two parts to it. Refurbished and Unrefurbished. It is refurbished from level 7 upwards. We were on level 10 and the rooms were big with a great bathroom and good views. The hotel lobby is beautifully presented and covered in marble. The location added to the satisfaction. Its a 5min walk to time square and only 2 blocks from central park. Almost all reviews on this site are people that stay on level 6 downward. Those floors do look old and in need of attention. Just make sure your above these and I can guarentee you will like it. If you have any questions or want to know more about the hotel, please feel free to contact me at: matt_the_don@hotmail.com I will give you guenuine answers as Im sure you will have the same worries that we had before we left. Don't have.... make sure you stay above level 6 and you won't believe your luck!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Park Central”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. My family and I spent 3 nights here. The location was perfect for going to a Broadway play or going to Carnegie Hall. I agree with past reviews the lobby of the "luxury" hotel is impressive enough but as soon we went up to the room floors you notice that the wallpaper is peeling off, the carpets are shabby, and all the paint work leaves a lot to be desired. The hotel rooms and hallways look nothing like they do on the hotel website. The only thing that looks like it does on the website is the lobby. The Good Points The rooms were a nice size for New York rooms. The beds were comfortable and I really appreciated the bedspreads were white so you would notice dirt right away. The Bad Points The ceiling plaster in the bathroom was molded and the wallpaper was peeling off. The bathroom was tiny. The room were also very stuffy. The hallway needed to be upgraded badly the rugs were extremely old looking and the walls needed a new paint job. The second day we were there we found a huge insect in our room. After killing the bug with a towel we pushed the towel into the hallway and walked down stairs to speak to the Hotel Manager. He apologized for the problem and advised he would send up someone immediately to check out the problem then he offered us a free breakfast. This is where the hotel really starting going down hill, if I found a bug in the room chances are there may be bugs in the kitchen which my cousin pointed out. To bad we had eaten there the night before after the bug problem we were happy to eat somewhere else. Later that day we saw another bug and asked to be moved to a different room. The second room was better but we still had issues with the bathroom, the inside of the shower curtain looked like someone had thrown up on it and the tub looked very outdated with mildew in surrounding spots in the bathroom. Once again management moved us to a third room the last room was fine. Final Points This hotel would be ok to stay at if they worked on painting the hallways, changing the hall rugs and make sure there was no mildew in the bathrooms. The hotel needs a face lift in all the rooms we viewed. On a scale of 1-10 this hotel is a 4. Due to all the problems we had at the hotel I would not recommend it to anyone. Last time I was in New York I stayed at the Hilton Time square and it was a very nice stay I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: baccala
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our room. It was large, clean, quiet, and comfortable. It had a large screen TV. Staff was friendly. Bed was fine. We booked with short notice using [---------]and had a rate of $119 plus tax. So for the price, location, and quality of room we think the hotel was very good.

Reviews.Title: “"Keep Looking"”
Reviews.Author: Cegct
Reviews.Content: Lets just say this hotel needs some work.. FOUR MAIN Problems this hotel had.. Went to stay there in advance of a broadway show with girlfriend.. I am 25 and we have been to NYC before.. The only thing this hotel has going for is its location. 1)Rooms had paint peeling off ceiling 2)IF YOU DON"T LOCK YOUR DOOR HOUSEKEEPING BARGES IN (I had just gotten out of the shower and she was just standing in my doorway.. no knock or attempt to see if anyone was there) THIS HAPPENED TWICE 3) ROOMS WERE OVERLY HOT (We were told rooms have no control over heat/cooling) not a comfy nights sleep 4) Hot water was so so.. don't expect a really hot shower with nice pressure in the morning,, i've had better luck at my kitchen sink Overall not the best stay,, i was REALLY steamed after the second barging in of the housekeeper.. the only thing i can say in a positive not was the General Manager comp'd us a nights stay for our troubles. Like i said.. KEEP LOOKING

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. My boyfriend and I stayed there for New Year this year and were there for 6 nights. The lobby of the "luxury" hotel is impressive enough but as soon we went up to the room floors you notice that the wallpaper is peeling off, the carpets are shabby, and all the paint work leaves a lot to be desired. Things only got worse when we got to our supposed luxury king size room. The room was very small. The ceiling plaster was falling off and the wallpaper was peeling off. The bathroom was tiny. Our room was supposed to have a desk, but the table in the room would barely fit a laptop. The safe in the room did not work and we asked for this to be fixed on several occasions. It never was. The rooms are not well sound-proofed. There was an ice machine directly outside our room and we were woken several times each night by people getting ice. The staff were all unhelpful and unfriendly, right from the check-in staff to the concierge to the guy in the lobby shop. The only good thing about the hotel is it's location as it is very central.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Like so many other reviews before, was a bit apprehensive about staying here following the negative feedback about the condition and comfort of the hotel, but was pleasantly surprised (and relieved !). Our room was very comfortable, clean and quiet ! Nice crisp white linen and clean new towels every day. The only negatives were that the receptionist on arrival had no friendly or welcoming qualities and although having booked last October 05 and requesting a room with a city view, our room was quite dark and looked straight onto a wall of a neighbouring building. Superb location being only a few blocks from Central Park south and Times Square / Broadway. Planning to return again next year and would have no hesitation in booking the Park Central again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Needs A LOT OF HELP”
Reviews.Author: museumlover
Reviews.Content: There is a reason why there is no eye contact when you check-in. They know that there is a 50-50 chance that the elevators will work, or that few of the advertised room ammenities will actually be available. The wallpaper is coming off in sheets. Messages don't get delivered. Washcloths & pillowslips are deemed frivolous.The lighting in the UNHEATED bathroom was low wattage. If there is a multi million dollar renovation going on, there was no evidence of progress.Conversations with other guests confirmed that this place no way lives up to the internet claims of customer service. The amount of broken or unavailable "ammenities" boggles the mind. Everyone we talked to had requested an "upgrade"....but there were none to be had. Isn't it unsafe not to post a notice when an elevator isn't working?

Reviews.Title: “Ok - but no fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Sarah04
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews after I booked the hotel I was concerned but thought I would give the hotel a chance. The lobby is smart and well presented. We found the reception staff very helpful and were able to provide us with all the information we needed. We had a large room on the 8th floor corner overlooking 7th Avenue and found the views very attractive. The windows were quite drafy and the heater not that great but as we were only using the hotel as a base we wern't too bothered. The bathroon however was freezing. There was no heater and with a tiled floor and drafty window it wasn't very warm in the morning. The rooms and corridors are in need of updating as the decor is looking tired and dated. Generally the hotel is adeqaute if you only want to sleep there. Great location for Central Park and all the main attractions. Would I stay here again? Probably not! Tip - the room service charges are expensive. Better to go to one of the local cafes

Reviews.Title: “Okay, not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is not the "luxury" hotel it claims to be, it is decent especially considering the often lower rates than similarly located hotels. Our room was of decent size for New York and had no bedbugs. It was reasonably clean and had a table and newer TV. It did have a great deal of cracking paint/plaster on the ceiling and the shower knob broke during our stay. The shower pressure was little more than a trickle. A friends' room had a non-working telephone. Additionally, the front desk staff was quite rude. If you really want this location, and this hotel is all you can afford, then it is okay. Otherwise, I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “If you come with low expectations, you'll enjoy your stay”
Reviews.Author: titchy1
Reviews.Content: I stayed for five nights from January 10th-15th, and would recommend the hotel for well-prepared budget-conscious travellers. Having read several rants before booking my room, I was fortunate enough to arrive on a late flight from Europe, avoiding the 4 p.m. check-in ordeal (it also helped that the airline lost my luggage, so I came even later than planned). I had earplugs, so managed to slumber through the late-night revelry and cleaning lady cacophony. I requested a quiet room, low down - stairs instead of lift queues. I had a shower in my room instead of a bath: no peering in revulsion at hair clogging the plug. The room was freezing the last day, but I burrowed down beneath my cosy bedding and survived. The few occasions I approached the front desk, the staff were just like any other New Yorkers: friendly and direct. I had breakfast across the road every morning. You save quite a few bucks staying here, and I didn't have any complaints, having come expecting the worst. The localisation is perfect for concerts at Carnagie Hall or the Lincoln Center. If you don't mind walking 10 blocks, then maybe the Hilton at Times Square would be an alternative. Naturally, the YMCA is only 25 dollars a night....

Reviews.Title: “Better than rated”
Reviews.Author: Davidgpf
Reviews.Content: Have real difficulty in understanding the negatives on the Park Central. For the price it is excellent. Rooms are clean, the staff is helpful and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the park central hotel for a five day break at the begining of jan with my mum and sister. after reading all the negative reviews we were very put off to say the least. when ariving at the hotel we got checked in early as our room was ready for us. the room was a great size and had everything we needed, very clean and fresh. we had maid service everyday with no problems with towels or anything else. we waited no longer than about 4mins for the lifts so this was def not a problem for us. the hotel has fantastic location and is just down the road from times square, and on the next road to broadway shops, resturants and bars just on your door step. recomended for breakfast is applejacks diner which is on broadway just down from the hotel, dinner ellens stardust diner is fab. if you like nightlife get a cab to websterhall which is a fantastic nightclub for anyone 19+ which has 7 floors to suit everyones music taste. i would def return to the park central hotel the staff are so helpful and friendly and the location is amazing

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: Sky101
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one night stay at this hotel and there is nothing good to say about it. I am a frequent travelor to N.Y. and this experience was the worst. Check in time is not until 4pm and the line at that time is very long. We were given a non smoking room when we had requested smoking, the telephone (one only) was not working resulting in waiting again, the bathroom was cramped and dark and the bathtub was broken as well. However, it was freezing in the room and they refused to turn on the heat. I was told on two occasions that by New York State Law they could not turn the heat on unless it reached below 48 degrees outside which is not true. They would not provide a heater or even a bathrobe. They finally turned the heat on several hours later when the temperature outside was 54 degrees. I have to wonder if they were lying or breaking the law. The staff was not at all helpful, the room was noisey, the hotel had awful service. Please be careful if you book here, you are not getting anything but a good location to get sick in from lack of heat.

Reviews.Title: “cockroach problem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Even though this hotel is in a convienient location, I would hesitate to stay there again. After entering the room, I went to draw the curtains and immediately saw a roach on the curtain. I called the front desk and they sent someone from security to check it out. As he was looking for it I spotted another one in the middle of the bathroom floor. It gave me quite a fright. I requested another room and they moved me only 5 rooms down on the opposite side of the hallway. I called the hotel manager shortly after because I hadn't received an apology or any kind of compensation for the upset. He reluctantly gave me 2 free breakfast coupons after getting back to me about my request to discount my room rate. I had a bad cold and didn't feel like going to the restaraunt for breakfast and they refused to let me use the coupon for room service. They also promised me a late check-out which ended up being an additional hour (1pm instead of 12pm) Why bother. For a few dollars more there are safer bets in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel but poor management”
Reviews.Author: Prescotttraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Park Central Dec 26-29, 2005. As stated in previous reviews, the hotel had only late check-ins available. Our bags were stored for a fee (we were even charged for our small backpacks). The hotel seemed generally under-staffed. We were promised a room with 2 beds, but were given one with only one bed. We then had to wait 2 hours for a roll-away. Our bathroom was clean but the floor was wet due to a leaky toilet. When I requested another room, none was available.
