At 11:30pm I was still waiting for a plumber to fix the problem. Overall the room was pleasant and the bed was comfortable. The heater did not allow for good climate control and kept the room much too warm. We had to open the window in Dec so we could breathe. Of course, that let in the city noises so sleeping was difficult. The location was convenient, but plan to do your research on sight seeing ahead of time. The bell hops were not able to answer any of my questions. The local people on the street were great with directions when asked.

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever US hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived for the second half of our honeymoon at 4pm on 29th December having travelled from DC on the Amtrak. On arrival we were met by the sight of a queue from the desk to the (distant) front door and a sign saying check-in started at 4. There were 2 (sometimes 3) check-in staff at 6 available terminals and a number of management types standing around or chatting with the check-in staff. One did manage to offer us gingerbread men but we would rather they had instead checked us in. We eventually checked in at 4.45 and took our keys up to the room where we discovered they did not work. I took the keys back down, queued for another 10 mins, was asked a series of questions about which lights flashed on the lock and finally had the keys reprogrammed and handed back to me. One of the first problems we noticed with this hotel was the lifts. You could easily wait 15 minutes for one at peak times (about half the day) and they seemed to have some weird car preference setting which meant that being on the 6th floor you rarely got a look in as the single occupants of the top few floors whizzed past in glorious solitude. In the room we finally worked out how the curtains worked after initially assuming there was no need for curtains as we had no light being at the bottom of the central well with a lovely view of the ventilation system. There were no tea/coffee making facilities, no mini-bar and the bath was dirty with some bedraggled looking hairs stuck to various parts of it. Sitting in the bath was uncomfortable due to the gritty residue of whoever had used the room before us. The next morning we awoke to the sounds of loud bangs as the hotels tarted some work on the xterior and then we were kept awake by the combination of loud radio and loud conversation from the maids who seemed to be holding a meeting outside our door this and every morning of our stay. We did get our room cleaned on all except one day, when they didn't bother, but the bedding had a disturbing tendency to fall off the bed during the night. On New Years Day, rather than brave the queues of New York diners for our brunch we noticed that the hotel restaurant was fairly empty so we decided to eat in there. We waited to be seated whilst the waiter finished his conversation with a couple in the restaurant and then we were shown to a table where we waited patiently for the menus. We waited some more. We read our paper as we waited. A number of waiters wandered in and out of the kitchen looking confused so we waited some more. Finally we stood up and went to the front desk to complain. The lady on the front desk asked me to wait while she got a customer services manager. He came over and took us to see the restaurant director as it was "really his problem to deal with". The restaurant director told us that it was "just one of those days" and he had "spent all morning apologising to people" and offered to reseat us. We decided to risk the queues elsewhere having now worked out why the hotel restaurant was empty today (and for the rest of our stay). As our flight was later on the evening that we checked out, we asked if we could have a later check out. We were told that we could pay $75 for 3 hours extra but that we would only actually get one hour extra as they wanted us out by 1pm. Some people may be tempted by this hotel because of its useful location. Don't be tempted as it is awful. Walk the extra few yards (or even miles) to avoid the Park Central at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Honest Opinion - no bias - list of pros and cons at bottom”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hello reader, to start off quickly, i'll give a quick discription of me because I believe that the evaluatoin of something like this is dependent on the person and their background. I am a frequent traveller, travelling since the age of 5 with my family. I come from a wealthy family and have always stayed at 5 star, all inclusive, or even 6 star hotels in some countries that have them. HOWEVER, when i went to park central with my girlfriend, in all honesty, it was definitely a thumbs up. Of course, it's no trump tower or marriott for that matter, but then again, when comparing the price, thank Goodness for that. The point of New york city is the city - obviously. A tourist will not go there to stay in the hotel. Park central is at an EXCELLENT locatoin, walkable to all the main attractions because it is right downtown. walking distance to - times square, rockefeller center, serendipity III, bloomingdales, etc. a bus or taxi is required to go to ground zero, and financial district further south. Positives ---------- - In terms of the hotel itself, it was very clean - the concierge is very friendly, as well as most of the staff. This is definitely a plus considering the usual rude personalities of most of the locals. - no problems with the phone, t.v., AC/Heater, etc. (everything worked fine) Negatives ---------- - Had to ask for a pull in bed for my sister 3 times until it came (the third time i went to the front desk myself) - Our neighbor ordered room service, put their tray outside their door, and it wasn't picked up for the entire duration of our stay (4 nights) - styaed on a high floor even though i requested a low floor. very bad window view, we faced a wonderful wall and had to crouch down, and look up to see the sky. Honestly, for the price, it doesn't get better. Definitely would go back to the same hotel everytime if looking for a good locatoin and good price. recommending to all friends and relatives.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Brandi715
Reviews.Content: I think the Park Central is an excellent alternative to other pricey Manhattan hotels. I found the hotel to be clean, and the staff was friendly. As for the size of the rooms, I found that for a New York hotel, they had plenty of space. The people who disagree obviously have never been to Europe. It is also conveniently located between Central Park and Times Square. But here are some pitfalls to expect: the check-in time is kind of late, 4 p.m. However, the hotel does have a luggage check that only costs $3 a bag. If you want wireless internet, it will cost $12 per day. The water pressure is very low, so just plan on a little more time in the shower. Other than that, my boyfriend and I were very satisfied with our first stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed at in NYC”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had to extend my visit in New York but the hotel I was staying at was booked solid, so I took the chance and booked here for the remaining two nights. I was advised at the front desk that they do not honor early check-in, so I checked my bags, (for about $10) for the early part of the day until 3pm check-in. When I returned in the afternoon between meetings to check in, the lobby was full of people everywhere, unbelievably busy. It turned out they were having some computer trouble and check-in would be delayed. I waited and was able to check in, finally, around 5pm. The wait for a bellman was estimated at 30-45 minutes, (!!), so I took my bags upstairs after a long wait for an elevator. The room was another story...it was very cold. The rooms are old, out-of-date, and not very clean. The bed linens are worn, furniture shows a lot of wear, and paint peeling on the walls/ceiling. The window was open; I couldn't shut it. I called downstairs and was told maintenance would be right up to help me. In the meantime, I went on the internet (not free, or reliable) and started some work while I waited. Two hours later when no one had come, the room was freezing. I called downstairs again, and was politely told maintenance would be right up. He arrived promptly within 10 minutes, but couldn't shut the window...broken. He told me that he would let the front desk know and that I would be able to switch rooms. I called downstairs, but no one answered, so I gathered my bags and went back downstairs. After a short wait, I talked with the front desk and they apologized, offering me a different room. The new room wasn't much better. Same tired, worn interior, but fairly clean. The internet access didn't work at all in this room, so the front desk offered me a high speed cable connection set, (which also did not work.) The worst thing about this room was that the bathroom windows were IN the shower, with no shades or way of covering them!! The shower wasn't clean, and the heat didn't work so well. The tv also didn't work consistently; some channels would fuzz out after a short period of time. Like other reviews, I also had a problem getting both washcloths and towels. For my second day, I checked out (and wrestled for a refund of my prepaid second night's stay) and went to the Rhiga Royal, only two blocks away. The best thing about this hotel was the front desk people and maintenance, (all very nice people). The worst thing, however, is the property itself, and some of the rest of the staff, (they all but ignore you.) No help getting a taxi outside. Construction was going on in the lobby, so you had to use the front or side entrance, with no indication of which was open when. I had a terrible stay here and would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel over New Years and we had a lovely, renovated room on a higher floor that looked directly down 7th Avenue, where if we would have been in our room, we could have seen the ball drop in Time Square. The staff was very friendly and helpful and when our first room was not suitable, we were relocated with no problem. We definitely would be happy to stay in that room again and in that hotel. The location is very central, very close to Columbus Circle and the Time/Warner Bldg., Central Park, shopping, restaurants, etc. renee, toronto, ontario.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Saintsfan777
Reviews.Content: I don't understand some of the reviews of this hotel. We had an overall wonderful experience. We stayed at the Shoreham hotel New Years Eve and the Park Central the next night. We got a good deal on the Park Central on Priceline only 2 days before we stayed and was worried with some of the reviews that we read. We thought the hotel was beautiful and conveniently located to nearly everything. The room was pretty big and clean and the bed was very comfortable. We liked it even more than the Shoreham and we liked that hotel a lot. The only issue we had was that there were no bath towels in the room when we arrived and we quickly received them when we asked. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and we have stayed in some nice hotels around the world thanks to Priceline.:)

Reviews.Title: “Toilet, ceiling, (all) staffs have problem”
Reviews.Author: Tsubasa
Reviews.Content: CHECKING IN - check in clerk was rude. We kindly requested a non-smoking room with king size bed and she yell out loud "I'm checking, I'm checking" overriding what we're trying to tell her. At the same time, another guest came down to talk to the clerk next to ours. He was extremely angry at the hotel for giving him an unacceptable room following by a room key that doesn't work. He said he had wasted over an hour. FIRST EXPERIENCE - the room was very old on the tenth floor (out of 24, I believe). Our ceiling peeled out and many pieces of them recently fell on the floor. Restroom was extremely small. The Zenith TV in the room was quite small and extremely old - the quality was so poor that we didn't bother watching much. The AC/heater unit was also very old. It had unidentifiable nasty stuff inside and quite loud. The knobs on the unit were all gone, but we could still adjust thing through the little metal toothpick sticking out. SECOND DAY - after one night of staying in this hotel, I started coughing. Not too sure where I got it from, but having that old and nasty ventilation unit in our room surely didn't help. The toilet now started to show up some flushing problem. But still was not clogged. THIRD DAY - more things to complain, but let's concentrate on the most important one. Today our toilet finally gave out and clogged. We called the hotel operater and forced to put on hold for a while. Finally someone picked up the phone. She told us someone will be on his/her way. We believed her and waited, waited and waited until exactly one hour had passed, so we called her again (follow the same process of getting put on hold), then asked the new guy how much longer we have to wait. It seemed like he didn't even know that a service request was made (I had to appologize to my wife for clogging up the toilet 'coz at this point, she had to hold it for a long time). After about 15 minutes, a guy came to our room with a plunger. Instead of plunging the toilet, he stupidly flushed the toilet, causing the nasty stuff to overflow all over our restroom floor. He then left the room and called for a "back up". Before he left thr room he throw all the towels on the floor to clean up (yes the very towels that you and I use after shower). After another 30 minutes, the new guy came in and cleaned up the mess. I requested new full-size towels, the same size as ones that were thrown on the floor by the previous guy. He was quite rude to reject it, so I went outside and asked the housekeeper person. She was equally rude saying that "it's not easy for me" - I was shocked! But at least now she gave me ONE small little towel. I was extremely unhappy, but at least now my wife wouldn't have to hold any longer. CHECKINT OUT - we didn't do the express checkout in hope that we can ask someone to compensate for our discomfort. Sure enough, we were rudely rejected again. She said that since we prepaid for the hotel (through online booking), the hotel can't do anything. I was like are you joking me? So despite all these, if you'd like to stay in this hotel - DO NOT PREPAY for it. I didn't ask to speak with the manager because I was too sick to fight over it (I officially had a cold, making my NY trip the most horrible vacation trip in my life). So I asked the checkout lady for something as little as a free bag check (cost $3), she said no but dismissed us like we were flies (yes she did the hand thing like we were kids). So we went to the bell desk, and the guy tops the chart in the rude-meter. My wife asked that we went to check in our luggage, he repeated with the rudest tone: YOU-WANT-TO-CHECK-IN-OR-OUT? We puzzled because we had already repeated twice. He asked again IN-OR-OUT (now very very loud), so I said IN. Then he pointed to the luggage check in/out area (the same area for both checking in and out)! It's sad to say that the most pleasant experience about this hotel was when we no longer had to deal with them.

Reviews.Title: “Read This..Stay Somewhere Else!”
Reviews.Author: herren29
Reviews.Content: We just spent our Christmas Holidays in NYC. The city was incredible, and thank goodness, because it took our mind off of our terrible living conditions. All of my fears came true after getting this room through Priceline, then reading all of the reviews. I suppose if you are lucky enough to get a renovated room, it would be OK because the location is superb. But DON'T be willing to take the chance. If you get the room like we got, you will be VERY disappointed. There is NO WAY that this is a 3-star hotel. The room was tiny, with no decor what-so-ever. There were no bedskirts on the beds...you could see the stained box springs even when the bed was made. The ceiling was completely falling down in our room. I had a huge chunk of the ceiling in my suitcase one morning when I woke up. The bathroom was maybe 4ft by 4ft. There was no vanity other than the bathroom sink, and imagine that with 3 girls! That was also the ONLY mirror in the room. The TV was maybe a 15", and didn't work part of the time. There was only one chair to sit on with a very tiny round table. Also, no coffee pot in the room...don't know about anywhere else in the country, but in Texas, coffee pots come in even the cheapest of hotels! The linen service was very poor...only towels or washcloths, but not both! Elevators were a nightmare!!!! Too slow, and not enough of them. Also, below our window every night around 12:30, there was a garbage truck that parked and made an enourmous amount of noise for 45 minutes to an hour. Honestly, I cried when we got there Christmas Eve night. I felt bad for my kids having to wake up Christmas morning in that room. We called to change rooms, but the front desk said that all of the rooms were the exact same, and they had all been renovated already! (not a chance!) It was 6 miserable nights! It was a dump, and I want my money back. A Motel 6 would have been a better choice!

Reviews.Title: “Was very relieved with our experience”
Reviews.Author: myohmy
Reviews.Content: I feel that I have to stick up for this hotel since our experience was better than expected. I got this hotel through a bid on Priceline before I read the reviews here and I was very nervous about it as a result. I believe what others wrote but I think that the hotel's worst crime is to be inconsistent. My experience was good because I was given a large corner room on a high floor whereas other were given smaller rooms that have still to be renovated (someone has to stay in those rooms if the hotel is full, I suppose). I had very little trouble with the linen service. We had sufficient towels, although washcloths seemed to be in short supply since ours were sometimes taken away without being replaced. We found an offensive looking stain on the down comforter that was between the topsheet and the coverlet. We left a note with the housekeeping about it and it was removed but not replaced by a clean one. That was alright, because we were glad to be rid of it and we just cranked up the heat. We didn't use any of the services mainly because we didn't require it and also to avoid ruining our experience if anything were to go wrong. We did pay $9 to store 3 bags, but that was after a cost/benefit analysis that found it worthwhile for us to pay to store them rather than lugging them around with us on our last afternoon in NYC. Lord knows $9 was nothing after all the expenses we racked up that week. All in all, it was a decent experience. I probably won't stay there again only because I would want to try a different hotel. For those of you who are thinking of booking here, you might want to assess whether the price you are paying is worth the risk of getting a bad room. I'd say that anything less than $175 is a fair value. For those that have already booked and are now spooked about staying here, I say that you should prepare to be disappointed but you may be pleasantly surprised. Also, it helps to be polite and friendly to the check-in clerk, they're the ones that assign the room. :) I made sure to take pictures of the entire room. I found none of the things in my room that people have complained about, although I may have just lucked out.

Reviews.Title: “no complaints”
Reviews.Author: seanachie
Reviews.Content: I just stayed for two great days at the Park Central Hotel. From reading the forum, I feel there must be two Park Central Hotels, the good one and the bad one. I am lucky to have stayed in the good one. In fact, the very good one. There was a large crowd in the lobby at the 4 pm checkin time, but the line moved quickly and we were upgraded to a concierge room even though we booked at a great price on an on line service. The room was large, very large for NYC and the paint, wallpaper etc. were fresh and the room was meticulously clean. Every one of the hotel staff we had any contact with was professional and courteous. I did not use the lobby bar or the restaurant, but they looked nice. The elevators were no problem, the soda machines worked, the carpets were clean in the brightly lit hallways. In fact, there was only one small complaint and that was that the cable TV was out for the better part of a day, but, since it was out in the entire hotel, I really couldn't complain. Needless to say the location is wonderful. Blocks to several museums including MOMA, Central Park, a few more blocks to the theater district and Times Square, steps to Carnegie Hall, the area is loaded with great restaurants within walking distance. Just an overall great experience that I shall repeat on my next trip into the City.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: kenbo20
Reviews.Content: A group of us (4 girls) have just returned from NY having stayed at the Park Central. We shared a room having read the comments about the bigger rooms than normal for New York on Park Central Website. The rooms were one of the smallest we have stayed in in NY having been quite a number of times. The beds were also very small for two people. Wardrobe space was approx 2ft x 3ft which meant we were falling over each others bags and clothes. We were on the 25th floor and woken every morning at around 7am with workmen installing new windows on our floor. I could go on and on but I would definitely not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Staying”
Reviews.Author: KKCanada1
Reviews.Content: My husband & I had an excellent experience. We booked the hotel without knowing much about it. It definitely exceeded our expectations. The room was very clean as was the lobby. The hotel was undergoing some renos but that wasn't an inconvenience to us. One day we came back to the room to find there was a leak in the bathroom - we were immediately moved to another room w/o any hassles or delays considering the hotel was busy checking in guests. The location of the hotel is fantastic - right on a subway line.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I stayed at in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Rc2008Canada
Reviews.Content: The first room had a broken toilet and 2 doubles instead of a king size which I reserved, and phoned-in a few days before arrival to confirm. Also, demolition in a building across made it impossible to sleep after 6:20am. The second room was better and it had a king size bed. However, the overall hotel experience was very bad. First, they have construction going at the front entrance, which is fine. What is not fine though is the fact that they keep switching randomly which entrance (front or side) is open for no good reason. So, at any point in time you'd come to an entrance and discover that it was closed in favor of the other. Second, the internet did not work right - wasted $24 discovering that fact. And third, my personal favorite - this hotel will charge you $3 PER BAG to store your luggage for a few hours after checkout time. I have stayed in at least 10 different hotels in NYC, and many in other places and I have never seen a ridiculous service like this. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Park Central Hotel. Great location, very accessible to the subway; also within walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Central Park. Starbucks was located in the building but you had to access from outside the hotel. The Carnegie Deli was right accross the street. The room size was adequate, as was the bathroom and closet. Our room was clean. Decent linens and pillows, but towels could be replaced by newer ones. The elevators worked fine. We did not have to wait too long considering the 25 floors the hotel has. I don't think many guest realize there was a separate bank of elevators for floors 3 thru 11. The hotel staff was friendly to us. I would stay here again. Greg & Jacqui Needham, MA

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as reviews say”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very concerned about staying at this hotel after I read the reviews. Upon arriving I was pleasantly surprised. Our room was clean and updated and a nice size. The elevators never took a long time except on check in when everyone else was trying to use them to check in. Our soda machine didn't work on our floor so I went up a floor no big deal. When reading other reviews if the worst thing on your trip is the soda machine on your floor didn't work, you have serious issues. The staff was very friendly and curtious. As far as the $3 per bag charge, it was worth $9.00 to not have to drag my luggage around town and worth it that it was safe & secure. I just don't get the negative reviews. My son was also hospitalized during the stay so I didn't stay at the hotel but 2 nights out of 6 but I did go there each day to shower. The hotel was under construction but only a mild inconvenience - the location is GREAT and I think if you are a normal person you will think it is a good deal for a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer beware- Websites can be deceiving!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I took his mom & 14 yr. old niece to NYC to see the Christmas lights, experience The Rockettes & see the city in all it's holiday finery. We stayed at The Park Central Hotel for 2 nights, 12/2 & 12/3. Their website states they've spent $65 million in renovations to the property so we thought this would be ideal- a great location & a spruced-up hotel. Someone needs to call for an audit, because none of the renovations were apparent. The carpet in the halls & in our room was old, stained & was coming up in the corners. Our room smelled of urine & we had to ask Housekeeping to clean it again once we'd finally checked in. The entire front of the hotel was under scaffolding with workers clamoring over you every hour as you ran the gauntlet to reach the 12 inches of sidewalk you could use. The lobby was draped in plastic & blue tape, with 2 of the 4 entrances closed, forcing all guests to come & go through one revolving door while staff shuffled bags through the one door that opened. The frontdesk staff was surly & abrupt. The 4pm check-in was later than any hotel I've stayed in. The $3/ bag charge to store bags until you can get into your room was ridiculous. No other hotel I've ever stayed in, in NYC or elsewhere in the world, has ever charged guests to store bags. The elevators were exceptionally slow. Thankfully, we were on the 3rd floor so we took the stairs twice- not a side of the hotel we were meant to see! The kicker was the big soft drink vending machine that was unplugged & left sitting in the hall right outside our door. We called & asked to have it removed when we arrived, but alas, it outlasted us & was still there when we checked out. The manager on duty wouldn't discount the rate but did tell us he'd knock off a little on our next stay with them. RIGHT!!! Granted, it was Christmas & everyone was hustling about, but I was very disappointed in this hotel. Great location- very poor delivery. Don't be fooled by the website.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a young couple!”
Reviews.Author: AshH1986
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visted New York last January for my birthday and we found the Park Central Hotel from Expedia. The price was right for everything the hotel web site said that it had. The hotle itself is very nice and very clean. We had fresh towels every morning and our room was cleaned daily. My only complaints are 1. The rooms do not have individual thermostats and the room we stayed in got warm, so we had to force the window up as much as we could. 2. The hotel staff was not very friendly, however our doorman was excelllent. 3. The room service and hotel restaurant were a little pricy. We were so close to everything it is a prime location. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to save money but still stay 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read the mixed reviews about this hotel, we were a little apprehensive. However on arrival we received a very friendly welcome and throughout our stay this level was maintained. The hotel itself is idealy situated, from our window we could see Central Park and from the front entrance the bright lights of Times Square greeted us. Our room was spacious and clean, ok it was not up to 5* standard, but we were very pleased, especially considering we were four females sharing the one room (and bathroom!)definately good value for money. Starbucks is next door, ideal for early morning coffees (we sent the smoker out for ours)and just round the corner in the direction of Central Park is the Brooklyn Diner, ideal for a traditional American breakfast. We shall definately return to this hotel, by which time the refurbishment will be complete, and I have no hesitation in recommending it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central Hotel - Definately would return”
Reviews.Author: JuMSw30
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews of this hotel prior to my visit I was slightly apprehensive but I cannot complain about the hotel in any way. I stayed at the hotel for 5 nights and the room was large and clean and sheets/bath towels were changed everyday if required. There was no problem with the lifts and the staff were helpful and polite. The only drawback would be the charge for storing baggage prior to checking in and after checking out. I would recommend this hotel to other people and I would stay there again. The hotel was an ideal central base for any visitor to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Loathed Park Central”
Reviews.Author: Clarendon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 nights from the 10th November, 2005, in a room that was a dark as a tomb day and night. That we could cope with, but the toilet that wouldn't flush properly, and flooded the bathroom was a nightmare. It happened on our first night, and we told we were in a "low pressure" room. The sink would not empty either. It happened again on our final night - it took housekeeping till 4 am to clean the bathroom, and we had to fly to Vienna the next day! No sleep was possible, and the staff would not even consider a discount on our last night's stay. The housekeeping staff never could count the towels, and routinely forgot that every bathroom needs a bathmat. Calls made using a phone card with 1800 numbers were charged at outrageous rates, despite the fact that the public phones in the lobby did not work. The lifts were also a problem - 10 minute waits for a lift down from the 14th floor were routine. We were told by a staff member that the hotel was being run by a group who really didn't care to spend any money on the hotel, and did not give a damn about the guests. We can well believe it, and would not stay there again if they paid us!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would give the park central 4 points, because its a great deal, prise value wise. We stayed there for 4 nights and had the best time. No elevator or staff problem. Just a nice place to stay. It`s close by everything you as a tourist would want to see and the walk down to Times square is one you wont forget. No extra luxury or allure in this hotel but just a perfect place to stay. Perfect? well as a tourist walking the streets 16 hours a day the only thing that matters is a warm and good bed. And that people has to be said the beds are what makes staying here a delight. Where can I buy one?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandrinekent
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 1 week and really enjoyed it. I was scared when I read the feedbacks from people and was really surprised by the hotel. It's a great location, you are in the centre of everything. I used the gym everyday and it was fine. Service was excellent. I am very fusy about where I stay but my room was big and confortable. I will go back with no worries.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central...never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel to NY approximately 4 times a year and I have never stayed in a hotel that charged me to store my bags ($3 per bag, large or small). The manager tried to tell me this was normal in NY! They also charged me $4 to pick up a package I had had sent to the hotel. The front desk staff didn't smile or seem welcoming, they were actually surly. My room smelt musty & moldy and the A/C didn't work even though the outside tempreature was in the 70's. The mold source was crawling down the wall in the bathroom. Towel service selection was varied, Day 1: 2 large towels, 2 small. Day 2: 3 large towels, 2 washcloths, 1 bathmat, Day 3: 2 large towels.The duvet must have been stuffed with 1/2 a duck, thank goodness it wasn't cold. One morning I waited 16 mins for the elevator and eventually took the stairs. I finally figured the elevators out - press the up call button, the elevator will arrive fairly quickly, get on and press the lobby button, low and behold the elevator would go down! Never press the down call button for the elevator. I asked for late checkout and was told that the charge would be $75 until 12:30...regular checkout was at 12:00!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was there for the Marathon weekend - the front desk staff was rude - I could not check in until 4 pm - and they neglected to tell me that there would be a $3 charge per bag for them to store my luggage until then. Despite leaving my room before 9 am and placing the "please clean my room" sign on the door - when I returned at 7 pm the room was not cleaned and when I called for towels - after waiting 1/2 hour - no towels - I finally received towels after returning from dinner and calling twice again (apparently the manager was stuck in the elevator!!! the wait for the elevators was on average 10 mins - it was easier to go up and then go down - the bathroom was moldy and the airconditioners did not work - they switch off the a/c in November - but it was 70 degrees in NYC !! I travel to NYC quite a lot and I would never recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: SXM03
Reviews.Content: Looked nice, but wouldn't even hold our luggage for 2 hours while we walked around the city since we had to check out by noon and didn't fly home until later. They have limited space and made many guests angry. Other than that it was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms, rude staff, frivolous charges.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through their own website, which states free high-speed internet is included. I was then billed $15 at checkout for using this service. Additionally, I found the staff at the front desk to be quite rude (some people may say that's part of the New York experience). The rooms at the Park Central are a good size for NY and the location of the hotel is decent, but the advantages stop there.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A rip-off. I checked-in at 235PM (repeatPM)and was charged $75.00 for an "early" arrival, although the room was ready. You can wait until later however, as the hotel will be only too happy to check your bags for a fee of $3.00 each(Also chargeable when you leave). As this is a pre-war hotel(certainly the 2nd, but perhaps the 1st), there are many interior rooms where cellphone reception is impossible. You can try phoning from the lobby, but the 24 hour MTV noise(which the front desk can't control)is so loud, you're better off going out to the street. The PC's in the Business Center accept dollar bills, but none of the one's I tried worked. Front Desk staff belong in the hostility, rather than the hospitality industry. The hotel is shown as a "Worldhotels" member in the 2005 guide, but "Worldhotels" says there are no longer a member. If you want a pleasant stay in New York, don't book at the Park Central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff at the Park Central could care less - They just want your Bucks”
Reviews.Author: Odin_the_Rooster
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at the Park Central at about 3PM on a Sunday afternoon in late October 2005 for a 3 day stay. I went inside to the front desk to find out about having our car parked after we removed our bags and we were told to talk to the doorman. I went back to the car, and I guess I was expecting too much, because the only person we saw in front was a scruffy looking guy without a hat or name tag in an unpressed black coat with the collar turned up that looked like an old US Navy peacoat. When he approached, he said that he would take care of my car or I could park it myself, at which point my wife and I looked at each other, wondering if this guy was even legit. We honestly thought that maybe the car would wind up in a chop shop if we left it with him. Another trip to the hotel bellman inside, and he confirmed that this guy was really the doorman. We removed our bags and did receive a check ticket for the car, and that part of the check in went according to plan. The front desk then informed us that check in time was 4 PM, and that we could leave our bags in the check room until that time (for a fee, of course). We elected to carry our bags into the lobby restaurant and have a light lunch, as a few other couples who could not check into the hotel had also done. We received our first room key, and my wife and I proceeded to the room. The room was about 80 degrees, reeked of stale cigar smoke, and the air conditioner did not work. (We had specified a non-smoking room). I left my wife there with all our bags while I went back to the front desk to request a different room, and then went up to check it out. The air conditioner in room #2 did not work either, and the heat/cool thermostat contacts were locked on in heat mode, so basically heating would have been on/off with no temperature regulation. Again I went to the front desk, now got a key for room #3, and stopped in room #1 to tell my wife what was happening. She had attempted to watch room #1's TV while I was changing rooms and had found out that she couldn't even change channels with the remote - she showed me that the photo diode on the front of the remote had been removed. Room #3's air conditioner also did not work, but at least the thermostat for heating appeared to click on and off, so the temperature could be regulated. We decided that since this was our third room, we would attempt to make the best out of the situation because in all probability, we wouldn't require the A/C in October anyway. Going into the bathroom and turning on the lights, we found the shower light bezel hanging down and the other light over the sink had one of the flourescent tubes burned out with the other bulb being close to end-of-life with blackened ends - really dim. I fixed the shower light bezel myself with my "30 years of road warrior experience hotel engineering kit" - (Don't leave home without it). We then attempted to put my wife's jewelry into the in-room safe. Following the instructions repeatedly gave "error" in the display. I contacted security, and they said they would send someone right up. 40 minutes later, no one had showed, and my wife and I went out for dinner that night. The following morning, I went to the front desk and again requested that someone from security come up to check out the safe problem. This time, a security person did show up, and after checking out the safe himeself, he verified that it was in fact defective, and that they would have to contact the safe company. I was to tell the front desk and they would let us use a safe deposit box in their office at N/C, which they did. While the security man was there, I asked him why I got both a green AND a red light when I used my room key card. He said not to worry about it, that the lock had to be "upgraded". I thought - OK, and so. . . After a day in the city and an early dinner, we decided to go back to the hotel and watch TV, since the NY weather had turned nasty. The TV was an absolute disaster. Even though the on-screen text showed many different channel names, many of the same channels were duplicated 2 to 5 times as one surfed up or down (different in either direction), and many channels were missing as a result. If I attempted to access the hotel TV's "menu" (movies, guest billing, etc.), it locked up and had to be powered off to be able to do anything. These problems were present when using either the remote or the TV's front panel pushbuttons. Yet another trip to the front desk, and they said they would send up an "engineer" to look into it. I went back to the room before he arrived and removed the defective flourescent tube in the bathroom sink light so I could request a replacement when he arrived and get that problem resolved. After spending about 10 minutes checking out the tv and changing the batteries in the remote (obviously not the problem), the "engineer" stated that the problem was probably caused by the bad weather outside. He had no explanation for the lockup problem, however. Seeing the futility in getting the TV fixed by him, I gave him the defective bulb, told him the other bulb should probably be changed also, and he left to fetch two bulbs, which he replaced. Ahhh! Decent light in the bathroom at last! The next morning, on our way out, I went to the customer relations desk in the lobby, told of the problem with our TV, and was told "yes, I seem to remember there being problems with the TV in that room in the past". He made some notes on a pad, and assured me that it would be looked into and a voice mail message would be left for me on our return that evening. That evening - no voice mail message had been left, another trip to the customer relations desk, another "engineer" sent to our room, and this one at least acknowledged that the problem could be in the hotel's central TV system, possibly a bad addressing PC card, or the TV itself. No resolution was suggested by him, that was "how it is". My 30 years of troubleshooting experience as an engineer would have been to swap out the lousy TV with a known good one and at least rule out the TV as a potential problem even if I didn't have sufficient experience with the central TV system somewhere in the bowels of the hotel. I casually asked another guest on our floor if his TV was functional, and he said he also couldn't get many channels. When an engineer sees this many problems with completely disassociated systems such as air conditioning units, lights, safes, door locks, TV's, etc., it points to only one thing - poor maintenance practices, both preventative and corrective. My impression is that the hotel management thinks that most people are just going to be in and out for a brief conference or stay, and they can let all these problems "slide". I'm sure that the management would shake in their boots if they knew that an engineer was checking into their hotel, because an engineer tends to see many things that a less technically oriented person wouldn't even pick up on. Due to the fact that there is such a high guest turnover rate at this hotel, it may take quite a while before the lackadaisical attitude of the hotel management towards resolving internal problems catches up to them, but sooner or later, it is going to show up in their P & L statement. While we were staying there, the Park Central was undergoing a massive facelift in the front entrance and the signs were touting their "new look". Very frankly, it will take more than a new look for my wife and I to ever consider ever setting foot through their doors again. When one spends an average of over $300 a night for a hotel room, the least that one expects is for everything to be functional or an honest effort made by hotel staff to make it so. What this hotel needs is a strong manager to go in and "kick --- and take names" to clean up this hotel's image.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: bcfcfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights (22nd Oct - 26th Oct) and found the hotel to be excellent and in a wonderful location close to Central Park and Times Square. Having read the terrible reviews we were very concerned as to what we were about to encounter - we needn't have been. The hotel lobby is spacious and welcoming. Our triple room on 14th floor was of a good size, nicely decorated, very clean with two comfortable double beds. There were plenty of fresh towels in the good size bathroom and these along with the bedding were changed daily. Didn't have a view to speak of but that didn't matter. We did request by email beforehand if we could have refurbished rooms - didn't get a reply as such but this may have been considered. Corridors outside were clean and fresh also we never had to wait more than a few minutes for the lifts. Staff we encountered were all very friendly. Didn't try out the restaurant - seemed a bit pricey. For breakfast, the Park Cafe opposite is very good value. From our experience - Don't be put off by the negative comments it is unnecessary worry. The Ritz it is not, but a good clean hotel with friendly staff in a great position it certainly is.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! (and very relieved!)-Stayed 10/22-10/24”
Reviews.Author: Dakota1
Reviews.Content: After reading all terrible reviews, I was really afraid to stay here. I thought it was going to turn out to be a disaster. It couldn't have been further from the truth! We arrived on Saturday around 1:30 p.m.. As we pulled up, I was already impressed with the location, which is great. There was no line for check-in. The woman at the table was very nice and polite...she did inform us that there weren't any rooms ready, but that wasn't a problem for us. If they allowed everyone to check in that early, check-out would have to be at 9:00 a.m.!! We put our 2 bags in the bag-check (which did cost $3.00 a bag...but having to pay $6.00 was not going to ruin our time!). We stopped at the Concierge Desk and got tickets to the Sunday night show of Chicago. The Concierge could not have been nicer or more helpful (and we ended up getting FANTASTIC seats). We walked around Times Square for a while and had lunch, and then came back around 5:00 p.m. to check-in. Again, no line at all. We were checked in without incident and then went to the elevators. I was prepared for a long wait, with what I've read here, but I can honestly say...during our ENTIRE stay and many elevator rides, we never waited more than 40 seconds!! We entered the room and I can't tell you what a relief it was....it was very clean, with what looked like a new carpet, very clean bedspread and sheets and a VERY comfortable bed. The room was more than big enough for the two of us, and had a city view with two windows that opened all the way for fresh air. I entered the bathroom tentatively, afraid I would find no towels and who knows what else! The bathroom was very clean, and we had a 2 person supply of fresh, clean towels. (I will say that I did request a "renovated room", which meant that the carpet/mattress and linens had been replaced)..at some point they will get to all rooms, but until then, maybe anyone who is booking here should request the same). The only complaint at all was that the bathtub drained very slowly...BUT...we never called maintenence, because it wasn't too bad, and we were only there for 2 days. On our second day, housekeeping came and cleaned the room and left us even more clean towels! We proceeded to have a fantastic 2 days in NYC...They allowed us a late check-out at 12:30 and checking out was very simple, we just did it electronically in the room. If you want a receipt, however, you do have to go to the front desk. There were a few people ahead of me in line, and it moved VERY quickly. The man checking us out was very nice, and he asked me if I would fill out a survey, which shows that they are working on customer reviews. We never ate in the hotel, because there is way too much in the city to do...but everything else was just great. This hotel is such a great value with it's incredible location..it's in walking distance of everything you'd want to do....but just outside of the action enough that you don't feel the craziness of it all in Times Square! My best guess is that all of the problems written about on here were either a case of when the management changed last year, there was a period of confusion when all the "kinks" weren't worked out, so that is unfortunate for those people who stayed there during that time and were dissapointed. OR, people are looking for a 5 star hotel, which this is not...but you also can't get a 5 star hotel for what you pay for the Park Central.... BUT, if you want a good, nicely sized, clean room with a location that can't be beat and a helpful staff for a reasonable price, this is the hotel for you. I would without a doubt stay here again. So if you've already booked or are going to book this hotel...please don't be discouraged by all the bad reviews and have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had two rooms at the Park CentralThree nights. The rooms were of good size by NY standards and very clean. Kurt at the front desk was most helpful and the entire staff did a great job in taking care of all our needs. They also had a very good room rate. The hotel is well located to see NY.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small, outdated, and bathrooms were dirty. Sheets were terrible, felt and sounded like we were sleeping on paper towels. Staff was okay, not overly accessible, did what they were suppose to do however never went the extra mile. One good thing . . . GREAT location for a reasonable price. Wouldn't stay there again, but would stay in the same area of town.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for New York Standards”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights over a weekend. The lobby was nice and the front desk person was pleasant. We initially reserved a standard room with a king size bed. When we requested a city view, he advised that a standard room with 2 double beds with a city view is available. We were very happy with that because we would each have our own bed. Our room was a nice size. It looked cleaned. The bathroom was not too small and it was clean. However, we noticed that the drain plug for the bathtub was yanked out and left lying in the tub. We were hoping that housekeeping would notice it and do something about it. Nothing was done to it for our whole stay. It wasn't a big deal because the water drained just fine. When I had to call a friend who was staying in another hotel in New York, there was no phone book in the room and had to call front desk for the number. They said they did not have the number and would send a phone book up to us. The phonebook never arrived. As we prepared to go out that evening, we went to the front desk and there was a phone book right in front of them. I guess they were either too busy or lazy to look it up for me. Elevators are slow but we did not have to wait for an exhorbitant amount of time. We paid approx $300 per night (taxes included). I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “It's about location”
Reviews.Author: helios1
Reviews.Content: On a positive note, the room was clean and actually a decent size for two people, the staff was pleasant, and the location was excellent with an easy walk to Times Square, Central Park, 5th Avenue. On the downside the air conditioner didn't work, the bathroom had no ventilation, there was no bathtub, the view was of a giant brick wall, there was minimal decor, and the hallway smelled rancid (20th floor). Photos on hotel website have NOTHING in common with the room we rented - perhaps they are pictures of the concierge level rooms? If so, those might be better choices. All in all it was not a "terrible" experience, but I'd definitely try one of the many other hotels in the same area before I'd return to this one. Also I'd recommend you skip the hotel restaurant and go two blocks north to the Brooklyn Diner - that was great!

Reviews.Title: “Not good!”
Reviews.Author: wearymom3
Reviews.Content: While a beautiful hotel located in Manhattan, please do not let anyone know you have received a "bargain" rate! Unfortunately the hotel DOES know, and you are greeted with a less than hospitable attitude. The hotel staff visibly snubbed our repeated requests for assistance - ie. extra towels and pillows for example. It took up to 3 requests to get any help or answers. I guess I figured "all were created equal" - not so in this case. I would heartily recommend you finding another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't deserve the bad press”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in this hotel, and feel that the bad reviews are unwarranted. True, the room was a bit shabby, but it was spotless as were the sheets and towels. The staff were very helpfull and friendly, and the location was great. My only complaint was the 4 0'clock check-in and charging $3 per item to leave luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a confirmed reservation for 2 single rooms with king size bed and not next to the elevator. What I got : 1 single with 2 small beds and 1 king-size all just in front of elevator. Reception staff is very rude. TV in my room was damaged. First night I got a cold because I slept with full aircond - there was no way to turn off this maschine. Front panel from the aircond. stand next to the unid . Nobody had the idea to fix it. Rooms are clean but without style. Wirings around lamps and under table .Water pressure in the shower very poor. After check out the bellboy was trying to sell mi a limo transfer to the airport .He told mi that the yellow caps are more expensive then a limo. There is no flat rate of 45 US$ to the airport JFK he told mi. All wrong . I took a yellow cap for 45 US flat rate+ tip .Good that the bellboys not having guns, he was so angry. I was afraid he want to kill mi. Then he told the taxi driver to put the meter on. The driver was very cool and no was listen to him.

Reviews.Title: “$375 a night?- maybe not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel on September 05. The stuff at front desk was nice but there is no one to help us carry our bags. The room is in good size and the bath room is small but clean. We then found the towels had brown stains and holes on them!!! I think we deserved some white tower since we paid $375 a night- and it is a “4 stars” hotel. I called the guess service and they sent new towers to our room within 10 minutes. The day we check-out, we asked if we can leave our bags in their storage room and pick them up later, they wanted to charge me $3.00/ per bag. It really ----- me off- overall, it’s a good hotel- but for that price, I do expect more from them.

Reviews.Title: “Room very clean, but basic”
Reviews.Author: l1zz1e
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews here it was with trepidation that we stayed here at all. I spoke directly to the Manager a couple of months before our arrival, and then the day before and then to Reservations, explaining my dilema and was assured that we would get a 'quality' room. However, though my requests had been noted, we were told that we could change the room the following day (this did not happen!!). The room was spotlessly clean however, though basic. The corridors and general maintenence of the Hotel were dreadful, very scruffy. The Reception staff, apart from Alfredo, were miserable and uninterested. The Consierge staffs were BRILLIANT. They couldn't have put themselves out more and were so kind and helpful. The location was fantastic. Don't eat here, go to the Diner the concierge recommends just around the corner - fantastic. The Management is doing the place up, but make sure you insist on a renovated bedroom. Enjoy yourselves - we did.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Weezie_woo
Reviews.Content: On a weekend getaway to New York City the last thing you want to do is spend your time travelling for ages to get to the action. My friends and I went for a weekend in May 2005 to NYC and stayed at the Park Central Hotel. It is opposite Carnegie Hall and surrounded by wonderful delis, with 2 blocks' walk to Central Park. A wonderful spot to stay. The actual hotel was average. The foyer and bar area is stunning - very art deco and swish. The corridoors on the other hand are dowdy and carpets a bit threadbare. Our room was fine although smaller than anticipated from the hotel's website descriptions and the bathroom was lovely. In all our stay there was fine but housekeeping were very under par. I would have to say though, that for the cost, we were more than happy. We really were right in the middle of the city with a few blocks' walk to most of the attractions we had come to see. We did get a subway pass though to see the other bits like the Natural History Museum and the village. All in all a good option for a cheap short break.

Reviews.Title: “Most Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: cdeaven
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Friday afternoon, September 23rd, and although we initially stored our luggage, when we came back at 2pm, Kevin greeted us in such a pleasant manner and told us we had a nice corner room, and it was. On the corner gave us several windows which was great. Staff was extremely courteous and upon going to the room, I did my normal room inspection (having had 15 years in the business) and would have to say that the room was very clean. I especially liked the bedding and the absence of a bed spread which to me is just meant to be thrown on the floor anyway. The elevators were fine, never had to wait - so I was very pleased that the negative reviews I had read proved faultless. The location is great, I would definately stay here again. Of course the rooms are not huge, you are not in Mexico you are in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back...probably.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Sept. 8th, We just arrived from NYC. I wont say that it is a luxurious hotel. But for the price 139 ave./night it is amazing. 2 block from central park less than 10 from Times Square. The staff was pleasant and helpfull. The room surface was in the average of NYC: small! The furniture looks new but the wall are overdue to be "repaint". And to be honest who care! We were there only for sleeping. Did not try the lounge or the restaurant. It wasn't my 1st time in NYC and surly not the last. We may go back to the same hotel. And I know what i am talking about i am a travel agent and i saw much worst.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location; horrible staff; tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Park Central was a poor experience. We showed up at 9 AM to check a bag and head to the U.S. Open, stopping off at the front desk to confirm our reservation. The employee told us that they had us in a king room and that arriving after midnight would pose no problem. After arriving at the hotel at 2 AM, they were overbooked. Obviously, we were upset, but it is what happened afterwards that bothered me most. After waiting in the lobby for 30-45 minutes, the manager came out and told us they had found another hotel and wanted us to sleep there for the night, pack up the next day and come all the way back. We informed him that due to our schedule, that was impossible. He said the problem was we didn't hold the reservation (see above). When I started to explain our earlier conversation with the front desk employee, the manager interupted me and began interrogating me as if he did not believe what I was saying. Unbelievable. After I asked him to keep his mouth shut long enough for me to finish the recount of the morning's conversation before insulting my integrity, he listened and then walked away. Upon return, he handed us a room ke and very loudly - there were other people in the lobby in our situation - stated that another customer had agreed to give up their room. This guy should have just paid the two nights at the other hotel and things would have been fine. Instead, he insulted us and impositioned another customer. Ridiculous. Of note - all of my other expereinces (20 or so) at priceline hotels has been wonderful. I give priceline a 10 and Park Central a -1.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Without doubt the worst hotel I have ever had the misfortune of staying in. The whole hotel is in dire need of refurbishment. The corridors are scruffy and worn. The rooms are filthy and badly furnished. My sink had a huge crack in it which meant it could not be filled. There was dirt in every corner of the room that looked like it hadn't been cleaned for months. The television only worked half of the time. There are only four lifts serving all floors, which can mean waits of up to 10 minutes. The whole hotel seemed under staffed and all of the employees were far from friendly. One morning our floor was woken by the fire alarm. After rushing down 12 flights of stairs, we asked reception what the situation was and their reply was that they didn't know and that we should go back to our rooms. All in all, a thoroughly unimpressive hotel. Even if there was no where else to stay in New York, I would never stay at the Park Central again.

Reviews.Title: “Staffed by graduates of the KGB charm school”
Reviews.Author: sallychurchill
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this good-value, well-located hotel late last year and were very pleased with it all round. Unfortunately, there has been a change of ownership, last Christmas, and the result is that morale has plummeted and most staff are now quite heroically, spectacularly rude. Of myriad examples, one that especially springs to mind was the deputy manager, who harangued me mercilessly and hysterically on the phone, because he wanted us to change rooms mid-stay, so that our room could be re-carpeted. When I replied that we would expect some compensation for the major inconvenience of packing and unpacking for our family of four in the middle of our holiday, he threw a tantrum worthy of a two-year old. When we initially checked into the hotel, the desk clerk disappeared for 15 minutes in the middle of checking us in. Desperate and jet-lagged after our flight from London, I asked one of her colleagues when she might be back, so she scuttled back out, explaining that she had been hungry and just gone on a little snack break. Am I the only one who thinks that this is quite bizarre behaviour? The staff here are so rude, I kept expecting to see a camera man pop out from behind a wall, crying "Smile you're on Candid Camera!'. The bell hop and luggage men are very friendly and polite, but one of them, with admirable candour, confessed to me that this is only because they work for tips! What a shame such a great, no-frills but central place has been ruined by grossly incompetant management. Only stay here if you want to be treated as if you are the scum of the earth, by people who hate their jobs and really want to take it out on the paying customer. Hopefully, if enough guests vote with their feet, management will wake up to the terrible mistake it is making and pull this place up to the decent standard it used to be. Until then, I'll be taking my money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Location Great, Service Bad!”
Reviews.Author: lottie022
Reviews.Content: Excellent location between central park and times square, opposite Carnegie Hall so is just a walk from some great bars and restaurants. The room was a reasonable size (2 doubles) and quite clean, although the service was pretty poor (it took 3 attempts just to get our room sorted on arrival!) Small bar in reception.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Park Central If Possible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be a very ragged operation. Several irritating problems: inadequate linen service, TV malfunction, bad lamp in room, room card failed (desk clerk offered no apology, said he had "no idea" why it failed), poor elevator service. Seems no serious attempt at quality control at this hotel. Frustrating experience. Also, this hotel has a restaurant but does not offer room service. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was really worried about staying here. There was absolutely no reason. Our room looked newly renovated and had new carpet. There were rolls of carpet in the hallway so I assume they are in the process of renovating. The staff was friendly and we had no problem checking in or out. You can't beat the location. The only negative aspect was the elevators!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: 101luvtotravel
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay at the the Park Central, 2 blocks from Central Park and 6 blocks from Times Square. We were very late in checking in 1am, the staff was very friendly and accommodating. The room was standard size for New York City (small) non-smoking floor, king bed and tiny clean bathroom. We were without wash cloths for all but one day of five. We did approach housekeeping and were informed they had not had any wash cloths all week, however on our last day we received two. We extended our stay of one day and I had called to confirm this on the Wednesday, when I called to re-affirm this Thursday morning. One of the front desk clerks advised we had to re-key - the from desk associate David was not of the most friendly nature, but other than that, all the staff from front desk, porters, housekeeping were very friendly. Would I stay there again, possibly, but with so many hotels in the area I may be tempted to look around.

Reviews.Title: “would stay there again...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one week while attending the US Open. The room was quite nice and the location was nearly perfect. We had to walk several blocks to catch the train at Times Square to get to the tournament, but there were so many things nearby that we really didn't mind at all.

Reviews.Title: “Care when booking at Park Central”
Reviews.Author: Blackpool_Big_Steve
Reviews.Content: The Park Central Hotel, is as you might expect a large, faceless and bland hotel. Be careful when looking at the website photos, as it does paint a very nice picture of a rather tired looking establishment. My main concern which I feel I must pass on is the way bookings are treated. We arrived at 1.30pm to be told that our room would not be ready until 4.00pm, although disappointed as we were extremely jaded and in need of a shower and an hours `siesta`, we left our bags at the hotel (service operated by an outside company - expensive) and went off to Times Square. On returning at 5.00, we were told that they still didn't have a room available, but they would within a few minutes. A few minutes later we were given our key to a room and told that although we had asked for a room with two doubles, the one we were getting had 1 double and a roll away bed. With some reluctance we accepted this. The first room we were shown, barely had room for the 1 double, never mind a roll away bed. On request, we were moved to another room which was slightly larger. After sitting in the room for over an hour, the roll away bed arrived - a single. When I said we needed 2 singles for my 2 boys, the manager said that this was against fire regulations. Now this is the crux of the matter - the manager said that although I had a confirmed booking for 2 double beds (Through British Airways) this was only on the basis of a request and that we were not entitled to 2 double beds! Once I had discussed this at some length with the Manager, I finally got what I wanted, after being told that no such room was available in the hotel. .............Be Warned. Apart from that, the hotel was just about ok, it could really do with a bit of tender loving care and more pleasant staff. Other hotels I have stayed in, of equal size and cost have managed this very well! - See my review of the Jurys Hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Crummy-Don't waste your time and money”
Reviews.Author: jondavi
Reviews.Content: A total rip off. Please do not waste your hard earned money on a lousy product. Unfriendly and unaccomodating. Spent a week while exhibiting at the NY Intl Gift Fair. The saying 'sometimes' popped up a lot ie sometimes they cleaned the room, and sometimes they didnt. Sometimes they replaced the towels and sometimes they didnt' etc etc. The carpets themselves are not fit for pigs to walk on. Subsequently, Travel Planners who arrange accomodation for the attendees and exhibiters, removed this disgrace of a hotel from their list of accomodations. Unless you are desparate and have to be in that area, don't waste your time and effort.

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to New York City and we had a difficult time picking a hotel, we had actually picked the Hotel Metro and when we got to New York my husband had cancelled the Metro instead of the Park Central (we had booked both) so off we went to the Park Central. We had no problems with the hotel the beds were very comfortable and rooms were clean we had two rooms as we were travelling with teenagers. Maid service was very pleasant. We also loved the location. Steps from Central park and in the other direction Times Square. My only complaints would be our view out the window as we faced a centre court and brick walls and there were stains on the carpet and the elevators were a little slow and luckily we were on the 6th floor so we could take the stairs. All in all a wonderful trip and a comfortable, well located hotel. Would we stay here again? I'm not sure. The price was reasonable for New York.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: GaNewby
Reviews.Content: While my mother was visiting me from the midwest, I decided to surprise her with a trip to NYC (she'd never been). I ended up at the Park Central through Priceline with a winning bid of $120 per night. After reading various reviews on TripAdvisor, I must admit that I was a little nervous about this hotel. I was very pleasantly surprised by my stay there. We were there for two nights (8/8-8/10). I found the staff to be friendly, efficient, and helpful. Other reviews complained about long lines for check-in/check-out and the elevators. I experienced neither. The one quirky thing that happened was that there were no towels in the room upon arrival. I called and was told towels would be sent immediately-they never arrived. Fortunately, while filling the ice bucket, I found the linen closet and helped myself to towels. We got to the hotel around 12:30 p.m. and were told that our room wouldn't be ready until 3/3:30. They have a baggage room available, but there is a $3 charge per bag. We left our bags and immediately began to explore the city. Our room was comfortable, clean, and nicely sized. This hotel is in a great location (W. 56th and 7th Ave.) with plently of inexpensive restaurants nearby. The hotel was a couple of blocks from Central Park and Times Square. Who could ask for better?

Reviews.Title: “Park Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jezebellejade
Reviews.Content: Location was great, just blocks from Times Square. Room was fairly large, with a huge bathroom. The only complaint was the elevators - there was always a line waiting on the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Double Charge”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was double charged for use of their valet parking - once by the parking attendant for cash payment, and, a month later found that an equal amount had also been added to my American Express account after I had checked out and settled my balance in full. Despite three letters and multiple telephone calls over the following four months, Park Central management has not responded.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights - July 19-22. First, let me say that the hotel is a reasonably priced hotel with an excellent location in Midtown (two blocks from Central Park). However, we did have some problems. We checked in late on the first night and, although we had requested a smoking king room, we were given a non-smoking double. The next day, we were moved to a smoking king on the 22nd floor with a decent view...a room that met our original expectations. Linens were a problem...we were provided with wash cloths on only one day of our four day stay. The ice machine didn't work on our floor. We didn't have any problem with the elevators. The hotel appears to be in the midst of a renovation...new mattresses were being delivered during our stay. At the end of the day, the bottom line is "would you stay there again?". No, I don't think I would.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central NYC - not worth it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On the website, the hotel advertizes asd "luxury accommodation". Far from it. Long check-in and check-out lines. Staff with bad attitude at the front desk. While the lobby looks fine, the rooms are exceptionally dirty. Stains on the carpets, walls, smudges on doors. Dusty glassess. When i checked in my room, one of my pillow cases had blood stains on it - apparently not changed from the (?) previous night. Staff at the front desk did not want to take care of this until I threatened them with the health department. The location is great - close to Cranegie hall, Brodaway, shops, may good and relatively inexpensive restaurants around. Nonetheless given the problems above in combination with disregard for the customers, I would not recommend staying there to anyone. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “No problems, great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was nervous after reading some of the other reviews, but we were pleasantly surprised by our two-night stay last week. We arrived around 4:30 p.m. on a Sunday. Checking in took about 5 minutes at the most. We had no problem with the elevators. The size of the room was fine for two adults and two young children (especially from what I've heard about NYC hotels). The room was clean, although somewhat worn looking--to be expected. The check-in, housekeeping, and concierge staff were friendly and helpful. The location was great (5-10 minute walk to Central Park, Times Square, or most anywhere in midtown), making up for any possible lack of luxury. We didn't spend much time in the hotel, so if it were lacking any "extras," I may not have noticed. We were looking for a clean, spacious, reasonably priced, centrally located hotel to sleep in after a long day doing the "tourist thing," and that's exacty what we got!

Reviews.Title: “No Problems”
Reviews.Author: tamblers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Central from July 5th to 9th and found it more than adequate. The maids were efficient and all we came in contact with were friendly and helpful. The hotel is huge and was built in 1930 so obviously it will show some wear and tear but considering it's location I consider it a great bargain. Those expecting Ritz-Carlton level amenities for less than 200 a night are kidding themselves. I will not hesitate to book this hotel for our next New York family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Room was small and dirty. Long lines at check in and check out. Stains on carpet in room and in hallways. Long lines to get into elevator---no separate elevator for bellboys w/ luggage. Ice machine on floor broken. This hotel was a huge disappointment---don't trust what you see on their website about "recent renovations" and photos are not a good representation of what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Brit review - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay with my wife and 2 sons aged 18 & 21. The hotel was fine - the room was clean, comfortable & modern. The lobby was welcoming & impressive. The service (reception, concierge & room service) was efficient & friendly. The location was fantastic ! Would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Shabby Dump!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself, and 3 pals went to go to NYC for a fun long weekend. I have travelled extensively but this was my first trip to NYC. We stayed at the Park Central May 19th to the 23rd because one of the group had stayed there before and insisted on staying there again. Why I cannot comprehend. As a new trip advisor member I had checked this place out and was very much afraid of what we would find on arrival. Anyone reading this review, pay heed to any negative reviews on the trip advisor as they are very accurate. Most of everything negative I read about, I suffered on my trip. On arrival, we were lucky to come at a time when there was little lineup at the check-in desk so that part was quite prompt. The wait for elevators to get to the room was long, due to the fact that several were out of commission and during our entire stay that was true every day. I noticed every time the elevator stopped that the hall area of each floor was dirty and shabby looking; wallpaper peeling, stained dirty carpet and worn out looking mouldings. On opening the door to one of the rooms (we booked two double rooms), my first impression was WHAT A DUMP! The room was okay in terms of size, but that was the only good thing about it. The carpet had several large stains and was very dirty looking. The furniture looked like it had endured several decades of use, scratches, dents, and looked very worn out. The decor of the room was dark and very shabby. The bathroom had mildew and mould in the bath/shower area and several tiles looked like they might be in danger of falling off. The tub and sink had some rusty looking spots and there were only towels for one, despite that this was a double and could sleep 4. The best part was turning down the bed the first night to discover the sheets on my bed were ripped! and I had this happen two other nights. The second room we booked was no better. Check-out was painful as the lineup was so long, it took an hour wait. The only thing for which I am grateful is that I did not see any bugs in our room as another reviewer did. For any who think I am too fussy or overly critical, let me say I am a very well seasoned traveller as I like to go to a different place each vacation and have seen all of Europe and Canada, and most of the USA, Mexico, and the Caribbean, so I have had my share of bad choices in the hotel department and stayed in a few dumps in my years. But I have never stayed in a dump and paid such an exorbitant fee for doing so. Thank God the city was so friendly and fun that it made up for the lousy accommodation otherwise my trip would have been ruined. Do yourself a favour and stay away from this hotel.
