NYC has so many choices there is no need to stay in a dump no matter your budget and certainly it is an insult to pay a high fee for doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Terse Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Located 2 blocks from Carnegie Hall, 3 blocks from Central Park, a few block north of the Times Square Bway Theaters, and a block from the touristy Carnegie Deli, this hotel is well located. The lobby is pleasant and stylish, my room with a king bed and desk was very good and a pleasant surprise. The downside of this hotel is that the desk staff was cold, terse, argumentative, and down right mean spirited. It ruins what should be a nice experience. And it wasnt just me, I heard over and over again while in line over the course of two days, their terseness and arrogance.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!!!”
Reviews.Author: bareboi23
Reviews.Content: This is, by far, one of the worst hotels I've been to. Service was substandard - I'm sure hostels treat their guests better. The lobby had a foul odor when I arrived. Only two elevators were working when I arrived. The room smelled like onions. I called and asked to have my room switched - they obliged and changed my room. The 2nd room was still dirty - the maid never cleaned it. I called again and the only room they had was the original onion room. Back to the onion room. On my 2nd night, I woke up in the middle of the night to hear and see a rate scurrying along the nightstand. Stay away - stay far away!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay 6/30/05”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Central for only one night. I had been to the hotel before for a convention, and it seemed very nice from the lobby, so I figured the rooms would reflect the same. This was not quite the case. The room was an okay size, however the first drawback was that the bathroom door was next to the bed, instead of around the corner on the other side of the wall by the entrance. Talk about no privacy! I have stayed in many hotels, in NYC and otherwise, and I have never seen this set up before. When I went to take a shower, I realized that there were only 2 hand towels in the bathroom, so I had to call downstairs and ask for towels. (How do you forget to put towels in the bathroom?) Not to mention when they did finally arrive (all 2 of them), they were rough and frayed with holes in them. In the corner of the room, the wallpaper was peeling back and hanging down. The elevators were a whole other story. This huge 30 floor hotel that takes up an entire block ony has 3 elevators. It took forever just to get an elevator, nervermind the fact that they stop on almost every floor. On the plus side, the central air worked pretty well, and the bed and pillows were comfortable. All I can say is you get what you pay for. We paid $139 a night for a "superior" king room, which of course in Manhattan is a good price. If you're just looking for a decent, clean, no-frills hotel, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: MargaretofLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Park Central from June 16 - 20 this year. The hotel was clean and in a very good position. 5 minutes from Times Square, 5 minutes from Broadway and Central Park. I had read the reviews after I booked so was not sure what to expect. The staff were very friendly especially at check in. The concierge seemed almost surprised when we tipped him, although it is the custom to do so. I have no idea why the reviews I read said the lifts were slow. They were not. They came and were empty almost every time so no waiting for the next one. If we go back to New York, I would not have any hesitation about staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and dirty”
Reviews.Author: Nook792
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and was very unimpressed. Rooms were musty and had mildew on the ceiling above the window as well as the inside of my shower curtain. Could not get another room due to summer crowds. Requested a non smoking room but apparently my room was sandwiched between two smoking rooms and the stench of stale cigarette smoke was always in the air. Yuck. Great location but this place should be put out of its misery and torn down to make room for a newer hotel. Stay here only as a last resort.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central Central to the City”
Reviews.Author: azheartnurse
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to the City for her graduation present and we stayed at the Park Central June 8-11. We got it on Priceline for $200 per night, probably not the best rate going. We found the hotel to be very centrally located to just about everything we wanted to do. Although we requested a non-smoking room and were put on what was signed as a non-smoking floor, the whole floor and room smelled of stale smoke. There were only 3 bath towels put in the room each day (us girls need 2 a piece) and when housekeeping was called for more towels, they never showed up. We did not eat at the restaurant in the hotel, too many other choices and they seemed way over-priced. Times Square was an easy walk, as were the shops on 5th Avenue. The beds were comfortable and the TV worked fine. The staff was courteous throughout our stay. We felt very safe in this hotel. There was a window in the room however it looked out onto a brick wall and a rooftop, no views whatsoever. If you are looking for a clean, basic hotel, centrally located, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “My first hotel stay in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: markxinger
Reviews.Content: I booked my room on Priceline for $140. From what I can gather, not a bad price. I had read the reviews, both good and bad, and didn't know what to expect. I am happy to report that the overall experience was very good. Great Location - The convienence to Central Park, Times Square, and other NYC attractions cannot be overemphasized. Subway close by, getting places was no problem once I figured out the subway routes. The staff was competent, but not overly friendly. Yes the room was relatively small, and the TV remote worked only occasionally; but I didn't come to sit in the room and watch TV. One caveat - the service in the hotel resaurant was horrible. If you are looking for a place to sleep while you take in NYC, I'd recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “frustrating but grows on you”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, near lots of good places to eat and inexpensive bagel place for breakfast. Staff was efficient but cold. Concerige got us tickets to a top broadway show at the last minute which made up for the worn quality of the carpets and tacky scratched furniture in the room. Good soundproofing against street noise. With a little care this hotel could be great- right now I'd call it a good second choice if others are sold out.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean, Above-Average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Park Central Hotel, located just a few blocks south of Central Park, it's a comfortable place to stay for anyone visiting the Midtown Manhattan area. My room was very clean, spacious, and incredibly comfortable. The bed was nice an relaxing, the bathroom was very nice and modern (nice water pressure, sanitray...one of the best for the price). Don't count on getting a nice view unless you're lucky; mine was of the very unattractive interior area. But that's ok; if you go to New York and spend time in your hotel room, you're wasting your time. The only complaint is the check-in/check-out process. Plan on at least an hour to get through the check-in line, and the same if you check-out that way (use the automated phone or TV service). But the staff was very friendly and accomodating. Overall, it was worth the money and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “NY Attitude, NY price, awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel because it was discounted as a part of a convention we were in town with, however as we came to find out, all the discounting was easily filled in with NY attitude for us--oh so free of charge. After requesting an early room, I called ahead and even specifically gave them the time I would be arriving AND asked--TWICE-- if the room would DEFINETALLY be available, I was still denied a room... well, that was unless I agreed to pay a $75.00 fee to get into a room that was already cleaned and ready for occupancy. Obviously I was outraged, even in my many trips to this city, I have never come across something as crazy as this policy. I told them I was not about to pay the $75 when he told me "uhhp, we DO have a room open." I accepted the room. I was later billed $75--but not as a fee, rather as a "occupation of room charge" wherein they can they freely tax (city, state, hotel (18.5%), and convention center). This "discounted room" ran us $249.00. ARE YOU KIDDING? We also had to switch rooms twice. The first room had no drapes. I don't mean it had a valance and no drapes-- nothing.... with high rises all around, no drapes. We were also conveniently placed above the mechanical units of the hotel which were very loud. After asking two seperate people to move our room, and explaining WHY, we were relocated to one floor down in the EXACT SAME SPOT. My husband and I are pretty young and we just sucked it up. However between no lightbulbs, no pulls to open the armoire and the toilet overflowing twice, we left that room,too. Luckily we weren't disappointed in the THIRD room where the ice machine outside our room sucessfully formed a lake soaking the carpet and, by the time we left, began molding. After notifying the front desk, the reply I received was "oh, we know." That's nice, hunh? The hotel is supposedly going to undergo a renovation and it couldn't come at a better time. Although the lobby is very nice, the carpets in the halls are all spotted badly, coming up at the sides and, in some places, threadbare. The room service is also on it's own personal schedule (a co-worker received her room service 3 hours after it was requested to be delivered). The service of towels (which don't match--and in our last room was only 2), toilet paper, etc. that we called for was swift however. The mopping of the overflowing toilet was not. The ONLY good point of this hotel is the location. It is conveninent, but there are far better places in the area at a similar rate. I found the staff here some of the worst in all my trips to New York and wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. This is the first poor review I have written at Trip Advisor and I'm not sure that the people who are loving this hotel were staying in the same building. Also, if you venture down the stairwell, pay attention to the floors--count them as you go-- two people we were with (females) wound up accidentally entering the staff men's dressing room where both came face-to-face with naked men. Upon reporting this mishap and suggesting signage, they were told that "if they ventured down there again, the hotel would remove them from the premises." So nice to take people's complaints into consideration, isn't it?

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: davidnyhan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really beautiful. I visited for the US Open in 2004 on Labour weekend and I was very impressed with the hotel. It has a good location, but is not really in walking distance of any major New York sites. When I arrived to check in, I was met with a very unfriendly and quite rude member of staff. I asked him if I could have a room with two beds and was informed that they were busy and No i could not. The best he could do was a camp bed and considering that it was advertised as a four and a half star hotel I dont think it was very reasonable. Despite this initial mishap, my experience there was great. The room was an adequate size and had the most comfortable bed I've had in a hotel. I did really like this hotel and would definitely recommend staying there, I just wish that the staff would cheer up a bit!

Reviews.Title: “Fun fun fun!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at Park Central last week for four days and had a great time! This is not the Ritz or Plaza and they dont claim t be--for the price it was excellent!! The location was amazing--but I think that has been stressed fairly well on here. But we were also very pleased with the the comfortable, though simple room as well as the service. The staff was polite and helpful--we checked in a full two hours early and this was not a problem at all :) You could look one way out our window and see Central Park...look the other direction and you see Times Square. The subway was exceptionally accessible, but the walk down to Times Square was actually quite a bit of fun! I would have marked the actual facilities as average--but when the location and price are taken into consideration...I definitely rate the experience as a whole at above average. :) food tip: John's Pizzeria on 44th between 7th and 8th Ave. This was SOO yummy and the price was incredible! Our dinner for two (appetizer, drinks, and pizza) was $28! But also the site itself is delightful--it's an old church, complete with stained glass--don't miss out!

Reviews.Title: “smelly sardine factory”
Reviews.Author: Robert-Chiswick
Reviews.Content: The only positive point is this hotel's location. However the rest is pants-we walked into our room to be met by a horendous smell which was from a kitchen air vent a few floors below us as our window was partially open. we asked for a spray which did not come-also our toilet was blocked which we had to remind reception 4 times to unblock it. You could have a full makeover in the time the lifts took to take you to/from your floor. You can find a lot better in new york city than this smelly sardine factory where there is no customer service .

Reviews.Title: “Dont Worry fellow Brits”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: To all the Brits worried about booking this Hotel, stop worrying. This is a great Hotel for the price and location. The only negative reviews made about this Hotel are from Americans, who as we know behave like spoilt children all over the world. The rooms are quite big for a 3 star Hotel in NYC, and clean. Great location, minutes away from Central Park, and Times Square. Another bonus is that opposite the Hotel is a fantastic diner, who make superb breakfasts, try the pancakes, delicious. I was worried sick before I arrived at this Hotel, but believe me, its fine. Ive stayed in far worse around the world, especially in London.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Been back from NY for about a week now, and had a fantastic time whilst there. After reading bad reviews about this hotel on this site, we were a bit worried. But after seeing how close we were to times square, and how flash the lobby was we felt fine. Bit of a mistake with our room at first but soon quickly sorted. Not much of a view, but we didnt plan on staying in the room all day. Excellent location for everything, and will be staying there again in the future. P.S If your going to NY for the city and not the hotel, but still want something comfortable, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “So Relieved! It was Great!!”
Reviews.Author: trippk
Reviews.Content: We made plans to stay at Park Central because we were joining my brother, who was attending a convention. His company chose Park Central for their employees. After reading the many reviews, I was more than concerned. I didn't know what to expect. However, upon our arrival and check-in, I found this to be a very nice hotel. Our room was nicely appointed, clean, quiet and had an excellent view. Other than the very slow elevators, I found this hotel to be an outstanding choice, particularly for the money. I have stayed at hotels of this rating class at large cities all over the country, and have found this hotel to rate very highly compared to others in this category. Don't hesitate to stay here - it's great!

Reviews.Title: “Little things that add up to something”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Last week, May 18th to the 23rd, was my third or four stay at this hotel. It comes up quite often in Priceline at reasonable rates. For your money you get a nice, comfortable room in an excellent location just steps from a subway stop. The hotel, however, has enough quirks to bother some travelers. Last week, no ice machine worked anywhere in the hotel. If you wanted ice in your room you had to travel to lobby and ask for some at the bar (if open) or the Restaurant (if open). On Sunday night and without prior notice the water was shut off and we went to bed without the requisite shower. In addition, the TV selection is a bit skimpy with no CNN. I have never been to any hotel anywhere during the last 10-15 years without CNN access. Water pressure in the shower is poor and the shower lining was a bit dirty. Little things all of these but they were there. Caution to the wary.

Reviews.Title: “Loathed every aspect of the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sfchef66
Reviews.Content: We chose the Park Central because of its excellent proximity to Central Park and the "Gates" exhibit and its lovely photos on the hotel's website. While the location was good, everything else about the hotel was just awful. The website misrepresents the hotel in that there was no view of Central Park, no room service, no dining room, a small, dirty room with a harried maid who had to wash our glasses with A BAR OF SOAP IN OUR BATHROOM SINK!! I could go on, but you get the picture. This truly is the worst hotel in which I have ever stayed in New York.

Reviews.Title: “As expected”
Reviews.Author: Dogboy12
Reviews.Content: We visited the hotel in May 2005 and it was clean and in good shape. The staff helped us in a reasonable amount of time when we did have a problem. Only problem I can see with the hotel is that they turn off the ice machines so you may have to go in search of ice and they only had a few elevators running when we got there. Within a day all of the elevators were working again so it wasn't a big problem.

Reviews.Title: “Just good enough for business travel”
Reviews.Author: Laffalot
Reviews.Content: I got into town at 10:30 one night and was tired and hungry. Room service closed at 10 so that wasn't an option. Yes, NYC never sleeps and I could have gone to any of the area eateries, but decided to just hit the sack instead because I had an all-day meeting the next day. But, a good night's sleep wasn't going to happen. My room keys didn't work, so I called the front desk. They eventually answered the phone (they don't always answer it) and sent someone up. I waited about 15 minutes and someone got me new keys that worked. I checked my email and was about to crash when I noticed a mini-bar. Could it be?? I could actually get snacks, even if they were expensive. But the minbar was just for show - they're all empty. Sigh. Eventually I started drifting off to sleep and heard someone trying to get into my room. It scared me and I called the front desk (who answered eventually) and they didn't know anything about it. Tried to sleep. At about 12:15 the same thing again - someone trying really hard to open the door. Called the front desk again and asked them to be sure they didn't give me the wrong room or something. No, they didn't - good night. Then they called back a few minutes later. Apparently the previous guest left his phone in the room and, thinking it was empty, was asking a hotel employee to get it for him. I found the phone and said they could have it if they came up right away. Didn't sleep well after that. Other issues included that the maid only gave me decaf packets of coffee, the breakfast buffet was a solid mediocre (but service fast and friendly) and they didn't tell me until the third time I logged on that there was a charge for internet services. Since they didn't start out charging me and I didn't know why I couldn't get on, I called tech support three times. Eventually I, not they, figured out I just needed to call the front desk (they didn't asnwer this time) and get the password. Later I saw the toll-free calls to tech support had been charged to my account. Oh yeah, and the fitness center is minimal. But that's OK. It's an older building with a few stains on the carpet, which is also OK, because it's NYC and not Vegas. And the construction noise was unavoidable, which I can't complain about when in a big city - one should travel with earplugs. I still expect more for the price. It looks a lot nicer on the website - Photoshop maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central - Great location”
Reviews.Author: agorisk
Reviews.Content: The staff at Park Central in NY,NY were extremely helpful. They assisted my mom, sister and me in getting a cab back to LGA airport. After reading the reviews on trip advisor, I requested a lower level room so I did not have to ride the elevator - they accomodated this request. My sister and mom took the elevator without any problems over the weekend. this is a great place to stay if you plan on seeing New York and not spending time in your hotel room without needing to use a lot of transportation.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!!”
Reviews.Author: danielmoll
Reviews.Content: I ´ve just arrived from NW in 8 days trip in Park Central. The Hotel was very good. We arrived at 18:00 and the check in was in 20 seconds! Our room were at 22 floor and we had views to 7 avenue and we could see Times Square veary nearly (I attached pictures). We choose smoking room and normal rate. The room was big and also the bathroom. Towels and cleaned every day(we putted 1$ tip daily). The lifts were faster, max. 2 minutes of waiting one time. Sincerelly I was very worried about some comments here but I am very happy to had chosen Park Central. The location is perfect, in the middle of all places you have to visit. If I return to New York, i will retun to Park Central!

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my family, we are 5 persons, are very happy with the hotel. We had a four day trip to the states and Manhattan from Sweden. Our children are in ages 13,17 & 20. The location of the hotel couldn´t have been better. Near Central Park, I am a birdwatcher, and close to the shopping and attractions. Both check in and check out took less than 2 minutes. The bagageservice after checkout was quick and correct. We didn´t need to wait for the elevator many minutes at any time. The two rooms had space and good bathrooms and safe and hairdryers in each room. We found the rooms clean and nothing was out of work. The staff were all nice and helpful. We didn´t pay much for the whole trip and hotel so we are only happy with everything and can reccomend it. It is not a luxury hotel but we got more than we paid for!

Reviews.Title: “You are better off throwing your money away than staying at the Park Central”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here. Most of the front desk staff is rude and unhelpful and doesn't believe in customer service. My husband had a guaranteed reservation for a Concierge King - through an online travel agency. When he arrived he was given a room on the 6th floor (not 21-25 as promised) - with no wifi access and no remote control. The front desk was extremely unhelpful. When I called to speak to the deak manager on duty to get a room change he said that there were no other rooms to move my husband to and that he had too much paperwork to call my husband and try to remedy the situation. He then hung up on me. When I called back - I spoke to a clerk who looked in the system and found that there were unreserved suites that my husband could be moved to, but the same manager who hung up on me had to authorize the change. But, the manager was too busy doing paperwork to even bother. By 11:30pm my husband still had no remote and the manager still had not bothered to figure out a solution.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth The Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived 4/22-4/23/05 . The room suprised me it was bigger than I thought I was going to get in NYC. Room was very clean. I was veiwing the feedback before my stay there and they said the elevators were real bad. They were a little slow but nothing to be that impatient about. Check in was pretty quick and check out was even quicker. Last year I stayed at the Hilton and I think the room I had at Park Central was better except for views even though I was only on the 5th floor over looking other rooms. I was exceptionally happy with this hotel and will stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, More than Adequate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked through Priceline the day before, had no problems checking in. Room was large by NYC standards, clean and fresh. No view as overlooking fire shaft but wasn't expecting much for the price I paid. Location cannot be beat, friendly doorman and staff, held our bags the next day while we got some coffee. Give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “We had no problems......”
Reviews.Author: MrsStacyLamb
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five night stay at this hotel and have encountered none of the problems mentioned in previous reports. We arrived at the hotel at 1.30pm and checked in straight away and we were given a room on the 15th floor overlooking Times Square. Every thing worked in the room and the king sized bed was massive and had a brand new mattress on it ( yes I did check!!). No hassel from any one, the concierge was very helpful and the Liberty helicopter tour was $7 cheaper booking through him. Left a $2 tip each day for house keeping and had heaps of fluffy towels and clean sheets each day. Had to report a prob. with the loo and it was fixed within 10 mins. Checked out within 3 mins without incident and decided to use the porters offer of transport to JFK at $60 because it was rush hour and would have cost more in a yellow cab. We travelled in style in an air con. huge Chevvy SVU with blacked out windows..... !!! The location was superb and many delis and diners within easy reach for breakfast. If you have booked already for Park Central don't be too daunted by the neg. reports it's not that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here unless you are desperate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I thought I'd give it a try for one night before moving to a very swish hotel 'Chambers' on 56th. Park Central is a dive. I've stayed in 4-5* hotels all my life so maybe it was the shock of how the place smelt badly. The elevators were very slow. I had a kingsize room on the 11th floor and the floors smelt damp. The room was very dark, badly lit and the decor was terrible. There is the side you pay for what you get but these rooms could do with some home improvement. You don't seriously think that Scharger hotel rooms cost a fortune to do up - they source their rooms from Ikea style shops -so dirt cheap. This place needs a serious face lift... starting off with the landings and the rooms, the lobby is ok. It could have potential of looking smart. I would not EVER recommend this place. It is in a good location but then so are a lot of places. Belvedere looked better. The staff seemed pretty miserable too and there was a lot of construction work going on.

Reviews.Title: “Lesson learned - read reviews BEFORE booking”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First impression - Does waiting in a long check-in line that winds through the lobby appeal to you? If so, this is the place to be!!! I listened as other guests were told their rooms were not ready yet - this after a 4:00 p.m. check-in - and here it is 5:00 pm. After 20 minutes, we were issued a room on the 24th floor. Quickly finding the elevator, we (again) waited. This time for the elevator - many others joined us -in fact too many to fit into the rather small elevator. We finally reached the 24th floor - I had mixed feelings about being this high but anticipated a rewarding view. The first view/impression of our non-smoking room was a mixed rush of the senses (in this order): stale cigarettes, view of air shaft, cramped room, filthy carpet (a stain the size of a regulation basketball) , burned out floor lamp and bed linens straight out of a Motel 6. Yes, the mattress was comfortable, but "let sleeping dogs lie".

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Central from 4-13-05 until 4-18-05, and had a great time. This hotel is super close (walking distance) to Central Park, Times Square, Carnegie Hall, 5th Ave shopping, Radio City Music Hall, most museums, Rockafeller Center, Madison and Park Ave, Broadway shows and almost all Off Broadway shows. Unlike the reviews we read about this place, the staff was super nice to us, and would do anything they could for us. The only complaint we had was about the elevators...they were a bit slow, and the button on our floor would not work sometimes. We basically just used the stairs to go down, and waited for an elevator to go up. We asked to be placed in a newly renovated room with a city view when we made reservations, and they accomodated this request. HINT: arrive later in the evening. Some people complained about their rooms not being ready when they arrived. This happens to most hotels, so I would reccomend checking in around 7PM. We arrived in the evening, and had no problems. Our room would be considered small to some, but when dealing with New York size rooms, we had a palace! Our room rate ranged from $199 to $259 a night (Sat. night was the most), and that was an economy rate. You have to understand that a nice room in this city will cost about $500 a night, so you are really getting a bargin at Park Central!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but shabby and cramped.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this place. First, the positive. The hotel has a wonderful location for anyone who likes to spend time in Midtown. It's across the street from Carnegie Hall, 2 1/2 blocks from Central Park, and adjacent to a busy subway station. In addition, the bathroom was larger than expected, and perfectly adequate. If you paid anywhere near the $125 per night I did, via an Internet deal (plus hefty NYC taxes), then the positives easily outweigh the negatives. If, however, you paid anywhere near the vastly higher rack rate, you'll be disappointed. Here's what's wrong w/ the hotel: (1) our room and the elevators were quite cramped - terrible for those w/ any claustrophobic tendencies (2) the elevators were very slow - 5 minute waits on our room floor, and lines for the elevators at the lobby, were common (3) lack of attention to detail - our room was rented to us w/o anyone noticing that a bedside lamp had a burned out bulb, that the bathroom door didn't latch properly (it wouldn't stay closed), and that the overhead bulb in the bathroom, above the tub, was flickering. ** However, hotel staff was pleasant and responded to our maintenance requests by getting these items fixed fairly quickly. (4) corridor on our floor was shabby, w/ faded carpeting and dirty walls (5) the hotel tends to gouge on prices - restaurant/room service was grossly overpriced, they charged $1.25 for a toll-free phone call made from the room phone, and they charged a $12-15 daily premium for parking over and above what neighboring garages charged (6) bed was too soft, and the lines were cheap, ugly, and felt uncomfortable (7) cable TV went out our second day at the hotel, and never went back on

Reviews.Title: “Not all that bad, but...”
Reviews.Author: deegee918
Reviews.Content: ...for the price it was OK. I was a bit intimidated by some of the other reviews. I have to say that the personnel were outstanding. Everyone was knowledgeable, helpful, prompt and friendly. Our room was too warm and we couldn't open the window. A call to housekeeping had a maintenance man in our room within 10 minutes - my husband offered, and was refused (nicely) a tip. Elevators were rapid enough - with no long waits. The breakfast buffet in the first floor restaurant was (mostly) fresh and flavorful (the rolls were stale). It must have been a bad staff day because although everyone was quick and courteous, the waiters, busboys and even the chef kept dropping and breaking dishes. Now for the just ok part - the rooms were advertised as being the largest in the city. Hardly. It was a small, average room (looking out over a lovely air shaft!). The bathroom was "stocked" with two bars of soap, shampoo and conditioner - and that's it. I'm a bit spoiled regarding prices of (and amenities in) hotel rooms lately - generally never paying more than $95 (and usually only paying about $65) thanks to PriceLine or one of the other discount sites - and that's for 4 star hotels (ie Westin, Wyndham, Hilton, etc). In that respect, I was disappointed. Oh yes, and the lack of a coffee pot (although there's a fabulous bakery across the street where, even though I was short $3, gave me my order anyway - btw, I did return w/more money).

Reviews.Title: “No problems for us at the Park Central”
Reviews.Author: Smileymiles
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed seven nights at the Park Central 25th March to 1st April 2005 in room 1157. We checked in at 10 p.m. no wait, no problem, pleasant reception clerk. Large clean room (at least twice the size of anything I've ever had in London!), king-size comfortable bed, largish bathroom/shower, towels changed daily, heating OK, opening windows, no noise problems (and we overlooked 7th Avenue and were next to the lifts). We tipped our maid 2 dollars a day. All staff we encountered seemed very nice. We ate and drank out and did not use the Hotel's facilities. We had no problems with the lifts. There were no coffee making facilities in our room - we bought coffees 'to go' over the road. The location is simply superb. For a three-star hotel at the price we paid through Expedia, we were more than satisfied and would be happy to return anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Don't take your coat off - you won't want to stop”
Reviews.Author: wahp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Central between March 25th - 29th 2005. We were a party of four and as two of of party required separate beds our travel agent called and asked about booking two rooms as we wanted one with twin beds and our booking was made on that basis. We booked two rooms one with any type of bed the other with twin beds. The four night break cost more than $2000. When we arrived we were told that we had been allocated two one bedded rooms. We queried this and to cut a long story short the lovely check in clerk called the front desk manager and after quite a wait a portly man popped his head out, tapped a few keys on the keyboard and in true Little Britain style said 'The computer says NO' well actually he just said NO. In fact he said we don't actually have any twin rooms in the hotel- none at all, not none available, none at all. So I asked why had they had accepted our booking when they couldn't fulfil it and he just shrugged his shoulders. I said to him that it was showing as a confirmed booking for twin beds and he said that no beds are guaranteed until check in. I asked him to refund our money so that we could find a hotel with twin beds and he said No - we had made a confirmed booking and it was non refundable!!! We were allocated rooms on the 25th floor, one was quite large the other very small. In the small room they added a rollaway bed - all this money and one guest gets to sleep on a rollaway.. It could have been worse as when we were checking in a couple with two strapping teenage lads were also told that their room would have one kingsize bed and a rollaway. I wonder how Dad got on sleeping with his lads. The largest of our rooms seemed to have a bathroom designed for disabled access. The bathroom was approximately 10' x 8' and one third of this was tiled with a shower. There was no curtain and the floor was very uneven and cracked. When the shower was used it flooded the whole room and from the skirting board and carpet in the bedroom it was clear that it had flooded reqularly. The shower was really weak and very disappointing. In addition to the shower there was a sink and toilet, no shelves, no counter, no cupboards in short no where to put a toothbrush or toiletries. There was no where to put this in the room either so it was put in with the television as this was the only place with a shelf. The room itself was comfortably furnished and on the surface clean but the maid service was lacking - no towels, no coffee, windows left open on cold, rainy days. The small room had a very small bathroom but it was fully functioning. The room was also very noisy - we turned our air conditioning off but it was still really noisy, it sounded like an aeroplane going over head and there was constant traffic noise. The smaller room (very small) was at the back of the hotel and much quieter. This is my fifth New York visit and this was definitely the noisiest hotel. We were on the 25th floor and the lifts were hopeless it took about 15 minutes to get a lift and there were often long queues with lots of queue jumpers. There was obviously a leak from the ice machine as there was a wet patch on the carpet around four feet wide around the machine. This got larger over the time we stayed there. Room service seemed very expensive - french toast was $18 plus 18.5% tax plus $3.50 delivery (plus gratuity?) and omlette was $20 plus the tax and delivery. I thought that this hotel was over priced and the useless front desk manager who's only function seemed to be to tap the keyboard and say 'The computer says no' was a definite negative. If there are only two of you and you can get this at a reasonable price then I think that you would be happy with it.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: arthouse1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Central hotel 10/13 March and was pleasently surprised by it given all the negative feedback on here. We booked a 'superior' room via a cheap UK website. The room we got was large with a huge super-kingsize bed and a large marble bathroom. The floor we stayed on (11th) had just had all the matresses replaced on the day we arrived so we had no complaints there. The maid service was good. New towels daily. The room itself was a tiny bit shabby and needed some minor cosmetic improvements (some peeling wallpaper in one corner). The room was warm - very handy when it was minus 12 outside! Check-in took about 10 minutes and we found the staff efficient but not unfriendly - remember this is a vast budget hotel and the staff are just getting on with their jobs as best they can. The lobby is huge and very noisy because of all the hard surfaces. We didn't have any problem with the lifts. They didn't strike us as slow as some have said on here. Location is superb ! The breakfast at the hotel is pricey. The are several good delis within a few minutes walk - we especially liked 'The Stage Deli'. All in all I would recommend this hotel and would use it again in the future. It is not a luxury hotel but then you're not paying luxury prices. It seems excellent value for money. Our stay appears very different to the experiences of some others who've left reviews here. Maybe we were lucky. Maybe it was because we booked a 'Superior' room. Maybe you should do the same in future.

Reviews.Title: “Bare Bones”
Reviews.Author: travelresearcher28
Reviews.Content: Returned from this hotel last night. Travelled with my family of 4. While yes, it is well located, it is really not as nice as a Holiday Inn. The rooms felt dirty, bedspreads and blankets were worn, bathroom tiny, no perks at all (no coffee maker, etc.). Check-in was a very long line (I noticed at any time of the day or night there was a long check-in line--this hotel is obviously not hurting for business). Check-in rep was nasty. The view out of our window was of a filthy dirty roof with buildings on all sides. It felt like night all the time. Do not spend more than $80 on this room. There are loads of hotels all around this area. TIP: Ask to be on the 3rd floor--we didn't do this intentionally, but soon discovered that we were grateful to be able to use the stairs as needed. This is no exaggeration--you can wait for 15 minutes for an elevator. You really have to filter in "elevator time" into your "travel time".

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here with my wife. Had a corner room. Very noisy at night, but most NYC hotels are. With earplugs we slept fine on the good beds. The sheets were clean yet firm and rough. The room was clean and pretty big for an NYC hotel. Couldn't hear my neighbors to the side or above, but family staying in other rooms could hear neighbors. The bathrooms were nice, although there are no bathroom fans, so plan your business accordingly. The main reason to stay here is location - right across the street from Carnegie Hall, 10 blocks up from Times Square, and three blocks down from Central Park. Also right next to a subway entrance. If you watch Letterman, you'll recognize two of the next-door restaurants - Trattoria del Arte & Redeye Grill. The hotel lobby looks upscale and the building seemed clean. For price, we paid $120 a night for Tuesday and Wednesday, and $160 for Thursday night. Those are good rates for this type of mid-town hotel. A good choice, and with so many hotels in NYC that there's no reason not to try it once and move on until you find something perfect.

Reviews.Title: “How slow is slow?”
Reviews.Author: BillsFanVA
Reviews.Content: Spent the Mar 11-13 weekend there with the family (4). Our room was incredibly small for 4 adults, even with the knowledge that in NYC you aren't getting a lot of sq ft for your green. As my son noted, the clearance between the bathroom door and the toilet could be measured in millimeters. The room was, however, clean, except for some spots on the rug -- typical I guess. We were very pleased with the maid service, which can be a BIG gamble in NYC hotels. They brought us extra pillows when we asked for them. Ditto towels. The biggest dig on this hotel is the elevators. As has been adequately documented, they are molasses slow. I guess there's nothing that can be done about it. Just know that if you stay here, you are going to age waiting for them. It's a very sore point. We didn't eat in the hotel's restaurant. One look at the prices scared us off. There are many little coffee/deli shops in the area where you can get stuff to go fairly cheap and fast, so that worked for us. My wife and I had a drink in the lobby lounge. We found that to be very nice after the theater. The bartender (didn't get his name) was VERY good. All in all, this is a hotel where you get what you pay for. I wouldn't highly recommend it, but then again, I wouldn't tell people to shy away either. After all, location, location, location.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the location alone, it's a decent stay.The downside is the ultra-unfriendly and slow staff. Check-in took an age. Still, the rooms are fine, perfectly comfy, reasonably soundproof, temperature ok. The safe in our room didn't work. Bathroom was fine, not especially big but not cramped either.... What can I say, it's an average decent hotel. Not luxury at all, but unless you're really fussy it's likely to be satisfactory, for the reasonable price we paid. I like a decent level of comfort in a hotel room and found this one to be fine. And the location is phenomenal if you like the park. The awesome Carnegie Deli is also just a few doors away.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband have just returned from a weekend stay in this hotel, and before going I was reading the reviews, I have to say that after reading the reviews I started having some serious doubt's about staying there. But once we arrived I was pleasantly suprised. The checking in staff were not overly welcoming but done enough without any hassle. The lifts were a bit slow, until you find that there are more than one set of lifts, then we didn't have any problems. The rooms were clean, spacious comfortable, and with a good view of central park. Hotel in a great location. Leaving a $2.00 tip did do the job of getting clean linen and towels everyday. We only had one problem and that was that we had a strip of headache tablets and my contraceptive pills went missing!!! We searched high and low for them but we just couldn't find them. I did not report this as I felt that is wasn't worth it, (and also felt slightly embrassed)as everything else was untouched. So with that aside we had a fantastic time, I would recommend this hotel and would go back to it as well. If you ever use this hotel enjoy it!!

Reviews.Title: “Average -- go only if you get heavy discounted rates”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: elevators are dreadful slow. the rooms are o.k. not dirty but rooms could use a make over. not everyone is friendly and not all that helpful. but if you can get a good room rate, the location is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Much better values in New York City than this one!”
Reviews.Author: NoBull
Reviews.Content: Awful, rude staff; worn-out accomodations...what more can I say? Every request, no matter how small, made to the staff is met with either an argument or a grunt. It is almost impossible to get a staff member to address simple maintenance issues in a room. When I got to my room, a table lamp was laying broken on the floor. I called down to the Front Desk to report this, and they told me to put it to the side and they will take care of it tomorrow. I told them I wanted light tonight, and they, after much arguing, agreed to give me a different room, which turned out to be an inferior, inside-facing room. The hotel must have massive water leaks because some rooms smell strongly of mold and mildew. The smoking floors REEK of smoke, far beyond the norm, which leads me to believe they do nothing to try to alleviate the smell. The rooms are worn-out and poorly furnished. This hotel has seen better days, I am sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, uneven service, doormen on the make”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times while in NY on business. It's a reliably cheap hotel, so it's usually where my company's travel coordinator books us. The rooms are fine, if nothing fancy. On the one occasion when my TV didnt work, I have to say that the repairman arrived very quickly and fixed the problem. The front desk staff is hit or miss. On my last trip, the guy checking us in could not have been nicer. Other times, we've been greeted by Charles Addams cartoons who ignored us for several minutes before finally groaning, "Yeah?" Okay, okay, no big deal. You get what you pay for. But if you're staying here because you want to save money, stay away from the fat doorman, especially if you're on your way to the airport. With several yellow cabs waiting at the curb, the doorman urged me over to a waiting stretch limousine - $75 to JFK. He obviously was getting some kind of kickback from the driver, who probably was just looking to pick up an airport run during his waiting time on another job. I told the doorman no, I'd take a cab and pay the metered rate (the flat fare only applies to inbound cabs). He argued, and I had to tell him twice more that I wanted a cab before finally barking at him. I was born and raised in New York, and happened to know that the average fare from Midtown to JFK is about $55. It's not a huge difference in price, but I hate being hustled, especially when it's combined with a hard sell. It bugs me that this is the impression out of towners are left with.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean, comfotable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a fantastic time in NYC. For a no frills, cheap stay in a great location we couldn't have picked a better hotel. Our check-in was fast with no smiles and no welcome but we got upgraded to a kingsize suite on the 20th floor (room 2017). The room was very spacious, the bed was big and comfortable, everything was clean. There was a safe, iron, ironing board, tv, hairdryer and coffe making facilites all in good working order. The only downside to the room was that the refridgerator wasn't working, so we put our milk and juice outside on the window ledge which kept them cold ;-) The bathroom was nice and the shower was always hot. We tipped the maid $2 a day and left a note to say thank you. We asked for more coffee which we got and the room was spotless with clean towels every time we returned later in the day. The staff were pleasant but not that helpful. There was an ice machine down the hall which was very noisey and we felt a bit guilty using it because it was right outside someones room. This machine was also creating a nice wet patch on the carpet... so if you do use it, make sure you have shoes on... not just socks :-( We never had breakfast in the hotel because it was expensive. If you turn right coming out of the hotel and walk about 100m down the street there is a salad bar where they do great breakfasts to take out. I went there a couple of mornings and took the breakfast back to our room. $1.75 for a bacon & egg bagel..mmmm! There are many places close to the hotel to get great food although we found these quite expensive due to our touristy location. The Stage Deli and Carnegie Deli are just a block south and did great sandwiches... They are absolutely ridiculous portions. There is no way you can eat one of those things. Ask for a doggie bag and finish it off later if you get pekish. One last thing, it felt very safe walking back to the hotel late at night because there was alway people around. I would stay at this hotel again but I like trying different places. I'm going to give a rating of 4 stars not because it was better than average, but because of it's location and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel = Fine / Price = Good / Location = Great”
Reviews.Author: Mustapha_Mond
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I came up to New York to see "The Gates" in Central Park, (that should date this review), and the musical "Hairspray". Through Priceline we got two rooms for $107 per person per night. We checked in “early” at 3:30 PM. She had a smoking room and I had a non-smoking room. Staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and contained all the basic amenities, (desk with data-port, (Wi-Fi was available for $10 a day), iron and ironing board, free in-room safe and of course a small TV.) Her air-conditioner was missing a knob, my shower handle came off in my hand. If this is the sort of thing that "simply ruins" your vacation, ("I paid $100 for this room, how DARE they!"), then this may not be the place for you. Other than these quirks, (and the slow elevators), we were delighted with the hotel. We walked out the front door and looked to the left to see Central Park then looked to the right to see billboards of Times Square (about a 1/2 mile away.) We walked everywhere because everything was so close. When we did take cabs (if our feet were sore or she was wearing high heels) we were usually no more than $5 from where we wanted to go. The hotel is also conveniently located next to the 57th street exit of the Q, N, R & W subway lines. We asked the very friendly concierge, (guests kept coming by to thank him for his help or recommendation), about a comedy club and he gave us "VIP" tickets to The Laugh Factory. The tickets got us to the front of the line and first choice of seating. (I felt guilty walking past about 50 people but my girlfriend loved it.) We both agreed that we would recommend this hotel. We give the hotel "Above average" for the rooms and price but bump it up to "Excellent" because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “First Time NY Visitor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Like many others, I had read the varying reviews of Park Central with some trepidation....Have recently returned from a 5 night stay there and it was excellent, from the original check in (speedy) through to the helpfulness of the staff (although I agree they were very keen to sell you theatre tickets). The room was warm and the beds comfy, and a $2 day tip ensured we had clean bedlinen and towels every day. A kettle might have been a nice addition though. The location is fantastic, close to both subway station, and 5 minutes walk from Central Park and Times Square. Getting around was simplicity itself and the Downtown bus loop tour will drop off right outside the hotel. My daughter and I had a fantastic stay in New York, and I can't wait to go back - and I would most certainly return to Park Central.

Reviews.Title: “Give me a break!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Central in mid-town NY for a trade show for a week. They started off by messing up my arrival date even though I booked it 7 MONTHS in advanced and confirmed it, charged me a 1 night no show fee that I disputed as was their mistake! No coffee pot in the room and when I requested one they wanted to charge me a $25.00 fee for the coffee pot! One day after work, the maids had made my bed, but not my friends bed- we had two queen beds. ??? The first room had no heat and the second room was a sauna. No bellman help and only revolving doors - not pretty w/big rolling luggage. Wanted to check out later than noon and they said it would be a $75.00 charge to do so. I would not reccomend this hotel and won't be staying there again to say the least. It's easy stuff that make the details and this hotel basically couldn't have cared less. Just lame customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Good Outweighs Bad For Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location is great. You will not find another hotel in this price range that is this close to Central Park, Broadway Theatres, Times Square, Carnegie Hall. Right across from Carnegie, one block from Letterman, 4 blocks from T.S. The lobby is big and attractive. Bell and door service were polite and helpful. Front desk staff was mixed in their performance. Management seemed polite, but desk workers were ambivolent about your service at best. The website lists 24 hour parking as $35. It is actually $39. The hotel did not seem to care about their mistake. If you stay one minute past 25 hours, you pay the next day's fee. Rooms are small, but there are smaller rooms in NYC. Not particularly clean. Floor had not been vacumed and the bathroom floor needed cleaning fairly badly. This left a bad impression as I was there with my two children under three years old. Water pressure was horrible. My wife couldn't get the shampoo out of her hair. We were there in February, but it was in the 40's and 50's. When the room got warm, we soon found that the air conditioning wouldn't come on, only the heat. Generally speaking, this is not a hotel you would pay more than $49 for if you were on the freeway stopping overnight. But for midtown, it was well worth the $129 we paid for two double beds. I actually hope they don't clean up their act too much - they might start charging like other hotels in the area. $129 is worth a little trouble here and there.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed at park central for 8 nights at the end of january and must say, was pleasantly surprised by the size of the room (though, it would've been wise if they'd actually used the extra room space for the bathroom which was rather small - can just about fit one person). nevertheless, there were some flaws. the heating was not enough for the extremely cold weather and hotel does not provide kettles. it would've been nice to make myself a nice hot cup of coffee in the morning before venturing out into the cold. also, room does not have a refridgerator. the perks with staying at park central is its prime location with central park, times square, fifth ave etc within walking distance. would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: TVJunkie
Reviews.Content: Check-in is at 4pm and "early" check-in is at 3pm--no exceptions is what we were told. The concierge was rude. I felt like I was at a sales pitch meeting. She was discouraging us to go to TIX down at the Theatre district. She said we wouldn't see any "respectable" plays and scoffed at us for even thinking about going down there. We ended up getting 1/2 price tickets for Rent. It was a great show. We also went down there another night and got 1/2 price tickets for "Fiddler on the Roof." Granted, these are not "hot" shows, but they were very entertaining. The front desk was horrible. When we asked to change rooms b/c our heater wasn't working and two of the lights in our bedroom were burnt out, they made a big fuss about it and told us they couldn't move us out until after the rest of the guests were checked-in. Since we had dinner plans, we didn't have time to argue with them so we left. When we returned to the hotel, they said they had fixed the lights and the heater. The heater was on full blast when we entered the room. We couldn't turn it down so we called the front desk. After waiting 15 minutes and trying to call the front desk over and over again (they wouldn't pick-up the line anymore), I had to go down to the Front Desk to ask for help again. I waited until someone was able to come back to the room with me. Two different people were called up to the room to fix the heater. Finally someone came up with a wrench and they were able to turn down the heat. They only fixed one of the lights in the room. They said they didn't know where the extra light bulbs were and the person in charge wouldn't be in until the following morning. When we asked for another room, they told us they were booked and didn't have another room for us. By this time we were so exhausted, we didn't even want to argue. One last note, if you stay here, bring your own blow-up mattress. The wire springs were jabbing us all night long. Worse beds than at a flea motel!

Reviews.Title: “stay away if you can”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Unprofessional and rude staff. For example, reception can't naswer the phone "bcz she's on lunch". Put on hold in all directions. Spoke to the "Director" who was barely helpful and reluctant to help. A tourist trap and if you are looking for at least minimum level of sophistication, go somewhere else. Totally overpriced. Why are people raving about the location? There are much prettier and as convenient locations in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “I,ll be back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews of this Hotel,we thought we had maybe made a mistake.How wrong we were.The Hotel is perfectly placed for Central Park,Time Square and Broadway theatres.Staff are very friendly and helpful.Rooms are very clean,and are cleaned every day.Would I stay there again? Oh yes,I,ll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else for the money!”
Reviews.Author: mimidress
Reviews.Content: Never again! I have stayed here on several occassions due to a business show that I go to. Everytime I say never again, but this time is really IT! I had to put sheets on the carpet because the hotel was so filthy, even after changing rooms. The carpets and beds are awful. The staff not very helpful. Great Location is all I have to say.

Reviews.Title: “All was good, no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a seven night stay at the Park Central. I paid $154.00 Canadian per night(tax incl.). For this i received a suite on the 21st. floor. A seperate bedroom with king size bed, sliding glass doors to my own balcony and a bathroom that had been newly renovated with all new fixtures and fittings. It was great. I found the staff to be friendly and helpful at all times. Two dollars a day for housekeeping and the room was spotless everyday. The elevators were never a problem for me, even on the 21st. floor. If this hotel had a piano bar or an Irish pub downstairs, i would have given it five stars(for the rate i paid). As others have said,the location is the best. World famous Carnegie Deli across the street, Starbucks one block north to the right, Hooters one block north to the left(hey, it was NFL playoffs!) and of course Central Park three blocks north. I loved it. It sure beats staying in Times Square. I wish i had known the hotel has car service to the airports. For $35.00 i could have ridden in a full size Mercedes-Benz. Instead i paid $17.00 for a one hour fifty-five minute white knuckle ride in a ten passanger Shuttle-Van, with eleven other people. Never again! A Madison Square Gardens WARNING!!!!!!!!!. Do not buy tickets from the scalpers working at the Gardens. Their is a very good chance they are counterfeit. I lost $80.00 to a scalper who was working inside the Gardens on a non game day. The Security Boss told me that they get anywhere from twenty to seventy-five counterfeit tickets on a game day. What a scam. Bye the way, the Police do not care. No report, nothing! Please spread the word. Lets put these guys out of business. Anyway, New York is a blast, enjoy. If you have any questions, feel free to e-mail.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in NYC”
Reviews.Author: alirph
Reviews.Content: We just got back and this hotel was fantastic. Starting with the price, we stayed 4 nights for under 600.00 and for that we got a clean large room with a king bed, desk and ample closet and drawer space. We requested a high floor away from elevators and got a room on 20th floor with a great view of manhattan. If you are looking for a value hotel with convenience to broadway, shopping, times square, central park, museums and even a subway station directly beneath hotel, this is your hotel. We never waited more than 3 minutes for a taxi and that was in the middle of a blizzard. We cant say enough about our stay at the Park Central and highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a good centrally located hotel-hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: Burdenben
Reviews.Content: We had booked a 6 night break at the Park Central using expedia. After(!) we had booked, I started reading loads of internet based reviews of this hotel. The overwhelmingly negative commentary made me wonder whether I had done the right thing. I had never visited the USA before and my views of NYC had been largely shaped by the film 'Taxi Driver' and a score of horror stories about the city in the UK. If you belong to the same mindset, be prepared to have your eyes opened. We checked in - it took 2 minutes. We were politely shown to our room (338) on the 3rd floor. The room was well appointed, clean, warm and big! The bathroom had a bath with shower over. The decorations were tidy and the beds a bit on the hard side (which I prefer). The hotel is in the best position possible. 10 minutes walk takes you to Times Square, 5 minutes to Central Park, 10 minutes to the Museum of Modern Art. A subway station 30 seconds away and taxis galore. We have no complaints about the hotel at all. If you are on a budget and need to eat/drink cheaply there is a brilliant deli store on 55th st and 7th Avenue, where a meal and drinks for 2 (to be taken back to the hotel) can be yours for less than $40.00. Maid service at the hotel was good. We struck up a pretty good relationship with one of the maids and (sensibly) left her a daily tip of a few dollars. This ensured that our room was cleaned and the beds made every day and the linen and towels chenged every other day. We were also left a huge amount of hotel toiletry goodies during our stay. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting from the UK. The standards are much higher than you would find in 3 star hotel in the UK. The staff work hard here and they were extremely friendly. Our room had a digital safe which was just about big enough to store a laptop. If you are thinking of calling home, buy a phone card with a free access 1-800 number for about$10.00. Telephone charges from the hotel work out cheaper that way. Oh, and ignore those negative reviews and put aside the NYC horror stories. You'll have a great stay at the Park Central and a great time in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central-Value hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Park Central Hotel in NYC. The lobby was that of a nice, large scale hotel (up-to-date). The rooms were fairly large. The hallways and rooms look like they could use updating (occasional stains on carpet in hallways, and scrapes into the baseboards), but things were clean. For the prices that they charge, and the time you really spend in the hallways, this was quite a bargain-priced hotel. The location was central to the activities we had planned. The weather was cold, but we were close enough to everything that we didn't need to take taxis for most trips.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine 3 Star Accommodation - would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 6 nights costing $100 on average a night. After booking I looked at the reviews posted on this website and began to dread my trip of a lifetime in New York. I had nothing to worry about. We got checked into our room in a matter of minutes. The longest we waited for a lift was about 2 minutes and that was at the busiest of times - other people were complaining about this but I don't know what all the fuss is about! Our room had all the facilities you would expect from a 3 star hotel, nicely decorated bedroom and bathroom with plenty of clean towels, soap etc. There was also a mini bar, cable tv, safe and radio alarm in the room. We found the housekeeping staff extremely friendly and trustworthy (I forgot to lock the safe one day leaving an expensive necklace, new digital camera complete with instruction book, camcorder, cash etc. - none of which were touched). I also had a problem closing a window and had to contact the staff to get someone to close it - they were with us within five minutes to sort it out. We didn't use the restaurant, although it did look nice but I thought the menu was a bit on the pricey side. The bar staff were very friendly but again the prices were slightly more expensive than bars on the street. Taking everything into consideration, I would definitely stay in this hotel again if I ever get the chance to go back to New York!

Reviews.Title: “Just Fine”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews we were concerned about our stay at the Park Central; however, it turned out to be just fine. We stayed three nights over Martin Luther King, Jr. weekend. The room lived up to a three star rating. A bit worn, but worth the $125 we paid from travelzoo website. The heat worked excellent. The elevators were slightly slow around busy times of the day, but other times we were able to walk right in. The location is excellent - it is easy to get anywhere in the city. The service was average. If you are staying at this hotel, don't worry. Just remember it is three stars and expect such.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother staying at the Park Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal online for the Park Central Hotel on 57th Street in NYC over Martin Luther King Holiday weekend. It was for the Concierge Level -- billed as having "spacious luxury" rooms, bathrobes, minibar, fax machines, etc. It was none of the above. Apparently the hotel believes that concierge means "upper floors." It was shabby and the equivalent of a Motel 6. The hotel is so large and has so few elevators that we spent more time waiting for, and inside of, the elevators than in our room. It's a great location but there are surely better hotels for the money nearby, and with some charm. By the way, the staffer who checked us in literally snarled at us and informed us he was having a bad day. Welcome to the Big Apple!

Reviews.Title: “Some Previous Reviews are Suspicious...”
Reviews.Author: sayleaway
Reviews.Content: First off, I'm giving the Park Central 4-stars based on the rate I paid - an average of $105 per night. If you can get this rate, book it! It is simply hard to beat the Park Central's location. It's right on a Subway line and just far enough from Times Square to be away from the chaos, but close enough to be there in moments. I've stayed in a few New York hotels. I found the room to be quite large for New York. I think many of the reviews on this site are by people who do not understand what to expect from New York hotels (or by competitors trying to make it look bad). The rooms are typically smaller than anywhere else as space is at a premium in NYC. I found the room size to be more than comfortable. Yes, the rooms showed a bit of wear, but that's to be expected in a large city - certainly nothing to be concerned about unless you're paying over $200 (which I wouldn't pay for the Park Central). Here are a few other observations. Room location. Make sure you ask for a room away from elevators. Our first room was on the other side of a bank of elevators and it sounded like roller coasters passing by. I called the front desk and they accommodated me with a room change immediately. Front desk. We had no wait at all. I found it to be a pleasant experience. Again, your dealing with New Yorkers who are down to business types, so don't expect Southern hospitality! Bathroom. I found it to be the largest bathroom I've had in NYC - not huge, but certainly adequate. Water flow was rather low, but that's typical in hotels. Location. Again, it simply is hard to beat the Park Central's location. That is by far it's best attribute. There is absolutely no reason to be afraid of this hotel. Understand that you are in New York! The Park Central doesn't fall into the Deluxe or Luxury categories by any stretch, but it is certainly more than adequate. I would definitely stay there again as long as I could get it for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: rachelsh1
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I were looking forward to a wonderful two nites in NYC. We booked our reservations through Quikbook for a Conceirge Room at the rate of $139 per nite. That was suppose to include breakfast and afternoon snacks. When we got to the hotel and tried to check in the person at the front desk stated that they were overbooked and could not give us a concierge room. We were not happy we told them that is what we wanted and we would not accept anything less. Then he brought out the manager. He told us that there were no longer conceirge rooms available at the hotel since it was going under new management. He was very rude and instead or offering us an upgrade in downgraded us to a regular room at a 109 rate. My husband and I decided to bite the bullet and just not let is spoil our vacation. We then proceeded up to our room and found that it was "FILTHY TO SAY THE LEAST" I WAS AFRAID TO TOUCH ANYTHING. Needless to say we were very disappointed in the Park Central Hotel and especially the staff, as to the way we were treated. WE WILL NEVER BOOK THRU QUIKBOOKS AND AGAIN AND NEVER STAY AT THE PARK CENTRAL EVER!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On arrival we got a room that smelled so bad that we didn't even put our bags on the floor, we were moved to a much better room without any hassle. After swapping out our coffee machine for one that worked we were all cozy for the 5 nights we stayed. I spoke with one of the hotel staff members at length to find out where to go & what to see from a local's point of view & he was totally friendly & helpful. The desk staff were always busy but made time to be helpful. Location is it's biggest asset, it's within walking distance of so much to see & do from Lower Manhatten to Central Park. The price is OK compared to other hotels in the area, they have some good deals worth looking into. Overall I'd give the place a 6 out of 10, I'm not sure that I'd stay there again, only because I'd like to check out a new area when I return to New York. Mind you, when in Manhatten you don't spend most of your time in your hotel room now do you :)

Reviews.Title: “very good average hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we really enloyed our stay in this hotel... we stayed for four nights. I travelled with my partner, my one year old son and my partners mum and dad. We were all a little worried about this hotel, having booked before we found the trip advisor web site. I cannot understand why some people are having problems with this hotel. This hotel is a an average hotel by rating but we feel our experience was above average (maybe we are easily pleased). I have stayed in hotels in London that have cost more and have not been as good as the Park Central. I feel people maybe expecting too much from this hotel. On our last day of our stay i over heard two ladies discussing there bad experience in the hotel, there main topic of conversation was about how dissapointed they were in the comp. coffee sachets and how difficult they were to open.... i cannot understand why anyone would waste ten minutes of there lives on this topic. my partner and I were on the 23rd floor (2316) and we had a decent view of the front and the sky line (full of office sky scrapers, obviously). my partners parents were on the 20th floor (2028), unfortunately they had an interior view. I have to be honest i did a little research before this trip and i asked for a renovated room and a city view in advance so i have no comlaints from the room, clean covers, working cable tv, controlled heating. The room was fine. We asked for a cot for my son and they gave us a roll-away bed, which was of no use but not the end of the world. Check-in was quick, round about ten minutes (3pm). no probs with the lift. They are a little slow at busy times. The concierage service was good, bell hops friendly, reception accessible. **great location... Maybe something to be aware of.... during our stay the hotel changed hands and they were in the process of removing the mini-bars.... could be a positive or a negative.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a four night stay at the Hotel and it was very clean and nice. The views were fab from are hotel room, the room was very clean we had a one year old with us and had no problems with how clean the room was. The Hotel staff were lovely even though it was quite a long wait too book in they were very helpful. Would stay there again if I visted new york again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for A Three Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for three days starting January 2, 2005. Considering the price we paid for each night, it was a much better hotel than some other three star hotels in New York City. The decor in the rooms are somewhat tired compared to the very modern hotel lobby but acceptable. Check-in was speedy and staff were very helpful. And I cannot say enough about the location, it is a springboard to the nearest attractions, such as Central Park, 5th Avenue, Times Square, Rockfellar Centre, etc. Would I stay in this hotel during my next visit to New York City? DEFINITELY!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible room, unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: julieSanDiego_Ca
Reviews.Content: Our experience was also awful. The room was one of the oldest, dirtiest, I have ever stayed in. I was so thankful my 2 small children weren't traveling with us - if so, I would have checked out in an instant. We too had a terrible time getting our room. When we were finally checked in at 5pm, we were checked into a smoky "non smoking" room without working electricity. We were moved but it was quite an ordeal. With the exception of the bell staff, everyone else was rude and unhelpful. The concierage wouldn't help us get theater tix and wouldn't make a dinner reservation for us. No one ever smiled at us, it takes an eternity to get a live person on the phone at the front desk, the front staff even were yelling at guests. I have travelled all over the world for the past 30 yrs and this is one of, if not, the worst run hotels I have ever seen. The only redeeming factor is location. In response to the guest who had a nice room, there must be a small section of the hotel that was renovated. You were lucky. I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It is Just fine, relax...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: To begin, remember, a three rating means neutral/average according to trip advisor ratings. I arrived expecting a haunted house atmosphere from all the reviews on here. There is absolutely nothing wrong with this hotel. Is there better? Yes. And I have stayed at them before in NY. We used priceline during the holidays Dec 26 thru 30, 4 nights. The rugs were clean, the lobby nice, the service at check in was great at 1pm and about 10 minute or less wait. We were given 2511 facing down toward broadway. Room was normal size but configured differently than a normal hotel room, probably why people think they are small. I kept saying, there is nothing wrong with this place, again and again. Bathroom was nice and clean. Towels? Yes. Room kept clean. Elevators, not a problem. Yes you will wait a minute or two for an elevator during busy times...You arent the only one who wants coffee in the morning in NY city. And by the way, yes, a coffee pot with reg and decaf, hair dryer, note pen and paper, mini bar stocked and automatically calculated when you remove an item. furniture was hotel furniture folks, cherry colored wood, very ok for a stay in a 3 star hotel. Cable TV, sheets are very average, but clean and mattress a little cheap but firm and actually comfortable, but seemed like a cheap mattress. Would I stay again?, absolutley. Do I like 4 star better? Of course but it is by no means dirty, gross etc. I mean a piece of wallpaper peeling at a seam or a corner does not make it gross, it makes it a hotel room, used by many people over and over. I checked the rugs, believe me, they are hotel rugs and not dirty, can tell have been cleaned. Its a hotel, not the Taj Mahal. Heat was controlled by us in the room by one of those hotel window air/heat units. Great location too. Unless there are different rooms in the hotel then we stayed in, it is just fine. Maybe being nice to the check in employee gave us a better room, but I doubt it. Who knows?

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
