Reviews.Content: we arrived on christmas day for a 3 night break, there were no check in queues, although we had to wait 30mins for a room. the first room was nice and spacious but a little on the cold side, also very noisy from the airshaft, after sleeping in the room for 1 night, we asked to be moved and were moved straight away. the 2nd room was also very spacious and alot warmer. had been in the room for 24hrs and the toilet broke, although this was fixed straight away, it broke for a second time once again fixed straight away. we never managed to get our minibar opened despite asking several times in the end we gave up. during our stay we found the staff to be very friendly and mostly helpfull, we had no probs waiting for a lift, i agree with some of the other comments about the hotel the rooms are a little tired looking don't be fooled by the nice lobby wich is very modern, but all in all not a bad hotel for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Sub-par”
Reviews.Author: CeeGee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here XMAS week and would NOT return. Entered the room to find clubs of hair under the bathroom vanity, stains on the rug, dust in corners. The decor is like a middle of the road airport motel. Only good thing was the location. Another couple who were traveling with us said that they had stayed two years before and remembered it to be a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “good value hotel would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: JoUK
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five night stay over Xmas Holiday period - no complaints of the hotel at all. Staff were freindly and all of our needs were met. Room size was perfectly spacious, although decor a little on the tired side. Fantastic location. Booked through Tradewinds (UK) and feel the hotel meets it's three star rating, and offered good value for money. We would certainly return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in New York City”
Reviews.Author: heathery
Reviews.Content: If you're paying $100 per night for this hotel, then you're fine. That is about what this hotel is worth. Unfortunately, I paid far more through Expedia, where it was advertised as a three-star hotel. I'd give it one and a half stars, tops. As mentioned in a previous review, the faults are almost too plentiful to mention. A few details: 1. Check in. When we arrived at 10:00 a.m., we were told to come back at 2:00 p.m. for a room. We returned at 2:00 to find no rooms were clean yet. The desk clerk said to wait 30 minutes. We waited 30 minutes, then another, then another. Two hours of our first day in New York was spent waiting in a lobby with too few chairs, before we were let into the dingiest room in New York. We arrived on December 27th, a very busy day. But I've been in New York on busy days before and NEVER had to wait so long for check-in. The hotel's web site doesn't mention the 4:00 check-in anywhere, nor does Expedia. 2. Room: I had purchased a room in advance for four people through Expedia. The first rip-off was the additional $35 per night for each person exceeding a party of two. We were crammed into a two-person room with two soggy beds practically next to each other. No desk. Tiny TV with a remote that didn't work. Torn rugs. Mildew on the shower curtain. No shampoo. Two towels, total, for four people. A heater with a broken knob. 3. Elevators: This was mentioned before, but plan to wait for an elevator for at least ten minutes. And if you're on a low floor, don't expect to take the stairs. Both sets were closed for painting on the day we tried to take them. At least there wasn't a fire. 4. Service. Rude check-in people, maid entered twice without knocking, the garbage cans were not emptied, on the second day she still left two towels for four people. I've stayed in at least ten hotels in New York City, and this is by far the worst. And one of the most expensive. I recommend either mid-town Hilton (Hilton Times Square is the best), the Marriott Marquis, the Casablanca, any W hotel or the Comfort Inn midtown. All better than this one and previously purchased at similar rates.

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating service despite great location.”
Reviews.Author: BigFootPA
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the Christmas holidays and had many of the problems other guests noted. We had a fairly clean but small room with double beds which were small and only marginally comfortable. Depending on the day, either hand towels, wash cloths, or all towels were lacking. With the complaint of no towels the staff were very unresponsive but I finally found an unattended maid's cart and got what I needed. The elevators were a challenge due to crowding which made check out difficult. The concierge helped us get good restaurant reservations as they had a list of the spots which accepted reservations over the holidays. The front desk staff was more spotty, and I had to get argumentative when I was overcharged for my stay. Fortunately, I had my confirmation printout, so after 2 visits to the front desk the manager gave me the "credit" for the correct rate. My advice to others- Always have a written confimation of the quoted rate. Always have every door lock secured when you are in your room in this, or any, hotel. And seriously consider staying at other hotels instead of this one, especially during busy holiday periods.

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and Minuses”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked a 5 night stay through Priceline at a very reasonable (for New York) cost. Treated very well a check-in. No elevator problem. Did have one of the smallest rooms I've ever seen in a United States hotel and the tiniest bathroom I've ever seen - but usable. The real downer was that the room, while nicely furnished and with a very comfortable bed, faced onto a large airshaft. We were on the 10th floor and at high noon, you couldn't tell if it was sunny, cloudy or what time of the day it might be. Very depressing for a long stay. But it was quiet, no street noise at all. Many of the rooms face this airshaft, so ask for an outside view or a very high floor. The housekeeping staff couldn't have been nicer or friendlier. Extra hangers delivered in no time and they kept the room immaculate. No mini-bar or in-room coffee, although a drink machine down the hall sufficed. And there is a great breakfast/lunch place "Le Pain Quotodien" two blocks north on 7th Avenue which makes a great cappuccino.

Reviews.Title: “Very ordinary hotel”
Reviews.Author: gwelch
Reviews.Content: Park Central location is good; however, the amenities are definitely lacking; i.e. no conditioner, no handtowels, not enough bath towels, poor response time in delivering needed towels. The room we had lacked the cleanliness I think necessary especially in the bathroom. Staff was pleasant for the most part. I was expecting a bit more than the run-of-the mill tourist hotel even though it was inexpensive by booking on-line. I would choose another hotel on the next visit to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great deal. It was clean, warm, comfortable, great service, location is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - for the location and the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just come back from 3 nights at this hotel. As lots of these reviews start, we were also worried about the hotel after some of the stuff written on here... However, all I can imagine is that some of the writers on here are very, rich and used to very luxurious accommodations! We arrived early and checked in with no problems and the staff were friendly. We were given a room on 17th floor with a side view which was still a good view. The room may not be decorated with gold leaf and velvet, but it's hardly shabby, it was clean and spacious (for UK travellers I'd rate it higher than a travel lodge/inn). It was serviced every day with clean towels etc. We had no problems at all and didn't really think the elevators were that slow either. I would defintately book to go there again next time and recommend it to anyone without hesitation. We went to New York City to see the City and not the hotel, but still wanted somewhere warm and clean to rest our heads and we were more than pleased with this hotel. And yes everyone else is right when they say the location is amazing, we walked to 5th Avenue, Times Sq, Rockefeller, Central Park and down to the Empire State building. Very, very good!

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: sheeboo
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on this site after I had made my reservation at Park Central and was honestly a bit worried that our stay would be less than pleasent. My husband, myself and our 14 month old daughter stayed at Park Central for a one-night stay prior to a transatlantic flight from Newark. Yes, it is true that the room decor is less than stunning and borders on shabby, but THE HOTEL IS RIGHT ACROSS THE STREET FROM COLUMBUS CIRCLE and we paid $120.00/night!!!!! The rooms were clean and spacious. We arrived at noon and after handing our car over to the valet ($40/ 24hours) we asked the front desk to hold onto our luggage until check-in at 4 pm. The friendly front desk clerk smiled and said we could check in early and we were given a room on the 16th floor with a great view. Another plus for a New York city hotel was the quietness of our room.....we could not hear the street or other rooms....a plus when traveling with a baby from the country! The staff was friendly and helpful (I have found it especially true in New York that you get what you give), the location superb. I didn't find the elevator to be any slower than others in the city in buildings of simmilar age. $1000.00 hold was put on our credit card for incidentals, which is the first time I have encountered this practice, but the hold was removed 24 hours after check-out. So all said, yes you could stay in a finer hotel in terms of the linens and furnishings, but you would either pay twice as much or be farther away from the center of it all. I reccoment this hotel for budget minded and family travelers who want to be close to Central Park and the theater. Just two downers....the heat in the bldg. wasn't turned on until after 8pm (too late to give our daughter a bath) and there is a $10 charge to acess wireless internet on your laptop...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Prior to our vist on 11/19, my girlfriend and I were very hesitant about what to expect from the Park Central Hotel, especially after reading so many horrible reviews. Not sure why others hated it, but we found our room to be exactly what we expected. The hotel is a typical 3 star hotel and with it's location...you can't possibly go wrong. We strongly recommend checking out the concierges lounge on the 23rd floor...amazing views of the city! Also if you get a chance...eat at Carnegie's Deli which is just accross the street. The cheesecake is to die for. Only one con for this hotel...the elevators. If your like us and like to plan out your vacations days because of limited time, remember to factor in the wait for the elevator. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “A quality hotel, with a good location!”
Reviews.Author: xxxMerlin
Reviews.Content: Having booked a room via priceline and after reading a numerous views on the Park Central, NY I was a bit apprehensive upon arriving. However the check in desk staff were friendly and glad to hep with all my requests, the lobby looked great! The room was OK, the bedding and the bathroom were nice and clean and the décor to standard (I guess we were in a renovated room (1709)) although the carpet could have done with a clean as there were a few stains but hey that didn’t bother us. The room we had looked down 7th Ave towards Times Square and my biggest gripe was we had no curtains to draw to block out the light so we had flashing lights in a bedroom all night but we got use to that pretty quickly! The bed and pillow left a bit to be desired I woke up with a back ache a few times, the most important thing for me was it was clean. The hotel is in a superb location, we walked to most places and only required to use the subway once, even then the station was on 53rd/7th Ave. There are many places to eat around the Park Central catering for all tastes, we made full use of the guide book in the room, it was of great use to us. There were also vouchers for free items and discount for the major attractions in these book so don’t miss out. A quality hotel, with a good location!

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: kevnengland
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked great as we approached,the check in desk was efficient,got to the room looked like something out of a nightmare,large burn hole in centre of quilt, no furniture other than a table with the television sitting on it ,no pictures or decoration of any kind,several large dirty stains on the carpet,room looked like it had not been cleaned or decorated for years,returned straight to desk and had room changed,this was was slightly better but carpet was dirty and marked,i booked this hotel after reading that millions of dollars had been spent improving the place,i would like to ask on what did you spend the money?. The most grubby and dingy hotel i ever stayed at. My advice,find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 3-star mattress!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms on Priceline at this hotel for a 4-night business stay. We checked in after 11:00 at night and there was a 10-minute wait. Not a good sign. When we got to the room, which looked nice enough, I noticed that the bedspread looked too taught, as if there were no padding underneath. I should say that I never think of testing the mattress when I check into a room since, in the era of the "Heavenly Bed" when Westin and Sheraton are advertising how luxurious their bedding is, even 2-star hotels have decent mattresses. To my dismay, when I pressed down on this mattress, I was shocked to find that I could feel the coils! My colleague's room had the same problem. I called the front desk and asked them to change our rooms and was told that the hotel was completely booked that night, but they would be glad to change my room the next day. Easier said than done. So, even though I have arthritis that I knew would be aggravated by the awful mattress, I had no choice but to wait until the next morning, when I awoke aching all over. The next day, I asked 3 different members of the hotel staff about changing my room. They all told me that there would be no problem, but that I would have to wait until all the rooms were made up so that could try to find me a better mattress. This was not promising, since that meant there were no renovated rooms that they knew had better mattresses. They all assured me that they were putting 2 rooms "on hold." I left the hotel feeling confident that my request would be honored, but I called at 5 p.m. to make sure. I was told that there was no record of my request, so I asked to speak to the manager. The manager told me that while he would make sure that our rooms were changed, he could not assure me of better mattresses. So, in the end, they did change our rooms, but the mattresses were no better. A guest should not have to put up with substandard bedding from a three-star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: simply_victoria
Reviews.Content: I was not quite sure what to expect with this hotel given the reviews on here. I have a pretty good experience and would recommend this hotel for budget minded travelers to NY. I arrived on Friday at about 1 pm and was told check in was not until 4 and all rooms were taken. That was ok for us. The desk clerk was very curtious as was the gentleman in bag check. We went out for lunch and shopping and came back at 4 to check in again. We were originally told that rooms were still not ready, but after seeing our tired faces, we were given a room with two double beds that just came up on the computer. I think if you ask nicely they are very accomodating. I will reiterate those who have said that the elevators are slow. I suggest going up and then down. It was the only way we went down one night. The rooms are small, but for NY they are pretty big. We had a nice room and a great view of 7th ave. The bathroom was huge and worked great. Our blowdryer broke. We called down and a new one was delivered within 15 minutes. One downside was that Friday night it was very cold and rainy. We could not get a cab. The door man helped 2 guests find a cab, but then got cold and walked inside, leaving the rest of us to fend for ourselves. We were not happy. Overall great location and you get a nice room for your money!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 5 night trip to New York. We spent the first 2 nights at the Park Central and the next 3 at the Waldorf. While the Park Central cannot come close to the Waldorf in terms of luxury, it does have it beat on location. It is located close to the park, the theatre district, Rockerfeller Center and shopping. Carnegie hall is right across the street. Almost everything you want is within walking distance. The room itself was tastefully decorated, not huge, but comfortable. Housekeeping was adequate, they forgot to leave towels in the bathroom and to put pillowcases on the pillows once, but it was immediately remedied and they even called back up to make sure it was taken care of promptly and to our satisfaction. The elevators are old and somewhat slow. The bathroom was very pretty with a granite vanity top, and so on. We also had a nice view from our room. Overall a very nice stay, attractive room in a great locataion and a good value for New York. We were happy and will most likely split our stay between the Park Central and the Waldorf again on our next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I just went to NY to celebrate my sisters b-day. Stayed at the Park Central and were very pleased. We read all the reviews and were a little concerned but found everything to be very satisfactory. The staff could not have been friendlier and very helpful. I would stay there again in a NY minute. The location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not much bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: StefanMarco
Reviews.Content: Convenient location. Rooms are small and unless in the upper half of the building dark, with no view, and noisy (not from 7th Ave. but from the AC/ventilation); bedding is of low end quality. Overall: There are many better places for the same or even less money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Sassypants01
Reviews.Content: We were a bit nervous due to previous reports, but the location was so darn great...right by Carnegie & Stage Deli's for cheesecake after a show or a close walk for a moonlit carriage ride in Central Pk. We admittedly do alot of tourist stuff when we're in town & this location is great for subway or walking. We had a group who used 2 rooms. They were clean & nice. The stay was just fine. We had a blowdryer go out & it was fixed within minutes! The check-in & out had lines, so go a few minutes early. But nothing outrageous. Yes, it's aging a bit & not super fancy. But you're not paying the super fancy price either! This is a fine value for the City & we'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The Park Central is a good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Penwal
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay in New York and were pleased with this hotel. This was our first trip to New York and we picked up this hotel on a good package with Expedia.ca. The location couldn't be better, very close to Central Park and we could walk to the Theatre District. After reading some of the reviews, I was leary about our choice but pleasantly surprised when we saw the hotel and our room. It is a good three star hotel. We had a great king size bed, very comfortable and the bathroom was nice and very clean and no mildew. Our rug had some stains but other than that the room was very satisfactory--no musty smell or dampness and I have very fussy about that. We travelled with another couple and their bathroom was much smaller so I would ask for a room with the larger one.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was just fine”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just like other guests, we were unsure of what the hotel would be like for us. We had looked at so many hotels and just couldn't decide on the best one for the best price so we got our room on hotwire. We read all the reviews on trip advisor and were pleased when we got Park Central as our hotel. There are always negative people and positive people so it was difficult to know which ones to believe. These are basically the same reviews as on other hotels in the city. We stayed from Oct 5 - Oct 10. Our room was fine. We had requested two double beds and that's what we got. The room was spacious and the bathroom was updated. We were locked out of our room twice and security came to let us in immediately after calling them on both occasions. The staff was never rude to us but hey - we were two girls on vacation and we were there to enjoy the city - not sit in the hotel and be disgruntled about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Satisfactory accommodation.”
Reviews.Author: Hep07
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located in midtown with direct access to subway. Our rooms had 2 double beds which were comfortable. Linens were clean and plentiful. Carpets in the hallways were soiled and in need of replacement. One room was next to freight elevator which was not fun. Staff were friendly and helpful. Only 4 elevators and they are slow and at check out time you will wait a long time for an elevator. Hotel is popular with tourists and flight crews.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in NYC -- across from Carnegie Hall. The rooms were a nice size and clean with a modern bathroom. There's a bar and nice restaurant downstairs. It's a bit hectic at times -- but that's NY.

Reviews.Title: “so so accomodations”
Reviews.Author: SB_Christy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Central in May 2004 for 3 nights. The room was a good size, however, the bathroom and carpet were not particularly clean - the floors needed a good mopping/ vacuuming, and the towels, sheets and blankets were all really cheap quality. I would say don't spend more than $100 a night, tops (in any other town a lot less, but it is NYC). Staff was decent generally - although we had to make several calls, over the course of 2 days, and go there to wait over an hour for them to retrieve an item after checkout. The doorman was really cool. Biggest complaint - the windows are extremely thin, and since the location is on such a busy street, I recommend ear plugs; even on the upper floors you can hear the street noise with windows closed.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent. The accomodations are just okay. The rooms are small but adequate. You can walk to almost every major attraction. Plentiful restaurants nearby. Leave a couple bucks for the maid and your service improves 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel if ya ask me”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have read some bad reviews of this place on this site, and since I got this hotel on Priceline, was stuck and worried a bit. I agree with those who enjoyed the hotel. I and my wife had a great time there and would go back without hesitation. First, the lobby is nice, not extraordinary, but pretty nice. The check in was a few minutes, and the staff seemed fine to us. The elevators are a bit slow, but not really a big deal at all. The rooms are nice. They are a bit smallish, but in NYC, they are about normal size. The bathroom was fine also. The AC worked well, but we didn't need it much as it was relatively cool. We had no stains, moisture, peeling paint, or any of the other things that some people said they had. The location. Ah.. what can I say about being maybe 5 minutes from Central Park and across from Carnegie Hall. This hotel has a FANTASTIC location, and you can easily get to the Plaza, CP, Times Square, and 5th Ave with a little walking. One thing, there is a bit of noise, so if you are a real light sleeper, it may bother you, but that is not a hotel thing, it is an NYC thing. This is a very good hotel, and although we liked the Grand Hyatt even better, this definitely is a great hotel to visit NY at. Our stay was Sept 24th thru Sept 28th, for 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “My 2¢ worth... Great hotel for the money...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading everyone else's wide-ranging reviews of this property, I feel like I have to throw my opinion into the mix. I stayed at the Park Central for three nights, 9/11 to 9/14, and was overall quite impressed. Our room was large (by NYC standards), with a king size bed and plenty of room to relax and move about. The room was comfortable, neither musty nor damp. The air conditioning was fully adjustable. The bed was firm, and the pillows were soft. The elevators were slow, but here we're splitting hairs. We were the only ones in line to check in, and the process took all of 2 minutes. The hotel has a generic feel overall (it's no Mansfield or Paramount), but for the price you simply cannot beat the comfort and location on Columbus Circle. Would I visit again? Absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “great location-nice room”
Reviews.Author: nuheart
Reviews.Content: Just got back from NYC and a stay at the Park Central. Was treated typical New york style at check ,which concerned me, but was pleased with the room and the wonderful location-- at a not so outrageous price. Bathrooms are small but hey, it's new york. My room was nice and clean recently renovated---. not mildewy as other reviews said, wish they had a coffe pot but the room was everything i expected and more for the price paid. I would stay there again. Remember, this isn't the Ritz but neither is their price. I recommend this hotel for those who don't care about fancy lobby's and want a nice room for the right price in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “very pleased”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased with service and facilities at the Park Central. When we first checked in the room we were given had a strong, unpleasant odour. Within minutes we were moved to another room. The rooms themselves were quite spacious - much better than I expected. The bathrooms and linens were clean and in good repair. The hallway carpets were somewhat worn/stained in areas but it wasn't offensive. The hotel staff were exceptionally pleasant, cheerful and helpful. My ONLY complaint is that there was a freeze of more than $1000USD put on my credit card at check in and I wasn't advised of it. Upon my return home when I discovered this I called the hotel and accounting advised this was an industry standard (I've never experienced this elsewhere though) and that the freeze would be cleared within 2-3 business days after checkout. It has created some inconvenience for me but I was assured that the front desk would be spoken to as no one ever advised myself or other friends that I travelled with of this freeze. The location is just south of Central Park and there are many good deli's & shops in the vicinity. Times Square is an easy stroll. Overall, I would not hesitate to book accomodations at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “We would return”
Reviews.Author: PlumPink
Reviews.Content: Our family of four had the opportunity to stay at the Park Central for 3 nights at the beginning of August. We found the hotel in a directory of hotels "approved" by my husband's employer and selected it based on it's location and rate - $150. The lobby was welcoming and the front desk people efficient. We did have to request a room change, however, as we were inadvertently placed on a floor that was bustling with activity due to a large group of people in the fashion industry having a function at the hotel at the time. The front desk clerk was apologetic and immediately assigned us to another room which turned out to be roomier than the first (it was handicap accessible), with a bathroom which looked to be newly remodeled with ceramic tile and lovely Kohler fixtures. Our room was to include a complimentary breakfast on the concierge level but because of the fashion function taking place at the time, we were given vouchers to use in the hotel cafe for the basic breakfast buffet, which was more than adequate for our needs. In addition to the hotel being within walking distance to Broadway, Times Square, etc., the subway was just a block away. The king sized bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've slept on in a long time (or was I just so exhausted at the end of each day?). The bed linens seemed especially nice and there were no problems with cleanliness. We asked for additional towels once, and they were delivered to our room....NICE towels, I might add. Should we have the opportunity to visit NYC in the future, we would stay at the Park Central again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent, especially for the price (priceline). The location is ideal, just a few blocks from the craziness of Times Square. Cheery atmosphere, unlike another hotel we stayed at. The staff is friendly, and the rooms were a great size. The lobby is decorated nicely, and you'll save a lot of money on cabfare since the location is excellent. Great hotel for the newbie tourist to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt fault this great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site I was really worried that this hotel would not be very nice. I was pleasantly surprised. Friendly hotel staff, clean room that was cleaned everyday and fresh towels provided. Really well situated, right next to Carnegie Deli and Time Square right down the road. Would recommend it highly and would definately stay there again -dont beleive the bad reviews!

Reviews.Title: “loved the location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there last summer & had no problems at all. I loved the location, walking distance to everywhere. The bathroom needed more lighting, but I found the room comfortable & quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: typer
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Park Central from 6th-10th August 2004. I was happy with the level of service and the rooms were fine. I was surprised how spacious our two rooms were especially after reading some of the reviews here. The location of the the hotel is ideal, Central Park is only 5min walk and Time Square only a few blocks in the other direction. Overall i thought the hotel represented good value for money, my only complaint was regarding the lifts - they seem to takes forever to arrive! But at the end of the day we had an enjoyable stay and a great time in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine and dandy! Will be back next year.”
Reviews.Author: Floof
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice, once in Sept 2003 and just recently from Aug 13-16, 2004. We arrived before 12noon, checked in immediately, dropped our bags and ran out site seeing. Hotel is a few blocks from Central Park, a few blocks from Times Square, Rockfeller Center and Radio City Music Hall - Perfect Location. We paid about $189/night but for NYC in a decent location, for a good sized room bigger than a closet - that was good. We had 4 people per room this year (5 last year - we got an extra cot delivered no problem) - found everything just fine. The secret elevators on the right side of the lobby were a savior as they were quite a bit faster than the "regular" elevators (one tip....never take the stairs as they lead to strange places). Don't expect super duper luxury but in my opinion it's not a dump either. Lobby bar is a bit expensive but a short jaunt to "The Irish Pub" down the street made for a lovely happy hour each day. All in all it's a good family hotel for the location and price. (Sorry I can't report any roaches, paint peeling, stained carpet and the only funny smell we had - I caused by eating my great big Rueben sandwich from Carnegie Deli in the room).

Reviews.Title: “Damp rooms with cockroaches!!”
Reviews.Author: uvababy
Reviews.Content: DON'T BELIEVE ANY OF THE POSITIVE REVIEWS! I have stayed in MANY hotels, and for the price I paid for this one I expected clean rooms and good service. The room was really damp the second we got in, the sheets felt damp and the air was very damp as well. I called and asked for another room and they said they would check the room. When we came back nothing changed. The next morning I saw a GIANT cockroach on the floor and called the front desk immediately. They sent security to kill the cockroach!?! My boyfriend could've killed it himself! It was ridiculous. I had to request a new room when they should've immediately provided us a new room. The new room they gave us was also dirty, smelly, and infested with flies!! Then our key didn't work and we had to wait a long time for a new key! At this point we just gave up. We are NEVER EVER staying here again!! DO NOT waste your money here.

Reviews.Title: “Checked out after 4 hours!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a 7hour flight from the UK we arrived at Park Central at 9pm, hoping to check - in, get something to eat then go to bed. Our room was not ready, therefore we waited in the bar for an hour. We didn't make a fuss as we were too tired and didn't mind getting a drink anyway. When an hour had passed with no sign of our key. I went to the front desk to enquire what was taking so long, as he knew we would be waiting for him in the bar. It seemed he couldn't be bothered to walk the 10 meters from the front desk to the bar to inform us our room was now ready. Again, I bit my tongue and tolerantly thanked him for his help. We got to the floor our room was on and we were overwhelmed by the damp muggy smell. We walked to the battered and scratched door, checked it was the correct number and reluctantly stepped into the room. The damp smell was even more intense. I had to use a hard swing to slam the door closed, as it was in a pitifull state. There was a large red stain on the already stained carpet and the curtains didn't close. Which I wouldn't mind normally, but as we were extreemly close to an office block I was very concerned. I called the front desk to get them to send someone to spray some air freshener in the room asap, they never arrived. We decided to go out and have something to eat as we were sick of waiting. When we got back the smell hit us again, we forgot how strong it was. I couldn't relax with the eye watering stench in the room. So we decided to request a room change. When we were waiting at the front desk there were two seperate people also waiting. One had been moved for the THIRD time, but this time his shower didn't work. The other person was moving into another room as her carpet in her room was damp. After hearing both tales we decided not to change rooms, but change hotels. So we checked out then and there at 1am! Just for reference I did not have any special discounts, we were going to pay $209 per night and stay there for three nights. We are not fussy people, we just wanted a room we could breath in whilst we slept, as we were'nt going to be in our room much anyway. I was so disappointed and exhausted by the time I got into bed in a much nicer hotel in Time square. Where I stayed for the remainder of my stay and had a fabulous time!

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Park Central from July 20-24th of 2004 and must say that Park Central was one of the most enjoyable hotels I have stayed at. Prior to arriving, I read reviews online and was very apprehensive about staying in the hotel and was very pleasantly surprised. Our room was very spacious, clean, and safe for a family of five. The location was wonderful, only a few blocks from time square, and the service was great. We called housekeeping for extra blankets, pillows, and an iron and ironing board and recieved all our things in a reasonable amount of time. There were no stains on the carpet, the paint was not peeling, and there was no odor in the room at all. Our view was of the building next door, but in NYC what hotels have an amazing view. You cant see anything pass the tall buildings. I really dont understand why people were giving this hotel such bad reviews. Our family would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality Professional Strikes Back.....”
Reviews.Author: inthebiz131
Reviews.Content: Now I know why I try and beat SUPERIOR GUEST SERVICE into the heads of my front desk agents so my guests don't walk away feeling like I did. I stayed with my daughter at the Park Central from July 9-14, 2004. We stayed here because we were referred by the Broadway Dance Center which is 2 blocks away, where my daughter was taking a summer intensive program. The rate we received was a special one arranged between the dance center and the hotel so it was a very good one. Now the location is excellent. The lobby of the hotel is nice and we were greated by a full door/bell staff upon arrival and given immediate assistance. However, when we got to the front desk, our nightmare began. The agent was new (I imagine) based on the fact that he didn't know what the hotel/occupancy tax was on the room and when I asked for the total amount for the 5 nights he told me just to leave my credit card and I would receive a receipt at the end. I told this gentleman, I want to pay in full now. I don't want you to swipe my card. I want to know what the total is for 5 nights plus tax now. He told me he couldn't do that. I told him to go in back of the "MAGIC" wall and find a calculator or his manager. I am a front desk manager and his behavior was absurd. Since when can't you tell me what my room/tax charges are in advance and allow me to pay them at check in? He then quotes me a price about $500.00 more than it should be because I am fully aware of what it should be. He is now multiplying with a pad and pen. I said again get a calculator. He said he didn't have one. So at this point I am doubtful of what to expect from this hotel. The alledged manager who came to assist who was not wearing a name tag, came and resolved this issue. He gave me a wonderfully mediocre room on the 3rd floor facing the roof. How nice. You would think after being at the front desk for 30 minutes and being a hospitality pro. myself, he would have given me a better room with a nicer view. Now the room itself was ok. So now the 3rd night we were there they did not replace our towels which I couldn't understand. So we called 3 times and even when out to dinner. So after a total of 6 hours, we still did not have towels delivered to us. So they gave us free breakfast. We go to the restaurant and they employees were very attentive and it is a pleasant atmosphere but the buffet is less than great. But it's free so who can complain after all, I felt really sorry for the people who were going to pay $20 a person and get at best, scrammbled eggs and pancakes. I've seen better buffets at my Son's school. Also, there is no On-Command system of movies or any entertainment in the rooms. Makes for very boring late nights. So to recap, this hotel is great for it's location. The bellstaff and restaurant staff are pleasant. The front desk staff is the worse I have even seen. Rude, unattentive, untrained and clearly don't appear to want to help their guests. I probably will not stay there again. I would rather pay more to stay at a Hilton or Sheridan and get better service.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Central July 13th-July 20th. It was a wonderful stay. Everyone was very pleasant and there were smiles everywhere. Check in was quick and easy, check out was just as simple. Our room was cleaned every day, and the "do not disturb" sign was honored. We had one day that no washcloths were left in our room, houskeeping was called, and within 5 minutes there was a knock on our door with the washcloths. The location without a doubt can't be beat. It was our first trip to NYC, and we couldn't have picked a better place to stay. Just a couple blocks from Central Park, and about 5 blocks from Times Square. It just doesn't get any better than that! We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: mlara0208
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was nervous about staying at the Park Central, but was locked into my room through Priceline. I was really pleasantly surprised. It was my first trip to NY and had heard how small the rooms are there. Our room (1711) was clean and fairly large with a nice sitting area. The bathroom was roomy as well - only complaint is that there isn't any counter space there. Towels were changed every day. Housekeeping was fine. Check in was smooth - no waiting, polite staff. The great location more than makes up for the slighly worn furnishings and carpet stains. All in all, it was a decent hotel at a decent price and a pleasant stay. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central was perfectly fine”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got a room at the Park Central on Priceline for this past Saturday night, July 17th. After winning the room I came here and was horrified by the majority of the reviews; we braced ourselves for a horrible stay. We were pleasantly surprised. The room was renovated, nicely decorated and very clean. Everything was in good working condition. The bedding was obviously not new but it was clean and serviceable. The beds, while not the most comfortable we'd ever slept in, were perfectly adequate. And the location, of course, can't be beat. The front desk person when we checked in was very nice, joked around with us, smiled. When we checked out the desk was severely understaffed but our checkout process was swift otherwise. No one tried to sell us anything. We would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central Was Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our convention group of 150 stayed at the Park Central for 4 nights in June, 2004. The rooms were fine. The service was top-flight. Everyone seemed to try extra-hard to make our stay memorable. It is an excellent hotel in the best possible location. The sales and catering staff were especially attentive to our needs. A specially-designed shipping case for a display was lost during the event, and the hotel staff stayed on the task even after we left to find the case and let us know. I would highly recommend it, and will definitley use it again.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I used Priceline, and Park Central accepted my bid. I was quite worried after reading mostly bad reviews about this hotel, but I am happy to say that overall my experience was actually not bad. Every time I had occasion to speak with someone at the front or concierge desk they were very helpful, and nice. I did not encounter any long lines, but that is always a case of luck of the draw. My room and bathroom were clean. The beds were only ok, and the hotel really needs to get new beds and new bedspreads (mine were a bit threadbare in places). But for me, the main thing was for the room to be clean and quiet, and it was both. I would stay here again. As everyone has stated the location is marvelous for midtown, the lobby is nice and large with plenty of restaurants and things to do in the immediate area. I also think that people are more likely to complain so I think that is one reason there are so many negative reviews of this hotel. But again, the management needs to get new beds and bedding, and then the rooms could be quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not worth more than $50 a night”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got locked into this hotel on priceline.com, and after reading the previous reviews, was scared out of my witts. So I went in expecting the worst and I got it. For starters, I was actually really hoping to contradict the negative reviews, No luck. I am not a high maintenance snob, and I don't count carpet stains and cigarette burns. But if I pay more than $100 a night for a room, I expect that they at least change my towels daily, they didn't even do that (they refolded our damp used towels). The room was muggy and smelled bad, the paint was peeling, the bathroom was dark and the windows didn't close. On a service level, We did everything possible to avoid dealing with front desk, because we could tell at check in that they were NASTY! It is quite apparent that service is NOT a priority at the Park Central. Luckily we didn't spend much time in our room, but it was upsetting that the website advertises something completely inaccurate. All in all, the location was good, but if you are high maintenance, stay away. This is the kind of place that you stay at when you have no other options. Just to keep in mind, for $20 more you can stay at the Sheraton two blocks down or the Radisson on Lexington.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central: Great Location, Huge Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: sjy66
Reviews.Content: I booked rooms for six people (3 rooms) to stay at Park Central for four days. It was a business trip and my employer (the owner of the comany) was coming with us. After looking at our options, I chose Park Central because of the location, some reviews, and the style of the hotel and the amenities it offered. When most of us arrived that morning we knew it was likely too early for checkin. We had our car take us there to check our luggage. I inquired about where to go to check the luggage (most hotels I've stayed in NYC have doormen to take them or direct me) but I had to go to the front desk. She was terribly rude and told me that I needed to come back later. I reitterated that I needed to check my luggage, so she pointed where I should go...way down the hall, to the right and down another hall. We left and went to take care of some business matters. Another member of our party arrived at 11am and was told to try back at 2. We went back after 2 and was told (same rude woman) that they were all taken and to come back at 4). I asked why we couldn't go ahead and use our reservation information to check in and come back at 4 for our keys. She refused. Knowing this could happen all over again, I waited and then approached another lady who soon checked us into our rooms. I should note that by this time (3pm) they didn't have any doubles left, which was what two of the rooms I'd reserved were...and they didn't have any left because others had "already taken them". Without going into all the details, you get the point of the difficult check-in for six people who'd had reservations for two months. The first night was just "okay" and the rooms were decent. Nice bathrooms with black stone counters, elegant wallpaper, nice towels. I soon found out that my employers room was NOT so nice and they had to be moved. For one thing, their bed was made but didn't have any sheets on the bed, just the spread! Neither of their two rooms ever had a coffee pot or wash cloths and were still not they type we had reserved 60 days prior to the visit. By the end of the four days, we'd had multiple daily battles to just get wash cloths for our bath. One day we had to use hand towels just to take our baths...and this is after repeated phone calls (so called "housekeeping" that the front desk transfers calls to never answered after 15 minutes of rining) and actual trips to the front desk to request and complain. Each time we were told they were sorry and that someone would be right up to take care of it...which they never did. After the first day we didn't get any more soap or replacements for the used toiletries, no more coffee packages, no ice buckets in two of the rooms...you get the picture. Being in charge of all the trip accomodations, this has really placed me in a bad position. My employer trusts me to make sure the everything is taken care of and done nicely. Their shoddy service reflects on me. I pity anyone in the same position. If that is you, do yourself a favor and book elsewhere. If you want a soft, comfortable bed, you'll also need to look elsewhere. We stayed in a room in their top three floors (the nicest ones, supposedly) and it would be a real stretch to call that a mattress. Slighlty padded box would be more appropriate. The TV is a small 13" set, not something you can watch a movie on and be comfortable. As a point of reference, we have stayed at the new Hilton on 42nd, the Hilton near Rockefeller, The Algonquin, Crowne Plaza, The Roosevelt and others, just so that you understand my frame of reference for Manhattan hotels. If you do stay there, be forwarned! They put a $19 bottle of wine on our bill from the mini bar. We never used the mini bar and the wine was still in it when we checked out. We battled that and finally got it taken off of our bill. By the way, that bottle in the mini bar would not have made more than one drink.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Awful Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: DUpton
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at this hotel while in New York on Business from 6/13/04 thru 6/18/04. The hotels location was great, but that’s the only thing it had going for it. The front desk staff was the worst I have ever experienced. They were the most arrogant hotel staff I have ever had to deal with. They all had an attitude about them and it was not a helpful attitude, more like a “and what do you want” attitude. My first room was horrible, with stained carpets and peeling wallpaper. The room was an inside room on the 5th floor. It was Dank, Dark, and stuffy. I complained to management about the room and was moved to a “cleaner” room. The second room was on the 14th floor and was at least cleaner and not so dank. This room was a little smaller, but livable. The light in the bathroom didn’t work and the tub was clogged but these issues were addressed quickly. I was provided a complementary breakfast for my troubles. I only ate at the hotel’s restaurant to redeem my complementary breakfast, and wouldn’t eat there again. The service staff was nice enough, but the abundance of flies buzzing around both the buffet line and dining tables was a real turn off. The room was way overpriced at $175.00 per night. The hotel lists itself as a “first class” hotel on their website, but I think that is only because they charge so much per night. Bottom line is that this was a poor choice of hotels and I would recommend that if you find your self in New York looking for a nice place to stay, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: chris_schene
Reviews.Content: location, location, location. The Park Central is located in the golden triangle: just across from Carnegie Hall, next to the Carnegie Deli a few blocks from Columbus Circle, a 5-7 minute walk from MTV, Trl, TV stations (NBC, Fox News, CNN), the David Letterman show, Time Square, Radio City and is two blocks south of beautiful Central Park and there are several subway entrances right nearby. This area is close to everything but not quite as “tourist trappy “ as Times Square. The fitness room is very well equipped, though with older equipment. The service is awful: among the worst I have ever seen and some of the staff are actually quite rude. The building is very old, but some rooms have been renovated recently: The quality of your room is the “luck of the draw.” Some are very nice and clean, while others are worn out, dingy and dirty. At one time the Park Central was quite a bargain and I was willing to put up with bad service because of the nice price and location. However, they have raised their rates close enough to the those of the nearby Sheratons and Westin that I can no longer see staying there: The Westins and Sheratons are a better deal and nicer hotels. Oh, one other thing: They are converting part of the hotel to the Manhattan Club time share and they will try and sell you a Time Share. The Manhattan Club is very nice, but over priced! If you can resist the pressure, go for the pitch and get the free gifts and then try and pick up the time share on the secondary market: The “official price” is around 28K, but if you can be patient they are selling on the secondary market for less than half that price.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine, nothing to rave over but nothing to complain about unless you were really nitpicking! Good location for eateries and park. I was put off by reviews on this website but I shouldnt have been. Contrary to other reports, my carpet was new and quite clean!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel/location/service”
Reviews.Author: petert2
Reviews.Content: The room I stayed in for 5 nights from June 12th 2004 must be different from the rooms some of the people who wrote reviews here stayed in. I stayed in a concierge room on the 23rd floor and found it to be very clean and comfortable even had a view down 7th Ave towards times square. My friends were on the 20th floor and the room was pretty much identical(without the view). The room was made up each day, the lifts were fine and I did not experience any long waits for them. Check-in/checkout was quick and hassle free. Used the conceirge to get seats to a Yankees game and the seats were great. The location of the Park Central was excellent as it was close to everyting I wanted to see and do in New York. I did not have any bad experiences staying there so wouldnt hesitate in using the Park Central again. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “No more Park Central”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Oh my god. Park Central is the worst hotel I have stayed in NYC. The service is so terrible. Front desk is the nightmare. No smile. No "Thank you". No service! The room is just okay. Nothing impressive. I reserved a "concierge room" but I was told it's not available at the time of check-in so I stayed a "regular room". Maybe a "concierge room" is great like the picture on their website? :P (oh. there was no memo pad nor pen in the room.) I was there for business. One night I came back to the hotel very exhausted. My room key didn't work! I went to the front desk and there was a huge line at 11 pm...... Really I waited more than 30 mins..because of their mistake. I was so mad. People working at other area of hotel seemed very nice and helpfull..but people at front desk is so terrible. By they way, I was supposed to be there in May but canceled my reservation. When I called, the lady at the front desk was soooooooo RUDE! She even told me she had to charge me for one night since I canceled too late. I called later and found out they don't have to charge me and the lady never canceled my reservation. Good thing I called back. Otherwise I would have to pay for three nights... I would never stay there!! Be aware!!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: dabatex
Reviews.Content: A friend and I spent one night at the Park Central hotel. 5/29/04. The location was great, but the room we had was very disappointing. The floors were dirty. The nightstand looked water damaged. The hallways and outside room doors were in need of paint. The bathroom was updated and looked nice. But the beds were very old and uncomfortable. No view, but I guess that is common in NYC hotels? The price was okay, but I would have spent more for more comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Like the user below I had a very frustrating experience at the Park Central Hotel. My company arranged a group booking however the room was nothing like those shown in the brochure. The carpet was stained, the room very dusty in some areas, a little smelly and the bathroom needed a good scrubbing. To top it off the phone in the room did not work. In addition to the depressing room, the service was very haphazard - due to the computers being down check in took over 30 minutes (no exageration), when checking out I was promised that the bill would be faxed to me(as computers were still down) however this was not done until I had phoned back and then faxed in a request. I would not recommend this hotel to fellow business travellers - if you need the midtown location, go for the Hilton around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Awful--twice sent to occupied rooms!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Central for one night. Never again! When I arrived at 11 p.m. they sent me to my room--a Do Not Disturb Sign was on the door. My card did not work. I went back to the desk and said the room was occupied. He insisted it was not and sent a security guard with me, who assured us both that it in fact was occupied. They then sent me to another room, assuring me it was vacant. My card worked, the room was dark, but the security chain was on. After a few moments someone called out--this room was also occupied. By the time I returned to the desk again I had lost an hour's sleep and had lugged my baggage a total of four times back and forth. When I checked out they had no receipt prepared for me. All told, an absolutely abominable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Tourist Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AntiquityTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. Good location if you want to be near Central Park and Times Square. Subway station right next to the hotel. Room sizes are average to small. Bathroom is clean. The carpet in the room could be cleaner. Price is very good for NYC and location (~$150/night). Water pressure is low. We did not use the concierge but it seemed to be busy. Staff was helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price paid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few nights in early June 2004. The hotel is in a great location, just a few blobcks from Central PArk and a 10-15 minute walk south to Times Square. There is also a subway station right outside. We had a smoking room on the 4th floor, but there was no lingering smell of smoke. It was fine for the price I paid, through Hotwire. I guess you could nitpick - the carpet was stained pretty good, the handle on the shower faucet would fall off if you pulled it, and the hairdryer would come off the wall if you weren't careful. But other than that the room and bathroom were clean. But I've paid $250 a night at the Hyatt, and that place was about the same as far as room quality goes. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Park Central and would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in NYC and I was nervous about where to stay. We stayed for 5 nights and everything was great. Check-in went smoothly we requested ajoining rooms and got them, and it was odd because we were there during Fleet Week and Memorial Weekend. The rooms were ready as soon as we arrived and VERY CLEAN. The carpet had a few stains but they were little stains besides what hotel doesn't have stains on the carpet. The size of the room was great. We had a normal room with two double beds. The beds were clean and every room comes with feather pillows. The bathroom was so clean that we actually took baths and I never take a bath at a hotel. We didn't have a great view but who cares we only slept there, the viewing should be done from outside the room anyway. The location of the hotel was wonderful, 3 blocks south of Central Park and about 5 blocks north of Times Square, and the doulble decker Tour bus stops in front of the hotel. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Hope you have a great time in NYC, We sure did!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal - great location”
Reviews.Author: vijocass
Reviews.Content: Great location and room was very nice. We had two rooms booked (1157 & 1151) 1157 was much larger and was perfect 1151 was fine but small, I think this is there normal room. This place is a 5 minute walk from Central Park, the 2 deck "red" bus stops here which was a great surprise, and right next door to Carnigie Deli. Walk to Times Square. Parking was $39.00, and the hotel when booked directly on there WEB site $143.00 was cheaper than the Expedia/Hotels etc. Based on pricing I would stay here on all future visits. Only one mishap was there checkin system went down when we arrived and they had no idea how to check people in, there front desk could use a larger staff - some people waiting 1 hour in line to check in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Just okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Park Central May 28th-30th three nights. Good price on Hotels $159.00 per night plus taxes. Arrived and hotel lobby was very impressive. Checked in on Friday evening about 9:00 and check-in went very smoothly - no lines, but we requested a non-smoking room with two double beds. When we arrived we were told that the only rooms available with double beds were on smoking floors - for a hotel with 900 rooms this is quite unbelieveable - but we took the room since we had to have two beds. Room was on the 4th floor and when the evavator door opened the smell of cigarette smoke almost knocked you down. However, the window was open in our room and the room did not smell quite as bad as the hallway. When time to go to bed, all bedding sheets and pillows smelled just like cigarette smoke. The smell was not too bad while the window was open, but got quite cool during the night and the window had to be closed. I will have to say the bathroom was good size and the shower worked well. After spending the night in what seem like a smoke-filled bar, we called down to the front desk promptly at 7:30 a.m. and requested a room in non-smoking and were told that a room would be held for us and we could change rooms at 2:00. Upon returning to the hotel at 2:00 the line for check-in was verrryyyy long and we had to wait maybe 30-40 mins to get our room changed. However, in walking through the lobby later the line was almost to the door checking-in as it looked liked only 3 people working the front desk and this is a very large lobby. The non-smoking room smelled much better, but the bathroom was much smaller, the shower had almost no water pressure and the tub was stopped up so you had to stand in water to your ankles while showering. But we did not complain because we were so happy to be away from the cigarette smell. In summation, I will have to say the hotel staff was very courteous at all times, the room was clean, and the location of the hotel is absolutely great. I felt very safe as most of the doors along 7th Ave. were locked late at night and you had to show a room key when you entered the lobby. Many deli's and shops right on 7th Ave. and easy to walk to many points of interest. A good value but just hope that you do not get a smoking room!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad At All”
Reviews.Author: grltra
Reviews.Content: After reading the postings here, I was some what concerned. I stayed here for 4 nights, and though it was great. The service was responsive and well informed. The room was quiet, clean, and given what we paid, a bargain. The location is just amazing, and can't be beat. I would stay here again in a instant.

Reviews.Title: “Very good deal here. Afine property.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have stayed here and was a little leery about it as some of the earlier reviews have not been too kind on this hotel. I still remember the one who was counting cigarette burns on the carpet. Brrr. Well let me count the ways of my satisfaction: Check in was fine to excellent. Nilsa the staff person did everything to accomodate me and extremely helpful. The Room. New carpets and fine looking bathroom. Great King size bed. Nothing spectacular but fine. Very clean no cigarette burns. No mini-bar. This would be a major draw back in any city but NYC where there are so many vendors steps from the hotel. The facilities: I only used the bar downstairs in the lobby. Very friendly people and comfortable surroundings albeit some of the furnishings need reupholstering. Nothing major though. The hotel was booked fully but they seemto be able to handle this. For the priceline price this was a major bargain. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Agreeably surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having booked through Hotwire we were very apprehensive when we found that we had selected the Park Central Hotel. Arriving after on a long and delayed flight from Europe we were however met with a very friendly check-in and even provided with maps etc. of NY. The room was very spacious and clean, bathroom was also clean with a very powerful shower. Very relaxing bar with a very attentive Irish Barman (John from Stillorgan). Location is absolutely perfect and we would certainly recommend staying here if a good rate is available. We paid $137 which was competitive for midweek in new York. However....request a room away from the elevator unless you're a heavy sleeper or travel with earplugs (as we do), the movement of the elevator could be clearly heard in our room!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money. A great place to base yourself from...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It just goes to show. Don’t believe in everything you read, especially negative views. I was rather concerned when my partner informed me we were staying in The Park Central Hotel from the information people had written here, but on the other I got a very nice surprise. Our room was spotless, bathroom clean with daily fresh towels and rooms cleaned on a daily basis. In this day and age you get what you pay for. You want marbled bathrooms; Egyptian cotton sheets etc go elsewhere. If you want a comfortable room, with a great location at a good price that will allow you to spend more money on other things stay here. P.S. one piece of advice always display the “Do not disturb sign” Housekeeping staff start early!! Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central was Extremely Nice!”
Reviews.Author: PitcherJLT
Reviews.Content: I must say that before my trip to NYC I was somewhat concerned about this hotel due to the negative comments on this site. But after staying at this hotel I can honestly tell you that I would highly recommend it and would stay there again if I got the opportunity. It was very easy to get a cab from LaGuardia to Park Central, the bellhop was very helpful, check-in was kind of slow and we could not check in until 4:00 but the hotel offered to hold our bags while we out to see some sights and get something to eat, the room was not huge but was big enough, the room was clean, bathroom was clean and spacious, and the a.c. was cold. The bathroom tub stopper was broken but was not a problem because I only take showers. I could see where this might be a problem for a guy traveling with his wife or girlfriend though. The staff was courteous and answered all of my questions about bars and restaurants and helped us with directions to Yankee Stadium for the game Saturday against the Red Sox. The location relative to everything else was tremendous. Short walk to Times Square, Broadway, numerous bars and clubs, restaurants, and shopping. I am telling you ... you really could not ask for a better location unless you stay at the W Hotel in the middle of Times Square. The entire trip with the ballgame, city, hotel, and everything else I give a resounding A+. I can't wait to get back and see David Letterman.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel except”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location as Central Park is 5 minutes north and Times Square is 5 minutes south. You can walk to everything in minutes. Room was OK and was fairly clean. Staff was fine except a Bell Hop who screamed when I tried to use a cart to move my Luggage. As fate would have it, he loaded my taxi for the trip to the Airport. As he finished and held at his hand, I remarked "Remember Me" and offered no tip. He was not happy but I felt it was a good payback for him being so rude. Other than him, everyone was fine and I will stay there again as the price is very fair for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “No problems here”
Reviews.Author: jas044
Reviews.Content: This is, I believe, the third hotel I've stayed in which has been largely trashed on here but yielded no problems at all for me and my family. Check in and check out were smooth as silk, a lost room key was replaced with no grief and the staff couldn't have been more considerate. Yes, the rugs are due for some serious shampooing, but the beds were fine and the bathroom large and clean. Some people must set their standards so high that no hotel could reach them or perhaps they hit them at a bad time. Whatever the case, the Park Central did just fine by us.

Reviews.Title: “HAD A GREAT TIME”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights April 3-7, 2004. I was also concerned after reading some of the terrible reviews. We had a great room, #1705, and really no problems at all. The location is great and so close to everything. We only took a cab one time to Ground Zero. The staff answered calls promptly. My husband is not a big tipper, so it had nothing to do with money either!! I highly recommend this place except the restaurant and gift shop are way overpriced compared to other establishments in the area. b. mayle

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location for families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Central in November 2003 and were very happy with our stay. The location is great, particularly with two small children in tow. Very close to Central Park and Times Square. The hotel lobby was lovely and the staff very nice and accommodating. We stayed in what was termed a "superior room" with two doubles. The furniture and decor was very plain, but the room itself worked out great for us because there was a wall divider between the two double beds - a big help in trying to get two little ones to sleep. The value was also great for the neighborhood. I would recommend it to friends and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was concerned after reading some of the reviews here, but we found the Park Central to be a great value. You cannot beat this location; We had a huge clean room with a view of the park. Would do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Park Central review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Park Central. We were glad it was for only a night. The alarm clock went off at 6a.m. in the room next to ours and continued until we called the front desk. The room also looked nothing like the picture that was posted on the web site. Bathroom was very clean. Can't say so much for the room. There was a big stain on the carpet along with a few huge stains on the window treatment. That really disgusted us. I guess you really do get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading a few reviews at this site about Park Central, I must say I was pretty nervous about what we'd find at the hotel (listed as 3 & 1/2 stars). Our fears were soon put to rest when we entered into a very clean, modern lobby with very courteous staff on hand to check us in & take our luggage to our room. For five days we stayed in a standard non-smoking room with two double beds on the 3rd floor, was very clean and everything was in working order (the safe, the iron, the lights). Our only little complaint was that the room was a bit chilly because they closed off the building heat. The location is perfect as many sites are within walking distance (Times Square, Central Park, Theatre district, famous restaurants, shopping etc...) including subway entrances right near the hotel to where ever else you need to go. Definitely recommended and we'll be choosing Park Central on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need cleaning”
Reviews.Author: staceyvols
Reviews.Content: The lobby is very nice. The rooms smelled like an ash tray every time we entered them. There was not an option of a non-smoking room. The rooms seemed clean, basic. They were average size which was impressive since it was NYC. While packing and moving stuff around to make sure we didn't miss anything of ours, we found two pairs of men's boxers with stains on them between the bed and wall. I informed the front desk. All I got was a sorry, we'll check into it. I'm not a screamer/scene maker so I guess they felt it OK to blow off two pairs of stained underwear in a room. I felt I should have had a portion of my room reimbursed. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for that reason.

Reviews.Title: “Park Central needs a class on "Customer Service"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beware! I stayed at this hotel 3/25-3/28, My return flight landed at 2:15, and the first thing I did was write this review, it 3:25pm. The following is what was wrong with my room; air fan not working, the sink and tub both have the stops stuck, I had to remove them to shower or brush my teeth . I sat for 4 hours with a clogged toilet. It took 2 calls to get somone up there to unclog it, Oh yeah... my bed spread was held together with safty pins. I cant believe that this hotel would risk their repetation vs closeing down a room that clearly wasnt ready to be rented. Not once did anyone say they were sorry for anything but they did say twice "we have a full house" I made a total of 5 calls to the front desk. The staff is not to blame, they clearly work in an enviormnent that excepts this. The only reason I stayed.... I pre-paid through hotels.com and could not afford another hotel charge on my credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be deceived by the hip lobby!”
Reviews.Author: aglazen
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at dozens of hotels in NYC...this is one of the worst. How they get 3 stars from anyone is way beyond me. The reviewer must have stopped at the lobby, which looks really nice, glitzy, cosmo---but the rooms are pathetic. Burns, stains, cheap junk furniture, stiff old beds, junky televisions, thin towels, cheap shampoo. I'm not kidding--this is like staying at a Red Roof Inn...except Red Roof is cleaner. I got this for $100 thru Priceline and feel ripped off!!! Don't be deceived---this is positively, absolutely one to avoid unless it's the last room in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not sooo bad, not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: March 18-22, 2004. We had a great time in New York. We checked in and found a convention was checking in, so it took about 20 minutes to get checked in. We were put in a smoking room with one king size bed, we want two doubles. Anyway the view was fantastic, 22nd floor facing Times Square. Staff was helpful, but a bit short at times. They put us in a different room on Friday. It was non-smoking, much better, on sixth floor. The elevators were as fast a most buildings I've been in. Some people are impatient, especially New Yorker's. Rooms were clean, and the beds comfortable. They charged a $1.00 for every call I made. Most every one were helpful. Both our room safe's did not work. So I use the hotel safety deposit boxes. Towels, hot water, baths were Great. We had a super time in New York. I would stay at the Park Central again.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service, anyone?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The most terrible night of my life began in the Park Central lobby and ended on a cot, with twelve other people in a Park Central conference room. Upon arriving at the Park Central after a delayed flight(but calling a few days before to confirm we would be late, but there), we were appaled to discover that the Park Central not only overbooked their hotel, but they had also given each of our rooms away. Following this discovery, the PC offered to put us up for the night in a dingy, rent-by-the-hour hotel, the premisis of which managment had never set foot on. Long story short, we spent the night in a PC conference room on thirteen cots, with no bathroom. The next day the PC tried to make amends by placing us in upgraded rooms and not charging us for out night spent in purgatory. However, promises were made and retracted several times and our overall experience was one of shoddy service. The one bright spot of our stay was a wonderful gentleman in customer service, Kurt. Efficent and willing to bend over backwards for us, Kurt was a ray of sunshine on our dingy, depressing excursion. Sadly, his superiors did not see things the way he did. One manager said that yes, she could live with losing the business of a small group from a small town in Indiana, but as a small voice in an ocean of opinions, I will never reccomend the Park Central to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just stayed 3 nights at the Park Central. I was a bit worried after having read some of the reviews however, I needn't have . The hotel was just fine. The location is fantastic, near everything I wanted to see and a short cab ride away from everything else. The room was clean and comfortable. In the bathroom we had enough towels of the thick and fluffy variety which were changed daily, there was piping hot water and good pressure. The hotel staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. No long line to check-in ( just 1 person in front) and our non-smoking room , as requested, was available immediately at 2pm. I was prepared to be told to come back at 4. We never had to wait more than a couple of minutes for an elevator. Anytime we asked for help we got it with a smile and nothing seemed too much trouble. I would definitely stay there again. There probably is better but you would have to pay a whole lot more for it.

Reviews.Title: “It's quite a fine property”
Reviews.Author: montognese
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, close to both the park and midtown activities. The lobby is splendid and the rooms are just fine. I like the art deco feel and bold color choices they made. The only complaints about the property are low water pressure (but not terrible), and small TV's that were a bit far away. I don't have time to count cigarette holes or spend half my trip complaining, like some of the other posters. This property is very reasonably priced and provides a good value, with a safe location and comfortable accomodations.

HotelInfo.Name: Park Central
